000 
FXUS64 KMRX 312018
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST SAT DEC 31 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS IN CONTROL 
OF AREA WEATHER TONIGHT FOR CONTINUED DRY CONDITIONS. ON SUNDAY... 
CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO INVADE THE MRX CWA FROM WEST TO EAST AS A LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM APPROACHES THE AREA. WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES NEAR 
GUIDANCE. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS REMAIN IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE EVOLUTION AND PROGRESSION OF A STRONG LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE PLAINS SUNDAY NIGHT. ITS ASSOCIATED STRONG 
WARM FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY 
NIGHT...WITH BOTH THE NAM AND GFS MODELS NOW REVEALING MORE 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT AHEAD OF IT (COMPARED TO THEIR PREVIOUS 
RUNS). THIS APPEARS TO BE THE RESULT OF MORE ELEVATED INSTABILITY 
EXPECTED TO DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE WARM FRONT. THUS...WILL INCREASE 
POPS SUNDAY NIGHT AND ADD A MENTION OF TSTORMS. WITH LOW WET BULB 
ZERO HEIGHTS...THIS ELEVATED INSTABILITY MAY LEAD TO THE POSSIBILITY 
OF LARGE HAIL WITH A FEW TSTORMS OVER SOUTHEAST TN AND CENTRAL EAST 
TN. 

ON MONDAY...INSTABILITY WILL INCREASE AND BECOME MORE SURFACE BASED 
AS DEWPOINTS AND TEMPS RISE (TO UNSEASONABLY WARM LEVELS) BEHIND THE 
PASSAGE OF THE WARM FRONT. A COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO BE OVER THE 
WESTERN TN RIVER VALLEY AROUND SUNRISE...AND WILL SLOWLY MOVE EAST 
DURING THE DAY. A DRY SLOT WILL LIKELY DEVELOP MONDAY MORNING OVER 
THE FORECAST AREA AFTER THE WARM FRONTAL PASSAGE AND BEFORE THE COLD 
FRONT ARRIVES. LATEST GFS AND NAM MODEL RUNS BOTH CONTINUE TO REVEAL 
A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIRMASS DEVELOPING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA... 
BUT BOTH MODELS NOW GENERATE LESS CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT ALONG THIS 
COLD FRONT. FEEL THIS IS THE RESULT OF A CONVECTIVE PARAMETERIZATION 
PROBLEM IN THE MODELS CAUSED BY THE EARLIER WARM FRONTAL CONVECTION. 
WITH A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIRMASS IN PLACE...COMBINED WITH STRONG 
WIND DYNAMICS (AS AN UPPER TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE MS RIVER 
VALLEY)...FEEL THAT THIS SCENARIO SHOULD RESULT IN A SEVERE WEATHER 
OUTBREAK WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF SUPERCELLS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
ON MONDAY. WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO ADDRESS 
THIS POSSIBILITY.

ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM QUICKLY MOVES ACROSS THE MIDWEST ON 
WEDNESDAY...BRINGING ANOTHER COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. 
LATEST GFS MODEL RUN CONTINUES TO REVEAL A DRY FRONTAL PASSAGE...BUT 
WILL MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS ON WEDNESDAY. A DEEPER AND 
MORE PERSISTENT UPPER TROUGH IS THEN PROGGED TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY WED NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY. THUS...WILL CONTINUE TO 
MENTION A CHANCE OF PRECIP THROUGHOUT MOST OF THIS PERIOD. TEMPS 
SHOULD COOL CLOSER TO NORMAL BY THE END OF THE WEEK. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             35  61  53  68 /   0  20  90  80 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  34  58  49  66 /   0  10  80  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       33  58  49  66 /   0  10  80  80 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              30  56  43  64 /   0  10  70  80 
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
347 AM EST SAT DEC 31 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH MONDAY)...WEAK COLD FRONT TRACKING 
THROUGH CWA THIS MORNING...NOT MUCH PRECIPITATION ASSOCIATED WITH IT.  
WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THIS MORNING...WITH DRY WEATHER AND 
BREAKING CLOUDS BY AFTERNOON.  HIGH PRESSURE BRINGING DRY WEATHER 
TONIGHT AND SUNDAY.  A BETTER DEVELOPED FRONT MOVING INTO AREA 
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.  FRONT MOVING A LITTLE QUICKER THAN THE 
PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS...WILL BUMP UP POPS A BIT FOR SUNDAY NIGHT.  
FRONT ENTERS CWA ON MONDAY.  WITH THE FORECAST LIS OF -2 TO -4 AND 
A 45-50KT 850 MB JET...MAY SEE SEVERE WEATHER ON MONDAY PRECEDING 
FRONT.   

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS 
COULD CONTINUE INTO MONDAY EVENING...BUT SHOULD STABILIZE AFTER 
FROPA MONDAY NIGHT.  UPPER TROUGH LINGERS INTO TUESDAY...BRINGING A 
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS TUESDAY MORNING IN THE NORTH.  RIDGE 
BUILDS IN TUESDAY NIGHT...BRINGING DRY WEATHER TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY.  ANOTHER DISTURBANCE MOVES IN WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BRINGING 
ANOTHER CHANCE FOR RAIN INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.  
THICKNESSES INDICATE RAIN COULD MIX WITH OR CHANGE TO SNOW LATE 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY MORNING ACROSS THE NORTHERN AREAS 
AND MOUNTAINS.  ANOTHER SHORTWAVE TRACKS IN ON THURSDAY NIGHT 
BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE FOR RAIN FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY... 
WITH RAIN MIXING WITH OR CHANGING TO SNOW LATE THURSDAY NIGHT AND 
EARLY FRIDAY MORNING IN THE NORTHERN AREAS AND MOUNTAINS AGAIN. 

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 302020
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST FRI DEC 30 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH 
THE MRX CWA TONIGHT. AHEAD OF THIS FEATURE...WE WILL SEE AN INCREASE 
IN WINDS AND A BAND OF SHOWERS MOVE THROUGH THE AREA. TEMPERATURE 
PROFILE IS SUCH THAT SHOWERS SHOULD REMAIN AS RAIN THROUGHOUT. THE 
SHOWERS WILL LINGER OVER THE AREA...MAINLY OVER EASTERN ZONES INTO 
SATURDAY MORNING. THE FRONT WILL EXIT THE AREA BY MORNING...WITH THE 
TROUGH AXIS SWINGING THROUGH AND FLOW ALOFT BECOMING NORTHWESTERLY. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
IS PROGGED TO BUILD OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY...WITH ZONAL 
FLOW ALOFT. THIS SHOULD RESULT IN QUIET AND MILD CONDITIONS FOR THE 
BEGINNING OF THE NEW YEAR. MODELS ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH A 
QUICKER PROGRESSION OF A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE MIDWEST 
ON MONDAY. IT NOW APPEARS THAT SHOWERS WILL BEGIN TO DEVELOP ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT SUNDAY NIGHT. AN UNSEASONABLY WARM 
AND MOIST AIRMASS WILL BE ADVECTED NORTHWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT. LATEST GFS AND NAM MODEL RUNS BOTH INDICATE A 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIRMASS DEVELOPING ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY... 
WITH STRONG WIND DYNAMICS ALSO EXPECTED AS AN UPPER TROUGH AMPLIFIES 
OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY. THIS SCENARIO COULD RESULT IN AN ACTIVE 
SEVERE WEATHER DAY ON MONDAY. 

ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM QUICKLY MOVES AGAIN ACROSS THE MIDWEST 
ON WEDNESDAY...BRINGING ANOTHER COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN CONTINUES TO REVEAL A DRY FRONTAL 
PASSAGE...BUT A DEEPER AND MORE PERSISTENT UPPER TROUGH IS PROGGED 
TO LINGER ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS WED NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY. AS A 
RESULT...WILL INCLUDE A CHANCE OF PRECIP THROUGHOUT MOST OF THIS 
PERIOD. TEMPS SHOULD COOL CLOSER TO NORMAL BY THE END OF THE WEEK. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

ON SATURDAY...BUT SHOULD BE OUT OF AREA BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON.  NAM 
INDICATING A LITTLE RESIDUAL MOISTURE IN THE NORTH SATURDAY 
NIGHT...WENT WITH THE DRIER GFS AND KEPT SATURDAY NIGHT DRY.  RIDGE 
BUILDS IN ON SUNDAY...BRINGING DRY WEATHER AND WARMER 
TEMPERATURES.   

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...NEXT FRONT MOVES INTO 
REGION SUNDAY NIGHT...BRINGING MORE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO THE 
AREA...HIGHEST CHANCES REMAIN ON MONDAY WITH FROPA.  RIDGE BUILDS 
BACK IN ON TUESDAY...BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  
ANOTHER FRONT AND UPPER TROUGH ENTERS AREA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT...KEPT 
CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.  THICKNESSES INDICATE

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 292032
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST THU DEC 29 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...UPPER LOW CONTINUES TO PULL AWAY 
FROM THE REGION THIS EVENING WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN. PATCHY 
DRIZZLE WILL END OVER THE FAR NORTHERN ZONES AS THE INFLUENCE OF THE 
LOW EXITS THE AREA. OTHERWISE...LOW CLOUDS OVER THE MRX CWA SHOULD 
SLOWLY ERODE FROM SOUTH TO NORTH OVERNIGHT WITH LOWS LOWERING TO 
NEAR FREEZING AT MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS. ON FRIDAY...WE WILL BE 
BETWEEN SYSTEMS WITH HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL FOR DRY AND WARMER 
CONDITIONS.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH QUICKLY MOVING A WEAK COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST 
AREA LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY MORNING. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL 
SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY DEVELOPING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD 
OF THIS FRONT...SO WILL MENTION A CHANCE OF TSTORMS FRIDAY NIGHT... 
BUT MAINLY EXPECT SHOWERS. THIS COLD FRONT QUICKLY EXITS THE REGION 
BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON...WITH LITTLE CHANGE IN TEMPS EXPECTED BEHIND 
THE FRONT. IN FACT...TEMPS SHOULD CONTINUE TO BE ABOVE NORMAL 
THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK. ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WITH STRONGER 
UPPER DYNAMICS IS PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE MIDWEST ON MONDAY... 
BRINGING WARMER TEMPS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF A COLD 
FRONT. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN INDICATES MODERATE LEVELS OF INSTABILITY 
DEVELOPING ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY ON MONDAY AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING. THUS...WILL MENTION A BETTER CHANCE FOR TSTORMS ON MONDAY 
AND WILL UPDATE THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK TO MENTION THE 
POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE TSTORMS (ESPECIALLY ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN). 

YET ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM QUICKLY MOVES ACROSS THE MIDWEST ON 
WEDNESDAY...BRINGING ANOTHER COLD FRONT THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. 
LATEST GFS MODEL RUN REVEALS LESS MOISTURE WITH THIS COLD FRONT... 
BUT WILL PLAN TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME SHOWERS BEHIND THE 
FRONT AS A DEEPER UPPER TROUGH DIGS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. TEMPS 
SHOULD RETURN CLOSER TO NORMAL BY THE END OF THE WEEK.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 290858
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
358 AM EST THU DEC 29 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW CURRENTLY OVER CENTRAL 
OHIO WITH ASSOCIATED TROF SHIFTING TO THE EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA 
WILL BRING A SHOT AT SOME WRAP AROUND SHOWERS AND LATER A FEW SNOW 
FLURRIES.  DO NOT THINK ANY OF THIS WILL AMOUNT TO MUCH EXCEPT 
POSSIBLY A DUSTING AT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  MOST OF THE PRECIP 
SHOULD BE ENDING BY EARLY EVENING THEN CLOUDS SHOULD BEGIN TO 
DISCIPATE BY LATE TONIGHT.  NOT ANY BIG DIFFERENCES TO GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS BUT LEANED TOWARDS WARMER MAV NUMBERS. 


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...THE FAST PARADE OF WEATHER 
SYSTEMS CONTINUES FOR THESE PERIODS...IN FACT THE BREAK BETWEEN 
TODAYS SYSTEM AND THE NEXT FOR FRIDAY NIGHT LOOKS SHORTER THIS 
MODEL RUN.  BIG DIFFERENCES ARE THAT BOTH THE SURFACE AND UPPER LOW 
WILL BE MUCH FURTHER NORTH...LEADING TO MUCH LESS DYNAMICS AND  
LIMITED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ADVECTION IN ADVANCE OF THE WEAK TRAILING 
COLD FRONT.  DEWPOINT TEMPS LOOK TO NOT REACH ABOVE THE MID 30S TO 
LOWER 40S...AND THE COLD FRONT SHOULD ARRIVE AROUND 12Z SAT.  THIS 
SHOULD ALL HINDER THE POTENTIAL FOR ANY THUNDERSTORMS...BUT THERE 
WAS A HINT OF ELEVATED INSTABILITY...SO I KEPT IN SLIGHT CHANCE 
WORDING FOR THUNDER LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY MORNING.

OTHERWISE...SPED UP THE DEMISE OF LINGERING SHOWERS BY SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON...THEN VERY LITTLE IF ANY CHANGES MADE TO THE POP/WX GRIDS 
FROM SATURDAY NIGHT INTO NEW DAY 7 PRELIMINARY GRIDS.  SLIGHT MAX 
AND MIN TEMP ADJUSTMENTS MADE FROM 3RD TO 5TH PERIODS...TO BETTER 
MESH WITH LATEST MOS AND NEIGHBORING GRIDS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

HVAE UPDATED GRIDS/ZONES TO REFLECT EVENING TRANSITIONS WITH 
CONVECTION, ETC.  STEADY WINDS KEEPING TEMPS UP AND EARLY GUIDANCE 
HAS DAYBREAK TEMPS UP AS WELL...SO HAVE BUMPED UP LOW TEMPS

FOR TOMORROW AS WELL SINCE THEY MAY BE AT DAYBREAK.

WRAP-AROUND LIFT WELL NORTH NEAR KLEX.

REACH AS FAR DOWN AS ABOUT 3000 FEET ELEVATION OVERNIGHT...BUT NOT 
MUCH IN THE WAY OF ORGANIZED PRECIP ON THE WAY...SO MOSTLY LIGHT

SEVERE WEATHER DISCUSSION...AXIS OF UNSTABLE AIR CONTINUES TO SUPPLY 
CONVECTIVE UPDRAFTS AT THIS HOUR.  WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE LOWER 
60S THROUGHOUT MOST OF EAST TENNESSEE AHEAD OF THE STORMS.  DEW 
POINTS RANGE FROM THE MID 40S ALONG THE VA BORDER TO THE MID 50S 
ALONG THE GA BORDER.  LIFTED INDEX VALUES RANGE FROM ABOUT 1.5 ALONG 
THE VA BORDER TO 3.5 DEGREES ALONG THE GA BORDER.  

STORMS IN THE NORTHERN PART OF THE CWA...APPROACHING THE TRI CITIES 
AREA...HAVE GONE THROUGH SOME MORE STABLE AIR OVER THE PAST 
HOUR...BUT ARE APPROACHING BETTER INSTABILITY.  TIMING OF THE 
EVENING COOLING IS TOUGH TO CALL...BUT STORMS COULD STRENGTHEN AGAIN 
IN THIS AREA.

ALONG THE GA BORDER STRONG INSTABILITY AND BACKED WINDS ARE KEEPING 
CONVECTION VERY WELL ORGANIZED.  

SPC GRAPHICS ARE SHOWING GOOD CHANCES OF MID LEVEL ROTATION...BUT 
MUCH LESS CHANCES OF ORGANIZED LOW LEVEL CIRCULATIONS.  CLOSE LOOK 
DOESNT SHOW ANY SURFACE BOUNDARIES AHEAD OF THE CONVECTIVE 
LINE...SO LOW LEVEL CIRCULATIONS WOULD MAY HAVE TO DEPEND ON LOCAL 
TERRAIN.  STILL EXPECTING DAMAGING OUTFLOW THUNDERSTORM WINDS AND 
MID LEVEL CIRCULATIONS...BUT THE PRIME TORNADO THREAT CONTINUES TO 
BE IN THE SOUTHERN HALF OF GEORGIA.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EST WED DEC 28 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...DEEP UPPER TROUGH ACROSS 
ILLINOIS WILL MOVE EAST OVER THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE VALLEYS TONIGHT 
AND THURSDAY. ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WAS LOCATED ACROSS MIDDLE 
TENNESSEE TO NORTHERN ALABAMA WITH STRONG SOUTHERLY WINDS AHEAD OF 
THE FRONT PULLING SURFACE DEWPOINTS INTO THE 50S OVER PARTS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA.  THE BOUNDARY LAYER JET WILL INCREASE THE LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY WITH SOME BREAKS IN THE 
CLOUDS...AIRMASS WELL CONTINUE TO DESTABILIZE THE AIRMASS.

AS THE COLD POOL ALOFT MOVES ACROSS TODAY...WBZ WILL BE QUITE LOW
(AROUND 6 KFT OR LESS) WITH A FAIRLY STRONG LOW LEVEL JET (35-45 KNOTS).
LATEST NAM CAPES AND LIFTED INDICES SUGGEST ATMOSPHERE WILL BE
UNSTABLE ENOUGH TO SUPPORT THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT. ALSO...NAM
SHOWS FORECAST AREA UNDER FAVORED LEFT FRONT QUADRANT OF UPPER JET.

LATEST SWOMCD...STATES THAT A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH MAY BE REQUIRED
SOON. MAIN CONCERN IS LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING STRAIGHT LINE WINDS. 
SHEAR PROFILE ALSO SUPPORTS SUPERCELL DEVELOPMENT AND ROTATION WITH 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING STORMS AS WELL...WHICH WILL ENHANCE UPDRAFT.

WILL CONTINUE MENTIONING OF LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING WINDS THIS 
EVENING. AFTER FROPA...NAM SHOWS A GOOD DEAL OF LOW STRATU-CU MOVING
ACROSS THE REGION OVERNIGHT AND THURSDAY. ENOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE
AND UPSLOPE FLOW TO SCATTERED SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS
TONIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING. TEMPERATURE PROFILE BECOMES COLD ENOUGH
FOR PRECIPITATION TO CHANGE TO SNOW FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN. SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS UP TO 1 INCH POSSIBLE FOR ELEVATIONS 4 KFT OR MORE.

LOW CLOUDS AND COLD NORTHWEST WINDS WILL PRODUCE A RAW DAY FOR THURSDAY
WITH LITTLE IF ANY TEMPERATURE RISE.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE 
MOVES THROUGH THE AREA THU NGT AND EARLY FRI. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
MOVES EAST ACRS THE LOWER GRTLKS EARLY WEEKEND. BEST CHC OF PCPN 
WILL BE EARLY SAT BEFORE FRONT SWINGS INTO S APPALACHIANS. GOOD WARM 
UP BEGINS SUN AND CONTINUES THROUGH MON AS SLOW MOVING SYSTEM 
APPROACHES FROM W. BEST PCPN CHCS WITH THIS SYSTEM LATE MON/EARLY 
TUE. ANOTHER LOW FOLLOWS SUITE WITH A FRONT APPROACHING LATE WED. 
CONFIDENCE TOO LOW ON TIMING SO HAVE LEFT THAT DAY DRY FOR NOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1027 AM EST WED DEC 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...
DEEP UPPER TROUGH ACROSS ILLINOIS WILL MOVE EAST OVER THE OHIO AND TENNESSEE
VALLEYS TODAY AND TONIGHT. ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WAS LOCATED ACROSS MIDDLE
TENNESSEE TO EXTREME NORTHWEST ALABAMA WITH STRONG SOUTHERLY WINDS
AHEAD OF THE FRONT PULLING SURFACE DEWPOINTS INTO THE 50S OVER
ALABAMA AND SOUTHERN MIDDLE TENNESSEE. THE BOUNDARY LAYER JET WILL INCREASE
THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE OVER THE FORECAST AREA TODAY WITH SOME
BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS ANTICIPATED AS WELL TO DESTABILIZE THE AIRMASS.

AS THE COLD POOL ALOFT MOVES ACROSS TODAY...WBZ WILL BE QUITE LOW
(AROUND 6 KFT OR LESS) WITH A FAIRLY STRONG LOW LEVEL JET (35-45 KNOTS).
LATEST NAM CAPES AND LIFTED INDICES SUGGEST ATMOSPHERE WILL BE
UNSTABLE ENOUGH TO SUPPORT THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT. ALSO...NAM
SHOWS FORECAST AREA UNDER FAVORED LEFT FRONT QUADRANT OF UPPER JET.

AFTER COORDINATED WITH SPC AND SURROUNDING OFFICES...I HAVE
UPDATED THE HWO AND ISSUED AN SPS CONCERNING THE POTENTIAL OF
SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. MAIN CONCERN
IS LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING STRAIGHT LINE WINDS. SHEAR PROFILE ALSO SUPPORTS
SUPERCELL DEVELOPMENT AND ROTATION WITH AFTERNOON STORMS AS WELL.

AS WARM FRONT MOVES INTO THE WESTERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...
I EXPECT TEMPERATURES TO WARM INTO THE 50S TO NEAR 60 SOUTH...SO
WILL UPDATE HIGHS ACCORDINGLY.

FXUS64 KMRX 280904
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
404 AM EST WED DEC 28 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A VERY BOTHERSOME FORECAST WITH 
A SHORTWAVE SWINGING THROUGH THE REGION TODAY AND WRAP AROUND 
TONIGHT.  MOISTURE APPEARS TO BE THE BIG LIMITING FACTOR WITH 
PRECIPITATION YET TO BREAK OUT.  DO FEEL THAT AS THE SYSTEM TAPS 
INTO THE GULF...PRECIPITATION WILL BEGIN AND SHOULD HAVE GOOD 
COVERAGE ACROSS THE AREA...HOWEVER AMOUNT WILL BE LIGHT.  WORDING 
FOR THE CATEGORICAL PERIOD WILL BE ...PERIODS OF RAIN SHOWERS...AND 
WILL PROBABLY ALSO ADD THE WORD LIGHT TO INDICATE LIMITED RAIN WITH 
THIS SYSTEM.

BOTH GFS AND NAM FAIRLY CLOSE AND LEANED A LITTLE TOWARDS THE GFS 
FOR GUIDANCE WHERE THEY DIFFERED AS IT APPEARS TO HAVE A LITTLE 
BETTER HANDLE ON TIMING OF THE SYSTEM.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...LOTS OF MINOR CHANGES
MADE EARLY PERIODS OUT TO SATURDAY NIGHT. THE SHORT TERM SYSTEM
(WHICH LOOKS STARVED FOR MOISTURE AT THIS POINT) MAY PROVIDE SOME
WRAP AROUND MOISTURE INTO THURSDAY...BUT MAINLY FOR THE NRN HALF OF
THE FORECAST AREA. POPS WERE REDONE TO REFLECT THIS SCENARIO WITH
MUCH LOWER POPS GIVEN TO SE TN/SW NC AND THE CENTRAL SECTIONS OF
THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY. NOT MUCH THREAT OF SNOW ON THURSDAY
AS LOW LEVEL THICKNESSES STAY MUCH TOO WARM...AND 850 MB TEMPS
BARELY FALL BELOW ZERO DEGREES CELSIUS. LET THE PCPN END MUCH
FASTER THURSDAY EVENING...KEEPING JUST A MENTION OF SPRINKLES OR
FLURRIES IN SW VA...SMOKIES AND NRN MTNS OF TN.

NEXT SYSTEM FOR FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY ALSO REQUIRED A FEW
CHANGES...MAINLY TO SPEED UP THE ONSET OF SHOWERS BY LATE FRIDAY
NIGHT PER BOTH NAM AND GFS. CONFIDENCE WAS TOO LOW (GIVEN WEAKNESS
OF TODAYS SYSTEM) TO GO LIKELY OR HIGHER WITH POPS JUST YET FOR
FRIDAY NIGHT OR EARLY SATURDAY. SYSTEMS SEEM TO BE ARRIVING IN LINE
WITH FASTER SOLUTIONS OF LATE...SO SOME SUPPORT FOR THIS THINKING.

OTHERWISE...MINOR ADJUSTMENTS MADE TO MAX AND MIN TEMPS TO BE IN
LINE WITH LATEST MOS IN THE EARLIER PERIODS...AND ALSO TO SMOOTH
OUT SOME SLIGHT DISCREPANCIES WITH NEIGBORING GRIDS FURTHER OUT IN
THE LONG RANGE. NAM MOS MAX TEMPS FOR THURSDAY STILL APPEARED TOO COOL
...ESPECIALLY IN AREAS THAT GET DOWNSLOPING AND POSSIBLE PARTIAL
CLEARING BY THE AFTERNOON. THANKS TO NEIGHBORING OFFICES FOR THE GOOD
COLLABORATION TO WORK OUT THESE CHANGES.

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH AND MIDLEVEL CLOUDS WILL OVERSPREAD THE AREA TONIGHT...WITH
LOW LEVEL CLOUDS INCREASING TOWARD DAYBREAK AS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE
ADVECTION INCREASES. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD PUT A CAP ON RAPIDLY
FALLING TEMPERATURES. TEMPS ACROSS THE AREA ARE WELL BELOW FORECAST
VALUES...BUT EXPECT THAT THE FORECAST MINS ARE NOT TOO FAR OFF.
WILL MAKE SOME SLIGHT DOWNWARD ADJUSTMENTS TO TEMPERATURES. WILL
ALSO INCREASE WINDS IN THE MOUNTAINS AS MODELS SHOW A STRENGTHENING
LOW LEVEL JET OVERNIGHT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 PM EST TUE DEC 27 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...NEXT SYSTEM ALREADY HEADED 
TOWARD AREA WITH WARM/MOIST ADVECTION BEGINNING.  GENERALLY WENT 
CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS TONIGHT...EXCEPT A LITTLE WARMER IN THE WEST 
DUE TO EARLIER ARRIVAL OF CLOUD COVER AND WARM ADVECTION.  WORKED 
HOURLY TEMPS TO GET LOW TEMPS IN MIDDLE OF NIGHT WEST AND NEAR USUAL 
DAYBREAK TIMING IN NORTHEAST.  LIKEWISE ON WEDNESDAY...HAVE HIGH 
TEMPS EARLY IN WEST AND CLOSER TO NORMAL TIME IN NORTHEAST DUE TO 
TIMING OF CLOUDS AND PRECIP.  HAVE GONE QUITE COOL WITH HIGH TEMPS 
IN WEST WEDNESDAY AS CLOUDS AND RAIN SHOULD BE STARTING EARLY...BUT 
IN NORTHEAST DOWNSLOPING WINDS AND LATE ARRIVAL OF CLOUDS SHOULD 
OFFER GOOD WARMUP...SO KTRI SHOULD BE WARMER THAN KCHA FROM LATE 
MORNING THROUGH THE AFTERNOON.

QUESTION AS TO HOW UNSTABLE THE AIR MASS WILL GET ON WEDNESDAY.  
LOOKING LIKE MOST OF THE RICH/MOIST AIR WILL STAY ON OTHER SIDE OF 
THE PLATEAU AND SOUTH OF THE AREA...SO WILL NOT INTRODUCE THUNDER AT 
THIS TIME.  BEST CHANCES IN SOUTHWEST AND WESTERN AREAS ON 
WEDNESDAY...BUT NOT LOOKING THAT PROMISING FOR NOW.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS BRINGING A 
COLD FRONT THROUGH AREA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  PRETTY GOOD MOISTURE 
AND DYNAMICS WITH IT...WILL BUMP UP POPS TO 90 PERCENT FOR WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT. THICKNESSES STILL INDICATE PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE LIQUID 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  UPPER TROUGH TRACKING THROUGH ON THURSDAY...BEST 
CHANCES SHOULD REMAIN IN THE MORNING HOURS AND IN THE NORTH.  
MOISTURE LINGERS INTO THURSDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP 20 POPS FOR 
SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS THURSDAY NIGHT...SHOULD BE COLD 
ENOUGH FOR A RAIN/SNOW MIX...ESPECIALLY IN THE MOUNTAINS...EXPECTED 
DRY WEATHER ELSEWHERE.  RIDGING RETURNS BRIEFLY BRINGING DRY WEATHER 
ON FRIDAY.  NEXT FRONT MOVING INTO AREA BY FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY...FRONT A LITTLE SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS...WILL HOLD BEST 
CHANCES FRIDAY NIGHT UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT...THEN CONTINUE 40 POPS 
INTO SATURDAY.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS SATURDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY DRY FOR NOW.  ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHES ON 
MONDAY...A LITTLE QUICKER THAN PREVIOUS FORECAST...WILL ADD SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND BUMP UP POPS TO 40 PERCENT ON 
MONDAY.  UPPER TROUGH LINGERING INTO MONDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP CHANCE 
POPS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY WITH THE BEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH.  
DRY WEATHER RETURNS TUESDAY AFTERNOON.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...RADAR AND OBS INDICATE PRECIP

AROUND EARLY TONIGHT MAINLY IN THE MOUNTAINS. WILL ALLOW SNOW

MAKING ONLY SLOW PROGRESS TOWARD THE AREA FROM WEST...BUT EROSION 
FROM THE SOUTH HAS PICKED UP A BIT.  THINK MOS TOO OPTIMISTIC ON 
CLEARING...AS NAM12 SOUNDINGS HINTING THAT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE MAY 
GET TRAPPED UNDER THE INVERSION TONIGHT WITH LACK OF STRONG DRY AIR 
PUSH IN LOW LEVELS.  WILL BEEF UP CLOUDS IN THE GRIDS FOR 
TONIGHT...WITH GRADUAL CLEARING FROM SOUTHWEST.  TOMORROW WILL GO 
PARTLY CLOUDY NORTH TO MOSTLY SUNNY SOUTH WITH NEAR GFS MOS TEMPS.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...RIDGE BRINGS DRY 
WEATHER INTO TUESDAY NIGHT.  MODELS BRINGING A COLD FRONT INTO AREA 
ON WEDNESDAY.  NAM A LITTLE QUICKER THAN GFS ON BRINGING FRONT INTO 
AREA...WILL USE A BLEND ON TIMING.  WILL ADD LIKELY POPS FOR 
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR OUR SOUTHERN AND WESTERN ZONES...THEN LIKELY 
POPS ACROSS THE CWA FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT WHEN BEST MOISTURE AND 
DYNAMICS ARRIVES.  THICKNESSES STILL INDICATE PRECIPITATION SHOULD 
BE LIQUID WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  UPPER TROUGH TRACKING THROUGH ON 
THURSDAY.  NAM IS A LITTLE SLOWER THAN GFS...BUT MOST OF THE SHOWERS 
SHOULD OUT OF AREA BE EARLY ON THURSDAY.  MOISTURE LINGERS INTO 
THURSDAY NIGHT... WILL KEEP 20 POPS FOR SOUTHWEST VA AND THE 
MOUNTAINS THURSDAY NIGHT...MAY SEE SOME UPSLOPE SNOWSHOWERS LATE 
THURSDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS...SHOULD BE DRY ELSEWHERE.  
RIDGING RETURNS BRIEFLY BRINGING DRY WEATHER ON FRIDAY.  NEXT FRONT 
MOVING INTO AREA BY FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY.  FRONT A LITTLE 
QUICKER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS...WILL ADD LOW CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY 
NIGHT AND SATURDAY.  SOME RESIDUAL MOISTURE LINGERING INTO SATURDAY 
NIGHT...WILL KEEP 20 POPS THROUGH THE NIGHT.  THICKNESSES A BIT 
COOLER THAN PREVIOUS RUN...COULD SEE SOME SNOW ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VA...NORTHEAST TN AND THE MOUNTAINS ON SATURDAY NIGHT.  DRY WEATHER 
RETURNS BRIEFLY ON SUNDAY BEFORE ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHES ON

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 260937
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
436 AM EST MON DEC 26 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FORECAST BASICALLY APPEARED TO 
BE ON TRACK THIS MORNING...ALTHO TIME OF THE DAY DOES NOT AFFORD 
MUCH GROUND TRUTH REPORTS AS TO WHERE IT IS SNOWING AND HOW MUCH. 
FEW CALLS MADE TO SWRN VA INDICATED VERY LIGHT SNOW IN WISE COUNTY 
VA...BUT SNOW WAS NOT ACCUMULATING ON ROADS OR GRASSY AREAS.  
SURFACE TEMPS REMAIN GENERALLY IN THE LOWER TO MIDDLE 30S ACROSS 
SWRN VA... WITH WEAK WARM AIR ADVECTION IN THE LOWER LEVELS ALREADY 
NUDGING EASTWARD FROM CENTRAL KY AND WEST TN.  THUS...DECIDED TO 
KEEP SWRN VA SNOW ACCUMULATIONS BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA FOR 
TODAY...ALSO BASED ON A DIMINISHING MOISTURE PROFILE FOR LATER THIS 
MORNING...ACTUALLY FALLING BELOW THE BEST DENDRITIC GROWTH ZONE.  
COLDEST TEMPS AT TOP OF THE SATURATED LAYER WERE ALSO MARGINAL EVEN 
FOR EARLY THIS MORNING (BARELY -10 DEGREES C).  

MAIN AREA OF THREAT FOR SNOW ADVISORY AMOUNTS STILL APPEARS TO BE 
NRN AND SMOKY MTNS OF EAST TN.  SWITCHED THE KMRX RADAR OVER TO 
CLEAR AIR MODE TO BETTER DETECT ANY AREAS OF SNOW...AND WE FIND SOME 
20 TO 30 DBZ RETURNS MAINLY IN THOSE AREAS.  EVENING SHIFT 
COORDINATED WITH SMOKY MTN NATL PARK AND SOME LIGHT SNOWS WERE 
STARTING TO ACCUMULATE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AT THAT TIME.  RADAR 
VAD WIND PROFILE SHOWS DECENT UPSLOPE COMPONENT (WINDS AROUND 280 AT 
30 KNOTS)...SO LATER THIS MORNING WOULD EXPECT MAINLY AN UPSLOPE 
LIGHT SNOW EVENT (ALTHO HIGHEST SPOTS LIKE NEWFOUND GAP TO MT 
LECONTE MIGHT GET SLIGHTLY HEAVIER AMOUNTS THAN WILL APPEAR IN THE 
GRIDS AND WSWMRX PRODUCT).  ALTHOUGH...SOME CONCERN THAT SURFACE AND 
BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS MAY BE TOO WARM AND WILL HINDER ACCUMULATIONS.

BASED ON CURRENT SURFACE AND TOWER OBSERVATIONS FEEL THAT WIND 
SPEEDS WILL REMAIN BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA...AND WILL RUN 15 TO 25 
MPH WITH GUSTS UP TO 35 MPH IN SMOKY AND NRN MTNS.  OTHERWISE...
ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO MOST GRIDS FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT.  WILL 
ISSUE UPDATED WSWMRX PRODUCT AROUND TIME OF ZFP ISSUANCE.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WITH WEAK 
RIDGING ALOFT TUESDAY AND A RAPID WARMUP FROM MONDAY ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. MODEL GUIDANCE GIVING MID 50S TO NEAR 60 ACROSS MOST 
OF THE EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY. CROSS SECTION DATA SHOWS SOME HIGH 
CLOUDS SPREADING IN BY AFTERNOON BUT A FAIRLY DRY AIRMASS AND WARM 
AIR ADVECTION AND RISING HEIGHTS SHOULD RAISE HIGH TEMPERATURES 
ABOUT 10 DEGREES. HIGH LEVEL CLOUDINESS WILL KEEP LOWS MUCH WARMER 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS. ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA TEMPERATURES 
WILL STILL BE AROUND FREEZING IN THE SHELTERED VALLEYS BUT ELEVATED 
AREAS MAY BE CLOSER TO 40. STRONG SOUTHERLY WINDS WEDNESDAY SHOULD 
DEVELOP AS A DEEP LOW PRESSURE AREA FORMS OVER THE MS VALLEY AND 
MOVES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY OVERNIGHT. SOME INSTABILITY IS SEEN ON 
SOUNDINGS WEDNESDAY EVENING WITH THUNDER A POSSIBILITY. BUT TIME OF 
DAY AND TIME OF YEAR ARE NOT FAVORABLE FOR THUNDERSTORMS. WILL STILL 
KEEP PRECIPITATION TYPE SHOWERS AT THIS TIME. INCREASED POPS TO 
LIKELY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF COLD FRONT. WRAP AROUND MOISTURE 
WILL AFFECT REGION THURSDAY WITH CONTINUED CHANCE OF RAIN. 
TEMPERATURES WILL STAY MILD BEHIND THIS FRONT ALTHOUGH UP TO 10 
DEGREES COOLER AND SNOW SHOULD NOT BE A PROBLEM. ANOTHER BRIEF BREAK 
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY BEFORE ANOTHER SIGNIFICANT FRONT 
APPROACHES SATURDAY.    
&&

.DISCUSSION...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CONTINUES TO ROTATE THROUGH THE 
MRX CWA THIS EVENING.  ONE BAND OF PRECIP IS EXITING THE AREA WHILE 
ANOTHER MOVES IN.  VALLEY LOCATIONS WILL CONTINUE TO SEE SCATTERED 
LIGHT RAIN WITH INCOMING BAND.  HOWEVER...COOLING TEMPS AT HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS WILL ALLOW RAIN TO MIX WITH THEN TURN TO SNOW OVERNIGHT  
...MAINLY OVER THE EASTERN TN MOUNTAINS.  UP TO 3 INCHES OF SNOW IS 
POSSIBLE TONIGHT OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  THE LOW AND ASSOCIATED PRECIP 
SHOULD EXIT THE AREA OVERNIGHT.  HOWEVER...UPSLOPE FLOW AND 
CONTINUED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE MAY PRODUCE ADDITIONAL MOUNTAIN SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS THROUGH MONDAY.  AS A RESULT...A SNOW ADVISORY IS IN 
EFFECT THROUGH 400 PM MONDAY.  CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD...WILL 
UPDATE TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST SUN DEC 25 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...MID LEVEL 
CIRCULATION OPENING UP AS IT MOVES THROUGH MRX CWA THIS AFTERNOON.
SURFACE CONTINUES TO MOVE NE ACROSS OH. FIRST WIND SHIFT TO THE SW 
HAS MOVED EAST INTO THE MOUNTAINS. ANOTHER WIND SHIFT TO THE WEST 
WILL OCCUR THIS EVENING. THEN A LATER SHIFT TO THE NW WILL BRING THE 
BETTER CAA INTO THE LOW LEVELS. PCPN WILL DECREASE SOME THIS EVENING 
THEN INCREASE AS WRAP AROUND 850-700 MB TROUGH SWINGS THROUGH THE 
AREA. THIS TROUGH FAIRLY MOIST WITH HIGHER RHS AT OR ABV -10 C AS 
IT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA OVERNIGHT. FREEZING LEVELS LOOK CONSISTENT 
WITH PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS DROPPING TO 2000 FEET BY EARLY MONDAY. THE 
DEEPER MOISTURE WILL MOVE OUT OF THE AREA MONDAY MORNING. GOOD NW 
UPSLOPE FLOW WILL ALLOW SNOWSHOWERS TO CONTINUE ACROSS ADVISORY 
AREAS ON MONDAY. SW VA AND N CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WILL LIKELY SEE 
MEASURABLE SNOW TONIGHT AND MONDAY BUT AMOUNTS SHOULD REMAIN BELOW 
ADVISORY CRITERIA. HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST ON MONDAY 
WITH A FAIRLY FAST WARM UP FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS BRINGING A COLD 
FRONT INTO AREA ON WEDNESDAY...BEST CHANCES SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL 
AFTERNOON WHEN BETTER MOISTURE ARRIVES.  PRETTY GOOD DYNAMICS 
EXPECTED WITH THE FRONT...WILL GO WITH HIGH CHANCE ACROSS THE CWA 
FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND CONTINUE CHANCES INTO THURSDAY.  THICKNESSES 
STILL INDICATE PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE LIQUID WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY.  MOISTURE LINGERS INTO THURSDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP 20 POPS 
FOR SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS THURSDAY NIGHT...MAY SEE A 
RAIN/SNOW MIX LATE THURSDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS...SHOULD BE 
DRY ELSEWHERE.  DRY WEATHER CONTINUES ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA ON  
FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT.  NEXT FRONT MOVING INTO AREA BY SATURDAY.   
WITH BETTER MOISTURE EXPECTED THAN PREVIOUS RUNS...WILL BUMP UP POPS 
TO 30 PERCENT FOR SATURDAY AND 20 FOR SATURDAY NIGHT...SHOULD BE 
WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL RAIN ON SATURDAY...BUT THICKNESSES INDICATE 
PRECIPITATION COULD BE RAIN/SNOW ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND THE 
MOUNTAINS ON SATURDAY NIGHT.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON SUNDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 250934
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EST SUN DEC 25 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND MOST OF TONIGHT)...BROKEN AREAS OF RAIN 
CONTINUE TO SPREAD NORTHEAST ACROSS MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
MORNING.  SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL JET OF AROUND 30 KNOTS DOES CONTINUE 
TO PRODUCE A RAIN SHADOW AREA FROM LOWER ELEVATIONS OF SEVIER COUNTY 
NE TO JOHNSON COUNTY IN EXTREME NE TN.  SURFACE OBSERVATIONS AND 
IFLOWS DATA SUGGEST MOSTLY LIGHT RAIN AMOUNTS...ALTHO RADAR DATA 
INDICATES SPOTTY HEAVIER SHOWERS.  CEILINGS (CLOUD HEIGHTS) REMAIN 
MVFR TO VFR MOST AREAS...ALTHO IFR CONDITIONS ARE APPROACHING FROM 
MIDDLE TN AND NRN AL.  

THE UPPER LOW HAS SPUN EASTWARD TO BE CENTERED OVER FAR WESTERN TN 
NORTH INTO SRN IL.  A BRIEF DRY SLOT NOTED ON WATER VAPOR AND IR 
SATELLITE PICS APPEARS POISED TO MOVE IN BY OR BEFORE MID MORNING 
TODAY...WHICH SHOULD LEAD TO A SHORT BREAK IN THE RAIN...BEFORE MORE 
AT LEAST LIGHT RAIN WRAPS BACK AROUND INTO THE AREA AS THE UPPER LOW 
EASES FURTHER E AND NE.  POP AND WEATHER GRIDS WERE ADJUSTED TO 
REFLECT THIS THINKING FOR TODAY.  

FOR TONIGHT...COLD AIR ARRIVES JUST AS THE SYNOPTIC SCALE POSITIVE 
OMEGA LOOKS TO BE MOVING EAST OF THE REGION...WITH MOISTURE 
GRADUALLY BECOMING MORE AND MORE SHALLOW OVERNIGHT.  ALLOWED FOR A 
MENTION OF MIX OR CHANGE TO SNOW BY AROUND 02-03Z ON THE 26TH...
MAINLY JUST IN THE NWRN AREAS AND NRN MTNS.  WARM SURFACE TEMPS AND 
BOUNDARY LAYER MAY INHIBIT ANY SIGNIFICANT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS...
AND ALSO NOTED PER ETA BUFKIT THAT THE DENDRITIC GROWTH ZONE LOOKS 
TO BE ABOVE THE MOISTURE PROFILE LATE TONIGHT INTO EARLY MONDAY.
THUS...CONFIDENCE IN SNOW AMOUNTS REACHING ADVISORY LEVELS IS STILL 
LOW AT THIS POINT.  PLANNING TO CONTINUE A MENTION IN THE HWO 
PRODUCT AND ALSO MAY ISSUE A SHORT SPS LATER THIS MORNING.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...COLD AIR ALOFT BEHIND 
TODAYS SYSTEM SHOULD BE PRODUCING MOSTLY SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA EARLY MONDAY MORNING AS FREEZING LEVELS DROP TO NEAR 
THE SURFACE. SOME STRONG NW WINDS MONDAY AND CONTINUED MOISTURE WILL 
ADD SOME ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS IN FAVORED HIGHER ELEVATION AREAS 
OF SW VA AND NE TN INCLUDING THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS OF THE SMOKIES. 
THIS WILL BE MAINLY IN THE MORNING BUT PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE 
ENDING BY AFTERNOON AND TEMPERATURES WILL SLOWLY WARM. LOW CLOUDS 
WILL SLOWLY DECREASE AS UPPER LOW AND TROUGH LIFTS NORTHEAST. NE 
SECTIONS MAY SEE CLOUDS ALL DAY WITH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE THICKER 
THERE. A FAST MOVING SHORTWAVE MONDAY NIGHT EARLY TUESDAY WILL BRING 
ANOTHER INCREASE IN HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE BUT NO PRECIPITATION. 
RIDGING WILL BUILD IN TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT AND A SURFACE LOW 
DEVELOPS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. MUCH WARMER TEMPERATURES 
TUESDAY AS HEIGHTS RISE. WEDNESDAY THIS SYSTEM DEEPENS AND SPREADS 
RAIN INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY LOOKING SIMILAR TO WHAT IS OCCURRING 
TODAY. THE SURFACE LOW MAY TRACK EVEN FARTHER SOUTH AS WELL. DAY 
SHIFT WILL PROBABLY NEED TO INCREASE POPS TO LIKELY FOR THE 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT OR THURSDAY TIME FRAME OF THE FORECAST. ANOTHER 
STRONG SYSTEM APPROACHES FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY WITH THE LOW 
MOVING OVER THE GREAT LAKES STATES. NEITHER SYSTEM HAS MUCH COLD AIR 
BEHIND THEM SO ONLY THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS SHOULD SEE ANY SNOW.
AN SPS HAS BEEN ISSUED FOR THE EXPECTED SNOWFALL TONIGHT AND MONDAY 
MORNING. MERRY CHRISTMAS FROM US HERE AT MRX.     
&&

SCT TSTMS SW AREAS. LOW MEANDERS EASTWARD ACROSS TN OVRNGT WITH SFC 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY MOVE INTO MRX CWA ARND DAYBREAK. A MID LEVEL DRY 
SLOT SWINGS INTO THE AREA ABOUT THAT TIME AND WILL RESULT IN A 
DECREASE IN PCPN COVERAGE SUN MORNING. ON AND OFF LIGHT PCPN WILL 
LIKELY CONTINUE THROUGHOUT THE DAY. LOW WILL BE NORTH OF AREA SUN 
EVENING AND TROUGH AXIS WILL MOVE THROUGH SLIGHTLY BEFORE MIDNIGHT. 
FREEZING LEVEL STARTS TO DECEND AND FALLS TO NEAR 1700 BY MON 
MORNING. CONTINUED RELATIVELY HIGH POPS SUN NGT AS WRAP AROUND 
MOISTURE LOOKS GOOD ONLY TAPERING TO .50 PWS. A SNOW ADVSRY MAY BE 
REQUIRED FOR LOCATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET WHILE LOWER LOCATIONS SHOULD 
SEE A MIX OR RAIN AND MELTING SNOWS. 26/00-06Z THERE IS GOOD 
MOISTURE ABOVE THE -10C ISOTHERM SO MNT TOPS COULD SEE LARGER SNOW 
ACCUMULATION. UPSLOPE SNOW CONTINUE ON MONDAY ACROSS FAVORED 
LOCATION WITH MIXED PCPN MAINLY ACROSS NE TN/SW VA. ALL LOCATIONS 
BACK TO BELOW FREEZING BY TUE MORNING AFTER PCPN CHC LEAVES THE AREA.

BRIEFLY ON TUESDAY.  GFS INDICATING NEXT FRONT MOVING INTO AREA ON 
WEDNESDAY...WILL HOLD OFF POPS UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON WHEN BETTER 
MOISTURE ARRIVES...THEN CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY.  THICKNESSES INDICATE PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE LIQUID 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...THEN A RAIN/SNOW MIX WILL BE POSSIBLE 
BY THURSDAY NIGHT ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS...AND DRY 
ELSEWHERE.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA BY FRIDAY.  
NEXT DISTURBANCE MOVING INTO AREA BY SATURDAY.  WILL ADD 20 POPS FOR 
SATURDAY...SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL RAIN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
426 AM EST SAT DEC 24 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES TO DEEPEN 
TO OUR WEST WITH A CLOSED UPPER LOW SLOWLY WORKING EAST INTO THE MID 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION THIS MORNING.  SURFACE LOW PROGD TO 
DEVELOP ACROSS WRN TN AND NRN AL BY THIS EVENING...WITH ASSOCIATED 
COLD AND/OR OCCLUDED FRONT TO MOVE THRU MOST OF OUR FORECAST AREA BY 
12Z SUNDAY.  MODELS SEEMED IN GENERAL AGREEMENT AND SPREAD SHOWERS 
INTO WRN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA LATE THIS AFTERNOON...THEN 
ACROSS REST OF THE AREA FROM LATE EVENING INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS.  

ONLY SLIGHT POP AND SKY COVER ADJUSTMENTS MADE FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS 
FOR THESE PERIODS...ALTHO DID ADD A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS 
FOR SE TN COUNTIES IN LINE WITH DAY ONE CONVECTIVE OUTLOOK.  LIMITED 
THE MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS TO LATE TONIGHT...WHEN BEST LIFT...UPPER
LEVEL DIVERGENCE AND INSTABILITY WERE NOTED.  DID INCREASE THE WINDS 
LATE TONIGHT...ESPECIALLY ACROSS PLATEAU AND ERN MOUNTAINS...AS LOW 
LEVEL JET REACHES AROUND 40 KNOTS.

OTHERWISE...HIGHS GENERALLY IN THE 50S FOR TODAY WITH COOLER VALUES 
FOR SE TN WHERE CLOUDS THICKEN SOONER AND SHOWERS MOVE IN QUICKEST.
MINS TONIGHT WERE KEPT CLOSER TO THE SIMILAR NAM/GFS MOS VALUES.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT OF 
FAIRLY DEEP LOW PRESSURE AREA TO THE WEST AND NORTHWEST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA SUNDAY MORNING WITH MID LEVEL LOW TO THE WEST AND A 
COLD FRONT MOVING THROUGH THE AREA. AIRMASS BECOMES SLIGHTLY 
UNSTABLE ACROSS THE EASTERN TN VALLEY SUNDAY MORNING AND BRIEF DRY 
SLOT MOVES THROUGH DURING THE MORNING AS THE SYSTEM WRAPS UP. KEPT 
HIGH POPS IN THE FORM OF RAIN SHOWERS GOING ALTHOUGH A FEW 
THUNDERSTORMS ARE NOT OUT OF THE QUESTION LINGERING SUNDAY MORNING 
BOTH ALONG FRONT AND WITH COLDER AIR ALOFT ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE 
SYSTEM. HAVE WARMED TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES SUNDAY WITH A BREAK 
IN THE PRECIPITATION EXPECTED IN THE MORNING AS DRY SLOT MOVES 
ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE BEHIND FRONT. SHOWERS SHOULD OVERSPREAD THE 
FORECAST AREA AGAIN BY AFTERNOON AND TEMPERATURES SHOULD STEADY OUT 
OR FALL AS COLDER AIR ALOFT FILTERS IN. FREEZING LEVELS FALL SUNDAY 
NIGHT SO RAIN SHOULD CHANGEOVER TO SNOW IN THE MOUNTAINS DURING THE 
EVENING. ONLY LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS OF AROUND 1 INCH OR SO EXPECTED 
EXPECT THE FAVORED HIGHEST ELEVATIONS OF THE SMOKIES. NAM A FEW 
HOURS SLOWER WITH MOVING MOISTURE OUT MONDAY SO EXTENDED POPS LATER 
IN THE DAY NE HALF WITH POSSIBLE SNOW SHOWERS AT HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
IN THE MORNING. GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE LOWER MAV GUIDANCE FOR POPS 
SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT BUT USED THE MAV/NAM BLEND FOR LOWS SUNDAY 
NIGHT AND HIGHS MONDAY. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED TO THE SOUTH 
WILL BRING DRY WEATHER MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY AND ANOTHER SYSTEM 
SENDS RAIN FROM THE SOUTHWEST LATE WEDNESDAY.

THE MODEL OF CHOICE DEPICTING A CLOSED LOW DROPPING INTO IOWA EARLY 
SAT. MODELS AGREE ON A SLOWER SOLUTION AS THE LOW MOVES ACROSS TN 
AND KY ON SUN. SAT PCPN TIMING BACKED UP WITH WIDESPREAD COVERAGE 
EXPECTED SAT NGT. SURFACE COLD FRONT SHOULD MOVE EAST INTO MNTS BY 
SUN AFTN WITH MID LEVEL DRYING SO PCPN COVERAGE WILL DECREASE AS 
TEMPERATURES FALL IN THE AFTN. RAIN WILL BECOME MIXED WITH AND 
CHANGE TO SNOW SUN NGT AS FREEZING LEVELS FALL TO ARND 1500-2000 W-E 
SUNDAY NGT. LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS PSBL ACROSS HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
INCLUDING THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...STILL A CHANCE 
OF RAIN/SNOW IN THE NORTHEAST AND MOUNTAINS EARLY MONDAY ACROSS AS 
UPPER TROUGH PASSES...WILL KEEP ONLY 20 POPS FOR THE MORNING...THEN 
DRY BY AFTERNOON.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS BRIEFLY ON TUESDAY.  GFS 
INDICATING NEXT FRONT MOVING INTO AREA ON WEDNESDAY...WILL HOLD OFF 
POPS UNTIL WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON WHEN BETTER MOISTURE ARRIVES.  
THICKNESSES INDICATE PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE LIQUID WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
AND THURSDAY MORNING...THEN A RAIN/SNOW MIX WILL BE POSSIBLE BY 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS.  SHOULD BE 
SNOW BY THURSDAY NIGHT ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS AND DRY 
ELSEWHERE.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA BY FRIDAY.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             30  54  40  46 /  10  50 100  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  29  53  40  45 /  10  50 100  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       29  52  39  44 /  10  50 100  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              22  55  38  44 /   0  20  90  80

FXUS64 KMRX 231611
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1100 AM EST FRI DEC 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...VERY DRY AIRMASS NOTED ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA WITH 07Z TEMPS RUNNING SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW GRID 
VALUES UNDER CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS.  23/00Z OHX AND RNK 
SOUNDINGS SHOWED JUST AROUND A VERY MEAGER 0.10 INCH OF PRECIPITABLE 
WATER.  

SATELLITE PICS SHOW A SHORTWAVE MOVING EAST TO OUR NORTH ACROSS THE 
MID/UPR MISS VALLEY REGION.  THIS FEATURE LOOKS TO SPREAD SOME MID 
TO HI CLOUDS OVER THE OHIO VALLEY AND CENTRAL APPALACHIANS TODAY... 
WHILE OUR REGION ENJOYS SUNNY SKIES.  IN FACT...THERE MAY JUST BE A 
SLIGHT INCREASE IN HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE VERY LATE TONIGHT TOWARD 
DAYBREAK SATURDAY.

SURFACE GRADIENT TIGHTENS TONIGHT AS STRONGER SHORTWAVE AND COLD 
FRONT APPROACH.  THIS MAKES FOR A TRICKY MIN TEMP FORECAST GIVEN THE 
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHTER WINDS ACROSS EASTERN AREAS (INCLUDING 
ERN MTN ZONES).  WENT CLOSE TO THE MILDER MINS ACROSS OUR PLATEAU 
COUNTIES INTO LEE/WISE COUNTIES OF SWRN VA...BUT FAVORED THE COOLER 
MINS IN EXTREME NE TN AREAS SUCH AS TRI.  

OTHERWISE...FOR HIGHS TODAY...NOTICED MOS HAD BEEN A LITTLE TOO WARM 
OVERALL FOR 1ST PERIOD HIGHS...THUS FAVORED A BLEND OF THE COOLER 
GFS AND NAM MOS

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE 
OVER THE MID MS VALLEY SATURDAY WILL INCREASE MOISTURE RAPIDLY 
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND INCREASE SOUTH TO SOUTHWEST WINDS 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND NIGHT AS A COLD FRONT MOVES ACROSS TN. MAIN 
CHANGES TO FORECAST THIS WEEKEND WAS TO INCREASE POPS SLIGHTLY 
SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY AS TIMING OF PRECIPITATION WITH NEXT SYSTEM 
LOOKS TO BE LATE SATURDAY AND THEN OVERNIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT TAPERING 
OFF SUNDAY. AS COLDER AIR MOVES IN BEHIND SYSTEM SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
EARLY MONDAY FREEZING LEVELS DROP TO AROUND 3000 FEET AND THEN NEAR 
THE SURFACE BY MORNING MONDAY. THE BEST MOISTURE STAYS IN THE OHIO 
AND MID ATLANTIC BUT MOUNTAIN LOCATIONS COULD PICK UP AN INCH OR SO 
OF SNOW...POSSIBLY MORE AT THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. AT LOWER 
ELEVATIONS SNOWSHOWERS OR FLURRIES WILL BE POSSIBLE BUT GROUND 
TEMPERATURES AT LOWER ELEVATIONS ARE LIKELY TO BE TO WARM FOR ANY 
ACCUMULATIONS BEFORE PRECIPITATION ENDS EARLY MONDAY. HIGH PRESSURE 
MOVES IN FROM THE WEST LATER MONDAY AND TUESDAY. THE NEXT CHANCE OF 
RAIN WILL BE LATE WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT POSSIBLY CHANGING TO 
SNOW BEFORE ENDING THURSDAY.   
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             55  32  56  39 /   0  10  60  80 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  53  30  54  39 /   0  10  50  80 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       52  30  53  38 /   0  10  60  80 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              52  22  55  37 /   0   0  30  80

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST THU DEC 22 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...A BAND OF CIRRUS WILL 
MOVE EAST ACROSS THE AREA THIS EVENING. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
REMAINS IN PLACE. TODAYS TEMPS HAVE BEEN RUNNING 3-8 DEGREES ABOVE 
WEDNESDAY. TEMPS SHOULD FALL FAST AFTER DARK WITH GOOD RADIATION 
CONDITIONS AND LOW DPS TONIGHT...WENT BELOW MOS GUIDANCE FOR MINS. 
NW EDGE OF SURFACE RIDGE WEAKENS FRI AS SW FLOW AND WARMING GETS 
UNDERWAY. A DRY SHORT WAVE APPROACHES AREA FROM SW AND MOVES THROUGH 
FRI NGT WITH LITTLE CONSEQUENCE. GFS REMAINS STRONGER WITH ENERGY 
DROPPING OUT OF THE N ROCKIES ON SAT. PREFER THIS OUTLIER SOLUTION 
BUT EFFECT ON MRX CWA CHANGES LITTLE EXCEPT WIND SPEEDS AND 
DIRECTION MAY NEED LATER TWEAKING PENDING DEVELOPING SFC LOW 
POSITION/STRENGTH. MOISTURE DOES TRANSPORT IN THE AREA FROM THE SW 
ON SAT. LIFT/INSTABILITY LIMITED BUT SCT SHWRS ON TRACK TO MOVE IN 
SAT AFTN. BULK OF PCPN NEAR FRONTAL ZONE WHICH MOVES THROUGH SAT 
NGT/SUN MORN. CAA UNDERWAY SUN WILL TEMPS STEADY OR FALLING IN THE 
AFTN. SCT SHWRS TAPERING OFF SUN/SUN EVENING CHANGING TO SNOW SHWRS 
SUN NIGHT ACROSS FAVORED N AREAS.  


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...STILL A CHANCE RAIN/SNOW IN 
THE NORTHEAST AND MOUNTAINS EARLY MONDAY ACROSS AS UPPER TROUGH 
PASSES...WILL KEEP ONLY 20 POPS FOR THE MORNING...THEN DRY BY 
AFTERNOON.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS BRIEFLY ON TUESDAY.  GFS INDICATING 
NEXT FRONT MOVING INTO AREA ON LATE WEDNESDAY...WILL HOLD OFF POPS 
UNTIL WEDNESDAY NIGHT WHEN BETTER MOISTURE ARRIVES.  THICKNESS 
INDICATE PRECIPITATION SHOULD BE RAIN WEDNESDAY NIGHT THEN SWITCH TO 
A MIX BY THURSDAY MORNING.  LATEST GFS PUSHING BEST MOISTURE OUT OF 
AREA QUICKER THEN PREVIOUS RUN...BUT WILL KEEP 20 POPS FOR ALL OF 
THURSDAY FOR NOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 AM EST THU DEC 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DRY NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT AND 
STRONG SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE AREA WEATHER THROUGH THE 
NEXT 24 HOURS.  AS A RESULT...WE WILL SEE CONTINUED DRY CONDITIONS.  
TEMPERATURES WILL WARM SLIGHTLY TODAY AS HEIGHT RISES PRODUCE WEAK 
WARM ADVECTION.  MODELS HANDLE THIS WELL AND WILL KEEP CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS.

LONG TERM...(FRI THROUGH WED)...LOOKS LIKE PLENTY OF SUNSHINE AGAIN 
ON FRIDAY WITH MILD TEMPS...THEN NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES FOR THE 
WEEKEND.  MODELS STILL IN POOR AGREEMENT...SO CONFIDENCE ON THE 
DETAILS STILL LOW.  GFS DEEPER THAN THE NAM...CUTTING OFF A LOW AT 
H5.  THINK A COMPROMISE SOLUTION IS THE COURSE OF LEAST REGRET FOR 
NOW.  WILL BRING CHANCE POPS IN BY SAT AFTERNOON...AND CONTINUE 
CHANCE THROUGH SAT NIGHT INTO SUNDAY MORNING.  THIS PRECIP SHOULD BE 
MAINLY RAIN...ALTHOUGH COLDER AIR ARRIVING ON SUNDAY MAY TURN ANY 
LINGERING SHOWERS TO SNOW SHOWERS OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  MAY 
SEE SOME SHOWERS AND SNOW SHOWERS IN THE COLD AIR ADVECTION AND 
NORTHWEST FLOW SUNDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY MONDAY...MAINLY NORTH AND 
MOUNTAINS...SO WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS. WILL NOT 
MAKE MUCH IN THE WAY OF CHANGES TO TUE AND WED FOR NOW.

SOUTH...WITH A LEE TROUGH ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL BRING DRY AND 
TRANQUIL CONDITIONS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH TOMORROW. AN 
UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH IS PROGGED TO SWING OVER THE REGION 
TONIGHT...BRINGING SOME CLOUDS OVER MAINLY THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL GENERALLY TREND TOWARD THE GFS 
MOS NUMBERS FOR TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...TRANQUIL WEATHER  
WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE REMAINS OVERHEAD. 
ALSO A VERY DRY ATMOSPHERE WILL ALLOW ANOTHER COLD NIGHT WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT BUT A WARMER DAY THURSDAY AND EVEN MORE WARMING FRIDAY. PUT 
HIGHS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY IN THE 50S IN MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
PATTERN CHANGES ON SATURDAY AS SYSTEM DROPS SOUTHEAST OUT OF 
CENTRAL CANADA AND NEAR ZONAL FLOW FRIDAY SHIFTS TO MORE 
SOUTHWESTERLY. 12Z RUN OF GFS DEVELOPS A SURFACE LOW OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS WHICH WOULD KEEP THE TN VALLEY FAIRLY WARM SATURDAY 
NIGHT AND SUNDAY BEFORE FRONT MOVES THROUGH. KEPT FORECAST COLDER 
FOR NOW WITH HIGHER PRECIPITATION CHANCES SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
SUNDAY NIGHT. COLDER AIR MOVES IN SUNDAY NIGHT BEHIND NEXT SYSTEM. 
SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. BEST CHANCE OF 
ACCUMULATION IN THE MOUNTAINS BUT CURRENTLY ONLY FORECASTING CHANCE 
POPS. VALLEY LOCATIONS MAY SEE SOME SNOW MIXED IN BUT GROUND 
TEMPERATURES LIKELY TO WARM AND LIMITED MOISTURE FOR ANY 
ACCUMULATION BY THE TIME ANY SNOW FALLS. LATER SHIFTS WILL HAVE TO 
WATCH IF MORE DEVELOPMENT OF SYSTEM OCCURS IN LATER RUNS.    
&&

PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST VA THIS AFTERNOON...BUT THEY ARE GRADUALLY

AND TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
FRIDAY TROUGH WILL CONTINUE OVER THE EASTERN STATES AT MID WEEK 
WITH A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE NORTH CENTRAL STATES 
EXTENDING SOUTHEAST TO COVER THE TN AND OHIO VALLEYS. A WEAK SYSTEM 
WILL MOVE FROM THE LOWER MS VALLEY EAST ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. THE ONLY AFFECT FOR THE FORECAST AREA WILL BE A 
FEW MORE CLOUDS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AREAS. WARMED TEMPERATURES A FEW 
DEGREES WEDNESDAY OVER TUESDAY WITH VERY DRY AIR IN PLACE AND UPPER 
TROUGH STARTING TO LIFT NORTHEAST. THURSDAY AND FRIDAY SHOULD WARM 
FURTHER REACHING INTO THE 50S AS THE UPPER TROUGH LIFTS NE AND 
SURFACE HIGH MOVES TO THE EAST AND AIR REMAINS VERY DRY.

SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY...GFS AND DGEX SHOWS A FAST MOVING SYSTEM 
DEVELOPING IN CANADA LATE THIS WEEK THAT MOVES SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS LATE SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY MORNING. THE MAIN 
PART OF THE STORM STAYS TO THE NORTH. THE COLD FRONT SHOULD BRING 
MAINLY RAIN SATURDAY NIGHT WITH A LITTLE SNOW AT HIGHER ELEVATIONS. 
ANOTHER SYSTEM FOLLOWS QUICKLY BEHIND SUNDAY INTO MONDAY. THIS 
SYSTEM SHOULD BRING A LITTLE COLDER AIR WITH IT AND POSSIBLY A 
LITTLE BETTER CHANCE OF SNOW TO THE MOUNTAINS SUNDAY NIGHT. NOT REAL 
CONFIDENT EITHER SYSTEM WILL BE SIGNIFICANT SO ONLY HAVE 20 TO 30 
PERCENT CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION.

OVERNIGHT FOR THE MOUNTAINS AND NC COUNTIES.

A FAST-MOVING UPPER TROUGH CROSSES THE AREA ON MONDAY. MODELS HAVE
FLIP-FLOPPED WITH HOW MUCH MOISTURE THERE WILL BE IN THE NORTHWEST
FLOW. HOWEVER LIFT CONTINUES TO BE VERY WEAK...AND WILL MAINTAIN A
DRY FORECAST. 

TEMPERATURE DO DIFFER QUITE A BIT IN THE MOS GUIDANCE TOMORROW...WITH
THE MET SHOWING HIGHS IN THE 50S. THIS SEEMS TO BE A LITTLE TOO
WARM GIVEN THE BELOW NORMAL TEMPS WE HAVE HAD LATELY. WILL LEAN
TOWARD THE COOLER GFS...WITH HIGHS MAINLY IN THE 40S. OTHERWISE MOS
TEMPS ARE CLOSE TO EACH OTHER...AND WILL STAY CLOSE TO CONSENSUS.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
LITTLE CHANGES NEEDED THIS PERIOD...DRY FORECAST WILL BE CONTINUED.
A SHORTWAVE TROUGH IN THE SOUTHERN STREAM PASSES WELL TO OUR
SOUTH...AND MAY BRING A SLIGHT INCREASE IN CLOUDS. OTHERWISE MOSTLY
CLEAR SKIES AND A WARMING TREND THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK.

306 PM EST FRI DEC 16 2005

.SHORT TERM...
TONIGHT AND SATURDAY...A LARGE LOW PRESSURE AREA AND UPPER LOW WAS

WITH WEAK HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING INTO THE TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN

SOUTHWEST AHEAD OF NEXT DEVELOPING SYSTEM OVER TX ALREADY BEGINNING 
TO PRODUCE PRECIPITATION OVER WEST TEXAS THIS AFTERNOON. SKIES ARE 
GENERALLY PARTLY CLOUDY THIS AFTERNOON AFTER SOME STUBBORN LOW 
CLOUDS ACROSS THE NORTH DEPARTED LATE THIS MORNING AND HIGH CLOUDS 
BEGAN ARRIVING FROM THE SW THIS AFTERNOON. TEMPERATURES ARE A LITTLE 
COOLER THAN EXPECTED DESPITE A GOOD SOUTHWEST WIND FROM DEPARTING 
LOWER PRESSURE TO THE NORTHEAST AND HIGHER PRESSURE TO THE 
SOUTHWEST. BOTH NAM AND GFS INDICATING MOSTLY HIGH AND MIDDLE 
MOISTURE INCREASING TONIGHT AND SATURDAY WITH APPROACHING SOUTHERN 
SYSTEM. TONIGHT THE HIGH CLOUDS WILL GRADUALLY INCREASE AND THICKEN 
BUT NOT ENOUGH TO KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM DROPPING INTO THE MID 20S 
TO NEAR 30. TEMPERATURES MAY ACTUALLY SLOWLY WARM OVERNIGHT. THE GFS 
HAS A MORE DENSE CLOUD COVER ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY WHICH 
IS REFLECTED IN THE GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR HIGHS. FOLLOWED CLOSER TO 
THESE NUMBERS. NO PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE CWA UNTIL SATURDAY 
NIGHT.       

.LONG TERM...
SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY...
SOME MAJOR DIFFERENCES IN THE MODELS FOR SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
SUNDAY LEADS TO A LOW CONFIDENCE FORECAST. THE NAM INITIALIZED 
POORLY...SHOWING A MORE AMPLIFIED TROUGH/RIDGE IN THE SOUTHERN 
ROCKIES/TEXAS AND A WEAKER CLOSED LOW OVER THE GREAT LAKES THAN 
OBSERVED. THE LESS AMPLIFIED PATTERN OF THE BETTER INITIALIZED GFS 
RESULTS IN A FASTER SYSTEM...AND MOISTURE AND LIFT ARE SUPPRESSED TO 
OUR SOUTH. IN ADDITION...THE MODELS GENERATE CONVECTION ALONG THE 
GULF COAST...WHICH WILL TEND TO CUT OFF OUR MOISTURE SUPPLY. THE GFS 
SEEMS TO DEPICT THIS BETTER IN ITS QPF FIELD. THUS PREFER THE GFS 
SOLUTION OF LOWER POPS IN OUR AREA...WITH THE HIGHEST POPS ON 
SATURDAY NIGHT INSTEAD OF SUNDAY. WILL HAVE CHANCE POPS IN THE MTNS 
WITH SLIGHT CHANCES IN THE VALLEY. WILL MAINTAIN A SLIGHT CHANCE POP 
IN THE MTNS SUNDAY MORNING...AND ALL PRECIP SHOULD BE GONE BY THE 
AFTERNOON. PRECIP SHOULD BE SNOW IN THE CLIMATOLOGICALLY FAVORED 
AREAS OF THE MTNS AND SW VA/NRN TN VALLEY. WILL MENTION RAIN OR SNOW 
IN THE CENTRAL VALLEY/SOUTHERN MTNS AND ALL RAIN IN THE SOUTH. IT IS 
IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT THE NAMS SLOWER/MORE NORTHERLY SYSTEM 
PRODUCES 7-12 INCHES OF SNOW IN SW VA AND NE TN DURING THE DAY ON 
SUNDAY...BUT THE NAM IS AN OUTLIER AMONG THE MODELS. 

ON MONDAY AFTERNOON A SHORTWAVE TROUGH CROSSES THE AREA..BUT 
MOISTURE IS VERY LIMITED. SOME UPSLOPE SNOW IS POSSIBLE IN THE 
MTNS...BUT LOW LEVEL FLOW DOES NOT APPEAR STRONG ENOUGH TO WARRANT 
ADDING POPS AT THIS TIME. COLD ADVECTION ON MONDAY WILL HOLD HIGH 
TEMPERATURES ONLY IN THE 30 IN MOST SPOTS...WITH SOME LOWER 40S IN 
THE SOUTHERN VALLEY.

MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY...DRY WEATHER IS EXPECTED THIS PERIOD 
WITH BELOW NORMAL TEMPS AS A CLOSED LOW OVER EASTERN CANADA PRODUCES 
A WEST TO NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. MODELS INDICATE A SPLIT FLOW 
DEVELOPING AND A SOUTHERN STREAM TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE GULF COAST 
REGION...BUT MOISTURE AND LIFT REMAIN SUPPRESSED WELL TO OUR SOUTH. 
A SLIGHT WARMING TREND IS EXPECTED LATE IN THE PERIOD AS A RIDGE 
BUILDS ALOFT.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             29  49  33  47 /   0  10  30  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  28  46  31  45 /   0  10  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       27  46  29  43 /   0  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              23  46  29  38 /   0  10  20  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

.DISCUSSION...HIGH PRESSURE IS BUILDING IN FROM THE WEST. SOME LOW 
CLOUDS AND PATCHY FREEZING FOG ARE BEGINNING TO LIFT ACROSS NE TN 
AND SW VA. STILL EXPECT PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES TODAY WITH SOME LOW 
CLOUDS AROUND LEFT OVER FROM MOISTURE ON THE GROUND FROM YESTERDAYS 
RAINFALL AND THEN HIGH CLOUDS MOVING IN THIS AFTERNOON. UPDATE OUT 
AROUND 10 AM TO REMOVE FOG AND ADJUST HOURLY TEMPERATURE AND 
DEWPOINT TRENDS. NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO FIRST PERIOD OF 
FORECAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EST FRI DEC 16 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT IN THE 
SHORT TERM AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST.  SOME 
FOG AROUND MAINLY SOUTH WHERE WINDS HAVE DIED...SO WILL HAVE TO 
CARRY SOME FOG EARLY WHERE IT IS OCCURRING.  EXPECT A MAINLY PARTLY 
CLOUDY SKY TODAY WITH SOME SC/CU AROUND AND THEN HIGH CLOUDS 
BEGINNING TO MOVE IN LATER...THEN CONTINUED PARTLY CLOUDY TONIGHT AS 
HIGH AND SOME MID CLOUDS MOVE ACROSS THE AREA WELL IN ADVANCE OF THE 
NEXT SOUTHERN SYSTEM.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV TEMPS.    

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...WENT WITH A DRY WEATHER 
REGIME FOR MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE PERIOD AS SOUTHERN 
STREAM S/WV SHIFTS EAST THROUGH THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON 
SATURDAY WITH ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW BUILDING EAST ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN GULF OF MEXICO. WENT WITH THE MINOR IMPACT SOLUTION WITH 
SLIGHT/SMALL CHANCE POPS AND LIGHT QPF ACROSS EXTREME SOUTHEAST 
TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA IN THE FORM OF A LIGHT 
RAIN/SNOW MIX WITH LIGHT SNOW ACROSS THE SMOKIES ENDING BEFORE 10 AM 
SUNDAY ACROSS THESE AREAS. REMOVED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FROM MONDAY 
FORECAST IN COORDINATION WITH HPC GUIDANCE. THIS LEAVES A DRY 
FORECAST FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD AS LOW LEVEL RIDGING 
MAINTAINS CONTROL FOR SEVERAL DAYS.

FXUS64 KMRX 160331
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 PM EST THU DEC 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. MAIN AREA OF PCPN MOVING EAST OF 
THE AREA THIS EVENING. SCT LGT SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES ACROSS N 
HALF OF CWA OVRNGT. TEMPS ON TRACK.

$$ 

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER LOW OVER MN AND WS IS 
MOVING SLOWLY EAST AND SOUTHEAST AS SOLID LIGHT RAIN AREA ALSO MOVES 
OUT TO THE NORTHEAST. TEMPERATURES HAVE WARMED INTO THE MID 30S TO 
MID 40S AREAWIDE. HAVE CANCELLED WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR SW VA 
AND NE TN AS ONLY LIGHT PRECIPITATION IS EXPECTED THE REST OF THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING. MODELS KEEP LOW CLOUDS IN MOST OF THE NIGHT 
EXCEPT ACROSS SOUTHERN AREAS. AS LOW CLOUDS WITH WRAP AROUND 
MOISTURE MOVES SOUTHEAST ANY BREAKS THAT FORM MAY FILL BACK IN LATER 
TONIGHT. CLOUDS SHOULD LINGER IN THE NORTHEAST FRIDAY MORNING 
BECAUSE OF THIS AS WELL. TEMPERATURES WILL SLOWLY DROP LATER TONIGHT 
AS COLDER AIR MOVES IN AND WITH MOISTURE ON THE GROUND SOME ICE MAY 
FORM BUT BELOW FREEZING TEMPERATURES WILL LAST ONLY A FEW HOURS. 
KEPT A CHANCE OF FLURRIES IN FRIDAY MORNING EXTREME NORTH AND EAST 
AS WRAP AROUND MOISTURE COULD GIVE A LITTLE UPSLOPE SNOW BUT UPPER 
FLOW STAYS FROM THE WEST. 

LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS INDICATE WEAK 
CYCLOGENESIS OCCURRING ALONG THE TEXAS COAST ON FRIDAY NIGHT...WHILE 
A LOW LEVEL RIDGE SITS OVER OUR AREA. THIS RIDGE WILL KEEP THE 
PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM SUPPRESSED TO OUR SOUTH. THE NAM 
HAS A SLIGHTLY WEAKER RIDGE AND THUS BRINGS PRECIP A LITTLE FARTHER 
NORTH THAN THE GFS...BUT THE BULK OF THE LIFT AND MOISTURE REMAIN 
SOUTH. WILL REMOVE POPS SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MONDAY THE NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH BEGINS TO DIG SOUTH. THE GFS SHOWS 
A STRONG VORT MAX AND UPPER JET PROVIDING LIFT OVER THE AREA MONDAY 
AFTERNOON. HOWEVER MOISTURE MAY BE LIMITED IN THE WESTERLY FLOW 
ALOFT. WILL ADD A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON AND MONDAY 
NIGHT...WITH RAIN OR SNOW FROM TYS NORTH AND SNOW IN SW VA AND TN 
MTNS. A SURGE OF COLD AIR BEHIND THE TROUGH WILL GIVE HIGHS MAINLY 
IN THE 30S ON TUESDAY. REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST WILL REMAIN DRY 
WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND BELOW NORMAL TEMPS.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 151702
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1201 PM EST THU DEC 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...STRONG COLD AIR DAMMING IS STILL OCCURRING ACROSS 
MAINLY THE CAROLINAS WHERE WIDESPREAD FREEZING RAIN HAS BEEN 
FALLING. MOST AREAS OF THE CWA HAVE WARMED TO THE MID 30S TO LOWER 
40S AS WARMER AIR MOVES IN AHEAD OF LOWER PRESSURE WEST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS. A FEW REPORTS OF ICING AND SLEET OR SNOW IN EXTREME 
EASTERN PARTS OF SW VA COUNTIES AND NEAR THE EASTERN EDGE OF THE TN 
MOUNTAIN COUNTIES HAVE PROMPTED A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR THE 
REST OF THE AFTERNOON. IT MAY TAKE A FEW MORE HOURS UNTIL THE COLD 
AIR IS SCOURED OUT. UPDATE OUT SOON TO ADJUST TEMPERATURES AND POPS 
WITH RAIN SLOWLY DECREASING FROM WEST TO EAST THIS AFTERNOON.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 4 PM THURSDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...
     SOUTHEAST GREENE...AND UNICOI. 

VA...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY UNTIL 4 PM THURSDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: RUSSELL...AND WASHINGTON.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 150841
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EST THU DEC 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A STRONG COLD AIR DAMMING EVENT 
OCCURRING ACROSS THE CAROLINAS AND NORTHEAST GA WHERE FREEZING RAIN 
HAS BEEN REPORTED AS FAR WEST AS ATLANTA. LOCAL OBS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA INDICATE TEMPS HOVERING ABOVE FREEZING...BUT DEWPOINTS 
REMAIN IN THE 20S ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. THESE 
DEWPOINTS HAVE BEEN SLOWLY RISING THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT...AND HAVE 
QUICKLY RISEN WHEN RAIN DEVELOPS AND MIXES WARMER AIR FROM ALOFT 
DOWN TO THE SURFACE. HOWEVER...SOME EVAPORATIVE COOLING AT THE ONSET 
OF THE PRECIP MAY CAUSE SOME BRIEF PERIODS OF FREEZING RAIN AND SNOW 
OVER NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA...WITH SOME LIGHT ICING POSSIBLE 
ON ELEVATED SURFACES IN SOME AREAS. THUS...WILL MENTION THIS 
POSSIBILITY IN THE FORECAST THIS MORNING...BUT OVERALL STILL EXPECT 
MAINLY A RAIN EVENT FOR MOST OF THE AREA WITH A WARM SOUTHERLY FLOW 
OBSERVED JUST ABOVE THE SURFACE. NAM MODEL HAS PICKED UP ON THE COLD 
AIR DAMMING SCENARIO BETTER THAN THE GFS...SO WILL CONTINUE TO TREND 
THE FORECAST TOWARD ITS WARMER SOLUTION. NAM MODEL STILL INDICATES 
THAT WET-BULB TEMPS WILL RISE ABOVE FREEZING ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST VA BY SUNRISE...SO FEEL THAT TEMPS SHOULD GRADUALLY RISE 
THIS MORNING ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. 

COLDER AIR WILL SLOWLY BEGIN TO WORK ITS WAY INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
TONIGHT...WITH SOME LIGHT SNOW POSSIBLE AS MOISTURE LINGERS ACROSS 
MAINLY NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. ANY SNOWFALL 
ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE LIGHT AND CONFINED TO THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS...SINCE THE MODELS INDICATE THAT MOISTURE WILL BE RAPIDLY 
DECREASING. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN INDICATES THAT AN ACTIVE SOUTHERN 
JET STREAM WILL BRING ANOTHER CHANCE FOR LIGHT PRECIP SATURDAY NIGHT 
INTO SUNDAY. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             44  28  47  28 / 100  10   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  42  29  44  26 / 100  20   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       41  29  43  26 / 100  10   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              38  28  39  22 / 100  30  10   0

FXUS64 KMRX 150350
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1045 PM EST WED DEC 14 2005

.DISCUSSION..FORECAST ON TRACK. ZFPMRX UPDATE TO REMOVE EVENING 
WORDING. ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASING OVERNIGHT. RAIN SHIED WORKING 
ITS WAY INTO CWA FROM SW. T/TDS ALONG EAST-NORTHEAST EDGE COULD 
ALLOW FOR SOME COOLING AT ONSET OF MAIN PCPN BUT ANY MIXED PCPN 
SHOULD BE SHORT LIVED AS TEMP PROFILE RISES TO ABOVE FREEZING IN 
RAIN AREA. 
$$

.PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...
SHORT TERM( TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
COMPARING THE 12Z MODEL INITIALIZATIONS...THE NAM WAS TOO WEAK
WITH THE CLOSED LOW OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS...WHILE THE GFS
INITIALIZED MUCH BETTER. THE GFS CONTINUES TO SHOW A STRONGER
SOUTHERN STREAM LOW DEVELOPING OVER E TX/LA/MS THIS
EVENING...RESULTING IN A COOLER THERMAL PROFILE IN THE GFS THAN THE
NAM SOME FROZEN PRECIP ACROSS NORTHEAST SECTIONS OVERNIGHT. THE GFS
KEEPS TEMPS NEAR OR BELOW FREEZING IN OUR NORTHEASTERN COUNTIES FOR
MOST OF THE NIGHT. HOWEVER...THE GFS MAY BE BLEEDING OVER TOO MUCH
COLD AIR ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS DUE TO IT POORER TOPOGRAPHICAL
RESOLUTION THAN THE NAM. IN ADDITION...CONVECTION THAT DEVELOPS
ALONG THE GULF COAST COULD DELAY THE ONSET OF PRECIP AND CUT HOW
MUCH QPF WE GET...AND GIVE ENOUGH TIME FOR WARMING BEFORE PRECIP
BEGINS. OBVIOUSLY...A VERY COMPLICATED FORECAST...AND THUS
CONFIDENCE IS LOW.

LIGHT PRECIP THAT HAS BEEN APPROACHING FROM THE WEST HAS BEEN 
DISSIPATING AS IT ENCOUNTERS DRIER AIR OVER THE PLATEAU...BUT A FEW 
SNOW FLAKES HAVE BEEN HITTING THE GROUND IN SPOTS. WILL MENTION 
FLURRIES OR LIGHT RAIN SHOWERS THIS EVENING. MORE SIGNIFICANT PRECIP 
BEGINS OVER OVERSPREAD THE AREA BETWEEN 06 AND 12Z IN ASSOCIATION 
WITH THE DEVELOPING LOW NEAR THE GULF COAST. THIS TIMING IS A LITTLE 
LATER THAN PREVIOUS FORECASTS AND MODEL RUN. AS STATED ABOVE THE GFS 
IS LIKELY TOO COLD AT THE SURFACE WHEN PRECIP STARTS IN THE 
NORTHEAST...SO WILL MENTION ONLY RAIN AFTER MIDNIGHT. CATEGORICAL 
POPS CONTINUE THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING...TAPERING OFF TO A CHANCE BY 
LATE AFTERNOON. THE 850 MB TROUGH PASSES AROUND 00Z FRIDAY...AND 
COLD ADVECTION ENSUES. TEMPS DROP BELOW FREEZING...AND ANY PRECIP 
REMAINING IN THE NORTHEAST SHOULD CHANGE TO SNOW BEFORE MIDLEVEL 
DRYING SHUTS OFF PRECIP. LAYER FROM 800 MB TO THE SURFACE REMAINS 
SATURATED IN THE NORTH THROUGH THE DAY FRIDAY...AND WILL CARRY A 
MENTION OF FLURRIES IN SW VA. MIDLEVEL CLOUDS INCREASE AGAIN ON 
SATURDAY AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM.

LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
CURRENT PATTERN OF ERN US TROUGH KEEPING FAST FLOW ACROSS THE 
AREA...AND WILL PUMP A COUPLE OF SYSTEMS THROUGH DURING THE 
PERIOD...AROUND SUNDAY AND TUESDAY.  TIMING CANNOT BE EXACT AND 
SYSTEMS LOOK PRETTY WEAK SO ONLY MILD FLUCTUATIONS IN PRECIP CHANCES 
THROUGH PERIOD.  ALSO...GFS MOS HAS SHOWN WET BIAS WITH THESE WEAK 
SYSTEMS...SO GOING BELOW GUIDANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY.  TEMPERATURE 
PROFILE FOR SUNDAY QUESTIONABLE AS TO PRECIP TYPE...06Z GFS RUN WAS 
COOLER AND 12Z RUN A LITTLE WARMER. SO WILL MENTION BOTH RAIN AND 
SNOW EXCEPT ACROSS THE SOUTH WHERE JUST RAIN IS MENTIONED. HAVE NOT 
INTRODUCED ANY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY YET...SYSTEM LOOKS WEAK AND MAY 
STAY MOSTLY SOUTH OF THE AREA.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  39  41  30  42 / 100 100  10   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       38  41  29  42 / 100 100  10   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
927 AM EST WED DEC 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...
PRECIP SEEN ON RADAR IS NOT REACHING THE GROUND AS FAR WEST AS A
NASHVILLE TO HUNTSVILLE LINE. AS THE PRECIP IN MIDDLE TN MOVES
EAST...EXPECT IT TO DISSIPATE SOMEWHAT AS IT CONTINUES TO ENCOUNTER
DRY LOW LEVEL AIR AND A SLIGHT DOWNSLOPE EFFECT IN THE VALLEY.
HOWEVER POPS WILL NEED TO BE RAISED SLIGHTLY IN THE SOUTHWEST
COUNTIES TO A CHANCE. TEMPERATURES ARE RUNNING SEVERAL DEGREES
WARMER THAN FORECAST...SO THE UPDATE WILL RAISE THEM A FEW DEGREES.
ALL LOCATIONS ARE AT OR ABOVE FREEZING EXCEPT SW VA AND NE TN
MTNS. LOCATIONS CURRENTLY BELOW FREEZING WILL WARM UP BY THE TIME
PRECIP REACHES THE GROUND...MAINLY THIS EVENING...SO NO P-TYPE
ISSUES ARE EXPECTED.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EST WED DEC 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER NEW 
ENGLAND AND EXTENDING OVER MOST OF THE EASTERN PART OF THE NATION. 
SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL CLOUDS INCREASING OVER THE REGION AS WINDS 
ALOFT HAVE BECOME SOUTHWESTERLY. AREA RADARS ALSO REVEAL MID-LEVEL 
MOISTURE INCREASING FROM THE SOUTHWEST...BUT WITH A DRY AIRMASS IN 
PLACE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...THINK THAT MOST OF THIS INITIAL 
MOISTURE THIS MORNING WILL EVAPORATE BEFORE REACHING THE GROUND. 
MEASURABLE RAIN SHOULD BE DELAYED UNTIL THE AFTERNOON HOURS ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA...WHICH SHOULD ENSURE THAT 
FROZEN PRECIP WONT OCCUR AS TEMPS WARM ABOVE FREEZING. A COLD AIR 
DAMMING SCENARIO IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE CAROLINAS THROUGH 
TONIGHT...AND THUS...WILL FOLLOW THE NAM MODELS WARMER SOLUTION FOR 
THE FORECAST AREA SINCE IT ALWAYS HANDLES THESE SCENARIOS BETTER 
THAN THE GFS. EXPECT PRECIP TO BECOME MORE WIDESPREAD TONIGHT...AS 
AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH DEEPENS OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY. NAM MODEL 
INDICATES THAT WET-BULB TEMPS WILL RISE ABOVE FREEZING ACROSS 
NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA LATER TONIGHT...SO FEEL THAT 
EVAPORATIVE COOLING WONT BE ENOUGH TO LOWER TEMPS BELOW FREEZING IN 
MOST OF THESE AREAS. SOME VALLEY LOCATIONS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND 
NORTHEAST TN WILL LIKELY BE HOVERING AROUND THE FREEZING MARK LATE 
TONIGHT...BUT WILL FORECAST TEMPS TO REMAIN SLIGHTLY ABOVE FREEZING 
IN THESE AREAS. THUS...WILL NOT MENTION ANY POSSIBILITY OF FREEZING 
RAIN IN THESE AREAS AND STICK WITH JUST A RAIN FORECAST. 

A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY MORNING... 
WITH COLDER AIR FILTERING IN DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. SOME 
LINGERING MOISTURE MAY RESULT IN SOME LIGHT SNOW THURSDAY NIGHT... 
BUT MAINLY ACROSS NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. ANY SNOW
ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...AND 
SHOULD BE LIGHT SINCE MOISTURE WILL BE RAPIDLY DECREASING BEHIND THE 
FRONT. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN INDICATES THAT AN ACTIVE SOUTHERN JET 
STREAM WILL BRING ANOTHER CHANCE FOR LIGHT PRECIP ON SUNDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 131922
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
221 PM EST TUE DEC 13 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
CLOUDS WILL BE THICKENING OVERNIGHT AS OUR NEXT SHORTWAVE TROUGH 
APPROACHES.  THE SOUTHERN STREAM VORT SEEN IN WV IMAGERY OVER 
CO/NM AREA IS PROGGED BY THE MODELS TO BECOME SHEARED AND WEAKEN AS 
IT MOVES EAST. THE GFS IS A LITTLE FASTER TO BRING PRECIP INTO 
WESTERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY...LIKELY DUE TO ITS 
STRONGER 500 MB VORT AXIS THAN THE NAM. SINCE THERE WILL BE A LOT OF 
LOW LEVEL DRY AIR TO BE OVERCOME...AND LIFT IS WEAK IN BOTH 
MODELS...WITH HOLD OFF ANY PRECIP MENTION UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING 
BUT BRING IN OVERCAST SKIES IN THE AFTERNOON. THE GFS IS STRONGER 
WITH THE CYCLOGENESIS NEAR THE GULF COAST ON WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT...WHILE THE NAM HAS A MUCH WEAKER COASTAL LOW DEVELOPING WITH 
MORE EMPHASIS ON THE CLOSED LOW OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS. THIS 
RESULTS IN STRONGER WARM ADVECTION IN THE NAM AND THUS A WARMER 
TEMPERATURE PROFILE. GIVEN RECENT MODEL TENDENCIES OF THE GFS BEING 
TOO COLD AND THE NAM VERIFYING SLIGHTLY BETTER...THE NAM IS 
PREFERED. THUS PRECIP WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY WILL BE ALL 
LIQUID. POPS WILL BE CATEGORICAL LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH EARLY 
THURSDAY MORNING...DECREASING TO A CHANCE THURSDAY AFTERNOON. AT 00Z 
FRIDAY THE LOW LEVEL TROUGH AXIS/SURFACE FRONT PASSES 
THROUGH...SHIFTING WINDS TO WEST AND COLD ADVECTION ENSUES. MOISTURE 
MAY BE DEEP ENOUGH AND UPSLOPE COMPONENT STRONG ENOUGH FOR SOME 
LIGHT SNOW IN SW VA AND NE TN MTNS. WILL CONTINUE A CHANCE OF SNOW 
IN THIS AREA. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE CONFINED BELOW 850 MB WILL LINGER 
THROUGH FRIDAY...THEN HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS INCREASE FRIDAY NIGHT AHEAD 
OF THE NEXT SYSTEM. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...THROUGH THE EXTENDED 
CONDITIONS WILL REMAIN COOLER THAN NORMAL AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS INTO THE AREA FROM THE NW. SOMEWHAT UNUSUAL E-W TROUGHING 
CONTINUES ALONG THE EASTERN 2/3RD OF THE NORTHERN UNITED STATES. 
CLOUD COVER AND PCPN CHANCES WILL BE REFINED PENDING POSITIONING AND 
STRENGTH OF WESTERN SHORT WAVE THAT GETS ABSORBED INTO SW-NE LAYER 
FLOW. THIS FLOW TIGHTENS BETWEEN NORTHERN TROUGH AND BUILDING RIDGE 
OVR THE BAHAMAS. FEATURE IS CURRENTLY PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH MRX 
CWA ON SUNDAY. EXPECT RATHER THICK CLOUD COVER BUT KEPT POP CHANCES 
LOW FOR NOW. PCPN SHOULD BE LIGHT AND START OFF AS A MIX EARLY 
SUNDAY BEFORE CHANGING TO A COLD RAIN AND ENDING AS LIGHT SNOW NE 
PARTS ON MONDAY. CLIPPER-TYPE SYSTEMS EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH 
FLURRIES/LIGHT SNOW PSBL NE TN/SW VA.

340 AM EST TUE DEC 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE OHIO AND TN 
RIVER VALLEYS...WITH SATELLITE IMAGES REVEALING EXTENSIVE CLOUDINESS 
LINGERING OVER THESE AREAS. A TEMP INVERSION ALOFT SHOULD KEEP 
MOISTURE TRAPPED FOR THE NEXT FEW HOURS...BUT MODELS STILL INSIST 
THAT SKIES WILL BECOME MOSTLY SUNNY BY THIS AFTERNOON AS DRIER AIR 
WORKS ITS WAY INTO THE FORECAST AREA. ISENTROPIC LIFT BEGINS TO 
INCREASE LATER TONIGHT AS SOUTHWEST WINDS ALOFT DEVELOP AHEAD OF A 
COLD FRONT. THIS WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN WILL RESULT IN AN 
INCREASE IN CLOUDS TONIGHT WITH SOME LIGHT PRECIP DEVELOPING BY 
WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT PRECIP WILL 
BE DELAYED UNTIL THE AFTERNOON HOURS...WHICH SHOULD ENSURE THAT 
FROZEN PRECIP WONT OCCUR AS TEMPS WARM ABOVE FREEZING. RAIN WILL 
BECOME MORE WIDESPREAD WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AS AN UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS 
OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY. TEMPS SHOULD REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING 
OVERNIGHT...BUT A FEW VALLEY LOCATIONS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND 
NORTHEAST TN MAY STILL BE HOVERING AROUND THE FREEZING MARK. NAM 
MODEL REVEALS WARMER TEMPS WEDNESDAY NIGHT THAN THE GFS...AND WILL 
FOLLOW ITS SOLUTION SINCE IT HAS BEEN VERIFYING BETTER LATELY. 
THUS...WILL NOT PLAN TO MENTION ANY FREEZING RAIN POSSIBILITIES AND 
STICK WITH A RAIN FORECAST. THIS COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA THURSDAY MORNING WITH COLDER AIR MOVING INTO THE AREA 
DURING THE AFTERNOON HOURS. SOME LINGERING MOISTURE MAY RESULT IN 
SOME LIGHT SNOW THURSDAY NIGHT ACROSS MAINLY NORTHERN PORTIONS OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN INDICATES THAT AN ACTIVE 
SOUTHERN JET STREAM WILL BRING ANOTHER CHANCE FOR LIGHT PRECIP ON

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A

MORNING...WHICH HAS KEPT TEMPS IN THE MID TO UPPER 30S IN MANY 
AREAS. AS A RESULT...LIGHT RAIN HAS BEEN REPORTED ACROSS CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA...WITH LIGHT SNOW OCCURRING 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN WHERE TEMPS ARE COLDER. AREA

EASTERN KY AND SOUTHWEST VA...WITH SATELLITE IMAGES REVEALING THE 
COLDEST CLOUD TOPS ACROSS THESE AREAS AS WELL. MODELS ARE IN GOOD

NORTHEAST TN. SNOW SHOULD GRADUALLY DIMINISH DURING THE AFTERNOON

WILL LIKELY PRODUCE SOME LINGERING SNOW IN THE MOUNTAINS THIS 
AFTERNOON...BUT THIS SHOULD COME TO AN END BY THIS EVENING AS DRIER 
AIR FILTERS INTO THE REGION. SNOW ADVISORY APPEARS TO BE IN GOOD 
SHAPE AND WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE IT THROUGH THE AFTERNOON HOURS. AS 
FOR TEMPS...WILL FOLLOW CLOSE TO THE GFS MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS TODAY 
AND TONIGHT.

ENOUGH UNCERTAINTY ON TIMING OF EVENT TO KEEP POPS IN THE HIGH 
CHANCE LEVEL ON WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY AND THIS EVENT WILL BE ON 
THE EDGE OF A WINTERY EVENT BUT MOST LIKELY WILL LEAN TOWARDS MAINLY 
LIQUID PRECIPITATION. SOME AREAS MAY BEGIN AS SNOW BEFORE CHANGING 
OVER TO MAINLY RAIN. BEYOND THAT...NEXT SHOT A PRECIPITATION LOOKS 
LIKE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL STAY ON THE COOL 
SIDE OF NORMAL FOR MOST OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
920 PM EST SUN DEC 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...SOME FLURRIES AND VERY LIGHT SNOW HAS BEEN FALLING AT 
TIMES SO FAR THIS EVENING ACROSS SW VA AND EXTREME NE TN WITH 
INCREASING VORTICITY AHEAD OF ALBERTA-TYPE SYSTEM THAT IS NOW 
SPREADING THE MAIN AREA OF PRECIPITATION INTO SOUTHERN IL AND 
WESTERN KY AS SEEN ON RADAR IN THE LOWER OHIO VALLEY. TEMPERATURES 
ARE STILL ABOVE FREEZING ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA EXCEPT FOR 
MOST OF WISE AND RUSSELL COUNTIES AND PART OF WASHINGTON COUNTY IN 
VA. WINDS ARE CONTINUING TO BLOW FROM THE WEST AND SOUTHWEST AT 
NEAR 10 MPH IN MOST PLACES AND MAY KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM FALLING 
UNTIL THE SNOW SHOWERS DEVELOP LATE TONIGHT. GFS AND NAM ARE STILL 
SHOWING THIS SYSTEM MOVING QUICKLY SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE  TENNESSEE 
VALLEY LATER TONIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY. STILL THINK START TIME OF 
ADVISORY IS GOOD. THE TRACK OF THE SYSTEM STILL LOOKS TO BE ACROSS 
KY INTO SW VA AND NE TN LATE TONIGHT AND MONDAY BEFORE MOVING EAST 
ACROSS THE REST OF VA DURING THE AFTERNOON. MODELS ARE TRENDING A 
LITTLE HIGHER IN SNOWFALL AMOUNTS WITH THE 18Z RUN BUT WITH THE MAIN 
PRECIPITATION AREA STILL SEVERAL HOURS AWAY DO NOT WANT TO MAKE ANY 
MAJOR CHANGES. WILL TWEAK POPS SLIGHTLY TONIGHT WITH THE INCREASE OF 
PRECIPITATION LATER ON.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...
MAIN FORECAST CONCERN FOR THE SHORT-TERM IS ALBERTA-TYPE SYSTEM THAT 
IS CURRENTLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS/MIDWEST. BOTH THE GFS AND 
NAM SHOWS THIS SYSTEM MOVING QUICKLY SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE OHIO AND 
TENNESSEE VALLEYS LATE TONIGHT AND EARLY MONDAY. TRACK OF SURFACE LOW
WILL BE ACROSS KENTUCKY INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE 
...SO BEST SNOWFALL POTENTIAL WILL BE ALONG AND NORTH OF THE TRACK. 
PWS AHEAD OF SYSTEM IS AROUND .40 INCH. FAIRLY DECENT ISENTROPIC 
LIFT AND JET DYNAMICS TO PRODUCE A QUICK SHOT OF LIFT FROM AFTER 06Z 
TONIGHT TO MID-MORNING MONDAY...THEN NORTHWEST FLOW SNOWFALL 
ANTICIPATED FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AFTER COORDINATION...WILL 
ISSUE A SNOW ADVISORY FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE 
MOUNTAINS WITH 1 INCH OR LESS FOR THE TRI-CITIES AND NORTHERN 
PLATEAU. FOR THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS WILL CALL FOR UP TO 2 INCHES.

SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE LIMITED SOME SINCE TEMPERATURES WILL 
NOT DROP MUCH BELOW FREEZING...EXCEPT FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS... 
DURING THE EVENT.

TIGHTENING PRESSURE GRADIENTS TONIGHT AND MONDAY WILL PRODUCE BREEZY
CONDITIONS...BUT WILL KEEP BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...ONLY CONFIDENT PERIODS 
FOR THE LONG TERM ARE THE EARLIEST PERIODS...WITH POSSIBLY A FEW 
FLURRIES LINGERING IN THE EAST MONDAY EVENING THEN GRADUAL CLEARING 
AND DRY WEATHER FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT.  THIS WAS A CHANGE 
FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST/GRIDS.  

UNCERTAINTY COMES AS EARLY AS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...WITH HPC 
FAVORING ECMWF MODEL FOR TIMING OF NEXT SYSTEM (MAINLY RAIN).  GFS 
AND NAM DELAYED ONSET OF PRECIPITATION (PCPN) ON WEDNESDAY BUT WOULD 
SUPPORT CATEGORICAL POPS BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  ECMWF WOULD ALSO BRING 
MAINLY A RAIN EVENT FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BUT A QUICKER RETURN TO 
DRY WEATHER ON THURSDAY.  FOR NOW...KEPT FORECAST/GRIDS IN LINE WITH 
NEIGHBORING OFFICES...AND CARRIED RAIN OR SNOW CHANCES INTO THURSDAY.
OUR POPS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT WERE BUMPED UP TO HIGHEST END OF CHANCE 
...AND MAY NEED HIGHER VALUES FROM LATER SHIFTS TO BE MORE IN LINE 
WITH LATEST GFSX MOS NUMBERS.  ENSEMBLE FORECASTS SHOWED A GOOD DEAL 
OF VARIANCE THESE PERIODS...ALSO LEADING TO LOW CONFIDENCE.  

KEPT FORECAST DRY FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY AS NEARLY ZONAL FLOW ALOFT 
BECOMES SOUTHWEST BY LATE SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY.  NO APPARENT 
SHORTWAVE IN THIS SOUTHWEST FLOW...SO JUST ADDED LOW CHANCE POPS FOR 
NOW SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY.  HPC MAX TEMP GRID FOR SUNDAY SEEMED 
A BIT LOW...SO NUDGED MAX TEMPS UP SOME...ESPECIALLY ACROSS SRN 
GROUPS TO BETTER MESH WITH HUN...FFC AND GSP MAX TEMP GRIDS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             34  45  29  49 /  10   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  34  40  26  44 /  50  20   0   0

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              32  36  22  39 /  80  60  10   0 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...SNOW ADVISORY FROM 1 AM MONDAY TO 4 PM MONDAY FOR THE FOLLOWING 
     ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...
     JOHNSON...SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SOUTHEAST CARTER...
     SOUTHEAST GREENE...AND UNICOI.

     ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...WASHINGTON...AND WISE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1007 AM EST SUN DEC 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...
FIRST SHORT-WAVE MOVED EAST OF THE AREA EARLY THIS MORNING. WRAP-AROUND
BOUDARY LAYER MOISTURE IS PRODUCING AN AREA OF CLOUDS ACROSS MUCH OF THE
FORECAST AREA.  HOWEVER...BACK EDGE IS MOVING ACROSS THE PLATEAU COUNTIES
WITH WARM AIR ADVECTION CLOUDINESS FOLLOWING CLOSELY BEHIND OVER KENTUCKY
AND NORTHERN HALF OF TENNESSEE. WILL CONTINUE MOSTLY CLOUDY SKY NORTHERN
TWO-THIRDS WITH PARTLY CLOUDY FOR THE CHATTANOOGA AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON.

NEXT SHORT-WAVE IS EVIDENT ON WATER-VAPOR ACROSS THE FAR NORTHERN 
PLAINS. THIS WAVE WILL QUICKLY MOVE SOUTHEAST WITH ASSOCIATED SURFACE
LOW TRACKING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA LATE TONIGHT AND MONDAY 
MORNING. DYNAMICS AND MOISTURE STRONGER WITH THIS NEXT WAVE WITH GOOD
ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD OF THE WAVE THAT WILL GIVE SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE A SHOT OF PRECIPITATION. NAM AND GFS SHOWS TEMPERATURE
PROFILE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW WITH SEVERAL INCHES POSSIBLE.

MAY NEED TO ISSUE A SNOW ADVISORY FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS FOR LATE TONIGHT AND MONDAY MORNING. FOR TRI-CITES
AND NORTHERN PLATEAU...SNOW ACCUMULATIONS UP TO 1 INCH IS POSSIBLE.
