FXUS64 KMRX 110751
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 AM EST SUN DEC 11 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH MONDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY...WITH SOUTHWEST WINDS 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA KEEPING TEMPS IN THE 30S. SATELLITE IMAGES 
REVEAL AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDINESS OVER THE OHIO AND TN RIVER 
VALLEYS ASSOCIATED WITH A DEEPENING UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH. MODELS ARE 
IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL BRING SOME LIGHT 
PRECIP ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...WITH 
THE COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE FORECAST AREA TOWARDS EVENING. A 
STRONG UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL QUICKLY MOVE ALONG THIS LONG WAVE 
TROUGH...BRINGING AN INCREASE IN MOISTURE AND A BETTER CHANCE FOR 
PRECIP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA LATER TONIGHT AFTER MIDNIGHT. LATEST 
MODEL RUNS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH TRENDING TOWARD MORE MOISTURE 
WITH THIS SHORT WAVE...BUT IT STILL APPEARS THAT THERE WILL NOT BE 
ENOUGH MOISTURE FOR ANYTHING OTHER THAN MINOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS. 
WILL PLAN TO REISSUE THE SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT FOR THE AREA... 
BUT WILL NOT MAKE MANY CHANGES TO THE PREVIOUS FORECAST. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO FOLLOW CLOSE TO THE GFS MOS GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
TODAY THROUGH MONDAY.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...SLOW MODERATING TREND 
IN STORE AS EASTERN CONUS TROUGH PULLS OUT AND SHORT WAVE RIDGING 
BUILDS INTO THE REGION BEFORE NEXT SIGNIFICANT EVENT APPROACHES ON 
WEDNESDAY. STILL SOME DOUBT ON TIMING OF PRECIP ONSET WITH THIS 
EVENT AS SERF AND CANADIAN GEM DEPICT PRECIP ENTERING THE WESTERN 
HALF OF OUR CWA BY 12Z WEDNESDAY...BUT GFS HOLDING PRECIP ONSET 
UNTIL AROUND 18Z. NAM IS EVEN SLOWER AS IT DEPICTS PRECIP JUST 
ENTERING WEST TENNESSEE BY 12Z WEDNESDAY...ITS FURTHEST PROJECTION 
FOR THE 00Z RUN. THUS HAVE OPTED NOT TO MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO 
ONGOING GRIDS/FORECAST. HOWEVER...PRECIP ONSET TIMING WILL LIKELY 
PLAY AN IMPORTANT ROLE IN INITIAL PRECIP TYPE AS AN AFTERNOON ONSET 
WOULD TEND TO FAVOR ALL RAIN. ANTICIPATE MAINLY A RAIN EVENT IN ANY 
CASE AS WAA STRENGTHENS ON SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW. SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW 
CONTINUES THROUGH THE BALANCE OF THE PERIOD WITH TEMPS CONTINUING TO 
MODERATE TO ACTUALLY ABOVE CLIMO BY LATE NEXT WEEKEND.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EST SAT DEC 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...SKIES ARE MOSTLY CLEAR ACROSS THE AREA TONIGHT BUT ONE 
WEAK SHORTWAVE IS MOVING THROUGH KY AND OH WITH A FEW CLOUDS PASSING 
THROUGH EAST CENTRAL TN ON THE TAIL END. NEXT STRONGER SHORTWAVE IS 
MOVING SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES SOUTHWEST INTO 
MISSOURI AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT PRODUCING SOME LIGHT SNOW AND RAIN. 
THIS SHORTWAVE SHOULD SPREAD CLOUDS INTO THE FORECAST AREA LATER 
TONIGHT. IT SHOULD WEAKEN AS IT MOVES INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND 
NOT PRODUCE ANY PRECIPITATION BEFORE MORNING. TEMPERATURES ARE A FEW 
DEGREES LOWER THAN WHAT IS CURRENTLY IN THE GRIDS BUT DEWPOINTS ARE 
ABOUT THE SAME OR A DEGREE OR TWO HIGHER. WILL KEEP LOWS THE SAME. 
WINDS ARE CONTINUING AROUND 10 MPH FROM THE WEST AND SOUTHWEST SO 
WILL CHANGE LIGHT WORDING IN ZONES TO 5 TO 10 MPH. NO OTHER CHANGES 
TO FORECAST.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
343 PM EST SAT DEC 10 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MAIN ACTION THESE PERIODS
TO BE PROVIDED BY A COUPLE OF FAST MOVING SHORTWAVES IN THE
DEEPENING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH. STRONGEST SHORTWAVE IS THE SECOND
ONE THAT ARRIVES LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY MONDAY. THIS ONE
PROVIDES SOME BRIEF WEAK UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE...CHANNELED
VORTICITY AND A SLIGHTLY DEEPER MOISTURE PROFILE (ALTHO STILL NOT
REAL IMPRESSIVE). LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW IS PRESENT BUT INSTABILITY
IS ALSO NOT THE MOST IMPRESSIVE WEVE SEEN WITH THESE TYPE OF
EVENTS (POSITIVE CAPES OF LESS THAN 50 J/KG).  

HOWEVER...DECIDED TO HIT THE LIGHT SNOW POTENTIAL A LITTLE HARDER
WITH THE SECOND SHORTWAVE...AND WENT FOR LIKELY POPS ACROSS SWRN
VA AND EXTREME NE TN...WHICH ALSO WAS NEEDED TO BLEND IN WITH
NEIGHBORING OFFICES TO THE NORTH AND EAST. FOR NOW HAVE SOME LIGHT
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN THE FAVORED LOCATIONS...AND ISSUED A SHORT
SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT. SOUTHERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA...
INCLUDING CHEROKEE AND CLAY COUNTIES NC MAY BARELY GET A FEW SNOW
SHOWERS OR FLURRIES FROM THIS EVENT.

MOS MIN TEMPS LOOKED GOOD FOR TONIGHT AS CLOUDS INCREASE LATE...
THEN GENERALLY UNDERCUT MOS MAX TEMPS FOR BOTH SUNDAY AND MONDAY
DUE TO CLOUDS...SNOW AND COLD AIR ADVECTION. POPS ARE CLOSER TO THE
HIGHER MOS POPS FROM THE NAM GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...NORTHWEST FLOW CAA 
CLIPPER MANIA ENDS BY MONDAY NIGHT WHILE AREA ENJOYS A PERIOD OF IN 
BETWEEN SYSTEM RIDGING AND DRY WEATHER DURING THE DAYTIME PERIOD 
TUESDAY. THAT NEXT SYTEM...AN UPPER LEVEL TROF AND ASSOCIATED 
SURFACE COLD FRONT DRIVE EAST THROUGH THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON 
WEDNESDAY AND THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY THURSDAY EVENING. AS THE 
SYSTEM SPREADS PRECIP IN AN ISENTROPIC FASHION ACROSS THE REGION 
TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY MORNING THE PRECIP MAY TRANSITION FROM A 
SNOW/RAIN MIX BACK TO RAIN IN MOST AREAS BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON WITH 
THE RETURN OF WARMER AIR AHEAD OF THE FRONT. MIXED SOME SNOW SHOWERS 
IN WITH THE RAIN WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY MORNING DUE TO 
UNCERTAINTY WITH THE VERTICAL TEMPERATURE PROFILE AND THEN BACK TO 
RAIN MOST AREAS FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON BEFORE ENDING. ITS HARD TO 
BELIEVE BUT ACTUALLY HAVE FORECAST A DRY FRIDAY AND SATURDAY AS A 
MORE ZONAL PATTERN RETURNS ALONG WITH SURFACE RIDGING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1015 AM EST SAT DEC 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...A WEAK IMPULSE MOVING ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY IS 
PRODUCING MID TO HIGH CLOUDS...BUT MAINLY NORTH OF OUR FORECAST AREA 
LEAVING MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES FOR OUR REGION.  12Z UPPER AIR PLOTS SHOW 
GOOD WARMING AT 850 MB LEVEL WITH TEMPS UP TO BETWEEN 3 AND 5 
DEGREES CELSIUS.  12Z OHX/RNK SOUNDINGS GENERALLY SUPPORT HIGHS THIS 
AFTERNOON IN THE 40S TO MID 50S.  FORECAST LOOKS TO BE IN GOOD SHAPE.

FOR FIRST OF SEVERAL FAST MOVING SHORTWAVES ON SUNDAY AND SUNDAY 
NIGHT...SEEMS NAM IS PRODUCING LESS LIGHT SNOW THAN GFS.  HARD TO 
GET VERY EXCITED ABOUT SNOW POTENTIAL WITH THIS FEATURE GIVEN THE 
LIMITED MOISTURE (POSSIBLY LIMITED TO 8000 FEET AND BELOW)... 
INSTABILITY OF LESS THAN 50 J/KG...AND ONLY MODERATE LOW LEVEL 
UPSLOPE FLOW.  THUS...DONT EXPECT MORE THAN UP TO 1 INCH OF SNOW 
POSSIBLY IN THE HIGHEST TERRAIN OF SWRN VA AND THE NRN MTNS OF TN
...AND THIS WOULD BE MAINLY ON THE WESTERN FACING SLOPES OR PEAKS.

MORE ON THIS IN THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS

OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO FOLLOW CLOSE 
TO GFS MOS GUIDANCE TODAY AND TONIGHT.

ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH UPSLOPE FLOW EVENT FOR SUNDAY THROUGH 
EARLY TUESDAY AS TWO WEAK NORTHERN STREAM WAVES APPROACH...BUT VAST 
DIFFERENCES APPEAR IN THE PROJECTED POPS VALUES OF THE RESPECTIVE 
MODEL GUIDANCE WITH NAM PROJECTING NEAR LIKELY POPS FOR THE 
NORTHEASTERN ZONES AND GFS SLIGHT CHANCE POPS OR LOWER FOR MOST 
LOCATIONS SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. MODEL TIME HEIGHTS SHOW MOISTURE 
LIMITED TO A SHALLOW SURFACE LAYER...RATHER TYPICAL OF UPSLOPE 
EVENTS. APPEARS NAM POPS ARE OVERDONE IN NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY 
LOCATIONS. HOWEVER...DUE TO UNCERTAINTY HAVE NOT MADE ANY 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO EXISTING GRIDS/FORECAST. ALSO INTRODUCED 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ON WEDNESDAY AS 00Z GFS RUN HAS SPED UP NEXT 
SYSTEM SOMEWHAT.

.DISCUSSION...CLEAR SKIES AND COLD TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 092001
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EST FRI DEC 9 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...TEMPERATURES HAVE WARMED
SLOWLY THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS THE REGION...RANGING FROM LOWER 30S
ACROSS SWRN VA TO MID/UPR 40S IN SWRN NC.  SKIES REMAIN MOSTLY CLEAR
WITH JUST SOME PASSING CIRRUS CLOUDS.  LOW CLOUDINESS OVER NRN KY
AND W VA HAS BEEN SLIPPING SOUTH SLOWLY BUT ALSO ERODING.  WILL
COUNT ON THESE LOW CLOUDS STAYING NORTH OVERNIGHT...AND GO WITH
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND AT OR BELOW THE COOLER MOS MIN TEMPS.

BRIEF PERIOD OF UPPER LEVEL RIDGING IS OVER BY EARLY SATURDAY NIGHT
AS UPPER TROUGH GETS ESTABLISHED AGAIN ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.
STRONG BUT FAST MOVING SHORTWAVE DEEPENS THE TROUGH EARLY SUNDAY
AND PASSES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON.  SEEMS TO
BE ENOUGH MOISTURE WITH THIS FEATURE TO JUSTIFY A DECENT CHANCE OF
SNOW SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN...DOWN TO JUST FLURRIES EXTREME
SRN ZONES.  THINK ANY ACCUMULATIONS WOULD BE VERY LIGHT AND MAINLY
ON WESTERN FACING SLOPES OF HIGHER TERRAIN.  WILL GO WITH OR JUST
UNDERCUT THE COOLER MOS VALUES FOR HIGH TEMPS SUNDAY DUE TO THE
CLOUDS AND COLD AIR ADVECTION.  OTHERWISE...GFS MOS OR BLEND FOR
SAT MAXES AND SAT NIGHT MINS LOOKED GOOD.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...WILL KEEP A SLGT CHC 
FOR -SHSN GOING ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
SUNDAY NIGHT AND HANG ONTO A SLGT CHC POP FOR SAME MONDAY ACROSS 
JUST SOME MAJOR TERRAIN AREAS ACROSS THIS REGION FOR CAA UPSLOPE 
CONTINUATION AND REMOVED FINALLY AT MIDNIGHT. HAD TO INTRODUCE SLGT 
CHC POP FOR -SHRA ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH 
CAROLINA TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT AS WEAK WAVE MOVES ACROSS THE 
REGION. WEDNESDAY DAY TIME PERIOD TURNS OUT TO BE ATTM THE LUCKY 
PRECIP-FREE DAY ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. BUT THE CHANCE FOR
RAIN (AND SOME SNOW MIXED WITH THE RAIN ACROSS HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS  
INCLUDING CUMBERLAND PLATEAU/SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE) WILL BE BACK IN THE FORECAST WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
THURSDAY NIGHT AS ANOTHER AMPLIFIED UPPER TROF/CLOSED LOW SHIFTS 
EAST INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY/GREAT LAKES REGION WITH DECENT 
MOISTURE ADVECTION/LIFT PROGGED. AS USUAL...THESE LONGER RANGE TIME 
PERIODS EVENTUALLY COME INTO BETTER FOCUS WITH EACH PASSING DAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 AM EST FRI DEC 9 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS...WITH 
COLDER AND DRIER AIR BEGINNING TO FILTER INTO THE FORECAST AREA. 
RADAR INDICATES ONLY A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS ACROSS EXTREME 
NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA...BUT THESE SHOULD EXIT THE AREA 
SHORTLY WITH NO UPSTREAM ECHOES NOTED ON AREA RADARS. WITH THIS IN 
MIND...WILL PLAN TO CANCEL THE SNOW ADVISORY EARLY THIS MORNING WITH 
DRIER AIR EXPECTED TO MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA. VAD WIND PROFILE 
FROM KMRX REVEALS THAT WINDS ALOFT ARE WEAKENING BEHIND THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE. MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS WEAKENING TREND WILL CONTINUE 
TODAY...AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...WILL 
ALSO CANCEL THE WIND ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS EARLY THIS MORNING. 
CLOUDS SHOULD GRADUALLY DECREASE THIS MORNING...WITH MOST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA BECOMING MOSTLY SUNNY BY THIS AFTERNOON. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO FOLLOW GFS MOS NUMBERS TODAY AND TONIGHT.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...GENERALLY TRANQUIL 
WEATHER ANTICIPATED...ALTHOUGH TEMPS WILL TEND TO BE BELOW CLIMO 
THROUGH MUCH OF THE PERIOD AS LONGWAVE TROUGH PERSISTS OVER THE 
EASTERN CONUS. EXCEPTIONS ARE SHORT WAVE TROUGH WHICH SWINGS THROUGH 
THE REGION ON SUNDAY AND A MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM WHICH APPROACHES 
ON THURSDAY. APPEARS LACK OF MOISTURE WILL PRECLUDE THE SUNDAY EVENT 
FROM BEING ANYTHING SIGNIFICANT...AND OUR NORTHERN TIER WILL BE ON 
THE SOUTHERN FRINGE OF PRECIP FIELD PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE (SREF) 
CONSENSUS. THURSDAY EVENT APPEARS MORE SIGNIFICANT AT THIS TIME WITH 
BETTER MOISTURE AVAILABLE. CURRENT FORECAST/GRIDS APPEAR TO HAVE 
THESE SCENARIOS WELL IN HAND...AND NO MAJOR CHANGES HAVE BEEN MADE.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
856 PM EST THU DEC 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...
OBSERVED TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE AREA HAVE BEEN HOLDING NEARLY
STEADY IN THE UPPER 30S TO MID 40S. THIS IS ABOUT 5 TO 10 DEGREES
WARMER THAN FORECAST. DEWPOINTS ARE ALSO HIGH...MID 30S TO LOWER
40S. THUS THE WET BULB ZERO DEGREE ISOTHERM IS WELL OUT OF OUR
AREA...ELIMINATING ANY POSSIBILITY OF FREEZING RAIN. TEMPS WILL NOT
DROP UNTIL A COLD FRONT NOW NEAR NASHVILLE PASSES THROUGH. BY THIS
TIME MOST OF THE PRECIPITATION WILL HAVE ENDED. RUC SHOWS VERY DRY
AIR MOVING IN FROM AROUND 850 MB AND HIGHER IN THE PLATEAU AROUND
06Z AND IN THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS AROUND 09Z. THE KMRX VWP DOES SHOW
THAT WINDS ARE NOW BACKING WITH HEIGHT...INDICATING THAT COLD
ADVECTION HAS BEGUN ALOFT...AND ERODING THE WARM NOSE ALOFT. BUT
GIVEN WARM TEMPS SURFACE COOLING WILL BE SLOW UNTIL THE FROPA.

THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL BE DROPPED FOR THE TN PLATEAU
COUNTIES AND LEE...SCOTT...AND WISE COUNTIES IN VA. HIGHER
ELEVATIONS IN SW VA AND NE TN STILL HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO SEE SOME
ACCUMULATION...SO WILL KEEP THE ADVISORY GOING THERE. SPS WILL BE
UPDATED TO SHIFT EMPHASIS TO BLACK ICE ACROSS THE AREA IN THE
MORNING...AND MENTION A POSSIBLE DUSTING OF SNOW FROM KNOXVILLE
NORTH AND IN THE MOUNTAINS.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
348 PM EST THU DEC 8 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...MAJOR EMPHASIS ON
WEATHER OCCURRING TONIGHT. LARGE AREA OF RAIN FINALLY REACHING
WESTERN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA AT THIS TIME...AS UPPER LOW HAS
EASED EAST INTO THE MID TO UPPER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY..AND SURFACE
LOW HAS DEVELOPED OVER WESTERN PARTS OF TN AND KY. BELIEVE SOME
DOWNSLOPING HAS INITIALLY KEPT EASTERN PARTS OF THE VALLEY DRY TODAY.

TEMPS WARMED CONSIDERABLY IN ADVANCE OF THIS SYSTEM...EVEN REACHING
INTO THE LOWER 50S AT TYS AND RHP.  NAM MODEL SHOWS STRONGER LOW
LEVEL JET AND A MUCH DIFFERENT/WARMER LOW LEVEL TEMPERATURE PROFILE
THAN GFS.  KMRX VAD WIND PROFILE WOULD SLIGHTLY FAVOR THE WEAKER
GFS LOW LEVEL JET AT THIS TIME.  GFS TEMP PROFILE FAVORS MORE SNOW
THAN NAM WHICH SUPPORTS A PROLONGED RAIN OR MIXED EVENT.

COMPROMISED TOWARD THE GFS AND CONSISTENCY WITH PREVIOUS FORECAST...
ALLOWING A MIX WITH SNOW AND SLEET THEN MOSTLY LIGHT SNOW LATE
TONIGHT...BEFORE THE LIFT RATHER QUICKLY DIMINISHES.  IN LINE WITH
HPC/WWD WINTER WEATHER GRAPHICS...INCLUDED SOME VERY LIGHT ICING
AMOUNTS POSSIBLE IN PARTS OF RUSSELL...WASHINGTON COUNTIES OF SW VA
AND OUR NRN MTNS OF NE TN.  POSITION AND TIMING OF THE UPPER LOW
SEEMS TO KEEP SOME LINGERING MOISTURE AT LEAST IN EASTERN PARTS OF
THE FORECAST AREA UP TO NEAR 12Z FRIDAY. 

WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY POSTED FOR AREAS MOST LIKELY TO GET A BRIEF
LIGHT SNOW AND/OR SLEET OCCURRENCE LATE TONIGHT.  SPS ISSUED FOR
THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA.

COMMENTS ON FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT WILL BE LIMITED TO LITTLE IF
ANY CHANGES FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS/FORECAST AS MUCH DRIER AIR MOVES IN
QUICKLY. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...RIDGING SFC AND ALOFT 
WILL DRY AND COLD WX REGIME IN PLACE SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. 
LARGE UPPER TROF BUILDS EAST ENCOMPASSING THE EASTERN HALF OF THE 
NATION BY SUNDAY WITH MODERATELY DEEP COLUMN OF MOISTURE SWINGING 
SOUTHEAST FROM THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY ON SUNDAY SO USED A 
SLIGHT CHANCE FOR -SHSN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE 
WITH SOME -RA MIXED IN FOR GOOD MEASURE MAINLY NORTHEAST TENNESSEE.
DRIED IT OUT FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY DESPITE NASTY PERSISTANT UPPER 
TROF IN PLACE OVER THE EASTERN U.S. WHICH GFS MODELS TRIES TO SHOW 
CONTINUED VORTS WITH LIMITED MOISTURE DROPPING SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE 
CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. 

NEXT MAIN CHANCE FOR PRECIP BACK IN THE FORECAST FOR WEDNESDAY 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA AS UPPER TROF PRESSES 
EAST THROUGH THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN PLAINS WITH A SURFACE LOW AND 
INVERTED TROF EXTENDING NORTH THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. EXTENDED 
SLIGHT CHANCE PRECIP (WHICH IS A RAIN/SNOW MIX ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
TWO THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA) ACROSS THE ENTIRE REGION WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY TO ACCOUNT FOR MOISTURE/LIFT ADVECTION WITH 
EASTWARD MOVING SYSTEM.

FXUS64 KMRX 081451
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
950 AM EST THU DEC 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...THREAT OF WINTRY PRECIPITATION (PCPN) HAS DIMINISHED 
FOR TODAY...DUE TO LOW LEVEL WARMING ALREADY UNDERWAY AND A 
SIGNIFICANT DELAY IN THE ONSET OF ANY PCPN THIS MORNING.

UPPER AIR ANALYSIS SHOWS 850 MB ZERO DEGREE ISOTHERM ACROSS NE TIP 
OF TN NORTHWARD ACROSS EXTREME ERN PARTS OF WASHINGTON AND RUSSELL 
COUNTIES OF SWRN VA.  MOST SURFACE OBSERVATIONS HAVE ALREADY WARMED 
WELL ABOVE 32 DEGREES EXCEPT FOR A FEW SITES ACROSS EXTREME NE TN 
AND SWRN VA...AND MANY OF THOSE ARE SCHOOL NET SITES WHICH TYPICALLY 
RUN COOLER ANYWAY.  VISIBLE SATELLITE PICS SHOW AREAS OF MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKIES WHICH HAS AIDED THE WARM UP.

CLOSEST LIGHT PCPN IS WORKING NORTHWARD ACROSS MAINLY WESTERN PARTS 
OF MIDDLE TN...IN AN AREA OF GOOD WARM AIR ADVECTION AND ISENTROPIC 
LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER LOW CENTERED OVER SE NEBRASKA AT 12Z.
MODELS GENERALLY BRING THIS LIGHT PCPN INTO WESTERN PARTS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS AFTERNOON...AND ACROSS REST OF THE AREA BY 
09/00Z.  THINKING NOW IS MOSTLY LIGHT RAIN FOR THE DAYTIME HOURS 
INTO THE EARLY EVENING...ALTHO WILL MONITOR THE COOLER EXTREME NE 
AREAS WHERE HIGHER VALLEYS MIGHT STILL HAVE A POTENTIAL FOR LIGHT 
FREEZING RAIN.  

FOR TONIGHT...EXPECT A RAIN MIX WITH SNOW/SLEET THEN CHANGE TO 
MOSTLY LIGHT SNOW AFTER 03-06Z...BUT ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE HINDERED 
BY RAPID DECREASE IN THE DEPTH OF AVAILABLE MOISTURE PLUS DEPARTURE 
OF BEST LIFT.  APPEARS THAT WE MIGHT NEED A SNOW OR WINTER WEATHER 
ADVISORY FOR SWRN VA AND PARTS OF NE TN...BUT WILL DECIDE ON THIS IN 
THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE AFTER WATCHING EVENT UNFOLD AND A LOOK AT 12Z 
MODEL RUN.

WILL UPDATE THE ZFPMRX...AND LIKELY DOWNPLAY THE FREEZING RAIN AND 
SLEET FOR TODAY.  GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS WILL ALSO GET FRESHENED.
SPSMRX MAY GET SOME COSMETIC ADJUSTMENTS BEFORE NOON.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 080930
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
420 AM EST THU DEC 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...MID/UPPER LOW NEAR THE NEBRASKA/KANSAS BORDER THIS 
MORNING. THIS POSITION IS SLOWER THEN PREVIOUS MODEL PROGS. AS A 
RESULT...THE SURFACE RIDGING DOWN THE EAST SIDE OF THE APPALACHIANS 
HAS NOT BEEN AS STRONG. THIS HAS ALLOW THE DEVELOPING LOW LEVEL 
INVERTED TROUGH FROM THE GLFMEX TO EXTEND FARTHER UP INTO THE EAST 
TN VLY. TEMPERATURES...ESPECIALLY ALONG SW PART OF MRX CWA ARE 
RUNNING ABOVE FREEZING. MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUD COVER STREAMING 
INTO THE AREA HAS NEGATED PROLONGED COOLING OVERNIGHT. THERE IS 
SOME SNOW VIRGA MOVING ACROSS THE AREA BUT DP DEPRESSIONS ARE NOT 
LARGE ENOUGH TO INCREASE RISK OF FREEZING RAIN. BY THE TIME PCPN 
COMMENCES...TEMPS SHOULD BE ABOVE FREEZING. SHORT PERIODS OF 
FREEZING RAIN AND SLEET ARE POSSIBLE BUT ARE NOT EXPECTED TO BE 
HAZARDOUS. GOOD LONG FETCH ISENTROPIC LIFT RIDES INTO AREA IN THE 
OVERNIGHT HOURS SO WIDESPREAD RAINFALL ON TRACK. A SFC LOW WILL 
DEVELOP IN THE INVERTED TROUGH OVER MID TN LATER TODAY AND MOVE NNE 
TONIGHT. A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE EAST INTO THE MRX CWA LATER TONIGHT.
THE RAIN WILL CHANGE OVER TO SNOW. THE BULK OF THE MOISTURE SHOULD 
BE EAST OF THE AREA AS THIS OCCURS SO SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ARE NOT 
EXPECTED TO EXCEED TWO INCHES. ROADWAYS WILL BE ICY EARLY ON FRIDAY 
ACROSS THE REGION. THE TROUGHING ACROSS THE EAST U.S. DEEPENS THIS 
WEEKEND WITH CONTINUED TEMPS BELOW NORMAL. A CLIPPER SYSTEM WILL 
BRING A SMALL CHANCE OF SNOW ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS LATER IN THE 
WEEKEND. DRY HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH CONTINUED 
BELOW NORMAL TEMPS.      



.LONG TERM...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EST WED DEC 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...
NO CHANGES ARE NEEDED TO THE FORECAST FOR THE OVERNIGHT PERIOD.
PLUME OF SUBTROPICAL MOISTURE SEEN IN WV IMAGERY WILL PROVIDE MID
LEVEL CLOUDS OVER THE AREA OVERNIGHT. THIS ALONG WITH A LIGHT WIND
WILL KEEP TEMPS FROM FALLING AS FAR AS LAST NIGHT...IN THE MID 20S
TO LOWER 30S.

18Z MODELS RUNS APPEAR TO BE WARMER THAN THE 12Z RUNS...WITH
FORECAST SOUNDINGS AT TRI ABOVE FREEZING FROM 750 MB TO THE SURFACE
UNTIL AROUND 06Z. AFTER THAT TIME...MID LEVEL DRYING BEGINS TO SHUT
OFF THE HEAVIER PRECIP. THUS THERE IS A VERY SMALL WINDOW OF
OPPORTUNITY FOR FROZEN PRECIP...AND MEETING WATCH CRITERIA APPEARS
DIFFUCLT AT THIS TIME. HOWEVER IT IS STILL A POSSIBILITY IN THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE WATCH AREA...AND THE MODELS MAY CHANGE
THEIR TUNE AGAIN. NO CHANGES WILL BE MADE TO THURSDAY/THURSDAY NIGHT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
354 PM EST WED DEC 7 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...CHALLENGING FORECAST FOR
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT...SO WILL FOCUS AFD ON THOSE PERIODS.
GFS AND NAM IN FAIR AGREEMENT ON SYNOPTIC FEATURES...ALTHO NAM IS
SLIGHTLY FASTER WITH THE ONSET OF PRECIPITATION (PCPN) THURSDAY.
THE AMOUNT OF LOW LEVEL WARM AIR ADVECTION IS STRONG ENOUGH TO
PRODUCE RAIN OR MIXED PCPN DURING THE DAY THURSDAY INTO THE EVENING
HOURS. THE COLD AIR ARRIVES JUST BEFORE THE MOISTURE BEGINS TO
RAPIDLY DIMINISH...WITH GENERALLY A THREAT OF SOME LIGHT SNOW
ACCUMULATIONS MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT. ISSUED WINTER STORM WATCH FOR
THE COLDER AREAS THURSDAY MORNING OF NRN TN MTNS AND NRN MOST SWRN
VA COUNTIES...WHERE SOME LIGHT ICING MIGHT OCCUR...ESPECIALLY IN
THE HIGHER VALLEYS. CONTINUED WINTER STORM WATCH THROUGH 12Z FRIDAY
DUE TO POTENTIAL FOR SNOW ACCUMULATIONS TOTALING UP TO 4 INCHES.

OTHERWISE...LITTLE CHANGES TO FRIDAY FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS. SPSMRX
UPDATED FOR AREAS OUTSIDE OF THE WINTER STORM WATCH...AND MENTIONED
A FEW AREAS OF SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN OR NEAR SNOW ADVISORY CRITERIA.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE 
BRINGING DRIER WEATHER FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY.  MODELS INDICATING 
A WEAK SHORTWAVE APPROACHING LATE SUNDAY.  BEST MOISTURE STAYING 
NORTH...BUT WILL ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND 
SUNDAY NIGHT FOR SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST TN AND THE SMOKIES.  MAY 
SEE MINOR ACCUMULATIONS SUNDAY NIGHT ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
WITH THE COLD TEMPERATURES AND SOME UPSLOPE EXPECTED.  SHORTWAVE 
TRACKS OUT QUICKLY ON MONDAY...WILL CONTINUE 20 POPS FOR ONLY THE 
MORNING HOURS ON MONDAY.  UPPER TROUGH AND COLD FRONT TRACKING INTO 
REGION MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.  12Z GFS INDICATING MORE MOISTURE 
WITH IT THAN PREVIOUS RUN...WILL CONTINUE TO KEEP MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUESDAY DRY FOR NOW.  HIGH PRESSURE RETURNING ON WEDNESDAY.  LATEST 
GFS INDICATING ANOTHER SHORTWAVE PUSHING IN LATE ON WEDNESDAY... 
PRECIP SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

1013 AM EST WED DEC 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...MOST TIME SPENT THIS MORNING VIEWING INCOMING MODEL

MIXED PRECIPITATION (PCPN) FOR THE MOST PART...BUT SOME POTENTIAL

AND EXTREME NE TN (ESPECIALLY HIGHER VALLEYS OF NRN MTNS) WITH THIS

THE LOW LEVEL WARM AIR ADVECTION.  NAM AND GFS SEEMED SIMILAR OVERALL
...ALTHO NAM A LITTLE FASTER WITH ONSET OF PCPN ON THURSDAY.  BOTH 
NAM AND GFS SEEM TO COOL ATMOSPHERE TO ALL SNOW NRN TWO THIRDS BY OR 
JUST AFTER 06Z FRIDAY...ALTHO AT THIS POINT THE MOISTURE IS RAPIDLY 
LEAVING WRN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA.  

WILL REFINE THE WEATHER/POP GRIDS FOR THIS EVENT IN THE AFTERNOON 
PACKAGE...AFTER VIEWING ALL 12Z MODEL DATA AND COORDINATION WITH 
NEIGHBORING OFFICES.  PLAN ON AT LEAST AN UPDATED SPS AT THIS POINT.


FOR TODAY...MAX TEMP FORECAST APPEARS RIGHT ON TRACK BASED ON LATEST 
OHX AND RNK SOUNDINGS.  SATELLITE PICS SHOW JUST PATCHES OF HIGH 
CLOUDS WORKING NORTH WITH THE SRN STREAM UPPER JET.  THUS...FORECAST 
LOOKS GOOD FOR REST OF TODAY.  WILL NOT UPDATE ZFPMRX...BUT PLAN TO 
CHECK FOR ANY NEEDED SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS TO THE GRIDS AND WEB 
PRODUCTS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
437 AM EST WED DEC 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...RAPID PRECIPITATION EVENT ON THURSDAY BEARS CLOSE WATCH.
MONDO SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SPANS NW-SE ACROSS UNITED STATES TODAY.
VERY COLD MID LEVEL LOW DROPS OUT OF ROCKIES LATER TODAY. THIS STRONG
LOW BUILDS HEIGHTS OVR CNTRL APPALACHIANS AND N VA LATER TONIGHT WHILE
DRAWING LOW LEVEL INVERTED TROUGH UPWARD THROUGH MS RVR VALLEY. CURRENT
SURFACE PRESSURES ARE RUNNING A TAD HIGHER THAN MODEL PROGS. CONCERN IS
PCPN TYPE AS ISENTROPIC LIFT GETS UNDERWAY ON THU. MODELS SUPPORT A
RAPID WARMUP DOWN FROM H85 AND DEPICT A LIQUID EVENT ACROSS MRX CWA.
WITH GOOD BET FOR MEARUABLE PCPN AREA-WIDE...AM AFRAID SUB BOUNDARY
LAYERS WILL NOT GET ABOVE FREEZING DURING EARLY STAGES OF
EVENT...ESPECIALLY ALONG EAST SIDE OF MRX CWA. BESIDES GOING A FEW
DEGREES LOWER ON THU TEMPS THAN ALL GUIDANCE...DID NOT WANT TO STRAY
TOO FAR WITH PCPN TYPE BUT CONDITIONS MAY GET HAZARDOUS WITH FREEZING
RAIN AND LATER ADJUSTMENTS MAY BE REQUIRED. RAIN CHANGES TO SNOW IN
EVENING HOURS THU AS MID LVL LOW MOVES EASTWARD THRU OH RVR VLY. TROUGH
AXIS MOVES THROUGH E TN EARLY FRI WITH SIGNIFICANT LAYER DRYING. NW FLOW
CONTINUES THROUGH EXTENDED RESULTING IN BELOW NORMAL TEMPS.

FXUS64 KMRX 061953
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EST TUE DEC 6 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...
STRONG SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL SLIDE SOUTHEAST AND CONTINUE TO 
BUILD INTO THE AREA TONIGHT. WITH CLEAR SKIES AND CALM WINDS...TEMPS 
WILL DROP INTO THE 15 TO 25 RANGE. SKIES SHOULD REMAIN CLEAR THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY...AND TEMPS SHOULD BE A DEGREE OR TWO WARMER THAN TODAY. 
MIDLEVEL CLOUDS BEGIN TO INCREASE WEDNESDAY NIGHT.

TOMORROW A CLOSED UPPER LOW DEVELOPS OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS...AND 
STRENGTHENS AS IT MOVES SOUTHEAST. THIS RESULTS IN AN INVERTED 
TROUGH DEVELOPING OVER TN AND GULF MOISTURE TRANSPORT. THE MODELS 
HAVE COME INTO MUCH BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THIS SYSTEM AND ITS 
ASSOCIATED TEMPERATURE PROFILES OVER THE AREA. BOTH SHOW PRECIP 
ARRIVING IN OUR SW THURSDAY MORNING AND SPREADING NORTHEAST THROUGH 
THE DAY...A SLIGHTLY FASTER TREND THAN PREVIOUS RUNS. SURFACE 
TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE ABOVE FREEZING OVER THE ENTIRE AREA THROUGH 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON...INCLUDING THE MOUNTAINS AS THE TEMPERATURE 
PROFILE BECOMES NEAR ISOTHERMAL OR SLIGHTLY INCREASING WITH HEIGHT. 
THERE COULD BE A BRIEF PERIOD OF FREEZING RAIN IN THE MOUNTAINS 
BEFORE THE 850 MB WARM ADVECTION KICKS IN...BUT CONFIDENCE IS NOT 
HIGH ENOUGH TO WARRANT A MENTION OF SUCH A BRIEF OCCURRENCE. AS THE 
CLOSED LOW CROSSES THE UPPER MS VALLEY REGION...IT INDUCES 
CYCLOGENESIS OVER THE OHIO VALLEY.  THIS BRINGS COLD ADVECTION IN 
THE 750 TO 900 MB LAYER...REDUCING THE WARM NOSE AND CHANGING PRECIP 
OVER TO SNOW...FIRST ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SW VA...THEN 
GRADUALLY SOUTH AFTER MIDNIGHT. SOUTHERN AREAS COULD BRIEFLY SEE 
SNOW BEFORE THE PRECIP IS SHUT OFF BY MIDLEVEL DRYING. ALL MOISTURE 
IS CONFINED BELOW 850 MB BY 11Z FRIDAY...SO WILL END PRECIP AT THAT 
TIME. SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN THE NORTHERN PLATEAU...SW VA...AND TN 
MTNS WILL BE LESS THAN 2 INCHES. A BIG CAVEAT IN THIS FORECAST IS IF 
TEMPERATURES ARE JUST A FEW DEGREES COOLER FROM 800 MB AND LOWER 
THAN THE MODELS SHOW. THIS COULD RESULT IN A MORE PROLONGED PERIOD 
OF SNOW AND GREATER ACCUMULATIONS...AS WELL AS FREEZING RAIN IN THE 
MOUNTAINS THURSDAY AFTERNOON. WILL CONTINUE WITH AN SPS TO HIGHLIGHT 
THIS EVENT.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
THURSDAY EVENT PULLS OUT LEAVING GENERALLY DRY WEATHER THROUGH THE 
PERIOD WITH NO MAJOR FEATURES OF NOTE. HOWEVER...RIDGE WEST/TROUGH 
EAST LONGWAVE PATTERN WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE PERIOD. THIS PORTENDS 
TEMPS WILL TEND TO STAY COOL AND GENERALLY BELOW CLIMO. STAYED CLOSE 
TO GFSX GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS FOR THE MOST PART EXCEPT FOR BUMPING 
GUIDANCE TEMPS SLIGHTLY ON SUNDAY WHILE TRIMMING GUIDANCE TEMPS 
SLIGHTLY ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY. THIS WAS BASED ON ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS 
WHICH SUGGEST DEEPER EASTERN TROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK COMPARED TO 
OPERATIONAL GFS MODEL.

FXUS64 KMRX 061452
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
952 AM EST TUE DEC 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CLOUDS CONTINUE TO LINGER IN SW VA AND NE TN THIS MORNING. WHILE
DRIER AIR IS EXPECTED TO MOVE INTO THE AREA LATER TODAY AND
DISSIPATE THE CLOUDS...THE CURRENT MOSTLY SUNNY WORDING IN THAT
AREA IS PROBABLY TOO OPTIMISTIC. WILL UPDATE TO INCREASE CLOUDS IN
THE NORTHEAST. WILL ALSO ADJUST WIND DIRECTION TO ACCOUNT FOR A
MORE SOUTHWESTERLY COMPONENT. TEMPERATURES ARE GENERALLY ON TRACK
AND WILL BE UNCHANGED.

THOUGHTS ON 06Z MODEL RUNS REGARDING THURSDAY NIGHT PRECIP EVENT...
THE MAIN DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE MODELS ARE THE TIMING OF THE
PRECIP AND THE TEMPERATURE PROFILES. THE NAM IS FASTER TO BRING IN
PRECIP...AND SHOWS A STRONGER WARM NOSE THAN THE GFS. THIS IS
LIKELY DUE TO THE NAM SHOWING A LOW LEVEL JET THAT IS TWICE THE
STRENGTH OF THE LLJ IN THE GFS (40KTS VS 20KTS)...AS WELL AS A MUCH
STRONGER SURFACE LOW DEVELOPING OVER ERN KY AND OHIO VALLEY.
BELIEVE THAT THE NAM IS OVERDONE WITH THE LLJ AND THE SURFACE
LOW...AND THUS THE WARM ADVECTION. IT WILL BE INTERESTING TO SEE
IF THE MODELS CONTINUE THESE TRENDS WITH THE 12Z MODEL RUN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
238 PM EST MON DEC 5 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...RADAR MOSAIC SHOWS PRECIP AXIS 
CONTINUES TO SHIFT NORTH AND EAST AWAY FROM OUR FORECAST AREA. 
ANTICIPATE ALL ORGANIZED PRECIP TO HAVE MOVED OUT BY EARLY EVENING 
AS MODEL TIME HEIGHTS DEPICT RAPID DRYING AT ALL LEVELS WITH 
MOISTURE CONFINED TO A SHALLOW SURFACE LAYER. COULD STILL SEE A FEW 
SNOW SHOWERS/FLURRIES IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN BUT EVEN THIS SHOULD END 
BY MID-FIRST PERIOD. THUS WILL DROP ALL ADVISORIES WITH ISSUANCE OF 
AFTERNOON PACKAGE. 

COLD ADVECTION WILL CONTINUE TO CAUSE TEMPS TO FALL OVERNIGHT... 
ESPECIALLY AS CLEARING COMMENCES FROM WEST TO EAST. REMAINDER OF 
SHORT TERM APPEARS GENERALLY TRANQUIL AS UPPER TROUGH PULLS AWAY AND
UPPER FLOW DEAMPLIFIES INTO A NEARLY ZONAL FLOW. TEMPS WILL REMAIN
SOMEWHAT BELOW CLIMO HOWEVER. GUIDANCE TEMPS ARE GENERALLY CLOSE
AND APPEAR REASONABLE.


.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND WEAK RIDGING ALOFT WILL BUILD INTO THE 
AREA FROM THE NORTHWEST TUESDAY NIGHT...ALONG WITH A REINFORCING 
SHOT OF COLD AIR ON WEDNESDAY. MEANWHILE A CLOSED LOW WILL MOVE 
ACROSS THE GREAT PLAINS. AS THE RIDGE AXIS SHIFTS EAST...A LOW TO 
MID LEVEL SOUTHERLY FLOW TRANSPORTS MOISTURE AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING 
LOW ON THURSDAY. AN INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER THE CWA IN 
RESPONSE TO THE LOW AND THE STRONG UPPER JET...AND ISENTROPIC LIFT 
STRENGTHENS THROUGH THE DAY ON THURSDAY. GFS IS SLIGHTLY FASTER WITH 
THE SYSTEM THAN THE NAM...AND COLDER AS WELL. GFS INDICATES AN ALL 
SNOW EVENT WHILE THE NAM SHOWS A PROMINENT WARM NOSE WHICH SUGGESTS A 
MIX. GIVEN THESE DIFFERENCES THIS FAR OUT...WILL KEEP IT SIMPLE AND 
MENTION ONLY RAIN OR SNOW IN CLIMATOLOGICALLY FAVORED AREAS WITH 
CHANCE POPS. WILL END PRECIP IN ALL AREAS BY 12Z FRIDAY. 

REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST WILL REMAIN DRY. A NORTHWEST FLOW ON 
FRIDAY BACKS TO A SOUTHWEST FLOW ON MONDAY AHEAD OF ANOTHER 
DEEPENING TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS. GIVEN THE INCONSISTENCIES OF THE 
MODELS OF LATE...ESPECIALLY THAT FAR OUT...WILL INTRODUCE MONDAY 
WITH NO POPS BUT WILL INCREASE CLOUD COVER.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WINTRY MIX STILL ON TRACK. MADE

SNOW INTO EVENING HOURS. SHORT WAVE TROUGH MOVES EAST TO W TN TDY.

AGREEMENT...FAVORED THE SLOWER AND MORE SNOW PESSIMISTIC SOLUTION OF

THIS SYSTEM. THE MAIN REASON FOR THIS DECISION WAS MODEL SFC T/TDS 
ARE A COUPLE DEGREES TOO WARM. THIS DIFFERENCE SHOULD HAVE ENOUGH 
AFFECT ON MIXY CHANGE-OVER PCPN EVENT TO CONTINUE A PRO SNOW EVENT. 
ANOTHER CONSIDERATION IS AVAILABLE MOISTURE WHICH IS ALSO BORDERLINE 
RELATIVE TO SNOW AMOUNTS. FOR TEMPS NOT MUCH OF A RISE TDY AND THEN 
FAIRLY STRONG CAA AFTER MIDNIGHT AND WITH WINDS STAYING UP EXPECT 
WIND CHILLS READINGS TO FALL INTO THE TEENS.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...PRECIP WILL HAVE COME TO AN 
END BY TUESDAY MORNING AS THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CONTINUES TO PULL 
AWAY.  WE WILL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY WITH ZONAL 
FLOW ALOFT.  MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT BY THURSDAY...CURRENT GFS 
MODEL NOW DEPICTING A WEATHER SYSTEM APPROACHING THE AREA FOR 
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT.  THIS IS A CHANGE FROM PRIOR RUNS AND 
CONFIDENCE IS LOW.  HOWEVER...WILL CARRY LOW POPS FOR THURSDAY 
NIGHT.  DRY CONDITIONS FOR FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY.  WILL KEEP TEMPS 
NEAR GUIDANCE THROUGH THE PERIOD.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 050216
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EST SUN DEC 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT ACROSS CENTRAL AL AND 
CENTRAL GA STRETCHING NORTHEAST ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE 
APPALACHIANS. TEMPS REMAIN IN THE LOWER TO MID 40S ACROSS MOST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...EXCEPT ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU WHERE TEMPS ARE ALREADY IN THE MID 30S. AN AREA OF LOW 
PRESSURE HAS BEGUN TO FORM ACROSS EAST CENTRAL AL NEAR MONTGOMERY 
ALONG THE FRONT...AND THIS SURFACE LOW SHOULD CONTINUE TO STRENGTHEN 
OVERNIGHT IN RESPONSE TO A DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH OVER THE LOWER MS 
RIVER VALLEY. NAM AND GFS MODELS CONTINUE TO REVEAL SOME 
DISCREPANCIES IN THEIR VERTICAL THERMAL PROFILES...WITH THE GFS 
MODEL INDICATING A COLDER PROFILE FOR NORTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS 
OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS COLDER GFS PROFILE APPEARS TO BE THE 
RESULT OF A MORE EASTWARD TRACK OF THE SURFACE LOW OVERNIGHT 
(COMPARED TO THE NAM SOLUTION). HOWEVER...THE NAM MODEL APPEARS TO 
HAVE INITIALIZED SLIGHTLY BETTER THAN THE GFS THIS EVENING 
(ACCORDING TO 00Z OBS)...AND WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW ITS WARMER 
SOLUTION TONIGHT. 

THE NAM MODEL REVEALS MORE OF A WARM BOUNDARY LAYER OVERNIGHT... 
WHICH SHOULD RESULT IN A RAIN/SNOW MIX FOR MOST OF THE VALLEY AREAS. 
A MOSTLY SNOW SCENARIO SHOULD DEVELOP AS FORECASTED ACROSS THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...NORTHEAST TN MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF 
SOUTHWEST VA TOWARDS SUNRISE...WITH SOME SLEET MIXING IN FROM TIME 
TO TIME DURING THE MORNING HOURS AFTER SUNRISE. SOME FRONTOGENETICAL 
FORCING IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP AROUND SUNRISE ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST VA...WHICH SHOULD INCREASE LIFT ACROSS THIS AREA RESULTING 
IN SOME ADDITIONAL DYNAMICAL COOLING FROM HEAVIER PRECIP. THUS... 
ALTHOUGH SURFACE TEMPS MAY BE HOVERING ABOVE FREEZING IN THE VALLEYS 
OF NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA AROUND SUNRISE...THINK THAT THIS 
HEAVIER PRECIP AFTER SUNRISE SHOULD HELP TO LOWER THESE TEMPS ENOUGH 
TO ALLOW ACCUMULATIONS OF SNOW IN THE VALLEYS. CURRENT WARNINGS AND 
ADVISORIES LOOK TO BE ON TRACK FOR THE MOST PART...BUT WILL LOWER 
TOTAL SNOWFALL AMOUNTS ACROSS THE VALLEYS OF NORTHEAST TN TO AROUND 
AN INCH OR TWO SINCE SNOW SHOULD HAVE A TOUGH TIME ACCUMULATING 
INITIALLY. DONT REALLY THINK SNOW WILL BE ABLE TO ACCUMULATE IN THE 
CENTRAL TN VALLEY WITH TEMPS EXPECTED TO REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING 
OVERNIGHT.

WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING MAINLY TO FRESHEN-UP 
THE WORDING...BUT WILL GENERALLY LEAVE TEMPS AND WINDS ALONE. 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

TN...WINTER STORM WARNING FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 4 PM MONDAY FOR THE
     FOLLOWING ZONES: JOHNSON...SOUTHEAST CARTER...SOUTHEAST 
     GREENE...AND UNICOI. 

     WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 4 PM MONDAY FOR
     THE FOLLOWING ZONES: BLOUNT SMOKY MOUNTAINS...CAMPBELL...
     CLAIBORNE...COCKE SMOKY MOUNTAINS...HANCOCK...HAWKINS...
     MORGAN...NORTHWEST CARTER...NORTHWEST GREENE...SCOTT TN...
     SEVIER SMOKY MOUNTAINS...SULLIVAN...AND WASHINGTON TN. 

VA...WINTER STORM WARNING FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 4 PM MONDAY FOR THE
     FOLLOWING ZONES: LEE...RUSSELL...SCOTT...WASHINGTON...AND 
     WISE.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 041941
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
241 PM EST SUN DEC 4 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...LATEST MODEL RUNS HAVE PROVIDED 
VERY LITTLE CLARIFICATION FOR UPCOMING EVENT. THERES GENERAL 
AGREEMENT ON DEVELOPMENT OF A WAVE ON COLD FRONT NEAR THE GULF COAST 
AND MOVING IT NORTHEAST TONIGHT. THERE ARE CRITICAL DIFFERENCES 
IN THE TRACK HOWEVER...SO CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW. NAM TRACKS SURFACE 
LOW JUST SOUTH AND EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA WHICH IS VERY FAVORABLE 
FOR A POTENTIAL HEAVY SNOW EVENT SYNOPTICALLY. HOWEVER...THE GFS 
SUPPRESSES THE TRACK FARTHER SOUTH AND EAST RESULTING IN MOST OF THE 
PRECIP OCCURRING ON THE EASTERN SIDE OF THE APPALACHIANS. THE 
CANADIAN GEM GENERALLY LENDS SUPPORT TO THE GFS SOLUTION. 
INCLINATION IS TO FAVOR SHORT-RANGE ENSEMBLES (SREF) WHICH APPEARS 
TO REPRESENT A REASONABLY GOOD COMPROMISE OF SOLUTIONS. BASED ON 
THIS SOLUTION...WARNING CRITERIA WOULD BE REACHED IN OUR SW VIRGINIA 
COUNTIES AND THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS. ADVISORY CRITERIA APPEARS 
POSSIBLE IN NE TENNESSEE AND NORTHERN PLATEAU AND POSSIBLY CENTRAL 
MOUNTAINS...ALTHOUGH FORECAST SOUNDINGS WOULD TEND TO FAVOR MIX. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY WENT SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN GFS GUIDANCE VALUES.




.LONG TERM...(MON NIGHT THROUGH SUN)...ANY LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS 
EARLY MON NIGHT SHOULD DIMINISH AND END BY TUE MORNING.  MODELS HAVE 
COME INTO SOMEWHAT BETTER AGREEMENT FOR THE LONGER TERM...WILL 
GENERALLY FOLLOW HPC SOLUTION WHICH KEEPS THINGS DRY...WITH TEMPS 
BELOW CLIMO FOR THE MOST PART.  GFS IS SHOWING POSSIBILITY OF A 
SYSTEM BRINGING PRECIP BY SUN...BUT WITH IT BEING DAY 7 WILL LEAVE 
IT OUT FOR NOW AND WAIT TO SEE IF OTHER MODELS AND LATER RUNS 
CONFIRM.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM GFS MOS TEMPS.  




&&

MOS TEMP GUIDANCE WHICH SHOWS NORMAL DIURNAL TEMP CURVE THIS AFTN.

AND WAVES NORTHWARD INTO THE CENTRAL PART OF THE MRX CWA TONIGHT.

CWA AND SOME VALLEY LOCATIONS.

EXITING THE REGION ON MONDAY WITH SOME RESIDUAL PRECIPITATION 
CONTINUING THROUGH MUCH OF THE DAY.  WITH COOLER AIR IN

ZONES WITH A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW POSSIBLE OVER THE SOUTHERN AND 
CENTRAL TENNESSEE VALLEY.  A FEW SNOW SHOWERS WILL LINGER OVER

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WARM FRONT ACROSS NORTHERN AL AND 
CENTRAL GA ASSOCIATED WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER NORTHEAST AR. 
LOCAL SOUNDINGS ALONG WITH KMRX VAD WIND PROFILER DATA REVEAL A 
STRONG LOW-LEVEL JET AROUND 850 MB CONTINUING TO ADVECT A WARM AND 
MOIST AIRMASS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. SURFACE OBS IN THE VALLEY 
REMAIN IN THE 30S TO NEAR 40 AT CHA...BUT THESE TEMPS AND DEWPOINTS 
SHOULD GRADUALLY RISE OVERNIGHT AS THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM NEARS THE 
FORECAST AREA AND WARM FRONT SLOWLY LIFTS NORTHWARD. MODEL SOUNDINGS 
REVEAL SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS 
EVENING...WHICH HAS RESULTED IN TSTORM DEVELOPMENT CURRENTLY NEAR 
NASHVILLE AND PADUCAH. THESE TSTORMS SHOULD CONTINUE MOVING EAST 
OVERNIGHT...WITH SOME POSSIBLY PRODUCING LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING 
WINDS. WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO MENTION 
TSTORMS...RISING OVERNIGHT TEMPS...AND THE SVR TSTORM WATCH.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EST SAT DEC 3 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...RATHER COMPLICATED SCENARIO 
SETTING UP THROUGH THE SHORT TERM AS A SERIES OF DISCRETE WEATHER 
SYSTEMS AFFECTS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. INITIAL SYSTEM CURRENT 
PASSING THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA IS PROJECTED TO EXIT THE AREA BY 
EARLY FIRST PERIOD. HOWEVER...THIS WILL BE FOLLOWED CLOSELY BY NEXT 
SYSTEM WHICH AGAIN GIVES US ANOTHER EVENT IN THE OVERNIGHT TIME 
FRAME. GFS DEPICTS A SOMEWHAT LESS ORGANIZED SYSTEM THAN EITHER NAM 
OR THE SHORT RANGE ENSEMBLES. HOWEVER...CATEGORICAL POPS SEEMS 
REASONABLE IN ANY EVENT. ANTICIPATING PRECIP TO BE ALL RAIN AS WAA 
CONTINUES. MODEL TIME HEIGHTS DEPICT LOW-LEVEL WINDS INCREASING TO 
NEAR 50 KNOTS...SO WILL ISSUE WIND ADVISORY FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
FOR TONIGHT. THIS FEATURE MOVES RAPIDLY EASTWARD AND IS FOLLOWED BY 
A BRIEF RESPITE IN THE SECOND PERIOD. THE NEXT SYSTEM WILL APPROACH 
FROM THE SOUTHWEST LATE IN THE SECOND PERIOD. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY 
FAVORED GFS GUIDANCE VALUES WHICH REPRESENTED A GOOD COMPROMISE OF 
THE GUIDANCE NUMBERS.


.LONG TERM...(SUN NIGHT THROUGH SAT)...VERY INTERESTING AND
DIFFICULT FORECAST FOR SUN NIGHT AND MON. MODELS HAVE TRENDED
WETTER AND COLDER. EXACT TRACK AND STRENGTH OF LOW PRESSURE MOVING
NORTHEAST ALONG THE FRONT WILL BE KEY. FOR NOW AM GOING WITH A
GFS/NAM BLEND...BUT CLOSER TO THE GFS. THIS ALLOWS CONSIDERABLE
MOISTURE AND LIFT TO AFFECT THE REGION LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO
MONDAY...AND THERMAL PROFILES INDICATE WE MAY BE DEALING WITH SOME
WINTRY PRECIP...ESPECIALLY NORTH AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WITH
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO THE NORTH AND DEEPENING LOW PRESSURE
MOVING BY TO THE SOUTH AND THEN SOUTHEAST...LOW LEVEL FLOW SHOULD
BE NORTH AND NORTHEAST OVER OUR AREA...BRINGING IN COLDER AIR FROM
THE NORTH.  NAM COLDER...AND INDICATES MAINLY SNOW NORTH...AND SNOW
POSSIBLE OVER MUCH OF THE AREA DEPENDING ON HOW COOL THE BOUNDARY
LAYER GETS. GFS IS WARMER...INDICATING MAINLY A COLD RAIN CENTRAL
AND SOUTH...BUT STILL VERY CLOSE TO A SNOW PROFILE. WITH THIS BEING
MAINLY A LATE THIRD AND FOURTH PERIOD EVENT...AND GIVEN SOMEWHAT
POOR MODEL RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY SO FAR...WILL LEAVE ANY POSSIBLE
WATCH ISSUANCE FOR LATER. HOWEVER...WILL ISSUE AN SPS HIGHLIGHTING
POSSIBILITY OF ACCUMULATING SNOW. AFTER SOME LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS
MON NIGHT...WILL GO DRY REMAINDER OF FORECAST PER HPC
SOLUTION...GIVEN UNCERTAINTY CAUSED BY THE EVER CHANGING MODEL
SOLUTIONS.

WHICH WORKS ITS DOWN FROM 700 MB AND PEAKS NEAR 850 MB OVRNGT 
TONIGHT. 850 MB TEMP CHANGES NEAR 20 C. SO PRECIP MAINLY A RESULT OF 
ISENTROPIC LIFT EARLY WORKING IT WAY ACROSS THE AREA FM THE SW AND 
PEAKS TONIGHT WHEN GOOD FRONTOGENESIS OCCURS IN 700-850 MB LAYER. 
MIN TEMPS MAY OCCUR ARND MIDNIGHT WITH INCREASED WINDS AND WAA 
TOWARDS DAWN.

LONG TERM WITH MODELS AND RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY RATHER POOR.  
MODELS TRENDING TOWARD PUSHING THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM AND 
ASSOCIATED FRONT FARTHER SOUTH THAN PRIOR RUNS.  STILL LEAN TOWARD 
THE GFS WHICH IS THE MORE NORTHERN OF THE MODELS.  HAVE LOWERED POPS 
SLIGHTLY SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY BUT STILL KEEP PERIODS OF LIKELY 
WORDING GOING.  COOLER AIR STILL EXPECTED TO PUSH IN BEHIND THE 
FRONT ON MONDAY...ALLOWING FOR A CHANCE OF SNOW...MAINLY OVER 
NORTHERN LOCATIONS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  GFS HAS ALSO BACKED OFF 
ON A SHORT WAVE FOR THURSDAY AND THEREFORE WILL KEEP THINGS DRY 
TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
257 PM EST FRI DEC 2 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...MAIN FORECAST ISSUE IS TIMING 
PROGRESS OF APPROACHING EVENT IN THE SECOND PERIOD. UPPER FLOW 
CONTINUES TO DEAMPLIFY AS UPPER TROUGH PULLS OFF THE EAST COAST. 
MINOR SHORTWAVE IS PROJECTED TO DEVELOP IN NEARLY ZONAL FLOW THAT 
RESULTS BY EARLY IN THE SECOND PERIOD. THIS WILL PROVIDE ENOUGH 
ISENTROPIC LIFT TO INCREASE CLOUDS BY LATE IN THE FIRST PERIOD...AND 
SPREAD GENERALLY LIGHT PRECIP SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST ACROSS THE AREA 
THROUGH THE SECOND PERIOD. THERE IS SOME CONCERN THAT PRECIP COULD 
INITIALLY BEGIN AS LIGHT SNOW OR SLEET IN OUR SW VIRGINIA COUNTIES 
AS SURFACE TEMPS WET-BULB BACK DOWN CLOSE TO FREEZING AT PRECIP 
ONSET PER MODEL TIME HEIGHTS. HOWEVER...THIS SHOULD BE SHORT-LIVED 
AS GOOD WARM ADVECTION PUSHES TEMPS IN THE LOWER LEVELS TO WELL 
ABOVE FREEZING BY LATE IN THE SECOND PERIOD...AND SIGNIFICANT 
ACCUMULATIONS ARE NOT EXPECTED. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE 
VALUES FAIRLY CLOSELY FOR BOTH TEMPS AND POPS...ALTHOUGH DID TWEAK 
TEMPS IN THE SECOND PERIOD SLIGHTLY TO REFLECT ANTICIPATED 
WAA...ESPECIALLY IN THE SOUTHERN TIER.


.LONG TERM...(SAT NIGHT THROUGH FRI)...TOUGH FORECAST FOR THE LONGER 
TERM.  MODELS DIVERGE WITH TIME...BUT STILL LOOKS LIKE GFS BETTER 
THAN THE NAM THIS RUN...SO WILL GO CLOSER TO ITS SOLUTION.  THIS 
KEEPS PRECIP IN THE FORECAST THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT...THEN AS WAVE OF 
LOW PRESSURE MOVES BY TO OUR SOUTHEAST...COLDER AIR PUSHES IN MONDAY 
WHICH MAY ALLOW PRECIP TO MIX WITH AND CHANGE TO SNOW BEFORE 
ENDING.  LOOKS LIKE BEST CHANCES FOR ANY ACCUMULATION MONDAY WOULD 
BE OVER THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND PARTS OF SW VA...BUT STILL A LOT OF 
UNCERTAINTY AT THIS POINT...WILL HAVE TO WATCH LATER MODEL RUNS. FOR 
NOW WILL MENTION POSSIBILITY OF SNOW MIXING IN ON MONDAY...THEN JUST 
SOME LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS IN THE COLD ADVECTION MONDAY NIGHT OVER 
THE NORTH AND SMOKIES.  POOR MODEL AGREEMENT AND POOR RUN TO RUN 
CONSISTENCY FURTHER OUT CONTINUES TO KEEP CONFIDENCE LOW. GFS 
CONTINUES TO INSIST WE MAY HAVE SOME RAIN OR SNOW SOMETIME TOWARD 
THE END OF THE PERIOD...FOR NOW WILL JUST CARRY A 20 POP FOR THU AND 
LEAVE REMAINDER OF FORECAST DRY.

.DISCUSSION...GENERALLY SOLID CLOUD COVER FROM CSV TO TYS NORTHWARD

BEEN UNIMPRESSIVE SO FAR.  02Z SURFACE AND 850 MB TEMPS FROM 02/00Z

OF ANY WIDESPREAD SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL...PERHAPS JUST A DUSTING TO A

PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES FROM EVENING RAOBS ARE ONLY AROUND 1/4 INCH
...BUT CERTAINLY ENUFF MOISTURE FOR UPSLOPE AND COLD AIR ADVECTION 
TO WORK WITH.  SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT WAS UPDATED EARLIER.

WILL CLEAN UP THE ZFPMRX PRODUCT BY REMOVING ANY EVENING WORDING.
OTHERWISE...SKY COVER AND CURRENT POP/WX GRIDS LOOK GOOD.  WILL 
FRESHEN HOURLY TEMP/DEWPOINT GRIDS AND SEE IF OTHER WEB PRODUCTS 
NEED A SLIGHT UPDATE.  MRX VAD WIND PROFILE AND SURFACE WINDS DONT 
SUGGEST ANY NEED FOR A LAKE WIND OR WIND ADVISORY OVERNIGHT.

NEXT CHALLENGE WILL BE TIMING THE ARRIVAL OF WIDESPREAD RAIN FOR 
VERY LATE FRIDAY NIGHT OR SATURDAY MORNING/AFTERNOON.  LATEST NGM 
MODEL RUN LOOKS DRY THRU 48 HOURS...WHILE 18Z GFS RUN DELAYS ONSET 
OF PCPN FOR SW VA/NE TN (COOLEST AREAS) UNTIL AFTER 18Z SATURDAY.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES IN

MOISTURE SHOULD PRODUCE SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS MAINLY FOR THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN IN THE FIRST PERIOD. MENTIONED SNOW FLURRIES FOR THE LOWER 
ELEVATIONS IN SOUTHWESTERN VA AND NORTHEAST TN. UPPER FLOW BECOME 
NEARLY ZONAL BY LATE IN THE SECOND PERIOD...CUTTING OFF ANY 
LINGERING SNOW. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE 
VALUES WHICH WILL AVERAGE BELOW CLIMO.

.LONG TERM...(FRI NIGHT THROUGH WED)...MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM AFFECTING THE REGION FOR THE WEEKEND...BUT STILL 
DIFFER ON THE DETAILS.  NAM CONTINUES TO BE FURTHER SOUTH AND FASTER 
WITH SURFACE LOW...AND QUICKER IN BRINGING PRECIP INTO THE OUR 
AREA.  PER HPC DISCUSSION...NAM APPEARS TO BE AN OUTLIER...SO WILL 
GO CLOSER TO THE GFS SOLUTION.  WILL KEEP FRI NIGHT DRY...THEN BRING 
LIKELY POPS INTO THE AREA BY SAT AFTERNOON AS WARM ADVECTION AND 
ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASE.  IF PRECIP MOVES IN QUICKLY ENOUGH 
SAT...MAY SEE SOME SNOW/SLEET OR FREEZING RAIN MIXING IN OVER 
PORTIONS OF THE NORTHEAST.  WILL ALLOW FOR THAT POSSIBILITY IN THE 
FORECAST...BUT WARMING SHOULD CHANGE ANY MIX OVER TO ALL RAIN FAIRLY 
QUICKLY.  WILL KEEP CATEGORICAL POPS FOR SAT NIGHT AS FRONT PUSHES 
IN. MAY BE A BIT OF LULL AT SOME POINT SUNDAY...BUT ANOTHER WAVE MAY 
KEEP PRECIP AROUND THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT.  WILL GO LIKELY BOTH SUN 
AND SUN NIGHT.  COLDER AIR SHOULD BEGIN PUSHING IN ON 
MONDAY...CHANGING ANY LINGERING SHOWERS OVER TO SNOW SHOWERS IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS DURING DAY MONDAY. A FEW SNOW SHOWERS MAY LINGER 
NORTHERN ZONES AND SMOKIES MONDAY NIGHT.   LOW CONFIDENCE FURTHER 
OUT...WITH POOR RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY AND MODEL AGREEMENT.  WILL 
GENERALLY GO WITH HPC SOLUTION...AND BRING A MOISTURE STARVED COLD 
FRONT THROUGH TUE NIGHT/WED TIME FRAME. WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY FOR 
TUE THROUGH THU. 


&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 010905
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST THU DEC 1 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...
S/WV MAKING ITS WAY EAST ACROSS THE MID WEST/WESTERN GREAT LAKES 
THIS MORNING AND BEGINS TO INFLUENCE FA WEATHER TODAY WITH AN 
INCREASE IN MID LEVEL CLOUDS THROUGH THE MORNING WITH BROKEN 
CONDITIONS DEVELOPING MOST OF THE REGION BY AFTERNOON AS ASSOCIATED 
COLD FRONT BUILDS EAST. SYSTEM STILL MOISTURE STARVED AND PRECIP 
REALLY NOT A PART OF THE EQUATION UNTIL LATE IN THE FIRST PERIOD AS 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE BUILDS INTO THE REGION. NORTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS 
BEHIND S/WV FEATURE LATE TODAY AND TONIGHT WITH CAA RESULTING IN 
OROGRAPHIC PRECIP WHICH WILL BEGIN AS -SHRA ESPECIALLY ON THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND WILL QUICKLY CHANGE TO -SHSN ACROSS THE MAIN 
UPSLOPE REGIONS INCLUDING PLATEAU...MUCH OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL MOUNTAINS BORDERING NORTH CAROLINA AS 
THICKNESSES DESCEND INTO FROZEN PRECIP CATEGORY. PRECIPITABLE WATER 
RATHER LIMITED IN THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE REGIME AND THEREFORE 
SNOWFALL ACCUMULATION WILL BE LIGHT. USED A DUSTING TO ONE HALF INCH 
ON THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND ONE HALF TO TWO INCHES ACROSS 
TERRAIN AREAS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA MAINLY LEE/WISE/RUSSELL COUNTIES 
AND HIGHER TERRAIN (MOUNTAIN ZONES) IN JOHNSON/CARTER/UNICOI/GREENE 
COUNTIES. EVENT FADES AWAY TOWARD DAYBREAK AS MODELS BRING DRIER AIR 
INTO THE REGION. FRIDAY IS AN IN BETWEEN KIND OF DAY AS FAST UPPER 
LEVEL FLOW BRINGS YET ANOTHER S/WV AND ASSOCIATED CHANCE FOR MORE 
PRECIP AGAIN ON SATURDAY. STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE BLEND CONCERNING 
TEMPS THROUGH SHORT TERM.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
AS THE LOW AND MIDLEVEL RIDGE SHIFTS EAST ACROSS THE AREA...A 
SOUTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS ALOFT...BRINGING WARM ADVECTION AND 
ISENTROPIC LIFT EARLY SATURDAY MORNING. GFS AND NAM HAVE SOME SLIGHT 
TIMING DIFFERENCES REGARDING THE ONSET OF PRECIP. THIS MAKES ALL THE 
DIFFERENCE IN REGARDS TO WHAT TYPE OF PRECIP FALLS SATURDAY MORNING. 
WILL LEAN TOWARD THE SLOWER GFS AS THERE WILL BE SOME PRETTY DRY AIR 
IN THE LOW LEVELS TO OVERCOME BEFORE PRECIP REACHES THE GROUND...AND 
WILL BEGIN POPS AROUND 12Z. HOWEVER TEMPS IN SW VA AND NE TN WILL 
STILL BE NEAR OR FREEZING AT THAT TIME...AND WITH AN 850 MB WARM 
NOSE ENCROACHING FROM THE SW...WILL HAVE A QUICK TRANSITION FROM 
SNOW/SLEET TO RAIN. STRONG ISENTROPIC LIFT AND POSITIVE 
MOISTURE/TEMPERATURE ADVECTION CONTINUE THROUGH SATURDAY...WITH THE 
850 MB CONVERGENCE ZONE OVERHEAD SATURDAY NIGHT. WILL RAISE POPS TO 
CATEGORICAL AT THIS TIME. THE APPROACH OF A SHORTWAVE TROUGH WILL 
KEEP LIKELY POPS THROUGH SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. DRIER AIR IN THE 
MIDLEVELS BUILDS IN ON MONDAY...HOWEVER LOW LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINS 
AND WITH COLD ADVECTION AND UPSLOPE FLOW...THERE COULD BE A LITTLE 
SNOW TO END THE PRECIP. FOR NOW WILL HAVE JUST RAIN AS SUCH DETAILS 
ARE SKETCHY AT DAY 5. REMAINDER OF FORECAST WILL REMAIN AS IS. 

&&

208 PM EST WED NOV 30 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...FAST WESTERLY FLOW WILL
CONTINUE THROUGH THE SHORT-TERM. RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY TODAY WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA FOR THURSDAY ALLOWING A FAST MOVING
SHORT-WAVE...CURRENTLY OVER THE HIGH PLAINS...TO MOVE INTO THE OHIO 
VALLEY. MOST OF THE DYNAMIC FORCING WILL BE NORTH OF THE FORECAST 
AREA AND MOISTURE IS OVERALL LIMITED...SO PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS WILL BE
LIGHT AND GENERALLY NORTHERN SECTIONS.  

FOR THURSDAY...MODELS SHOW AREAS OF MID AND HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS MOVING
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. FROPA IS EXPECTED DURING THE AFTERNOON 
HOURS.  BOTH THE NAM AND GFS SHOW WRAP-AROUND BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE
MOVING INTO THE REGION...ESPECIALLY NORTHERN THIRD...DURING THE EVENING
HOURS AND OVERNIGHT THURSDAY. EVEN BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE COMBINED 
WITH UPSLOPE FLOW TO PRODUCE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS. PRECIPITATION WILL
START AS RAIN...THEN CHANGE OVER TO SNOW. NO SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
ANTICIPATED.


.LONG TERM...(FRI THROUGH WED)...MODELS AGREE IN SHOWING SIGNIFICANT 
PRECIPITATION PRODUCER FOR THE WEEKEND...BUT DIFFER IN THE DETAILS.  
NAM A BIT FURTHER SOUTH WITH THE SURFACE LOW THAN THE GFS...AGREE 
WITH HPC THAT A BLEND LOOKS BEST FOR NOW.  AFTER A DRY DAY 
FRI...MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE FRIDAY NIGHT AS WARMER AIR 
SURGES NORTH.  LOOKS LIKE LOWER LEVELS MAY BE TOO DRY FOR ANY 
PRECIP FRI NIGHT...SO JUST INCREASING CLOUDS.  LOOKS LIKE MAINLY A 
RAIN EVENT FOR SAT INTO SUNDAY...ALTHOUGH CAN NOT RULE OUT A BIT OF 
FROZEN/FREEZING PRECIP EARLY SAT DEPENDING ON HOW FAST PRECIP MOVES 
IN...MAINLY NORTH. LOW CONFIDENCE FURTHER OUT...AS POOR CONSISTENCY 
AND AGREEMENT IN MODELS.  GENERALLY WENT WITH HPC IDEA OF HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING IN MONDAY AND CONTROLLING OUR WEATHER 
TUESDAY...THEN A MOISTURE STARVED COLD FRONT POSSIBLY AFFECTING THE 
AREA ON WED.

.DISCUSSION...
SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE LOWER AND 
MID-MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.  THE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE EAST
TODAY PRODUCING LIGHT WINDS AND PLENTY OF SUNSHINE.  SATELLITE DOES
SHOW SOME COLD AIR ADVECTION STRATU-CU OVER THE FAR NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS
AND EAST KENTUCKY.  HOWEVER...AS COLD AIR ADVECTION DIMINISHES TODAY
AS RIDGE BUILDS IN...LOW CLOUDS WILL DISSIPATE...SO MOSTLY SUNNY
FORECAST LOOKS GOOD.

PLENTY OF SUNSHINE AND DRY AIRMASS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM
SOME THIS AFTERNOON...PER GOING FORECASTS. DO NOT PLAN ANY CHANGES
TO GOING FORECAST.

ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE IS MOVING ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES THIS MORNING.
THE WAVE WILL MOVE EAST TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY TONIGHT AND THURSDAY.
MOST OF THE ENERGY AND MOISTURE WILL REMAIN NORTH OF THE FORECAST 
AREA...HOWEVER...NAM/GFS BOTH SHOW SOME BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE MOVING
INTO THE REGION AFTER FROPA THURSDAY EVENING...MAINLY FOR SOUTHWEST
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSSEE MOUNTAINS. SOME UPSLOPE 
PRECIPITATION ANTICIPATED THURSDAY EVENING AND NIGHT...PER GOING 
FORECAST.

HAVE A GREAT DAY.

.SHORT TERM...
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE BUILDING OVER THE AREA TODAY. SOME

MORNING AS DRY AIR ADVECTION ENSUES. A SHORTWAVE TROUGH NOW CROSSING

CROSS THE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF THE AREA ON THURSDAY. THOUGH THE 
VORTICITY AND UPPER JET STREAK ARE RELATIVELY STRONG...MOISTURE IS 
VERY LIMITED. HOWEVER BEHIND THE TROUGH AN UPSLOPE NORTHWEST FLOW 
DEVELOPS...AND MODELS SHOW NEAR SATURATION AT 800 MB AND LOWER. 
THUS WILL CONTINUE SLIGHT CHANCE OF SNOW IN SW VA AND THE TN MTNS 
FOR THURSDAY NIGHT. DRIER AIR ALOFT MIXES DOWN ON FRIDAY.

TEMPERATURES WILL BE CLOSE TO MOS GUIDANCE...THOUGH WILL LEAN TOWARD 
THE COOLER NUMBERS TONIGHT WITH GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING POTENTIAL.  

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
ISENTROPIC LIFT AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ADVECTION INCREASE RAPIDLY 
LATE FRIDAY NIGHT. IF THE PRECIP BEGINS EARLY ENOUGH...IT COULD 
START AS SNOW IN THE NORTHERN SECTIONS BEFORE CHANGING TO RAIN. 
HOWEVER AT THIS TIME WILL KEEP FORECAST AS ALL RAIN WITH THE BULK OF 
THE PRECIP OCCURRING AFTER 12Z. UPPER DYNAMICS INCREASE WITH THE 
APPROACH OF THE JET ON SATURDAY NIGHT. SURFACE COLD FRONTAL 
PASSAGE APPEARS TO OCCUR ON SUNDAY...BUT THE UPPER TROUGH LAGS THE 
SURFACE FRONT...SO CHANCE POPS LINGER INTO MONDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 291954
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EST TUE NOV 29 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...HAND ANALYSIS SHOWS COLD 
FRONT EXTENDING FROM DEEP SOUTH MS-AL LINE ACROSS NORTHEAST 
AL...EAST TN...SOUTHEAST KY...INTO CENTRAL OH AT AROUND 1 PM. THE 
ONLY REAL CHANGE IN CONDITIONS IS THE COLDER AIR BEHIND THE 
BOUNDARY...NO REAL PRESSURE CHANGES OCCUR UNTIL WAY BACK NEAR THE MS 
RIVER WHERE A WEAK SURFACE TROF EXISTS. CLOUDS RAPIDLY DIMINISHING 
IN DRIER, MORE STABLE AIR OVER TN VALLEY.

EXPECTED A LITTLE MORE WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE IN CENTRAL MOUNTAINS 
WHICH NEVER ATERIALIZED. NORTHEAST TN MTNS HAVE SOME RESIDUAL 
CLOUDINESS. HAVE KEPT PARTLY CLOUDY OVERNIGHT AS AFOREMENTIONED 
SURFACE TROF PROGRESSES TOWARD AREA AND PROVIDES A LITTLE LIFT.  
EXPECT WHAT MOISTURE THERE IS TO MOVE OUT OVERNIGHT AND WEDNESDAY TO 
BE MOSTLY SUNNY AND DRY. HAVE TWEAKED UP MIN/MAX A DEGREE OR TWO 
WITH WINDS STAYING UP SOME OVERNIGHT AND PLENTY OF SUN WEDNESDAY.  

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL GIVE WAY TO A FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVE IN STRONG 
WEST-NORTWEST FLOW ALOFT.  DUE TO LIMITED MOISTURE RETURN AND 
FAST NATURE OF SYSTEM...PRECIPITATION WILL ALSO BE LIMITED AND
MAINLY BEHIND THE FRONT. WILL INCLUDE A CHANCE OF RAIN/SNOW SHOWERS
FOR MAINLY NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS THURSDAY EVENING AND NIGHT.

FOR FRIDAY...UPPER FLOW BECOMES ZONAL WITH SURFACE RIDGING. MODELS
DIFFER IN REGARD TO NEXT SYSTEM DIGGING INTO THE EASTERN HALF OF
THE NATION.  THE GFS SEEMS TOO AGRESSIVE WITH NEXT SYSTEM. AS NEXT SYSTEM
DIGS INTO THE SOUTHERN PLAINS...ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL INCREASE OVER THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY BY SATURDAY PRODUCING A CHANCE OF RAIN. SYSTEM WILL
MOVE EAST ACROSS THE REGION SUNDAY CONTINUING CHANCES OF RAIN. ENOUGH
COLD AIR WILL PULL INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY MORNING
THAT THE PRECIPITATION COULD CHANGE OVER TO SNOW OVER THE NORTHERN
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...ESPECIALLY HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

CONFIDENCE OF EXTENDED FORECAST...ESPECIALLY FROM SATURDAY THROUGH 
MONDAY...IS LOW GIVEN DIFFERENCES IN MODELS AND SPREAD OF ENSEMBLE 
MEMBERS.

FXUS64 KMRX 290823
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
323 AM EST TUE NOV 29 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
COLD FRONT IS SLOWLY MOVING EAST ACROSS THE CWA...WITH LIGHT TO 
MODERATE RAIN SHOWERS AHEAD OF IT AND NO LIGHTNING STRIKES OBSERVED. 
SURFACE WINDS HAVE ALSO DROPPED OFF ESPECIALLY IN THE VALLEY...AND 
THE WIND ADVISORY WILL BE CANCELLED WITH THE NEW FORECAST ISSUANCE. 
TIMING OF THE FRONT TAKES IT OUT OF THE AREA BY LATE MORNING. 
HOWEVER A CHANCE WILL BE MAINTAINED INTO THE AFTERNOON IN NE 
SECTIONS AS MOUNTAINS MAY SLOW FRONTAL PROGRESSION FURTHER. SKIES 
SHOULD BEGIN TO CLEAR THIS EVENING EXCEPT IN SW VA AND THE TN MTNS 
AS MODELS SHOW SOME 850 MB MOISTURE WRAPPING AROUND THE CLOSED LOW 
ALONG WITH AN UPSLOPE COMPONENT.   

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...
A FAST-MOVING SHORTWAVE TROUGH CROSSES THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA 
ON THURSDAY. THE GFS HAS STRONG PVA OVER SW VA WITH A NEGATIVE TILT 
TO THE TROUGH. THE ETA HAS A MUCH WEAKER VORT THAT IS FARTHER NORTH 
THAN THE GFS. MOISTURE IS LIMITED IN BOTH MODELS. GIVEN THESE 
DISPARITIES AND LIMITED MOISTURE WILL NOT ADD ANY PRECIP MENTION AT 
THIS TIME. THE FLOW ALOFT DEVELOPS INTO A MODIFIED SPLIT FLOW 
PATTERN...WITH THE CONVERGENCE OF THE NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAMS 
IN OUR VICINITY. ISENTROPIC LIFT AND MOISTURE ADVECTION WILL BRING A 
CHANCE OF RAIN ON SATURDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. SHORTWAVE TROUGH CROSSES 
IN THE GFS ON SUNDAY NIGHT...AND WILL INCREASE POPS TO A CHANCE AT 
THAT TIME.

FXUS64 KMRX 282000
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST MON NOV 28 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL BE MOVING 
THROUGH THE REGION OVERNIGHT WITH LIMITED UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT...LOW 
CAPE VALUES AND NEAR ZERO LIFTED INDICES.  THE ONLY BIG SUPPORTER OF 
SEVERE WEATHER IS VERY HIGH HELICITY VALUES WITH THE SPECIAL MID DAY 
SOUNDING RUN FROM NASHVILLE INDICATING OVER 1000 0-3 KM SHEAR.  IF 
ANY THUNDERSTORMS DO DEVELOP...THIS COULD LEAD TO ISOLATED SEVERE 
WEATHER WITH A FEW ISOLATED TORNADOES PARTICULARLY IN THE SOUTHERN 
VALLEY AREA.  THE OTHER THREAT FOR TONIGHT CONTINUES TO BE THE HIGH 
WINDS ALOFT BEING TRANSPORTED TO THE SURFACE BY THESE SHOWERS...AND 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  EARLIER TODAY CROSSVILLE REPORTED WIND GUSTS 
TO 35 MPH AND NASHVILLE 42 MPH.

SOME MINOR MODEL DIFFERENCES AND GENERALLY LEANED ON THE NAM FOR 
GUIDANCE. 

.LONG TERM... (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...CLEARING AND DRYING 
EXPECTED BEHIND THE EXITING COLD FRONT TUESDAY NIGHT AND WE WILL BE 
BETWEEN SYSTEMS INTO WEDNESDAY.  AN UPPER LOW WILL TRACK EASTWARD 
ACROSS KY ON THURSDAY...KEEPING MAIN ENERGY TO OUR NORTH.  MAY SEE 
SOME INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER AS IT PASSES THROUGH.  THE NEXT SYSTEM 
ON CONCERN WILL REACHING INTO THE AREA FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.  MODELS 
IN POOR AGREEMENT WITH THIS SYSTEM...BUT CURRENT PROJECTIONS SHOW IT 
TO BE RATHER UNORGANIZED AND WILL KEEP POPS GENERALLY IN THE 20 TO 
30 PERCENT RANGE AS IT MOVES THROUGH.  THE SYSTEM WILL EXIT THE 
REGION WITH A RETURN TO DRY CONDITIONS BY MONDAY.  GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
LOOK GOOD AND WILLS STAY CLOSE.

&&

TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              52  57  31  49 /  90  70  10   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
444 AM EST MON NOV 28 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...COLD FRONT STRETCHING 
ACROSS CENTRAL MO AND AR...WITH SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MOVING 
INTO WESTERN KY AND TN AHEAD OF IT.  RADAR ALSO SHOWING SOME LIGHT 
SHOWERS MOVING UP FROM GA...MOST OF THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD DISSIPATE 
WHEN IT GETS INTO OUR AREA FROM THE DOWNSLOPING.  BETTER CHANCES 
SHOULD WAIT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON.   MODELS FAIRLY SIMILAR ON 
BRINGING FRONT INTO AREA BY LATE AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING.  WILL KEEP 
LIKELY POPS FOR THE OUR WESTERN COUNTIES...AND CHANCE ELSEWHERE.  
BEST POPS SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL TONIGHT WITH FROPA.  WINDS WILL ALSO 
INCREASE TODAY AND TONIGHT AS GRADIENT INCREASES WITH THE FRONT.  
MODELS SHOWING 50-55KT JET AT 850 MB.  SHOULD BE BELOW WIND ADVISORY 
CRITERIA...BUT IT SHOULD BE BREEZY ACROSS THE AREA TODAY AND 
TONIGHT.  WITH THE LOW LEVEL SHEAR AND THE INSTABILITY EXPECTED... 
COULD SEE STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING.  
UPPER TROUGH MOVING THROUGH ON TUESDAY...WILL KEEP CHANCE TO LIKELY 
POPS FOR TUESDAY...WITH BEST POPS IN THE THE MORNING HOURS.  DRY 
WEATHER RETURNS TUESDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BRINGING DRY 
WEATHER ON WEDNESDAY.  GFS INDICATING A COLD FRONT ENTERING AREA 
THURSDAY...BUT SHOULD BE DRY.  SHORTWAVE TRACKS THROUGH THURSDAY 
NIGHT...WILL CONTINUE LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SNOW SHOWERS THURSDAY 
NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING ACROSS THE SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS.  
DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY.  GFS ADVERTISING A 
DISTURBANCE MOVING IN FROM THE WEST SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...WITH 
LIMITED MOISTURE...WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST.


000 
FXUS64 KMRX 271947
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EST SUN NOV 27 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...A WARM FRONT IS LIFTING NORTH 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND 
TEMPERATURES HAVE RESPONDED BY CLIMBING INTO THE 60S ACROSS MANY 
VALLEY LOCATIONS. A WEAK WAVE RIDING ALONG THE FRONT IS EXITING THE 
AREA AND ASSOCIATED ISOLATED PRECIP IS LIFTING OUT AS WELL. A FEW 
ISOLATED SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT WITH VERY WEAK RESIDUAL 
LIFT AND A MOISTENING AIR MASS. WITH THE INCREASE IN HEIGHTS AND 
850MB TEMPS...OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL BE WARM AS WELL. LATE MONDAY...A 
COLD FRONT WILL BE APPROACHING THE AREA. IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT... 
A WEAKLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL PUSH IN. THE AIR MASS WILL HAVE LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE AND GOOD VERTICAL SHEAR. AS A RESULT...SCATTERED 
SHOWERS AND EVEN A FEW THUNDERSTORMS MAY REACH INTO THE AREA BY LATE 
AFTERNOON. WITH THE VERTICAL WIND FIELD...A STRAY SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A STRONG 500 MB TROUGH 
WILL COMBINE WITH FAVORABLE JET DYNAMICS (RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF A 
250 MB JET STREAK) TO SUSTAIN A LARGE AREA OF CONVECTION ALONG AND 
AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT...AS IT MOVES EAST ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY 
MONDAY NIGHT. SHORT-TERM MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH MOVING 
THE COLD FRONT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE EVENING HOURS... 
AND WILL RAISE POPS INTO THE CATEGORICAL RANGE. A STRONG LOW-LEVEL 
850 MB JET (IN EXCESS OF 50 KTS) IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP ALONG THE 
FRONT...ALONG WITH LARGE 0-1 KM HELICITY VALUES. HOWEVER...AS IS SO 
OFTEN THE CASE DURING THE FALL AND WINTER MONTHS...THE AMOUNT OF 
INSTABILITY WILL BE IN QUESTION AND WILL LIKELY BE ONLY MARGINAL 
ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. LIFTED INDICES ARE PROGGED BY BOTH 
THE GFS AND NAM MODELS TO BECOME SLIGHTLY NEGATIVE AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT...SO WILL CONTINUE A MENTION OF TSTORMS MONDAY NIGHT. WITH A 
STRONG LOW-LEVEL JET EXPECTED...THINK THAT SOME TSTORMS ACROSS 
MAINLY SOUTHWEST PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA COULD BECOME SEVERE 
WITH DAMAGING WINDS. WILL CONTINUE A MENTION OF POST-FRONTAL SHOWERS 
ON TUESDAY MORNING...WITH RAIN GRADUALLY ENDING TUESDAY AFTERNOON. 

HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD THEN BUILD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...BRINGING DRY AND TRANQUIL WEATHER. ANOTHER 
WEAK COLD FRONT WILL QUICKLY APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY 
NIGHT INTO FRIDAY MORNING...BUT MOST OF THE UPPER DYNAMICS AND 
MOISTURE SHOULD REMAIN NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION. GFS MODEL CANT SEEM TO MAKE UP ITS MIND WITH HOW MUCH 
MOISTURE WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR PRECIP...BUT WILL GO AHEAD AND 
MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR UPSLOPE-INDUCED SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN NOW ALSO 
REVEALS A DIFFERENT SCENARIO FOR THE WEEKEND...WITH A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. HOWEVER...WILL KEEP THE 
FORECAST DRY FOR NOW SINCE THIS IS THE FIRST INDICATIONS OF THIS 
SCENARIO...AND THE EXTENDED MODELS HAVE BEEN INCONSISTENT OF LATE.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             52  65  49  56 /  30  70  90  50 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  49  67  50  55 /  30  70  90  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       50  67  50  55 /  30  70  90  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              45  65  51  57 /  30  50  90  70 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE EXITING THE AREA

GUIDANCE AS WELL. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A LINE OF STRONG 
CONVECTION IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY 
SUNDAY NIGHT...AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH A DEEPENING 
SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. STRONG 
SOUTHERLY FLOW AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM SHOULD PUSH A WARM FRONT THROUGH 
THE FORECAST AREA BY SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH A ONLY FEW SHOWERS EXPECTED 
AS A DRY SLOT DEVELOPS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY AHEAD OF THE COLD 
FRONT. WITH STRONG DOWNSLOPING SOUTHERLY WINDS EXPECTED ON MONDAY... 
WILL PLAN TO RAISE MAXES ABOVE GUIDANCE VALUES ACROSS THE CENTRAL 
AND NORTHERN VALLEY. A STRONG 500 MB TROUGH SHOULD COMBINE WITH 
FAVORABLE JET DYNAMICS (RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF A 250 MB JET 
STREAK) TO SUSTAIN A LARGE AREA OF CONVECTION ALONG AND AHEAD OF THE 
COLD FRONT AS IT MOVES EAST ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. MODELS ARE 
IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH A SLOWER EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF THIS 
FRONT...AND WILL ADJUST THE FORECAST ACCORDINGLY. RIGHT NOW...IT 
APPEARS THAT THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
DURING THE EVENING HOURS ON MONDAY. LIFTED INDICES ARE PROGGED TO 
BECOME SLIGHTLY NEGATIVE AHEAD OF THE FRONT MONDAY NIGHT...SO WILL 
CONTINUE A MENTION OF TSTORMS BEGINNING MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH 
MONDAY NIGHT. GFS MODEL INDICATES A SECONDARY SURFACE WAVE 
DEVELOPING ALONG THE FRONT OVER THE CAROLINAS ON TUESDAY...WHICH 
COULD CREATE SOME POST-FRONTAL SHOWERS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 
HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD THEN BUILD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...BRINGING DRY AND TRANQUIL WEATHER. IT 
APPEARS ANOTHER WEAK COLD FRONT WILL QUICKLY APPROACH THE FORECAST 
AREA ON THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...BUT UPPER DYNAMICS REMAIN ACROSS 
THE GREAT LAKES REGION WITH LIMITED MOISTURE. THUS...WILL NOT 
MENTION ANY PRECIP AT THIS TIME WITH THE FRONT. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             43  61  55  68 /  20  40  40  60

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...A STRONG UPPER TROUGH 
OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL DEVELOP A STRONG SURFACE LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM OVER THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY ON SUNDAY. STRONG SOUTHERLY

WILL KEEP ONLY A SMALL CHANCE POP. WITH DOWNSLOPE SOUTHERLY WINDS 
EXPECTED ON SUNDAY...WILL PLAN TO RAISE MAXES ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND 
NORTHERN VALLEY AREAS. THIS WARM FRONT SHOULD MOVE NORTH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA BY SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH A DRY SLOT EXPECTED OVER THE 
REGION AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY. A 
STRONG 500 MB TROUGH SHOULD COMBINE WITH FAVORABLE JET DYNAMICS 
(RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF A 250 MB JET STREAK) TO PRODUCE A LARGE

EAST ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. IN ADDITION...LIFTED INDICES ARE 
PROGGED TO BECOME NEGATIVE AHEAD OF THE FRONT ON MONDAY...SO THINK 
THERE WILL BE A GOOD CHANCE FOR TSTORMS ALONG THE FRONT. HIGH 
PRESSURE SHOULD THEN BUILD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BY TUESDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH THURSDAY...BRINGING DRY AND TRANQUIL WEATHER. RIGHT NOW...IT 
APPEARS ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL QUICKLY MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
BY THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...BUT MOISTURE APPEARS LIMITED AT THIS 
TIME. THUS...WILL MENTION ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS WITH THIS 
FRONT.

300 PM EST THU NOV 24 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...LOCALLY BREEZY CONDITIONS OVER 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION WILL SLOWLY DIMINISH DURING THE 
EVENING HOURS AS A WEAK COLD FRONT CONTINUES TO EXIT THE AREA. 
THEREFORE...WILL ALLOW THE WIND ADVISORY TO EXPIRE. OTHERWISE...COOL 
AND DRY AIR IS FILTERING INTO THE MRX CWA...ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO 
DROP INTO THE TEENS AND 20S OVERNIGHT. ON FRIDAY...THE UPPER TROUGH 
REMAINS POSITIONED OVER THE AREA WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING 
IN.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE 
EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY...WITH A MODERATING TEMP TREND 
DEVELOPING THIS WEEKEND AS WINDS BECOME SOUTHERLY. EXTENDED MODELS 
AGREE WITH AN OVERALL LONG-WAVE PATTERN CHANGE FOR NEXT WEEK...BUT 
DIFFER ON THE SMALLER-SCALE DETAILS. THUS...WILL TREND THE EXTENDED 
FORECAST TOWARDS THE ENSEMBLE MEANS...WHICH INDICATES ABOVE-NORMAL 
TEMPS DEVELOPING NEXT WEEK. AN UPPER TROUGH OVER THE WEST IS PROGGED 
TO DEVELOP A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE PLAINS BY SUNDAY. A 
FEW SHOWERS SHOULD DEVELOP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BY LATE SATURDAY 
NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...AS ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASES AHEAD OF A WARM 
FRONT OVER THE DEEP SOUTH. THIS WARM FRONT SHOULD MOVE NORTH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA BY SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH ONLY A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS 
EXPECTED AS DRY SLOTTING DEVELOPS OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY AHEAD OF 
THE COLD FRONT OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY. MOST OF THE STRONGER 
UPPER DYNAMICS WITH THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ARE EXPECTED TO MOVE 
NORTH TOWARDS THE GREAT LAKES REGION ON MONDAY...WHICH SHOULD SLOW 
THE EASTWARD PROGRESS OF THE COLD FRONT ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. 
LATEST GFS MODEL RUN INDICATES THAT THIS FRONT WILL STALL-OUT AROUND 
THE FORECAST AREA BY MONDAY NIGHT...WITH ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH 
QUICKLY DEVELOPING OVER THE PLAINS ON TUESDAY. THIS UPPER TROUGH 
SHOULD PUSH THE COLD FRONT THOUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY TUESDAY 
NIGHT...BUT WILL CONTINUE WITH SOME LOW CHANCE POPS THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY TO ACCOUNT FOR MODEL INCONSISTENCIES. LIFTED INDICES ARE 
PROGGED TO BECOME NEGATIVE AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT ON MONDAY AND 
TUESDAY...SO WILL MENTION TSTORMS BOTH DAYS UNTIL FRONTAL PASSAGE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
347 AM EST THU NOV 24 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...PERIOD WILL BE CHARACTERIZED BY 
SLOW DEAMPLIFICATION OF UPPER LONG WAVE TROUGH THAT HAS PERSISTED 
OVER THE EASTERN CONUS FOR THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS. SURFACE COLD FRONT 
PROJECTED TO PASS THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY MID-MORNING 
PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. NOT EXPECTING ANY SIGNIFICANT 
PRECIP WITH THIS FEATURE AS MOISTURE IS CONFINED TO LOWEST LAYER. 
CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SOUTHWESTERN 
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE HOWEVER. FRONT WILL ISSUE IN COLDER 
AIR WITH TEMPS EXPECTED TO SLOWLY FALL THROUGH THE AFTERNOON. 
REASONABLY GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS SHOULD ALLOW TEMPS TO
DROP DRAMATICALLY IN THE SECOND PERIOD. GENERALLY FOLLOWED BLEND 
OF GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGH THE SHORT TERM.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MANY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS
MADE TO FALL IN LINE WITH LATEST MOS AND NEIGHBORING GRIDS FOR
NEARLY EVERY DAY.  ALTHOUGH GENERALLY PATTERN CHANGES SEEMED
SIMILAR TO PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS...WITH A BRIEF PERIOD OF SURFACE AND
UPPER RIDGING FOR FRIDAY INTO SUNDAY.  THEN UPPER PATTERN EVOLVES
BACK TO TROUGHING TO OUR WEST...BUT NOT ENOUGH AGREEMENT ON
STRENGTH AND TIMING OF SRN STREAM SHORTWAVES TO MAKE MANY DETAILED
CHANGES TO PREVIOUS FORECAST FOR SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MID NEXT WEEK.

FAVORED THE NAM FOR THE WEEKEND INTO MONDAY...AS GFS MODEL SEEEMED
A BIT TOO AGRESSIVE IN DEVELOPING PCPN AND TAKING IT SO FAR EAST.
DID INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SRN MOST AREAS LATE SATURDAY
NIGHT TO BE WITHIN TOLERANCE OF HIGH RAIN CHANCES TO OUR SOUTH.

TEMPS LOOK TO REBOUND WELL ABOVE CLIMO ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY...BEFORE
COOLING SLIGHTLY WEDNESDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 232010
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST WED NOV 23 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...A FAST MOVING SHORT WAVE WILL 
SWING THROUGH THE REGION TONIGHT. LIMITED MOISTURE WILL ALSO LIMIT 
PRECIPITATION. PRECIPITATION WILL LIKELY BEGIN AS LIGHT SNOW... 
PARTICULARLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...THEN SWITCH OVER TO ALL RAIN 
BEFORE ENDING. STRONG GUSTY WINDS TONIGHT INTO TOMORROW IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS WILL NECESSITATE A WIND ADVISORY ALONG THE NORTH 
CAROLINA BORDER. SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE LIMITED TO GENERALLY 
LESS THAN AN INCH IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...SO NO ADVISORY OR 
WARNINGS WILL BE ISSUED. TENDED TOWARDS THE NAM FOR GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
BUILD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY...BRINGING 
UNSEASONABLY COLD TEMPS BY FRIDAY MORNING (SOME FIFTEEN TO TWENTY 
DEGREES BELOW NORMAL). A MODERATING TREND WILL QUICKLY DEVELOP ON 
SATURDAY...AS SOUTHERLY WINDS DEVELOP ON THE BACK SIDE OF THIS HIGH. 
EXTENDED MODELS ARE COMING INTO BETTER AGREEMENT WITH AN OVERALL 
PATTERN CHANGE FOR NEXT WEEK...BY DEVELOPING AN UPPER RIDGE OVER THE 
EAST AND A STRONG UPPER TROUGH OVER THE WEST. IN RESPONSE TO THIS 
UPPER TROUGH...A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS BY SUNDAY. SCATTERED SHOWERS SHOULD 
DEVELOP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM...AS 
ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASES AHEAD OF A WARM FRONT OVER THE DEEP SOUTH. 
THIS WARM FRONT SHOULD MOVE NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA BY SUNDAY 
NIGHT...BRINGING A BRIEF BREAK IN THE SHOWER ACTIVITY. THE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE PLAINS IS PROGGED TO MOVE NORTH TOWARDS THE 
GREAT LAKES REGION ON MONDAY...WITH ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT MOVING 
ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. GFS MODEL INDICATES SOME STRONG DYNAMICS 
WITH THIS FRONT ON MONDAY...AS A NEGATIVELY-TILTED UPPER TROUGH DIGS 
OVER THE MS RIVER VALLEY. IN ADDITION...LIFTED INDICES ARE PROGGED 
TO BECOME NEGATIVE AHEAD OF THE FRONT...SO WILL MENTION TSTORMS ON 
MONDAY INTO MONDAY NIGHT. GFS MODEL INDICATES A PROGRESSIVE PATTERN 
FOR NEXT WEEK...AS ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM QUICKLY DEVELOPS OVER 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND BRINGS ANOTHER CHANCE FOR SHOWERS ON 
WEDNESDAY.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1031 AM EST WED NOV 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SATELLITE SHOWS A FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVE MOVING SOUTHEAST FROM THE OHIO
VALLEY TOWARD THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. FAIRLY DECENT DYNAMICS WILL QUICKLY
MOVE ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON
AND EVENING. INITIALLY AIRMASS IS QUITE DRY WITH DEWPOINT IN THE
TEENS OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. THE INITIAL DRY SOUNDING WILL MOIST UP
GIVING WAY TO DECENT EVAPORATIVE COOLING. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW BOUNDARY
COOLING ALLOWING INITIAL PRECIP TYPE BEING MAINLY SNOW FOR
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS WITH RAIN/SNOW
MIXTURE FOR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE VALLEY (TRI AREA). 

GROUND TEMPERATURE REMAINS FAIRLY WARM...SO ONLY EXPECT THE HIGHER TERRAIN
TO HAVE A CHANCE OF SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS BEFORE BOUNDARY WARMS
ENOUGH TO CHANGE TO A MIXTURE. WILL INCLUDE SNOW ACCUMUATIONS OF UP
TO 1 INCH FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS. FOR AREAS FROM MORRISTOWN SOUTHWARD...ONLY
EXPECT MAINLY SPRINKLES FOR THIS AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING WITH DRY CONDITIONS
SOUTH OF TYS.

BESIDES THE PRECIPITATION...WINDS WILL INCREASE OUT OF THE WEST-SOUTHWEST
TODAY APPROACHING WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA. WILL KEEP WINDS BETWEEN
THE 15 AND 30 MPH RANGE FOR NOW.

MADE MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO TEMPERATURES.  HAVE A GOOD DAY...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
323 AM EST WED NOV 23 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MAIN FORECAST CONCERNS REVOLVE 
AROUND NORTH TO SOUTH POP GRADIENT ASSOCIATED WITH CLIPPER SYSTEM 
TRANSLATING THROUGH THE NORTHWEST FLOW OF THE LONGWAVE TROUGH...AND 
PRECIP TYPE. MODELS AND SHORT RANGE ENSEMBLES ARE IN REASONABLY GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE EVOLUTION OF THE CLIPPER SHORTWAVE. APPEARS THAT 
THIS SYSTEM WILL MAINLY AFFECT THE NORTHERN HALF OF OUR FORECAST 
AREA. ALSO APPEARS THAT THE EFFECTS WILL BE CENTERED AROUND 00Z 
THURSDAY. MODEL SOUNDINGS AND TIME HEIGHT TEMPERATURE PROFILES 
INDICATE GOOD WARM ADVECTION IN THE LOW AND MID LEVELS. ANTICIPATE 
THIS TO BE MAINLY A RAIN EVENT WITH ONLY THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS 
RECEIVING ANY SNOW. DID NOT MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO PREVIOUS 
TEMPS AS THEY AGREE QUITE WELL WITH LATEST MODEL GUIDANCE BLEND.


.LONG TERM...(THANKSGIVING DAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...LINGERING EFFECTS
OF CLIPPER SYSTEM LAST INTO THANKSGIVING DAY AND EVENING...BUT
DONT EXPECT ANY SIGNIFICANT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS.  GENERALLY RAN LOW
CHANCE POPS SW VA/NE TN DOWN TO NO POPS FOR SE TN.  PCPN TYPE IS A
MIX OR MAINLY SNOW HIGHER ELEVATIONS IN THE MORNING...THEN MAINLY
SNOW SHOWERS AFTERNOON HOURS WHERE ANY LIGHT PCPN LINGERS. 

ONE SIGNIFICANT CHANGE FOR THANKSGIVING DAY WAS THE MODERATE TO
STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION ADVERTISED BY BOTH NAM AND GFS...MUCH TOO
COLD FOR MAX TEMPS ANYWHERE NEAR THE GFS MOS VALUES (ACTUALLY NEAR
CLIMO). I GENERALLY LOWERED MAX TEMP GRID DOWN BY 4 TO 8 DEGREES IN
LINE WITH THE COLDER NGM/NAM MOS HIGHS...WHICH MESHED NICELY WITH
NEIGHBORHOOD GRIDS. ALSO...LOWERED MIN TEMPS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND
BROUGHT IN SOME MUCH DRIER/LOWER DEWPOINTS INTO LATE FRIDAY.  

RIDGING LOOKS TO PROVIDE DRY WEATHER AND MODERATING TEMPS INTO THE
WEEKEND.  NEXT SYSTEM OF CONCERN IS THE UPPER LOW PRESSURE AREA
THAT DEVELOPS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ON MONDAY.  THE OPERATIONAL
MODELS AND ENSEMBLE MEMBERS SHOW MUCH VARIANCE WITH THIS SYSTEM ON
TRACK AND TIMING...SO DID NOT TRY TO FINE TUNE ANY POP GRIDS EARLY
NEXT WEEK.  DOES NOT LOOK UNSTABLE ENOUGH FOR THUNDERSTORMS YET ON
MONDAY NIGHT OR TUESDAY...BUT DID GO WITH SHOWERS AS TYPE OF PCPN.

ENOUGH FOR SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST TENNESSEE 
AND THE MOUNTAINS.  SYSTEM MOVING FAIRLY QUICKLY...SO NOT EXPECTING

THROUGH SUNDAY.  A WARM FRONT MOVES INTO THE REGION ON SUNDAY...WILL 
HOLD OFF POPS UNTIL SUNDAY NIGHT WHEN BETTER MOISTURE IS EXPECTED.  
MAY ALSO SEE A MIX OF SNOW AND RAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST 
TN AND THE SMOKIES ON SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY MORNING.  BUT GETTING 
SOME WARM AIR ADVECTION ON MONDAY...SO SNOW SHOULD CHANGE TO RAIN BY 
AFTERNOON.  WILL CONTINUE CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY AS 
SURFACE AND UPPER LOW APPROACHES. SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL RAIN 
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.  STAYED CLOSE TO HPC GUIDANCE FOR 
TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE PERIOD.
