AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
344 AM EST TUE NOV 22 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AREA RADAR MOSAIC SHOWS 
ORGANIZED PRECIP HAS JUST ABOUT DEPARTED OUR FORECAST AREA AS UPPER 
LOW CONTINUES TO TREK TOWARD THE EAST COAST. MID AND UPPER LEVELS 
DRY OUT RAPIDLY PER LATEST MODEL TIME HEIGHTS...BUT SIGNIFICANT 
MOISTURE REMAINS IN THE BOUNDARY LAYER THROUGH THE FIRST PERIOD AND 
MUCH OF THE SECOND. THIS IN CONJUNCTION WITH STRONG UPSLOPE FLOW AND 
COOLING BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS ARGUES FOR A GOOD UPSLOPE FLOW SNOW
EVENT IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. BASED ON THIS SITUATION...WILL CONTINUE 
CURRENT WARNINGS/ADVISORIES AND EXTEND UNTIL MIDNIGHT. EVENT 
EXPECTED TO WIND DOWN BY LATE IN THE SECOND PERIOD AS BOUNDARY LAYER 
MOISTURE BECOMES SHALLOWER AND UPSLOPE FLOW RELAXES SOMEWHAT. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY FAVORED COOLEST OF GUIDANCE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MAIN SYSTEM IS EARLY IN
THE LONG TERM PERIOD AS CLIPPER SHORTWAVE DROPS QUICKLY SE AND
AFFECTS MAINLY NRN 2/3RDS OF THE FORECAST AREA LATE WEDNESDAY INTO
EARLY THANKSGIVING DAY.  MODELS SEEM TO CONTINUE THE TREND OF THIS
FEATURE BEING A BIT NORTH OF OUR FORECAST AREA...ALTHO GFS SEEMS TO
BE TOO GENEROUS OR ZEALOUS IN SPREADING SO MUCH QPF AS FAR SOUTH AS
MUCH OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS LOOKS SUSPECT TO ME...SINCE
EVEN THE GFS KEEPS MOST OF THE ASSOCIATED VORTICITY NORTH OF SWRN VA.
NAM LOOKS MORE REASONABLE AND BETTER IN LINE WITH HPC QPF PROGS AND
WINTER WEATHER DESK (WWD) DAYS 1-3 SNOW PROGS. 

NAM DOES SHOW A WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN AND WEAK ISENTROPIC
LIFT DEVELOPING BY LATE WEDNESDAY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...BUT
THINK THAT THIS MAY JUST EQUATE TO AN INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER.
THIS WARM AIR ADVECTION ALSO COMPLICATES WHAT TYPE OF PCPN MAY
OCCUR...ALTHO EXPECT LIGHT QPF...POSSIBLY NEAR 0.10 OVER SWRN VA
AREAS. DECIDED TO INCREASE POPS SLIGHTLY ACROSS SWRN VA AND NE TN
MTN ZONES LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT...JUST BELOW LIKELY FOR NOW.  DOWN
SOUTH OVER THE SRN THIRD OF THE AREA...LOWERED POPS TO JUST SLIGHT
CHANCE AND REMOVED SOME OF THE SNOW DUE TO THE WARM AIR ADVECTION
AND BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS.  

OTHERWISE...LITTLE CHANGES MADE FOR NOW.  PLENTY OF WEATHER IN THE
SHORT TO MID TERM...SO WILL LET DAY SHIFT MAKE ADJUSTMENTS TO LATER
PERIODS INTO THE NEW DAY SEVEN (TUESDAY).  WSW...ZFP AND ALL WEB
PRODUCTS ISSUED ALREADY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
745 PM EST MON NOV 21 2005

.DISCUSSION...A LARGE SWATH OF RAIN IS COVERING THE MRX CWA THIS 
EVENING IN RESPONSE TO A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVING THROUGH 
THE AREA.  THE UPPER LOW...CURRENTLY POSITIONED OVER NORTH GA IS 
MOVING NORTHEAST WITH THE CENTER PROGGED TO TRACK TO OUR EAST.  
CURRENT TEMPERATURE PROFILE INDICATED PRECIP SHOULD REMAIN AS RAIN 
THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY.  HOWEVER...AS THE 
LOW LIFTS NORTHWARD...WINDS WILL SHIFT TO THE NORTHWEST AND PULL IN 
COOLER AIR.  HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU HAVE 
ALREADY SEEN RAIN MIX WITH OR CHANGE OVER TO SNOW.  THE EAST 
TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS SHOULD SEE RAIN CHANGING OVER TO SNOW ANY TIME 
AFTER 9 PM.  AS THE LOW CONTINUES TO LIFT NORTH AND EAST...UPSLOPE 
FLOW WILL KEEP A CHANCE OF SNOW OVER HIGHER TERRAIN THROUGH 
TUESDAY.  WITH THE TIMING OF THE COLDER AIR...THE WARM GROUND AND 
THE DEPTH OF MOISTURE AS THE LOW EXITS THE AREA...SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
ARE DIFFICULT TO PINPOINT.  CURRENT THINKING IS 1-3 INCHES OVER HIGH 
TERRAIN WITH 3-5 INCHES AT THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS.  A SNOW ADVISORY 
IS IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY TO COVER THIS ACCUMULATION.  ALL 
HANDLED WELL IN THE CURRENT FORECAST...WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE 
EVENING/MIDNIGHT TYPE WORDING.

TROUGH PUSHING THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...BEST MOISTURE IN

SHORTWAVE TRACKING THROUGH ON SATURDAY WITH MOISTURE STAYING

FXUS64 KMRX 210952
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
450 AM EST MON NOV 21 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...INITIAL AREA OF LIGHT RAIN 
CONTINUES TO SPREAD NE AT AROUND 25 MPH...WITH JUST TRACE AMOUNTS TO 
A FEW HUNDREDTHS OF AN INCH THUS FAR.  ACTUALLY NOT MUCH AT ALL 
MEASURED YET ACROSS FAR NE TN INTO EXTREME SWRN VA FORECAST AREAS. 
EVAPORATIVE COOLING INITIALLY...RAPID INCREASE IN CLOUDS/RAIN AND 
NORTHERLY SURFACE WINDS WILL REALLY HINDER TEMPS FROM RISING MUCH 
TODAY.  THUS...KEPT MAX TEMPS IN LINE WITH THE COOLER MOS CHOICES.

THE 21/00Z GFS AND NAM MODELS SEEM TO BE IN DECENT AGREEMENT OVERALL 
ON THE PCPN PATTERN AND ARRIVAL OF COLDER AIR (FOR PCPN TYPE CHANGE)
BY AROUND 09Z TUESDAY.  GFS STILL IS A LITTLE FASTER IN MOVING THE 
UPPER LOW NE AND OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA BY VERY EARLY TUESDAY 
MORNING.  ADDED A FEW SPOTS OF SNOW SHOWERS FOR SWRN VA AND NE TN 
MTN ZONES (MAINLY ABOVE 3000 FEET) IN THE 09Z TO 12Z TUESDAY WEATHER 
GRIDS.

OTHERWISE...JUST MINOR CHANGES OVERALL TO GRIDS FOR THESE PERIODS.
DID INCREASE POPS TO 90 TO 100 PERCENT ALL AREAS BY LATE MORNING 
INTO EARLY AFTERNOON.  ALSO...LOWERED MIN TEMP FORECAST IN LINE WITH 
COOLER 21/00Z MOS AS COLD AIR WRAPS AROUND INTO REGION BY DAYBREAK 
TUESDAY.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...COLDER AIR ARRIVING INTO 
FORECAST AREA TUESDAY WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES NEARLY STEADY AND 
POSSIBLY FALLING. STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION WITH THE FLOW OUT OF THE 
NORTHWEST WILL ALSO BRING SNOW SHOWERS OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. 
PROGGED SOUNDINGS OF THE NAM AND GFS SHOWS FREEZING LEVELS AROUND 
2500 TO 3000 FEET. MOST OF THE MOISTURE IS GONE ABOVE 850 MB BY 
AROUND 12Z TUESDAY. BUT NW WINDS OF 15 TO 20 KNOTS AT 2500 FEET AND 
UP TO 35 KNOTS AT ABOUT 850 MB IN NE TN WILL BE GOOD FOR UPSLOPE 
SNOW SHOWERS THROUGHOUT THE DAY. HAVE ISSUED SPECIAL WEATHER 
STATEMENT FOR UP TO TWO INCHES OF SNOW BY TUESDAY EVENING ACROSS SW 
VA AND NE TN HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WIND ADVISORY MAY BE NECESSARY FOR 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS TUESDAY. WINDS BEGIN DECREASING AFTER 00Z 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND MOISTURE THINS. THINK THERE WILL BE LITTLE 
ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATION TUESDAY NIGHT BUT TEMPERATURES WILL DROP 
INTO THE MID AND UPPER 20S AND WITH WINDS NEAR 10 MPH IT WILL FEEL 
QUITE COLD. UPPER RIDGE STAYS ANCHORED ACROSS THE WESTERN STATES 
LEAVING THE DOOR OPEN WITH COLD AIR COMING SOUTH FROM CANADA TOWARDS 
THE TN VALLEY. THE NEXT SYSTEM IS NOW MOVING A LITTLE FASTER SOUTH 
AND WILL BEGIN TO SPREAD CLOUDS INTO TN AS EARLY AS WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON. THIS SYSTEM WILL AFFECT MOSTLY THE NORTHERN TWO THIRDS 
WITH A CHANCE OF RAIN OR SNOW WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. IT LOOKS 
LIKE UPSLOPE CONDITIONS WILL TAKE SHAPE AGAIN ON THURSDAY IN THE 
MOUNTAINS.     

(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...PREVIOUS RUNS OF THE GFS SHOWED 
THE UPPER JET DIVING SOUTH AND PUSHING A FRONT INTO THE AREA 
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING. THIS FEATURE HAS DISAPPEARED WITH 
THE 00Z RUN AND POPS WILL BE REMOVED THIS PERIOD. A COLD AIR MASS 
WITH ORIGINS IN NORTHERN CANADA BUILDS INTO THE AREA ON 
SATURDAY...THEN TEMPS GRADUALLY WARM AS THE CLOSED LOW SHIFTS EAST 
AND AN UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE REGION.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             49  40  45  30 / 100  80  20  10

OAK RIDGE, TN                       51  38  44  29 /  90  80  30  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
812 PM EST SUN NOV 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...WE REMAIN UNDER SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT AS AN UPPER 
LOW CURRENTLY OVER AR CONTINUES TO DIG TO THE SOUTHEAST TONIGHT.  A 
SHORT WAVE MOVING THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW IS PULLING IN LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE AND LIFT INTO THE AREA.  ASSOCIATED PRECIP IS MOVING 
IN...THOUGH THE MAIN BAND OF RAIN SHOULD REMAIN TO OUR EAST.  WITH 
CONTINUED CLOUD COVER AND WEAK WARM ADVECTION OVERNIGHT...850MB 
TEMPS SHOULD STAY NEAR THE 5 TO 8 DEGREE C MARK AND SURFACE 
TEMPERATURES SHOULD REMAIN WELL ABOVE FREEZING...SO EXPECT PRECIP TO 
REMAIN RAIN THROUGH THE NIGHT.  THE UPPER LOW IS PROGGED TO TRACK 
ALONG THE GULF COAST ON MONDAY...CONTINUING TO FEED MOISTURE AND 
ENERGY INTO THE MRX CWA...AND KEEPING BANDS OF RAIN MOVING THROUGH 
THE AREA.  THINGS LOOK GOOD IN THE CURRENT FORECAST...WILL UPDATE TO 
REMOVE EVENING/MIDNIGHT TYPE WORDING.

FXUS64 KMRX 202034
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EST SUN NOV 20 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGE AND 
DRY LOW LEVELS REMAIN BRIEFLY ACROSS THE MRX CWA THIS EVENING. 
STRONG DEVELOPING SYSTEM TAKING SHAPE FOR THIS WEEK WITH MODELS 
COMING INTO BETTER AGREEMENT. COLD CORE LOW SLIDES SE TONIGHT TO S 
MS RVR VLY. THIS LOW IS ACCOMPANIED BY STRENGTHENING JETS AND 
DYNAMICS WHICH WILL BRING GOOD SHOT OF RAIN TO THE AREA. A SURFACE 
LOW WILL DEEPEN AS IT MOVES FROM THE NORTHEAST GULF OF MEXICO TO THE 
CAROLINAS ON MONDAY. GOOD ISENTROPIC LIFT IS ALREADY EVIDENT NORTH 
OF THE LOW AND WILL CONTINUE TO MATERIALIZE AS THE LOW MOVES 
NORTHWARD. THIS COUPLES WELL WITH VERY GOOD UPPER DIFFLUENCE THAT 
SETS UP OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TONIGHT NORTHEAST OF THE 
MID/UPR LEVEL LOW. WIDESPREAD STEADY RAIN WILL BEGIN LATER TONIGHT 
AND CONTINUE INTO TUESDAY MORNING. BY THEN...THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
WILL BE NE OF THE MRX CWA. CAA GETS UNDERWAY IN ERNEST WITH 
SUFFICIENT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO ENHANCE UPSLOPE SPRINKLES AND 
FLURRIES. THE FREEZING LEVEL WILL BE AROUND 2500 FEET AT DAYBREAK 
AND LOWER THROUGHOUT THE DAY ALLOWING FOR SOME SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
ACROSS FAVORABLE ELEVATED AREAS. ANOTHER FAIRLY STRONG JET WILL 
REINFORCE THE EAST COAST TROUGH BRINGING MODERATE POTENTIAL 
VORTICITY ACROSS THE AREA. COLD MID LEVELS WILL STEEPEN THE LAPSE 
RATES AND THE SNOW SHOWERS ARE LIKELY TO BE ENHANCED BY THESE 
FEATURES.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS A BIT QUICKER ON 
BRINGING COLD FRONT AND UPPER LOW IN ON WEDNESDAY...WILL INTRODUCE 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE NORTHERN AREAS FOR WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON.   
SYSTEM TRACKS THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT BRINGING A SHOT OF SNOWSHOWERS 
ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING.  MODELS INDICATING 
SUFFICIENT MOISTURE TO KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING BOTH PERIODS.  GETTING 
DECENT COLD AIR ADVECTION WITH THE FRONT...SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR 
SNOW ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA... NORTHEAST TN AND THE MOUNTAINS.  MAY SEE 
A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW IN THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY BEFORE 
CHANGING TO RAIN BY AFTERNOON.  UPPER TROUGH AND ANOTHER FRONT 
PUSHING THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...BEST MOISTURE IN THE 
NORTH...SO WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE  POPS INTO THURSDAY NIGHT AND 
FRIDAY FOR THE NORTHEAST TN... SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS...AND 
DRY ELSEWHERE.  GFS INDICATING ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE TRACKING 
THROUGH ON SATURDAY WITH LIMITED MOISTURE...WILL KEEP SATURDAY DRY 
FOR NOW.  DRIER WEATHER EXPECTED BY SUNDAY...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH 
THE DRY FORECAST FOR THE REST OF THE WEEKEND.  STAYED CLOSE TO HPC 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 200927
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
426 AM EST SUN NOV 20 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...FAST MOVING SHORTWAVE/VORT MAX 
IS EXITING NE PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS MORNING... 
LEAVING CLEARING SKIES BEHIND THIS FEATURE.  MORE MID DECK CLOUDS 
UPSTREAM OVER MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY IN ADVANCE OF THE DEEPENING 
UPPER LOW...SO LOOK FOR INCREASING CLOUDS AGAIN LATER TODAY.  ADDED 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS TO SE FORECAST AREA AND MTNS FOR LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON AS CLOUDS THICKEN AND LIFT OCCURS IN ADVANCE OF THE 
APPROACHING UPPER LOW.  EXPECT PCPN TYPE BOTH LATE TODAY AND TONIGHT 
TO BE STRATIFORM (LIGHT RAIN INSTEAD OF SHOWERS).  LOWERED QPF 
TOTALS INITIALLY DUE TO DRY AIR IN LOW LEVELS.

FOUND THE NAM AND GFS TO OVERALL BE IN BETTER AGREEMENT ON FEATURES 
SUCH AS THE DEEPENING UPPER LOW...AND GENERALLY ON LOCATION ONCE THE 
LOW CLOSES OFF.  HOWEVER...GFS IS SEVERAL HOURS FASTER IN SPREADING 
LIGHT RAIN NORTHWARD INTO THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...AND EVEN IF 
GFS IS ONLY SLIGHTLY TOO FAST...THEN MEASURABLE PCPN MIGHT DELAY 
UNTIL AFTER 12Z MONDAY.  NAM HAS BEEN CONSISTENT IN SHOWING GOOD 
ISENTROPIC LIFT TO DEVELOP TONIGHT...SO PERHAPS NAM MOS POPS COULD 
BE A LITTLE LOW.  DECIDED TO COMPROMISE FOR NOW...AND GRADUALLY LEAD 
INTO THE CATEGORICAL POPS MONDAY MORNING.

TRENDED MORE TOWARD THE COOLER GFS MOS MAX TEMPS TODAY GIVEN 
INCREASING CLOUDS...WITH NO REAL PREFERENCE TONIGHT AMONGST VERY 
SIMILAR MOS MIN VALUES.  

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS IN BETTER AGREEMENT 
ABOUT RAIN ON MONDAY AND TIMING IS BECOMING CLOSER TOO. UPPER LOW 
OVER AR WITH SURFACE LOW ACROSS GA/FL WILL BRING CONSIDERABLE 
MOISTURE NORTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THIS WILL MEAN A RAINY DAY 
ACROSS THE EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. 
CLOUDS AND RAIN SHOULD HOLD TEMPERATURES IN THE UPPER 40S TO LOWER 
50S AND AS SURFACE LOW MOVES NORTHEAST ALONG THE EAST COAST SURFACE  
WINDS WILL SHIFT TO THE NORTH AND KEEP TEMPERATURES FROM RISING. 
MONDAY NIGHT COLDER AIR ALOFT WILL MOVE IN AS CLOSED UPPER LOW OR 
TROUGH MOVES ACROSS EAST TN AND UPPER FLOW COMES OUT OF THE 
NORTHWEST. NAM AND GFS SOUNDINGS SHOW FREEZING LEVEL DROPPING TO 
BETWEEN 2 AND 3 THOUSAND FEET JUST AS THE BULK OF THE MOISTURE IS 
MOVING OUT TUESDAY MORNING. THIS SHOULD GIVE THE MOUNTAINS A DUSTING 
OF SNOW AND POSSIBLY A TRACE IN THE VALLEYS. SNOW FLURRIES MAY 
LINGER IN SW VA AND NE TN TUESDAY AND MAY HAVE TO LOWER HIGHS IF 
NEXT MODEL RUNS ARE CONSISTENTLY COLD. MAY HAVE TO PUT IN A FEW 
INCHES IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY 
DEPENDING ON HOW MUCH MOISTURE IS LEFT MONDAY NIGHT. WILL HAVE TO 
WATCH THE UPPER LOWS TRACK AS IT MOVES EAST AND THE STRENGTH OF THE 
SURFACE LOW MOVING UP EAST COAST. COLD WEATHER WITH A TROUGH IN THE 
EAST CONTINUES ALL WEEK. THE NEXT SYSTEM WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY MORNING WILL BE DRIER BUT COULD BRING A CHANCE FOR MORE 
SNOW ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.        
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST SAT NOV 19 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...SFC RIDGE CONTINUES 
TO EXTEND SW-NE ACROSS MRX CWA WITH VERY DRY LOW LEVELS. GOOD 
SUNSHINE TODAY ALLOWED TEMPS TO RISE 30 OR MORE DEGREES BUT STILL 
BELOW NORMAL. SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS AREA THIS EVENING BRINGING
A GOOD SLUG OF MID LEVEL MOISTURE WITH IT. SOME VIRGA MAY BE 
SPOTTED. OVRNGT TEMPS ABT 10 DEGREES ABV THIS MORNINGS DUE TO CLOUD 
COVER. POWERFUL WX SYSTEM CONTINUES TO EVOLVE INTO NEXT WEEK WITH 
POOR AGREEMENT AMONGST MODEL SOLUTIONS. REGARDLESS OF EVOLUTION MRX 
CWA LOOKS TO GET SOME MUCH NEEDED RAINFALL. COLD CORE LOW DROPS INTO 
LWR MS RVR VLY SUN WHILE PRESSURES LOWER OVR E GLFMEX INTO FL. 
LITTLE CHC OF RAIN OUTSIDE NC EARLY. BY SUN NGT...WAA AND MOISTURE 
TRANSPORT IN LARGE SCALE ASCENT AS CONVEYOR SETS UP FM LOW LEVELS TO 
THE SE TO MID LVLS TO THE SW. GFS...WHICH APPEARS TOO FAST WITH 
FEATURES DOES SHOW VERY GOOD UPPER SUPPORT OVER MRX INTO MONDAY. 
THIS SCENARIO LINGERS OVR S APPALACHIANS AS SFC LOW MOVES NE UP E 
CST AND MID LVL COLD CORE SLIDES TO S PART OF AREA.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER TROUGH PASSING  
THROUGH ON TUESDAY ALONG WITH SOME UPSLOPE FLOW...WILL BUMP UP POPS 
ON A BIT.  WITH SOME COLD AIR FILTERING IN ON TUESDAY MORNING...WILL 
KEEP MENTION OF SNOW...MAINLY OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...BUT MAY 
SEE A MIX ACROSS THE LOW LEVELS.  UPPER TROUGH PUSHING THROUGH 
TUESDAY NIGHT.  BEST MOISTURE TO THE NORTH OF OUR CWA...SO WILL KEEP 
ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST TN...AND THE 
MOUNTAINS AND DRY ELSEWHERE.  SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW ACROSS 
NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA FOR TUESDAY NIGHT.  DRIER AIR 
FILTERING IN ON WEDNESDAY...WILL KEEP WEDNESDAY DRY.  COLD FRONT AND 
UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES LATE WEDNESDAY BRINGING ANOTHER SHOT OF 
SNOWSHOWERS ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY MORNING.  MODELS 
INDICATING MORE MOISTURE AVAILABLE THAN PREVIOUS RUNS...WILL BUMP UP 
POPS A BIT TO CHANCE FOR ALL OF CWA FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THURSDAY.  SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA... 
NORTHEAST TN AND THE MOUNTAINS.  MAY SEE A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW IN 
THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY...BEFORE CHANGING TO RAIN BY 
AFTERNOON.  UPPER TROUGH PUSHING THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS INTO THURSDAY NIGHT FOR THE NORTHEAST TN... 
SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS.  ANOTHER FRONT PUSHING IN ON 
FRIDAY...WILL ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY.  MOISTURE MORE 
LIMITED BY FRIDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY DRY 
FOR NOW.  STAYED CLOSE TO HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.



000 
FXUS64 KMRX 190943
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
440 AM EST SAT NOV 19 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HEIGHTS SLIGHTLY RISE TODAY 
ACROSS THE REGION AS TROUGHING ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES DEEPENS. AT 
THE SURFACE...HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE SLIPS EASTWARD ALLOWING WEAK 
SOUTHERLY LOW LEVEL WINDS AND WARM AIR ADVECTION THIS AFTERNOON. 
MOSTLY SUNNY SKIES EXPECTED AND GENERALLY ACCEPTED THE MOS BLEND FOR 
MAX TEMPS TODAY...NOTING NO CLEARLY BETTER PERFORMER FROM YESTERDAY.

KEPT THE SLIGHT INCREASING TREND IN CLOUDS LATE TONIGHT...BUT 
DEFINITELY NO THREAT OF PCPN...ACTUALLY NOT UNTIL SUNDAY NIGHT.
GUIDANCE PROGS SEEM NOW TO FAVOR THE LATEST GFS MODEL RUN OVER NAM
...WHICH IS A CHANGE FROM 24 HOURS AGO.  EITHER WAY...NOT A BIG 
INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER UNTIL TOWARD SUNDAY MORNING.  MUCH MILDER 
MIN TEMPS TONIGHT...BUT TRIMMED SW VA/NE TN MINS DOWN A BIT CLOSER 
TO 19/00Z MOS VALUES (SINCE CLOUD COVER SHOULD ARRIVE THERE LATEST).

COMMENTS ON LATER PERIODS...WE WERE NOT TOTALLY SOLD ON THE GFS 
HANDLING/LOCATION OF THE DEVELOPING CLOSED UPPER LOW BY LATE 
SUNDAY.  THIS LOCATION AND STRENGTH DIRECTLY AFFECTS THE PLACEMENT 
OF THE ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW PRESSURE AREA.  DID NOTICE THAT ALTHO 
GUIDANCE POPS DIFFER GREATLY FROM NAM TO GFS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT...EVEN 
THE NAM DEVELOPS DECENT ISENTROPIC LIFT ACROSS THE SE STATES INTO 
SRN APPALACHIANS TOWARD EARLY MONDAY MORNING (06Z-12Z).  GOOD NEWS 
IS THAT PCPN LOOKS TO BE ALL LIQUID WITH THIS SYSTEM.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS NOW COMING INTO BETTER 
AGREEMENT WITH CLOSED UPPER LOW OVER THE SOUTH CENTRAL STATES 
SUNDAY. THIS PUTS THE FORECAST AREA IN A MOISTER SOUTHWEST FLOW 
SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT. INCREASING MOISTURE AT ALL LEVELS SUNDAY 
WILL CAUSE SKIES TO BECOME MOSTLY CLOUDY. BEST CHANCE OF RAIN WILL 
BE THE SOUTHERN AREAS AS ISENTROPIC LIFT DEVELOPS FROM SOUTH TO 
NORTH. WITH DRY AIRMASS IN PLACE WILL STILL TAKE AWHILE FOR 
ATMOSPHERE TO BECOME SATURATED. THINK THIS WILL BE SUNDAY NIGHT AND 
MONDAY. INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY SOUTH AND CHANCE NORTH MONDAY. WITH 
CLOUD COVER LOWS SUNDAY NIGHT SHOULD BE SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER. A 
SURFACE LOW MOVES NORTH OUT OF THE GULF AND DEEPENS BEGINNING MONDAY 
AND THEN MOVES NORTHEAST INTO THE NE STATES. THE GFS IS MUCH FASTER 
WITH THIS FEATURE THEN THE NAM. COLD AIR ALOFT WITH UPPER LOW 
AND ON NW SIDE OF DEEPENING SURFACE LOW WILL LOWER FREEZING LEVELS 
MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY. ADDED SNOW SHOWERS TO EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA MONDAY NIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY. 
THIS COULD BE A SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL FOR MOUNTAINS AND LATER SHIFTS 
WILL NEED TO LOOK AT LATER MODEL RUNS TO SEE IF THEIR IS CONSISTENCY 
WITH THIS SYSTEM. RIDGE IN THE WEST AND TROUGH IN THE EAST CONTINUES 
ALL WEEK. ANOTHER SYSTEM MOVES SOUTH OUT OF SOUTH CENTRAL CANADA 
INTO THE GREAT LAKES WEDNESDAY AND THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
THANKSGIVING DAY WITH ENOUGH COLD AIR AND MOISTURE FOR A CHANCE OF 
MORE SNOW ESPECIALLY ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS.        
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 182030

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EST FRI NOV 18 2005

.SHORT TERM...ANOTHER COLD NIGHT IN STORE WITH CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT 
WINDS. TEMPS HAVE A LONGER WAY TO FALL TONIGHT WITH TODAYS TEMPS 
GETTING INTO THE 40S AND 50S...FCST CLOSE TO WARMER GFS #S AND ABOUT 
ONE DEGREE WARMER THAN THIS MORNING. SURFACE RIDGE AXIS STRETCHES NE 
ACROSS MRX CWA. MOS GUIDANCE CONTINUES TO HAVE TROUBLE WITH AFTN 
DPS IN THIS VERY DRY AIRMASS. EXPECT DPS TO REBOUND SOME TONIGHT. 
SAT...SFC RIDGE CONTINUES TO SHIFT NE WITH CENTER MOVING OFF TO OUR 
NE BY EVENING. A SHORT WAVE MOVES INTO THE AREA FM THE SW WHICH WILL 
BRING SOME MID/HIGH LVL CLDS ACROSS THE AREA IN THE AFTN...WARMING 
TREND CONTINUES. STRENGTH AND POSITION OF TROUGH OVR NATIONS 
MIDSECTION WILL AFFECT MRX CWA WEATHER SAT NGT INTO SUN NGT. EXPECT 
STRONG JET SEGMENT TO DEVELOP ON EAST SIDE OF TROUGH ON SUN 
INCREASING LIFT OVER DEPARTING LOW LEVEL RIDGE. AVAILABLE MOISTURE 
STILL IN QUESTION SO WENT WELL BELOW MOS GUIDANCE SUN/SUN NGT WITH 
LOW CONFIDENCE ON POSITION OF DEVELOPING LOW LEVEL INVERTED TROUGH. 
FOR NOW EXPECT SOME DOWNSLOPE FLOW TO HINDER PCPN DEVELOPMENT.  


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...TROPICAL SYSTEM MOVING UP 
FROM SOUTHWEST ON MONDAY...WITH AN INVERTED TROUGH STRETCHING 
THROUGH THE REGION...WILL BUMP UP POPS TO 30/40 FOR MONDAY AND 
MONDAY NIGHT AS DISTURBANCES PASSES.  TEMPERATURES/THICKNESSES  
MONDAY NIGHT SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL LIQUID PRECIPITATION.  
COLD FRONT PUSHES INTO AREA TUESDAY.  WITH PLENTY OF MOISTURE STILL 
IN PLACE...KEPT CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY.  UPPER TROUGH PUSHING 
THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT.  BEST MOISTURE TO THE NORTH OF OUR CWA...SO 
WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST 
TN...AND THE MOUNTAINS AND DRY ELSEWHERE.  SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR 
SNOW ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY MORNING...THEN LIQUID PRECIP BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON.  
SHOULD HAVE A BRIEF BREAK BEFORE NEXT FRONT AND UPPER TROUGH BRINGS 
ANOTHER SHOT OF SNOWSHOWERS ON LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY 
MORNING.  MODELS INDICATING MORE MOISTURE AVAILABLE THAN PREVIOUS 
RUNS...WILL ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR ALL OF CWA FOR WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY.  SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VA...NORTHEAST TN AND THE MOUNTAINS.  MAY SEE A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW 
IN THE CENTRAL VALLEY...BUT SHOULD BE ALL LIQUID ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
VALLEY.  UPPER TROUGH PUSHING THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS INTO THURSDAY NIGHT FOR THE NORTHEAST TN... 
SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS.  DRIER WEATHER PUSHING IN BY 
FRIDAY.  STAYED CLOSE TO HPC GUIDANCE FOR TEMPERATURES.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 181554
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1045 AM EST FRI NOV 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED.
SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...JUST ABOUT THE ONLY PERIODS THAT 
MODELS SEEM TO AGREE UPON...WITH MUCH DIVERGENCE IN MODELS FROM 
ESPECIALLY SUNDAY THRU MID NEXT WEEK.  18/00Z GFS RUN IS REALLY 
OFFERING A DIFFERENT (AND VERY WET) SOLUTION...AND NOTED AS A 
RADICAL CHANGE FROM PREVIOUS RUNS AND AN OUTLIER...SO WE WILL STICK 
CLOSER TO NAM SOLUTION AND PREVIOUS FORECAST GRIDS.

SURFACE RIDGE JUST TO OUR WEST WILL SETTLE INTO THE REGION TODAY AND 
TONIGHT.  WEAK SHORTWAVE PASSING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES AND OHIO 
VALLEY REGIONS...WHICH MAY SPREAD A BIT OF MID TO HIGH CLOUDS 
BRIEFLY ACROSS NRN PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA LATER TODAY.  OTHERWISE
...DRY AND UNSEASONABLY COOL FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT.  

PREVIOUS MAX TEMP FORECAST WAS CLOSE TO MOS BLEND AND LOOKED GOOD.
SURFACE RIDGE ACROSS REGION TONIGHT WITH CLEARING SKIES AND VERY 
LIGHT WINDS...SO FAVORED COOLER MOS MINS WITH JUST SLIGHT ADJUSTMENT 
DOWNWARD TO PREVIOUS MIN TEMP GRID.

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THANKSGIVING)...HIGH PRESSURE 
CONTINUES OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
SATURDAY AS ZONAL FLOW CONTINUES BUT BEGINS TO TRANSITION TO MORE 
SOUTHWEST LATER IN THE DAY. INCREASING THICKNESSES AND THE CURRENT 
DRY AIR IN PLACE WILL MAKE FOR A RAPID WARMUP INTO THE 50S IN MOST 
LOCATIONS. MODELS SHOW LATER IN THE DAY SATURDAY TROUGHING DEVELOPS 
FROM THE GREAT LAKES SOUTHWEST TOWARD TEXAS WITH THE GFS TRYING TO 
CLOSE OFF AN UPPER LOW OVER MO SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE ALONG THE MID ATLANTIC COAST AND EXTENDING SOUTHWEST 
INTO SE TEXAS WILL BE SLOW TO SHIFT EAST UNTIL LATER SUNDAY. A COLD 
FRONT APPROACHING THE LOWER OHIO AND MS RIVERS SATURDAY NIGHT WILL 
HAVE A HARD TIME MOVING EAST. THE NAM/GFS/UKMET/ECMWF DEVELOP A 
SURFACE LOW OFF FLORIDAS WEST COAST SUNDAY NIGHT AND MOVE IT NORTH 
THROUGH THE SOUTHEAST MONDAY AND TUESDAY. ONLY THE GFS KEEPS AN 
UPPER LOW TO THE WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA AND THEN BRINGS IT OVER 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS MONDAY NIGHT WITH LOW ENOUGH THICKNESSES 
FOR SOME SIGNIFICANT SNOW IN THE MOUNTAINS AND POSSIBLY VALLEY 
AREAS. PREFER THE OTHER SOLUTIONS WHICH BRING MOISTURE TO MAINLY THE 
MOUNTAINS AND EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH ONLY SLIGHT CHANCES OF 
PRECIPITATION AS THE WEATHER SYSTEM MOVES NORTH ALONG THE EAST 
COAST.     
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             51  28  59  35 /   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  48  24  55  32 /   0   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       49  24  56  31 /   0   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              44  20  54  28 /   0   0   0  10

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EST THU NOV 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE 
CENTERED OVER THE MID MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY EXTENDING OVER MOST 
OF THE EASTERN U.S. SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL CLEAR SKIES ACROSS THE 
ENTIRE REGION...WHICH SHOULD ALLOW TEMPS TO DROP TO WELL BELOW 
NORMAL LEVELS OVERNIGHT. IN FACT...IT APPEARS THAT MINS TOMORROW 
MORNING WILL BE NEAR RECORD LOWS ACROSS CENTRAL AND NORTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. RECORD LOWS FOR THE 18TH ARE: 18 
(TYS)...21 (OQT) AND 16 (TRI). WASNT IT A FEW DAYS AGO WE WERE 
SETTING RECORD HIGHS? THIS HAS BEEN QUITE A CHANGE IN AIR MASSES.

OVERALL...CURRENT FORECAST FOR TONIGHT LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK AND WILL 
NOT PLAN TO UPDATE.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST THU NOV 17 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SAT NIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGE CONTINUES 
TO MOVE INTO THE AREA FROM THE WEST. VERY DRY AIRMASS AND LIGHT 
WINDS TONIGHT WILL ALLOW FOR MAX COOLING OVERNIGHT. COLD AIR 
ADVECTION WEAKENS TONIGHT AND BECOMES NEUTRAL EARLY FRIDAY. WILL GO 
FOR MIN TEMPS SLIGHTLY COOLER THAN MODEL BLEND. TAIL OF MID LEVEL 
SHORT WAVES MOVES ACROSS N PART OF AREA FRI AFTN/FRI NGT. MOISTURE 
APPEARS TOO LIMITED FOR SIGNIFICANT CLOUDS SO DOWNPLAYED CLOUD COVER 
POTENTIAL. OTHERWISE SLOW WARMING TREND LATE FRI THROUGH SAT NGT.  

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...RIDGE BRINGING DRY WEATHER 
FOR SUNDAY...BUT UPPER TROUGH TRACKING THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT.  
MOISTURE LIMITED...BUT WILL ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SOUTHWEST VA 
AND THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS FOR LATE SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY 
MORNING.  SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOWSHOWERS.  DRY WEATHER 
RETURNS BRIEFLY FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON AND MONDAY NIGHT BEFORE A FRONT 
APPROACHES ON TUESDAY.  BEST MOISTURE AGAIN TO THE NORTH OF OUR 
CWA...SO WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY 
NIGHT.  WILL KEEP THE SOUTHERN COUNTIES DRY FOR NOW.  SHOULD BE COLD 
ENOUGH FOR SNOW ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA FOR TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY MORNING...THEN LIQUID PRECIP BY WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON.  SHOULD HAVE A BRIEF BREAK BEFORE NEXT SHORTWAVE BRINGS 
ANOTHER SHOT OF SNOWSHOWERS ON LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY 
MORNING ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS.  COLD FRONT 
AND UPPER TROUGH  APPROACHES ON THURSDAY...SO WILL CONTINUE SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY.  STAYED CLOSE TO HPC GUIDANCE 
TEMPERATURES...MEX GUIDANCE A LITTLE HIGH TOWARDS THE END OF THE 
PERIOD.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 170838
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
338 AM EST THU NOV 17 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...STEADY NWLY FLOW
CONTINUING TO PUMP IN COLDER/DRIER AIR. SHORT WAVE MOVING INTO AREA
NOW LOOKS LIKE IT MAY THICKEN UPSLOPE CLOUDS FOR NEXT FEW
HOURS...BUT AFTER IT PASSES THEN MUCH DRIER AIR BEGINS TO ADVECT
AND SUBSIDE INTO AREA...850 MB DEWPOINT TEMPS DOUBLE DIGIT BELOW
ZERO ON THE WAY INTO THE AREA. THINK CLOUDS WILL QUICKLY ERODE AT
BEGINNING OF FORECAST PERIOD. HAVE NOT PLACED ANY MENTION OF WX
SINCE CLOUD LAYER IS VERY SHALLOW WITH BASES AT 4500-5000 FT MSL.
WILL WATCH TO SEE HOW DEEP CLOUDS GET ON IR SATELLITE PICS--LATEST
CLOUD TOPS ARE ABOUT -11 TO -12 DEG C OVER SMOKIES...IF THEY GET TO
-17 WOULD LIKELY UPDATE TO PUT IN SOME FLURRIES.

AFTER UPSLOPE CLOUDS ERODE LATER THIS MORNING SHOULD BE CLEAR
ACROSS THE AREA FOR REST OF DAY AND MOST OF TONIGHT. WEAK
DISTURBANCE SWEEPS IN ON FRIDAY THAT WILL GENERATE SOME MID LEVEL
CLOUDS...BUT NO PRECIP.  

FOR TEMPS...WENT A LITTLE ABOVE GUIDANCE IN SOUTH AND A LITTLE
BELOW GUIDANCE IN THE NORTH TODAY...LOOKING UPSTREAM INTO SOURCE
REGION APPROXIMATELY SERN MO AND SRN IL...THERE WAS A PRETTY GOOD
SW-NE GRADIENT OF HIGH TEMPS ON WEDNESDAY.  THINKING MODELS
UNDERPLAYING OUR GRADIENT BETWEEN KCHA AND KTRI...MODELS AVERAGED
ABOUT 6 DEGREES DIFFERENCE...THINKING MORE LIKE 9-10 DEGREES
DIFFERENCE IN STORE TODAY. FOR OTHER 3 PERIODS...NEW GUIDANCE VALUES
VERY CLOSE TO CURRENT FORECAST...ONLY MINOR TWEAKINGS.

.LONG TERM...(SAT THROUGH WED)...MEAN EASTERN TROUGH TO PERSIST 
THROUGH THE PERIOD...WITH INDIVIDUAL SHORT WAVES MOVING THROUGH AND 
REINFORCING THE EASTERN TROUGH. ONE WAVE SHOULD ARRIVE SUNDAY...BUT 
THIS SYSTEM LOOKS MOISTURE STARVED WITH LITTLE FORCING...SO WILL 
JUST INCREASE CLOUDS AND WILL GO DRY FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT.   
NEXT WAVE IS FORECAST FOR TUESDAY/TUES NIGHT...AND THIS SYSTEM LOOKS 
LIKE IT MAY BE A LITTLE MORE SIGNIFICANT. WILL GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS NORTH AND CENTRAL TUE...THEN SLIGHT CHANCE NORTH AND SMOKIES 
FOR TUE NIGHT INTO WED IN UPSLOPE FLOW.  GFS MOS TEMPS GENERALLY 
LOOK REASONABLE...SO WILL NOT STRAY FAR.   

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 162005
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST WED NOV 16 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...PCPN AREA WEAKENING 
AND WILL MOVE NE OF THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON. SFC HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDING INTO THE AREA FM THE WEST. CLOUDS SHOULD ALSO DISSIPATE 
FAIRLY FAST THIS EVENING AS DRY AIR FILTERS IN. ANTICYCLONIC LOW 
LEVEL FLOW IN WAKE OF FRONT NOT VERY CONDUCIVE FOR UPSLOPE SPRINKLES 
OR FLURRIES TONIGHT. GOOD MIXING EXPECTED OVERNIGHT AND THE 
TRANSPORT OF DRY AIR WILL HINDER FOG FORMATION. SFC HIGH PRESSURE 
MOVES EAST ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH SHORT TERM. DAYTIME DPS WILL 
DIP BELOW 20F FOR THU AND FRI. COLD NIGHTS AND COOL DAYS INTO THE 
WEEKEND. BROAD TROUGH DEVELOPING ACROSS EASTERN US. A FEW SHORT 
WAVES WILL MOVE THROUGH THE MEAN TROUGH. THE TAIL END OF ONE OF 
THESE WAVES WILL MOVE ACROSS N PART OF MRX CWA BRINGING SOME CLOUD 
COVER N AREAS FRI AND FRI NIGHT. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...RECEIPT OF THE MODELS 
CAUSING SOME PROBLEMS...BUT ENOUGH CAME IN TO MAKE THE FORECAST.  
GOOD REINFORCING SHORT WAVE SWINGS THROUGH THE REGION ON SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON INTO SUNDAY NIGHT WITH A SHOT OF PRECIP POSSIBLE 
PARTICULARLY IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE PREFERRED UPSLOPE AREAS.  
SOME OF THIS PRECIP COULD BE IN THE FORM OF SNOW...HOWEVER...IT 
DOESNT LOOK LIKE HEAVY AMOUNTS AT THIS TIME.  YET ANOTHER SHORT 
WAVE SWINGS INTO THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY WITH THE SAME AREA UNDER 
BASICALLY THE SAME THREAT...RAIN POSSIBLY MIXING WITH SNOW 
PARTICULARLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  WELCOME TO LATE FALL.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT)...STRONGER CONVECTION ABOUT

AROUND 18Z. REMAINING CLOUDS/MOISTURE VERY SHALLOW...SO NOT
EXPECTING MUCH IN THE WAY OF UPSLOPE PRECIP IN SRN APPS THIS AFTERNOON.

COLD AIR WILL BE FLOWING INTO THE AREA...WITH HIGH TEMPS STILL
LOOKING TO BE EARLY MORNING READINGS. CLEARING AND QUITE COLD
TONIGHT...BUT WINDS NOT EXPECTED TO DECOUPLE...SO THAT SHOULD KEEP
IT FROM GETTING AS COLD TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(THU THROUGH TUE)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO 
BUILD IN THU...AND ATMOSPHERE WILL BE QUITE DRY THU AND THU 
NIGHT...SO WILL GO MOSTLY CLEAR/CLEAR.  MODELS INDICATE THAT THE 
EASTERN CONUS WILL GENERALLY REMAIN IN A LONG WAVE TROUGH FOR THE 
PERIOD...WITH INDIVIDUAL SHORT WAVES MOVING THROUGH MEAN EASTERN 
TROUGH.  FIRST OF THESE FORECAST FOR FRIDAY...BUT MOISTURE LOOKS 
QUITE LIMITED SO WILL JUST INCREASE CLOUDS A BIT.  NEXT WAVE AROUND 
THE SUNDAY TIME FRAME...AND RIGHT NOW THAT LOOKS LIKE IT MAY HAVE A 
LITTLE MORE MOISTURE TO WORK WITH.  WILL CONTINUE TO CARRY SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON/SUNDAY NIGHT FOR MAINLY NORTHERN 
AREAS.  WILL GENERALLY LEAVE MONDAY AND TUESDAY ALONE FOR NOW.  WILL 
UNDERCUT MAV TEMPS A LITTLE FOR THU...THEN ONLY MINOR TWEAKS FOR THU 
NIGHT AND FRI.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
808 PM EST TUE NOV 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...SEVERE STORMS AND TORNADOES CONTINUE OVER MAINLY 
WESTERN PARTS OF MIDDLE TN THIS EVENING...WITH STORMS ASSOCIATED 
WITH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY ATTEMPTING TO OVERTAKE THE SQUALL LINE 
ACTIVITY JUST TO THE EAST OF THE FRONT.

16/00Z OHX SOUNDING SHOWS ABOUT A 60 KNOT LOW LEVEL JET WITH 0-3KM 
STORM RELATIVE HELICITY VALUES AROUND 600.  SURFACE BASED 
INSTABILITY REMAINS LOWEST ACROSS OUR PART OF THE STATE...WITH 
POSITIVE CAPES OF AROUND 500 J/KG NOTED ON LATEST OHX SOUNDING.

AREA OBSERVATIONS SHOW S-SW SURFACE WINDS HAVE DIMINISHED ACROSS OUR 
FORECAST AREA...EVEN AT TYS WHERE WINDS HAD GUSTED ALL AFTERNOON.  
THINKING THAT THE CONVECTION JUST AHEAD OF AND ALONG THE FRONT WILL 
HAVE POTENTIAL FOR DAMAGING WINDS...SO DONT SEE THE NEED FOR A WIND 
ADVISORY...ALTHO WINDS MAY GUST BEHIND THE FRONT TO NEAR AT LEAST 
LAKE WIND ADVISORY CRITERIA.  

LACK OF INSTABILITY MAY BE A LIMITING FACTOR...BUT EXPECT THE NEED 
FOR WARNINGS FOR AT LEAST OUR CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COUNTIES BY LATE 
EVENING...POSSIBLY INTO EARLY MORNING HOURS IF CONVECTION REMAINS 
ORGANIZED WITH THE FRONT.  STAFFING FOR A SIGNIFICANT SEVERE EVENT 
AND HAM RADIO NETWORK HAS ALREADY BEEN ACTIVATED. 

BASICALLY CURRENT FORECAST AND GRIDS LOOK RIGHT ON TRACK...WITH AN 
UPDATE NEEDED FOR ZFP IF OR WHEN A WATCH IS ISSUED FOR OUR AREA.
WILL FRESHEN GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS AS WELL IF NEEDED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST TUE NOV 15 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A WARM FRONT ACROSS THE MID WEST AND A COLD FRONT 
ACROSS WESTERN ARKANSAS...OCCURRING IN ASSOCIATION WITH A STRONG 
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER THE OZARKS. TWO PRE-FRONTAL LINES OF 
CONVECTION HAVE EXPLODED ACROSS THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY EARLY THIS 
AFTERNOON...AND EXPECT THESE LINES OF CONVECTION TO SLOWLY ADVANCE 
EAST ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY THIS EVENING. DOWNSLOPING SOUTHERLY 
WINDS OVER THE REGION HAVE ALREADY RESULTED IN RECORD TEMPS AT TYS 
AND TRI EARLY THIS AFTERNOON. DEWPOINTS HAVE REMAINED IN THE 50S TO 
NEAR 60 ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...SO INSTABILITY LEVELS WILL LIKELY 
REMAIN MARGINAL THIS EVENING AS THE LINE OF CONVECTION APPROACHES 
THE PLATEAU. SPECIAL 18Z SOUNDING FROM NASHVILLE ALSO ONLY INDICATES 
A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIRMASS ACROSS MIDDLE TN...BUT WITH A STRONG 
WIND FIELD AND LARGE HELICITY VALUES. WITH A STRONG LOW-LEVEL JET 
AROUND 850 MB EXPECTED ALONG THE COLD FRONT...THINK THAT A LARGE 
DAMAGING WIND EVENT WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE AS THE FRONT APPROACHES 
THE FORECAST AREA TOWARDS MIDNIGHT AND THEREAFTER. LOW LEVEL (0-1 
KM) HELICITY VALUES REMAIN LARGE AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT ACROSS 
MIDDLE TN AND NORTHEAST TN THIS EVENING...SO THINK THAT AN ISOLATED 
TORNADO MAY BE POSSIBLE AROUND THE PLATEAU BEFORE THE AIRMASS 
STABILIZES OVERNIGHT. ON WEDNESDAY...A FEW SHOWERS WILL LIKELY 
LINGER BEHIND THE FRONT DURING THE MORNING HOURS...WITH MUCH COLDER 
AIR FILTERING INTO THE FORECAST AREA. IN FACT...TEMPS WILL LIKELY 
FALL THROUGHOUT THE DAY ON WEDNESDAY. A FEW SNOW SHOWERS MAY BE 
POSSIBLE WEDNESDAY EVENING ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AS STRONG UPSLOPE 
FLOW SQUEEZES OUT SOME LINGERING MOISTURE.


.LONG TERM...(THU THROUGH TUE)...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS AND ENSEMBLES 
GENERALLY AGREE THAT EASTERN CONUS WILL REMAIN IN LONG-WAVE TROUGH 
THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG-TERM PERIOD. HOWEVER...POOR AGREEMENT AMONG 
MODELS AND ENSEMBLES EXISTS REGARDING TIMING AND INTENSITY OF 
INDIVIDUAL EVENTS WITH LOW CONFIDENCE IN EXTENDED FORECAST THE 
RESULT. THUS HAVE NOT MADE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO EXTENDED 
FORECAST/GRIDS. GENERALLY FOLLOWED ENSEMBLE MEAN GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS. 
AT ANY RATE...LONG-WAVE TROUGH PORTENDS BELOW CLIMO TEMPS THROUGH 
EARLY NEXT WEEK.

OZARKS REGION. IN RESPONSE TO THIS STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM... 
SOUTHERLY WINDS SHOULD CONTINUE TO INCREASE TODAY ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. IN FACT...EXPECT DOWNSLOPING WINDS OFF THE MOUNTAINS 
THIS AFTERNOON...RESULTING IN LESS CLOUD COVER AND MORE WARMING 
ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY AREAS. SATELLITE IMAGES 
ALREADY REVEAL LARGE BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS ACROSS THESE AREAS. 
MORNING TEMPS ARE ALREADY WARMER THAN EXPECTED...SO WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO RAISE MAXES THIS AFTERNOON... 
ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY ZONES. LOCAL 
RADARS REVEAL SOME SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS ACROSS THE PLATEAU AND 
CENTRAL VALLEY...AND WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE WITH 30 POPS AREAWIDE FOR 
THIS AFTERNOON.

FXUS64 KMRX 150911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
411 AM EST TUE NOV 15 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH WED)...MAJOR NOVEMBER STORM SYSTEM
HEADED TOWARD AREA...BUT TIMING OF EVENTS SUCH THAT OUR AREA WILL
PROBABLY NOT GET MUCH IN THE WAY OF ANYTHING MAJOR. LOOKS LIKE
STORMS WILL HOLD OFF TO THE WEST UNTIL AFTER SUNSET FOR MOST OF THE
AREA...AND EVEN AFTER MIDNIGHT FOR A GOOD PART OF THE AREA. BY THAT
TIME LI VALUES ARE BARELY NEGATIVE AND CAPE VALUES ARE <500 J/KG
OVER ALMOST THE ENTIRE AREA. BEST CHANCES OF SEVERE WILL BE ON THE
SOUTHERN PLATEAU WHERE IT WILL BE EARLIER (EXTREME WEST PART OF AREA)
AND THE MOISTURE WILL BE BETTER (SOUTHERN PART OF AREA). 

EXPECT A WEAKENING SQUALL LINE TO ENTER THE AREA ALONG/AHEAD OF
FRONT...PROBABLY AFTER MIDNIGHT. BEST CHANCES FOR TYPE OF SEVERE SHOULD
MAINLY BE OUTFLOW WINDS FROM STORM CELLS MOVING AT 50-60 MPH.
EXPECT AIR MASS TO BE TOO STABLE TO GET MUCH SEVERE HAIL...AND
ROTATING UPDRAFTS SHOULD BE VERY LIMITED AS WELL. UNLESS AIR MASS
BECOMES MORE UNSTABLE...EVEN ROTATING UPDRAFTS WOULD HAVE VERY
DIFFICULT TIME GETTING ANY INSTABILITY IN REAR-FLANK
DOWNDRAFTS...SO TORNADO CHANCES SEEM SLIM AT BEST.

FRONT SHOULD EXIT THE AREA MID MORNING ON WEDNESDAY AND MAKE WAY
FOR LOTS OF COOL AIR FOR THE REST OF THE DAY.  FOR TEMPS...NOT
STRAYING FAR FROM GUIDANCE AND PREVIOUS PACKAGE IN FIRST TWO
PERIODS AND NON-DIRUNAL TEMPERATURE TREND ON WEDNESDAY WITH COLD
AIR ADVECTION OFFSETTING NORMAL INSOLATION.

.LONG TERM...(WED NIGHT THROUGH TUE)...LOOKS LIKE LOW LEVEL 
WINDS...MOISTURE DEPTH AND TEMP PROFILES WILL NOT BE OVERLY 
CONDUCIVE FOR LOW CLOUDS AND UPSLOPE PRECIP WED NIGHT. WILL KEEP 
NORTH MOSTLY CLOUDY FOR MUCH OF THE NIGHT...AND CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR SOME RAIN/SNOW SHOWERS FOR THE FIRST PART OF THE NIGHT IN 
FAR NORTHERN ZONES.  CLEARING SKY FOR THU AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS 
IN AND DRYING CONTINUES.  GFS SHOWS ANOTHER UPPER LEVEL TROUGH/WEAK 
SURFACE FRONT FOR FRIDAY/FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT KEEPS BETTER ENERGY AND 
MOISTURE NORTH OF OUR AREA.  WILL JUST INCREASE CLOUDS A BIT NORTH 
FOR NOW.  DRIER AIR DEPICTED AGAIN FOR SATURDAY.  JUST A FEW TWEAKS 
IN LATER PERIODS....WILL LEAVE SLIGHT CHANCE PRECIP IN FOR LATE 
SUNDAY/SUNDAY NIGHT OVER THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTH ASSOCIATED WITH 
NEXT UPPER TROUGH/WEAK SURFACE FRONT...ALTHOUGH MOISTURE MAY BE RATHER 
LIMITED WITH THIS SYSTEM AS WELL.

FXUS64 KMRX 141940
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EST MON NOV 14 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS 
SHOWS A WEST-TO-EAST ORIENTED WARM FRONT ACROSS CENTRAL EAST TN... 
WITH A LARGE AREA OF SHOWERS AND SOME EMBEDDED THUNDER OCCURRING IN 
ASSOCIATION WITH IT ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS WARM 
FRONT SHOULD CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTH THIS EVENING WITH GOOD UPPER- 
LEVEL DYNAMICS...SO EXPECT RAIN TO CONTINUE THIS EVENING BUT 
GRADUALLY DECREASE FROM SOUTH TO NORTH OVERNIGHT. MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH AMPLIFYING A LONG-WAVE TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS TONIGHT 
INTO TUESDAY...WHICH WILL DEEPEN A LOW PRESSURE AREA OVER THE MID 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND CREATE BREEZY WINDS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
ON TUESDAY. WITH STRONG SOUTHWEST FLOW EXPECTED...THINK THAT TEMPS 
TOMORROW WILL RISE HIGHER THAN GUIDANCE VALUES AND POSSIBLY APPROACH 
RECORD VALUES (CHA 77...TYS 76...OQT 74...TRI 75). THE STRONGEST 
DYNAMICS WITH THIS SYSTEM ON TUESDAY SHOULD BE LOCATED NORTH AND 
WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA...SO OVERALL...IT SHOULD BE A DRY DAY 
TOMORROW FOR MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...WILL CONTINUE WITH 
A SMALL POP TO ACCOUNT FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF A FEW SHOWERS.

BY TUESDAY NIGHT...MODELS INDICATE THAT A STRONG WIND FIELD WILL 
DEVELOP ALONG THE COLD FRONT AS IT MOVES ACROSS THE TENNESSEE RIVER 
VALLEY...RESULTING IN STRONG UPPER DYNAMICS ALONG THE FRONT. IN 
ADDITION...HELICITY VALUES BECOME QUITE LARGE AHEAD OF THE FRONT... 
WHICH SUGGESTS THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME SUPERCELLS DEVELOPING ACROSS 
THE TN RIVER VALLEY AHEAD OF THE MAIN FRONTAL BAND. THE AMOUNT OF 
INSTABILITY OVER THE FORECAST AREA REMAINS IN QUESTION...AND WILL 
ULTIMATELY DEPEND ON HOW MUCH WARMING OCCURS TOMORROW (AND HOW MUCH 
SOLAR WARMING OCCURS FROM POSSIBLE BREAKS IN THE CLOUD COVER). RIGHT 
NOW...IT WOULD APPEAR THAT A SIGNIFICANT SEVERE WEATHER OUTBREAK 
COULD DEVELOP AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY... 
WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF A FEW TORNADOES IN THE FORECAST AREA. WILL 
GO AHEAD AND ISSUE A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO MENTION THIS 
POSSIBLE SCENARIO FOR TUESDAY NIGHT. STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION 
BEHIND THE FRONT WILL RESULT IN FALLING TEMPS THROUGHOUT THE DAY ON 
WEDNESDAY.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...UPSLOPE FLOW NORTHWEST 
FLOW AND WRAP-AROUND BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE WILL PRODUCE A CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS (SOME SNOW SHOWERS) ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WEDNESDAY NIGHT. OTHERWISE...A RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL BUILD INTO THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY AND THURSDAY 
NIGHT WITH SKIES CLEARING. CALM WINDS...CLEAR SKY AND DRY AIRMASS 
WILL PRODUCE GOOD RADITIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS FOR FRIDAY MORNING...
SO COLDEST NIGHT OF THE SEASON EXPECTED.

ANOTHER SHORT-WAVE WILL DIG SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES FRIDAY
NIGHT AND SATURDAY WITH BRUNT OF THE ENERGY STAYING WELL NORTH OF THE
REGION NEXT WEEKEND. HOWEVER...ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS
THE REGION SUNDAY BRINGING WITH IT ANOTHER SHOT OF COLD AIR WITH 850
MB TEMPERATURES DROPPING TO -5 TO -8 DEGREES. AIRMASS TOO DRY FOR 
PRECIPITATION WITH FROPA...BUT ENOUGH WRAP-AROUND BOUNDARY LAYER 
MOISTURE AND UPSLOPE FLOW TO INCLUDE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN/SNOW
SHOWERS FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE SUNDAY NIGHT.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             58  75  49  49 /  70  50  90  60

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK QUASI-STATIONARY FRONT LOCATED

ALABAMA...OCCURRING IN ASSOCIATION WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE 
MOVING AHEAD OF A DEEPENING LONG-WAVE TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS. THE STATIONARY FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE NORTH AS A WARM 
FRONT TODAY...WITH THE AREA OF RAIN OVER NORTHERN ALABAMA EXPECTED 
TO CONTINUE SPREADING NORTHEAST ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. 

WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL PLAN TO RAISE POPS TODAY ACROSS THE ENTIRE 
FORECAST AREA...AND WILL ALSO MENTION THUNDER. FORECAST TEMPS FOR 
THIS AFTERNOON LOOK REASONABLE...AND WILL NOT PLAN TO CHANGE IN THE 
UPDATE.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 140918
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EST MON NOV 14 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK COLD FRONT HAS BECOME NEARLY 
STATIONARY JUST NORTHWEST OF OUR AREA.  EXPECT FRONT TO MAKE LITTLE 
ADDITIONAL PROGRESS SOUTHEAST...BEFORE LIFTING BACK NORTH AS A WARM 
FRONT LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT.  CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE WILL LINGER 
OVER OUR AREA...AND ANY WEAK IMPULSES IN THE FLOW WILL LIKELY 
TRIGGER SOME SHOWERS.  HOWEVER...DIFFICULT TO FIND MUCH IN THE WAY 
OF ORGANIZED FORCING FOR OUR AREA...SO WILL CONTINUE RECENT TREND OF 
UNDERCUTTING GUIDANCE POPS.  INSTABILITY STILL UNIMPRESSIVE THROUGH 
TONIGHT...SO WHILE THUNDER CAN NOT BE RULED OUT...WILL LEAVE MENTION 
OUT OF FORECAST FOR NOW.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO 
WILL STAY CLOSE.     

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...FORECAST AREA IN THE WARM 
SECTOR OF CENTRAL U.S. STORM SYSTEM DURING THE DAY TUESDAY AND KEPT 
SMALL CHANCE POPS GOING WITH FAIRLY DECENT MOISTURE ADVECTION 
PASSAGE OF A COUPLE WEAK IMPULSES AND SOME ISENTROPIC LIFT. MAIN 
EVENT OCCURS TUESDAY NIGHT FROM AROUND 05Z THROUGH 12Z WEDNESDAY AS 
HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER TROF BUILDS EAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES 
PUSHING STRONG COLD FRONT INTO THE REGION. USED CATEGORICAL POPS FOR 
THE FROPA WHICH FEATURES A SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS 
COMPLIMENTS OF SPC ALTHOUGH MODEL INSTABILITY WAS NOT TOO 
IMPRESSIVE. HELD ONTO POPS IN THE MORNING WEDNESDAY AS POWERFUL 
UPPER TROF A LITTLE SLOW TO SHIFT EAST. USED SOME MOSTLY CLOUDY 
SKIES NORTHERN SECTIONS AS ENERGY DROPS INTO THE BACK SIDE OF UPPER 
LEVEL TROF. FOLLOWING PASSAGE OF THIS SYSTEM UPPER LEVEL FLO GOES 
ZONAL FOR A BRIEF TIME ON THURSDAY FOR A DRY FORECAST. MEDIUM RANGE 
MODELS PROG ANOTHER UPPER TROF WITH COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE FRIDAY 
NIGHT INTO SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY BUT MOISTURE 
LACKING SO KEPT THIS PERIOD DRY AS WELL. DID NOT STRAY FAR FROM 
GUIDANCE TEMPS.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 131930
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
227 PM EST SUN NOV 13 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...SURPRISINGLY DIFFICULT FORECAST, 
ESPECIALLY ON THE POP PART. CURRENTLY COLD FRONT LIES ACROSS 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY MOVING SLOWLY EAST. DEWPOINT DEPRESSIONS 
HAVE LOWERED DRAMATICALLY TODAY, AND HELD OUT THE HOPE FOR SOME RAIN 
OVER THE ENTIRE AREA. LIFTING MECHANISMS HAVE BEEN WEAK AND WILL 
CONTINUE TO BE SO EVEN AS UPPER TROF MOVES ACROSS AREA TONIGHT AND 
TOMORROW. TROUBLE IS, THAT THE COLDEST AIR ALOFT IS WELL NORTH, WITH 
ONLY -14C OR SO AT H5. THIS NOT BE ENOUGH TO GENERATE THUNDERSTORMS, 
AND EVEN THE H7 LIFT IS DEBATABLE OVERNIGHT. FRONT WEAKENS AS IT 
MOVES EAST AND BECOMES BARELY DISCERNABLE. MOS GUIDANCE IS QUITE 
UNREALISTICALLY HIGH, WITH LIKELIES AND EVEN CATEGORICAL POPS 
OVERNIGHT, WITH VERY LOW QPF LIKELY. THIS PRESENTS A DILLEMA: HIGH 
POPS GIVE THE IMPRESSION OF A DELUGE FORECAST. HAVE COUNTERED THE 
MODEL GUIDANCE WITH HIGH CHANCES TO LOW LIKELIES AND SERIOUSLY 
LOWERED THE QPF THROUGH MONDAY. WENT BASICALLY WITH BLEND TEMPS.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...
THERE WILL BE PLENTY OF MOISTURE BUT LIFTING MECHANISMS WILL BE 
LACKING FOR PRECIP MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. MOS POPS ARE LIKELY TO 
CATEGORICAL...WHICH SEEMS WAY TOO HIGH AS THE ONLY LIFT IN THE NAM 
IS WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT. THE GFS SUFFERS FROM CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK 
PROBLEMS SO ITS HIGH POPS AND QPF WILL BE MOSTLY IGNORED. WILL HAVE 
CHANCE POPS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...RISING TO LIKELY POPS IN THE 
WEST TUESDAY NIGHT AS THE NEXT FRONT APPROACHES. THE MODELS HAVE 
SLOWED DOWN THIS SYSTEM...AND TIME FRAME OF GREATEST LIFT LOOKS TO 
BE BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z. DYNAMICS WITH THE TROUGH/JET ARE IMPRESSIVE SO 
THUNDER WILL CONTINUE TO BE MENTIONED THOUGH THE FRONT COMES THROUGH 
OVERNIGHT. WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS EAST/CHANCE WEST THROUGH WEDNESDAY 
MORNING...DECREASING QUICKLY TO SLIGHT CHANCES EAST WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON. BEHIND THE FRONT...THE GFS HAS TRENDED FARTHER NORTH WITH 
THE UPPER TROUGH VORTICITY AND WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE. WILL REMOVE 
POPS AND SNOW MENTION ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BUT KEEP MOSTLY CLOUDY 
SKIES IN THE NORTHEAST AS MOISTURE IS CONFINED BELOW 850 MB. 

FORECAST WILL REMAIN DRY WITH BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES THURSDAY 
THROUGH SUNDAY. A SERIES OF SHORTWAVE TROUGHS DIVE SOUTHEAST OUT OF 
CANADA...BRINING REINFORCING SHOTS OF COLD DRY AIR. MOISTURE IS 
LIMITED WITH EACH SYSTEM AND MAY ONLY INCREASE CLOUDS. 

&&

HIGH RIGHT AT THE MOMENT BUT AS LOWER ATMOSPHERE MOISTENS, THEY WILL 
LOOK BETTER AND BETTER AS THE DAYS GOES ON. WILL THEREFORE LEAVE 
ALONE.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS IN GENERAL AGREEMENT FOR

TONIGHT.  MODELS AGREE ON BRINGING DEEP MOISTURE INTO THE AREA...BUT

INSTABILITY MINIMAL.  WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS MOST ZONES

TONIGHT. WILL MENTION ONLY SHOWERS FOR NOW...AND WHILE POPS WILL BE 
FAIRLY HIGH...EXPECT ONLY LOW AMOUNTS OF PRECIP. MAV TEMPS GENERALLY 
LOOK REASONABLE...SO ONLY A FEW MINOR TWEAKS.    

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...COOL FRONT STALLS OVER THE 
APPALACHIANS EARLY ON MONDAY AND THEN MOVES SLOWLY NORTH ACROSS THE

FROM THE WESTERN CANADIAN PROVINCES INTO THE NORTH CENTRAL U.S.

MOISTURE ADVECTION MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT AS LOW LEVEL FLO 
STRENGTHENS. USED CHANCE POPS FOR THIS PERIOD. UPPER TROF AND 
ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM PRESS STEADILY EAST ON TUESDAY AND KEPT 
POPS IN THE CHANCE RANGE FOR THIS PERIOD RAISING TO LIKELY TUESDAY 
NIGHT FOR FROPA. LIS AND CAPE INDICATIVE OF CONVECTION AND STAYED 
WITH SHRA/TSRA FOR THE EVENT TUESDAY NIGHT WHICH FEATURES HIGHER 
PWS FOR MORE SUBSTANTIAL RAINFALL THAN INITIAL FRONT AFFECTING THE 
AREA SUNDAY NIGHT. FROPA OCCURS A LITTLE BEFORE 12Z WED WITH MORE 
ENERGY DROPPING INTO TRAILING UPPER LEVEL TROF ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES/MIDWEST. SUFFICIENT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE/LIFT FOR THE PRODUCTION 
OF SCATTERED -SHRA AND -SHSN IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE DURING THE DAY WEDNESDAY INTO 
WEDNESDAY EVENING. LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATION EXPECTED ATTM. 
FOLLOWING PASSAGE OF THIS SYSTEM UPPER LEVEL FLO GOES ZONAL FOR A 
BRIEF TIME ON THURSDAY FOR A DRY FORECAST. MEDIUM RANGE MODELS PROG 
ANOTHER UPPER TROF WITH COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO

FXUS64 KMRX 121904
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
202 PM EST SAT NOV 12 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...CURRENTLY WEAK RIDGE OVER EASTERN 
CONUS IS RAPIDLY MOVING EAST. UPPER TROF AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT 
OUT OVER THE MISSOURI VALLEY WILL APPROACH EAST TENNESSEE SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON. EXPECT SLOW MOVEMENT OF BROAD FRONTAL ZONE TO ENTER THE 
FORECAST AREA BETWEEN 18-21Z SUNDAY. VIRTUALLY NO CAPE ASSOCIATED 
WITH THIS ZONE, AND SOME CIN WILL KEEP MUCH STRONG UVV FROM 
HAPPENING. HOWEVER K INDEX VALUES ARE IN THE UPPER 20S-LOW 30S AND 
INDICATE THAT LAYER HUMIDITY WILL INCREASE IN RESPONSE TO RETURN 
FLOW FROM SFC HIGH AND FROM COLD TEMPS ALOFT INCREASING OVERALL 
SFC-H5 RH. THIS WILL BE SUFFICIENT TO INCREASE POPS DRAMATICALLY 
LATE TOMORROW MORNING INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS. WITH ADEQUATE SFC 
HEATING TODAY AND SOME OVERNIGHT CLOUDS INHIBITING COOLING, EXPECT 
THAT PRESENCE OF WEAK FRONT WILL BE ENOUGH TO TRIGGER ISOLATED 
THUNDER TOMORROW, WITH CHANCES INCREASING AS DAY PROGRESSES. HAVE 
KNOCKED MAX TEMPS DOWN A HAIR, AND OVERNIGHT MINS UP A HAIR, DUE TO 
INCREASING CLOUD COVER AND POPS. DONT EXPECT MUCH IN THE WAY OF 
RAINFALL AMOUNTS, AS ATMOSPHERE IS SO DRY, POPS AND QPF ARE NOT 
NECESSARILY DEPENDANT ON ONE ANOTHER.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...COLD FRONT STALLS 
OVER THE AREA ON SUNDAY NIGHT...AND A SHORTWAVE TROUGH PASSES 
OVERHEAD. WILL RAISE POPS TO LIKELY BEFORE MIDNIGHT WITH A MENTION 
OF ONLY ISOLATED THUNDER...AS INSTABILITY IS VERY WEAK. ON MONDAY 
THE 850 MB FLOW TURNS TO THE SOUTH AND INCREASES IN RESPONSE TO AN 
APPROACHING CLOSED LOW COMING OUT OF CANADA. RESULTING ISENTROPIC 
LIFT WILL RESULT IN CHANCE POPS MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT. PRECIP WILL 
LIKELY BE LIGHT HOWEVER TO DUE A LACK OF OTHER FORCING MECHANISMS. 
GFS APPEARS TO HAVE CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK PROBLEMS DURING THIS TIME 
AND ITS OMEGA MAXES WILL BE IGNORED. 

DIGGING UPPER TROUGH AND STRONG UPPER JET WILL BRING STRONG LIFT TO 
THE AREA ON TUESDAY EVENING. POPS WILL BE RAISED TO LIKELY. COLD 
FRONT WILL BE THROUGH THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY MORNING WITH THE UPPER 
TROUGH AXIS LINGERING BEHIND. SOME WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE...A 
NORTHWEST UPSLOPE FLOW...AND VORTICITY WITH THE TROUGH AXIS COULD 
PROVIDE SOME PRECIP ACROSS SW VA ON WEDNESDAY. TEMPS MAY BE COLD 
ENOUGH FOR SNOW...AND WILL MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE ABOVE 2KFT. HIGH 
PRESSURE AND A WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT PROVIDE DRY AND BELOW NORMAL TEMPS 
THROUGH FRIDAY. A LONGWAVE TROUGH DEEPENS OVER THE EASTERN CONUS ON 
SATURDAY WITH ANOTHER FROPA...BUT IT APPEARS TO BE DRY AT THIS TIME.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EST SAT NOV 12 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE WILL SHIFT EAST OF 
THE AREA TONIGHT. THE ATMOSPHERE WILL REMAIN QUITE DRY TODAY...SO A 
MOSTLY CLEAR SKY EXPECTED.  MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE AHEAD OF 
AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT LATE TONIGHT...SO EXPECT CLOUDS TO BEGIN 
TO INCREASE LATE...ESPECIALLY OVER WESTERN COUNTIES.  LOOKS LIKE ANY 
PRECIPITATION WILL HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER TONIGHT...SO DRY THROUGH THE 
SHORT TERM PERIOD.  WILL MAKE A FEW MINOR TWEAKS TO MAV TEMPS...BUT 
OVERALL THEY LOOK REASONABLE SO WILL NOT STRAY FAR.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...TIS THE SEASON OF NUMEROUS 
FROPA AS AN UPPER TROF DRIVES EAST ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES DRAGGING A 
COLD FRONT TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA. NUDGED POPS UP TEN PERCENT 
ACROSS THE BOARD FOR SUNDAY WITH LIKELY POPS ON THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU NEAR THE KENTUCKY BORDER AND CHANCE POPS ELSEWHERE. FRONT 
BECOMES A SLOW MOVER AS MORE ENERGY BUILDS INTO THE BACK SIDE OF 
BROAD TROF ACROSS THE U.S. CAUSING UPPER LEVEL FLOW TO TURN MORE 
SOUTHWESTERLY WHICH EVENTUALLY STALLS FRONTAL BOUNDARY NEAR THE 
APPALACHIANS ON MONDAY REQUIRING THE CONTINUED USE OF POPS FOR 
-SHRA/-TSRA DURING THE DAY AND EVENING AS LOW LEVEL WINDS BECOME 
SOUTHERLY AHEAD OF AMPLIFYING TROF OVER THE CENTRAL U.S. MODELS 
INDICATE SUFFICIENT MOISTURE WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT DEVELOPING. UPPER 
TROF STRENGTHENS WITH ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT BUILDING THROUGH THE 
REGION ON TUESDAY. USED 50 PERCENT POPS FOR SHRA/TSRA FOR EVENT. 
MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW TRAILING S/WV ENERGY DROPPING INTO THE BACK 
SIDE OF EASTERN GREAT LAKES UPPER TROF WITH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND 
CAA/UPSLOPE COMPONENT FOR CHANCE -SHRA ACROSS TERRAIN AREAS 
INCLUDING THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINA 
AS WELL AS TENNESSEE/NORTH CAROLINA BORDER. DRIER WEST NORTHWESTERLY 
FLO DEVELOPS THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD ALLOWING PRECIP 
FREE GRIDS. ADJUSTED TEMP GRIDS SLIGHTLY WITH NEW GFS MOS GUIDANCE 
THROUGH FRIDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
206 PM EST FRI NOV 11 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE AREA WILL ONCE AGAIN GIVE GOOD RADIATIONAL 
COOLING CONDITIONS OVERNIGHT. WILL UNDERCUT MOS GUIDANCE BY A COUPLE 
DEGREES...AND HAVE LOWS IN THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S. DEWPOINTS 
SHOULD RECOVER AFTER SUNSET FROM THE SINGLE DIGITS CURRENTLY 
OBSERVED IN SEVERAL LOCATIONS. SKIES REMAIN CLEAR THROUGH SATURDAY 
NIGHT...AND HIGH TEMPS SATURDAY SHOULD REACH THE 65 TO 70 RANGE.

A DEEP SOUTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS SATURDAY NIGHT AS THE RIDGE AXIS 
SHIFTS EAST. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ADVECTION KICKS IN ON SUNDAY 
MORNING...AND THE MID LEVEL VORT AXIS AND UPPER JET PROVIDE LIFT ON 
SUNDAY AFTERNOON. INSTABILITY LOOKS LIMITED BUT LIFT SHOULD BE 
STRONG ENOUGH TO CONTINUE MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS. WILL HAVE HIGH 
CHANCE POPS SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MIDNIGHT. THE SURFACE FRONT 
APPEARS TO STALL SOMEWHERE NEAR THE MOUNTAINS ACCORDING TO THE 
GFS...SO WILL LEAVE A LOW TO SLIGHT CHANCE MENTION IN FOR MONDAY IN 
THE EAST.  

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...
A LONGWAVE TROUGH DIGS SOUTH OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS ON MONDAY 
NIGHT...PUSHING A COLD FRONT INTO THE AREA ON TUESDAY. 12Z GFS 
PLACES THE GREATEST LIFT OVER THE AREA AT 18Z...AND GIVEN THE 
STRENGTH OF THE UPPER JET JUST TO THE NORTH THE LIFT COULD BE QUITE 
STRONG. WILL NUDGE POPS UP A BIT AND CONTINUE MENTION OF 
THUNDERSTORMS. THE GFS SEEMS TO BE THE FASTEST OF THE MODELS SO WILL 
KEEP A POP IN ON TUESDAY NIGHT TO ACCOUNT FOR THE SLIGHTLY SLOWER 
DGEX AND ECMWF. SOME WRAP AROUND MOISTURE AND COOLING ALOFT COULD 
PRODUCE SOME SHOWERS IN SW VA ON WEDNESDAY...AND WILL HAVE A SLIGHT 
CHANCE POP THERE. AIR MASS BEHIND THIS FRONT IS QUITE COLD AND 
DRY...WITH DROPPING TEMPS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY BELOW NORMAL. GFS 
SHOWS ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHING FOR FRIDAY...BUT WITH A WESTERLY 
FLOW ALOFT AND LIMITED MOISTURE...WILL BEGIN FRIDAY DRY.

ON SATURDAY BUT AN UPPER TROF WITH FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL SHIFT EAST 
INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY EARLY SUNDAY AND WILL PRESS INTO THE

SMALL/SLGT CHC POPS GOING INTO MONDAY AS COLD FRONT SLOWS AND 
WEAKENS JUST SOUTH OF THE REGION. YET ANOTHER UPPER TROF DROPS SOUTH 
THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES DRIVING A MORE ROBUST COLD FRONT TOWARD THE 
MID SOUTH ON TUESDAY AND MAINTAINED LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THIS EVENT 
AND HELD ONTO TO SMALL/SLGT CHANCE POPS TUESDAY NIGHT INTO PART OF 
WEDNESDAY AS UPPER TROF LOOKING MORE LIKE WINTER WITH SEEMINGLY 
NEVER ENDING VORTS DROPPING THROUGH THE BACK SIDE OF THE TROF WITH 
CAA AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE TO KEEP -SHRA AROUND THROUGH THIS PERIOD. 
DRIER NW FLO DEVELOPS AS SFC RIDGE STRENGTHENS LATER WEDNESDAY INTO 
THURSDAY FOR A DRY PERIOD AT THE END OF THE 7 DAY FORECAST. TRIED TO 
ADJUST TEMPS TOWARD NEW GFS MOS WHILE STAYING WITHIN THE BOUNDS OF 
WFO COORDINATION THROUGH THE PERIOD.

925 PM EST THU NOV 10 2005

SON

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION:
SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...
HIGH AMPLITUDE RIDGE WILL BE MOVING OVERHEAD THIS PERIOD. SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE CENTERED OVER THE AREA TONIGHT...SO WINDS 
SHOULD DECOUPLE AND ALLOW TEMPS TO DROP INTO THE LOWER 30S IN THE 
SOUTHERN VALLEY TO MIDDLE 20S IN THE MTNS AND IN SW VA. WITH NEAR 
NEUTRAL ADVECTION TOMORROW AND FULL SUN...HIGHS SHOULD BE WARMER 
THAN TODAY...IN THE UPPER 50S TO MIDDLE 60S. ANOTHER GOOD 
RADIATIONAL COOLING NIGHT ON FRIDAY NIGHT WILL GIVE LOWS IN THE 
UPPER 20S TO MIDDLE 30S. WITH THE HIGH SHIFTING FARTHER EAST A 
SOUTHWEST FLOW DEVELOPS...RESULTING IN A WARMING TREND THROUGH 
SATURDAY NIGHT. HIGHS SATURDAY WILL BE IN THE LOWER 60S TO AROUND 
70...WITH LOWS SATURDAY NIGHT IN THE UPPER 30S TO MIDDLE 40S. 

LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...
A COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE AREA ON SUNDAY...THOUGH THE MODELS 
DIFFER ON THE TIMING OF PRECIP WITH THE FRONT. GFS HAS TRENDED 
FASTER AND BRINGS PRECIP INTO WESTERN SECTIONS BEFORE 18Z 
SUNDAY...WHILE THE NAM REMAINS SLOWER WITH NO PRECIP UNTIL AROUND 
00Z. WITH UPPER LEVEL FORCING BEING RELATIVELY WEAK...SURFACE BASED 
INSTABILITY WILL LIKELY PLAY A PRIMARY ROLE IN CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT...SO WILL RAISE POPS SUNDAY AFTERNOON. GFS HAS BEEN 
INCONSISTENT IN THE PLACEMENT OF THE FRONT SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
MONDAY. THE 12Z RUN TAKES IT JUST EAST OF THE MTNS...WHILE THE 
PREVIOUS RUN HAD IT DIRECTLY OVER EAST TN. WILL KEEP A LOW CHANCE 
POP EAST TO A SLIGHT CHANCE POP WEST FOR MONDAY. WILL HAVE MONDAY 
NIGHT DRY AHEAD OF THE NEXT APPROACHING FRONT...WHICH CROSSES THE 
AREA ON TUESDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING. THE UPPER TROUGH IS DEEPER WITH 
THIS FRONT SO WILL BUMP UP POPS AND ADD A MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS. 
A DRY AND COOL AIR MASS BUILDS IN BEHIND THE FRONT FOR WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY...WITH HIGH TEMPS IN THE 50S.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
220 PM EST WED NOV 9 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...
COLD FRONT ACROSS SRN IN/WRN KY WILL CROSS THE AREA TONIGHT. SHOWERS 
THAT HAVE DEVELOPED ACROSS MIDDLE TN DO NOT APPEAR TO BE VERY DEEP 
DUE TO THE STRONG MIDLEVEL INVERSION IN THE OHX SOUNDING THIS 
MORNING. 850 MB THETA-E RIDGE WILL EXTEND OVER THE AREA AROUND 
03Z...AND THE DIGGING UPPER JET WILL CREATE UPPER DIVERGENCE AROUND 
THE SAME TIME. HOWEVER THE INSTABILITY APPEARS MARGINAL AT BEST AS 
MOISTURE IS LACKING. SURFACE HEATING WILL ALSO BE LOST AT THE TIME 
OF FROPA. THUS THE SEVERE THREAT APPEARS TO BE MINIMAL...AND 
THUNDERSTORM COVERAGE WILL BE MAINLY ISOLATED. MOS GUIDANCE POPS ARE 
ALL LIKELY OR HIGHER OVERNIGHT...BUT WILL HAVE LIKELY POPS ONLY IN 
THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND SW VA WITH CHANCE POPS ELSEWHERE. 

FRONT WILL BE THROUGH THE AREA BEFORE 12Z TOMORROW. A MUCH DRIER AIR 
MASS WILL BUILD INTO THE AREA WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE 20S. WINDS WILL 
ALSO INCREASE TO 15 TO 25 MPH...WITH GUSTS IN THE MOUNTAINS UP TO 
35. HOWEVER AFTER SUNSET WE SHOULD DECOUPLE NICELY AS THE HIGH 
PRESSURE CENTER MOVES OVERHEAD. WILL UNDERCUT MOS TEMPS A BIT AND 
HAVE LOWS MAINLY IN THE UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S. A LARGE HIGH 
PRESSURE RIDGE WILL BE CROSSING THE AREA FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY...GIVING CLEAR SKIES AND GRADUALLY WARMING TEMPS...WITH 
HIGHS INTO THE MID/UPPER 60S BY SATURDAY. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
RIDGE AXIS WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA ON SATURDAY NIGHT...GIVING A 
DEEP SOUTHWEST FLOW AHEAD OF AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT. THE MODELS 
ARE IN BASIC AGREEMENT ON THE FRONT MOVING ACROSS THE AREA SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON AND SUNDAY NIGHT. FLOW ALOFT IS NEARLY PARALLEL TO THE 
FRONT...SO ONCE IT HITS THE MOUNTAINS IT BECOMES NEARLY STATIONARY. 
THUS WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS IN THE MOUNTAINS THROUGH MONDAY. A 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH PUSHES THE FRONT FARTHER EAST ON MONDAY 
NIGHT...THEN A SECOND FRONT APPROACHES ON TUESDAY/TUESDAY NIGHT. 
THIS FRONT LOOKS MOISTURE STARVED BUT WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS. 
FRONT SHOULD BE THROUGH BY WEDNESDAY WITH CLEARING SKIES AND COOLING 
TEMPS BEHIND.

POSSIBLE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...WITH A STRONG WIND 
FIELD EXPECTED ALONG THE FRONT.

FORECAST AREA BEHIND THE FRONT ON THURSDAY. A MODERATING TREND WILL 
THEN QUICKLY DEVELOP BY THE WEEKEND...AS AN UPPER RIDGE BUILDS 
ACROSS THE REGION. GFS MODEL INDICATES THAT THE NEXT COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVE INTO THE AREA BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON...WITH ANOTHER CHANCE FOR 
CONVECTION THROUGH MONDAY MORNING. 

ANOTHER DAY OF UNSEASONABLY WARM TEMPS IS EXPECTED TODAY...AND WILL 
TREND WARMER THAN GUIDANCE TEMPS. RECORD HIGHS ARE AGAIN EXPECTED... 
POSSIBLY AT ALL FOUR OBSERVATION SITES. THE RECORD HIGHS FOR TODAY 
ARE 79 (CHA)...78 (TYS)...77 (OQT)...AND 78 (TRI).

NIGHT MAY KEEP CONVECTION LIMITED. MUCH COOLER AIR INVADES THE MID

NORMAL IN THE UPPER 50S NORTH AND LOW TO MID 60S SOUTH. SHOULD BE 
QUITE A BIT COLDER THURSDAY NIGHT WITH MINS AROUND 5 TO 10 DEGREES 
BELOW NORMAL DUE TO RADIATION IN CALM WIND DRY AND ATMOSPHERE 
ENVIRONMENT.   

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED 
OVER THE AREA ON FRI AND RIDGING ALOFT SHIFT EAST THRU SUNDAY. DRY 
CONDITIONS WITH COOL NIGHTS AND WARM DAYS(10+ DEGREES ABV CLIMO) 
INTO SAT. MODEL SOLUTIONS BEGINNING TO SHIFT WITH MORE UNCERTAINTY 
IN THE ENSEMBLES LATER IN THE PERIOD. THE NORTHERN STREAM FLOW IS 
PROGGED TO BECOME MORE AMPLIFIED. CUT-OFF MOVES FARTHER NE TO NR 
IOWA BY EARLY SUN...BEFORE STRONG JET CARVES SE ...ABSORBING THE 
CUT-OFF...RESULTING IN FAIRLY BROAD TROUGHING DOWN INTO TN VLY BY 
SUN AFTN. PCPN CHC BEGIN ACROSS E TN SUN AFTN AND PEAK ON MON 
MORNING AS COLD FRONT MOVES THRU...LOWER PCPN CHCS CONTINUE ON MON 
TIL UPR TROUGH AXIS MOVES THRU. AGAIN...POST FRONTAL AIRMASS NOT 
VERY COLD WITH ANOTHER COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE PSBL TUE NGT.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EST TUE NOV 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...WITH A WARM FRONT STRETCHING FROM WEST TN 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS NORTHERN AL AND CENTRAL GA. DEWPOINTS WERE IN THE 
50S SOUTH OF THIS WARM FRONT...AND EXPECT THESE HIGHER DEWPOINTS TO 
ADVECT INTO THE FORECAST AREA TODAY AS THIS WARM FRONT MOVES NORTH. 
THIS WARM FRONT SHOULD COMBINE WITH SOME MARGINAL INSTABILITY AND A 
SHORT WAVE OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY TO PRODUCE SOME ISOLATED 
CONVECTION ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA TODAY. AFTER THIS 
WARM FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA...THE LOCAL AIRMASS SHOULD BE 
CAPPED ON WEDNESDAY...PREVENTING ANY CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT IN THE 
AFTERNOON DESPITE A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIRMASS. UNSEASONABLY WARM 
TEMPS ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE ACROSS THE REGION TODAY AND 
WEDNESDAY...WITH NEAR RECORD HIGHS EXPECTED AGAIN ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THAT A STRONG COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BRINGING SCATTERED CONVECTION. 
IN FACT...THINK THAT SOME SEVERE WEATHER WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH A 
STRONG WIND FIELD EXPECTED ALONG THE FRONT. MUCH COLDER TEMPS (BUT 
ACTUALLY CLOSER TO NORMAL) WILL MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA BEHIND 
THE FRONT ON THURSDAY. A MODERATING TREND WILL QUICKLY DEVELOP BY 
THE WEEKEND...AS AN UPPER RIDGE BUILDS ACROSS THE REGION. GFS MODEL 
INDICATES THAT THE NEXT COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA BY SUNDAY 
NIGHT INTO MONDAY...WITH ANOTHER CHANCE FOR CONVECTION.

HIGH SETTLES INTO REGION.  DID NOT CHANGE GRIDS FOR NEXT WEEKEND.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER FLOW BECOMES
ZONAL INTO MID WEEK...WITH NAM AND GFS SUGGESTING A POSSIBLE WEAK
IMPULSE IN THIS FLOW (AIDED BY WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT) MAY GENERATE
SOME SPOTTY VERY LIGHT RAINS VERY LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY.
NAM SEEMS TO SLIGHTLY OVERDO THIS FEATURE WITH GFS MOS POPS STAYING
BELOW 20 PERCENT ACROSS THE BOARD. DECIDED TO TREND MORE WITH THE
GFS SOLUTION AND ONLY MENTION SPRINKLES FOR CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND
EXTREME SWRN VA ZONES FOR NOW...AND THIS ALSO MESHES WITH JKL GRIDS.

OTHERWISE...TIMING OF EAST TO WEST ORIENTED COLD FRONT LOOKS
SIMILAR FOR A BETTER CHANCE OF SHOWERS WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO
THURSDAY NIGHT. SO NO CHANGES MADE FOR THOSE PERIODS...ALTHO DID
ADJUST DEWPOINT TEMPS A BIT FROM MONDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY NIGHT.

SURFACE RIDGE BUILDS IN ON FRIDAY AND FELT THAT JUST A POSSIBLE
LINGERING WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY DID NOT JUSTIFY KEEPING LOW POPS
FOR FRIDAY.  A SLIGHTLY MORE AMPLIFIED SHORTWAVE AND BETTER COLD
FRONT LOOK TO BRING AT LEAST CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY...AND I
INCLUDED A MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS AS INSTABILITY APPEARED TO BE
SIMILAR TO TODAYS CONDITIONS.

TO 10 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL TODAY AND TONIGHT.

GENERALLY TRANQUIL CONDITIONS WITH WELL-ABOVE-CLIMO TEMPS RETURNING 
AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS BACK INTO THE REGION. BOTH THE NAM AND GFS 
SUGGEST A MINOR NORTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE MAY AFFECT THE NORTHERN 
TIER OF OUR FORECAST AREA EARLY TUESDAY...BUT THE SHORT-RANGE 
ENSEMBLES AND CANADIAN GEM DO NOT SUPPORT THIS EVENT. WILL LEAVE 
FORECAST/GRIDS DRY FOR NOW. GFS HAS ALMOST COMPLETELY BACKED OFF THE 
VIGOROUS UPPER TROUGH/SURFACE COLD FRONT IT HAD BEEN ADVERTISING FOR 
THURSDAY. WILL NOT MAKE ANY CHANGES AT THIS TIME WITH THE 
UNCERTAINTY ASSOCIATED WITH POOR RUN-TO-RUN CONSISTENCY AND 
DIFFERING SCENARIOS DEPICTED BY ENSEMBLES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
905 PM EST FRI NOV 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...A BROAD TROUGH IS DEVELOPING OVER THE MIDDLE OF THE 
COUNTRY WITH SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT OVER THE FORECAST AREA. AS A 
RESULT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IS GRADUALLY INCREASING THIS EVENING WITH 
DEWPOINTS RISING TO THE MID TO UPPER 40S NORTH AND LOWER TO MID 50S 
SOUTH. INTERMITTENT MID AND HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE IS ALSO SPREADING 
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FROM THE WEST 
AND SOUTHWEST. THE NAM SHOWS A VORTICITY MAXIMUM OVER THE ARKLATEX 
THIS EVENING MOVING NORTHEAST AND STRENGTHENING WHEN IT REACHES EAST 
TN SATURDAY. THIS DOES NOT REACH THE FORECAST AREA UNTIL AROUND 
DAYBREAK SO DO NOT EXPECT ANY SHOWERS OVERNIGHT. EXPECT CLOUDS TO 
VERY SLOWLY INCREASE BUT STILL REMAIN IN THE PARTLY CLOUDY RANGE. 
LOWS SHOULD CONTINUE TO DROP TO NEAR DEWPOINTS WHICH IS WHAT IS IN 
THE FORECAST NOW. WITH SOME CLOUD COVER DO NOT EXPECT ANY 
SIGNIFICANT FOG. NO CHANGES TO CURRENT FORECAST.

THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE POPS GOING FOR 
SATURDAY NIGHT.  BETTER CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION WILL HOLD OFF 
UNTIL SUNDAY AS COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA.  WILL KEEP CHANCE 
POPS FOR SUNDAY.  FRONT EXITS AREA LATE SUNDAY...WILL KEEP SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR THE EVENING HOURS AS DRY WEATHER EXPECTED AFTER 
MIDNIGHT.  HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS ON MONDAY...BRINGING DRY WEATHER 
FOR MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  GFS INDICATING A WEAK WAVE MOVING 
THROUGH ON TUESDAY...BUT THINK MOISTURE LIMITED SO WILL CONTINUE A 
DRY FORECAST.  ANOTHER FRONT MOVES INTO REGION ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  
WILL ADD SLIGHT CHANCES POPS FOR WEDNESDAY AND KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR 
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT.  FRONT SHOULD BE EAST OF AREA...BUT 
UPPER TROUGH STILL LINGERING SO WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
FRIDAY.

MOISTURE LEVELS WITH A SLIGHT INCREASE IN CLOUDS. TEMPS SHOULD BE 
AROUND 10 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL TODAY FOR MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
WARMER TEMPS ARE EXPECTED AGAIN TONIGHT ACROSS THE PLATEAU AND 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA...WHERE CLOUDS AND STEADY WINDS 
WILL PREVENT TEMPS FROM FALLING TOO RAPIDLY.


.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAIN FORECAST ISSUE REMAINS 
TIMING AND INTENSITY OF UPCOMING WEEKEND EVENT. MODELS CONTINUE TO 
BE ONLY IN FAIR AGREEMENT WITH GFS PROJECTING A SIGNIFICANTLY 
STRONGER SHORT WAVE THAN THE NAM. ENSEMBLES TEND TO INITIALLY 
SUPPORT THE NAM BEFORE SUPPORTING A BLEND OF THE TWO MODEL 
SOLUTIONS. HOWEVER...SPREAD AMONG ENSEMBLE MEMBERS BECOMES QUITE 
LARGE BY 18Z SUNDAY. CANADIAN GEM TENDS TO SUPPORT THE GFS TIMING 
BUT NOT THE INTENSITY. WITH NO CLEAR CONSENSUS YET WITH THIS 
EVENT...HAVE NOT MADE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO EXISTING 
GRIDS/FORECAST.

TUESDAY WILL BRING INCREASING CLOUD COVER AND A SOMEWHAT LARGER 
CHANCE OF RAIN...HOWEVER...IT APPEARS THE THE GREATEST ENERGY WITH 
THE SYSTEM WILL SHUNT TO THE NORTH AND SOUTH OF THE AREA SO HAVE 
KEPT POPS GENERALLY IN THE SLIGHT CHANCE RANGE.  WE CALL THIS A COLD 
FRONT...HOWEVER...TEMPERATURES BEHIND THE FRONT WILL BE ABOUT THE 
SAME AS BEFORE FRONTAL PASSAGE...AND POSSIBLY A FEW DEGREES HIGHER.  
WEDNESDAY WILL SEE A RETURN OF SUNNY SKIES.


.LONG TERM...(WED NIGHT THROUGH MON)...RETURN TO DRY WEATHER IN 
STORE PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS AS BROAD UPPER RIDGE BUILDS 
BACK INTO AREA. ANOTHER UPPER TROUGH/COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH IN THE 
LATE SUNDAY TIME FRAME. GFS IS SOMEWHAT MORE AMPLIFIED WITH THE 
UPPER TROUGH THAN THE OTHER MODELS. HAVE INTRODUCED POPS LATE 
SUNDAY/EARLY MONDAY...BUT ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE CATEGORY AT THIS TIME 
DUE TO THE UNCERTAINTY IN INTENSITY. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY STAYED 
CLOSE TO GFS/GFSX GUIDANCE VALUES.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
236 PM EST SUN OCT 30 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...TRANQUIL WEATHER WITH 
MODERATING TEMPERATURE TREND IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THROUGH THE 
SHORT TERM. UPPER RIDGE AXIS WILL CONTINUE TO DRIFT EAST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS WHILE AN AMPLIFYING UPPER TROUGH MIGRATES EASTWARD FROM 
THE CENTRAL PLAINS. THIS WILL CREATE A SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. 
MODEL TIME HEIGHTS SHOW SOME INCREASE IN MOISTURE AT HIGH LEVELS 
WHICH SHOULD MATERIALIZE AS ONLY SCATTERED HIGH CLOUDS ON MONDAY. 
GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS PERSIST IN THE FIRST PERIOD 
HOWEVER. INCLINATION IS TO USE COOLEST OF MODEL GUIDANCE VALUES AS 
GUIDANCE MINS HAVE TENDED TO BE TOO WARM UNDER THIS REGIME. GUIDANCE 
MAX TEMPS FOR MONDAY ARE CLOSE AND APPEAR REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM...(MON NIGHT THROUGH SUN)...WAS HOPING THAT THE 
TUESDAY/WEDNESDAY TIMEFRAME WOULD BECOME MUCH CLEARER BY NOW...BUT 
CONFIDENCE STILL VERY LOW GIVEN POOR MODEL RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY 
AND DICHOTOMY OF MODEL SOLUTIONS.  LATEST RUNS HAVE MODELS IN TWO 
CAMPS WITH HANDLING OF UPPER LOW THAT MOVES ACROSS SOUTHERN STATES.  
GFS NOW SHOWS A MORE NORTHERLY AND QUICKER UPPER LOW...WHILE THE NAM 
LEADS THE MORE SOUTHERLY/SLOWER CAMP.  NEITHER CAMP OVERLY BULLISH 
FOR PRECIP FOR US...AND FOR NOW THINK COURSE OF LEAST REGRET IS TO 
KEEP THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT.  
SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND AN UPPER RIDGE SHOULD KEEP US DRY THROUGH 
FRIDAY ONCE ANY EFFECTS OF THE UPPER LOW ARE GONE. A WEAK 
FRONT MAY APPROACH DURING THE WEEKEND...BUT GIVEN HOW UNIMPRESSIVE 
IT LOOKS AT THIS POINT AND THE UNCERTAINTY THAT FAR OUT...WILL 
CONTINUE DRY FORECAST THROUGH SUNDAY AND JUST INCREASE THE CLOUDS A 
BIT FOR NOW.

IT TO AFFECT OUR SOUTHERN ZONES.  HOWEVER...WILL STAY WITH CURRENT 
GFS SOLUTION THAT PUTS THE SYSTEM WELL SOUTH...KEEPING US DRY ON 
WEDNESDAY.  HIGH PRESSURE MOVES IN ONCE AGAIN FOR THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY.  ZONAL FLOW EXPECTED OVER THE REGION FOR THE WEEKEND WITH A 
SYSTEM APPROACHING FROM THE NORTHWEST.  FOR NOW WILL KEEP THINGS DRY.

FXUS64 KMRX 291823
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
223 PM EDT SAT OCT 29 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...DRY AND STABLE ATMOSPHERE 
PROJECTED TO REMAIN IN PLACE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. UPPER RIDGE AXIS EXPECTED TO PASS THROUGH 
THE FORECAST AREA BY AROUND 12Z SUNDAY. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
ALSO DRIFT EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS BY THE SECOND PERIOD RESULTING 
IN SOUTHERLY RETURN FLOW. BOTH OF THESE FACTORS SUGGEST WARMING 
TREND WILL CONTINUE. HOWEVER VERY GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING 
CONDITIONS WILL AGAIN EXIST DURING THE FIRST PERIOD...WHICH WILL 
TEND TO NEGATE THE WARMING INDUCED BY THE HEIGHT RISES AND RETURN 
SURFACE FLOW. GFS GUIDANCE TEMPS APPEAR AGAIN TO BE TOO WARM IN THE 
FIRST PERIOD AND AM INCLINED TO FAVOR COOLER NAM GUIDANCE WHICH 
SEEMS TO BE A REASONABLE COMPROMISE. EXPECT ANOTHER FROSTY NIGHT BUT 
OVERALL TEMPS NOT ANTICIPATED TO BE QUITE AS COLD AS PRECEDING NIGHT.


.LONG TERM...(SUN NIGHT THROUGH SAT)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
THAT THE ATMOSPHERE WILL REMAIN QUITE DRY INTO MON NIGHT...THEN 
UPPER TROUGH APPROACHING FROM THE WEST AND WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
WILL AFFECT THE AREA TUE/TUE NIGHT. MODELS APPEAR TO BE CONVERGING 
ON THE IDEA THAT THE ENERGY WILL SPLIT...WITH A PORTION MOVING 
SOUTHEAST AND STAYING TO OUR SOUTH...AND THE MUCH OF THE REMAINDER 
MOVING BY TO OUR NORTH...WITH LITTLE PRECIP FOR OUR AREA.  NAM IS A 
BIT MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH THE MOISTURE FOR OUR AREA...BUT IT IS ALSO 
GOING THAT ROUTE.  WILL JUST KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN FOR TUE AND 
TUE NIGHT FOR NOW.  WHAT HAPPENS TO THE UPPER LOW OVER THE SOUTH IS 
PROBLEMATIC.  LATEST GFS MOVES IT CLOSE ENOUGH TO OUR AREA TO AFFECT 
AT LEAST SOUTHERN AREAS WED/THU...BUT WILL GO MORE WITH EARLIER 
IDEA/HPC SOLUTION AND KEEP THINGS FURTHER SOUTH.  REMAINDER OF 
FORECAST PRECIP FREE...AS NEXT WEAK FRONT NOT FORECAST TO ARRIVE 
UNTIL NEXT SAT NIGHT OR SUNDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 281834
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
234 PM EDT FRI OCT 28 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...MODELS AND SHORT RANGE 
ENSEMBLES PROJECT DRAMATIC HEIGHT RISES OVER THE SHORT TERM AS 
HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH/CLOSED LOW DEPARTS AND UPPER RIDGE 
BUILDS INTO THE REGION FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS. MODEL TIME HEIGHTS 
SHOW A VERY DRY ATMOSPHERE AT ALL LEVELS THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. AS 
A RESULT...PLEASANT CONDITIONS WITH A CONTINUATION OF THE WARMING 
TREND IS ANTICIPATED. DRY MOISTURE PROFILE COUPLED WITH LITTLE IN 
THE WAY OF WIND SUGGESTS GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS THROUGH 
THE FIRST PERIOD HOWEVER. GUIDANCE MIN TEMPS HAVE BEEN RUNNING SOMEWHAT TOO 
WARM RECENTLY UNDER THESE CONDITIONS AND AM INCLINED TO UNDERCUT 
THOSE VALUES SLIGHTLY. THUS WILL ISSUE A FREEZE WARNING IN THE 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEYS AS SOME AREAS MAY REACH THOSE 
CRITERIA...ESPECIALLY IN RURAL VALLEY LOCATIONS. FREEZE WARNING IS 
NOT NECESSARY FOR THE REMAINING PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREAS SINCE 
THOSE AREAS HAVE ALREADY EXPERIENCED A HARD FREEZE AND HAVE BEEN
REMOVED FROM THE FREEZE PROGRAM FOR THIS FALL.


.LONG TERM...(SAT NIGHT THROUGH FRI)...ATMOSPHERE QUITE DRY OVER OUR 
AREA SAT NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY...AS UPPER RIDGE MOVES OVERHEAD AND 
THEN SHIFTS EAST.  STILL A LOT OF UNCERTAINTY IN TIMING AND IMPACT 
OF UPPER TROUGH/WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY THAT IS FORECAST TO BE IN THE 
VICINITY TUESDAY/TUESDAY NIGHT.  GFS HAS BEEN INCONSISTENT WITH 
TIMING AND DETAILS OF THIS SYSTEM. THE LATEST 12Z RUN SPLITS THE 
ENERGY...WITH SOME DIVING SOUTHEAST AND SOME MOVING BY TO OUR 
NORTH...LEAVING US IN BETWEEN WITH LITTLE PRECIP FOR OUR AREA.  
THINK BEST IDEA IS TO LEAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN TUE AND TUE NIGHT 
FOR NOW. DRIER AIR TO MOVE IN AGAIN FOR WED THROUGH FRI AS HIGH 
PRESSURE FORECAST TO BUILD IN. WILL LEAVE REMAINDER OF FORECAST 
PRECIP FREE.

CONTINUE TO DRIFT ACROSS THE AREA...MAINLY OVER NORTHERN TIER.  THE 
TROUGH WILL EXIT THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON AS HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO 
BUILD IN...USHERING IN CLEARING SKIES.

.LONG TERM...QUIET WEATHER PATTERN DEVELOPING FOR THE EARLY PART OF 
THE EXTENDED AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE REGION.  AS A RESULT 
...WILL SEE DAYTIME TEMPERATURES WARM...VALLEY READINGS SHOULD CLIMB 
INTO THE 60S AND LOWER 70S FOR THE WEEKEND AND MONDAY.  THE NEXT 
SYSTEM REMAINS ON TRACK TO REACH INTO THE AREA ON TUESDAY.  LITTLE 
IN THE WAY OF MOISTURE OR ENERGY EXPECTED WITH THE SYSTEM.  WILL 
KEEP LOW POPS FOR TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT WITH HIGH PRESSURE 
REBUILDING IN FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.

935 PM EDT THU OCT 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...CONSIDERABLE DIFFERENCE IN TEMPS ACROSS THE REGION 
FROM 24 HOURS AGO...WITH MOST LOCATIONS RUNNING ABOUT 3 TO 7 DEGREES 
WARMER TONIGHT.  DEW POINT TEMPS SHOWING LITTLE CHANGE AT ALL. 
SURFACE RIDGE TO OUR NW CONTINUES TO BUILD SLOWLY SE...KEEPING A 
VERY WEAK NORTH WIND OR CALM WINDS ACROSS THE REGION.  

A BIT MORE CLOUD COVER OVERALL THAN LAST NIGHT...WHICH SEEMS TO BE 
THE MAJOR REASON FOR WARMER MINS SO FAR THIS EVENING.  THERE HAS A 
BEEN JUST A SLIGHT DECREASE IN THIS CLOUD LAYER (ROUGHLY 5000 TO 
7000 FT) UPSTREAM...BUT EXPECT PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES TO LINGER 
OVERNIGHT.  THIS MAY HELP TO REDUCE THE PATCHY DENSE FOG THAT WAS 
NOTED AT SUCH SPOTS AS TRI LAST NIGHT.

WILL CHECK OUT MIN TEMP FORECAST...AND FRESHEN GRIDS AND WEB 
PRODUCTS...ALTHO ZFPMRX MAY NOT NEED AN UPDATE THIS EVENING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
237 PM EDT THU OCT 27 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER AIR FLOW 
CONTINUES THROUGH THE SHORT TERM AS RIDGING DOMINATES THE CENTRAL 
PLAINS WHILE TROUGHING COVERS BOTH COASTS. A SHORT WAVE TROUGH WILL 
APPROACH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS IN THE FIRST PERIOD THROUGH THE 
LONG WAVE TROUGH FLOW. THERE IS A DECIDED LACK OF MOISTURE WITH THIS 
FEATURE...BUT ENOUGH IS AVAILABLE TO CAUSE SCATTERED TO BROKEN CLOUD 
DECK THROUGH MUCH OF THE FIRST PERIOD. BIGGEST ISSUE IS TIMING 
CLOUD DECK DEPARTURE AND ITS EFFECT ON MIN TEMPS. MODELS INDICATE 
THAT SHORT WAVE TROUGH AXIS SHOULD BE EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY 
LATE IN THE FIRST PERIOD. HOWEVER...MOST OF THE SHORT RANGE ENSEMBLE 
MEMBERS ARE SLIGHTLY SLOWER WITH THE PROGRESSION. THUS...DO NOT 
ANTICIPATE TEMPS TO BE QUITE AS COLD AS LAST NIGHT AS RADIATIONAL 
COOLING APPEARS LESS FAVORABLE. SKY CONDITIONS SHOULD GENERALLY 
CLEAR IN THE SECOND PERIOD ALLOWING A MODEST WARMING TREND IN TEMPS. 
GENERALLY USED A BLEND OF GUIDANCE VALUES FOR TEMPS.


.LONG TERM...(FRI NIGHT THROUGH THU)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE 
OVER THE REGION THROUGH FRI NIGHT THROUGH THE WEEKEND...AND THE 
UPPER LOW OVER THE NORTHEAST PULLS AWAY AND RIDGING BUILDS IN 
ALOFT.  SHOULD SEE CLEAR/MOSTLY CLEAR SKY...AND AFTER A COLD NIGHT 
FRI NIGHT...WILL HAVE A GRADUAL WARMING TREND THROUGH MONDAY. STILL 
NOT A HIGH LEVEL OF CONFIDENCE ON TIMING OF NEXT TROUGH AND WEAK 
COLD FRONT.  LATEST RUNS HAVE BEEN LESS AMPLIFIED AND QUICKER.  FOR 
NOW WILL LEAVE SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS IN FOR TUE AND TUE 
NIGHT...BUT IF LATER RUNS CONTINUE THE FASTER TREND MAY NEED TO MOVE 
UP 12 HOURS. DRY WED AND THU AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN AGAIN.
