AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
216 AM EDT THU OCT 27 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...
SEVERAL LOCATIONS HAVE ALREADY FALLEN TO NEAR OR BELOW FREEZING 
ACROSS THE NORTHER PLATEAU...SW VA...AND EXTREME NE TN. THERE WILL 
LIKELY BE SOME PLACES OUTSIDE OF THE FREEZE WARNING AREA THAT WILL 
SEE A KILLING FREEZE...BUT AT THIS POINT WILL LEAVE THE WARNING AS 
IS FOR THE MORNING HOURS AS PREPARATIONS TO PROTECT PLANTS HAVE 
ALREADY BEEN MADE.

CYCLONIC CIRCULATION SEEN IN SATELLITE IMAGERY OVER THE STL AREA IS 
PROGGED BY THE MODELS TO BECOME SHEARED...AND A CHANNELED VORTICITY 
AXIS CROSSES THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND THIS EVENING. EXPECT ONLY A 
SLIGHT INCREASE IN CLOUDS WITH THIS FEATURE MAINLY ACROSS THE NORTH 
AS MOISTURE IS VERY LIMITED AND LIFT IS VERY WEAK. EVEN THOUGH WINDS 
WILL GO CALM TONIGHT THESE CLOUDS MAY BE JUST ENOUGH TO KEEP TEMPS 
UP ABOVE FREEZING IN MOST LOCATIONS. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...
HEIGHTS BEGIN TO RISE FRIDAY AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE DRIFTS SLOWLY 
EAST. WITH THE SURFACE HIGH AND 850 MB RIDGE OVERHEAD ON FRIDAY 
NIGHT...TEMPS MAY DROP TO NEAR FREEZING ACROSS THE ENTIRE AREA. WILL 
UNDERCUT MOS GUIDANCE BY A COUPLE DEGREES DUE TO EXCELLENT 
RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS. AREAS THAT HAVE NOT SEEN A FREEZE 
YET WILL LIKELY SEE ONE FRIDAY NIGHT. SAME SET UP FOR A FREEZE WILL 
BE IN PLACE SATURDAY NIGHT AS WELL. 

RIDGING ALOFT WILL PROVIDE CLEAR SKIES THROUGH MONDAY. TEMPS 
GRADUALLY WARM...AND HIGHS MAY REACH INTO THE LOWER 70S ON SUNDAY 
AND MONDAY. GFS SHOWS A WEAK TROUGH MOVING THROUGH ON TUESDAY...BUT 
MOISTURE IS LIMITED. WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ON TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY...BUT 48 HOURS OF POPS IS LIKELY OVERDONE FOR SUCH A WEAK 
AND FAST MOVING SYSTEM.

.DISCUSSION...SKIES HAVE BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR ACROSS THE REGION...
ALTHO AT LEAST PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES CONTINUE UPSTREAM OVER MUCH OF SE 
KY AND WEST VA.  ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ALSO LOOMS FURTHER 
NORTH INTO THE OHIO VALLEY REGION...WHERE MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES ARE 
NOTED. 

TEMPS HAVE FALLEN A BIT FASTER THAN 12Z MOS...WHICH INDICATES THE 
POSSIBILITY OF COOLER MINS THAN CURRENT FORECAST.  ONE AREA OF MOST 
CONCERN WOULD BE SWRN VA WHERE CURRENT TEMPS APPEAR TO ALREADY BE IN 
THE MID AND UPPER 30S.  WORRIED THAT CLOUDS WONT FILL BACK IN FAST 
ENOUGH TO PREVENT A BRIEF PERIOD OF AT LEAST 30 TO 32 DEGREE 
READINGS...SO WILL LIKELY INCLUDE SWRN VA COUNTIES IN THE FREEZE 
WARNING AND GIVE A RANGE OF UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S.

OTHERWISE...WILL FRESHEN THE GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS...AND REMOVE THE 
AFTER MIDNIGHT WORDING REFERRING TO AREAS OF FROST IN THE ZFP.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
309 PM EDT WED OCT 26 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LOW THAT BROUGHT
WINTER LIKE WEATHER TO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY MONDAY AND TUESDAY HAS
NOW MOVED INTO EASTERN MAINE AND NE CANADA THIS AFTERNOON. CLOUDS
BROKE UP ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA LATE THIS MORNING AND THEN
CONSIDERABLE STRATOCUMULUS FORMED KEEPING SKIES PARTLY TO MOSTLY
CLOUDY ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES
WARMED INTO THE UPPER 40S TO NEAR 60 ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH
THE ABUNDANT SUNSHINE ABOUT 5 TO 7 DEGREES WARMER THAN TUESDAY.

MAIN FORECAST PROBLEM TONIGHT IS TEMPERATURES. SOME LOW LEVEL
MOISTURE AT AROUND 850 MB WILL STAY OVER THE FORECAST AREA
ESPECIALLY NORTH AND EVEN THOUGH CLOUDS WILL LIKELY DECREASE AS THE
SUN GOES DOWN LOW CLOUDS WERE MOVING SOUTH AND SOUTHWEST FROM THE
OHIO VALLEY TOWARD E TN AND SW VA. 850 MB TEMPERATURES ARE FROM
ABOUT 0C TO 2C TOMORROW MORNING WHICH IS SLIGHTLY WARMER FOR MOST
OF THE AREA EXCEPT EXTREME NORTH. GUIDANCE NUMBERS ARE LOWER TO MID
30S NORTHEAST AND MID TO UPPER 30S ELSEWHERE. THINK TRI CITIES
AIRPORT MAY DROP TO NEAR 32 BRIEFLY BUT NOT STAY DOWN LONG ENOUGH
FOR A FREEZE WARNING. NOT CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO ISSUE FREEZE WARNING
FOR MOST OF NE TN AND SW VA EXCEPT WHERE ALREADY ISSUED IN THE MOUNTAINS.
MODELS BRING SHORTWAVE FROM IL THIS AFTERNOON AND ELONGATE TROUGH
THAT EXTENDS FROM THE NE UPPER LOW INTO THE TN VALLEY TONIGHT AND
THURSDAY. EXPECT MORE CLOUDS TO THE NORTH IN OHIO VALLEY AND KY AS
SHORTWAVE APPROACHES BUT SOME CLOUDS WILL MOVE IN FROM THE NW
OVERNIGHT AND THURSDAY ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN TWO THIRDS.
THIS SHOULD KEEP TEMPERATURES ABOUT THE SAME AS TODAYS. THERE MAY
BE SOME PATCHY FOG TONIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY BUT CLOUD COVER
SHOULD LIMIT ANY SIGNIFICANT DROPS IN VISIBILITY LATER TONIGHT.
WILL CONTINUE SPS FOR FROST FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA
TONIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY.

.LONG TERM...(THU NIGHT THROUGH WED)...MODELS INDICATE SOME SHORT 
WAVE ENERGY ROTATING THROUGH BASE OF NORTHEAST TROUGH/UPPER LOW WILL 
BE OVER THE REGION THU NIGHT INTO FRI.  WHILE THEY DIFFER A BIT ON 
THE DETAILS...THE AGREE MOISTURE WILL BE VERY LIMITED.  SHOULD SEE 
SOME CLOUDS ESPECIALLY NORTHEAST THU NIGHT...THEN DECREASING THROUGH 
FRIDAY TO A MOSTLY CLEAR FRI NIGHT.  HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE 
OUR WEATHER FOR THE WEEKEND INTO MONDAY...THEN QUITE A BIT OF 
UNCERTAINTY FOR TUE AND WED AS POOR MODEL AGREEMENT AND RUN TO RUN 
CONSISTENCY REARS ITS HEAD.  WHILE TIMING IS UNCERTAIN AT THIS 
POINT...A TROUGH SHOULD BE APPROACHING AND MAY AFFECT THE REGION 
SOMETIME TUESDAY OR WEDNESDAY...SO WILL GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
FOR NOW.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW GRADUALLY LIFTS OUT 
THROUGH NEW ENGLAND AND THE CANADIAN MARITIMES IN THE SHORT TERM 
ALLOWING HEIGHTS TO BUILD ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN

THE OHIO VALLEY IMPACTING THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY. MAIN 
PROBLEM IN THIS PERIOD IS HOW FAST TO ERODE LOW CLOUDS. ATTM APPEARS 
THAT CLOUDS ARE THINNING QUICKLY ACROSS THE REGION WITH CLEAR SKIES 
ALREADY EVIDENT ACROSS MUCH OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SOUTHEAST 
TENNESSEE. BELIEVE LOW DECK SHOULD ERODE ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE BY LATE MORNING LEAVING SKIES PARTLY CLOUDY 
THROUGH REMAINDER OF THE AFTERNOON. STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS 
TODAY/TONIGHT WHICH FEATURES CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES AND LIGHT 
WIND ALLOWING FOR RADIATION WELL INTO THE MIDDLE AND LOWER 30S. NPW 
AND SPS WERE ISSUED FOR FREEZE WARNING NRN/CNTRL MTNS OF TENNESSEE 
AND PATCHY FROST FORMATION ELSEWHERE ACROSS THRE FORECAST AREA FOR 
TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...
A TROUGH DIVES SOUTH OUT OF CANADA ON THURSDAY AND BECOMES A CLOSED 
CIRCULATION OVER THE MID ATLANTIC ON FRIDAY. THERE IS SOME STRONG 
VORTICITY WITH THE SYSTEM BUT VERY LITTLE MOISTURE. WHAT LITTLE 
MOISTURE THERE IS IS CONFINED TO THE 850 MB LAYER ACROSS OUR 
NORTHERN SECTIONS. SLIGHT CHANCE MENTION WILL BE REMOVED FOR 
THURSDAY. SW VA MAY SEE A PERIOD OF MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES THURSDAY 
NIGHT...BUT THE REST OF THE AREA WILL REMAIN PARTLY CLOUDY TO MOSTLY 
CLEAR. A RIDGE WILL BE OVER THE AREA FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY. THIS 
WILL PROVIDE CLEAR SKIES AND A LARGE DIURNAL SWING IN TEMPS. WILL 
HAVE HIGHS IN THE 60S AND APPROACHING 70 IN THE SOUTH SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY. BUMPED HIGH TEMPS UP A BIT BUT STILL BELOW GFS MOS GUIDANCE 
WHICH SHOWS SOME 70S SUNDAY AND MONDAY. OVERNIGHT LOWS IN THE 30S. A 
TROUGH APPROACHES FROM THE WEST ON TUESDAY. MOISTURE LOOKS LIMITED 
BUT WILL KEEP THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 PM EDT TUE OCT 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...DEEPER MOISTURE AND RADAR RETURNS SHIFTING EAST OF THE 
AREA TONIGHT. A FEW SPRINKLES AND LIGHT SNOW AND FLURRIES REMAIN 
POSSIBLE NORTH AREAS AND SMOKYS. MODEL SOUNDING DEPICT SOME 
POTENTIAL FOR FREEZING DRIZZLE BUT CONFIDENCE IN ELEVATION AND 
LOCATION TOO LOW FOR MENTION IN ZFP. EFFECTS ON ROADS EXPECTED TO 
REMAIN MINIMAL. CURRENT RELATIVELY WARM TEMPS IN GOOD SHAPE IN 
GRIDS. TWEAKED MAINLY SW AREA MIN TEMPS DOWNWARD A DEGREE OR TWO FOR 
SLACKENING WINDS AND BREAKS IN CLOUD COVER. ELSEWHERE MIXING WINDS 
SHOULD INHIBIT ANY SIGNIFICANT FROST OR FREEZE WED MORN.

PREV DISCUSSION:

FOR WEDNESDAY...WENT ON COOL SIDE OF GUIDANCE ON HIGH TEMPS...THINK 
MODELS ARE A LITTLE AGGRESSIVE IN BREAKING UP CLOUD COVER.  LOOKING 
AT VISIBLE SATELLITE LOOP...LONG FETCH OF OVC STRATOCUMULUS CLOUDS 
WAY BACK THROUGH OHIO.  SO FIGURING ON SLOW WARMUP ON WEDNESDAY.  
NORTHEAST SECTIONS MAY HAVE TOUGH TIME GETTING RID OF CLOUDS UNLESS 
SUBSIDENCE/DOWNSLOPING CAN HELP OUT.

LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...AN UPPER TROUGH WILL 
REMAIN POSITIONED OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE U.S. THROUGH THURSDAY 
...AS ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE DROPS SOUTH INTO THE TROUGH.  MAIN 
DYNAMICS AND MOISTURE SHOULD STAY TO OUR NORTH...BUT IT MAY REACH 
SUFFICIENTLY SOUTH AND INTO OUR NORTHERN TIER ZONES FOR ISOLATED 
SHOWERS.  WILL THEREFORE...INTRODUCE LOW POPS IN NORTHERN ZONES FOR 
THURSDAY AFTERNOON.  THE UPPER TROUGH WILL EXIT THE REGION ON FRIDAY 
WITH AN UPPER RIDGE BUILDING IN FOR THE WEEKEND.  WITH CLEARING 
SKIES...A DRY AIR MASS AND INCREASING HEIGHT FIELD...AFTERNOON HIGHS 
SHOULD WARM.  MODELS ARE IN POOR AGREEMENT WITH TIMING AND POSITION 
OF THE NEXT SYSTEM TO MOVE INTO THE AREA.  THE TIME FRAME SHOULD BE 
AROUND TUESDAY...SO FOR NOW WILL BRING IN LOW POPS FOR THE END OF 
THE EXTENDED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

319 PM EDT TUE OCT 25 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LOW STILL SLUGGISH 
TO MAKE A MOVE...AS UPPER JET COMES AROUND WEST SIDE.  SYSTEM SHOULD 
BEGIN TO TUCK ITS TAIL AND HEAD TO NORTHEAST THIS EVENING AS JET 
FINISHES ROUNDING BASE OF TROUGH.  LOOKS LIKE WHAT PRECIP THERE IS 
WILL BE WINDING DOWN OVERNIGHT.  ONCE AGAIN...ABOVE ABOUT 2500 FEET 
PRECIP SHOULD BE TRENDING TOWARD SNOW...BUT MOSTLY JUST FLURRIES.

IN VA...HWY 160 ON VA SIDE OF BORDER AT PASS HAD ABOUT 0.5 INCH OF 
SLUSH AND ONLY ON ABOUT THE LAST 1/2 MILE CLIMBING TOWARD THE 
PASS...MORE ON KY SIDE.  ALSO IN VA...HIGH KNOB ONLY HAD FLURRIES.  
MOST OF PRECIP DUE TO UPSLOPE FLOW...SO WEST SIDE OF MOUNTAINS IN KY 
GETTING BRUNT OF SNOW.  SAME TO CONTINUE THIS EVENING.

IN SMOKIES...REPORTS FROM THIS AFTERNOON INCLUDED ABOUT A 0.5 INCH 
SLUSHY SNOW AND ICE AT NEW FOUND GAP.  THINK LIGHT FREEZING DRIZZLE 
POSSIBLE ABOVE ABOUT 4000 FEET. ALL OF THIS SHOULD SLOWLY SUBSIDE 
AND BY DAYBREAK...MOST OF THE PRECIP SHOULD BE ENDED...EVEN IN THE 
MOUNTAINS.

FOR WEDNESDAY...WENT ON COOL SIDE OF GUIDANCE ON HIGH TEMPS...THINK 
MODELS ARE A LITTLE AGRESSIVE IN BREAKING UP CLOUD COVER.  LOOKING 
AT VISIBLE SATELLITE LOOP...LONG FETCH OF OVC STRATOCUMULUS CLOUDS 
WAY BACK THROUGH OHIO.  SO FIGURING ON SLOW WARMUP ON WEDNESDAY.  
NORTHEAST SECTIONS MAY HAVE TOUGH TIME GETTING RID OF CLOUDS UNLESS 
SUBSIDENCE/DOWNSLOPING CAN HELP OUT.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...AN UPPER TROUGH 
WILL REMAIN POSITIONED OVER THE EASTERN HALF OF THE U.S. THROUGH 
THURSDAY ...AS ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE DROPS SOUTH INTO THE TROUGH.  
MAIN DYNAMICS AND MOISTURE SHOULD STAY TO OUR NORTH...BUT IT MAY 
REACH SUFFICIENTLY SOUTH AND INTO OUR NORTHERN TIER ZONES FOR 
ISOLATED SHOWERS.  WILL THEREFORE...INTRODUCE LOW POPS IN NORTHERN 
ZONES FOR THURSDAY AFTERNOON.  THE UPPER TROUGH WILL EXIT THE REGION 
ON FRIDAY WITH AN UPPER RIDGE BUILDING IN FOR THE WEEKEND.  WITH 
CLEARING SKIES...A DRY AIR MASS AND INCREASING HEIGHT 
FIELD...AFTERNOON HIGHS SHOULD WARM.  MODELS ARE IN POOR AGREEMENT 
WITH TIMING AND POSITION OF THE NEXT SYSTEM TO MOVE INTO THE AREA.  
THE TIME FRAME SHOULD BE AROUND TUESDAY...SO FOR NOW WILL BRING IN 
LOW POPS FOR THE END OF THE EXTENDED.  

&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 AM EDT TUE OCT 25 2005

.SHORT TERM...
TODAYS WEATHER INFLUENCED BY CENTRAL APPALACHIANS UPPER LOW WHICH 
SLOWLY MAKES ITS WAY EAST ACROSS THE ANCIENT MOUNTAIN RANGE BY LATE 
TONIGHT. A FAIR AMOUNT OF VORTICITY DROPPING INTO THE BACK SIDE OF 
UPPER LOW CIRCULATION WITH SUFFICIENT DEPTH OF MOISTURE TO TREND 
TOWARD THE SUGGESTED MOS POP BLEND WITH LIKELY POPS TODAY ACROSS 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WITH 
POPS RANGING FROM TEN PERCENT ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY IN 
SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE TO FORTY AND FIFTY PERCENT IN THE SMOKY 
MOUNTAINS. PRECIP TYPE WILL BE FLURRIES ABOVE 3000 FT AND RAIN AND 
FLURRIES FROM 2500 TO 3000 FT. WHILE UPPER LOW MAKES ITS DEPARTURE 
THROUGH THE EVENING...GRADUALLY DROP OFF POPS AS DEEPER 
MOISTURE/LIFT EXIT. WILL KEEP THIS COMPLEX ELEVATION PRECIP TYPE 
FORECAST GOING INTO THE EVENING IN THESE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AT ANY 
RATE...NOT MUCH IN THE WAY OF ACCUMULATION EXPECTED. STAYED CLOSE TO 
GUIDANCE TEMPS WHICH WERE SIMILAR TODAY/TONIGHT FEATURING MAXES 
AROUND 15 TO 20 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. BELIEVE PRES GRAD TIGHT ENOUGH 
AND LOW CLOUD LAYER PERSISTANT ACROSS MUCH OF THE REGION TO KEEP 
FROST FROM FORMING TONIGHT.    

.LONG TERM...
AS THE CLOSED UPPER LOW EXITS NEW ENGLAND...WRAP AROUND MOISTURE 
WILL LIFT OFF TO THE NORTHEAST. A SECOND TROUGH DIVES SOUTH OUT OF 
CANADA...AND TAKES SOME CHANNELLED VORTICITY ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. MOISTURE IS 
VERY LIMITED WITH THE SYSTEM...AND MODEL TRENDS HAVE BEEN FASTER AND 
FARTHER NORTH. DUE TO THE FASTER MODELS TRENDS THE SLIGHT CHANCE POP 
ON FRIDAY WILL BE REMOVED. EVEN THE SLOWER GFS HAS THE TROUGH AXIS 
THROUGH THE AREA BY FRIDAY WITH RIDGING BUILDING IN ALOFT. WITH THE 
BUILDING RIDGE THERE SHOULD BE A WARMING TREND THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND...WITH HIGHS GOING FROM 55 TO 60 ON FRIDAY TO 65 TO 70 BY 
MONDAY. RASIED TEMPS A BIT OVER THE WEEKEND TO BE MORE IN LINE WITH 
THE LATEST GFS ENSEMBLE MOS GUIDANCE.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...

EXTRAPOLATION TAKES THE BACK EDGE OF THE CLOUDS OUT OF THE AREA

SUNRISE...BUT WITH COLD ADVECTION ALOFT EXPECT BROKEN STRATOCU TO 
DEVELOP BY MID TO LATE MORNING...KEEPING MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES THROUGH

FILL BACK IN AS WINDS ALOFT MIX DOWN TO THE SURFACE. DEEPER MOISTURE 
WILL WRAP AROUND THE CLOSED LOW TONIGHT...AND WITH UPSLOPE FLOW

CLOSER TO THE DEEPER MOISTURE. WILL MAINTAIN MENTION OF SNOW ABOVE 3 
KFT. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MADE SOME LITTLE CHANGES TO 
TUESDAY MORNING AS ABOVE MENTIONED VIGOUROUS VORT VENTURES ALONG. 
WILL KEEP COLD AIR INTO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING, THUS KEPT SOME MIX OF 
SNOW/RAIN ABOVE 3000 FEET AS IN SHORT TERM. WILL ADD WORDING TO 
ZONES. TROF MOVES OUT BUT LEAVES MUCH COLDER THAN NORMAL TEMPS IN 
ITS WAKE, BUT WITH CLOUDS IN PLACE, WILL LIMIT NIGHTTIME RADIATION 
SO NO ADVISORIES THOUGH SOME PLACES WILL HIT THE LOWER 30S OR SO IN 
THE LOWER ELEVATIONS. MOUNTAIN IN THE 20S IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. 
SOME WARMING AGAIN ON WEDNESDAY-THURSDAY AS SOME SUN MAKES IT 
THROUGH, BUT GFS SHOWS A RATHER LARGE CONCENTRIC OCCLUDED LOW 
DIRECTLY OVERHEAD FRIDAY INTO LATE SATURDAY. NATURALLY, FLIP 
FLOPPING BY MODELS GIVE LITTLE CONDIFENCE THAT THIS WILL HAPPEN AS 
ADVERTISED, BUT YOU HAVE TO ACCOUNT FOR ITS POSSIBILITY. HAVE ADDED 
SOME SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE RAIN POPS FOR FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY, 
WITH VERY LOW QPF.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...AN UPPER L0W POSITIONED OVER IL

SHOWERS OVER PORTIONS OF KY AND MIDDLE TN. AS THE WAVE TRACKS TO THE

PROVIDING SCATTERED RAIN SHOWERS ACROSS THE AREA OVERNIGHT. THE BEST 
CHANCE FOR RAIN WILL BE OVER NORTHERN ZONES. UPSLOPE FLOW WILL ALSO 
AID PRECIP CHANCE OVER EASTERN MAINTAINS. A COOL AIR MASS CONTINUES 
TO FILTER INTO THE AREA TONIGHT. OVERNIGHT LOWS SHOULD BE IN THE 40S 
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY...WITH 30S OVER HIGHER TERRAIN. THE 
HIGHEST ELEVATIONS...AT LEAST OVER 3000 FEET...TEMPERATURES MAY 
LOWER ENOUGH TO ALLOW FOR BRIEF PERIODS OF A RAIN/SNOW MIX. THE WAVE 
WILL EXIT ON MONDAY...ENDING PRECIP OVER MUCH OF THE AREA. 
HOWEVER...CONTINUED UPSLOPE FLOW MAY KEEP ISOLATED SHOWERS OVER THE 
NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS INTO THE AFTERNOON. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...ANOTHER STRONG SHORT WAVE 
IS PROGGED TO ROTATE AROUND THE LONG WAVE TROUGH MONDAY NIGHT INTO 
TUESDAY...WITH SOME ADDITIONAL LIGHT PRECIP POSSIBLE ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. WILL CONTINUE THE PREVIOUS FORECAST WORDING OF A 
CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS ABOVE 3000 FEET...AS 850 MB TEMPS FALL BELOW 
FREEZING. GFS MODEL CONTINUES TO REVEAL A 500 MB CUT-OFF LOW 
DEVELOPING NEAR THE TENNESSEE RIVER VALLEY BY THE END OF THE WEEK... 
BUT THERE CONTINUES TO BE LARGE DISCREPANCIES FROM RUN TO RUN WITH 
THE STRENGTH AND POSITIONING OF THIS UPPER LOW. IT STILL APPEARS 
THAT THERE WILL BE A DRY AIRMASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR THE END 
OF THE WEEK...SO WILL KEEP THE EXTENDED FORECAST DRY FOR NOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EDT SAT OCT 22 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...ISOLATED LIGHT RAIN OR SPRINKLES 
WILL REMAIN POSSIBLE INTO THE EVENING HOURS...WITH THE BEST CHANCE 
OVER NORTHERN ZONES. OTHERWISE...WE WILL BE BETWEEN WEATHER SYSTEMS 
TONIGHT WITH FLOW ALOFT BECOMING BRIEFLY ZONAL. LOW CLOUDS WILL 
CONTINUE TO SLOWLY ERODE FROM WEST TO EAST THROUGH THE NIGHT. THIS 
COMBINED WITH DECOUPLED WINDS...RECENT RAINS AND LOWERING DEW POINTS 
WILL DROP OVERNIGHT LOWS INTO THE 40S OVER MOST LOCATIONS AND ALLOW 
PATCHY FOG TO FORM BY MORNING. A COOLER AIR MASS WILL CONTINUE TO 
PUSH INTO THE REGION ON SUNDAY AND TEMPERATURES IN THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY WILL ONLY REACH INTO THE 60S. AN APPROACHING SHORT WAVE WILL 
BE APPROACHING THE AREA LATE SUNDAY. CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON TIMING AND 
WILL KEEP POPS LOW FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH AMPLIFYING A DEEP UPPER TROUGH OVER THE APPALACHIANS 
BY SUNDAY NIGHT. BOTH THE GFS AND NAM MODELS INDICATE ENOUGH 
MOISTURE FOR SOME LIGHT PRECIP OVER MAINLY SOUTHWEST VA AND 
NORTHEAST TN...BUT THE NAM MODEL IS MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH THE AMOUNT 
OF AVAILABLE MOISTURE AND RESULTING PRECIP AMOUNTS. WILL TREND THE 
FORECAST ON SUNDAY NIGHT TOWARD THE MORE CONSISTENT AND DRIER GFS 
MODEL. BOTH MODELS INDICATE SUB-FREEZING 850 MB TEMPS OVER SOUTHWEST 
VA AND NORTHEAST TN FOR SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT WITH A WARM BOUNDARY 
LAYER...SURFACE TEMPS SHOULD HAVE A TOUGH TIME FALLING INTO THE 
LOWER 30S EXCEPT ACROSS THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS. WILL CONTINUE THE 
PREVIOUS FORECAST OF MENTIONING A CHANCE OF SNOW ABOVE 3000 FEET FOR 
SUNDAY NIGHT AND AGAIN ON MONDAY NIGHT. ANOTHER STRONG SHORT WAVE 
WILL ROTATE AROUND THE LONG WAVE TROUGH ON MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUESDAY...WITH SOME ADDITIONAL LIGHT PRECIP POSSIBLE...MAINLY ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN. ANOTHER WEAKER SHORT WAVE ON 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT LOOKS TO BE DRY AT THIS TIME FOR THE FORECAST AREA. 
GFS MODEL CONTINUES TO INDICATE AN UPPER CUT-OFF LOW DEVELOPING OVER 
THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY BY THE END OF THE WEEK...BUT OTHER EXTENDED 
MODELS REVEAL MORE OF A ZONAL PATTERN. THUS...WILL KEEP THE EXTENDED 
FORECAST DRY FOR THE END OF THE WEEK.

HEATING WILL BE LIMITED AND AFTERNOON HIGHS TODAY ARE EXPECTED TO BE 
AT LEAST 15 DEGREES COOLER THEN YESTERDAY.  ALL HANDLED WELL IN THE 
CURRENT FORECAST...NO UPDATES EXPECTED.

WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY DRY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 AM EDT THU OCT 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS HAS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION UNDER A WEAK SHORT WAVE RIDGE AS AN UPPER LOW POSITIONED OVER 
MO SLOWLY TRACKS TO THE EAST.  THE WEAK RIDGING OVER THE AREA HAS 
INCREASE HEIGHT FIELDS AND 850MB TEMPS HAVE REACHED INTO THE MID 
TEENS C.  THIS WILL TRANSLATE INTO WARM ...POSSIBLY NEAR RECORD... 
TEMPERATURES FOR THE AFTERNOON.  HOWEVER...AS THE LOW APPROACHES THE 
AREA THIS EVENING AND OVERNIGHT...CLOUDS WILL INCREASE.  SOUTHERLY 
FLOW HAD INCREASE DEWPOINTS INTO 55 TO 60 DEGREE RANGE.  SO...WITH 
SOME LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IN PLACE AND WEAK LIFT FROM THE APPROACHING 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM...THERE WILL BE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS OVER 
GENERALLY OUR SW VIRGINIA ZONES TONIGHT.  ALL LOOKS GOOD IN THE 
CURRENT FORECAST...NO UPDATES EXPECTED.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 200736
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EDT THU OCT 20 2005

.SHORT TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
STATIONARY FRONT DISSECTING KENTUCKY (NORTH-SOUTH).  THIS FRONT MAY 
MOVE SLOWLY SOUTH APPROACHING SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA DURING THE 
AFTERNOON... SO HAVE INCLUDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS THERE FOR 
LATE TODAY. ELSEWHERE...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL HOLD ON ONE 
MORE DAY PRODUCING DRY WEATHER. SOUTHWEST WINDS...PLENTY OF 
SUNSHINE...AND RELATIVELY DRY GROUND...WILL ONCE AGAIN PRODUCE 
UNSEASONABLY WARM DAY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. RECORD HIGHS ARE THE 
FOLLOWING: TRI 84 (1993)...TYS 86 (1941)... CHA 88 (1941). FORECAST 
HIGHS TODAY WILL BE JUST SHY OF THESE RECORDS.  WILL INCLUDE NEAR 
RECORDS HIGHS IN THE FORECAST.

STATIONARY FRONT REMAINS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/EXTREME NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE TONIGHT...SO WILL INCLUDE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS THERE WITH 
MAINLY DRY CONDITIONS ELSEWHERE.

FOR FRIDAY...NAM AND GFS DIFFER GREATLY ON THE DEWPOINT 
TEMPERATURE OVER THE REGION.  THE NAM KEEPS DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER 
AND MID 60S WHILE THE GFS TENDS TO DRY THEM INTO THE 50S DURING THE 
DAY. LIKEWISE...THE NAM IS MUCH MORE UNSTABLE WITH LIFTED INDICES 
DROPPING DOWN TO -4 TO -6...PER MODEL SOUNDINGS. WILL NOT GO AS 
AGGRESSIVE AS THE NAM...BUT DO EXPECT SCATTERED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS. WOULD GO HIGHER WITH POPS...BUT MAIN DYNAMICS IS NOT 
OF THE FORECAST AREA.

FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...COLD FRONT WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS THE REGION WITH 
COLDER AIR FILTER IN BEHIND FROPA. NAM AND GFS SHOWS A GOOD DEAL OF 
COLD AIR STRATO-CU SPREADING INTO THE FORECAST AREA FOR FRIDAY NIGHT 
AND SATURDAY. WILL KEEP SKIES CLOUDY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY THROUGH 
SATURDAY. 


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MINOR CHANGES MADE 
TO THE EARLIER PERIODS OF THE LONG TERM.  COLD AIR ADVECTION IN THE 
LOW LEVELS AND CYCLONIC MID AND UPPER LEVEL FLOW AS THE UPPER LOW 
DEEPENS AND CLOSES OFF...SHOULD LEAD TO MORE CLOUDINESS THAN MOS 
INDICATES FROM SATURDAY NIGHT WELL INTO MONDAY.  GENERALLY INCREASED 
SKY COVER IN NRN AREAS AND ESPECIALLY ALL HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS WHERE 
LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE FLOW WILL BE A FACTOR.  KEPT A BIT OF PARTLY 
CLOUDY SKIES FOR CENTRAL AND SRN VALLEY LOCATIONS...BUT MAINLY IN 
THE DAYTIME PERIODS.  

QUITE A CHANGE IN OUR VERY TRANQUIL AND MORE SUMMERLIKE PATTERN...
LEADING TO AT LEAST A POSSIBILITY OF A FEW SNOW SHOWERS LATE SUNDAY 
NIGHT...MAINLY ABOVE 3500 FEET OR SO AS 850 MB TEMPS TUMBLE BELOW 
ZERO DEGS CELSIUS BY 06Z MONDAY INTO EARLY MONDAY MORNING.  BOUNDARY 
LAYER TEMPS AND PARTIAL THICKNESSES MUCH TOO WARM FOR ANY SNOW AT 
ELEVATIONS BELOW 3500 FEET...ALSO WE ARE LOOKING AT MAINLY VERY 
LIGHT AMOUNTS OF PRECIPITATION AS FORCING GRADUALLY BECOMES JUST 
COLD AIR ADVECTION AND LOW LEVEL UPSLOPE WINDS.

OTHERWISE...VERY MINOR MAX/MIN TEMP ADJUSTMENTS MADE IN LINE WITH 
LATEST MOS...GENERALLY DOWNWARD A FEW DEGREES WHEN THE COLDEST AIR 
IS FILTERING IN COURTESY OF THE NW-N LOW LEVEL WINDS AND CLOUD COVER 
LINGERS TO INHIBIT MUCH SUNSHINE.  ADDED SOME PRELIMINARY GRIDS FOR 
THE NEW DAY SEVEN (THURSDAY).


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             86  59  80  56 /   0   0  40  40

OAK RIDGE, TN                       84  58  75  55 /  10  10  50  60

FXUS64 KMRX 190739
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
338 AM EDT WED OCT 19 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...TRANQUIL WEATHER CONTINUES WITH 
TEMPS CLIMBING TO MUCH ABOVE CLIMO AS HEIGHTS CONTINUE TO RISE IN 
RESPONSE TO AMPLIFYING TROUGH OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS. MODEL TIME 
HEIGHTS SHOW LITTLE IN THE WAY OF MOISTURE THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. 
THUS ANTICIPATE VERY SPARSE CLOUD COVER. GUIDANCE TEMPS ARE AGAIN IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT AND HAVE NO COMPELLING REASON TO SIGNIFICANTLY 
DEVIATE FROM THOSE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...NO CHANGES NEEDED FOR 
THE MOST PART...ESPECIALLY WITH EARLY AND LATE PERIODS OF THE LONG 
TERM.  I DID INCREASE POPS SLIGHTLY FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY 
MORNING...WITH THE SLOW FRONTAL PASSAGE.  WENT UP TO 50% AND 40% FOR 
THOSE PERIODS...ALTHO COVERAGE OF SHOWERS MAY BE WIDESPREAD ENOUGH 
TO JUSTIFY LIKELY POPS LATE FRIDAY NIGHT.  WILL LOOK AT THIS AGAIN 
TONIGHT OR DAYSHIFT MAY VERY WELL NUDGE POPS UP IN AFTERNOON PACKAGE.

19/00Z GFSX MOS TEMPS GENERALLY FELL RIGHT IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS 
GRIDS AS MUCH COOLER AIR FLOWS INTO THE REGION SUNDAY INTO TUESDAY.
THINKING THAT THE COLD AIR ADVECTION AND CYCLONIC UPPER LEVEL FLOW 
MAY VERY WELL KEEP SKIES IN THE MOSTLY CLOUDY CATEGORY.  SO...I MADE 
SLIGHT INCREASES IN CLOUD COVER IN SPITE OF GFSX MOS SUGGESTING 
LITTLE CLOUDINESS FROM LATE SUNDAY INTO TUESDAY.  TOUGH TO TIME ANY 
INDIVIDUAL SHORTWAVES THAT MIGHT ROTATE AROUND THE DEEP UPPER 
LOW...BUT ANY RAIN LOOKS TO BE LIGHT WITH LOW POPS REASONABLE FOR 
NOW.  ALL LIQUID PCPN TYPE...EVEN ON THE COOLEST PERIOD OF TUESDAY 
MORNING.

UPPER LOW LOOKS TO LIFT NE BY WEDNESDAY...BRINGING PARTLY CLOUDY 
SKIES AND TEMPS BACK UP TO NEAR CLIMO.  SOME PRELIMINARY GRIDS MADE 
FOR THE NEW DAY 7...WITH POPS WELL BELOW MOS FOR NOW. 

&&

.DISCUSSION...
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE DEEP SOUTH EXTENDS NORTHEAST OVER 
THE AREA THIS EVENING...WHILE A BOUNDARY REMAINS STATIONARY TO THE 
NORTH ACROSS WV AND KY. SOME MID LEVEL CLOUDS OVER THE NORTHEAST 
SECTIONS ARE MOVING EAST AND SHOULD BE OUT OF THE AREA IN A FEW 
HOURS...LEAVING CLEAR SKIES OVERNIGHT. THIS ALONG WITH CALM WINDS 
SHOULD ALLOW TEMPS TO DROP TO THE DEWPOINT...AND SOME PATCHY FOG IS 
POSSIBLE...MAINLY NEAR LAKES AND RIVERS DUE TO A LACK OF SURFACE 
MOISTURE. DO NOT EXPECT FOG TO BE ENOUGH TO WARRANT A MENTION IN THE 
ZONES...SO NO UPDATE WILL BE NEEDED.

THROUGH TUESDAY.  GETTING SOME DECENT COLD AIR ADVECTION SUNDAY

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
333 AM EDT TUE OCT 18 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DRY WEATHER REGIME TO CONTINUE 
THROUGH THE SHORT TERM PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. MODEL TIME 
HEIGHTS DO DEPICT SOME INCREASE IN MID-LEVEL MOISTURE IN RESPONSE TO 
A LOW-AMPLITUDE SHORT WAVE TROUGH WHICH PASSES THROUGH THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS TODAY. HOWEVER...ONLY A SLIGHT INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER 
IS EXPECTED WITH THIS FEATURE. WEAK FRONT ALSO MEANDERS AROUND THE 
NORTHEASTERN PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA. HAVE SLIGHTLY RAISED 
CLOUDS IN FIRST PERIOD. FOR TEMPS...SOUTHWESTERLY SURFACE FLOW 
AROUND RETREATING HIGH PRESSURE SHOULD ALLOW TEMPS TO CLIMB SEVERAL 
DEGREES OVER THE PAST FEW DAYS. GUIDANCE TEMPS ARE GENERALLY CLOSE 
AND APPEAR REASONABLE. GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO THOSE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...STILL SOME SLIGHT 
DIFFERENCES ON TIMING THE APPROACH AND PASSAGE OF COLD FRONT FOR 
LATE FRIDAY OR EARLY SATURDAY.  BETTER DYNAMICS MAY STAY TO OUR 
NORTH CLOSER TO THE TRACK OF THE SHORTWAVE AND SURFACE LOW...SO NO 
CHANGES MADE TO RAIN CHANCES FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS/FORECAST AT THIS 
POINT.  OUR AREA STAYS IN THE WARM SECTOR SOUTH OF WARM FRONT AND 
EAST OF THE COLD FRONT FOR THURSDAY...SO NUDGED MAX TEMPS UP TO THE 
WARMER NEW MOS VALUES.

ONE SIGNIFICANT CHANGE IS THE POTENTIAL FOR CONSIDERABLE COOLING 
FROM SUNDAY INTO TUESDAY...AS MODELS (FAIR AGREEMENT AND ALSO WITH 
ENSEMBLES) ADVERTISE A DEEP AND CLOSED UPPER LOW DEVELOPING OVER THE 
OHIO VALLEY AND GREAT LAKES REGION FOR THOSE PERIODS.  THIS LOOKS TO 
SEND MUCH COOLER 850 MB TEMPS SOUTHWARD...WHICH SEEMS REASONABLE AND 
COULD EASILY LOWER TEMPS TO THE 18/00Z GFSX VALUES (8 TO 12 DEGREES 
BELOW CLIMO ON MAXES).  KEPT THESE LATER PERIODS DRY FOR NOW...BUT A 
SHORTWAVE COULD ROTATE AROUND THE UPPER LOW AND BRING MORE 
CLOUDINESS AND LOW CHANCE POPS AS WELL.  

LOWERED TEMPS...ESPECIALLY MAX TEMPS...STARTING SAT AND THRU MON
FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS.  NEXT SHIFT MAY VERY WELL NEED TO LOWER TEMPS A 
BIT MORE AFTER VIEWING 12Z MODEL DATA FOR CONSISTENCY...AND UPDATED 
GRIDS FROM NEIGHBORING OFFICES.

THEN STALLING.  NAM BRINGS FRONT FURTHER SOUTH INTO OUR AREA AND

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
408 AM EDT MON OCT 17 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
GENERALLY EXTENDS ACROSS TN VALLEY NWD INTO OHIO VALLEY REGION THIS 
MORNING.  SCHOOL NET OBSERVATIONS INDICATE PLENTY OF UPPER 30S 
ACROSS THE AREA THIS MORNING...BUT ASOS/AWOS/FIRE WX SITES GENERALLY 
SHOW LITTLE WARMER READINGS AT 07Z FROM NEAR 40 TO UPPER 40S.  KEPT 
IN THE PATCHY FROST EARLY THIS MORNING IN WEATHER GRIDS UP TO 12Z.  

SINCE WE WILL EXPERIENCE NEARLY FULL SUNSHINE TODAY...AND MODELS 
ADVERTISE NEUTRAL TO WEAK WARM AIR ADVECTION THIS AFTERNOON...
WOULD EXPECT HIGHS TO TOP OUT AROUND 2 TO 4 DEGREES ABOVE SUNDAY 
MAXES.  THUS...TRENDED TOWARD THE SLIGHTLY WARMER MOS VALUES.  

FOR TONIGHT...EXPECT LIGHT TO CALM WINDS AGAIN AND A CONTINUED DRY 
AIRMASS FOR THE MOST PART.  HOWEVER...TIME HEIGHT SECTIONS SHOW A 
SLIGHT INCREASE IN MOISTURE FROM AROUND 850 TO 700 MB LEVEL AS A 
WEAK TROUGH/COLD FRONT DRAWS NEAR.  NOT CONVINCED THAT A SOLID CLOUD 
LAYER WILL DEVELOP...BUT SEEMS WORTH BRINGING SLIGHTLY HIGHER CLOUD 
COVER VALUES TO NRN MOST AREAS LATE TONIGHT (ALMOST UP TO PARTLY 
CLOUDY).  ALSO...THIS MOISTURE SHOULD HELP TO RAISE DEWPOINT TEMPS 
SLIGHTLY AS SUGGESTED FROM MOS OUTPUT...BUT PREFERRED TO STAY CLOSE 
TO PREVIOUS MIN TEMP GRID AND COOLER MOS VALUES FOR NOW.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...EXPECTING ONLY LIMITED HIGH 
AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE FROM THE WEAK TROUGH THAT PASSES BY ALONG THE 
NORTHERN EDGE OF THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY. HAVE ADDED A FEW MORE 
CLOUDS ACROSS MAINLY SW VA TUESDAY. RIDGING BUILDS BACK IN TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY WITH UPPER FLOW BECOMING MORE ZONAL. 
TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM A FEW DEGREES TUESDAY AND REMAIN WARM 
WEDNESDAY AS HEIGHTS RISE. THE NEXT TROUGH/FRONT SHOULD APPROACH 
THURSDAY WITH SOME ADDED CLOUD COVER BUT TEMPERATURES STILL ABOVE 
NORMAL. BOTH GFS AND NAM/DGEX KEEP THE DEEPEST MOISTURE NORTH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA UNTIL LATE FRIDAY. BEST CHANCE OF RAIN WILL BE FRIDAY 
NIGHT AND SATURDAY AS THE FRONT MOVES THROUGH ALTHOUGH DOES NOT LOOK 
LIKE ANY BIG AMOUNTS AT THIS TIME. NEW TROPICAL DEPRESSION IN THE NW 
CARIBBEAN EXPECTED TO MOVE INTO THE GULF COULD AFFECT THE SOUTHEAST 
US THIS WEEKEND. TOO EARLY TO TELL IF IT COULD GIVE THE TN VALLEY 
ANY RAINFALL NEXT WEEK.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...DRY AIRMASS HAS 
FILTERED INTO THE FORECAST AREA WITH DEWPOINTS GENERALLY IN THE 
UPPER 20S TO LOWER 30S. DRY NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AND SURFACE RIDGING
WILL DOMINATE THROUGH THE SHORT-TERM. SOUNDING SHOW LIMITED MOISTURE
SO CLEAR SKIES WILL BE THE RULE. GIVEN CLEAR SKY AND CALM WINDS WITH
SURFACE RIDGING WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO DROP NICELY OVERNIGHT WITH
LOWS IN THE 30S ANTICIPATED OVER NORTHEAST AND EASTERN MOUNTAINS. WILL
CONTINUE TO HIGHLIGHT WITH A SPS CONCERNING POTENTIAL FROSTY CONDITIONS
IN THESE AREAS BY MONDAY MORNING. 

GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE COLDER MINS DUE TO FAVORABLE RADIATIONAL COOLING
CONDITIONS. HOWEVER...DUE TO DRY AIRMASS AND ABUNDANT SUNSHINE GOOD
DIURNAL RANGE IN TEMPERATURES WILL ALLOW FOR FAIRLY RAPID WARMING DURING
THE DAY.

FIRE WEATHER PURPOSES...DRY AIRMASS WILL PRODUCE LOW AFTERNOON HUMIDITIES
IN THE 20S MOST LOCATIONS THE NEXT TWO DAYS. HOWEVER...WINDS WILL BE
LIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...RIDGE ACROSS REGION 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER INTO THE END OF THE WEEK.  GFS INDICATING A 
WEAK FRONT DROPPING SOUTH INTO KY ON THURSDAY AND STALLING...HIGH  
PRESSURE IN OUR AREA SHOULD KEEP ACTIVITY WELL TO THE NORTH OF OUR 
CWA.  A BETTER ORGANIZED UPPER TROUGH AND FRONT PUSHING INTO REGION 
ON FRIDAY NIGHT WHICH IS A LITTLE SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS.  STILL 
ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE WITH IT.  WILL REMOVE THE POPS FROM FRIDAY AND 
KEEP THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING FOR FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY 
NIGHT.  GFS TAKING TROPICAL DEPRESSION 24 TOO FAR EAST TO AFFECT US

VALUES.  KEPT IN PATCHY AREAS OF FROST LATE TONIGHT IN THE SHELTERED 
VALLEYS AND HIGHEST ELEVATIONS...AND WE WILL LIKELY ISSUE SPS AGAIN.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)... SUBTROPICAL RIDGE IN GULF
OF MEXICO LOOKS STRONG ENOUGH TO KEEP MAIN STORM TRACK TO OUR
NORTH. STILL HAVE POPS IN FOR THE END OF THE WEEK...BUT SHOULD ONLY
HAVE A GLANCING BLOW FROM THAT SYSTEM AS IT TRACK NORTH OF AREA AS
WELL.

SURFACE RIDGE THAT WILL BE OVER THE AREA MONDAY MORNING WILL SETTLE
INTO THE GULF COAST STATES FOR A FEW DAYS LEAVING US IN A FAIRLY
DRY WEST OR SOUTHWEST LOW LEVEL FLOW.

TEMPERATURES EXPECTED TO REBOUND TO READINGS WELL ABOVE AVERAGE
AGAIN BY MID WEEK.  MADE ONLY MINOR TWEAKS TO TEMPS.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...MAIN FORECAST CONCERN ARE
LOW TEMPERATURES AND POTENTIAL OF FROST THE NEXT TWO NIGHTS.  MODELS SHOW
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING OVER THE AREA THROUGH MONDAY WITH DRIER
DEWPOINTS (CURRENTLY IN THE 30S ACROSS THE MID-WEST) ADVECTING INTO THE
FORECAST AREA. GUIDANCE MINS SHOW TEMPERATURES DROPPING INTO THE MID 30S
TO LOWER 40S OVER THE NORTHEAST AND FAR EASTERN MOUNTAINS.

SHELTERED VALLEYS AND HIGHEST ELEVATIONS HAVE THE GREATEST POTENTIAL OF
FROSTY CONDITIONS AND WILL INCLUDE WITHIN A SPS FOR THIS AFTERNOON.

SOME SCATTERED CI/CS POSSIBLE...OTHERISE CLEAR SKY EXPECTED THE NEXT
TWO DAYS.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...RIDGE ACROSS REGION 
BRINGING DRY WEATHER FOR MOST OF THE WEEK.  GFS INDICATING A WEAK 
SHORTWAVE PASSING THROUGH OUR AREA ON EARLY TUESDAY...BUT BEST 
MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH...SO KEEPING IT DRY IN OUR AREA.  A MORE 
DEVELOPED UPPER TROUGH AND FRONT PUSHING INTO REGION ON FRIDAY... 
MOISTURE STILL PRETTY LIMITED...SO WILL ONLY ADD SLIGHT CHANCE   
POPS FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.

.DISCUSSION...VISIBLE SATELLITE AND OBSERVATIONS SHOW A GOOD DEAL OF

LOWER OHIO VALLEY WHICH WILL MOVE SOUTH OVER THE AREA BY EARLY THIS
AFTERNOON. DUE TO VERY LIMITED MOISTURE...NO CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH
FROPA. MAIN EFFECT WILL BE SLIGHT INCREASING NORTH-NORTHWEST WINDS
AND USHERING OF DRIER DEWPOINTS.

CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD AND DO NOT PLAN ANY CHANGES TO GOING 
FORECAST...EXCEPT FOR COSMETIC ONES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
332 AM EDT SAT OCT 15 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WARM DRY TODAY...COOL DRY TONIGHT. 
COLD FRONT EXTENDS FROM CENTRAL MI TO SRN IL TO SW MO. ONLY REAL 
INDICATION IS WEAK SFC PRESSURE RISES AND SOME LIGHT WINDS BEHIND 
IT. AIRMASS BEHIND THE FRONT IN THE UPPER MIDWEST IS NOT THAT COLD 
AND DRY AND EVEN IF THIS ADVECTS IN OVERNIGHT DO NOT EXPECT 
DRASTICALLY COLD TEMPS SUNDAY MORNING...ALTHOUGH THERE MIGHT BE SOME 
TEMPS DROP TO THE MID 30S IN SECLUDED HOLLERS IN THE MOUNTAINS AND 
SW VA.  THIS ALL DUE TO MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND THE RAPID DECOUPLING 
OF WINDS TONIGHT. HAVE DROPPED MIN TEMPS TONIGHT A DEGREE OR TWO 
BELOW MAV EVERYWHERE.

THERE WILL BE SOME ISSUE OF WINDS IN THE MOUNTAINS THIS AFTERNOON AS 
925-700 THICKNESS GRADIENT TIGHTENS. HAVE INCREASED WINDS IN 
MOUNTAINS AND ALONG VA-KY BORDER TO TEENS WITH SOME GUSTINESS. LAST, 
HAVE NUDGED MAX TEMPS IN THE SRN HALF A DEGREE-ISH WITH AMPLE SUN 
EXPECTED, BUT HAVE NUDGED THEM DOWN A HAIR IN THE NRN HALF WHERE IT 
WILL HAVE TO DEAL WITH SIGNIFICANT RADIATION AND BURN OFF OF FOG IN 
MANY AREAS. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...DRIER AIR LOCATED IN THE 
DAKOTAS NOW SHOULD BE FILTERING INTO THE AREA DURING THE EARLY PARTS 
OF THE PERIOD.  HIGH TEMPS ON SUNDAY LOOK RESONABLE CONSIDERING 
HIGHS WERE MAINLY IN THE 60S IN THE DAKOTAS ON FRIDAY.  LOOKING AT 
FRIDAYS LOWS AND CURRENT TEMPS UP IN THAT AREA...HAVING A LITTLE 
CONCERN THAT GUIDANCE LOW TEMPS MAY BE A LITTLE TOO COOL MONDAY 
MORNING.  PRESENT 06Z FARGO TEMP IS 41 DEG...NAM MOS FORECAST IN 48 
HOURS (06Z) AT KTRI IS 41 DEG...SUGGESTING THAT AIRMASS WONT MODIFY 
ON ITS WAY SEWD...HMMM.  ALSO...DEWPOINTS ARENT OVERLY DRY...AROUND 
FREEZING.  FROST MAY BE LIMITED TO HIGHEST ELEVATIONS SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY MORNINGS UNLESS WE CAN GET THE DEWPOINTS A LITTLE DRIER.

PRETTY QUICK WARMUP STARTS MONDAY AFTERNOON AND CONTINUES THROUGH AT 
LEAST THURSDAY UNTIL NEXT SYSTEM GETS INTO AREA AROUND FRIDAY.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...PROBLEM OF THE DAY IS WHAT TO DO

FASTER. LL MOISTURE, ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTHEAST, WILL ALLOW FOR A 
LITTLE SLOWER BURN OFF IN THE NORTHEASTERN HALF OF FORECAST AREA. A 
LITTLE MORNING FOG PERHAPS TODAY AND SATURDAY EARLY MORNING IN AREAS 
WITH CLEARER SKIES. HAVE INCREASED CLOUD COVER TODAY A LITTLE IN THE 
NORTHEAST TO ACCOUNT FOR EXTRA MOISTURE THERE, AND PRESENCE OF WAVE. 
ALSO, HAVE RAISED TEMPS A DEGREE OR SO OVER MAV IN SOUTHWEST 
PORTIONS, AND EITHER KEPT THE SAME OR LOWERED THEM A DEGREE UNDER 
MAV IN NORTHEAST PORTIONS. OVERNIGHT LOWS I DROPPED A DEGREE OR TWO 
AS SKIES CLEAR, WAVE MOVES OUT, WINDS DIE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
CONTINUES TO SLOWLY BUILD INTO THE REGION OVER THE WEEKEND WITH DEW 
POINTS BOTTOMING OUT AROUND MONDAY MORNING.  HAVE LOWERED LOW TEMPS 
FOR SUNDAY NIGHT ABOUT 4-6 DEGREES DUE TO EXPECTATIONS OF DRY AIR 
AND LIGHT WINDS.

LOOKS TO REMAIN DRY THROUGH ENTIRE LONG TERM PERIOD AS MOST
SYSTEMS STAY TO OUR NORTH. ANOTHER MINOR SHORT WAVE RACES THROUGH AREA
ON TUESDAY...BUT NO RAIN EXPECTED WITH IT FOR NOW EITHER.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...PERSISTENT UPPER RIDGE

AREA. DEGREE OF CLOUD COVER WILL AGAIN MAKE TEMPS PROBLEMATIC 
ESPECIALLY MAX TEMPS FOR THURSDAY. RELATIVELY WIDE VARIATION IN 
GUIDANCE TEMPS ACCENTUATES THIS POINT. MODEL TIME HEIGHTS GENERALLY 
DEPICT SLIGHTLY LESS BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE TOMORROW. THUS SOMEWHAT 
LESS CLOUD COVER ANTICIPATED. INCLINATION IS TO NOT MAKE ANY 
DRAMATIC CHANGES TO PREVIOUS FORECAST WHICH TENDS TO AGREE WITH 
WARMER GFS GUIDANCE VALUES.



.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...COLD FRONT MOVES
THROUGH THE AREA ON FRIDAY WITH ASSOCIATED SHORTWAVE...
HOWEVER... NOT ENOUGH MOISTURE TO GENERATE SHOWERS SO HAVE BACKED
POPS BELOW 15 PERCENT AND REMOVED SHOWERS FROM THE FORECAST. THIS
LEAVES THE ENTIRE FORECAST DRY. TEMPERATURES POST FRONTAL WILL BE
ABOUT 5 DEGREES COOLER THE PRE-FRONTAL. BASICALLY TYPICAL OCTOBER
WEATHER FOR THE FORECAST PERIOD.

CARRY 20 POPS ON FRIDAY.  SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO BUILD INTO THE

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 111857
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT TUE OCT 11 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...ABUNDANT PESKY CLOUD COVER 
OVER MOST OF THE NORTHERN 2/3 OF THE FORECAST AREA AND MORE 
ADVECTING IN ALL THE TIME. THIS HAS PROVED TO BE THE PROBLEM O THE 
DAY, WITH ITS ATTENDANT SINK/SWIM ON TEMPS. NAM SEEMS TO BE THE BEST 
MODEL WITH SHORT RIDGING AND LIMITED POPS OVERNIGHT AND ESPECIALLY 
ON WEDNESDAY. HAVE ADJUSTED CLOUD COVER TO ALLOW STRATUS DECK TO 
REFORM OVERNIGHT EVERYWHERE, THEN BURN OFF TOMORROW IN THE CENTRAL 
VALLEY, BUT IT WILL LIKELY EITHER STAY PUT ALONG THE PLATEAU, 
MOUNTAINS, AND NORTHEAST, OR IT WILL BURN OFF JUST ENOUGH TO ALLOW 
SOLAR GENERATED STRATOCU TO REFORM. SOME CU MAY ACTUALLY BECOME 
TOWERING IN THE SUNNIER AREAS IN THE SOUTH. A MINOR PIECE OF ENERGY 
MOVE OVER THE RIDGE WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON WHICH WILL WORK WITH LL 
MOISTURE AND PRODUCE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS EARLY ALONG THE 
MOUNTAINS, GROWING TO INCLUDE MOST OF THE AREA EAST OF THE PLATEAU 
BY THE END OF THE PERIOD. ADJUSTED MIN TEMPS UP A DEGREE IN THE 
SOUTHERN TWO THIRDS AS CLOUDS WILL REFORM AND HOLD THEM UP A LITTLE. 
BETWEEN THE MINOR SHORT WAVE AND THE SUN, GAPS IN THE CLOUD COVER 
WEDNESDAY WILL ALLOW MAX TEMPS TO BE A LITTLE HIGHER THAN THE MAV 
NUMBERS SOUTHERN TWO-THIRDS AND ADJUSTED ACCORDINGLY.


.LONG TERM...(WED NIGHT THROUGH TUE)...GENERALLY BENIGN WEATHER WITH 
ABOVE CLIMO TEMPS IN THE OFFING FOR MUCH OF THE REMAINDER OF THE 
WORK WEEK PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. SHORT WAVE/COLD FRONT 
APPROACH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON FRIDAY...BUT MODEL TIME 
HEIGHTS DEPICT VERY UNIMPRESSIVE MOISTURE PROFILE ACCOMPANYING THIS 
FEATURE. WILL CONTINUE TO MENTION SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ON FRIDAY...BUT 
PROSPECTS DO NOT LOOK PROMISING AT THIS TIME.

FURTHER OUT...MODEL SOLUTIONS BECOME INCREASINGLY DIVERSE BY THE END 
OF THE PERIOD...RESULTING IN RATHER LOW CONFIDENCE. CANADIAN GEM 
MODEL TENDS TO SUPPORT THE ECMWF MAKING THE 00Z GFS AN OUTLIER. 
THUS HAVE GENERALLY FOLLOWED A ECMWF/GEM CONSENSUS. THIS MODEL 
CONSENSUS PROJECTS GENERALLY DRY CONDITIONS WITH ABOVE CLIMO TEMPS 
PERSISTING.


&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EDT SAT OCT 8 2005

.SHORT TERM...
TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY...THE RAIN HAS ENDED ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON WITH A FEW AREAS OF DRIZZLE STILL 
POSSIBLE. LOW CLOUDS STILL BLANKET ALMOST ALL OF THE AREA WITH SOME 
BREAKS ACROSS SW NC AND ACROSS THE SOUTHERN VALLEY. THE COLD FRONT 
HAS NOW MOVED ALMOST TO THE EAST COAST AT MID AFTERNOON. COLD AIR 
ADVECTION IS CONTINUING WITH STRONGEST WINDS NEAR 15 MPH OVER THE 
SOUTHERN VALLEY. TEMPERATURES ARE STILL COOL AND RANGE FROM THE MID 
50S IN PARTS OF SW VA AND THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU TO THE 
LOWER AND MID 60S EXCEPT THE UPPER 60S SOUTHERN VALLEY AND LOWER 70S 
SW NC. 

CURRENT SATELLITE PICTURES AND SHORT TERM RUC MODEL SHOWING UPPER 
LOW OVER OHIO BRINGING SOME LOW CLOUDS SOUTH TOWARD THE OHIO RIVER. 
ANOTHER MID LEVEL LOW NOW OVER THE ARKLATEX IS ALREADY SPREADING 
HIGH AND MID LEVEL CLOUDS NE INTO MIDDLE TN AND NORTH AL ABOVE THE 
LOW CLOUD DECK THAT IS STILL THERE THIS AFTERNOON. THIS UPPER LOW 
WILL MOVE NORTHEAST INTO WEST TN BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON. FOR TONIGHT 
AND SUNDAY THE MAIN PROBLEM WILL BE LINGERING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND 
ITS AFFECT ON LOW AND HIGH TEMPERATURES. THE GFS MODEL IS SCOURING
OUT THE MOISTURE SOME TONIGHT AND SUNDAY AND THE GUIDANCE DROPS 
TEMPERATURES INTO THE UPPER 40S...THEN SUNDAY WITH BREAKS WARMING 
MOST PLACES INTO THE 70S. WILL FOLLOW THE WARMER NAM NUMBERS TONIGHT 
IN THE LOWER 50S AND FOR SUNDAY A BLEND WITH TEMPERATURES A FEW 
DEGREES BELOW MAV. CROSS SECTION RH DATA BELOW 850 MB STAYS ABOVE
90 PERCENT THROUGH SUNDAY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA.

.LONG TERM...
SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY...THE MIDLEVEL LOW WILL LIFT NORTHEAST
AND CROSS THE AREA SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY. IN RESPONSE THE 850
MB WINDS TURN TO A MORE UPSLOPE COMPONENT AND INCREASE. LOW LEVEL
WARM THETA-E ADVECTION WILL BE OCCURRING BELOW 500 MB
COOLING...RESULTING IN 850-500 LAPSE RATES OF 6 TO 7 C/KM. NAM ALSO
SHOWS SLIGHTLY NEGATIVE LI ON MONDAY ALONG WITH SURFACE CONVERGENCE
IN THE TN VALLEY WITH DEWPOINTS IN THE LOWER/MID 60S. THUS WILL ADD
A MENTION OF ISOLATED THUNDER. WV IMAGERY INDICATES THAT DEEP
MOISTURE IS LIMITED WITH THIS SYSTEM...AND THE GFS SHOWS VERY
LITTLE LIFT DESPITE A 28/S VORT MAX...SO WILL KEEP POPS AT A LOW
CHANCE. HEIGHTS RISE ON MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY AS THE SYSTEM
EXITS AND A SHORTWAVE RIDGE BUILDS OVERHEAD. TEMPS SUNDAY NIGHT
WILL LEAN TOWARD THE WARMER MET GUIDANCE...IN THE MID/UPPER 50S.
SOUTHWEST SECTIONS MAY SEE ENOUGH SUN MONDAY TO REACH 80 WHILE
CLOUDS CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST WILL HOLD TEMPS IN THE 70S. WITH MORE
SUNSHINE ON TUESDAY HIGHS SHOULD REACH THE MID 70S TO LOWER 80S.

TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY...MID LEVEL RIDGE AXIS WILL BE OVER 
THE AREA ON TUESDAY NIGHT...AND SHIFT TO THE EAST ON WEDNESDAY. 
THE RESULTING SOUTHWEST FLOW WILL INCREASE MOISTURE...AND AN
APPROACHING UPPER TROUGH WILL INCREASE LIFT ON THURSDAY. MODELS
DIFFER WITH THE STRENGTH AND TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM...WITH THE DGEX
SHOWING A SLOW CLOSED CIRCULATION AND THE GFS SHOWING A PROGRESSIVE
POSITIVELY-TILTED TROUGH. GIVEN THESE DISPARITIES WILL NOT MAKE
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES AND POPS THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WILL BE KEPT AS
LOW CHANCES. BEHIND THIS TROUGH A LARGE RIDGE CROSSES THE EASTERN
CONUS...GIVING DRY WEATHER FOR THE WEEKEND.

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.DISCUSSION...WITH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS MORNING THE UPPER LEVELS HAVE DRIED OUT ACROSS THE WEST AND 
SOUTHWEST AND ARE BEGINNING TO DRY OUT TO THE EAST. LOW LEVELS

THIS MORNING. TEMPERATURES ARE STILL NEAR THE LOWS OF MID 50S TO

AGREE WITH NAM THAT LOW LEVEL CLOUDS WILL REMAIN TRAPPED FOR THE 
REST OF THE DAY. MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION HAS MOVED TO THE NORTHEAST 
SO WILL DROP POPS AND INCLUDE DRIZZLE. WILL ADJUST HIGHS DOWN 
SEVERAL DEGREES...CLOSER TO NAM GUIDANCE.

THURSDAY THROUGH FRIDAY AS UPPER TROF MAKES PROGRESS INTO THE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
319 PM EDT FRI OCT 7 2005

.SHORT TERM...
TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY...A TROUGH OF LOW PRESSURE 
EXTENDS FROM THE NORTHEAST GULF TO THE NORTHEAST OVER THE EASTERN 
HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA AND EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS THIS 
AFTERNOON. LOW CLOUDS AND LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN CONTINUES ACROSS 
MOST OF THE EASTERN TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. AN UPPER 
TROUGH WAS OVER THE UPPER MS VALLEY AND AHEAD OF THIS TROUGH A 
SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONT HAD MOVED TO THE WESTERN EDGE OF THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS AFTERNOON WITH A NOTICEABLE DIFFERENCE IN TEMPERATURES 
ACROSS THIS BOUNDARY. CURRENT TEMPERATURES IN SCOTT AND BLEDSOE 
COUNTIES ARE NEAR 60 WITH SOME COLD AIR SPREADING IN TO THE PLATEAU. 
THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA IS IN THE MID 60S TO LOWER 70S. A 
WEAK UPPER LOW WAS LOCATED OVER THE FLORIDA PANHANDLE EXTENDING INTO 
SOUTHERN GA AND AL. DURING THE NEXT 24 HOURS MODELS BRING THIS UPPER 
LOW NORTHEAST AND MOVES THE FRONT VERY SLOWLY EAST. A COUPLE 
IMPULSES MOVE NORTH NORTHEAST TONIGHT AND SATURDAY ACROSS GA INTO NC 
AND VA BRUSHING NORTHEAST TN AND SW VA. THIS AREA MAY GET ANOTHER 
ONE TO TWO INCHES OF RAIN ESPECIALLY OVER THE MOUNTAINS. GFS IS 
FASTER WITH MOVING THE FRONT EAST BUT THINK THE SLOWER NAM IS MORE 
REPRESENTATIVE OF THE CURRENT SPEED. MODELS START TO DRY OUT THE 
UPPER LEVELS SATURDAY BUT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE GETS TRAPPED WHICH WILL 
KEEP CLOUDS AROUND. TEMPERATURES WERE TRICKY WITH THE FRONT SO 
CLOSE. FOLLOWED CLOSER TO THE WARMER MET NUMBERS TONIGHT AND HAD A 
RANGE FROM LOWER TO MID 60S PLATEAU TO UPPER 60S IN THE VALLEYS 
SATURDAY.     

.LONG TERM...
SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY...THE SOUTHERN PORTION OF THE TROUGH 
CROSSING THE MIDWEST BECOMES CUT OFF OVER THE SOUTHERN MS VALLEY ON 
SATURDAY NIGHT. MID AND UPPER LEVELS DRY LATE SATURDAY BEHIND THE 
EXITING SHORTWAVE TROUGH...BUT BOTH THE NAM AND GFS INDICATE PLENTY 
OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE REMAINING IN PLACE. THUS WILL HAVE CLOUDY 
SKIES WITH NO POP FOR SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING. ON 
SUNDAY THE CLOSED LOW BEGINS TO LIFT NORTHEAST. VORTICITY ADVECTION 
AND UPPER DIVERGENCE INCREASE IN RESPONSE...AND WILL BEGIN POPS 
ACROSS THE AREA ON SUNDAY EVENING. GFS IS STRONGER WITH THE VORT 
AXIS BUT BOTH NAM AND GFS HAVE SIMILAR TIMING. STRONG DYNAMICS IN 
THE GFS SUGGEST THUNDER MAY BE POSSIBLE...BUT INSTABILITY IS TOO 
LIMITED AT THIS POINT TO ADD A MENTION. THE VORT LIFTS OUT OF THE 
AREA LATE TUESDAY...ENDING POPS AND DRYING OUT THE COLUMN. 

MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY...RIDGE OVER THE GULF OF MEXICO WILL 
BUILD NORTH ON MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. WILL KEEP A DRY 
FORECAST THIS PERIOD WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES. THE RIDGE AXIS 
WILL SHIFT EAST OF THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY AS A TROUGH APPROACHES FROM 
THE WEST. UPPER DIVERGENCE AHEAD OF A JET STREAK AND INCREASING 
MOISTURE WILL BRING A CHANCE OF RAIN BEGINNING WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. 
SURFACE FRONT APPEARS TO STALL NEAR THE MOUNTAINS...AND RAIN CHANCE 
WILL CONTINUE THROUGH FRIDAY. THE POSITIVE TILT TO THE TROUGH AND 
RELATIVELY LIGHT WINDS IN THE LOW LEVELS WILL KEEP POPS IN THE 
SLIGHT/LOW CHANCE RANGE. A SECOND TROUGH THAT DIVES OUT OF CANADA 
MAY LEAD TO HIGHER POPS LATE FRIDAY BUT WILL LEAVE AS A CHANCE THIS 
FAR OUT.

TOWARD THE TN VLY AND SRN APPALACHIANS. GFS/NAM INDICATE SUFFICIENT 
DEPTH OF MOISTURE IN PLACE AHEAD OF THE S/WV FOR THIS POSSIBILITY. 
KEPT SKY COVER PESSIMISTICALLY MOSTLY CLOUDY AS WELL. KEPT THE DRY 
AND IMPROVING WX TREND GOING MONDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY DAYTIME PERIOD 
AS UPPER RIDGE AMPLIFIES AHEAD OF NEXT TROF. THIS FEATURE PRESSES 
EAST INTO THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY WITH

POPS FROM PREVIOUS FCST AS THIS TROF APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA.

TERM FCST BUT NOT AS RADICALLY AS GFS MOS DUE TO SLOWER PROGRESSION 
OF FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND EXTENDED PERIOD OF SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT.

REMNANTS OF TAMMY IS ROTATING WESTWARD ACROSS AREA AND PRESSURE
GRADIENT HAS REMAINED TIGHTER THAN ORIGINALLY THOUGHT AND THAN THE MODELS
FORECAST. THIS SHOULD REMAIN A PLAYER THE REST OF THE NIGHT. AS A
RESULT, WILL NOT UPDATE TEMPS AS THE MIXING WILL MAINTAIN HIGHER
TEMPS OVERNIGHT.

FXUS64 KMRX 061916
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EDT THU OCT 6 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MOISTURE HAS BEEN STREAMING 
NORTH AND NORTHWEST ALL DAY FROM TROPICAL DEPRESSION TAMMY AS SHE 
DIES OUT IN AL. MOSTLY LIGHT RAIN HAS BEEN FALLING WITH SOME 
MODERATE RAIN IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS TO THE EAST. TEMPERATURES 
HAVE BEEN HELD NEARLY STEADY SINCE LATE MORNING IN THE UPPER 60S TO 
THE LOWER 70S AS LOW CLOUDS AND RAIN HAVE MOVED NORTH ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. THE SURFACE AND UPPER LOW REMAINS OF TAMMY WERE OVER 
SOUTHERN AL AND A COLD FRONT IS CURRENTLY MOVING SOUTHEAST INTO THE 
LOWER OHIO VALLEY AND HAS CROSSED THE MS RIVER IN WEST TN. THE COLD 
FRONT WILL SLOW TONIGHT AND FRIDAY AS IT PICKS UP THE MOISTURE FROM 
TAMMY. RAINFALL TONIGHT WILL NOT BE CONTINUOUS UNTIL A SHORTWAVE 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT APPROACHES LATE TONIGHT. CROSS SECTION DATA 
INDICATES COPIOUS MOISTURE WITH LIFT INCREASING LATE TONIGHT IN THE 
SOUTH AND THEN FRIDAY FARTHER NORTH AND NORTHEAST. PRECIPITABLE 
WATER VALUES WILL BE NEAR 2.00 INCHES. EXPECT RAINFALL TO BECOME 
HEAVY AT TIMES LATE TONIGHT AND FRIDAY WITH AMOUNTS FROM TWO TO 
THREE INCHES IN SW NC AND THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS BY THE TIME THE RAIN 
ENDS FRIDAY NIGHT OR EARLY SATURDAY WITH MOST OTHER AREAS ONE TO TWO 
INCHES. DO NOT THINK ANY SERIOUS FLOODING WILL DEVELOP WITH THE 
FLASH FLOOD VALUES AROUND TWO INCHES FOR ONE HOUR AND THREE TO FIVE 
INCHES FOR A SIX HOUR PERIOD. ALSO THE RAIN WILL BE SPREAD OUT OVER 
A 24 TO 36 HOUR PERIOD. TONIGHTS MODEL RUN WILL NEED TO BE LOOKED AT 
TO DETERMINE IF AMOUNTS COULD BE HIGHER. DID NOT LIKE THE HUGE GFS 
BULLEYES OF PRECIPITATION AND PREFERRED THE MORE GENERAL NAM WHICH 
SPREADS THE AMOUNTS OVER TWO DAYS. FOR TEMPERATURES LIKED THE COOLER 
MAV NUMBERS OF LOW TO MID 60S TONIGHT AND WITH NO SUN AND RAIN 
FRIDAY THINK HIGHS WILL BE IN THE UPPER 60S TO AROUND 70 
DEGREES.        

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL 
COLLIDE WITH MOISTURE STREAMING NORTHEAST FROM REMAINS OF TAMMY. 
FAIRLY DECENT UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT IS EVIDENT WITH Q-VECTOR FORCING 
NOTED AT THE 850-700 MB AND 700-500 MB LEVELS FRIDAY AFTERNOON 
THROUGH EARLY SATURDAY MORNING. ALSO...NOTED FORECAST AREA WILL BE 
UNDER THE FAVORED RIGHT REAR QUADRANT OF THE JET (JET AXIS OVER THE 
OHIO VALLEY). WILL CONTINUE HIGH POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT (HIGHEST FOR 
TYS AND TRI). 

WILL GENERALLY TREND REST OF THE FORECAST WITH THE GFS MODEL...EVEN 
THOUGH I HAVE LOW CONFIDENCE ON THE MOISTURE STARVED SHORT-WAVE 
MOVING ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. OHIO 
VALLEY SHORT-WAVE IS MORE PROGRESS WITH THE GFS THAN THE NAM MODEL 
WHICH WILL ALLOW RAIN TO END GENERALLY SATURDAY MORNING. GFS SHOWS 
925-850 MB RELATIVE HUMIDITY HANGING TOUGH THROUGH SATURDAY WITH 
DECREASING RH SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY.

UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. RIDGE FLATTENS 
FOR MID-WEEK ALLOWING FOR A FRONTAL PASSAGE FOR WEDNESDAY OR 
THURSDAY. WILL INTRODUCE POPS FOR THE END OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EDT WED OCT 5 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...CONFIDENCE IS LOW IN THE SHORT 
TERM FORECAST.  MODELS ARE IN VERY POOR AGREEMENT AND THE RUN TO RUN 
CONSISTENCY IS OFF AS WELL.  MODELS MAIN DIFFICULTY IN THE SHORT 
TERM IS THEIR HANDLING OF TROPICAL SYSTEM TAMMY.  NOT PARTICULARLY 
TAKEN WITH CURRENT RUNS OF THE NAM OR GFS...AND BELIEVE MAIN 
MOISTURE AND DYNAMICS WILL STAY TO OUR SOUTH AND EAST.  FOR NOW... 
WILL KEEP POPS ON THURSDAY ON THE LOW SIDE...RANGING FROM AROUND 20 
PERCENT WEST TO 40S EAST.  ALSO...WILL GO BETWEEN GUIDANCE NUMBERS 
FOR HIGH TEMPS...THROUGH TRENDED TOWARD THE WARMER MET. 


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SEEMS THAT MODELS
HAVE BEEN INCONSISTENT PLUS THE SUDDEN DEVELOPMENT OF TROPICAL
STORM TAMMY...WHICH HAS LED TO SOME DRASTIC CHANGES IN THE FORECAST
FOR THE EARLY PARTS OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST.  NAM MODEL USUALLY
PERFORMS POORLY WITH TROPICAL SYSTEMS (ALSO NOTING COMMENTS ABOUT
POOR INITIALIZATION IN THE NAM CONCERNING T.S. TAMMY).  THUS...
CONTINUED TO GENERALLY FAVOR THE GFS MODEL FOR HANDLING OF THE
REMNANTS OF TAMMY PLUS THE APPROACHING COLD FRONT AND UPPER TROUGH
PASSAGE THAT LAGS BEHIND THE FRONT.  

FELT THAT MOST SIGNIFICANT RAINS FROM TAMMY WILL AFFECT AREAS TO
OUR EAST AND SOUTHEAST.  THIS LEAVES THE COLD FRONT WHICH ARRIVES
WITHOUT MUCH UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT.  SINCE BOTH THE GFS AND NAM SHOW
A DEEPER UPPER LEVEL TROUGH BEHIND THE FRONT...HAD TO CARRY AT
LEAST CHANCE POPS INTO SATURDAY AND INCREASE CLOUD COVER
CONSIDERABLY. LITTLE TO NO INSTABILITY INDICATED SO KEPT TYPE AS
SHOWERS WITH NO THUNDER.  KEPT THE DECREASE IN CLOUDS BY SATURDAY
NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...BUT LATER SHIFTS MAY NEED TO HOLD ON TO CLOUDS
LONGER.

BASED ON THESE CHANGES...DEW POINT TEMPS AS WELL AS MAX/MIN TEMPS
WERE ADJUSTED CONSIDERABLY. OTHERWISE...NO CHANGES MADE FOR MONDAY
AND TUESDAY...WITH NEW DAY 7 (WEDNESDAY) INTRODUCED AS PARTLY
CLOUDY AND DRY. TEMPS ACTUALLY LOOK TO BE NEAR NORMAL VALUES SUNDAY
THRU WEDNESDAY. MAJOR DIFFERENCES BETWEEN MOS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...
DUE TO MODEL DIFFS FROM NAM TO GFS...SO TRENDED VALUES TO THE BLEND.
DGEX LOOKED EXTREMELY DIFFERENT FROM GFS...OTHER LONG RANGE MODELS
AND ENSEMBLES BEYOND SUNDAY...SO DGEX DATA WAS PRETTY MUCH IGNORED.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             86  63  79  66 /  10  10  20  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  85  61  79  63 /  10  10  30  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       85  61  79  63 /  10  10  30  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              83  58  77  62 /  10  10  40  60

FXUS64 KMRX 050739
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
339 AM EDT WED OCT 5 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE ACROSS THE REGION 
BRINGING ANOTHER DRY DAY TODAY WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES.  
STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT.  MODELS 
ADVERTISING A SYSTEM MOVING UP FROM SOUTH LATE TONIGHT.  GFS TAKING 
DISTURBANCE AND BEST MOISTURE TO THE EAST OF OUR CWA TONIGHT...WHILE 
NAM TRACKS IT TO THE SOUTH.  WENT WITH THE GFS AND INTRODUCED SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR THE MOUNTAINS FOR LATE TONIGHT.  


.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...GREAT DISAGREEMENT BETWEEN
NAM AND GFS THIS MORNING. SUPPORT FROM MANY OTHER MODELS TO GO WITH
GFS SOLUTION AND TO GIVE NAM NO WEIGHT IN THIS FORECAST. THIS
GFS SOLUTION IS MUCH DRIER THAN THE NAM WITH THE BULK OF THE PRECIP
STAYING EAST OF AREA. WITH DIRECTION PRECIP IS COMING FROM...MOST OF
OUR AREA WOULD BE IN A RAIN SHADOW WEST OF THE MOUNTAINS...EXCEPT
FOR THE PEAKS AND OUR 2 NC COUNTIES. SO GOING WITH A PRETTY GOOD
GRADIENT OF POPS AND QPF ACROSS THE EASTERN PARTS OF THE AREA. SOME
ADDITIONAL PRECIP MAY BE STOLEN WHEN CONSIDERING THAT THE SURFACE
TROUGH SHOULD BE LOCATED WELL EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS.

NO MAJOR CHANGES TO TEMPS THIS TIME...EXCEPT THAT IVE COOLED DOWN
HIGHEST TERRAIN FOR FRIDAY HIGHS DUE TO SOCKED-IN COLD AIR
ADVECTION SCENARIO--NO DOWNSLOPING THERE.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 041912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT TUE OCT 4 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...NAM AND GFS IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT ON BRINGING FRONT THROUGH THE AREA ON THURSDAY, SO 
THE MAIN FORECAST ISSUES FOR THE NEAR TERM PERIOD IS WHAT TO DO 
ABOUT CLOUDS, TEMPS, AND WINDS. WITH MAIN WEAK VORT CENTERS 
FOLLOWING BEHIND THE FRONT, AND DRY AIRMASS IN ADVANCE, NO THREAT OF 
PRECIP THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  HAVE MADE SOME VERY MINOR 
ADJUSTMENTS TO CLOUDS ALONG THE WESTERN SLIVER OF THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU IN THE MRX FORECAST AREA TO REDUCE OVERALL COVER FOR TONIGHT 
AND WEDNESDAY, AND ALSO REDUCED HIGH TEMPS (ONLY BY 1-2 DEGREES) FOR 
WEDNESDAY IN MOST PLACES AS BELIEVE HIGH CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO 
OBSCURE SUN JUST A LITTLE. ALSO, RAISED WINDS SPEEDS SOME AND 
ADJUSTED DIRECTIONS TO ACCOUNT FOR APPROACH OF FRONT, ESPECIALLY IN 
HIGHER TERRAIN. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...EASTERLY WAVE WILL CONTINUE 
TO PRESS TOWARD FL EMERGING IN THE EASTERN GULF OF MEXICO BY 12Z 
THURSDAY WHILE UPPER TROF/COLD FRONT MAKE PROGRESS THROUGH THE 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY INTO THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES/OHIO VALLEY. KEPT 
POPS IN LOW TO MEDIUM CHC CATEGORY FOR THE ARRIVAL OF UPPER 
TROF/COLD FRONT AS THE INVERTED SURFACE TROF ASSOCIATED WITH THE 
EASTERLY WAVE ABSORBS MUCH OF THE INFLOW INTO THE FRONTAL SYSTEM DUE 
TO THE EAST-NORTHEASTERLY COMPONENT TO THE LOW LEVEL FLOW IN 
ADDITION TO THE DOWNSLOPING ACTION ACROSS THE BLUE RIDGE IN THIS 
SYNOPTIC SITUATION. MAINTAINED SOME SLGT/LOW CHC POPS FRIDAY MUCH OF 
THE FORECAST AREA TAPERING OFF PRECIP FROM WEST TO EAST FRIDAY NIGHT 
AS FRONT MAKES SLOW PROGRESS AWAY FROM THE APPALACHIANS. COOLER WX 
WITH RIDGING BUILDS BEHIND THE FRONT FOR THE WEEKEND AS ANOTHER 
UPPER RIDGE GRADUALLY AMPLIFIES OVER THE CENTRAL AND EASTERN U.S. 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY KEEPING RAIN OUT OF THE FORECAST AND ALLOWING FOR 
A SLOW WARMING TREND BY THE END OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD.   

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 040716
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 AM EDT TUE OCT 4 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE ACROSS THE REGION 
BRINGING WARM AND DRY WEATHER TODAY AND TONIGHT.  ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TO CONTINUE IN THE SHORT TERM.  GUIDANCE 
TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE...SO DIDNT STRAY TOO FAR.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MAINLY CONCENTRATING ON
FRONTAL PASSAGE AND RAINFALL POTENTIAL BAHAMA TROUGH. LOOKING LESS
AND LESS LIKELY THAT OUR AREA WILL GET SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION
LATER THIS WEEK. AS FRONT MOVES INTO REGION...WINDS AHEAD OF FRONT
ARE BACKING IN RESPONSE TO INTENSIFYING BAHAMA DISTURBANCE AS IT
CROSSES INTO GLFMEX. AS THE WINDS BACK...THE FRONT LOOKS LIKE ITS
NWLY WINDS MAY SIMPLY BLEND INTO THE PRE-FRONTAL NELY WINDS. MAYBE
APPROACH OF FRONT WILL VEER WINDS LOCALLY ENOUGH TO GET SOME DECENT
CONVERGENCE...BUT OVERALL DOESNT LOOK LIKE A VERY EVENTFUL FROPA.
MODELS MAY NOT BE IN GREAT AGREEMENT ON THE SPECIFICS OF BAHAMA
DISTURBANCE...BUT THERE IS GOOD AGREEMENT THAT MOST OF THE DEEP LIFT
AND MOISTURE WILL BE EAST OF THE APPS FOR THIS ENTIRE MID-LATE WEEK EVENT.

FOR TEMPS HAVE WARMED UP HIGHS ON THURSDAY...PLANNING ON SLOWER
FRONTAL MOVEMENT AND DOWNSLOPING WINDS INTO TENN BASIN. ALSO WARMED
UP THU NIGHT LOWS A FEW DEGREES AS CLOUD COVER HAMPERS INITIAL
COOLING OF POST-FRONTAL AIR MASS.

LASTLY...BUMPED UP WINDS ON FRIDAY AND POPULATED WIND GUST GRIDS.
WINDS WILL LIKELY BE BLOWING ALONG THE MAIN MOUNTAIN RIDGES...SO
DOUBT THAT ADVISORY CRITERIA WILL BE MET IN THIS EVENT.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 031923
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EDT MON OCT 3 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...595 DM H5 RIDGE IN 
PLACE OVER SE US. FAIRLY POTENT FRONT ACROSS PLAINS, WITH 20 DEG F 
TEMPS DIFFS ACROSS BOUNDARY. WV IMAGERY SHOWS SHORT WAVE OVER NE OK 
TO NW MO MOVING GENERALLY EAST. THIS WILL BEGIN TO DEPRESS RIDGE BY 
LATER THIS EVENING. SFC HIGH EAST OF APPALACHIANS WILL CONTINUE TO 
DROP DOWN EAST OF MOUNTAINS, WITH MINOR WEDGE MAKING ITS WAY INTO 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. ALL THIS WILL DO IS CAUSE SOME LIGHT EASTERLY 
WINDS ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS WHICH WILL GENERALLY DOWNSLOPE INTO THE 
AREA, DRYING THE LOWER ATMOS SOMEWHAT. NO CHANCE OF PRECIP THIS FAR 
AHEAD OF FRONT THROUGH WEDNESDAY 12Z. TEMPS ARE A BLEND, BUT 
ADJUSTED A LITTLE JUST TO COINCIDE WITH SURROUNDING OFFICES. ALSO 
TWEAKED WIND DIRECTIONS A LITTLE MORE TO NORTHEAST, BUT SPEEDS STILL 
LIGHT.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...SLOW MOVING UPR TROF AND 
ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONTAL SYSTEM MAKES PROGRESS INTO THE GREAT 
LAKES BY 12Z WED WHILE THE FA ENJOYS MORE DRY AND WARM WEATHER. USED 
SLGT CHC POPS FOR POSSIBILITY OF A SHRA OR TSRA DEVELOPING WELL 
AHEAD OF COLD FRONT WED NITE. TIMING OF FRONT WITH THIS PACKAGE 
DOESNT OCCUR UNTIL AROUND 12-16Z FRI AND SO MAINTAINED HIGHEST CHC 
POPS THU NITE FOR SHRA/TSRA. ENERGY CONTINUES TO SPILL INTO THE BACK 
SIDE OF GREAT LAKES UPR TROF WITH UPPER LEVEL WINDS REMAINING SW 
KEEPING FRONTAL MOVEMENT AND A FAIR AMOUNT OF UNCERTAINTY WITH 
ONSET/END OF PRECIP THROUGH THE FIRST HALF OF THE EXTENDED. FOR NOW 
WRAPPED UP THE EVENT WITH POPS TAPERING TO CHC/SLGT CHC ON FRI AND 
LINGERED SLGT CHC ALONG THE TN/NC BORDER FRI NITE. ALLOWED HIGHER 
PRESSURES AND DRIER NW-N FLO FOR MUCH OF THE REMAINDER OF THE FCST. 
ALONG WITH VARIOUS NEIGHBORING WFOS STRAYED SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER 
THAN NATIONAL GUIDANCE CONCERNING MAX TEMPS THU DUE TO SLOW MOVEMENT 
OF FRONT BUT OTHERWISE STAYED FAIRLY CLOSE TO GFS MOS.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 030728
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
328 AM EDT MON OCT 3 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGE STILL NOSING 
INTO AREA...WITH LOW-LEVEL FLOW GOING OVER SRN APPS AND INTO THE 
UPPER TENN BASIN.  THIS FLOW INDUCING WEAK SURFACE LEE TROF ON WEST 
SIDE OF MOUNTAINS AND ALSO INDUCING DOWNSLOPING.  AS RIDGE CONTINUES 
TO BUILD-IN PLUS DOWNSLOPING ABLE ENTRAIN SOME DRIER AIR...DEW 
POINTS SHOULD FALL OFF DURING THE DAY ALLOWING ENHANCED SURFACE 
HEATING.  HAVE BUMPED UP HIGH TEMPS 1-2 DEGREES ACROSS AREA...EXCEPT 
IN NC COUNTIES WHERE DOWNSLOPING WILL NOT BE OCCURRING.  WILL LEAVE 
IN PATCHY FOG FOR THIS MORNING NEAR LAKES...FIRST FOG SATELLITE 
IMAGE AFTER ECLIPSE SHOWS SOME FOG/LOW CLOUDS FORMING IN A FEW SPOTS.

LIGHT WINDS ALL DAY TODAY...SHOULD GO CALM TONIGHT FAVORING FAST 
COOLING THIS EVENING.  MINIMAL CHANGES TO TEMPS TONIGHT. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...UPPER RIDGE REMAINS DOMINATE 
FEATURE FOR THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH MID-WEEK. SHORT WAVE 
TROUGH/SURFACE COLD FRONT STILL PROJECTED TO APPROACH AREA ON 
THURSDAY...BUT EXACT TIMING STILL UNCERTAIN AS ENSEMBLES AND 
OPERATIONAL MODELS BECOME DIVERGENT WITH PROGRESSION OF SHORT WAVE. 
BASED ON THIS UNCERTAINTY...MADE NO CHANGES TO GRIDS/FORECAST PAST 
DAY THREE (WEDNESDAY) AND ONLY MINOR TWEAKS PRIOR TO THAT. 
ANTICIPATE DRY WEATHER WITH WELL ABOVE CLIMO TEMPS UNTIL FRONTAL 
PASSAGE SOMETIME ON THURSDAY. TEMPS PROJECTED TO AVERAGE SLIGHTLY 
BELOW CLIMO AFTER FROPA BEFORE REBOUNDING TO NEAR CLIMO BY LATE NEXT 
WEEKEND. GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO GFS GUIDANCE VALUES FOR TEMPS.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
845 PM EDT SUN OCT 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...NOT MUCH CHANGE FROM LAST NIGHTS PATTERN EXCEPT 
TEMPERATURES ARE A FEW DEGREES WARMER AT THIS TIME. I THINK PARTLY 
BECAUSE OF A LITTLE WIND BLOWING AND SOME BROKEN CLOUDS AROUND CHA 
THIS EVENING. DEWPOINTS TONIGHT ARE ALSO A LITTLE LOWER IN THE 
NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY AREAS. THIS WILL HELP TEMPERATURES DROP 
INTO THE 50S THERE. CURRENT FORECAST HAS LOWS ABOUT THE SAME MONDAY 
MORNING AS THEY WERE THIS MORNING. SKIES SHOULD BE MOSTLY CLEAR OVER 
THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEYS WITH SOME LOW CLOUDS AT TIMES 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHERN VALLEY WHERE EASTERLY FLOW IS DEEPER. 
CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. NO CHANGES ANTICIPATED.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 021907
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 PM EDT SUN OCT 2 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...WEAK SHORTWAVE CONTINUES
TO LIFT NE ACROSS THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION THIS AFTERNOON.
ONLY EFFECT THUS FAR FOR OUR REGION HAS BEEN A SLIGHT INCREASE IN
MOISTURE/CLOUDS PER SATELLITE PICS.  KEPT FORECAST DRY FOR TONIGHT
AND TOSSED IN SOME PATCHY VALLEY FOG AGAIN.  EXPECT WESTERN AND
SOUTHERN AREAS TO KEEP MORE OF A PARTLY CLOUDY SKY...WITH MOSTLY
CLEAR GENERALLY FOR NE AREAS.  CLOSE TO GFS OR BLEND FOR MIN TEMPS.

OVERALL THERE IS A SLIGHT DECREASE IN RH FOR MONDAY...WITH TIME
HEIGHT SECTIONS SHOWING THAT MOISTURE IS MAINLY FROM AROUND 800 MBS
TO SURFACE INTO TUESDAY.  THIS LOOKS TO PRODUCE MOSTLY CLEAR TO
PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES AND NO RAIN.  THE E TO SE FLOW AROUND THE RIDGE
GRADUALLY DEEPENS BY LATE TUESDAY...WHICH SHOULD HELP TO ADVECT
MOISTURE IN ADVANCE OF THE COLD FRONT THAT SLOWLY APPROACHES IN THE
EXTENDED PERIODS.  MOS MAX AND MIN TEMPS QUITE CLOSE AND ACCEPTED
WITH A TWEAK OR TWO BASED ON PATTERN OF PAST FEW DAYS.   


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...BACKED OFF ON TIMING OF 
PRECIP WITH UPR TROF/CD FNT UNTIL WED NITE AS SYSTEM PROGRESSES 
SLOWLY E WHILE HI PRES MAINTAINS PRESENCE EARLY IN THE EXTENDED 
FCST. CONTINUED WITH SLGT/SMALL CHC POPS WED NITE INCREASING TO 
MEDIUM CHC FOR THU AS CD FNT MOVES THRU THE REGION. HELD ONTO SMALL 
CHC POPS THU NITE AS WAVE DEVELOPS ALONG FNT ACROSS GA/CAROLINAS 
POSSIBLY SLOWING FRONTAL PASSAGE. DRIED OUT THE AREA AGAIN FRI THRU 
SUN AS DRIER AIR ADVECTS INTO THE REGION WITH MOST OF THE ACTIVE WX 
OCCURRING E OF THE APPALACHIANS. GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO GFS MOS 
TEMP GUIDANCE FOR THE LONG TERM PERIOD.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
958 AM EDT SUN OCT 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...VISIBLE SATELLITE PICS SHOWING A FEW AREAS OF FOG...
MAINLY ACROSS WRN PARTS OF EAST TN AND ALONG THE POWELL AND CLINCH 
RIVERS IN SW VA.  THE FOG AND LOW CLOUDS SHOULD DISSIPATE IN THE 
NEXT HALF HOUR OR SO...AND VSBYS ARE RUNNING 3 MILES OR BETTER AT 
MOST LOCATIONS.

12Z OHX SOUNDING STILL SHOWS A FAIR AMOUNT OF MOISTURE FROM SURFACE 
TO 700 MB LEVEL...AND ALSO GENERALLY SUPPORTS MAX TEMP FORECAST.
DRY FORECAST LOOKS GOOD AS ONLY FEATURE TO AID SHOWER DEVELOPMENT IS 
THE WEAK SHORTWAVE TROUGH PASSING EAST INTO THE MID MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY REGION TODAY.  LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE WILL AFFECT 
MIDDLE AND WEST TN...BUT NOT OUR PART OF THE STATE.

WILL REMOVE FOG WORDING FROM ZFPMRX...AND FRESHEN GRIDS/WEB PRODUCTS 
SHORTLY.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 020640
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
237 AM EDT SUN OCT 2 2005

.SHORT TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL REMAIN. AREAS OF UPSLOPE CLOUDS PULLING 
NORTHWEST ACROSS THE CAROLINAS...BUT DOWNSLOPE INTO THE VALLEY WILL 
LIMIT CLOUDS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. SOME PATCHY FOG AGAIN 
DEVELOPING...SOME MAY BE LOCALLY DENSE.

MOS GUIDANCE HAS BEEN TRENDING TOO COOL THE LAST COUPLE OF DAYS. 
BELIEVE DOWNSLOPE FLOW INTO THE VALLEY AND STILL RELATIVELY DRY 
GROUND...WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO CLIMB NICELY AGAIN TODAY. WILL 
TREND TOWARD THE WARMER MET GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...PERSISTENT UPPER RIDGE HOLDS 
OVER THE EASTERN CONUS THROUGH MUCH OF EARLY WORK WEEK WHICH 
SUGGESTS A CONTINUATION OF THE WARM AND DRY WEATHER. LATEST MODEL 
RUNS DELAY PROGRESSION OF UPPER TROUGH/COLD FRONT UNTIL LATE 
THURSDAY NOW. HOWEVER...MOISTURE ADVECTION AROUND WESTERN PERIPHERY 
OF RIDGE KEEPS LOW CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY REASONABLE. TEMPS 
SHOULD REMAIN WELL ABOVE CLIMATOLOGY UNTIL FROPA IN SPITE OF 
INCREASING CLOUDS...SO HAVE BUMPED UP MAX TEMPS ON WEDNESDAY 
SOMEWHAT.

TOO HIGH LAST NIGHT...SO GIVEN THIS PLUS CURRENT DEW POINTS THINK
THAT GOING A LITTLE ABOVE GFS MINS LOOKS BEST.

FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...SHORTWAVE STILL EXPECTED TO MOVE
EAST ACROSS THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY REGION...BUT MOST LIFT
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE (INCLUDING WEAK ISENTROPIC) SHOULD
STAY TO OUR W AND NW. WEAK UPSLOPE INTO SRN MTNS AND PLATEAU IS
NOTED...BUT CANT SEE MORE THAN A SPRINKLE OR TWO.  KEPT DRY
FORECAST FOR NOW PER CONSENSUS FROM NEIGHBORS.  STAYED CLOSE TO GFS
MOS FOR MAX TEMPS SUNDAY AND NEAR OR JUST ABOVE GFS FOR MINS.

MONDAY...AFTER SLIGHT DRYING SUNDAY NIGHT...EASTERLY FLOW DEEPENS
AND INCREASES OFF THE MID ATLANTIC BY MONDAY MORNING/AFTERNOON.
HOWEVER...DONT SEE THE NEED FOR RAIN CHANCES AT THIS POINT.
DOWNSLOPING EASTERLY WINDS COULD SEND MAX TEMPS TO NEAR THE WARMER
NAM MOS VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...LOTS OF ACTION WITH 
EASTERLY FLO AROUND THE BASE OF RIDGE BRINGING ATLANTIC MOISTURE 
ACROSS THE CAROLINAS EARLY IN THE PERIOD BUT THE EASTERLY FLO BRINGS 
ADIABATIC COMPRESSION WHICH LEADS TO WARMING AND DRYING ACROSS THE 
FA TUE AND TUE NITE. HOWEVER MOISTURE BECOMES DEEP ENOUGH ON WED 
AHEAD OF UPR TROF/CD FNT TO BRING A CHANCE FOR SHRA/TSRA. WITH BEST 
CHANCE WED NITE AS CD FNT SWINGS THRU THE FA. UPR FLO FLATTENS 
FAIRLY QUICKLY ON THU AND FNT SLOWS DOWN WITH WAVE DEVELOPING ON FNT 
S OF THE REGION. MAINTAINED SLGT/CHC TYPE POPS ON THU FOR POSSIBLE 
SLOWER MOVEMENT OF SFC FNT. KEPT REMAINDER OF FCST DRY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT FRI SEP 30 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...SO FAR THIS AFTERNOON ONLY 
SCATTERED CUMULUS CLOUDS OVER SMOKIES AND SRN MTNS...AND LATELY A 
FEW OVER NE PARTS OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU.  FOR TONIGHT...EXPECT 
THESE CLOUDS TO GRADUALLY DISSIPATE WITH SOME RE-DEVELOPMENT OR 
ADVECTION POSSIBLE LATE TONIGHT FOR MAINLY SW NC AND SE TN AREAS.
FOG THIS MORNING WAS VERY LIMITED...SO DOWN PLAYED FOG A BIT TO JUST 
PATCHY VALLEY FOG.  DEW POINT TEMPS HAVE RISEN SLIGHTLY TODAY WHICH 
WOULD FAVOR THE GFS MOS OR BLEND WHERE MINOR DIFFERENCES WERE NOTED.

FOR SAT THRU SUN...MAIN ITEM OF CONCERN WAS HOW MUCH DO CLOUDS 
INCREASE FROM THE SE AND SW.  THE EAST TO SOUTHEAST FLOW IS 
INITIALLY VERY SHALLOW WITH 850 MB FLOW STAYING MORE SW EARLY.  SOME 
WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT GENERALLY LOOKS TO STAY PRIMARILY TO OUR S AND 
SW...SO DID NOT SEE THE NEED FOR ANY RAIN CHANCES OR EVEN DRIZZLE ON 
OUR SIDE OF THE MTNS.  WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT MAY EVENTUALLY BRUSH SE 
TN AREAS...BUT OVERALL FELT IT WAS WISE TO JUST SHOW A GRADUAL 
INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER FOR NOW.  IF CLOUDS INCREASE BY SAT NIGHT
THEN I DID NOT SEE JUSTIFICATION TO INCLUDE ANY FOG IN THE FORECAST 
AT THIS POINT.  AS A SHORTWAVE LIFTS NE INTO THE MID/UPR MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY REGIONS ON SUNDAY...WOULD EXPECT MID TO HIGH CLOUDS TO ALSO 
SLOWLY APPROACH FROM THE WEST LATE SUN AFTERNOON.  THIS MADE ME 
FAVOR UNDERCUTTING GFS MOS MAX TEMPS A BIT ON SUN.  OTHERWISE...FOR 
SAT AND SAT NIGHT TRENDED TOWARD A MOS BLEND FOR TEMPS.  


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...RIDGING SFC AND ALOFT 
KEEPS THE FA CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY AND DRY DURING THE FIRST HALF OF 
THE PERIOD ALTHOUGH LOW LVL ELY FLO CONTINUES TO ADVECT ALANTIC 
MOISTURE ACROSS THE CAROLINAS WITH INCREASING DEPTH INTO WED WHICH 
SETS THE STAGE FOR THE NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN. USED SLGT CHC/CHC POPS 
FOR WED INCREASING TO LOW CHC POPS FOR THE MAIN EVENT WED NITE AS 
COLD FRONT APPROACHES. FROPA OCCURS AROUND 12-18Z THU SO TAPERED 
BACK POPS DURING THE DAY AND USED A DRY FCST FOR FRI. STAYED CLOSE 
TO GFS MOS CONCERNING TEMPS.

THE FORECAST AREA...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS AREA-WIDE FOR 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.  GFS SHOWS A WAVE DEVELOPING ALONG THE FRONT
ACROSS THE EXTREME SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES FOR THURSDAY KEEPING THE CLOUDS

COUNTIES.

.DISCUSSION...COLD FRONT HAS CROSSED MOUNTAINS AND WAS MOVING ONTO

WITH DRIER AIR AND SOME WINDS. TEMPERATURES WILL DIP INTO THE 40S MOST

THROUGH THE EXTENDED FORECAST.

MODELS SUGGEST SOME RETURN OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE LATE FRIDAY THROUGH
THE WEEKEND. MOISTURE LOOKS RATHER SHALLOW...BUT MAY BE ENOUGH FOR
ISOLATED SHOWERS ESPECIALLY LATE SATURDAY AND SUNDAY AS A DISTURBANCE
MOVES FORM EAST TO WEST ACROSS THE REGION. APPEARS HIGHER RAIN CHANCES
WILL STAY TO OUR SOUTH AND WEST AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE FROM NEW
ENGLAND NOSES INTO OUR AREA.

NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN WILL ARRIVE LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AS ANOTHER
DISTURBANCE FROM THE EAST DRAWS ATLANTIC MOISTURE TOWARD THE AREA. RAIN
CHANCES WILL PEAK EARLY THURSDAY WITH THE PASSAGE OF A COLD FRONT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
237 PM EDT WED SEP 28 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...A DISSIPATING BOUNDARY AND UPSLOPE
FLOW IS PRODUCING MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES AND WIDELY SCATTERED SHOWERS ACROSS
THE PLATEAU...SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE...AND SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA.  
MODEL SOUNDING SHOW PWS INCREASING OVERNIGHT WITH AMPLE MOISTURE AVAILABLE
FOR FROPA...AROUND 09-13Z TIME-FRAME. BEST DYNAMICS WITH UPPER TROUGH
SWING ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY AND GREAT LAKES WILL BE NORTH OF THE 
REGION...HOWEVER...GOOD Q-VECTOR FORCING ALONG FRONT AS WELL AS MARGINAL
INSTABILITY. GIVEN STRENGTH OF FRONT...EXPECT NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND 
SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WITH FROPA.

HAVE INCREASED THE WINDS TO NEAR LAKE WIND ADVISORY LEVELS. BOTH THE
850 AND 925 MB WINDS INCREASED TO THE 20 TO 30 MPH LEVELS JUST BEFORE
AND AFTER FROPA.

NAM SHOWS A GOOD DEAL OF WRAP-ARND COLD AIR ADVECTION STRATU-CU FOR
MOST OF THURSDAY WITH CLOUDS SCATTERING OUT ACROSS THE SOUTHWEST
HALF OF THE FORECAST DURING THE AFTERNOON. NORTHWEST FLOW AND LEFT
OVER MOISTURE WILL HELP KEEP A CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR FAR EASTERN 
TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND MOUNTAINS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA THROUGH
THE EARLY AFTERNOON. ELSEWHERE...RAIN WILL BE OVER BY MID TO LATE
MORNING.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...AFTER STRONG COLD 
FRONT PASSES THE ATMOSPHERE DRYS OUT CONSIDERABLY OVER THE WEEKEND.  
MODELS DO TRY TO DEVELOP WEAK E TO SE LOW LEVEL FLOW OVER THE 
WEEKEND...BUT I DID NOT SEE ENOUGH MOISTURE RETURN OR INSTABILITY TO 
JUSTIFY KEEPING LOW POPS IN FOR SAT NIGHT AND SUNDAY.  ALSO... 
CONSENSUS FROM NEIGHBORING OFFICES WAS TO GO DRY FOR THOSE PERIODS.
NOT GOOD AGREEMENT FROM MOS AS TO HOW MUCH MIN TEMPS FALL THU NIGHT 
OR RISE FRI...AND I GENERALLY FAVORED A BLEND OF THE NAM/GFS MOS.

WEATHER LOOKS TO STAY MAINLY DRY FOR EARLY TO MID NEXT WEEK AS 
RIDGING HOLDS ACROSS MOST OF EASTERN U.S.  SOME DEGREE OF UPPER 
LEVEL TROUGHING DOES DEVELOP ACROSS THE PLAINS STATES...AND GFS 
INDICATES POSSIBLE MOISTURE RETURN ON SE LOW LEVEL FLOW BY LATE 
WEDNESDAY.  ANOTHER FROPA POSSIBLE AS EARLY AS THURSDAY MORNING... 
THUS I HAVE INTRODUCED LOW POPS FOR SE TN AND THE ERN MTN ZONES FOR 
WEDS AFTERNOON AND EVENING.  CAN ADJUST THIS EITHER WAY OVER THE 
NEXT FEW DAYS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EDT TUE SEP 27 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR ABOUT
DONE ADVECTING INTO AREA AS SURFACE HIGH SLIDES PAST US TO THE
NORTH. TIMING OF RETURN FLOW GOOD FOR FOG FORMATION TONIGHT IN
NORTHEASTERN SECTIONS AS MOIST ADVECTION STARTS UP ACROSS
RADIATIONALLY COOLED GROUND. TO THE SOUTHWEST SAME SITUATION
OCCURRING EXCEPT THAT FLOW AT TOP OF BOUNDARY LAYER MAY BE ALREADY A
LITTLE FAST TO ALLOW AS MUCH RADIATION COOLING. MAY BE QUITE THICK
IN LOCAL VALLEYS AND MINIMAL IN EXPOSED/ELEVATED AREAS.

HAVE GONE A LITTLE COOLER THAN PREVIOUS FORECAST IN NORTHEAST
TONIGHT DUE TO EXCELLENT RADIATIONAL SETUP. ALSO THINKING THAT
UPSLOPE FLOW IN OUR SW NC COUNTIES WILL FAVOR FOG DEVELOPMENT AS
WELL.

FOR WEDNESDAY...MOISTURE RETURNING BUT LOOKS LIKE DEEP CONVECTION
IS CAPPED FOR MOST OF AREA. AM INSERTING SOME SLGT POPS IN HIGHER
TERRAIN IN SRN APPS...OTHERWISE KEEPING DAYTIME DRY. ONLY MINOR
TWEAKING TO HIGH TEMPS. WITH EXPECTED FOG...HAVE SLOWER THAN NORMAL
DIURNAL WARMING IN HOURLY TEMP GRIDS. WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON OFFERS
THE HIGHEST COMBINATION OF LOWER RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND BREEZIER
WINDS IN A WHILE. 

.LONG TERM (WED NIGHT THROUGH TUE)...MOISTURE CONTINUES TO INCREASE
IN ADVANCE OF AN APPROACHING SHORT WAVE/SURFACE COLD FRONT. FRONT
STILL PROJECTED TO PASS THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA EARLY THURSDAY.
NOT EXPECTING A MAJOR EVENT WITH THIS SYSTEM AS MOISTURE PROFILE
REMAINS RATHER UNIMPRESSIVE. NEVERTHELESS...SCATTERED CONVECTION
EXPECTED TO ACCOMPANY PASSAGE OF FRONT. COOLER...DRIER AIR MASS
ADVECTS INTO THE FORECAST AREA BEHIND FRONT. SOME CLEARING POSSIBLE
BY LATE THURSDAY WITH DRY AIR INTRUSION.

FURTHER OUT...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES BECOME INCREASINGLY DIVERGENT IN 
THEIR SOLUTIONS...THUS CONFIDENCE IS NOT ESPECIALLY HIGH. 
HOWEVER...GENERAL CONSENSUS DEPICTS UPPER RIDGE BUILDING BACK OVER 
VIRTUALLY THE ENTIRE SOUTHERN TIER OF THE CONUS AS WELL AS 
AMPLIFYING INTO THE UPPER PLAINS. THIS SUGGESTS ANOTHER ROUND OF 
TEMPS WARMING TO WELL ABOVE CLIMO BY LATE IN THE UPCOMING WEEKEND 
AND EARLY NEXT WEEK. INTRODUCED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR PARTS OF 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY AS SOME MODELS AND ENSEMBLE MEANS DEPICT LIGHT 
PRECIP OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH MOIST RETURN FLOW.

THROUGH AREA THIS EVENING WITH CONTINUED DRYING IN THE LOW LEVELS. A 
CHC OF SPRINKLES CONTINUES ACROSS N PART AND NORTHERN MNTS EARLY 
TNGT. EXPECT MIXING FLOW TO CONTINUE OVRNGT HOLDING FOG DEVELOPMENT 
OFF SOMEWHAT. LATER PACKAGE MAY HAVE TO INCREASE FOG THREAT IF CLOUD 
COVER AND WINDS DROP OFF VERY FAST LATE TNGT.

.LONG TERM...THE COLD FRONT WILL MOVE OFF TO OUR EAST ALLOWING HIGH 
PRESSURE TO BUILD IN ONCE MORE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  ANOTHER...STRONGER COLD FRONT 
WILL PUSH INTO THE MRX AREA LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.

LIKE AIR MASS IS EXPECTED TO FILTER IN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EDT SUN SEP 25 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...MAIN FORECAST ISSUE FOR THE 
SHORT TERM REMAINS TIMING AND DEGREE OF IMPACT OF REMNANT MOISTURE 
FROM RITA FOR OUR FORECAST AREA. MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT WITH 
TIMING MAIN BAND OF MOISTURE...WHICH GETS CAUGHT UP BY AN UPPER 
SHORT WAVE TROUGH AND SURFACE COLD FRONT...INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY 
LATE FIRST PERIOD/EARLY SECOND PERIOD. DISAGREEMENT OCCURS MAINLY ON 
PRECIP AMOUNTS...WITH GFS PROJECTING SIGNIFICANTLY MORE QPF THAN 
NAM. SHORT-RANGE ENSEMBLES GENERALLY SUPPORT NAMS LOWER QPF...BUT 
INCLINATION IS TO COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE TWO OPERATIONAL MODELS 
SINCE DOWNSLOPE EFFECT BECOMES LESS OF A FACTOR AS FLOW BECOMES MORE 
SOUTHWESTERLY IN NATURE. TEMPS WILL CONTINUE TO COOL AS HEIGHTS FALL 
IN RESPONSE TO APPROACHING UPPER TROUGH.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUN)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
THAT BULK OF MOISTURE WILL BE TO OUR EAST BY MONDAY NIGHT AS SHORT 
WAVE MOVES ACROSS EARLY AND THEN EXITS...AND WEAK COLD FRONT PUSHES 
OFF TO OUR EAST.  WILL STILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS 
FOR EARLY MONDAY NIGHT. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE FORECAST TO BUILD IN FOR 
TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY. THEN A MORE SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONT
FORECAST TO PUSH THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT OR EARLY THURSDAY.
MOISTURE LOOKS LIMITED WITH THIS SYSTEM...BUT STILL WILL CARRY
BRIEF PERIOD OF LOW CHANCE POPS EARLY THU...WITH SLIGHT CHANCE WED
NIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE...AND MUCH COOLER AIR FORECAST TO PUSH INTO
THE AREA BEHIND THE FRONT. SHOULD BE DRY AND MORE FALL LIKE FOR
FRIDAY INTO SUNDAY.
