OF APPALACHIANS WILL SLOWLY ERODE THROUGH PERIOD. TD RITA PROGGED TO 
FILL RAPIDLY AS IT MOVES NE THROUGH AR INTO W TN LATE TNGT. MRX CWA 
WILL BE IN TRANSITION AREA BETWEEN SYSTEMS. STRONG SE-S LOW TO MID 
LEVEL FLOW WILL RESULT IN SOME ASCENDING MOTION OVER RIDGE SQUEEZING 
OUT MOISTURE INTO VERY DRY RESIDENT AIRMASS. THROW IN GOOD 
DOWNSLOPING FLOW AND PCPN CHANCES REMAIN ON THE LOW SIDE WITH 
EVAPORATING VIRGA EXPECTED MOST AREAS. LITTLE CHANGE IN LLVL 
THICKNESS VALUES EXPECTED BUT INCREASINGLY DENSE CLOUD CANOPY SHOULD 
HOLD TEMPS AT OR BELOW MOS #S TODAY AND AT OR ABOVE MOS #S TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...CONFIDENCE STILL RATHER LOW 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD.  OF CONCERN REMAINS THE TIMING AND 
STRENGTH OF A WEAKENING COLD FRONT PROGGED INTO THE AREA ON MONDAY.  
ADDITIONALLY...UNCERTAINTY REMAINS WITH THE INTERACTION OF THE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY WITH THE REMAINS OF RITA.  BELIEVE MAIN DYNAMICS 
FROM THE FRONT WILL STAY TO OUR NORTH...BUT WITH THE ADDED MOISTURE 
IN PLACE FROM RITA AND LIFT FROM THE FRONT...SHOULD SEE SCATTERED 
PRECIP DEVELOP AND MOVE THROUGH THE MRX CWA.  THE FRONT SHOULD PUSH 
OUT OF TH AREA MONDAY NIGHT WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN FOR 
TUESDAY.  ANOTHER COLD FRONT SHOULD MOVE THROUGH THE REGION 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY WITH A RETURN TO DRY CONDITIONS 
EXPECTED BEHIND THE FRONT FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
229 PM EDT SAT SEP 24 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...MAIN FORECAST ISSUE IS 
WHEN/IF MOISTURE FROM RITA WILL PROGRESS EASTWARD FAR ENOUGH FOR 
PRECIP TO ENTIRE OUR FORECAST AREA IN THE SHORT TERM. DOMINANT UPPER 
RIDGE IS PROJECTED TO FINALLY MOVE EAST RESULTING IN FALLING HEIGHTS 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. 
MOISTURE FROM RITA IS PROJECTED TO GET PICKED UP BY ADVANCING TROUGH 
OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND SHUNTED EASTWARD. NAM AND GFS ARE 
SIMILAR WITH THIS PROCESS. ANTICIPATE PRECIP TO BEGIN TO INVADE OUR 
SOUTHWESTERN COUNTIES BY LATE IN THE SECOND PERIOD...WITH DECREASING 
POPS TOWARD THE NORTHEAST. ALSO ANTICIPATE THAT STRENGTHENING 
SOUTHEASTERLY (DOWNSLOPE) FLOW WILL TEND TO INHIBIT PRECIP IN THE 
CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEYS. TEMPS SHOULD BEGIN A COOLING TREND IN 
THE SECOND PERIOD WITH THE AFOREMENTIONED HEIGHT FALLS AND 
INCREASING CLOUDINESS. GENERALLY FAVORED GFS GUIDANCE VALUES HERE.

.LONG TERM...(SUN NIGHT THROUGH SAT)...LOOKING AT MODEL DATA...STILL
NOT REAL CLEAR ON THE DETAILS OF WHAT HAPPENS WITH THE REMNANTS OF
RITA. LACK OF CONSISTENCY LENDS UNCERTAINTY...WILL GENERALLY GO
WITH A MODIFIED GFS SOLUTION...WHICH ALLOWS SOME MOISTURE TO SWING
ACROSS THE AREA MAINLY LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF
A WEAK COLD FRONT. WILL RAISE POPS TO HIGH CHANCE FOR MON AND MON
NIGHT. FOR LATER PERIODS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED HPC IDEA...BUT
BLENDED IN A BIT OF THE DRIER GFS SOLUTION FOR TUESDAY INTO WED. A
STRONGER COLD FRONT FORECAST TO SWING THROUGH WED NIGHT. WITH DRIER
AIR MOVING IN AND HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN BEHIND THE FRONT...WILL
GO DRY THU THROUGH SAT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

355 AM EDT SAT SEP 24 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE IS CENTERED OVER THE 
MRX CWA THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON.  HOWEVER...MOISTURE WILL INCREASE 
THROUGHOUT THE DAY AS CIRCULATION AROUND RITA CARRIES MOISTURE 
INTO THE AREA.  AS A RESULT...WILL SEE HIGH AND MID LEVEL CLOUDS 
ROTATE THROUGH.  WHILE THERE DOES REMAIN A SLIGHT POSSIBILITY OF 
SOME PRECIP ROTATING IN AS WELL...BELIEVE LOWER AND MID LEVELS ARE 
DRY ENOUGH...SIGNIFICANTLY LIMITING PRECIP CHANCES.  THEREFORE... 
WILL CONTINUE WITH PERSISTENCE OF DRY AND WARM TODAY.  HOWEVER... 
WITH CONTINUED MOISTURE MOVING INTO THE REGION...SOME BANDS OF 
PRECIP MAY REACH INTO THE MRX CWA OVERNIGHT...SO WILL CONTINUE 
THE LOW POPS HERE. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODEL AND RUN TO RUN 
CONSISTENCY REMAINS POOR DURING THE EXTENDED TIME FRAME.  WITH 
UNCERTAINTY OF THE EXTENT OF MOISTURE AND ENERGY INFLUX FROM RITA 
WILL CONTINUE WITH LOW POPS SUNDAY.  AN APPROACHING FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
ON MONDAY WILL ADD NEEDED LIFT FOR SLIGHTLY BETTER CHANCE POPS.  DUE 
TO DIFFICULTIES MODELS ARE HAVING WITH THE CURRENT PATTERN...WILL 
CONTINUE AT LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS INTO TUESDAY.  MODELS CONTINUE 
TO HAVE DIFFICULTIES WITH STRENGTH OF THE NEXT COLD FRONT WHICH IS 
PROGGED THROUGH THE AREA THURSDAY.  WILL THEREFORE...KEEP WEATHER 
UNSETTLED WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY WITH DRYING ON FRIDAY.  A COOLER 
AIR MASS SHOULD SLOWLY PUSH INTO THE REGION THROUGH THE PERIOD... 
ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO SLOWLY FALL BE NEAR NORMAL LEVELS.  THIS 
REFLECTED WELL IN CURRENT GUIDANCE NUMBERS AND WILL KEEP TEMPS CLOSE 
TO THESE.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES 
GENERALLY AGREE THAT BENIGN WEATHER WITH WELL-ABOVE CLIMO TEMPS 
WILL CONTINUE THROUGH THE SHORT TERM AS UPPER RIDGE PERSISTS OVER 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. PERIPHERAL EFFECTS FROM RITA EXPECTED TO 
INCREASE WITH INCREASING HIGH CLOUDINESS BEING THE MAIN NOTICEABLE 
OUTCOME. LATEST GFS RUN IS PROJECTING CONVECTIVE BANDS FROM THE 
HURRICANE TO APPROACH OUR SOUTHWESTERN ZONES BY LATE IN THE SECOND 
PERIOD. HOWEVER...THIS IS NOT PORTRAYED BY OTHER MODELS/ENSEMBLES. 
WILL LEAVE POPS OUT FOR NOW BUT CANNOT COMPLETELY RULE OUT THE 
POSSIBILITY THAT PRECIP MAY INVADE LATE IN THE SHORT TERM. TEMPS 
ALSO WILL BE INFLUENCED BY PROXIMITY OF PRECIP AND DEGREE OF OPAQUE 
CLOUDINESS...AND GUIDANCE TEMPS REFLECT THIS UNCERTAINTY. GENERALLY 
FAVORED A BLEND OF GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(SAT NIGHT THROUGH FRI)...STILL A PROBLEMATIC FORECAST 
FOR THE LONGER TERM...AS MODELS CONTINUE TO EXHIBIT POOR AGREEMENT 
AND RUN TO RUN CONTINUITY IN HANDLING OF TROPICAL MOISTURE 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE REMNANTS OF RITA AFTER IT MAKES LANDFALL.   
OFFICIAL TRACK STILL BASICALLY STALLS RITA NEAR NE TX/NW LA AREA.  
WHILE UNCERTAINTY ON THE DETAILS IS STILL HIGH...MODELS GENERALLY 
SHOW SOME MOISTURE MOVING NE INTO OUR AREA...BUT WITH SE DOWNSLOPE 
FLOW AND BETTER FORCING STAYING TO OUR SOUTH AND WEST...LOOKS LIKE 
PRECIP COULD BE LIMITED.  WILL GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE SW ZONES SAT 
NIGHT...THEN SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE SUN AND SUN NIGHT.  WEAK 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY MAY ENHANCE CHANCES FOR PRECIP IN THE MONDAY INTO 
TUES TIME FRAME.  A STRONGER COLD FRONT FORECAST TO MOVE THROUGH WED 
NIGHT OR THU.  WILL GO DRY THU NIGHT AND FRI BEHIND THE FRONT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...SURFACE ANALYSIS CURRENTLY 
DEPICTS A COLD FRONT STRETCHING FROM UPPER MIDWEST TO THE CENTRAL 
PLAINS. MODELS AND ENSEMBLES GENERALLY AGREE THAT THIS FEATURE WILL 
SLOWLY SINK INTO THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY BY LATE IN THE SECOND PERIOD. 
MAIN FORECAST ISSUE BECOMES WHETHER OR NOT THIS FRONT COMES CLOSE 
ENOUGH TO OUR NORTHERN TIER TO GENERATE ANY PRECIP BY LATE IN THE 
SHORT TERM. AT THIS TIME...AM INCLINED TO LEAVE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA 
DRY BASED ON THE DRY WEATHER REGIME THAT HAS BEEN EXPERIENCED ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS RECENTLY. FAR ABOVE CLIMO TEMPS ARE 
EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TOMORROW...WITH THE POSSIBLE EXCEPTION OF THE 
NORTHERN TIER WHERE MORE CLOUD COVER MAY PREVENT TEMPS FROM CLIMBING 
QUITE AS MUCH.

.LONG TERM...(FRI NIGHT THROUGH THU)...CONFIDENCE STILL LOWER THAN 
AVERAGE FOR THE LONG TERM.  TRACK OF RITA STILL A SIGNIFICANT 
FACTOR...WITH THE RECENT TREND FURTHER EAST THERE IS SOME CONCERN THAT 
SOME OUTER BANDS OF PRECIP COULD AFFECT OUR AREA BY SATURDAY.  
HOWEVER...FOLLOWING CURRENT OFFICIAL TRACK...WILL KEEP FRI NIGHT 
THROUGH SAT NIGHT DRY AS UPPER RIDGE OVER THE AREA SHIFTS EAST.  
REMAINS OF RITA NOT FORECAST TO BE MUCH OF A FACTOR FOR OUR 
AREA...AS IT STALLS OUT IN THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AREA...AND PERHAPS 
EVEN MOVES SOUTHWEST.  MODELS DO INDICATE MOISTURE MAY BEGIN TO 
INCREASE SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...SO WILL INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS...THEN CHANCE MON AS WEAK COLD FRONT SAGS SOUTH ACROSS THE 
AREA.  HIGH PRESSURE FORECAST TO BUILD IN FROM THE NORTH BEHIND THE 
FRONT...SO DRY TUES AND TUES NIGHT.  MOISTURE FORECAST TO INCREASE 
AHEAD OF ANOTHER FRONT DURING WED OR THU TIME FRAME...SO WILL 
INCLUDE PRECIP AGAIN IN FORECAST BUT WITH FAIRLY LOW POPS.

ONCE AGAIN BE QUITE UNSTABLE FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND THURSDAY AFTERNOON...

A RELATIVELY DRY ATMOSPHERE (PWS 1-1.25 INCH). WILL CONTINUE WITH
DRY FORECAST THROUGH SUNDAY. 

AS HURRICANE RITA PUSHES INLAND ACROSS SOUTHEAST TEXAS AND FRONT
APPROACHES THE AREA FROM THE NORTHWEST. INCREASING HIGH AND MID-
LEVEL CLOUDS WILL INVADE THE TENNESSEE VALLEY SUNDAY AND SUNDAY
NIGHT. A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION FOR MONDAY THROUGH
TUESDAY PROVIDING THE FORECAST AREA WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND
THUNDERSTORMS. BIG QUESTION FOR THE MEDIUM RANGE FORECAST INTO MID-WEEK
NEXT WEEK IS IF/HOW MUCH MOISTURE FOR RITA WILL MOVE INTO THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY.

FROPA FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO COME CLOSER TO 
MORE NORMAL READINGS FOR LATE SEPTEMBER. HOWEVER...RAINFALL AMOUNTS WITH
FRONT DOES NOT SEEM GENEROUS ENOUGH TO HELP MUCH WITH CURRENT DROUGHT/
FIRE DANGER CONDITONS OVER THE REGION.

SECTIONS.

.LONG TERM...(SUN THROUGH WED)...LOWER THAN AVERAGE CONFIDENCE FOR 
THE LONGER TERM...AS MODELS OFFER DIFFERING SOLUTIONS.  HAVE 
GENERALLY FOLLOWED HPC GUIDANCE...WHICH VARIES FROM THE WETTER GFS 
IDEA.  HPC SOLUTION HAS REMAINS OF RITA STALLING IN THE SOUTHERN 
PLAINS...AND A WEAK COLD FRONT PUSHING SOUTH ACROSS OUR REGION 
MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT.  WILL KEEP SUNDAY DRY FOR NOW...THEN SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS SUN NIGHT...CHANCE POPS MONDAY AND SLIGHT CHANCE 
NORTH/CHANCE SOUTH FOR MONDAY NIGHT WITH THE FRONT.  GIVEN 
UNCERTAINTY...WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE FOR TUESDAY...ALTHOUGH IF FRONT 
IS AS FAR SOUTH AS HPC HAS IT THEN IT MAY BE DRY.  DRY TUE NIGHT AND 
WED.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM GFS MOS TEMPS.

.DISCUSSION...
RIDGING SURFACE AND ALOFT WILL BE MAIN PLAYER IN THE FORECAST TODAY THROUGH
SATURDAY. MODEL SOUNDING DO SHOW A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIRMASS
TODAY AND FRIDAY WITH CAPES OF 2000-2500 J/KG...BUT ATMOSPHERE WILL
BE RELATIVELY DRY WITH PWS BETWEEN 1 AND 1.25 INCH. MOST IMPORTANTLY...
MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW A FAIRLY DECENT 700 MB INVERSION WHICH WILL
TEND TO CAP ANY THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT THE NEXT TWO DAYS.

THERE ARE SOME DISAGREEMENTS IN RESPECT TO FRONT PULLING SOUTH FROM
THE OHIO VALLEY TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY
TIME-FRAME. NAM IS MUCH MORE AGRESSIVE IN BRINGING A WEAK FRONT
INTO THE REGION ALONG WITH SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. GFS
KEEPS THE CONVECTION TO OUR NORTH WITH WASHING OUT A FRONT JUST TO OUR
NORTH AND EAST. GIVEN THE PRESENT TREND OF MAINLY DRY WEATHER FOR
NEARLY A MONTH...WILL TEND TOWARD THE DRY SOLUTION AND KEEP POPS
OUT OF THE FORECAST.

NEXT BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE
MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT AS LATEST MEDIUM RANGE MODELS ARE SHOWING MOISTURE
FROM HURRICANE RITA (OVER TEXAS) PULLING EAST ALONG A COLD FRONT.
THIS FRONT IS SHOWN TO MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY AND
MONDAY NIGHT. HAVE INCREASED CLOUDS AND RAIN CHANCES FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY.

HAVE A GOOD DAY...

COMPONENT...THINK THIS IS A REFLECTION OF UPPER RIDGE MIXING DOWN 
NWLY WINDS RATHER THAN A FRONT.  WITH THIS SCENARIO...SHOULDNT BE 
MUCH IN THE WAY OF CONVERGENCE TONIGHT OR WEDNESDAY EITHER.  
DIFFERENT STORY EAST OF APPS WHERE FRONT BACKDOORS WELL INTO VA.  

HAVE COOLED OFF LOW TEMPS ABOUT 2-3 DEGREES FROM PREVIOUS RUN MAINLY 
DUE TO LOWER SURFACE DEWPOINTS.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE STILL 
IN CONTROL OF AREA WEATHER THROUGH THE END OF THE WEEK.  AS SUCH... 
WILL CONTINUE TO SEE DRY CONDITIONS AND SEASONABLE WARM TEMPERATURES 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND.  POOR MODEL TO MODEL...AND RUN TO RUN 
CONSISTENCY FOR THE MONDAY/TUESDAY TIME FRAME.  MAIN CONCERN IS 
POSITION AND STRENGTH OF A FRONTAL BOUNDARY DROPPING IN FROM THE 
NORTH AND THE POTENTIAL OF THE REMNANTS OF A LOW COMING IN FROM THE 
SOUTHWEST.  FOR NOW...WILL CONTINUE WITH A 20 TO 30 POP FOR THIS 
TIME FRAME.

BECOMES THE MAJOR PLAYER FOR REST OF THE WEEK THROUGH THE WEEKEND.
MOSTLY DRY CONDITIONS AND CONTINUED UNSEASONABLY WARM WEATHER WILL
PREVAIL. EVEN THOUGH FALL OFFICIALLY STARTS THIS WEEK...
TEMPERATURES WILL BE FAR FROM AUTUMN LIKE. 

PERSISTENT DRY AND UNSEASONABLY WARM CONDITIONS COMBINED WITH
FALLING LEAVES WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE THE CONCERN FOR FIRES
THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK AND BEYOND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
314 PM EDT MON SEP 19 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE LIES 
DIRECTLY OVER THE TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS 
AFTERNOON. ALOFT UPPER RIDGE HOLDING FIRM WITH VERY DRY AIRMASS. NO 
CUMULUS HAS FORMED SO FAR AND TEMPERATURES AT 2PM ARE IN THE MID 
80S. A LOW PRESSURE AREA IS LOCATED OVER WISCONSIN WITH AN 
ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT EXTENDING TO THE SOUTHWEST THROUGH KANSAS 
CITY. THIS FRONT IS EXPECTED TO MOVE SOUTHEAST TONIGHT AND TUESDAY. 
GFS AND NAM MODELS BRING FRONT INTO TN TUESDAY. THE BEST DYNAMICS 
STAY NORTH IN THE MID ATLANTIC AREA. WITH STRONG RIDGING FROM THE TN 
VALLEY SOUTH THE FRONT SHOULD WEAKEN AND POSSIBLY SLOW DOWN ITS 
SOUTHEAST PROGRESS. NAM IS MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH POPS AND GFS A 
LITTLE SLOWER WITH BRINGING PRECIPITATION INTO THE AREA. SOUTHERN 
AREAS MAY NOT GET ANY MEASURABLE PRECIPITATION IF FRONT SLIDES EAST 
THROUGH THE TN VALLEY INTO NC LATE TUESDAY INTO TUESDAY NIGHT. KEPT 
POPS OUT OF THE SOUTHERN PART OF FORECAST AREA TONIGHT AND WILL BUT 
LATE WORDING IN NORTH. PUT HIGHEST POPS ACROSS SW VA AND THE 
NORTHERN EDGE OF EAST TN TUESDAY. THE AIRMASS IS MODERATELY UNSTABLE 
WITH LIS OF -5 TO -7 AND CAPES FROM 1000 TO 2000 J/KG SO STRONG 
THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE. HIGH TEMPERATURES SHOULD REMAIN WARM IN 
THE MID 80S TO NEAR 90.       

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...THE COLD FRONT WILL BE 
EXITING THE AREA TUESDAY NIGHT.  SOME RESIDUAL SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL LINGER OVER THE MRX CWA DURING THE EVENING... 
SLOWLY ENDING OVERNIGHT.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS BACK IN FOR WEDNESDAY 
AND THURSDAY WITH DRY AND STABLE AIR FILTERING INTO THE  AREA.  THE 
MODEL BRUSHES A WEAK WAVE THROUGH TO OUR SOUTH AND EAST ON FRIDAY.  
CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON THE TRACK AND STRENGTH OF THE WAVE BUT WILL 
KEEP LOW POPS IN AFFECTED AREAS FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON.  HIGH PRESSURE 
DOMINATES FOR THE WEEKEND FOR A RETURN TO DRY CONDITIONS.  MODELS IN 
POOR AGREEMENT BY THE END OF THE EXTENDED...MAIN DISCREPANCY LIES 
WITH THE TIMING...TRACK AND STRENGTH OF THE REMNANTS OF RITA.  WITH 
THE HIGH DEGREE OF UNCERTAINTY...FOR NOW WILL INTRODUCE A LOW POP 
ACROSS THE AREA FOR MONDAY.  AS FAR AS TEMPERATURES FOR THE 
EXTENDED...GUIDANCE LOOKS REASONABLE AND WILL STAY CLOSE TO THESE 
NUMBERS.

FOR ONE MORE DAY...AND SLIDE THE FRONT IN OVERNIGHT. WILL THEREFORE 
KEEP THINGS DRY AND WARM THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL 
APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA MONDAY NIGHT AND MOVE ACROSS THE AREA ON 
TUESDAY...BRINGING A CHANCE FOR CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY. LATEST MODEL 
RUNS INDICATE A LITTLE MORE MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY AHEAD OF THIS 
FRONT...SO WILL INCREASE POPS A LITTLE FOR TUESDAY...MAINLY ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. HIGH PRESSURE WILL THEN 
BUILD ACROSS ACROSS THE REGION FOR THE REST OF THE WEEK...WITH ABOVE 
NORMAL TEMPS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE. MOISTURE SHOULD AGAIN INCREASE 
ACROSS THE REGION BY THE WEEKEND...AS SOUTHERLY WINDS DEVELOP ALONG 
THE WESTERN SIDE OF A BERMUDA HIGH. AS A RESULT...WILL PLAN TO 
MENTION A SLIGHT CHANCE OF CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY FOR FRIDAY THROUGH 
SUNDAY WITH THE LOCAL AIRMASS BECOMING SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE.

A BRIEF SPRINKLE...SO HAVE ADDED THIS WORDING TO THE FORECAST.  
OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO NOSE INTO THE REGION 
TONIGHT. AS A RESULT...DEW POINTS SHOULD CONTINUE TO LOWER. 
HOWEVER...WITH THE RECENT RAINFALL...LIGHT WINDS AND CLEARING SKIES 
LATE TONIGHT...EXPECT PATCHY FOG TO FORM...ESPECIALLY NEAR RIVERS... 
LAKES AND OTHER LOW LYING AREAS. ON SUNDAY...DRIER AND WARMER AIR 
WILL CONTINUE TO FILTER IN. TEMPS SHOULD WARM A COUPLE DEGREES FROM 
THIS AFTERNOON/S READING AS 850MB TEMPS RISE BACK TO NEAR 18C. THE 
DRY AND STABLE AIR WILL SEVERELY LIMIT PRECIP POTENTIAL...SO WILL 
CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR SUNDAY AFTERNOON. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL 
APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY...BRINGING A CHANCE FOR 
CONVECTION ACROSS MAINLY THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. 
OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE REGION FOR MOST 
OF THE UPCOMING WEEK...WITH ABOVE-NORMAL TEMPS EXPECTED. GFS MODEL 
INDICATES THAT MOISTURE WILL INCREASE ACROSS THE REGION ON FRIDAY 
AND SATURDAY...WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF CONVECTION EXPECTED AREAWIDE 
AS THE LOCAL AIRMASS BECOMES SLIGHTLY UNSTABLE. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             63  88  61  90 /   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  60  86  59  88 /   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       61  86  60  88 /   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              58  84  56  86 /   0   0   0  10

.LONG TERM...DRIER AIR MOVES IN BEHIND FRONT FRIDAY EVENING
SILENCING CONVECTION. RETURN TO HIGH AND DRY WITH RETURN OF RIDGING
OVER EASTERN CONUS. TEMPS WILL MODERATE A LITTLE AS SLIGHTLY COOLER
AIR ADVECTS IN, BUT WILL WARM BACK UP TO ABOVE NORMAL BY EARLY PART
OF WEEK. HAVE INCREASED POPS MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY TO 10%
(FROM ZERO) DUE TO PASSAGE OF VERY WEAK FRONT AND ASSOCIATED
WEAKENING SHORT WAVE. MOST AREAS WILL SEE LITTLE RAIN WITH CURRENT
SYSTEM AND THEN WE GET A WEEK OF MORE DRYING. LOOKS LIKE IT COULD
BE THE BEGINNING OF A DROUGHT AS WE ARE ALREADY IN A D-ZERO
CLASSIFICATION (ABNORMALLY DRY).

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 AM EDT WED SEP 14 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODEST CHANGES IN STORE BY THE 
END OF THE SHORT TERM PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE DATA AS UPPER TROUGH 
APPROACHES THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FROM THE WEST. ATMOSPHERE 
BECOMES INCREASINGLY MOIST AS UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES WITH PW VALUES 
INCREASING FROM LESS THAN AN INCH EARLY IN THE FIRST PERIOD TO 
NEARLY 1.75 INCHES BY LATE IN THE SECOND PERIOD PER MODEL SOUNDINGS. 
HOWEVER...ANY PRECIP EXPECTED TO BE WIDELY SCATTERED AS UPPER RIDGE 
HOLDS ON OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN CONUS. APPEARS BEST CHANCE WILL BE ON 
NORTHERN PLATEAU AND HAVE INTRODUCED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THAT 
AREA IN THE SECOND PERIOD. TEMPS AGAIN WILL AVERAGE WELL ABOVE 
CLIMATOLOGY. A BLEND OF GUIDANCE VALUES AND PERSISTENCE WAS 
GENERALLY USED.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SLIGHT MODEL DIFFERENCES 
NOTED BETWEEN GFS AND NAM WITH THE FRONTAL SYSTEM THAT AFFECTS THE 
REGION INTO FRIDAY EVENING.  NAM HAS A MORE AMPLIFIED SHORTWAVE 
TROUGH AND DEVELOPS MORE ORGANIZED CONVECTION AND HEAVIER RAINS...
WHILE GFS SOLUTION HAS A WEAKER LESS AMPLIFIED SHORTWAVE TROUGH 
(LEADING TO BEST DYNAMICS AND VORTICITY JUST TO OUR NORTH) AND 
A MORE RANDOM AND LIGHTER CONVECTIVE PCPN PATTERN.  TENDING TO FAVOR 
THE GFS SOLUTION AT THIS POINT...AND ALSO FELT THAT ENOUGH RIDGING 
WILL HOLD INTO THURSDAY NIGHT TO KEEP CONVECTIVE PCPN SUPPRESSED A 
BIT.  BEST RAIN CHANCES LOOK TO COME INTO NE PLATEAU AND SWRN VA 
VERY LATE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY DAYTIME...THEN PERHAPS SOME 
LINGERING SCATTERED CONVECTION AT LEAST FOR FRIDAY EVENING.

ONLY MINOR CHANGES MADE TO THE ASSOCIATED GRIDS FOR THE PERIODS 
NOTED ABOVE...AND ALSO ADDED NEW DAY 7 (WEDS) PRELIMINARY GRIDS.
OTHERWISE...JUST MINOR TEMP ADJUSTMENTS IN LINE WITH 14/00Z MOS 
GUIDANCE.  RAINS ON THU AND FRI WILL BE THE FIRST MEASURABLE PCPN 
FOR THE MONTH OF SEPTEMBER...FOLLOWED BY SEVERAL DAYS OF MORE DRY 
WEATHER.  QUITE A DRY SEPTEMBER IN THE MAKING.  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 131856
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EDT TUE SEP 13 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO 
DOMINATE THE WEATHER PATTERN OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS...HOWEVER A 
WEAKENING WILL BEGIN TO OCCUR BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON.  THE BIGGEST 
HINDRANCE TO PRECIPITATION IS THE EXCESSIVE DRYNESS IN THE LOWER 
LAYERS OF THE ATMOSPHERE.  IT WILL TAKE SOME TIME TO MOISTEN UP 
THESE LEVELS...SO HAVE HELD BACK ON ANY MENTION OF RAIN IN THE 24 
HOUR PERIOD.  TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN ON THE WARM SIDE UNTIL BEYOND 
24 HOURS.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS BRINGING 
FRONT INTO REGION WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  LOW LEVELS WILL STILL BE 
DRY...SO THINK THE ONSET OF PRECIP WILL BE DELAYED...WILL LEAVE 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT DRY FOR NOW.  MOISTURE WILL INCREASE BY THURSDAY... 
WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS FOR BOTH THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WITH FROPA... 
BEST CHANCES SHOULD BE THURSDAY NIGHT.  SOME INSTABILITY EXPECTED... 
SO WILL KEEP THUNDER IN THE FORECAST FOR BOTH THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  
DRIER WEATHER RETURNS FRIDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE POPS FOR 
ONLY THE EVENING HOURS.  RIDGE BUILDS IN FOR THE WEEKEND...WILL KEEP 
DRY WEATHER FOR SATURDAY THROUGH MONDAY.  GFS INDICATING A WEAK 
FRONT MOVING THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT...BEST MOISTURE STAYING NORTH... 
SO WILL CONTINUE THE DRY FORECAST FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY... 
BUT A FEW MORE CLOUDS EXPECTED WITH THE FRONT.  MEX GUIDANCE 
TEMPERATURES LOOKED REASONABLE...DIDNT STRAY TOO FAR.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 130722
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
322 AM EDT TUE SEP 13 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES DEPICT 
UPPER RIDGE AXIS REMAINING OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH 
THE SHORT TERM...SIGNIFYING A CONTINUATION OF THE DRY WEATHER 
PATTERN. UPPER TROUGH/SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH FROM THE 
NORTHWEST BY LATE IN THE SECOND PERIOD. NEVERTHELESS...EFFECTS FROM 
THIS FEATURE NOT ANTICIPATED THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. GUIDANCE TEMPS 
GENERALLY AGREE WELL WITH PERSISTENCE AND HAVE BEEN FOLLOWED CLOSELY 
FOR THE MOST PART.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...ONLY MINOR CHANGE MADE 
EARLY IN THE LONG TERM PERIODS WAS TO ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WEDS 
NIGHT FOR NE PLATEAU AND LEE/WISE COUNTIES OF SW VA.  THIS WAS FOR 
THE POSSIBILITY OF PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION...ALTHO HAVE A STRONG 
FEELING THAT GFS AND NAM MAY BOTH BE OVER DOING THE DEVELOPMENT AND 
EXTENT OF CONVECTION IN ADVANCE OF THE WEAK COLD FRONT.  THERE IS 
STILL SOME LINGERING RIDGING ALOFT ACROSS OUR REGION WEDS NIGHT INTO 
EARLY THU...AIDED SOMEWHAT BY OUR AREA BEING ON THE WRN SIDE OF 
OPHELIA.  ANY LINGERING SUBSIDENCE ALOFT PLUS ONLY MARGINAL 
INSTABILITY SHOULD WORK TO SUPPRESS CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT.  

JUST CHECKED THE CLIMATE BOOKS AND APPEARS NO RAIN HAS FALLEN FOR 
THE MONTH OF SEPTEMBER ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...WHICH HAS US 
RUNNING FROM ABOUT 1.20 TO 1.75 INCHES BELOW NORMAL RAINFALL FOR THE 
MONTH.  MORE REASONS TO AT LEAST INITIALLY BE PESSIMISTIC ABOUT 
SIGNIFICANT RAINS WITH THE APPROACHING WEAK COLD FRONT.

OTHERWISE...STILL ACCEPTING A FRONTAL PASSAGE FRIDAY NIGHT AND A 
RETURN OF DRY WEATHER (SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPS?) FOR THE WEEKEND.  
SOME PRELIMINARY GRIDS MADE FOR NEW DAY SEVEN (TUESDAY).  

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             91  66  89  67 /   0  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  89  64  88  66 /   0  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       89  64  88  66 /   0  10  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              87  58  86  61 /   0  10  10  20

254 PM EDT MON SEP 12 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...UPPER RIDGE AXIS BEGINS TO 
SHIFT EAST...BUT PERSISTENCE STILL LOOKS LIKE THE BEST FORECAST FOR 
THE SHORT TERM.  WILL CONTINUE WITH MOSTLY CLEAR TO CLEAR SKY...AND 
WILL GO CLOSE TO MAV TEMPS...WHICH ARE CLOSE TO PERSISTENCE.  WILL 
ADJUST DEWPOINTS DOWN MORE IN THE AFTERNOON THAN MAV...SIMILAR TO 
WHAT HAS BEEN OCCURRING.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...RIDGE IN PLACE FOR 
TUESDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP A DRY FORECAST FOR THAT PERIOD.  GFS 
SHOWING SHORTWAVE ROTATING OVER RIDGE ON WEDNESDAY...PREFER DRIER  
NAM AND WILL KEEP WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT DRY.  FRONT ENTERS 
REGION ON THURSDAY...WILL ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY.  BEST 
CHANCE SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY WITH FROPA.  
SOME INSTABILITY INDICATED...WILL KEEP MENTION OF THUNDER FOR 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  DRIER WEATHER RETURNS FRIDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP 
ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT.  RIDGE BUILDS IN BY THE 
END OF THE PERIOD.  GFS INDICATING A WEAK SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH 
ON MONDAY...BUT BEST MOISTURE SHOULD STAY NORTH.  WILL KEEP SATURDAY 
THROUGH MONDAY DRY FOR NOW.  MEX GUIDANCE TEMPERATURES LOOKED 
REASONABLE...DIDNT STRAY TOO FAR.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 120750
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT MON SEP 12 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEATHER PATTERN LOOKS TO REMAIN 
VIRTUALLY UNCHANGED FROM THE WEEKEND...WITH LARGE RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE DOMINATING AT ALL LEVELS OVER THE TN AND OHIO VALLEY 
REGIONS.  HURRICANE OPHELIA ALSO CONTINUES TO SPIN OFF THE SC/NC 
COASTS WITH A SLOW WESTWARD DRIFT. 

A FEW PATCHES OF MID DECK CLOUD PASSING OVERHEAD...AND VERY LIKELY 
SOME AREAS OF HAZE WHICH HAVE TRANSITIONED TO FOG...ESPECIALLY NEAR 
BODIES OF WATER IN THE VALLEYS.  HAVING PERSONALLY ENCOUNTERED SOME 
OF THIS VALLEY FOG NEAR NORRIS LAKE AFTER SUNRISE SATURDAY MORNING 
...I DECIDED TO INCLUDE SOME PATCHY VALLEY FOG FOR THIS MORNING.   

ANOTHER WARM AND DRY DAY IN STORE...WITH DRY GROUND HELPING TO 
CREATE A LARGE DIURNAL RANGE FROM THIS MORNINGS MIN TEMPS TO 
AFTERNOON HIGHS.  PREVIOUS MAX TEMP GRID AND MOS FOR A FEW SPOTS 
LOOKED A BIT LOW...SO NUDGED VALUES BACK TO AROUND SUNDAYS HIGHS.
MY FORECASTED HIGHS WONT BE NEAR RECORD HIGHS FOR THIS DATE.  
DEW POINT TEMPS HAVE CREPT UPWARDS SLIGHTLY...AND GENERALLY FOUND 
MOS BLEND ACCEPTABLE FOR LOWS TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MOSTLY SUNNY WITH ABOVE 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES TUESDAY AS UPPER RIDGE STILL IN PLACE. HURRICANE 
OPHELIA IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TO SPIN OFF THE SOUTH CAROLINA 
COAST. WEDNESDAY OPHELIA BEGINS TO MOVE TOWARDS THE COAST OF NORTH 
CAROLINA. AT THE SAME TIME THE RIDGE BEGINS TO BE PUSHED SOUTH AND 
EAST AS A COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE MID MS VALLEY AHEAD OF A 
DEEPENING TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN TWO THIRDS OF THE COUNTRY. KEPT 
TEMPERATURES SIMILAR TO MONDAYS THROUGH MID-WEEK. CLOUDS AND 
MOISTURE INCREASE LATE WEDNESDAY AHEAD OF THE FRONT MOVING INTO THE 
LOWER MS AND TN VALLEYS. THE BEST DYNAMICS STAY TO THE WEST 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY AS FRONT HAS A HARD TIME PUSHING SOUTH 
DUE TO RIDGE SETTLING ALONG GULF COAST. A STRONG SHORTWAVE MOVES 
ALONG FRONT AND THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. 
THIS MAY BE THE BEST CHANCE FOR RAIN EAST TN HAS HAD IN TWO WEEKS 
ALTHOUGH DID NOT INCREASE RAIN CHANCES YET AS TIMING IS STILL 
UNCERTAIN. FRONT MOVES SOUTH OF TN FRIDAY NIGHT AS HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN FROM THE NORTH. IT LOOKS LIKE A NICE DROP IN TEMPERATURES 
WITH HIGHS ONLY IN THE 70S TO LOWER 80S.        
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             91  63  90  65 /   0   0  0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  90  62  89  63 /   0   0  0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       90  62  89  63 /   0   0  0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              87  55  86  58 /   0   0  0   0

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1030 AM EDT SUN SEP 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATE PLANNED AS PERSISTENT SFC RIDGE REMAINS IN 
PLACE.

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION...SUNNY AND DRY CONDITIONS TO PREVAIL AGAIN 
TODAY AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE DOMINATES THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. WILL USE PERSISTENCE WITH HIGHS IN 
THE UPPER 80S TO NEAR 90 AGAIN TODAY AND LOWS IN THE MID 50S TO 
LOWER 60S. HURRICANE OPHELIA CONTINUES TO SPIN OFF THE CAROLINAS 
THIS MORNING WITH CLOUDS ONLY AFFECTING NORTH CAROLINA COASTAL 
AREAS. UPPER RIDGE BEGINS TO BREAK DOWN WEDNESDAY AS COLD FRONT 
MOVES INTO MID MS VALLEY. FORECAST AREA STILL LOOKS DRY WITH WEAK 
SURFACE HIGH BETWEEN THE COLD FRONT AND THE HURRICANE. HURRICANE 
OPHELIA MAY MOVE ACROSS NORTH CAROLINA WEDNESDAY AS RIDGE WEAKENS 
BEFORE THE STORM MOVES OUT TO SEA THURSDAY. MOISTURE INCREASES 
SOMEWHAT WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY AS WEAK COLD FRONT APPROACHES 
FROM THE NORTH AND WEST. SLIGHT CHANCE RAIN AS FRONT TRIES TO PUSH 
THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY. LATEST GFS RUN BRINGS 
STRONG SHORTWAVE THAT ENHANCES LIFT OVER FORECAST AREA LATE 
SATURDAY. HAVE NOT CHANGED SATURDAYS RAIN CHANCES YET.

THAN 10 MPH.

FXUS64 KMRX 110805
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT SUN SEP 11 2005

.DISCUSSION...SUNNY AND DRY CONDITIONS TO PREVAIL AGAIN TODAY AS 
UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE DOMINATES THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. WILL USE PERSISTENCE WITH HIGHS IN THE 
UPPER 80S TO NEAR 90 AGAIN TODAY AND LOWS IN THE MID 50S TO LOWER 
60S. HURRICANE OPHELIA CONTINUES TO SPIN OFF THE CAROLINAS THIS 
MORNING WITH CLOUDS ONLY AFFECTING NORTH CAROLINA COASTAL AREAS. 
UPPER RIDGE BEGINS TO BREAK DOWN WEDNESDAY AS COLD FRONT MOVES INTO 
MID MS VALLEY. FORECAST AREA STILL LOOKS DRY WITH WEAK SURFACE HIGH 
BETWEEN THE COLD FRONT AND THE HURRICANE. HURRICANE OPHELIA MAY MOVE 
ACROSS NORTH CAROLINA WEDNESDAY AS RIDGE WEAKENS BEFORE THE STORM 
MOVES OUT TO SEA THURSDAY. MOISTURE INCREASES SOMEWHAT WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY AS WEAK COLD FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE NORTH AND 
WEST. SLIGHT CHANCE RAIN AS FRONT TRIES TO PUSH THROUGH THURSDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY. LATEST GFS RUN BRINGS STRONG SHORTWAVE THAT 
ENHANCES LIFT OVER FORECAST AREA LATE SATURDAY. HAVE NOT CHANGED 
SATURDAYS RAIN CHANCES YET.    
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE

THE CAROLINAS.  THINK BULK OF PRECIPITATION SHOULD STAY EAST...BUT 
WILL ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR OUR EASTERN MOUNTAINS TUESDAY NIGHT 
AND WEDNESDAY.  FRONT ENTERS REGION ON THURSDAY AND STALLS... 
MOISTURE LIMITED...BUT SHOULD BE SUFFICIENT TO ADD SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY.  LIS INDICATING SOME 
INSTABILITY...WILL MENTION THUNDER ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.  MOS 
TEMPERATURES LOOK REASONABLE...DIDNT STRAY TOO FAR.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 101453
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1045 AM EDT SAT SEP 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED. SFC RIDGE AXIS 
FM THE NE INTO TN RVR VLY AND UPR RIDGING BUILDING IN FM THE SW WILL 
MAINTAIN DRY CONDITIONS. CIRCULATION ARND TS OPHELIA BEGINNING TO 
SHOW UP EAST OF MRX CWA. N-NE WNDS ACRS AREA ABOVE GUIDANCE BUT 
REMAIN FAIRLY LIGHT. 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION 

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ALTHOUGH BOTH THE OHX AND RNK 
10/00Z SOUNDINGS SHOWED A SLIGHT INCREASE IN PRECIPITABLE WATER 
VALUES...THE DRY AND WARM WEATHER PATTERN LOOKS TO CONTINUE.  THE 
UPPER RIDGE LOOKS TO BUILD EAST OVER TODAY AND SUNDAY...GRADUALLY 
TAKING US OUT OF THE WEAK NW FLOW ALOFT.  MEANWHILE AT THE 
SURFACE...VERY WEAK NE OR E WINDS CONTINUE AROUND THE SURFACE RIDGE 
OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE NE STATES.  NO EFFECTS AT ALL THESE 
PERIODS FROM HURRICANE OPHELIA.

MINOR CHANGES TO THE GRIDS INCLUDED DECREASING SKY COVER JUST A BIT 
FOR TODAY...AND ALSO ZEROING OUT THE POPS.  PREVIOUS MAX TEMP GRID 
LOOKED GOOD FOR TODAY...ALLOWING ABOUT 1 DEGREE OR SO WARMER THAN 
YESTERDAY...WHICH WAS CLOSEST TO THE MAV/GFS MOS IN MOST CASES.  
MINS TONIGHT CLOSE TO MOS BLEND AND PREVIOUS MIN TEMP GRID.

LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...STRONG UPPER LEVEL RIDGE 
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE AND OHIO VALLEYS WILL CONTINUE SUNDAY AND 
MONDAY. THEN HURRICANE OPHELIA MAY MOVE WEST INTO THE CAROLINAS AND 
SPREAD CLOUDS MOSTLY NORTH BUT SOME WILL LIKELY MOVE INTO SW NORTH 
CAROLINA AND ALONG THE APPALACHIAN CREST. UPPER RIDGE BREAKS DOWN 
BRIEFLY AS THE HURRICANE MOVES INLAND AND THEN MOVES NORTHEAST. 
RIDGE STRENGTHENS AGAIN WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY. HOWEVER 
MOISTURE MOVING INTO THE SOUTH CENTRAL STATES AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT 
APPROACHING THE OHIO VALLEY AT THE END OF THE WEEK SHOULD SPREAD A 
FEW MORE CLOUDS INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. THIS FRONT BECOMES 
STATIONARY TO THE NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA AT THE END OF THE WEEK. 
HIGH TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER BY MID WEEK WITH 
LOWS NOT AS COOL WITH MORE SCATTERED CLOUD COVER. WINDS SHOULD STAY 
LIGHT SUNDAY AND MONDAY. LATER SHIFTS MAY NEED TO ADJUST WINDS 
UPWARD ABOUT TUESDAY DEPENDING ON HOW FAR INLAND OPHELIA 
TRACKS.       
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             90  63  90  64 /   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  89  61  88  63 /   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       89  60  89  63 /   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              87  54  86  56 /   0   0   0   0

FXUS64 KMRX 091505 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1110 AM EDT FRI SEP 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. NO UPDATE PLANNED.

SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEATHER IS SO GREAT (UNLESS ONE 
WANTS RAIN) THAT THE LACK OF MODEL DATA THIS MORNING WAS NO MAJOR 
CONCERN.  VIEWED THE 08/18Z MODEL DATA AND 09/00Z MOS...TO MAKE JUST 
SOME VERY SLIGHT CHANGES TO SKY COVER...TEMPS AND DEWPOINTS. 
 
CONVECTION IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT IS RAPIDLY DISSIPATING ACROSS THE 
OHIO VALLEY...BUT A BIT OF THESE CLOUDS MAY DRIFT ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS MORNING.  OTHERWISE LOOKS TO BE JUST A FEW 
TO SCATTERED CUMULUS CLOUDS LATER TODAY.  TWEAKED MAX TEMPS IN LINE 
WITH PERSISTENCE PLUS A DEGREE OR SO.  MINS TONIGHT STILL LOOKED 
FINE AND IN LINE WITH NEW MOS.  

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THIS WEEKEND KEEPING HURRICANE OPHELIA OFF THE 
SOUTHEAST COAST.  A WEAK BOUNDARY TO THE NORTH SHOULD LIFT NORTH AND 
DISSIPATE WITH STRENGTHENING RIDGE.  TEMPERATURES WILL STAY RATHER 
WARM FOR LATE SUMMER WITH HIGHS IN MID 80S TO NEAR 90 WITH LITTLE 
CLOUD COVER AND LIGHT WINDS.  NIGHTTIME LOWS WILL RISE A FEW DEGREES 
TOO AS HEIGHTS RISE.  THIS PATTERN CONTINUES AT LEAST THROUGH MID 
WEEK. BY THURSDAY RIDGE WEAKENS AND COLD FRONT MOVES INTO OHIO 
VALLEY.  STILL NO RAIN EXPECTED THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST. &&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             90  63  91  64 /   0   0   0  10

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
318 AM EDT FRI SEP 9 2005

.SHORT TERM....SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEATHER IS SO 
GREAT (UNLESS ONE WANTS RAIN) THAT THE LACK OF MODEL DATA THIS 
MORNING WAS NO MAJOR CONCERN.  VIEWED THE 08/18Z MODEL DATA AND 
09/00Z MOS...TO MAKE JUST SOME VERY SLIGHT CHANGES TO SKY 
COVER...TEMPS AND DEWPOINTS. 
 
CONVECTION IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT IS RAPIDLY DISSIPATING ACROSS THE 
OHIO VALLEY...BUT A BIT OF THESE CLOUDS MAY DRIFT ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA EARLY THIS MORNING.  OTHERWISE LOOKS TO BE JUST A FEW 
TO SCATTERED CUMULUS CLOUDS LATER TODAY.  TWEAKED MAX TEMPS IN LINE 
WITH PERSISTENCE PLUS A DEGREE OR SO.  MINS TONIGHT STILL LOOKED 
FINE AND IN LINE WITH NEW MOS.  

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER RIDGE BUILDS OVER 
THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THIS WEEKEND KEEPING HURRICANE OPHELIA OFF THE 
SOUTHEAST COAST. A WEAK BOUNDARY TO THE NORTH SHOULD LIFT NORTH AND 
DISSIPATE WITH STRENGTHENING RIDGE. TEMPERATURES WILL STAY RATHER 
WARM FOR LATE SUMMER WITH HIGHS IN MID 80S TO NEAR 90 WITH LITTLE 
CLOUD COVER AND LIGHT WINDS. NIGHTTIME LOWS WILL RISE A FEW DEGREES 
TOO AS HEIGHTS RISE. THIS PATTERN CONTINUES AT LEAST THROUGH MID 
WEEK. BY THURSDAY RIDGE WEAKENS AND COLD FRONT MOVES INTO OHIO 
VALLEY. STILL NO RAIN EXPECTED THROUGHOUT THE FORECAST.

UPPER RIDGE BUILDING OVER THE AREA FOR SUNDAY INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK.  
LOW CONFIDENCE IN WHAT TROPICAL SYSTEM OFF THE SE COAST WILL 
DO...BUT FOR NOW OFFICIAL FORECAST KEEPS IT WELL SOUTHEAST OF OUR 
AREA.   SO...DESPITE SOME UNCERTAINTY...WILL HAVE MOSTLY CLEAR AND 
DRY FORECAST FOR THE EXTENDED PERIOD.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER NEW ENGLAND DOMINATING 
THE ENTIRE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. THIS AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL CONTINUE TO KEEP A DRY AIRMASS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH 
THURSDAY NIGHT...WITH TRANQUIL CONDITIONS EXPECTED. A WEAK COLD 
FRONT WILL SLOWLY MOVE INTO THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY ON THURSDAY...BUT 
SHOULD BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA BY 
THURSDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...COLD FRONT NEARLY STATIONARY 
ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY AND MID ATLANTIC FRIDAY MAY BRUSH SW VA AND 
NE TN WITH SOME CLOUDS AS DEPICTED BY THE NAM. RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTH CENTRAL STATES BUILDS NE ACROSS THE TN AND 
OHIO VALLEYS OVER THE WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK BECOMING QUITE 
STRONG SUNDAY AND MONDAY. WITH THE ATLANTIC BECOMING ACTIVE WITH 
TROPICAL SYSTEMS SOME MOISTURE WILL LIKELY WORK NORTHWARD BY THE 
WEEKEND BUT WITH STRONG RIDGE NEARLY OVERHEAD ONLY EXPECT SKIES TO 
GO PARTLY CLOUDY. NHC GUIDANCE KEEPS NEW TROPICAL SYSTEM OFF THE SE 
ATLANTIC COAST NEAR FLORIDA THROUGH THE EXTENDED AND THE LONG RANGE 
GFS KEEPS DEEPER MOISTURE AWAY FROM THE TENNESSEE VALLEY UNTIL THE 
LAST DAY OF THE EXTENDED...A LITTLE TOO FAR OUT TO ADD ANY RAIN 
CONSIDERING THE TIME OF YEAR AND PERSISTENT DRY PATTERN. 
TEMPERATURES REMAIN ABOUT THE SAME WITH WARMER LOWS NEAR THE END OF 
THE EXTENDED AS HEIGHTS RISE WITH BUILDING RIDGE AND LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE INCREASES.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 051855
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
255 PM EDT MON SEP 5 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN INVERTED TROUGH EXTENDING GENERALLY ALONG A 
MEMPHIS TO NASHVILLE TO PIKEVILLE LINE...WITH HIGH PRESSURE 
DOMINATING THE ENTIRE EASTERN HALF OF THE NATION. MODELS INDICATE 
THAT SOME ISOLATED CONVECTION MAY DEVELOP THIS EVENING ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN PLATEAU NEAR THIS TROUGH...BUT WILL KEEP THE FORECAST DRY 
SINCE THIS SURFACE TROUGH APPEARS TO BE A LITTLE FARTHER WEST THAN 
THE MODELS HAVE DEPICTED. OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT BRINGING DRY AND TRANQUIL 
CONDITIONS.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...RIDGING OVER THE NORTHEAST US
STARTS BREAKING DOWN BUT UPPER HIGH OVER THE SOUTH CENTRAL STATES 
HOLDS STRONG THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. A WEAK FRONT APPROACHES THE OHIO 
VALLEY BUT WASHES OUT BEFORE IT REACHES THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. 
DEEPENING TROUGH ALONG THE WEST COAST BUILDS RIDGE OVER THE CENTRAL 
STATES AND NORTHEAST THIS WEEKEND. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES 
OVER THE EASTERN TN VALLEY DURING THIS TIME. TO THE SOUTH AND EAST A 
BROAD AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OFF THE FLORIDA COAST AND BAHAMAS AND 
ANOTHER WELL DEFINED LOW PRESSURE AREA SOUTH SOUTHWEST OF BERMUDA 
ARE BEGINNING TO BECOME BETTER ORGANIZED. THE GFS TRIES TO BRING 
SOME MOISTURE FAR ENOUGH NORTH TO GIVE CLOUDS TO MUCH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA SUNDAY AND MONDAY. THE DGEX TRIES TO DEVELOP ONE 
SYSTEM INTO A TROPICAL SYSTEM AND MOVE IT NORTHEAST ALONG THE EAST 
COAST FROM FLORIDA TO THE CAROLINAS FRIDAY AND SATURDAY. DECIDED TO 
KEEP THE EXTENDED DRY ALTHOUGH INCREASED SKY COVER. GENERALLY 
FOLLOWED A STATUS QUO FOR TEMPERATURES WITH HIGHS IN THE 80S AND 
LOWS IN THE MID 50S TO MID 60S.      
&&

ENTIRE FORECAST AREA SHOULD PREVENT ANY CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT ALONG 
THE PLATEAU TROUGH THIS AFTERNOON.

241 PM EDT SUN SEP 4 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...A MOSTLY SUNNY

SOUTHEAST STATES THIS AFTERNOON. ONLY A FEW CUMULUS HAS FORMED OVER 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND SOUTHERN VALLEY. TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE 
LOWER TO MID 80S AT THE PRESENT TIME AND WILL RISE A FEW MORE 
DEGREES THIS AFTERNOON. A MID AND UPPER TROUGH OVER THE NORTHEAST 
WILL LIFT NE AS RIDGING BUILDS OVER THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES AND 
NORTHEAST MONDAY AND TUESDAY. THIS WILL KEEP THE TENNESSEE VALLEY IN 
A SUNNY PATTERN AS A SURFACE HIGH TO THE NORTH MOVES EAST AND 
SETTLES OVER THE MID ATLANTIC STATES. A EAST TO SOUTHEAST FLOW OF 
MOISTURE OFF THE ATLANTIC WILL INCREASE MOISTURE ALONG THE GULF 
COAST BY MONDAY NIGHT BUT IT WILL BE FAR TO THE SOUTH. THE 
ATMOSPHERE WILL REMAIN DRY SO EXPECT MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES TO CONTINUE. 
HIGHS AND LOWS WILL CONTINUE ABOUT THE SAME AS THE LAST TWO DAYS. 
GENERALLY FOLLOWED CLOSE TO MAV TEMPS THROUGH THE PERIOD.  


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO
DOMINATE THE WEATHER THROUGH THE PERIOD. AGAIN THE MODELS ARE
TRYING TO INDICATE AN EASTERLY WAVE MOVING INTO THE REGION ON
SUNDAY...HOWEVER WITH US MOVING INTO THE CLIMATOLOGICAL DRY SEASON
AND VERY LIMITED MOISTURE AM KEEPING THE FORECAST DRY. THERE WILL
BE VERY LIMITED CLOUDS...AND GENERALLY SEASONABLE TEMPERATURES.

INTO OUR CLIMATALOGICAL DRY SEASON. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN MILD
WITH HIGHS IN THE VALLEY GENERALLY IN THE LOW TO MID 80S WITH LOWS
IN THE MID 50S TO LOW 60S.

BELIEVE TEMPERATURES SHOULD DROP A FEW DEGREES BELOW THIS MORNINGS 
LOWS IN THE UPPER 50S TO MID 60S. HIGHS SATURDAY SHOULD BE SIMILAR 
TO TODAYS WITH MORE SUN AND DRY AIR OFFSETTING THE COOLER START.  

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...QUIET WEATHER PATTERN 
REMAINS IN PLACE THROUGH THE EXTENDED WITH HIGH PRESSURE AT THE 
SURFACE AND ALOFT.  RESULTING NORTHERLY FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO PULL 
IN DRY AND STABLE AIR.  MODELS INDICATE A COUPLE OF WEAK IMPULSES IN 
THE UPPER FLOW DURING THE EXTENDED PERIOD...BUT THESE SHOULD HAVE 
LITTLE EFFECT ON AREA WEATHER...EXCEPT FOR A FEW CLOUDS.  SO WILL 
KEEP FORECAST DRY THROUGH THE PERIOD.  MINOR COOLING ALOFT WILL 
TRANSLATE TO SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPS AND WILL STAY NEAR GUIDANCE.

CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE RIVER VALLEY WITH DRIER AND COOLER AIR FILTERING INTO THE 
REGION. SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES ACROSS MUCH OF 
THE REGION. THIS DRIER AIR...COMBINED WITH A STRONG CAPPING 
INVERSION ALOFT...SHOULD KEEP THE NEXT COLD FRONT ON FRIDAY DRY. IN 
FACT...MODELS INDICATE THAT THE ATMOSPHERE WILL ALSO BE TOO DRY TO 
SUPPORT MUCH OF AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS WITH THIS FRONT. THE NEXT 
SEVEN DAYS LOOK TO BE DRY AND TRANQUIL WITH HIGH PRESSURE SETTLING 
OVER THE REGION THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. TEMPS WILL BE A FEW 
DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH FRIDAY...BUT THEN SHOULD COOL DOWN TO 
NEAR NORMAL LEVELS FOR NEXT WEEK. 
&&

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS THE CENTER OF THE REMNANTS OF KATRINA 
OVER SOUTHWEST OHIO WITH BREEZY WINDS CONTINUING ACROSS NORTHEAST TN 
AND SOUTHWEST VA. THESE WINDS SHOULD GRADUALLY DIMINISH THIS MORNING 
AS KATRINA CONTINUES TO MOVE NORTHEAST AWAY FROM THE FORECAST AREA. 
SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL THAT CLOUDS ARE GRADUALLY DECREASING FROM 
THE SOUTHWEST AS DRIER AIR FILTERS INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY. THIS 
DRIER AIR...COMBINED WITH A STRONG CAPPING INVERSION ALOFT...SHOULD 
LIMIT ANY POSSIBLE RAIN WITH A SHORT WAVE THAT IS PROGGED TO SWING 
ACROSS THE REGION TONIGHT. OUTSIDE OF A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS ACROSS 
NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA THIS MORNING...THE NEXT SEVEN DAYS 
LOOK TO BE DRY WITH HIGH PRESSURE SETTLING OVER THE REGION. TEMPS 
WILL BE A FEW DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH FRIDAY...BUT WILL THEN 
COOL DOWN TO NORMAL LEVELS AFTER THE PASSAGE OF A COLD FRONT FRIDAY 
NIGHT. MODELS INDICATE THAT THE ATMOSPHERE WILL BE TOO DRY TO 
SUPPORT ANY RAIN WITH THIS FRONT...AND THIS FRONT WILL LIKELY NOT 
EVEN PRODUCE MUCH OF AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS.

.SHORT TERM...LOW CIRCULATION OF KATRINA BEGINNING TO MOVE NORTHEAST 
ACROSS W KY THIS EVENING. WINDY CONDITIONS CONTINUE THIS EVENING AS 
LOW IS SLOW TO FILL. AS THE LOW MOVES NE TNGT...PRESSURE GRADIENT 
WILL RELAX WITH BREEZY CONDITIONS CONTINUING AFTER MIDNIGHT 
ESPECIALLY NORTH AND MOUNTAINS. LATE AFTN TEMPS JUMPED UP THIS AFTN 
ACROSS NE AREAS AS DOWNSLOPE FLOW ALLOWED FOR SOME BREAKS IN THE 
CLOUD COVER. THIS INCREASED INSTABILITY SUFFICIENTLY TO COINCIDE 
WELL WITH VERY GOOD LLVL SHEAR ACROSS THE NORTHERN AREAS PROMPTING 
TORNADO WATCH THIS EVENING. AXIS OF STABLE AIR SLIDING NE ACROSS 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. THIS SHOULD SLIDE INTO THE WATCH AREA DECREASING 
THE TORNADO THREAT AND POSSIBLY ALLOWING FOR EARLY CANCELLATION OF 
WATCH. OTHERWISE CLOUDY CONDITIONS WITH A FEW SPRINKLES WILL PERSIST 
MOST OF THE NIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...REMAINS OF KATRINA SHIFT 
WELL NE INTO THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES BY 12Z WED HOWEVER...FAIRLY 
DEEP MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO SPIRAL AROUND THE CIRCULATION AND A 
WEAK TROF WILL MOVE ACROSS THE FA DURING THE DAY. USED SOME CHC POPS 
FOR -SHRA FOR THIS POSSIBILITY. THE REMAINDER OF THE FCST APPEARS TO 
BE TRANQUIL WITH TOO MUCH DRY AIR ON W-NW FLO ALOFT EVEN DESPITE A 
WEAK FRONTAL OR TROF PASSAGE AROUND THURSDAY NIGHT/EARLY FRIDAY. 
LABOR DAY WEEKEND FEATURES HIGHER PRESSURES AND SEASONABLE TEMPS. 
MOISTURE GRADUALLY INCREASES BY TUE AS ELY FLO DEVELOPS CREATING A 
SMALL CHC FOR A SHOWER ACROSS THE CAROLINAS. WILL LEAVE MRX FA DRY 
FOR NOW SINCE THIS IS AT SUCH A FAR TIME RANGE ON DAY SEVEN.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 300738
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT TUE AUG 30 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS THE CENTER OF TROPICAL STORM KATRINA 
NEAR TUPELO MISSISSIPPI WITH WINDS AROUND 30 TO 35 MPH GUSTING TO 45 
MPH BEING REPORTED AROUND NORTHERN MS AND WEST TN. THE CENTER OF 
KATRINA APPEARS TO BE MOVING A LITTLE FASTER AND LITTLE FARTHER EAST 
THAN EARLIER FORECASTED...AND THE 00Z MODEL RUNS HAVE INITIALIZED 
AROUND 30 MILES TOO FAR SOUTH OF THE ACTUAL CENTER. THUS...WILL 
TREND THE FORECAST TOWARD A FASTER OVERALL MOVEMENT OF THIS SYSTEM 
COMPARED TO THE MODELS AND PREVIOUS FORECAST. OVERALL..THE MODELS 
APPEAR TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE DETAILS OF KATRINA FOR THE 
FORECAST AREA THROUGH TONIGHT. SURFACE WINDS ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND 
NORTHERN VALLEY AREAS CONTINUE TO BE LIGHT THIS MORNING...BUT VAD 
WIND PROFILES FROM KMRX AND KHTX INDICATE WINDS OF 30 TO 40 KNOTS 
AROUND 3000 FT AGL. WINDS AT CHA AND CSV INCREASED TO AROUND 20 MPH 
WITH GUSTS UP TO 30 MPH AS THE RAIN BANDS MOVED THROUGH AND LOWERED 
THE STRONGER WINDS ALOFT. WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE THE LAKE WIND 
ADVISORY TODAY AND MENTION THAT THE STRONGEST WINDS WILL BE REACHED 
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND IN THE VALLEY AREAS DURING THE 
STRONGER RAIN BANDS.

WILL CONTINUE THE FLOOD WATCH FOR THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...SOUTHEAST 
TN AND SOUTHWEST NC THROUGH TONIGHT...WHERE RAIN COULD BE HEAVY AT 
TIMES. SATELLITE IMAGES AND REGIONAL RADAR MOSAICS REVEAL DRIER AREA 
CIRCULATING AROUND THE WESTERN AND SOUTHERN SIDE OF THE CENTER OF 
KATRINA...SO THINK THAT RAIN WILL RAPIDLY DIMINISH IN COVERAGE 
BEGINNING THIS AFTERNOON AND BECOME MAINLY SCATTERED IN NATURE BY 
TONIGHT. HOWEVER...HEAVY RAIN WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE WITH SOME OF 
THESE SHOWERS UNTIL THE SYSTEM COMPLETELY EXITS THE AREA TONIGHT. 
WITH A STRONG SOUTHERLY WIND FLOW...THINK A STRONG UPSLOPE/DOWNSLOPE 
COMPONENT TO THE RAINFALL WILL CONTINUE TODAY...BUT SLOWLY END 
TONIGHT AS WINDS SHIFT TO THE NORTHWEST WITH KATRINA MOVING NORTH OF 
THE REGION. THIS SOUTHERLY FLOW SHOULD CREATE STRONG DOWNSLOPE FLOW 
ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY AREAS TODAY...WHICH SHOULD 
NOTICEABLY LIMIT THE AMOUNT OF RAINFALL IN THESE AREAS. A SHORT WAVE 
THEN ROTATES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BEHIND KATRINA ON WEDNESDAY... 
PRODUCING A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS. AS WITH MOST 
TROPICAL SYSTEMS...INSTABILITY WILL CONTINUE TO BE WEAK THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY...AND WILL PLAN TO MENTION MAINLY SHOWERS WITH SCATTERED 
TSTORMS. IN ADDITION...STRONG HELICITY VALUES ARE PROGGED TO MOVE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...SO THINK THERE WILL BE A CHANCE OF 
ISOLATED WEAK TORNADOES FOR MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA.

ONCE PAST WEDNESDAY...MOSTLY CLEAR AND DRY CONDITIONS RETURN WITH 
NEAR NORMAL TEMPS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             81  69  86  65 / 100  50  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  83  69  84  63 / 100  60  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       81  69  85  63 / 100  60  20  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              83  68  83  60 / 100  70  30  20

CENTER WILL HAVE ADVANCED NE INTO WRN OH BY 12Z WED WITH TRAILING 
SFC TROF PRESSING E ACROSS THE FA DURING THE DAY AND THEREFORE WE 
WILL KEEP LIKELY POPS SW VA/NE TN THRU MEDIUM CHC POP ACROSS SE 
TN/SW NC DURING THE MORNING TAPERING BACK TO CHC/SLGT CHC BY 
AFTERNOON AS THE CIRCULATION CENTER MOVES RAPIDLY NE INTO THE ERN 
GREAT LAKES. DESPITE THE PASSAGE OF A WEAK UPR TROF AND ASSOCIATED 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY THU NIGHT INTO FRI MORNING WHICH SHOULD PROVIDE A 
FEW CLOUDS BUT LITTLE CHANCE OF RAIN...THE REMAINDER OF THE FCST 
FEATURES HI PRES AND SEASONABLE TEMPS AS DRIER NW FLO PREVAILS IN 
TIME TO PROVIDE A DECENT LABOR DAY WEEKEND.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 291417
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1015 AM EDT MON AUG 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...FORECAST ON TRACK. CURRENT FLOOD WATCHES BEST APPROACH 
TO HANDLE EXPECTED RAINFALL TONIGHT AND TUESDAY. WINDS FOR TNGT WILL 
BE MONITORED FOR POSSIBLE UPWARD ADJUSTMENT...MAINLY ACROSS HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. FOR TODAY...CLOUDY CONDITIONS WITH WIDESPREAD MAINLY 
LIGHT RAINFALL. MAX TEMPS ON THE COOL SIDE OF THE MOS BLEND ALSO 
APPEARS A GOOD CHOICE. 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION

SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS 
SHOWS THE CENTER OF HURRICANE KATRINA NEAR THE MOUTH OF THE 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER...WITH THE LATEST TPC FORECAST TRACK CONTINUING TO 
BRING THE REMNANTS INTO WESTERN MIDDLE TN BY SUNRISE TUESDAY 
MORNING. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH THE TRACK AND INTENSITY 
OF THE STORM...WITH KATRINA EXPECTED TO BE A TROPICAL STORM WITH 
WINDS AROUND 45 MPH AS IT ENTERS MIDDLE TN. RIGHT NOW...IT APPEARS 
THAT WINDS WILL BE BREEZY ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN (ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS)...BUT THEY SHOULD REMAIN WITHIN WIND ADVISORY 
CRITERIA LATE TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY MORNING. SINCE WINDS WILL NOT 
RISE INTO ADVISORY CRITERIA UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT...WILL HOLD 
OFF ON ISSUING A WIND ADVISORY FOR NOW. MODELS INDICATE THAT A 
DEFORMATION ZONE WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY TODAY AHEAD 
OF KATRINA...WHICH SHOULD RESULT IN A GOOD CHANCE FOR SHOWERS ACROSS 
MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. AS WITH MOST TROPICAL SYSTEMS... 
INSTABILITY WILL BE WEAK AND WILL PLAN TO MENTION MAINLY SHOWERS 
WITH SCATTERED TSTORMS THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A 
FLOOD WATCH FOR THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST 
NC...WHERE RAIN COULD BE HEAVY AT TIMES TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY 
NIGHT. UPSLOPE FLOW FROM THE STRONG SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL LIKELY 
PRODUCE SOME LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND 
EXTREME SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. THIS SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL ALSO 
CREATE STRONG DOWNSLOPE FLOW ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY 
AREAS...WHICH SHOULD NOTICEABLY LIMIT THE AMOUNT OF RAINFALL IN 
THESE AREAS. THUS...WILL NOT INCLUDE THESE AREAS IN THE FLOOD WATCH. 
IN ADDITION...STRONG HELICITY VALUES ARE PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA LATER TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY...SO THINK THERE WILL BE A 
CHANCE OF ISOLATED WEAK TORNADOES FOR MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE IN FORECAST. 
EXPECT KATRINA TO MOVE OUT TO THE NORTHEAST PER GFS AND LEAVE OPEN 
H5 WAVE IN PLACE WHICH HAS A PRETTY STRONG DRY SLOT BEHIND IT. SOME 
COOLING AS TROF CROSSES THE AREA THROUGH THE PERIOD. EVEN ON 
WEDNESDAY WITH TAIL END OF KATRINA EXPECT CHANCE OF STORMS AND 
SHOWERS TO DIMINISH AS SYSTEM MOVES NORTHEAST. HAVE CHANGED WORDING 
FROM COVERAGE TO CHANCES TO REFLECT LESS LIKELIHOOD AND FAIRLY RAPID 
MOVEMENT OF SYSTEM OUT OF AREA. ONCE PAST THURSDAY, EXPECT SUNNY AND 
SOME RETURN TO WARMER TEMPS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             82  73  82  72 / 100 100 100  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  84  70  84  70 /  90 100 100  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       83  70  83  70 /  90 100 100  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              85  68  85  69 /  70 100 100  80

DEFORMATION ZONE WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY TODAY AHEAD 
OF KATRINA...WHICH SHOULD RESULT IN A GOOD CHANCE FOR SHOWERS ACROSS 
MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. AS WITH MOST TROPICAL SYSTEMS... 
INSTABILITY WILL BE WEAK AND WILL PLAN TO MENTION MAINLY SHOWERS 
WITH SCATTERED TSTORMS THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A 
FLOOD WATCH FOR THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST 
NC...WHERE RAIN COULD BE HEAVY AT TIMES TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY 
NIGHT. UPSLOPE FLOW FROM THE STRONG SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL LIKELY 
PRODUCE SOME LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND 
EXTREME SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. THIS SOUTHERLY FLOW WILL ALSO 
CREATE STRONG DOWNSLOPE FLOW ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY 
AREAS...WHICH SHOULD NOTICEABLY LIMIT THE AMOUNT OF RAINFALL IN 
THESE AREAS. THUS...WILL NOT INCLUDE THESE AREAS IN THE FLOOD WATCH. 
IN ADDITION...STRONG HELICITY VALUES ARE PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA LATER TONIGHT INTO TUESDAY...SO THINK THERE WILL BE A 
CHANCE OF ISOLATED WEAK TORNADOES FOR MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE IN FORECAST. 
EXPECT KATRINA TO MOVE OUT TO THE NORTHEAST PER GFS AND LEAVE OPEN 
H5 WAVE IN PLACE WHICH HAS A PRETTY STRONG DRY SLOT BEHIND IT. SOME 
COOLING AS TROF CROSSES THE AREA THROUGH THE PERIOD. EVEN ON 
WEDNESDAY WITH TAIL END OF KATRINA EXPECT CHANCE OF STORMS AND 
SHOWERS TO DIMINISH AS SYSTEM MOVES NORTHEAST. HAVE CHANGED WORDING 
FROM COVERAGE TO CHANCES TO REFLECT LESS LIKELIHOOD AND FAIRLY RAPID 
MOVEMENT OF SYSTEM OUT OF AREA. ONCE PAST THURSDAY, EXPECT SUNNY AND 
SOME RETURN TO WARMER TEMPS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.DISCUSSION...CONVECTION GOT LATE START THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY 
EVENING. AS DAYTIME HEATING RAISED TEMPERATURES TO THE UPPER 80S 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FORMED IN THE FOOTHILLS OF THE 
APPALACHIANS EAST OF MRX AND THEN MOVED NORTH NORTHEAST ACROSS NE TN 
AND INTO SW VA. WEAK BOUNDARY OVER THE OHIO VALLEY ENHANCED 
THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY ACROSS KY AND MIDDLE TN. THIS CONVECTION 
SPREAD ONTO THE NORTHERN PLATEAU THIS EVENING. SOME TRAINING HAS 
OCCURRED WITH HEAVY RAIN ACROSS SCOTT AND CAMPBELL COUNTIES. THINK 
CONVECTION WILL DIMINISH SOON WITH LOSS OF HEATING SO WILL GRADUALLY 
LOWER POPS NORTH AND NORTHWEST. MAIN AREA OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WITH KATRINA WILL MOVE NORTH ACROSS AL AND GA TONIGHT 
BUT NOT EXPECTED TO AFFECT SE TN UNTIL MONDAY. NEXT SHIFT MAY NEED 
TO CONSIDER FLOOD WATCH FOR PART OF SOUTHERN THIRD WITH HEAVY RAIN 
POSSIBLE MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
332 PM EDT SUN AUG 28 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...MAIN STORY IS OF
COURSE THE APPROACH OF POWERFUL HURRICANE KATRINA TOWARD THE LA/MS
COASTS. DISCARDED THE NAM MODEL AS IT WAS SOLE OUTLIER FROM THE
REST OF MODELS WHICH CLOSELY RESEMBLED THE OFFICIAL NHC TRACK. GFS
MODEL WAS VERY CLOSE AND FOLLOWED FOR THE MOST PART...ESPECIALLY IN
TIMING THE ONSET OF CONVECTIVE PCPN AND STRONG SE WINDS FOR MAINLY
JUST OUR SRN AND WRN MOST PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA. STUDIED THE
NWS DIRECTIVES AND THOUGHT BRIEFLY ABOUT ISSUING AN INLAND TROPICAL
STORM/WIND WATCH FOR LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY. THIS IS A
VIABLE PRODUCT FOR US...BUT SINCE WIND SPEEDS SEEM TO BE JUST
GETTING INTO THE UPPER ENDS OF A WIND ADVISORY AT THIS TIME...OPTED
TO FOLLOW-UP OUR SPS AND INCREASE WIND SPEEDS AND GUSTS FOR SE TN...
NE PLATEAU...SMOKIES AND SW NC AREAS FOR NOW.

INCREASED POPS GENERALLY FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON INTO TUESDAY NIGHT
IN LINE WITH GFS...BUT DID TRY TO CARRY LOWER POPS AND QPF WHERE I
FEEL THAT THOSE STRONG SE WINDS WILL KEEP SOME DOWNSLOPE EFFECTS
GOING AT LEAST INITIALLY.  MODIFIED HPC QPF GRIDS A BIT.  

OTHERWISE...FOR TONIGHT...BEST COVERAGE SO FAR OF DEVELOPING
CONVECTION IS MIDDLE TN NEAR THE WEAK FRONT...AND ACROSS SE TN AND
SW NC. MOVEMENT IS SLOWLY NORTH. KEPT THE PREVIOUS LOOK OF GRIDS
WITH CHANCE POPS FOR SRN AND WRN AREAS EARLY TONIGHT AND SLIGHT
CHANCE POPS ELSEWHERE.

GFS MODEL AND MOS LOOKED GOOD...SO DID NOT STRAY FAR FROM GFS MOS
TEMPS. 


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...REMNANTS OF KATRINA WILL
BE EXITING AT A MODERATE PACE NORTHEAST AWAY FROM THE FA ON WED
WITH TROF SWINGING EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS DURING THE DAY. A
GRADATION OF LIKELY POPS NRN SECTIONS TO LOWER CHC POPS SOUTHERN
SECTIONS SHOULD SUFFICE FOR THE END OF KATRINAS EFFECTS ON THE FA.
HOWEVER WILL STILL CARRY A SLGT CHC POP ACROSS THE NRN/CNTRL MTNS
WED NIGHT FOR POSSIBILITY OF SOME WEAK UPSLOPE WITH TRAILING
MOISTURE ALIGNED WITH TROF. KEPT THE REMAINDER OF THE FCST DRY AS
NW FLO BUILDS IN ALOFT AND SFC HI PRES STRENGTHENS OVR THE ERN U.S.

PERCENT POPS LOOK FINE FOR THIS AFTERNOON.  CLOUDS AROUND EARLY 
TODAY SHOULD LIMIT HOW HIGH MAX TEMPS REACH AND ALSO KEEP 
INSTABILITY DOWN.

CONCERNING HURRICANE KATRINA...JUST LISTENED TO THE 10 AM EDT 
CONFERENCE CALL.  MOST MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH LITTLE CHANGES 
EXPECTED ON THE LATEST TRACK.  OF THE SHORT RANGE MODELS THE NAM 
(FORMERLY KNOWN AS ETA) SEEMS TO HAVE THE POOREST TRACK AND WONT BE 
FOLLOWED.  HOWEVER...MAY CONSIDER INCREASING WIND SPEEDS FOR SE TN 
AND SW NC AREAS STARTING MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY.  WOULD PREFER TO 
LOOK OVER MODEL DATA AND COORDINATE WITH SURROUNDING OFFICES BEFORE 
ISSUING ANY TYPE OF WIND WATCH AT THIS POINT.  THANKS TO HUNTSVILLE 
FOR EARLIER COORDINATION CALL.

WILL FRESHEN UP THE GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS...AND ALSO AT LEAST 
REMOVE THE AFTERNOON WORDING FROM THE ZFPMRX.

TOWARDS SUNRISE TOMORROW...SO WILL LEAVE POPS IN THE FORECAST 
THROUGHOUT TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...TODAY SHOULD BE WARMER THAN 
YESTERDAY WITH SOME MORE SUNSHINE EXPECTED...AND WILL PLAN TO FOLLOW 
CLOSE TO THE GFS MOS NUMBERS.


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MAIN FORECAST ISSUE FOR THE 
LONG TERM CONTINUES TO BE TRACK AND TIMING OF KATRINA. LATEST NAM 
AND GFS STILL SHOWING SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES WITH NAM PROJECTING A 
MORE EASTERLY TRACK. GFS SIMILAR TO OFFICIAL TRACK AND RECEIVES 
SUPPORT FROM SHORT RANGE ENSEMBLES. THUS...GFS WILL BE MAIN SOURCE 
OF GUIDANCE. TIME HEIGHTS DEPICT DEEP MOISTURE PROFILE AS KATRINA 
APPROACHES WITH PW VALUES APPROACHING TWO INCHES. HOWEVER...STRONGLY 
DOWN-SLOPING FLOW SUGGESTS QPF VALUES WILL BE HELD DOWN SOMEWHAT 
OVER MUCH OF THE FORECAST AREA. NEVERTHELESS...HIGH POPS APPEAR 
APPROPRIATE AND HAVE BUMPED UP POPS SLIGHTLY FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND 
TUESDAY AREA-WIDE. REMAINDER OF LONG TERM CHARACTERIZED BY TROUGH 
OVER THE EASTERN CONUS WITH NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT PREDOMINATING 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. GENERALLY DRY WEATHER PROJECTED AT 
THIS POINT...WITH TEMPS NEAR CLIMO.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
346 PM EDT SAT AUG 27 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...NOT IMPRESSED WITH 
CONVECTIVE POTENTIAL THIS LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH SO FAR 
JUST A NARROW BAND OF PRE-FRONTAL PCPN NOTED.  IN SPITE OF BEST

WRN AREAS AND SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ERN AREAS FOR TONIGHT.  TAPERED 
POPS OFF TO LOW SLIGHT CHANCE EVERYWHERE AFTER MIDNIGHT...AND ALSO 
DROPPED THE MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS.

FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...DID NOT SEE MUCH FOCUS FOR CONVECTION
SO UNDERCUT MOS POPS.  HOWEVER...MOSTLY CLOUDY OVERALL WHICH FAVORED 
THE COOLER MAX TEMPS.

FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT...I DID NOT LIKE THE GFS TIMING ON 
HURRICANE KATRINA OR REMNANTS...ALTHO 12Z GFS MODEL DID GET MORE IN 
LINE WITH THE REST OF THE MODELS.  THE NAM AND ECMWF SEEMED MUCH 
CLOSER TO THE OFFICIAL NHC TRACK OF KATRINA...AND GRIDS WERE OVERALL 
DRAWN THAT WAY.  A BIT WORRIED THAT WE MAY BE RUSHING IN THE PCPN 
FOR SRN AREAS THOSE PERIODS...BUT HAD TO MESH WITH HIGHER FFC AND 
GSP POP GRIDS.  IT IS POSSIBLE THAT CONVECTIVE BANDS MIGHT REACH OUR 
SRN AREAS AT THAT TIME...OR PERHAPS DAYTIME HEATING AND UPSLOPE E-SE 
WINDS MAY AID DEVELOPMENT.  IN SPITE OF NOT FAVORING GFS MODEL WITH 
KATRINA...I DID FAVOR THE GFS/MAV MOS COOLER HIGH TEMPS MONDAY.


.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...EARLY PART OF FCST PAINTED 
WX CONDITIONS IN LINE WITH TPC OFFICIAL KATRINA TRACK WHICH BRINGS 
WEAKENING TS INTO MID MISSISSIPPI AT THE BEGINNING OF THE PERIOD. 
USED LIKELY POPS FOR TUE THROUGH TUE EVENING TAPERING BACK TO 
CHC/SLGT CHC POP FOR MOST OF THE FA BY 12Z WED AS KATRINA DEPARTS N 
THRU THE OH VLY. MAINTAINED SOME CHC POPS WED/WED NIGHT FOR 
POSSIBILITY OF HIGHER MEAN RH AND LIFT BEHIND DEPARTING TROPICAL 
SYSTEM. REMAINDER OF THE FCST DRY AS RIDGING SFC AND ALOFT 
ESTABLISHES ITSELF ACROSS EASTERN U.S.

MAY NOW MOVE FROM AL NORTHEAST OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU LATE

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
246 PM EDT FRI AUG 26 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...FORECAST IN THE SHORT TERM 
NOT REAL STRAIGHT FORWARD AS CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE LINGERS OVER THE 
AREA...AND THE POSSIBILITY OF WEAK DISTURBANCES IN THE FLOW WHICH 
COULD INCREASE PRECIP COVERAGE. THE BATCH OF CONVECTION OVER KY AND 
MIDDLE TN HAS HAD TROUBLE MOVING INTO THE AREA...TENDING TO DIMINISH 
AS IT MOVES INTO MORE STABLE AIR.  SECOND DISTURBANCE AFFECTING IL 
AND MO MAY MISS US TO THE NORTH...BUT PRECIP ON THE TAIL END 
BUILDING SOUTH MAY AFFECT SOME OF THE AREA ESPECIALLY FOR PLATEAU 
AND NORTH.  WILL LOOK AT LATEST RADAR RIGHT BEFORE RELEASE...BUT 
PLAN TO GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTHEAST TONIGHT...CHANCE ELSEWHERE.  
THEN CHANCE ALL ZONES SAT. WILL GO NEAR TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE MAV TEMPS 
BOTH PERIODS.  


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...THE BIGGEST HEADACHE 
IS THE TRACK KATRINA WILL TAKE.  THE NAM MODEL HAS IT GOING ON-SHORE 
AROUND APPALACHICOLA FLA TRACKING NORTHEAST FROM THERE...WHICH WOULD 
GIVE OUR FORECAST AREA VERY MINIMAL IMPACT.  THE LATEST GFS MODEL 
HAS LANDFALL AROUND NEW ORLEANS AND TRACKING NORTHWARD ACROSS WEST 
TENNESSEE...AGAIN MINIMAL IMPACT.  

THE TROPICAL PRECICTION CENTER TRACK HAS LANDFALL MONDAY WITH A 
NORTH-NORTHEAST TRACK WITH THE CENTER GOING JUST EAST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS WHICH COULD BRING RAINS INTO THE AREA WITH SIGNIFICANT 
RAINS POSSIBLE IN THE HEADWATER AREAS OF SOME OF OUR RIVERS THAT 
FLOW FROM NORTH CAROLINA.  IF THE TRACK GOES JUST A LITTLE WEST OF 
THE CURRENT OFFICIAL TRACK...THE AREA COULD SEE SIGNIFICANT 
RAINS...AND HIGH WINDS PARTICULARLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

NEEDLESS TO SAY...THIS IS A POTENTIALLY SIGNICANT WEATHER MAKER AND 
WE WILL BE KEEPING A CLOSE WATCH TO THE TRACK AND IMPACTS ON OUR 
WEATHER.

PLAYED THE RAINFALL CHANCES ON THE HIGH END OF CHANCE WITH THE 
UNCERTAINTIES OF THE TRACK.  LATER FORECASTS WILL NEED TO RAISE OR 
LOWER BASED ON FUTURE FORECAST TRACKS.

COMPARED TO THAT OBSERVED FARTHER WEST OVER THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
AND OHIO RIVER VALLEYS. THIS FRONTAL BOUNDARY SHOULD AGAIN BECOME 
THE FOCUSING MECHANISM FOR CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT LATER TODAY...WITH 
OUTFLOW FROM A CONVECTIVE COMPLEX OVER THE LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEY 
PROVIDING AN ADDITIONAL TRIGGERING MECHANISM. WITH ALL OF THIS IN 
MIND...WILL PLAN TO RAISE POPS A LITTLE TODAY WITH THE HIGHEST POPS 
LOCATED ALONG THE PLATEAU. CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY SHOULD GRADUALLY 
DIMINISH AFTER SUNSET TONIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO GO WITH 
SLIGHTLY LOWER TEMPS TODAY COMPARED TO YESTERDAY DUE TO THE EXPECTED 
INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER FROM CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODEL TIME HEIGHTS DEPICT 
DEEP MOISTURE PERSISTING OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND. HOWEVER...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES PROJECT ONLY 
SCATTERED CONVECTION AT BEST...IN SPITE OF WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
APPROACHING BY SUNDAY. REMNANTS OF KATRINA APPROACH EARLY NEXT 
WEEK...BUT OFFICIAL TRACK STILL KEEPS SYSTEM EAST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS WHICH IMPLIES MINIMAL IMPACT FOR OUR AREA. GUIDANCE 
TEMPS GENERALLY AGREE AND APPEAR REASONABLE BASED ON RECENT 
PERSISTENCE. DID NOT DEVIATE TOO MUCH FROM THOSE VALUES.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
328 PM EDT THU AUG 25 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THRU SATURDAY)...HIGHEST POPS (ALTHO NO 
GREATER THAN CHANCE) IN THE WESTERN AREAS IS WORKING QUITE WELL THIS 
AFTERNOON AS ATMOSPHERE IS MUCH MORE UNSTABLE ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND 
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU REGIONS.  CARRIED THIS PATTERN INTO THE 
EVENING...BUT ALSO SPREAD A BROAD AREA OF SLIGHT CHANCE POPS EAST TO 
INCLUDE THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA...DUE TO SLOW EAST MOVEMENT AND 
POSSIBLE DEVELOPMENT.  LATER TONIGHT CONTINUED THE PATTERN OF TSRA 
POSSIBLY SPREADING SE FROM KY...AND DIURNAL CONVECTION ELSEWHERE 
DISSIPATING.  NEXT SHIFT MIGHT WANT TO ADD PATCHY FOG TO THE 
MIX...ALTHO VSBYS THIS MORNING WERE GENERALLY 3 MILES OR BETTER AT 
MOST LOCATIONS. 

OTHERWISE...GENERALLY THE BEST RAIN CHANCES FOR FRIDAY THRU SATURDAY 
APPEAR TO BE MAINLY NE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND WRN MOST COUNTIES OF 
SWRN VA.  THESE AREAS STAND THE BEST CHANCE OF MCS ACTIVITY...AND 
ALSO THE BEST INSTABILITY EACH DAY.  NUDGED SKY COVER CLOSER TO 
MOSTLY CLOUDY ACROSS THE BOARD FOR FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY.  
FAVORED THE COOLER GFS/MAV MOS HIGHS EACH DAY DUE TO INCREASING 
MOISTURE AND RAIN CHANCES. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...COLD FRONT BUILDS 
INTO MID TN SATURDAY NIGHT AND STALLS...KEPT LOW CHANCE POPS IN FOR 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.  GFS BRINGING THE REMNANTS OF TS KATRINA ACROSS 
THE EASTERN FL PANHANDLE EARLY MONDAY MORNING AND TAKES SYSTEM ON AN 
EASTERN TRACK ALONG SOUTHERN ATLANTIC COAST. STAYED WITH THE FURTHER 
WEST TPC/HPC GUIDANCE WHICH BRINGS SYSTEM INTO AREA LATE MONDAY 
NIGHT INTO TUESDAY WITH SLOW DEPARTURE TO THE NE IN CENTRAL VIRGINIA 
AROUND 12Z WEDNESDAY. HIGHER MEAN RH ASSOCIATED WITH WEAKENING 
TROPICAL SYSTEM REQUIRES A WEST TO EAST 30 TO 50 PERCENT POP 
GRADIENT FOR MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH DAYTIME PERIOD TUESDAY DROPPING 
OFF TO SLIGHT CHC MOST OF THE FA BY DAYTIME PERIOD WEDNESDAY. 
DISCOUNTED GFS SOLUTION FOR THURSDAY OPTING FOR LOWER MEAN RH AND 
HIGHER PRESSURES DEPICTED IN HPC GUIDANCE FOLLOWING DEPARTURE OF 
KATRINA.

MOST OF THE SOUTH CNTRD OVR TX BUT A SUBTLE MID LVL SHORT WAVE TROF 
LAYS ACROSS NE TN TDY AND LINGERS INTO TNGT. FOR THESE REASONS WENT 
ABOVE GUIDANCE FOR POP CHANCES AND INCREASED CLOUD CVR TDY ALONG W 
SIDE OF CWA. SHORT WAVE ENERGY RIDES E ON TOP OF MID LVL RIDGE AND 
SPILLS INTO UPR DIFFLUENCE OVR E TN ON FRI WITH LOW PCPN CHCS 
FAVORING NW AREAS. MDTLY STRONG TROUGHING TO THE NW SUPPRESSES MID 
LVL RIDGING ACROSS TN ON SAT AS SFC RIDGING WEAKENS A TAD. NEAR 
NORMAL TEMPS AND RAIN CHANCE. NO CHANCES TO FCST BEYOND SAT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
301 PM EDT WED AUG 24 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THRU FRIDAY NIGHT)...WEAK LOW LEVEL 
CONVERGENCE AND BEST INSTABILITY CONTINUE TO BE NOTED MAINLY ACROSS 
THE SMOKY MTNS/SE TN/SW NC AREAS. WILL CARRY OVER SOME LATE AFTERNOON
AND EARLY EVENING SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE POPS IN THOSE AREAS.  DRY
ELSEWHERE AND I FAVORED THE SLIGHTLY WARMER MOS BLEND FOR MIN TEMPS
TONIGHT THAN COOLER MAV/GFS MOS...PARTIALLY SINCE CURRENT DEWPOINTS WERE
RUNNING A LITTLE ABOVE GFS MOS. RE-POPULATED WITH NGM/FWC MOS DEWPOINTS
WHICH WERE CLOSEST TO REALITY THIS AFTERNOON.

CANT RULE OUT ISOLATED CONVECTION JUST ABOUT ANYWHERE TOMORROW 
AFTERNOON...BUT DECIDED TO KEEP POPS AT 14 PERCENT OR LESS FOR NOW.
SHORT RANGE MODELS ALL GENERALLY AGREE THAT WEAK SHORTWAVES/IMPULSES 
MAY WEAKEN THE RIDGE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY.  THIS KEEPS THE 
THREAT OF CONVECTION LATE THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH 
THIS ACTIVITY MOVING ESE FROM THE MID MISSISSIPPI AND SRN OHIO 
VALLEY REGIONS.  DID NOT INCREASE POPS DRAMATICALLY JUST YET...AS
GFS AND NAM WERE NOT EXTREMELY ZEALOUS WITH COVERAGE (BEYOND NE 
PLATEAU AND SWRN VA) AT THIS POINT.  PREVIOUS GRIDS WERE ALREADY 
PAINTED FOR THIS SCENARIO...SO JUST SOME MINOR ADJUSTMENTS NEEDED.

OTHERWISE...THE MAIN FRONTAL BOUNDARY STAYS TO OUR SOUTH AND WE WILL 
NEED TO MONITOR THE DEVELOPMENT AND TRACK OF T.S. KATRINA INTO THE 
WEEKEND.  DID NOT STRAY FAR FROM MOS BLEND FOR MINS/MAXES...ALTHO 
EXPECT POTENTIALLY A LITTLE COOLER FOR FRIDAY MAX TEMPS.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...COLD FRONT ENTERING 
REGION SATURDAY AND STALLS...KEPT LOW CHANCE POPS IN FOR SATURDAY 
AND SUNDAY.  GFS BRINGING THE REMNANTS OF TS KATRINA ACROSS FL 
SUNDAY NIGHT.  WILL FOLLOW THE SLOWER AND FURTHER WEST TPC/HPC 
GUIDANCE WHICH BRINGS SYSTEM INTO AREA TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  WITH 
THE INCREASED MOISTURE...WILL KEEP 20/30 POPS FOR MONDAY THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY...WITH THE BEST CHANCES DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
HOURS.

FXUS64 KMRX 231838
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
237 PM EDT TUE AUG 23 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WED)...CURRENTLY STATIONARY FRONT IS 
LOCATED NEAR THE TENNESSEE/ALABAMA/GEORGIA LINE. A FEW WEAK 
SHORT-WAVES ARE MOVING ALONG AND NORTH OF THE BOUNDARY. MODERATELY 
UNSTABLE AIRMASS WITH CAPES OF 1500-2000 J/KG AND LIFTED INDICES OF 
-3 TO -5 OVER THE AREA. SCATTERED CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE TO 
DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH BEST 
CONCENTRATION OF STORMS OVER THE SOUTHERN AND EASTERN COUNTIES WHERE 
MOISTURE IS A LITTLE DEEPER.

IF CLOUDS DO BREAK TONIGHT...SOME PATCHY FOG IS POSSIBLE FOR THE 
NORTHERN SECTIONS...MAINLY NEAR AREA LAKES AND STREAMS DUE TO THE 
POTENTIAL OF STEAM FOG. CONFIDENCE TOO LOW TO INCLUDE...BUT WILL 
INFORM EVENING SHIFT OF POTENTIAL.

MODELS SHOW FRONT SAGGING FARTHER SOUTH FOR WEDNESDAY WITH UPPER 
RIDGE BEGINNING TO BUILD BACK INTO THE REGION. MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW 
SOME MID-LEVEL WARMING WHICH WILL HELP TO CAP OFF AND LIMIT ANY 
CONVECTION FOR TOMORROW. WILL DROP POPS TO ONLY 2O PERCENT OR LESS 
MOST LOCATIONS WITH DRY CONDITIONS ANTICIPATED FOR TRI AREA.

.LONG TERM...(WED NIGHT THROUGH TUE)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES 
GENERALLY AGREE ON A RATHER TRANQUIL WEATHER PATTERN THROUGH THE END 
OF THE WORK WEEK. UPPER FLOW TRANSITIONS FROM CYCLONIC TO 
ANTICYCLONIC AS UPPER RIDGE BUILDS BACK INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION. ANTICIPATE GENERALLY DRY CONDITIONS ON THURSDAY 
BEFORE WIDELY SCATTERED CONVECTION BECOMES MORE PROBABLE BY FRIDAY. 
FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE FAIRLY CLOSELY.

FURTHER OUT...MODEL SOLUTIONS DIVERGE AND ENSEMBLES BECOME 
CHAOTIC...SO CONSENSUS SOLUTION DIFFICULT TO ASCERTAIN AT THIS TIME. 
APPEARS MAJORITY OF GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS BUILDS A RIDGE INTO THE 
EASTERN CONUS BY LATE IN THE PERIOD. HOWEVER...MAJORITY OF THE 
CANADIAN ENSEMBLE MEMBERS DEPICTS TROUGHING OVER THE EASTERN CONUS 
DURING THE SAME TIME FRAME. DUE TO THIS UNCERTAINTY...HAVE TENDED TO 
FAVOR PERSISTENCE THROUGH MOST OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD...FEATURING 
MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION AND NEAR CLIMO TEMPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT MON AUG 22 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WED)...STATIONARY FRONT/THETA-E 
GRADIENT WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY TONIGHT THROUGH 
WEDNESDAY. MODELS SHOW ANOTHER WEAK SHORT-WAVE MOVING EAST ACROSS 
THE REGION TUESDAY WHICH WILL HELP PRODUCE SCATTERED CONVECTION 
TOMORROW...BEST CHANCES ALONG AND SOUTH OF INTERSTATE 40. WILL 
CONTINUE WITH WIDELY SCATTERED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS FOR 
WEDNESDAY FOR TENNESSEE...AGAIN BEST CHANCES OVER THE SOUTHERN HALF 
OF THE AREA.  MAINLY DRY FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AS DRIER AIR HAS 
ADVECTED INTO THE AREA.

.LONG TERM...(WED NIGHT THROUGH MON)...GENERALLY BENIGN WEATHER 
PROJECTED BY MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS WITH NO ORGANIZED EVENT(S) 
IN THE OFFING. RIDGING ONCE AGAIN BECOMES ESTABLISHED OVER THE 
SOUTHEASTERN CONUS BEFORE BEING SUPPRESSED BY THE NEXT IN A SERIES 
OF VIGOROUS NORTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVES BY FRIDAY. WEAK 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW IS DEPICTED FOR SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND. LOW-AMPLITUDE RIDGING BUILDS BACK IN BY EARLY NEXT WEEK. 
ANTICIPATE ONLY ISOLATED TO SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION THROUGH 
MOST OF THE LONG TERM. APPEARS MAX TEMPS WILL REMAIN SOMEWHAT ABOVE 
CLIMO THROUGH THE PERIOD ALTHOUGH MIN TEMPS MAY AVERAGE NEAR CLIMO 
BY THE WEEKEND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 AM EDT MON AUG 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...
LATEST RUC AND NAM SHOW A SHORT-WAVE MOVING EAST ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY
THIS AFTERNOON. CONVECTION ACROSS WESTERN AND MIDDLE TENNESSEE IS ASSOCIATED
WITH THIS WAVE. COLD FRONT/DEWPOINT GRADIENT IS LOCATED NEAR THE TYS
AREA WHICH WILL HELP TO FOCUS CONVECTION LATER THIS AFTERNOON. NAM SOUNDINGS
SHOW AIRMASS ACROSS THE CHA AREA MODERATELY UNSTABLE WITH CAPES BETWEEN 2000
AND 2500 J/KG WITH LIFTED INDICES OF -6 TO -7. MAIN CONCERN WITH CONVECTION
WILL BE DAMAGING DOWNBURSTS WINDS AND LOCALIZED FLASH FLOODING.

WILL UP POPS SOUTH TO 50-60 PERCENT...BUT KEEP SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA DRY.

HAVE A GOOD AFTERNOON.

BACK INTO THE 60S MOST AREAS. DEBRIS CLOUDS WILL PUSH ACROSS THE

MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES N AREAS. PCPN CHCS REMAIN LOW FAVORING HIGHER DP 
BOUNDARY ACROSS S PART.

SOME AGREEMENT ON WETTER PERIOD FOR TUESDAY...TUESDAY NIGHT.  
HOWEVER...CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW ON TRACK AND TIMING OF WEAK WAVE 
PROGGED INTO THE REGION.  FOR NOW...WILL CONTINUE TO TREND THINGS 
WETTER AND UP POPS INTO CHANCE CATEGORY ON TUESDAY.  MODELS STILL 
INDICATING SOME DRYING BEGINNING WEDNESDAY...BUT DOES KEEP MOISTURES 
INTO SOUTHERN AREAS.  SO...HAVE ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE THIS AREA.  
MODELS ON TRACK WITH RIDGE OVER THE AREA BY WEEK/S END AND WILL 
CONTINUE WITH FORECAST OF DRY CONDITION HERE...AND KEEPING THE 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY.  TEMPS LOOK GOOD THROUGH THE PERIOD.

FXUS64 KMRX 211819
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
219 PM EDT SUN AUG 21 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...MODELS AND SHORT RANGE ENSEMBLES 
GENERALLY AGREE THAT UPPER RIDGE THAT HAS PERSISTED OVER THE 
SOUTHEASTERN CONUS AND IMPEDED INFILTRATION OF DRIER AND SOMEWHAT 
COOLER AIR FROM THE NORTH WILL GRUDGINGLY RETREAT THROUGH THE SHORT 
TERM. NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH WILL STAY MAINLY NORTH OF OUR 
AREA...BUT THE COMBINATION OF THE RETREATING RIDGE AND INFLUENCES 
FROM NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH WILL ALLOW HEIGHTS TO FALL INCREMENTALLY. 
THIS SUGGESTS TEMPS WILL BE SLIGHTLY COOLER...ALBEIT STILL ABOVE 
CLIMO. THE MODELS AND ENSEMBLES ARE DEPICTING ONLY ISOLATED 
CONVECTION THROUGH THE PERIOD. HAVE GENERALLY STAYED WITH PREVIOUS 
FORECAST IN TERM OF POPS. FOR TEMPS...FOLLOWED GUIDANCE BLEND FAIRLY 
CLOSELY FOR THE MOST PART.


.LONG TERM...(MON NIGHT THROUGH SUN)...CONFIDENCE IS NOT HIGH FOR 
THE LONGER TERM AS MODELS CONTINUE TO LACK RUN TO RUN CONTINUITY.  
LOOKS LIKE LESS DRYING THAN EARLIER ADVERTISED...BUT DETAILS ON 
TIMING ANY PRECIP DIFFICULT AT BEST.  THERE COULD BE A WEAK IMPULSE 
AT SOME POINT EARLY ON...BUT GIVEN UNCERTAINTY FOR NOW THINK THE 
BEST IDEA IS JUST TO CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
FOR MON NIGHT THROUGH TUE NIGHT.  GFS STILL TRYING TO ADVERTISE SOME 
DRYING AS RIDGING ALOFT COMBINES WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE TO OUR 
NORTH AND NORTHEAST FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK.  WILL GO AHEAD 
AND KEEP CURRENT DRY FORECAST FOR WED THROUGH SAT...THEN A SLIGHT 
CHANCE FOR DAY 7 AS A WEAK FRONT MAY BE APPROACHING.   WILL NOT 
ARGUE MUCH WITH GFS MOS TEMPS...JUST A FEW MINOR TWEAKS.


&&

.DISCUSSION...MODELS APPEAR TO HAVE PRETTY MUCH ABANDONED THE IDEA

WITH THIS SLOW PROGRESS ANTICIPATED TO CONTINUE THROUGH THE COURSE OF
THE DAY. DEWPOINTS ARE PROJECTED TO FALL MARGINALLY AS FRONT DRIFTS
THROUGH THE AREA...BUT UPPER RIDGE REMAINS ENTRENCHED OVER THE
SOUTHEAST AND TEMPS ARE AGAIN PROJECTED TO BE WELL ABOVE CLIMO. WILL

BIT TOWARD THE GFS AT THIS POINT.  SO...WILL COMPROMISE AND TREND 
FORECAST A LITTLE WETTER AND KEEP AT LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS INTO 
MONDAY NIGHT.  GENERALLY IN BETWEEN SYSTEMS WEDNESDAY THROUGH

FXUS64 KMRX 201833
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
233 PM EDT SAT AUG 20 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...A FEW CHANGES IN STORE AS SURFACE 
COLD FRONT IS STILL PROJECTED TO APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA DURING THE 
FIRST PERIOD. UPPER RIDGE WHICH HAS BEEN RESPONSIBLE FOR THE 
OPPRESSIVE HEAT AND HUMIDITY OF THE PAST FEW DAYS WILL BE SUPPRESSED 
SOUTH BY AN AMPLIFYING UPPER TROUGH CURRENTLY DIGGING INTO THE 
WESTERN GREAT LAKES REGION. HOWEVER...FRONTAL PROGRESSION SLOWS AND 
HEIGHTS FALL ONLY MARGINALLY SUGGESTING THAT TEMPS WILL REMAIN ABOVE 
CLIMO FOR TOMORROW. GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO GFS GUIDANCE VALUES 
FOR TEMPS. ANTICIPATE SCATTERED CONVECTION TO ACCOMPANY COLD FRONT. 
THUS CONTINUED CHANCE POPS THROUGH MOST OF THE PERIOD.

.LONG TERM...(SUN NIGHT THROUGH SAT)...MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT IN 
HANDLING UPPER TROUGH THAT MOVES INTO THE NORTHEAST. NAM IS MORE 
PROGRESSIVE...WHILE GFS BRINGS A LOT MORE VORT ENERGY THROUGH THE 
BACK OF THE TROUGH.  THIS HAS IMPLICATIONS ON HOW FAST THINGS DRY 
OUT HERE.  NAM DRIES THINGS OUT QUICKLY...GFS IS OPPOSITE EXTREME 
WITH MOISTURE AND PRECIP LINGERING INTO MON NIGHT.  FOR NOW WILL NOT 
GO WITH EITHER EXTREME...BUT WILL TREND THE FORECAST TOWARD THE GFS 
IDEA AND GO WITH CHANCE POPS SUN NIGHT...THEN SLIGHT CHANCE MON AND 
DRY MON NIGHT. STILL LOOKS LIKE THINGS WILL GENERALLY BE DRY TUE 
THROUGH SAT AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE WILL BE CENTERED TO OUR NORTH 
AND NORTHEAST...AND RIDGING BUILDS IN ALOFT FOR THE LATTER HALF OF 
THE WORK WEEK. 


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 200750
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT SAT AUG 20 2005

.SHORT TERM...TODAY AND TONIGHT...STRONG UPPER RIDGE IN PLACE OVER 
THE CWA TODAY.  850MB TEMPS REMAIN IN THE LOW 20C WHICH WILL 
TRANSLATE INTO LOWER TO MID 90S ACROSS MOST VALLEY LOCATIONS THIS 
AFTERNOON.  WITH DEW POINTS CONTINUING IN THE LOWER 70S...HUMID 
CONDITIONS WILL PUSH HEAT INDEX NUMBERS INTO THE UPPER 90S AND LOW 
100S.  WILL ISSUE A SPS FOR THE HOT AND HUMID CONDITIONS EXPECTED 
FOR THIS AFTERNOON.  THE STRONG HEATING ALOFT WILL LIMITED THE 
ABILITY FOR CONVECTION...AS WILL THE LACK OF A GOOD TRIGGER.  
HOWEVER...WITH A MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIR MASS IN PLACE...CAN NOT RULE 
OUT CONVECTION COMPLETELY SO WILL KEEP 20-30 CHANCE POPS IN FORECAST 
FOR NOW.  

.LONG TERM...SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...A COLD FRONT STILL ON TRACK TO 
MOVE INTO THE REGION ON SUNDAY.  ALONG AND IN ADVANCE OF THE 
FRONT...SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED TO MOVE THROUGH.  
MODELS REMAIN IN DISAGREEMENT WITH TIMING OF THE FRONT...WILL 
CONTINUE WITH A BLEND.  WILL KEEP POPS TO 20 PERCENT SUNDAY NIGHT 
AND HAVE ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS OVER EASTERN MOUNTAINS INTO MONDAY 
MORNING.  BEHIND THE FRONT...DRY CONDITIONS WILL FILTER IN.  AS SUCH 
WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY THROUGH THURSDAY WITH ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE 
FRIDAY.  GUIDANCE TEMPS LOOK GOOD THROUGH THE EXTENDED AND WILL 
STAY CLOSE.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...SOUTHEASTERN CONUS PROJECTED TO

ANTICIPATED FEATURING EVEN WARMER TEMPERATURES AND SCATTERED... 
MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION. GFS GUIDANCE POPS AND TEMPS APPEAR 
REASONABLE AND HAVE BEEN USED AS A BASIS FOR FORECAST THROUGH THE 
PERIOD.

.LONG TERM...(SAT NIGHT THROUGH FRI)...NAM A BIT FASTER THAN THE GFS 
WITH PUSHING THE FRONT THROUGH...AND QUICKER BRINGING DRIER AIR IN 
BEHIND THE FRONT SUNDAY NIGHT.  THINK A COMPROMISE IS THE BEST WAY 
TO GO FOR NOW.  WILL GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH SAT NIGHT...CHANCE 
NORTH...THEN CHANCE ALL ZONES SUNDAY WITH THE FRONT.  WILL CARRY 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS INTO EARLY SUN NIGHT...THEN DRY.  WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING IN FROM THE NORTH ALONG WITH DRIER AIR...WILL KEEP 
THE FORECAST DRY THROUGH THU.  WILL ADD SLIGHT CHANCE TO FRI AS 
RETURN FLOW MAY BRING ENOUGH MOISTURE FOR SOME PRECIP BY THEN.  NO 
MAJOR ARGUMENTS WITH GFS MOS TEMPS THIS RUN.
