FXUS64 KMRX 191928
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
327 PM EDT TUE JUL 19 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...WEAKLY CAPPED UNSTABLE 
AIR MASS TO CONTINUE OVER REGION IN SHORT TERM.  CONVECTION STILL 
MORE COMMON IN WESTERN PARTS OF CWA.  THINK THIS TREND WILL CONTINUE 
AS SURFACE LEE TROF CONTINUES EAST OF APPS THAT SHOULD LESSEN 
COVERAGE OVER WESTERN SIDE OF APPS.  WESTERLY MID LEVEL FLOW IS 
HELPING KEEP WESTERN SIDE OF CWA MORE ACTIVE AS STORMS THAT FORM ON 
PLATEAU MOVE INTO WESTERN PARTS OF VALLEY DURING PEAK HEATING.

ONLY CHANGES IN TEMPS WERE TO BUMP UP LOW TEMPS TONIGHT 1-3 DEGREES 
OVER CENTRAL AND NORTH WHERE TEMPS HAVE NOT COOLED AS MUCH AS MODELS 
HAVE HINTED AT FOR THE PAST FEW NIGHTS.

.LONG TERM...(WED NIGHT THROUGH TUE)...MAIN FEATURE OF CONCERN FOR 
THE LONG TERM PERIOD IS MASSIVE UPPER RIDGE THAT MODELS AND 
ENSEMBLES GENERALLY AGREE WILL BE BUILDING INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS OVER THE WEEKEND. RIDGE WILL BE CENTERED OVER THE 
TENNESSEE RIVER VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY EARLY NEXT WEEK. 
THIS WILL TEND TO SUPPRESS CONVECTION IN MOST LOCATIONS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA WITH THE POSSIBLE EXCEPTION OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN. 
THUS HAVE CONTINUED TO CONFINE ANY POPS TO MAINLY THE MOUNTAIN ZONES.

THE OTHER MAJOR EFFECT THIS STRONG UPPER RIDGE WILL HAVE IS WELL 
ABOVE CLIMO TEMPS. GFS GUIDANCE PROJECTS 100 FOR CHA ON SATURDAY 
WITH MID 90S FOR OTHER FORECAST POINTS IN OUR FORECAST AREA. WILL 
TRIM THESE TEMPS SOMEWHAT DUE TO MOIST SOIL CONDITIONS RESULTING 
FROM RECENT WIDESPREAD CONVECTION. NEVERTHELESS...VERY WARM 
CONDITIONS CAN BE ANTICIPATED AS THIS UPPER RIDGE TREKS THROUGH THE 
REGION.

ENERGY AVAILABLE THIS AFTERNOON FOR ADDITIONAL STORM DEVELOPMENT.
MAIN CONCERN WILL BE TORRENTIAL RAINS AND ISOLATED DAMAGING WET 
DOWNBURSTS.

SATELITTE AND AREA OBSERVATIONS SHOWING FOG IS LIFTING ACROSS THE
REGION WITH PARTLY-MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS ANTICIPATED TODAY. CURRENT
FORECAST HIGHS LOOK GOOD. OVERALL...NO CHANGES PLANNED FOR 
FORECAST...EXCEPT FOR COSMETIC.

FXUS64 KMRX 181905
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EDT MON JUL 18 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...PRETTY GOOD COVERAGE OF 
PRECIP OVER NORTHERN AND WESTERN SECTIONS OF CWA THIS AFTERNOON.  
LOOKS LIKE WEAK SHEAR AXIS WAS OVER THIS AREA AS WELL AS PLATEAU OUT 
WEST THAT GOT STUFF STARTED.  MUCH OF THIS PRECIP SHOULD DIMINISH 
AFTER SUNSET.  SHEAR AXIS SHOULD SAG OUT OF THE AREA OVERNIGHT AS 
UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES.  FOR TUESDAY...GENERALLY LOCATING HIGHER 
POPS IN A GRADIENT HIGHER NW TO LOWER SE FOR TUESDAY AS UPPER TROUGH 
SAGS INTO AREA.  

HAVE MADE ONLY MINOR CHANGES TO OTHER PARAMETERS IN GRIDS THROUGH 
TUESDAY.


.LONG TERM...(TUE NIGHT THROUGH MON)...NOT MUCH CHANGE TO TYPICAL 
SUMMER-TYPE PATTERN ANTICIPATED THROUGH THE LONG TERM. MODELS AND 
ENSEMBLES GENERALLY AGREE THAT UPPER RIDGE CURRENTLY DEVELOPING OVER 
THE SOUTHWESTERN CONUS WILL SLOWLY BUILD EASTWARD AND WILL MERGE 
WITH WESTERN ATLANTIC RIDGE. FLOW ALOFT BECOMES MORE NORTHWESTERLY 
AS SOUTHWEST UPPER RIDGE DRIFTS EASTWARD TOWARD THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS AND STRENGTHENS TO BECOME THE DOMINANT FEATURE. THE 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT IS PROJECTED TO PROVIDE A MODICUM OF DRYING 
IN THE MID AND UPPER LEVELS AND THUS SOMEWHAT LESS DIURNAL 
CONVECTION COVERAGE IS ANTICIPATED. THEREFORE GENERALLY CONFINED ANY 
POPS TO THE HIGHER TERRAIN FOR THE UPCOMING WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. OTHERWISE KEPT AS POPS PREVIOUSLY DEPICTED IN GRIDS. TEMPS ARE 
PROJECTED TO AVERAGE ABOVE CLIMO THROUGH MOST OF THE LONG TERM 
PERIOD.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 180741
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT MON JUL 18 2005

.SHORT TERM...WEAK ISOLATED CONVECTION CONTINUES ALONG A BOUNDARY 
MAINLY TO OUR NORTH AND WEST THIS MORNING.  OTHERWISE...AN UPPER 
RIDGE CONTINUES TO BUILD INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION OVER 
THE NEXT 24 HOURS...BRINGING FLOW ALOFT MORE WESTERLY.  AS A 
RESULT...SLOW DRYING IN THE UPPER LAYERS.  HOWEVER...AIR MASS IN 
PLACE REMAINS MARGINALLY UNSTABLE WITH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE.  A SLIGHT 
INCREASE IN DAYTIME WARMING WILL AID DIURNAL SCATTERED CONVECTION... 
PROVIDING NORMAL DIURNAL SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORM THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING.

.LONG TERM...A WEAKENING FRONTAL BOUNDARY APPROACHING THE AREA ON 
TUESDAY WILL HANG UP TO OUR NORTH AND SLOWLY SAG SOUTHWARD AS IT 
WASHES OUT OVER THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY.  LITTLE CHANGE IN THE AIR 
MASS EXPECTED THROUGH THIS PERIOD AND THEREFORE...EXPECT CONTINUED 
SCATTERED MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION.  UPPER LEVEL FLOW BECOMES MORE 
NORTHWESTERLY ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY AS A CENTRAL U.S. RIDGES 
STRENGTHENS.  A SECOND WEAKENING BOUNDARY IS PROGGED INTO THE REGION 
ON FRIDAY.  ALL THIS WILL ALLOW FOR A SLOW DRYING OF THE 
ATMOSPHERE...THOUGH CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW OVER THE EXTENT OF 
DRYING...ESPECIALLY ON THE LOWER LAYERS.  WILL KEEP SOME POPS GOING 
THROUGH MUCH OF THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED...THOUGH SHIFTING POPS 
TO BECOME MORE DIURNAL IN NATURE AND SLOWLY DECREASING THE PERCENT.  
GUIDANCE NUMBER LOOK REASONABLE AND WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES CLOSE TO 
THESE.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...SUBTLE CHANGES IN STORE OVER THE SHORT

BUILD WESTWARD INTO THE CENTRAL GULF STATES. THIS WILL NOT ONLY RESULT
IN MARGINAL HEIGHT RISES OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...BUT ALSO
PROVIDE MORE OF A WESTERLY COMPONENT TO THE UPPER AIR FLOW. THIS IN TURN
WILL RESULT IN SOMEWHAT DRIER AIR IN THE UPPER LEVELS. THUS ANTICIPATE
SLIGHTLY LESS COVERAGE OF CONVECTION...ALTHOUGH SCATTERED DIURNAL
CONVECTION STILL A STRONG POSSIBILITY IN THE SECOND PERIOD.
THEREFORE...CONTINUED WITH PREVIOUS GRIDS/FORECAST OF SLIGHT CHANCE POPS
OVERNIGHT INCREASING TO LOW CHANCE POPS DURING PEAK HEATING IN THE
SECOND PERIOD. TEMPS SHOULD CONTINUE TO WARM AS A RESULT OF THE HEIGHT
RISES AND LESS CLOUD COVER. GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE VALUES.

.LONG TERM...(MON NIGHT THROUGH SUN)...NOT MUCH CHANGE FOR MUCH OF 
THE PERIOD AS CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE EXPECTED TO LINGER OVER THE 
AREA...BUT NO MAJOR TRIGGERS EVIDENT OTHER THAN DAYTIME HEATING. 
MODELS DEPICT WEAK COLD FRONT SAGGING TOWARD THE AREA...BUT IT 
SHOULD STALL TO OUR NORTH BEFORE DISSIPATING.  WILL GENERALLY HAVE 
CHANCE POPS THROUGH FRIDAY.  GFS TRIES TO DRY THINGS OUT A BIT BY 
THE WEEKEND AS UPPER FLOW TURNS MORE ZONAL AND EVEN NORTHWEST.  
CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH THAT ANY SIGNIFICANT DRYING WILL OCCUR...BUT 
WILL GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE WEEKEND RATHER THAN CHANCE.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  72  90  74  90 /  30  30  20  40

REMAINS LOW AS TO THE EXTEND OF DRYING AND WILL CONTINUE WITH NORMAL

FXUS64 KMRX 161915
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT SAT JUL 16 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE IN THE OFFING 
THROUGH THE SHORT TERM AS PERSISTENT SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AROUND UPPER 
RIDGE OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC CONTINUES TO BRING DEEP TROPICAL 
MOISTURE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. MODELS AND 
SHORT-RANGE ENSEMBLES DEPICT UPPER RIDGE EXPANDING WESTWARD THROUGH 
THE SHORT TERM RESULTING IN SUBTLE HEIGHT RISES. HOWEVER...FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS PROJECT VIRTUALLY NO CAP IN SPITE OF EXPANDING RIDGE. 
INSTABILITY NOT DEPICTED TO BE GREAT...BUT SUFFICIENT TO GENERATE 
SCATTERED TO NUMEROUS SHOWERS DURING THE SECOND PERIOD. THUS WILL 
CONTINUE WITH HIGH CHANCE TO LOW LIKELY POPS ON SUNDAY WITH BEST 
CHANCES IN THE FAVORED HIGHER TERRAIN. THE ENSEMBLES AND MODELS 
GENERALLY SHOW A DIURNAL NATURE TO THE PRECIP...BUT BASED ON RECENT 
PAST...WILL CONTINUE CHANCE POPS THROUGH THE FIRST PERIOD. TEMPS 
WILL AGAIN BE TRICKY BASED ON THE AMOUNT OF BREAKS IN SKY 
COVER...BUT WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW GFS GUIDANCE WHICH AGREES FAIRLY 
WELL WITH OTHER GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...NOT MUCH CHANGE 
MONDAY AS UPPER LEVEL RIDGE IS IN PLACE. NAM AND GFS WANT TO BRING A 
COLD FRONT SOUTHEAST THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY TUESDAY AND INTO THE TN 
VALLEY TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER THE UPPER RIDGE REMAINS 
STRONG OVER THE SOUTHEAST STATES SO DO NOT WANT TO RAISE POPS HIGHER 
THAN CHANCE TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. THE COLD FRONT WASHES OUT LATE 
WEDNESDAY. AT THE END OF THE WEEK GFS MODEL TRIES TO SHIFT WESTERN 
RIDGE FARTHER EAST WITH BUILDING HEIGHTS OVER THE CENTRAL STATES AND 
MS VALLEY. ANOTHER FRONT MOVING AROUND RIDGE COULD FINALLY GIVE THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS SOME DRIER AIR BY NEXT WEEKEND IF IT CAN MOVE 
SOUTH OF THE OHIO VALLEY INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. DROPPED POPS TO 
JUST TERRAIN AREAS ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS SATURDAY BUT NOT REAL 
CONFIDENT THAT THE DRY AIR WILL MAKE IT CONSIDERING THE STRENGTH OF 
THE RIDGE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
311 PM EDT FRI JUL 15 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS GENERALLY AGREE 
THAT VERY MOIST ATMOSPHERE WILL PERSIST OVER MOST OF THE 
SOUTHEASTERN CONUS THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. HOWEVER...VERY LITTLE IN 
THE WAY OF SIGNIFICANT FEATURES ARE AVAILABLE TO TRIGGER ORGANIZED

PROJECTED IN GUIDANCE A LITTLE SUSPECT. THUS...WILL UNDERCUT 
GUIDANCE POPS SOMEWHAT...ESPECIALLY IN THE NOCTURNAL HOURS. 
ANTICIPATE MAINLY SCATTERED DIURNAL CONVECTION AGAIN IN THE SECOND 
PERIOD WITH BEST CHANCE ALONG THE HIGHER TERRAIN. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS GUIDANCE VALUES AS THEY AGREE QUITE 
WELL WITH OTHER GUIDANCE OVERALL.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS KEEP 
ATMOSPHERE MOIST AND MODERATELY UNSTABLE AS BERMUDA HIGH RIDGE 
BUILDS IN FROM THE SOUTH AND EAST. LIKE THE SHORT TERM AM SKEPTICAL 
ABOUT THE NAM MODELS HIGH POPS SATURDAY NIGHT AND BOTH NAM AND GFS 
MODELS SUNDAY. FOLLOWED CLOSER TO GFS SATURDAY NIGHT AND KEPT POPS 
10 TO 20 PERCENT LOWER...IN THE CHANCE RANGE SUNDAY. TERRAIN AREAS
SHOULD SEE THE BEST CHANCE SUNDAY AND BEYOND AND BE THE AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING VARIETY OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOPING FROM 
UNEVEN HEATING. TEMPERATURES SHOULD CONTINUE TO WARM FROM SATURDAY 
AND BE NEAR NORMAL FROM SUNDAY THROUGH THE WEEK. A COLD FRONT TRIES 
TO DROP SOUTH THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AT 
MID TO LATE WEEK WHICH COULD ENHANCE RAIN CHANCES. BECAUSE ITS STILL 
ABOUT 5 DAYS OFF LEFT POPS THE SAME. DID LOWER HIGHS A DEGREE OR 
TWO. EVEN WITH RIDGE BUILDING IN THINK IT MAY TAKE LONGER TO WARM UP 
WITH ALL THE MOISTURE STILL IN THE AIR AND GROUND FROM RECENT 
RAINS.

.SHORT TERM...REMNANTS OF DENNIS CONTINUE TO INFLUENCE WEATHER

AGAIN WILL BE HIGHLY DEPENDENT ON SKY COVER...BUT HAVE NO COMPELLING 
REASON TO SIGNIFICANTLY DEVIATE FROM GFS GUIDANCE VALUES.

SHORT-TERM...EFFECTS OF DENNIS WILL CONTINUE TO WEAKEN WITH SURFACE
AND UPPER RIDGING STRENGTHENING OVER THE AREA.  HOWEVER...MODELS
SHOW AIRMASS REMAINING QUITE TROPICAL IN NATURE WITH PWS BETWEEN 1.75
AND 2 INCHES THROUGH THE EXTENDED. MORE SUNSHINE AND THUS WARMER
TEMPERATURES ARE IN THE OFFING AS RIDGE BUILDS IN.  THE VERY WARM
AND MUGGY CONDITIONS WILL PRODUCE QUITE UNSTABLE CONDITIONS FOR NEXT
WEEK DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. ONLY LIFTING MECHANISMS
WILL BE TERRAIN AND ANY LEFT OVER BOUNDARIES. WILL HAVE HIGHEST POPS
FOR THE MOUNTAINS AREAS (HIGH CHANCE) WITH LOWER POPS FOR THE VALLEY
LOCATIONS. ISOLATED SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE EACH DAY WITH DAMAGING
DOWNBURSTS WINDS AND TORRENTIAL RAINS MAY CONCERN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT THU JUL 14 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...USED A BROADBRUSHED APPROACH FOR 
POPS TODAY PLACING FA IN CATEGORICAL RANGE FOR SHRA AND SOME THUNDER 
(USED CHC TSRA TERM ACROSS NRN SECTIONS OF FA INCLUDING NRN PLATEAU 
AND SW VA/NE TN WHERE INSTABILITY SUFFICIENT FOR CONVECTION 
QUESTIONABLE) AS DENNIS STILL SPINNING WITH A SLIGHT EWD SHIFT FROM 
YESTERDAYS POSITION. DEEPEST MOISTURE APPEARS TO HAVE SHIFTED E OF 
THE APPALACHIANS TODAY BUT PWS STILL QUITE HIGH WITH AT LEAST A 
COUPLE OF MORE SPOKES OF VORTICITY TO ROTATE ACROSS THE FA TODAY. 
THREE WAVES ARE EVIDENT IN SAT IMAGERY THIS MORNING WITH THE FIRST 
PRODUCING SHRA AND SOME TSRA ACROSS ERN TN/SW VA WITH ANOTHER 
FARTHER BACK ACROSS WRN/MID TN AND YET ANOTHER DROPPING S ACROSS WRN 
KY SO EXPECT CATEGORICAL POP NOT BAD FOR TODAY. A LITTLE 
DISHEARTENED AT THE ABILITY OF MOS (OR MY ABILITY) TO GET A LITTLE 
CLOSER TO REALITY ON WED MAX TEMPS. DECIDED TO UNDERCUT A BIT AT 
TRI/TYS TODAY AND KEEP THESE AREAS IN THE UPR 70S WITH ABUNDANT 
MOISTURE BEING WORKED ON BY OLD TROPICAL CIRCULATION. THE PROBLEM IS 
WITH MID SUMMER INSOLATION AND A BREAK IN THE OVC HERE AND THERE MOS 
MAX TEMPS WOULD BE RIGHT IN THE BALLPARK. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...WITH THE GFS LOSING THE 
REMNANT CIRCULATION OF DENNIS BY THE START OF THE PERIOD...THE MAIN 
SYNOPTIC DRIVING FEATURE WILL BE SURFACE AND MID LEVEL RIDGING OF 
THE BERMUDA HIGH. SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AROUND THE HIGH WILL CONTINUE 
TO PROVIDE A SURGE OF TROPICAL MOISTURE AND ALLOW FOR CONTINUED 
UNSETTLED WEATHER IN THE AFTERNOON HOURS. EVEN WITH THE MAIN UVV OF 
DENNIS OUT OF THE PICTURE...ITS MOISTURE STILL REMAINS AND WILL 
COMBINE WITH NEW TROPICAL MOISTURE ADVECTION FROM THE SOUTH. THIS 
PATTERN DOES NOT BREAK DOWN UNTIL LATE MONDAY WHEN THE GFS MOVES A 
MODERATELY STRONG SHORT WAVE INTO THE UPPER MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY 
AND INTO THE GREAT LAKES. THIS SW WILL ONLY SERVE TO WEAKEN THE 
RIDGE  A TAD THROUGH THE WEEKEND. GFS TRIES TO PUT A COLD FRONT 
ABOUT 100 MI NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA ON WEDNESDAY MORNING AND 
PRESSURE PATTERN IN GFS INDICATES IT SHOULD STALL THERE BEFORE 
WASHING OUT AS UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT IS PROGGED TO SHIFT TO THE NORTH 
AND EAST OF THE SURFACE FRONT.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       79  70  84  72 /  80  60  50  40

END OF LIKELY IN A LATE EVENING UPDATE.  WILL PROBABLY REMOVE 
THUNDERSTORMS FROM SW VA AND EXTREME NE TN WHERE THE ATMOSPHERE IS

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 131935
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 PM EDT WED JUL 13 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER LOW LEFT OVER FROM DENNIS
CONTINUES TO REMAIN IN PLACE OVER THE OHIO VALLEY TODAY AND PROVIDED THE
FORECAST AREA WITH EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER. SHOWERS KEPT TEMPERATURES MUCH
COOLER TODAY THAN YESTERDAY. THE ONLY AREA THAT HAD SOME HEATING WAS
EXTREME NE TN AND SW VA. THIS WAS THE ONLY AREA WHERE THUNDERSTORMS
DEVELOPED AND BROUGHT SOME LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL TO SULLIVAN AND
JOHNSON COUNTIES. EXPECT COVERAGE TO SLOWLY DECREASE ALL NIGHT BUT WITH
SHORTWAVE ENERGY ROTATING AROUND UPPER LOW THERE WILL BE A GOOD CHANCE
OF SHOWERS DURING THE NIGHT WITH AT LEAST LIGHT RAINFALL AMOUNTS. SHOWER
ACTIVITY SHOULD PICK UP AGAIN THURSDAY AS AIRMASS DESTABILIZES WITH THE
HEAT OF THE DAY. THINK THERE MIGHT BE A LITTLE LESS RAINFALL BUT WILL
FOLLOW NAM AND GFS GUIDANCE WITH HIGH POPS. THERE MIGHT BE MORE
THUNDERSTORMS BUT THAT WILL DEPEND ON HEATING. WENT A DEGREE OR TWO
BELOW GUIDANCE THURSDAY AND ADDED PATCHY FOG WITH THE RAINFALL THAT
OCCURRED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY. STILL COULD BE SOME FLOODING
CONCERNS DUE TO SATURATED GROUND THROUGH THURSDAY. THE BEST AREA FOR
HEAVIER RAINS LOOK TO BE ACROSS THE NORTHEAST CLOSER TO LOW.  THIS CYCLE
WILL CONTINUE INTO SATURDAY.



.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...WITH THE GFS LOSING
THE REMNANT CIRCULATION OF DENNIS BY THE START OF THE PERIOD...THE MAIN
SYNOPTIC DRIVING FEATURE WILL BE SURFACE AND MID LEVEL RIDGING PROVIDED
BY THE BERMUDA HIGH SOUTHEAST OF CAPE HATTERAS. WITH POSITIONING OF THE
RIDGE OFF TO OUR SOUTHEAST...SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AROUND THE HIGH WILL
CONTINUE TO PROVIDE A SURGE OF TROPICAL MOISTURE AND ALLOW FOR CONTINUED
UNSETTLED WEATHER IN THE AFTERNOON HOURS. EVEN WITH DENNIS OUT OF THE
PICTURE...HIS MOISTURE STILL REMAINS AND WILL COMBINE WITH TROPICAL
MOISTURE FROM THE SOUTH. THIS PATTERN DOES NOT BREAK DOWN UNTIL LATE
MONDAY WHEN THE GFS...ALONG WITH THE OTHER GLOBAL MODELS...MOVES A
POTENT SHORT WAVE TROF INTO THE UPPER MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY AND INTO
THE GREAT LAKES. WHILE THE TROF IS NOT PREDICTED TO PASS THROUGH OUR
REGION HERE...IT WILL SERVE TO WEAKEN THE GRIP THE RIDGE WILL HAVE ON
OUR WEATHER THROUGH THE WEEKEND. GFS TRIES TO PUT A COLD FRONT ABOUT 100
MI NORTH OF MY CWA ON WEDNESDAY MORNING AND PRESSURE PATTERN IN GFS
INDICATES IT SHOULD STALL THERE BEFORE WASHING OUT AS UPPER LEVEL
SUPPORT IS PROGGED TO SHIFT TO THE NORTH AND EAST OF THE SURFACE FRONT.

SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...EXPECT CONVECTION FROM SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON TO BE ONGOING DURING THE FIRST OF THE PERIOD WITH BEST 
INSTABILITY LOCATED OVER THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE CWA. SHORTLY 
AFTER SUNSET...CONVECTION SHOULD DIMINISH AND COME TO AN END BY 
DAYBREAK SUNDAY. SUNDAY SHOULD BE MUCH LIKE SATURDAY WITH AFTERNOON 
DEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. WILL FOLLOW MEX GUIDANCE 
CLOSELY HERE AND GO WITH WARMER TEMPS IN THE AFTERNOON AS CLOUD 
COVER WILL BE HIGH PARTLY CLOUDY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY. MIN TEMPS WILL 
CONTINUE TO BE WARM IN THE TROPICAL STYLE AIRMASS.

MONDAY...WITH MOISTURE LEVELS DECREASING ONLY SLIGHTLY WILL GO AHEAD 
AND LOWER THE POPS TO 40 PERCENT MOUNTAINS 30 PERCENT ELSEWHERE AS 
ONLY TRIGGER MECHANISM IS THE TERRAIN FOR ALL THE INSTABILITY LIKELY 
TO BE GENERATED. MAX TEMPS RETURN TO THE LOW 90S SOUTH AND UPPER 80S 
NORTH. MINS CONTINUE TO BE ON THE WARM SIDE.

TUESDAY...INSTABILITY CONTINUES IN THE AFTERNOON HOURS WITH ONLY 
TRIGGER THE TERRAIN AGAIN. FRONT APPEARS TO BE FAR ENOUGH TO THE 
NORTH TO PRECLUDE ANY GOOD QUALITY LIFT. WILL BLANKET THE AREA WITH 
30 PERCENT POPS AS DIFFICULT THIS FAR OUT TO ADEQUATELY PREDICT 
PRECISE LOCATION OF DEVELOPMENT. 

WEDNESDAY...WITH FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO MY NORTH COULD SEE SOME LIFT 
FROM THE FRONT TO HELP KICK OFF SOME SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN 
THE AFTERNOON. WITH THIS FRONT NEARBY WILL GO AHEAD AND RAISE POPS 
TO 40 PERCENT MOST LOCATIONS TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS POSSIBILITY. TEMPS 
CONTINUE TO BE SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL WITH LOW TO MID 90S SOUTH TO 
NEAR 90 NORTH. 

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

1001 AM EDT WED JUL 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...CIRCULATION REMNANTS OF DENNIS IS SLOWLY SPINNING IN PLACE
OVER INDIANA BUT BANDS ROTATING AROUND IT HAVE MOVED ACROSS THE
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. LEADING EDGE OF THE ACTIVITY HAS PRODUCED
THE HEAVIEST INITIAL RAINFALL AND HAS STABILIZED THE ATMOSPHERE OVER
WESTERN SECTIONS. TEMPERATURES ARE NOT RISING VERY FAST DUE TO CLOUDS
AND RAINFALL. EXPECT THE ACTIVITY TO SLOWLY SPREAD ACROSS THE REMAINDER
OF THE FORECAST AREA BY EARLY AFTERNOON WITH SOME THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE
ON THE LEADING EDGE. CLOUD COVER WILL HOLD TEMPERATURES DOWN OVERALL BUT
ANY BREAKS WILL ALLOW FAIRLY RAPID HEATING IN A FEW PLACES. RAINFALL
AMOUNTS ALSO A CONCERN WITH SOME AREAS SATURATED WITH LOW FLASH FLOOD
GUIDANCE. IF TRAINING DEVELOPS OR ORGANIZED CONVECTION LOCALIZED
FLOODING IS A POSSIBLITY. UPDATE TO CHANGE WORDING TO CHANCE OF THUNDER
AND WILL KEEP HIGH POPS ALL DAY.



000 
FXUS64 KMRX 121837
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
326 PM EDT TUE JUL 12 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...MAIN CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT 
THIS AFTERNOON HAS STAYED ALONG AND EAST OF THE BEST INSTABILITY AXIS
...WHICH GENERALLY RUNS E-W ACROSS CENTRAL AL THEN TURNS SW-NE 
ACROSS NW GA INTO WRN NC.  THIS WAS THE AREA WELL DEFINED BY MOST 
SHORT RANGE MODELS AND MODIFIED 12Z ACTUAL SOUNDINGS...TO HAVE THE 
HIGHEST CAPES AND THETA-E VALUES.  SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR INFILTRATED 
MOST OF MIDDLE TN AND JUST INTO WRN PARTS OF OUR FORECAST AREA...AND 
THESE AREAS CONTINUE TO BE ALMOST RAINFREE.  SINCE THE MAIN AXIS OF 
DEVELOPMENT (WITH MOVEMENT NE) IS TO MY SOUTH AND EAST...I HAVE 
UNDERCUT MOS POPS CONSIDERABLY FOR REST OF THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE 
EVENING HOURS (POPS LESS THAN 50 PERCENT WITH CHANCE WORDING).  

HOWEVER...DO FEEL THAT SHORT RANGE MODELS ARE CORRECT IN A HAVING A 
SHORTWAVE ROTATE EWD FROM THE REMNANTS OF DENNIS OVER ILLINOIS LATE 
TONIGHT.  THUS...POPS WILL BE ALLOWED TO INCREASE CONSIDERABLY AFTER 
MIDNIGHT FROM THE WEST.  LET POPS MAX OUT BEFORE 18Z IN THE WEST 
TOMORROW...THEN MAX POPS IN ERN ZONES FOR TOMORROW AFTERNOON.  DONT 
THINK THE CONVECTIVE PCPN WILL LAST ALL DAY...SO TRENDED POPS BACK 
TO LIKELY CATEGORY BY LATE AFTERNOON.

OTHERWISE...MAV MOS AT LEAST SLIGHTLY REFLECTED THE DRIER AIR 
INITIALLY IN PARTS OF OUR FORECAST AREA...SO DEW POINT TEMPS WERE 
POPULATED FROM MAV MOS.  NEAR OR JUST BELOW PERSISTENCE FOR MIN 
TEMPS TONIGHT...THEN I FAVORED THE COOLER MAV MOS MAX TEMPS DUE TO 
RAIN AND CLOUDS TOMORROW.

.LONG TERM...WENDESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY...

WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY...THE REMNANT CIRCULATION OF TROPICAL 
DEPRESSION DENNIS CONTINUES TO LINGER ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
THROUGH THE MID RANGE. MODELS CONTINUE TO BE IN GOOD AGREEMENT ABOUT 
THE CONTINUAL EVOLUTION OF THE REMNANT CIRCULATION. GFS HAS 
PERFORMED WELL TO THIS POINT AND SEE NO REASON TO NOT USE THIS 
MODEL. WILL THEREFORE BE RELYING HEAVILY ON IT FOR THE FORECAST. NAM 
ALSO HAS A GOOD HANDLE ON THE SITUATION BUT THE GUIDANCE POPS ARE 
JUST A BIT TO HIGH FOR MY TASTE CONSIDERING THAT MOST OF THE 
PRECIPITATION WILL TAKE ON A DIURNAL FORM. 

WEDNESDAY NIGHT...LARGE AREA OF OMEGA LIFT EXITING MY FORECAST AREA 
AT THE START OF THE PERIOD AND LEAVING BEHIND ONLY SMALL POCKETS OF 
UPWARD MOTION. WILL THEREFORE HAVE HIGHEST POPS OVER THE MOUNTAINS 
AT START OF THE PERIOD AND LOWER POPS TO THE SOUTHWEST. WILL 
INCREASE POPS TOWARD MORNING ACROSS SE TN AS THE GFS INDICATES 
ANOTHER PIECE OF ENERGY WILL BE MOVING INTO THE AREA. MODEL GUIDANCE 
FROM THE GFS HAS POPS IN THE LOW 70S AND WILL GO CLOSE TO THIS 
VALUE. NAM GUIDANCE IS NEAR 90 AND FEEL THIS MAY BE TO HIGH. FOR 
TEMPERATURES...CONTINUAL SOUTHERLY FLOW HAS BROUGHT IN A VERY MOIST 
TROPICAL AIRMASS. WILL BE GOING ABOVE GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS SLIGHTLY 
HERE DUE TO AIRMASS AND CLOUD COVER HELPING TO KEEP TEMPERATURES UP.

THURSDAY...GFS INDICATES LARGE AREA OF PRECIP DEVELOPING AREAWIDE 
DURING THE DAYLIGHT HOURS. WITH A DEEP LAYER OF AVAILABLE MOISTURE 
AND GOOD LIFT IN THE COLUMN SEE NO REASON WHY LIKELY POPS WILL NOT 
WORK. MAV GUIDANCE IS GOING AS HIGH AS 86 PERCENT AT TYS AND WHILE 
THIS IS NOT TOTALLY UNREALISTIC...LOW AND MID LEVEL FLOW IS BECOMING 
MORE SOUTHEASTERLY BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND THIS WILL ADD QUITE A 
DEGREE OF DOWNSLOPE FLOW TO AREAS IN THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN 
VALLEYS. WILL THEREFORE GO WITH 70 POPS SOUTH AND 60 CENTRAL AND 
NORTH TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS. EXPERIENCE WITH THIS SYSTEM HAS 
SHOWN...ESPECIALLY YESTERDAY...THAT DOWNSLOPE FLOW REALLY DRIES OUT 
MOST AREAS IN NORTHEAST TN...SO DEPARTING FROM GUIDANCE POPS SEEMS 
REASONABLE. TEMPERATURES WILL BE NEAR THE LOWER MAV GUIDANCE BECAUSE 
DESPITE WHETHER IT RAINS OR NOT...CLOUD COVER SHOULD BE PRESENT 
HELPING TO LOWER MAX TEMPS AND THE COOLER MAV LOOKS GOOD.

THURSDAY NIGHT...PRECIPITATION BEGINS TO DWINDLE INTO THE OVERNIGHT 
HOURS AND WILL REDUCE POPS BACK TO 50 PERCENT AS ENOUGH MOISTURE 
REMAINS THAT ONLY A LITTLE LIFT IS NECESSARY TO KICK OFF SOME 
SHOWERS. AGAIN...WARMER THAN GUIDANCE ON TEMPERATURES DUE TO THE 
MOIST AIRMASS UNDER CLOUDY SKIES.

FRIDAY...LESS MOISTURE AND MORE DOWNSLOPE FLOW WILL TRANSLATE INTO 
50 POPS SOUTH AND 40 POPS NORTH AS INDICATED BY THE 12Z GFS. TEMPS 
WILL CONTINUE TO TREND SLIGHTLY BELOW MAV GUIDANCE FOR MAX TEMPS.

FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY...LOW TO MID LEVEL MOISTURE WITH WEAK 
TO MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIR CONTINUES OVER THE REGION THROUGH THE 
PERIOD.  ADDITIONALLY...THOUGH THERE IS SOME DISCREPANCY IN 
TIMING...MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW A COUPLE OF WAVES ROTATING THROUGH 
THE AREA.  AS A RESULT...WILL CONTINUE WITH GENERALLY SCATTERED 
SHOWERS.THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE END OF THE PERIOD. 

&&
.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             71  82  72  84 /  50  70  70  70 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  71  81  69  83 /  50  70  60  60

.DISCUSSION...REMNANTS OF DENNIS CENTERED OVER SRN TIP OF ILLINOIS 
THIS MORNING...WITH MRX FORECAST AREA UNDER A DRY SLOT AND ENJOYING 
SOME OF THE WARMEST TEMPS ACROSS TN PARTS.  APPEARS THAT THE BEST

AND FROM THE SRN APPALACHIANS EASTWARD.  THIS WAS REFLECTED IN 
MODIFYING OHX AND RNK 12Z SOUNDINGS...WITH MUCH MORE INSTABILITY 
INDICATED WHEN WARMING RNK SOUNDING INTO THE MID 80S (POSITIVE CAPE 
GREATER THAN 2000 J/KG AND LIFTED INDEX OF -7 DEGS).  MODIFIED OHX 
SOUNDING GENERATED POSITIVE CAPE LESS THAN 1000 J/KG AND LIFTED 
INDEX OF AROUND -2 DEGREES C.  FREEZING AND WET BULB ZERO HEIGHTS 
ARE VERY HIGH...WITH THE SEVERE THREAT LOOING TO BE ISOLATED 
DOWNBURSTS.

RADARS SHOW ALMOST NO ECHOES ACROSS EAST TN/SW VA/SW NC CURRENTLY...
ALTHO CONVECTION DEVELOPING TO OUR SOUTH IS TRACKING NE TOWARD SE TN 
AND SW NC.  I DOUBT IF ALL AREAS WILL SEE 50 PERCENT COVERAGE...AND 
MAY TRY TO RELFECT A BIT OF A POP GRADIENT IN THE UPDATE THIS 
MORNING.  OTHERWISE...FEEL THAT TERRAIN WILL PLAY A MAJOR ROLE IN 
WHERE STORMS DEVELOP ACROSS OUR FORECAST AREA...WITH EXPECTED 
MOVEMENT TO BE NORTHEAST AWAY FROM THE MTN ZONES.  DOUBTFUL IF MAX 
TEMPS OR SKY COVER PART OF FORECAST WILL NEED MUCH ADJUSTMENT.

WILL UPDATE GRIDS...WEB PRODUCTS AND ZFPMRX BY OR BEFORE 11 AM EDT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT TUE JUL 12 2005

.SHORT TERM...WATER VAPOR LOOP SHOWS A DRY SLOT OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA
THIS MORNING AS A SHORT-WAVE MOVES EAST OF THE REGION. A FAIRLY WARM MORNING
ACROSS THE AREA WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE GREAT TENNESSEE VALLEY GENERALLY IN
THE MID 70S. REMAINS OF DENNIS WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE SLOWLY NORTH THEN EAST
ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY TODAY AND WEDNESDAY. SEVERAL SHORT-WAVES WILL ROTATE
AROUND THE UPPER LOW...BUT TIMING OF WAVES DIFFICULT.

IN ANY EVENT...FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW AIRMASS WILL BE QUITE UNSTABLE...
ESPECIALLY OVER THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...THIS AFTERNOON
AND EVENING WITH CAPES NEAR 2500 J/KG AND LIFTED INDICES OF -5 TO -7.
CONVECTIVE TEMPERATURE IN THE LOWER AND MID 80S. MAIN LIFT WILL BE LOCAL
TERRAIN...BUT PLENTY OF MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY FOR SCATTERED MAINLY
AFTERNOON AND EVENING CONVECTION.

SOME ISOLATED SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE GIVEN EXPECTED INSTABILITY WITH
MAIN CONCERN BEING DAMAGING DOWNBURSTS WINDS AND TORRENTIAL RAINS. WILL ISSUE
A SPS CONCERNING POTENTIAL OF ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS.

.LONG TERM...WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY...REMAINS OF DENNIS WILL MEANDER ACROSS
THE OHIO VALLEY THROUGH THE REST OF THE WEEK BEFORE DISSIPATING. NAM AND GFS
SHOWS PLENTY OF DEEP TROPICAL MOISTURE OVER THE REGION WITH MODERATELY UNSTABLE
AIRMASS GENERALLY EACH DAY. BOTH MODELS ALSO HINT OF A SEVERAL WAVES ROTATING
ACROSS THE REGION WEDNESDAY...SO HAVE KEPT POPS IN THE 60-70 PERCENT RANGE.
ALSO...WILL KEEP SCATTERED MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION GOING THROUGH THE REST
OF THE FORECAST AS PWS REMAIN HIGH.  DAYTIME HEATING WILL WORK WITH LOCAL
TERRAIN AND LIFT OVER OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES TO PRODUCE SCATTERED STORMS EACH
DAY...GENERALLY AFTERNOON AND EVENING VARIETY.

.DISCUSSION...NO CHANGES. CENTER OF CIRCULATION OF DENNIS REMNANTS
CONTINUE TO DRIFT NORTHWARD THROUGH THE LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEY.
HOWEVER...BROAD CIRCULATION AROUND THIS SYSTEM ENCOMPASSES NEARLY THE
ENTIRE EASTERN HALF OF THE CONUS. CONVECTIVE BANDS ALSO CONTINUE TO
ROTATE AROUND THE EASTERN HEMISPHERE OF THE CIRCULATION. RADAR SHOWS
SEVERAL OF THESE BANDS IN THE VICINITY OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.
MUCH OF THIS ACTIVITY HAS BEEN SUPPRESSED IN EAST TENNESSEE TODAY BY
STRONG DOWNSLOPE FLOW. STILL REMAINS TO BE SEEN HOW LONG THIS TREND
WILL CONTINUE AS FLOW SLOWLY WEAKENS AND SHIFTS TO A MORE
SOUTHWESTERLY COMPONENT. AM RELUCTANT TO LOWER POPS BECAUSE OF THIS
UNCERTAINTY AND WILL NOT MAKE ANY CHANGES TO ONGOING FORECAST AT
THIS TIME.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 111912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EDT MON JUL 11 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...REMAINS OF HURRICANE DENNIS 
WILL BE THE FORECAST FOCUS FOR THE NEAR TERM.  CIRCULATION WILL 
CONTINUE TO WEAKEN OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS...HOWEVER DEEP MOISTURE 
FIELD IN PLACE AND DAYTIME HEATING FEEL THAT THUNDERSTORMS STILL A 
SIGNIFICANT THREAT ON TUESDAY.  GOOD BREAKS THIS AFTERNOON...AND 
FEEL THERE WILL BE EVEN MORE TUESDAY WITH A LITTLE LESS MOISTURE 
INFLUX...SO WENT WITH WARMER GFS GUIDANCE NUMBERS.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...DENNIS...OR WHAT 
REMAINS OF DENNIS...CONTINUES TO BE THE MAIN FOCUS FOR OUR WEATHER 
OVER THE EXTENDED TERM. AS STEERING CURRENTS REMAIN WEAK...DENNIS IS 
PROGGED TO MOVE LITTLE OVER THE NEXT FEW DAYS. MODELS IN GENERAL 
GOOD AGREEMENT THAT DENNIS WILL MOVE TO THE EAST EVER SO SLOWLY 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND INTO WEDNESDAY. IT IS THIS MOVEMENT BACK TO THE 
EAST THAT WILL CAUSE AN INCREASE IN THE CHANCE OF -SHRA AND -TSRA 
FOR OUR REGION ON WEDNESDAY. WILL ONLY SLOWLY INCREASE POPS 
OVERNIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY. GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS ARE TIGHTLY CLUSTERED 
ON TEMPERATURES THROUGH MOST OF THE PERIOD SO WILL ONLY DEVIATE 
SLIGHTLY WHERE APPROPRIATE.

WEDNESDAY...WITH DENNIS MOVING BACK TO THE EAST DURING THE 
DAY...CONDITIONS LOOK GOOD FOR NUMEROUS SHOWERS TO DEVELOP. 
X-SECTIONS ON THE GFS FROM NEAR HSV TO RNK SHOW A VERY DEEP LAYER OF 
MOISTURE EXTENDING FROM NEAR THE SURFACE WELL UP TO 400MB. 
ACCOMPANYING THIS LAYER IN THE MODEL FIELDS IS AN INCREASE IN 
VORTICITY AT 500MB COUPLED WITH RATHER STRONG OMEGA LIFT AROUND 18Z 
WEDNESDAY. WITH MAV GUIDANCE POPS IN THE 70 PERCENT RANGE SEE NO 
REASON TO DIFFER FROM MOS HERE. DESPITE THE FACT IT IS DAY 3 OF THE 
FORECAST AND ONLY NEGATIVE ISSUE MAY BE TERRAIN INFLUENCES...FEEL IT 
IS PRUDENT TO GO WITH HIGH LIKELY POPS NORTH AND LOW LIKELY SOUTH AS 
MOISTURE AND LIFT LOOKS FARLEY DECENT. WILL ACCORDINGLY GO WITH 
CLOUDY SKIES AND LOWER THAN MAV GUIDANCE TEMPS HERE IN THE DAY AND 
WARMER THAN GUIDANCE TEMPS AT NIGHT DUE TO WARM AND MUGGY TROPICAL 
AIRMASS.

SPC HAS MY AREA IN A SEE TEXT HEADLINE FOR SOME ISOLATED SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS. AT THIS POINT...THINK ANY SEVERE STORMS WOULD BE 
ISOLATED DUE TO PERSISTENT CLOUD COVER EXPECTED WEDNESDAY. AND THUS 
AGREE WITH SPC TAKE ON THE SITUATION.

THURSDAY...DENNIS IS LIKE A PARTY GUEST THAT JUST WONT LEAVE. GFS 
STILL HAS THE REMNANT CIRCULATION OVER NORTH CENTRAL KENTUCKY 
MOVING SLOWLY TO THE EAST. MOISTURE STILL AVAILABLE THOUGH NOT AS 
DEEP AS WEDNESDAY. WILL GO WITH 50 POPS HERE MOST LOCATIONS AS 
EXPECT MID LEVEL FLOW TO BE OUT OF THE SOUTHWEST AND THIS WILL CAUSE 
UPSLOPE IN A FEW LOCATIONS TO ENHANCE PRECIPITATION. BEST CHANCES 
AFTERNOON AND DIMINISHING AFTER SUNSET. TEMPS WILL BE CLOSER TO 
GUIDANCE VALUES HERE AS A FEW BREAKS IN THE CLOUD DECK STILL SEEMS 
POSSIBLE.

FRIDAY...WITH GFS LOSING THE REMNANT CIRCULATION...WEATHER PATTERN 
STARTS TO TURN INTO A TYPICAL SUMMERTIME REGIME...BUT WITH ADDED 
TROPICAL MOISTURE THAT NORMALLY IS NOT PRESENT. STRONG SOUTHWESTERLY 
FLOW COMBINED WITH A COUPLE OF VORT MAXES MOVING IN DURING THE 
DAYLIGHT HOURS LOOK TO CAUSE AN INCREASE IN THE PRECIPITATION. AGAIN 
WILL BE GOING WITH 50 PERCENT. TEMPS AGAIN FOLLOW CLOSELY WITH MEX 
GUIDANCE.

SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...WITH MOISTURE AMOUNTS STARTING TO DWINDLE WILL 
SEE MAINLY AFTERNOON CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY ENHANCED BY TERRAIN 
FEATURES AND HAVE STARTED TO DECREASE POPS ACCORDINGLY. WILL SEE 
TEMPERATURES AGAIN START TO WARM UP BUT DUE TO PERSISTENT SOUTHERLY 
FLOW...HEAT INDICES LOOK TO BE QUITE HIGH THANKS TO DEWPOINTS IN 
THE LOW 70S IN MANY PLACES. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             72  88  72  84 /  60  60  50  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  71  87  71  83 /  50  60  50  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       71  86  71  82 /  50  60  50  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              68  86  68  82 /  40  60  40  70

FXUS64 KMRX 101844
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT SUN JUL 10 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...OUTER BANDS OF MAINLY SHOWERS 
ROTATING AROUND DENNIS ARE LIFTING NORTHWESTWARD ACROSS THE 
SOUTHEASTERN U.S.  AS DENNIS APPROACHES THE GULF COAST THEN MOVES 
INLAND OVER AL AND MS TONIGHT...THESE BANDS WILL SLOWLY ROTATE INTO 
EAST TENNESSEE.  WILL RANGE POPS FROM AROUND 60 PERCENT SOUTHERN 
ZONES TO 20 IN THE NORTH.  WITH EXPECTED TRACK OF DENNIS OVER 
NORTHERN MS AND INTO WEST TN ON MONDAY...MAIN PRECIP BANDS WILL STAY 
TO OUR SOUTH AND WEST.  DOWNSLOPING WILL ALSO AID IN LIMITING 
PRECIP.  HOWEVER...SOME BANDS OF SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS ARE EXPECTED 
TO MOVE THROUGH THE AREA.  BEST POTENTIAL OF RAINFALL REMAINS OVER 
SOUTHERN ZONES.  DEEP MOISTURE...STRONG ROTATIONAL SHEAR AND A 
WEAKLY UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL AID THUNDERSTORMS IN THE SOUTHERN 
ZONES.  WITH THIS...THERE WILL BE A SLIGHT POTENTIAL FOR LIMITED 
STRONG TO SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS.  WINDS WILL INCREASE ACROSS THE AREA 
AS WELL AS THE REMNANTS OF DENNIS APPROACHES THE REGION.  STRONGEST 
WINDS...AS USUAL...WILL BE FOUND OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  HOWEVER... 
DUE TO THE EXPECTED TRACK OF DENNIS BEING SUFFICIENTLY TO OUR 
WEST...BELIEVE WINDS WILL REMAIN BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA.  WITH A 
THICKENING CLOUD COVER AND EXPECTED RAINFALL...MONDAY AFTERNOON 
TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN SUNDAY/S.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...LATEST MODEL RUNS INDICATE 
THAT DENNIS WILL CONTINUE MOVING NORTHWEST INTO WEST TN BY MONDAY 
MORNING...WITH THE BULK OF ITS ASSOCIATED WINDS AND MOISTURE 
REMAINING WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA. EXTENDED MODELS NOW INDICATE 
THAT THE REMNANTS OF DENNIS WILL STALL-OUT OVER THE WESTERN OHIO 
RIVER VALLEY...AND REMAIN WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA THROUGHOUT THE 
WEEK. THIS WOULD KEEP THE BULK OF DENNIS HEAVY RAINFALL OVER THE 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY THROUGHOUT THE WEEK. HOWEVER...WITH INCREASED 
MOISTURE LEVELS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...SCATTERED CONVECTION 
SHOULD DEVELOP ALMOST EVERY DAY THIS WEEK...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE MOUNTAINS AND PLATEAU WHERE UPSLOPE FLOW 
WILL AID IN CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT. WITH THE NEARLY TROPICAL AIRMASS 
IN PLACE...EXPECT THE POSSIBILITY OF LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL AND 
ISOLATED DAMAGING DOWNBURST WINDS WITH SOME OF THESE STORMS. HAVE 
ALREADY UPDATED THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK TO MENTION THIS 
POSSIBILITY. TEMPS SHOULD REMAIN FAIRLY STEADY THROUGH THE FORECAST 
PERIOD...WITH A WARM AND HUMID AIRMASS REMAINING IN PLACE THROUGH 
SUNDAY. 
&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT SAT JUL 9 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...AFTERNOON CONVECTION DEVELOPING 
SOUTH OF THE MRX CWA.  AIR MASS OVER THE AREA IS FAIRLY STABLE AND 
DRY.  WILL KEEP LOW POPS OVER FAR SOUTHERN ZONES BUT EXPECT MAIN 
EVENING CONVECTION TO STAY SOUTH OF THE TENNESSEE BORDER.  HIGH 
PRESSURE WILL REMAIN IN PLACE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION 
TONIGHT WITH PATCHY FOG POSSIBLE ONCE AGAIN TOWARD MORNING.  ON 
SUNDAY...MOISTURE WILL BEGIN TO INCREASE AS DENNIS MAKES LANDFALL.  
MAY SEE LIMITED INFLUENCE FROM DENNISS APPROACH ON SUNDAY AND WILL 
SLOWLY INCREASE CLOUDS AND POPS FROM SOUTH TO NORTH DURING THE 
AFTERNOON.  HOWEVER...MAIN PRECIP BANDS FROM DENNIS SHOULD BE 
CONFINED TO OUR SOUTH THROUGH THE DAY AND WILL KEEP POPS NEAR 40 
PERCENT SOUTH...AND LESS THE 20 PERCENT NORTH.  GUIDANCE 
TEMPERATURES LOOK GOOD AND WILL NOT STRAY FAR. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS INDICATE THAT 
DENNIS WILL CONTINUE MOVING NORTHWEST INTO WEST TN BY MONDAY 
MORNING...WITH THE BULK OF ITS ASSOCIATED MOISTURE REMAINING WEST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...SOME OF THIS MOISTURE WILL HELP TO 
TRIGGER SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...ESPECIALLY 
ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS WHERE UPSLOPE FLOW WILL AID IN CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT. LATEST EXTENDED MODEL RUNS INDICATE THAT THE REMNANTS 
OF DENNIS WILL STALL-OUT OVER THE WESTERN OHIO RIVER VALLEY BY 
TUESDAY NIGHT...AS IT BEGINS TO INTERACT WITH A COLD FRONT OVER THE 
UPPER MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY. THE GFS MODEL INDICATES THAT THIS 
COLD FRONT WILL THEN SLOWLY PUSH THE REMNANTS OF DENNIS SOUTHWARD 
INTO THE TENNESSEE RIVER VALLEY BY WEDNESDAY...WHERE IT COULD BECOME 
QUASI-STATIONARY AND LINGER THROUGH FRIDAY. THIS WOULD RESULT IN A 
VERY WET SCENARIO WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF HEAVY RAINS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA FOR THE LATTER HALF OF THE WEEK. TEMPS SHOULD REMAIN 
FAIRLY STEADY THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD...WITH A WARM AND HUMID 
AIRMASS REMAINING IN PLACE THROUGH SATURDAY. 
&&

.DISCUSSION...NO CHANGES WARRANTED AS FORECAST APPEARS ON TRACK IN
BENIGN WEATHER REGIME. TEMPS LO0K REASONABLE BASED ON LATEST GFS AND
LAMP GUIDANCE.

FXUS64 KMRX 081900
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT FRI JUL 8 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...ISOLATED CONVECTION 
DEVELOPING TO OUR SOUTHWEST THIS EVENING.  THE MAIN FOCUS OF THIS 
SHOULD GENERALLY STAY SOUTH OF THE TENNESSEE BORDER WITH ONLY 
LIMITED CELLS REACHING INTO THE MRX CWA.  AS SUCH...WILL PUT LOW 
POPS OVER FAR SOUTHERN ZONES.  OTHERWISE...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
CONTINUES TO BUILD INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TONIGHT.  
CONTINUED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND LIGHT WIND SHOULD ALLOW AREAS OF 
FOG TO FORM BY MORNING.  THE AIR MASS REMAINS RELATIVELY STABLE 
THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON...SIGNIFICANTLY LIMITING CHANCE OF 
CONVECTION.  WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES NEAR GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...

MODEL DISCUSSION...ALL EYES FOCUSED ON MAJOR HURRICANE DENNIS AND 
ITS EVENTUAL MOVEMENT TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA. LATEST GUIDANCE FROM 
GLOBAL MODELS INDICATE A LANDFALL BETWEEN BILOXI MS AND PANAMA CITY 
FL SOMETIME SUNDAY MORNING. THE MODELS THEN DIVERGE SLIGHTLY BUT ARE 
IN REASONABLE AGREEMENT OF TAKING THE STORM OVER MIDDLE OR WESTERN 
TENNESSEE...FAR ENOUGH AWAY FROM MY FORECAST AREA TO CAUSE MAJOR 
PROBLEMS...BUT JUST CLOSE ENOUGH TO BE AFFECTED BY SOME OUTER 
BANDING. MORNING INITIALIZATION ON GFS AND ECMWF LOOK PRETTY GOOD AT 
500MB WITH ONLY THE UKMET OVER PLAYING THE WEAK TROF OVER LOUISIANA. 
CURRENT THINKING IS THAT TROF OVER LOUISIANA WILL HELP INDUCE A 
TRACK MORE TO THE EAST INITIALLY THEN ALL MODELS BUILD BACK IN A 
RIDGE OVER THE EASTERN US THAT SHOULD STEER DENNIS BACK TOWARD THE 
WEST. HOW FAR WEST IS UNCERTAIN AT THIS TIME. NEVERTHELESS...FEEL 
CONFIDENT ENOUGH THAT OUR REGION WILL SEE SOME PRECIPITATION. GFS 
ALREADY INDICATING THAT A GOOD PORTION OF OUR FORECAST AREA WILL SEE 
DOWNSLOPING FLOW INTO THE CENTRAL VALLEY AND WILL LESSEN 
PRECIPITATION AMOUNTS. 00Z RUN OF FSUS MM5 MESOSCALE MODEL 
INDICATES THAT TOTAL AMOUNTS MAY ONLY APPROACH ONE QUARTER TO ONE 
HALF INCH IN THE CENTRAL VALLEY BY TUESDAY WITH TOTALS ONE INCH OR 
MORE ACROSS SE TN. AT THIS POINT...TO EARLY TO COMMIT TO ANY 
PRECIPITATION TOTALS.

SUNDAY...WITH DENNIS PROGGED TO BE MOVING ASHORE ACROSS THE GULF 
COAST...QUESTION IS HOW MUCH CLOUD COVER WILL STREAM OVERHEAD DURING 
THE DAY. THIS MAY BE ONE OF THE RARE INSTANCES WHERE CHATTANOOGA IS 
ACTUALLY COOLER FOR MAX TEMPS THAN TRI CITIES. WILL CONSTRUCT GRIDS 
THIS WAY WITH NEAR 90 NORTH AND UPPER 80S SOUTH AS CLOUD COVER WILL 
ARRIVE OVER SOUTHERN SECTIONS FIRST. WILL ALSO PLACE LIKELY POPS IN 
SW NC AND EVENTUALLY SE TN AS OUTER BANDS OF DENNIS SHOULD AFFECT 
THE REGION. 

SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY...AS DENNIS MOVES ACROSS ALABAMA TOWARD 
MIDDLE TENNESSEE..WILL CONTINUE TO INCREASE POPS AS GFS INDICATES 
VORT LOBE MOVING THROUGH MY CWA BETWEEN 06Z AND 12Z AND WILL RAISE 
POPS TO 70 PERCENT CHA TO 40 PERCENT TRI. MAIN CONCERN HERE IS THAT 
DOWNSLOPING WILL LIMIT PRECIPITATION FROM TYS UP TO VJI AND HAVE 
BACKED OFF POPS THERE. MY CURRENT POP DISTRIBUTION IS BELOW MEX 
GUIDANCE BECAUSE DUE TO SOME REMAINING UNCERTAINTY FROM 
DENNIS...FEEL IT IS NOT PRACTICAL TO GO TO CATEGORICAL POPS SOUTHERN 
SECTIONS JUST YET. HAVE FOLLOWED HPC QPF GUIDANCE CLOSELY WITH ONLY 
MINOR TWEAKS TO BRING OUT TERRAIN INFLUENCES. WILL HAVE LOWER THAN 
GUIDANCE TEMPS HERE AS CLOUD COVER WILL BE ESPECIALLY THICK ACROSS 
SE TN.

TUESDAY...WITH DENNIS NOW FORECASTED TO MOVE INTO WESTERN KENTUCKY 
WILL START TO TAPER POPS DOWN BELOW THE LIKELY CATEGORY DURING THE 
DAY AS MOST OF THE MOISTURE THEN STARTS TO MOVE AWAY FROM THE 
REGION. HOWEVER...GFS INDICATES THAT DENNIS MAY STALL ACROSS THE 
OHIO VALLEY AND THEN TRACK BACK ACROSS MY FORECAST AREA INTO 
WEDNESDAY. WILL TREND TOWARD MEX TEMPS HERE AS CLOUD COVER STARTS TO 
THIN OUT.

WEDNESDAY...IF DENNIS STALLS AND THEN MOVES BACK ACROSS MY FORECAST 
AREA ON WEDNESDAY...WOULD SEE ANOTHER SHOT AT RAIN ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. WITH THIS BEING THIS FAR OUT IN THE EXTENDED...WILL 
NOT GO COMPLETELY WITH THE GFS FORECAST AND ONLY ADVERTISE 30 POPS 
AT THIS POINT. THIS IS ACTUALLY ONLY 10 PERCENT BELOW MEX GUIDANCE. 
FOR TEMPS...WILL FOLLOW MEX GUIDANCE CLOSELY.

THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...THE REMAINS OF DENNIS PREDICTED BY THE GFS TO 
BE MOVING OUT ONLY LEAVING BEHIND SOME RESIDUAL MOISTURE WHICH COULD 
TOUCH OFF SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. FELT THAT 30 TO 
40 POPS WERE BEST SOLUTION HERE. 

IT IS CURRENTLY JUST A LITTLE TO EARLY TO PREDICT WITH ANY CERTAINTY 
A RAINFALL FORECAST FOR EXACT AMOUNTS FOR OUR REGION...BUT HEAVIER 
AMOUNTS SHOULD BE SEEN ACROSS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST 
NORTH CAROLINA MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY WITH LESSER AMOUNTS FROM 
KNOXVILLE ON NORTHEAST TOWARD THE TRI CITIES IN ASSOCIATION WITH 
DENNIS.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 071908
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EDT THU JUL 7 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...REMNANTS OF TS CINDY CONTINUES 
TO LIFT NORTHWARD AND ASSOCIATED RAIN SHIELD WILL EXIT THE MRX CWA 
THIS EVENING.  THE FLOOD WATCH HAS BEEN CANCELED FOR MUCH OF THE 
AREA...BUT WILL REMAIN IN EFFECT THROUGH 00Z FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA 
COUNTIES.  OTHERWISE...ISOLATED TO SCATTERED SHOWERS MAY DEVELOP 
THIS EVENING WITH ABUNDANT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE...MARGINAL INSTABILITY 
AND WEAK LIFT FROM THE EXITING SYSTEM.  DRYING TREND DEVELOPS FOR 
LATE TONIGHT WITH DECREASING CLOUDS AND WINDS.  AS A RESULT...PATCHY 
FOG IS EXPECTED...MAINLY ALONG AREA LAKES AND RIVERS.  ON 
FRIDAY...THE DRYING TREND CONTINUES WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
MOVING IN.  GUIDANCE NUMBER LOOK ON TRACK AND WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES 
CLOSE TO THESE.

.LONG TERM...(TOMORROW NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)

MODEL DISCUSSION...STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY IN THE MODEL FORECAST FOR 
THE LONG TERM PERIOD. 06Z GFS STARTED TO MOVE BACK TO THE EAST WITH 
ITS TRACK OF DENNIS ALONG WITH ALL OF THE OTHER DYNAMICAL MODELS. 
NHC IN TCDAT4 PRODUCT MENTIONED THAT A GULFSTREAM IV JET MISSION 
LAST NIGHT DISCOVERED THE SUB TROPICAL RIDGING OVER THE ATLANTIC TO 
BE SOMEWHAT WEAKER THAN PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS HAD INDICATED. 
THEREFORE...TODAYS MODEL CYCLES HAVE RESPONDED WITH SHIFTING THE 
TRACK FURTHER TO THE EAST. THE 12Z GFS RESPONDED BY CALLING FOR A 
LANDFALL ACROSS THE BIG BEND REGION OF FLORIDA ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON 
AND MOVING THE SYSTEM JUST TO THE WEST OF CHATTANOOGA BY DAYBREAK 
MONDAY. OTHER GLOBAL MODELS...THE ECMWF AND UKMET HAVE NOT SHIFTED 
THE STORM AS FAR TO THE EAST AT THIS TIME. WHICH SUCH UNCERTAINTY 
FEEL IT IS PRUDENT NOT TO TOTALLY FOLLOW THE GFS SOLUTION AND GO 
WITH LIKELY POPS FOR THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY...BUT 
WILL NEVERTHELESS RATCHET UP POPS SOME.

FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY...WITH CINDYS REMAINS WELL TO THE NORTH 
OF THE FORECAST AREA AT THE START OF THE LONG TERM PERIOD...THE 
REGION WILL RECEIVE A BRIEF RESPITE FROM THE RAINY WEATHER ON 
SATURDAY BEFORE FOCUS SHIFTS BACK TO THE SOUTH AND THE APPROACH OF 
HURRICANE DENNIS. AS TYPICAL WITH LARGE TROPICAL 
SYSTEMS...SUBSIDENCE OUT IN FRONT OF THE STORM WILL PROVIDE SOME 
NICE WEATHER FOR SATURDAY AFTERNOON WITH PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES AND 
WARM CONDITIONS. IN FACT...TEMPS MAY BE 20 DEGREES WARMER IN SOME 
PLACES THAN WHAT OCCURRED ON THURSDAY AFTERNOON. WILL ONLY PLACE A 
SLIGHT CHANCE POP SOUTHERN SECTIONS AND INTO THE MOUNTAINS TO 
ACCOUNT FOR AFTERNOON CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY...THOUGH SHOULD BE 
EXTREMELY ISOLATED UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING. 

SUNDAY...AS THE OUTER FRINGES OF DENNIS START TO MOVE TOWARD THE 
REGION...WILL INCREASE POPS SOUTH TO NORTH DURING THE DAY. WILL GO 
FOR 40 TO 50 PERCENT FOR CHATTANOOGA BY SUNDAY EVENING AND 20S AND 
30S ACROSS CENTRAL AND NORTHERN SECTIONS. WILL GO SLIGHTLY BELOW MAV 
GUIDANCE HERE TO ACCOUNT FOR CLOUD COVER. 

MONDAY...IF THE 12Z GFS VERIFIES WE COULD BE LOOKING AT ANOTHER 
TROPICAL SYSTEM TRAVERSING OUR REGION. WITH UNCERTAINTY STILL IN THE 
FORECAST AS EXPLAINED ABOVE...WILL ONLY GO UP TO 50 PERCENT CHANCE 
OF RAIN FOR MONDAY SOUTH AND 40 ELSEWHERE. WILL KNOCK MAX TEMPS DOWN 
A FEW DEGREES BELOW GUIDANCE TO ACCOUNT FOR THE CLOUDY SKIES. 
AGAIN...IT SHOULD BE POINTED OUT THAT MUCH UNCERTAINTY EXISTS IN THE 
PATH OF DENNIS. THE EVENTUAL PATH OF THE STORM WILL DICTATE WHAT 
WEATHER WE EXPERIENCE EARLY IN THE WORK WEEK.

TUESDAY...DENNIS WILL MOVE INTO THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY DURING THE 
MORNING HOURS. 06Z GFS INDICATED A LARGE MID LEVEL RIDGE SETTING UP  
OVER THE REGION AND CAUSING DENNIS TO STALL. 12Z GFS NOT SO BULLISH 
ON THIS FEATURE THOUGH IT DOES BRING THE REMAINS OF DENNIS BACK 
THROUGH MY FORECAST AREA TUESDAY AFTERNOON WITH ANOTHER SHOT AT 
RAINFALL THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT. WILL ONLY GO WITH 30 POPS HERE AS 
MODELS ARE HIGHLY DIVERGENT BY THIS TIME IN THE FORECAST PERIOD.

WEDNESDAY...WITH UNCERTAINTY IN DENNIS AND OTHER FEATURES IN THE 
FORECAST...WILL RUN SLIGHT CHANCE AND CHANCE POPS AT THIS END OF THE 
FORECAST PERIOD. WILL TREND TEMPS TOWARD MEX GUIDANCE.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             66  89  67  92 /  20  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  63  86  65  89 /  20  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       63  86  65  89 /  20  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              61  83  62  86 /  50  10  10  10

MID AFTERNOON.  HOWEVER...SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL 
REMAIN OVER THE AREA INTO THE EVENING.  ALL LOOKS GOOD IN THE 
CURRENT FORECAST...WILL UPDATE LATE MORNING TO REMOVE MORNING

FXUS64 KMRX 070748
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
347 AM EDT THU JUL 7 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...REMNANTS OF TS CINDY MAKING MORE 
RAPID PROGRESSION THAN PREVIOUSLY ANTICIPATED. GFS APPEARS TO HAVE 
BEST HANDLE ON CURRENT CINDY PRECIP TRENDS AND IS THUS THE PREFERRED 
SOLUTION. LATEST GFS RUN HAS MOVED TRACK SLIGHTLY WESTWARD AND NOW 
DEPICTS BULLSEYE OF HEAVIEST PRECIP JUST WEST OF THE APPALACHIANS 
AND DIRECTLY OVER OUR FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE FIRST PERIOD. RAPID 
PROGRESSION SHOULD LIMIT QPF SOMEWHAT THOUGH. DOWNSLOPE FLOW 
COMPONENT ALSO A LIMITING FACTOR. NEVERTHELESS...EXPANDING FFA TO 
INCLUDE ENTIRE CWA SEEMS PRUDENT GIVEN THE RATHER WET CONDITIONS 
THAT HAVE PREVAILED OVER THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS IN MANY AREAS. 
NEEDLESS TO SAY...CATEGORICAL POPS IN ORDER...ESPECIALLY FROM THE 
CENTRAL VALLEY NORTHEAST. ALSO GENERALLY FAVORED COOLER GFS GUIDANCE 
TEMPS.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAIN CHANGES MADE EARLY 
WERE TO TAPER OFF RAINS A LITTLE QUICKER ON FRIDAY MORNING DUE TO 
FASTER EXPECTED TRACK OF CINDY REMNANTS.  ALSO...SOME CHANGES MADE 
TO MANY AREAS FOR LATE FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY TO REMOVE THE SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS (ALL BUT ERN MTNS AND EXTREME SE TN AREAS).  I PREFERRED 
THE GFS MODELS DEPICTION OF A BRIEF BREAK IN THE RAINY WEATHER 
BEHIND THE EXIT OF CINDY...AND ALSO HURRICANE DENNIS DOES NOT COME 
INTO OUR WEATHER PICTURE TOO SOON.  MODELS DO SHOW A LOT OF VARIANCE 
AS THEY BEGIN TO PICK UP DENNIS OVER THE GULF OF MEXICO THIS WEEKEND.
HOWEVER...EXPECT MORE DRY AREAS THAN IN A LONG TIME FOR SAT AND SUN. 
KEPT IN SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THOSE DAYS WHERE WE NEEDED TO MESH WITH 
FFC AND GSP GRIDS.  THE OFFICIAL NHC TRACK OF DENNIS AND OPERATIONAL 
GFS HINTED AT DENNIS AFFECTING OUR WEATHER BY EARLY NEXT WEEK...AND
POPS WERE RAISED JUST SLIGHTLY FOR WEDS WITH PRELIMINARY GRIDS FOR 
THURSDAY (NEW DAY 7) INTRODUCED AS A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS.

OTHERWISE...ZFP...WEB PRODUCTS AND FLASH FLOOD WATCH ALREADY ISSUED.
THANKS TO NEIGHBORING OFFICES FOR COORDINATION VIA CHAT THIS MORNING.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 061912
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
312 PM EDT WED JUL 6 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TOMORROW NIGHT) ALL EYES FOCUSED ON 
THE MOVEMENT OF TROPICAL DEPRESSION CINDY AS IT MOVES NORTHEAST 
TOWARD OUR REGION. CURRENT SATELLITE IMAGE HAS THE CENTER OF 
CIRCULATION ABOUT 50 MILES TO THE SOUTHWEST OF MONTGOMERY ALABAMA. 
KBMX RADAR SHOWS A LARGE PRECIPITATION SHIELD MOVING NORTHEAST 
TOWARD MY FORECAST AREA. HAVE ALREADY ISSUED THE FLOOD WATCH AND 
WILL LET CURRENT CONFIGURATION CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING HOURS. 

OUT AHEAD OF CINDY...WHERE A LITTLE HEATING OCCURRED THIS MORNING 
COUPLED WITH RISING MOTION ATTRIBUTED TO A LEFTOVER 
BOUNDARY...NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED. SOME 
OF THIS ACTIVITY IS VERY HEAVY NECESSITATING A FEW FLASH FLOOD 
WARNINGS. THIS ACTIVITY IS CONTINUING TO MOVE OFF TO THE NORTHEAST 
INTO HAMBLEN AND GREENE COUNTIES AT THIS TIME. RAINFALL RATES ARE 
AROUND ONE INCH OR MORE PER HOUR. 

TONIGHT...SOMEWHAT OF A NO BRAINER. WILL GO WITH HIGHER POPS SOUTH 
AS MAIN RAIN SHIELD APPROACHES. GFS HAS 100 POPS IN CHATTANOOGA AND 
FIND IT HARD TO ARGUE WITH THIS FORECAST. WILL TAPER POPS DOWN TO 
NEAR 50 PERCENT NORTH AS MAIN ACTIVITY WILL NOT ARRIVE THERE UNTIL 
DAYBREAK.

TOMORROW...TRACK OF CINDY WILL BE ON THE EASTERN SIDE OF THE 
APPALACHIANS AND THIS WILL HELP DECREASE RAINFALL AMOUNTS ACROSS 
PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA DUE TO DOWNSLOPING. HOWEVER...WILL 
STILL LIKELY SEE SOME PRECIPITATION AREAWIDE. THEREFORE...WILL HAVE 
HIGHEST POPS (100 PERCENT) ON THE MOUNTAIN TOPS TAPERING DOWN TO 60 
PERCENT IN THE FAR NORTHWEST CORNER OF THE CWA. THIS FOLLOWS CLOSELY 
WITH MAV GUIDANCE. 

TOMORROW NIGHT...AS THE SYSTEM EXITS TO THE NORTH...WILL KEEP LIKELY 
POPS NORTHEAST UNTIL AFTER MIDNIGHT WHEN IT WILL TAPER DOWN TO 
CHANCE POPS. 

FLOODING CONCERNS WILL BE GREATEST IN THE MOUNTAINOUS AREAS WHERE 
RAINFALL IS PREDICTED TO BE HEAVIEST. RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF 2 TO 4 
INCHES SHOULD BE COMMON ACROSS THE RIDGETOPS ON THE TN-NC BORDER AND 
IN CHEROKEE AND CLAY COUNTIES. LESSER AMOUNTS DOWN INTO THE VALLEY 
WITH AMOUNTS NEARING 1 INCH IN THE TRI CITIES AND KNOXVILLE METRO 
AREAS. LESSER AMOUNTS BACK TOWARD THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU OF HALF 
INCH WILL BE POSSIBLE. CHATTANOOGA METRO SHOULD BE BETWEEN ONE AND 
ONE HALF INCH FROM THIS SYSTEM.

WIND THREATS...WILL ADD GUSTY WORDING TO THE ZONES IN THE 
MOUNTAINS AS COULD SEE SOME GUSTS UP TO 25 TO 30 MPH. BUT AT THIS 
TIME CONFIDENCE IS NOT HIGH ENOUGH NOR WOULD IT MEET LOCAL CRITERIA 
FOR WIND ADVISORY.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY) AFTER THE REMAINS OF T.S. 
CINDY EXIT THE REGION...WE WILL HAVE A FEW DAYS RESPITE FROM THE 
RAINS BEFORE SUMMERTIME AFTERNOON CONVECTION RETURNS.  THE BIG 
UNKNOWN IN THE FORECAST IS THE TRACK OF T.S. (MOST LIKELY SOON 
HURRICANE) DENNIS.  THERE IS A WIDE SPREAD OF LANDFALL POSSIBILITIES 
FROM WESTERN LOUISIANA TO TAMPA SO ITS IMPACT ON THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS IS STILL WAY UP IN THE AIR.  IF IT WERE TO IMPACT THE 
REGION IT WOULD BE IN THE EARLY TO MID PART OF NEXT WEEK.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 061451
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1051 AM EDT WED JUL 6 2005

.DISCUSSION...NEWLY DOWNGRADED TROPICAL DEPRESSION CINDY LOCATED 40 
MILES NORTH OF MOBILE ALABAMA. SUSTAINED WINDS OF ONLY 35 MPH 
PERSISTING VERY NEAR THE CENTER. THIS WILL BE THE MAIN FOCUS FOR OUR 
WEATHER OVER THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS. THE MAIN THREATS FROM CINDY 
WILL BE VERY HEAVY RAIN. SOME BREEZY CONDITIONS COULD DEVELOP OVER 
THE MOUNTAINOUS TERRAIN ON THURSDAY INTO FRIDAY. 

CURRENT GUIDANCE FROM NHC MOVES THE CENTER OF WHAT WILL REMAIN OF 
CINDY OVER EXTREME SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA IN 24 HOURS THEN 
CONTINUING THE NORTHEAST MOVEMENT ACROSS WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA 
THROUGHOUT THE DAY ON THURSDAY AND MOVING THE REMAINS OUT OF OUR 
REGION AND INTO CENTRAL VIRGINIA ON FRIDAY MORNING. ALONG THIS 
PATH...THE HEAVIEST RAIN WILL LIKELY FALL ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
OF THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND OVER SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. 
HPC AND RFC QPF AMOUNTS OF AROUND 1 TO 3 INCHES WILL BE LIKELY 
ACROSS THESE AREAS WITH ISOLATED HIGHER AMOUNTS APPROACHING 4 
INCHES. WE HAVE JUST ISSUED A FLOOD WATCH FOR ALL OF THE EAST 
TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND CHEROKEE AND CLAY COUNTIES IN SOUTHWEST 
NORTH CAROLINA. ALSO INCLUDED IN THIS WATCH ARE 
HAMBLEN...GREENE...COCKE...AND JEFFERSON COUNTIES DUE TO POSSIBLE 
RIVER FLOODING OF THE NOLICHUCKY...PIGEON AND FRENCH BROAD RIVERS 
FROM HEAVY RAINS FALLING IN THEIR HEADWATERS IN THE MOUNTAINS. 
LOCATIONS OUTSIDE THE WATCH WILL LIKELY SEE UP TO ONE INCH OF 
RAIN...WITH ISOLATED AMOUNTS APPROACHING ONE AND A HALF INCHES. 

FOR THE UPDATE...WILL BE UPDATING THE ZONES TO INCLUDE THE FLOOD 
WATCH. ADDITIONALLY...BASED ON RADAR TRENDS...OUTER BANDING FROM 
CINDY MOVING NORTHEASTWARD OUT OF ALABAMA TOWARD MY TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA COUNTIES AND WILL GO AHEAD AND RAISE POPS 
TO LIKELY THERE. WILL CUT BACK MAX TEMPS A COUPLE OF DEGREES DUE TO 
CLOUDY SKIES OVER A PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA. WILL BE WATCHING 
LATEST MODEL RUNS AND GUIDANCE ON A POSSIBLE LAKE WIND OR WIND 
ADVISORY FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN...BUT WILL HOLD OFF FOR NOW.

ZONES AND OTHER PRODUCTS OUT SOON. FLOOD WATCH ALREADY SENT. 

HAVE A GREAT DAY

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
259 AM EDT WED JUL 6 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RATHER TYPICAL SUMMER WEATHER 
ANTICIPATED THROUGH MOST OF THE SHORT TERM AS REMNANTS OF TS CINDY 
APPROACH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY LATE IN THE SECOND PERIOD. 
HAVE GENERALLY UNDERCUT GUIDANCE POPS FOR TODAY AS THEY SEEM 
OVERDONE BASED ON PROJECTED OPERATIONAL MODEL PARAMETERS. MODEL TIME 
HEIGHTS DEPICT UNIMPRESSIVE MOISTURE PROFILE WITH GENERAL SUBSIDENCE 
PROJECTED IN THE LOWER LEVELS OF THE ATMOSPHERE. FORECAST SOUNDINGS 
DEPICT WEAK MID-LEVEL CAP THROUGH MUCH OF THE FIRST PERIOD. THUS 
ANTICIPATING ONLY SCATTERED...MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION AT THIS TIME 
IN SPITE OF ILL-DEFINED SURFACE BOUNDARY LURKING NEARBY. RESIDUAL 
MOISTURE FROM CINDY ENCROACHES SOUTHERN TIER OF FORECAST AREA BY 
LATE IN THE SECOND PERIOD PER GFS. HAVE INCREASED POPS IN THOSE 
AREAS LATE. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY STUCK WITH PRECEDING 
GRIDS/FORECAST.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MAIN WEATHER EVENT IS 
THE EXPECTED REMNANTS OF T.S. CINDY ON THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT.
PER DISCUSSIONS...GFS MODEL BEST OF THE BUNCH AND CLOSEST TO NHC 
TRACK...SO MANY OF THE GRIDS (SUCH AS WINDS AND QPF) WERE ADJUSTED 
IN LINE WITH 06/00Z GFS MODEL.  KEPT THE HIGHEST POPS AND HEAVIEST 
QPF ACROSS SWRN NC AND EXTREME ERN TN ZONES...INCREASING POPS TO 
LIKELY TO JUST INTO CATEGORICAL FOR THOSE AREAS BY THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON.  GENERALLY ALL SHORT RANGE MODELS MOVE REMNANTS OF CINDY 
QUICKER EAST OF THE REGION BY EARLY FRIDAY MORNING...THUS POPS WERE 
TRIMMED BACK FROM THE WEST A BIT FASTER THAN PREVIOUS GRIDS.  MAX 
TEMPS WERE ALSO LOWERED SOME ON THURSDAY DUE TO THE APPROACH OF 
CONVECTIVE PCPN AND CLOUDS.

SEEMS STILL EARLY TO ISSUE ANY SORT OF FLOOD WATCH FOR THURSDAY...
BUT WILL UPDATE OUR SPS FOLLOWING THE EARLY MORNING UPDATE ON CINDY.

OTHERWISE...JUST VERY MINOR CHANGES INTO FRIDAY...AND THE ADDITION 
OF SOME PRELIMINARY GRIDS FOR NEW DAY 7 (WEDNESDAY).  TROPICAL STORM 
DENNIS IS JUST TOO FAR AWAY AT THIS TIME...TO JUSTIFY MUCH DETAIL IN 
THE GRIDS FOR NOW.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 051914
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT TUE JUL 5 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...BIG WEATHER STORY IN THE 
SHORT TERM WILL BE THE ONGOING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MOVING 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA AT THE START OF THE PERIOD. ONE 
THUNDERSTORM OVER SCOTT COUNTY PROMPTED A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM 
WARNING...BUT HAS SINCE WEAKENED BELOW SEVERE LIMITS. SOME OF THESE 
STORMS HAVE ALSO CONTAINED VERY HEAVY RAINFALL RATES NEAR ONE AND 
ONE HALF INCH PER HOUR. WITH MOST OF THE ACTIVITY MOVING TOWARD THE 
EASTERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA AT THIS TIME...WILL START THE 
FORECAST PERIOD WITH 50 PERCENT POPS EVERYWHERE EXCEPT THE MOUNTAIN 
COUNTIES WHERE WILL CONTINUE LIKELY POPS NEAR 60 PERCENT. 

OVERNIGHT...EXPECT SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO DIMINISH THROUGH THE 
NIGHT AND JUST ONLY LIGHT SCATTERED SHOWERS SHOULD PERSIST 
OVERNIGHT. WITH RAIN SEEN AROUND THE TRI CITIES AIRPORT...WILL GO 
AHEAD AND ADD PATCHY FOG IN THE NE SECTIONS OF THE CWA...BUT WILL 
NOT INCLUDE ELSEWHERE AT THIS TIME. FOR TEMPERATURES WILL GO AHEAD 
AND TREND TOWARD THE WARMER GUIDANCE AS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND CLOUD 
COVER WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE OVERNIGHT HOURS.

TOMORROW...FOG SHOULD LIFT OUT NE SECTIONS YIELDING TO PARTLY CLOUDY 
SKIES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA EARLY AS ALL ATTENTION SHIFTS TO THE 
SOUTH TOWARD TROPICAL STORM CINDY. AFFECTS SHOULDNT BE FELT ACROSS 
MY CWA UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...WITH TROPICAL MOISTURE 
STREAMING NORTHWARD WILL RUN 40 POPS SOUTH AND 20 NORTH AS AFTERNOON 
HEATING MAY HELP TO KICK OFF SOME SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. WILL GO 
SLIGHTLY BELOW GUIDANCE FOR MAX TEMPS TOMORROW AS WELL.


.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...FRONT LINGERS ACROSS 
AREA INTO WEDNESDAY EVENING.  WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE POPS IN THE SOUTH 
FOR WEDNESDAY EVENING...THEN SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THE ENTIRE AREA FOR 
THE REST THE NIGHT.  REMNANTS FOR TROPICAL STORM CINDY PUSHING IN 
FROM SOUTH.  GFS IS A LOT QUICKER WITH PRECIP MOVING IN...BRINGING 
IT IN ON WEDNESDAY.  WENT WITH THE ETA WHICH IS CLOSER TO HPC/TPC 
TRACK ON HELD OFF BEST CHANCES UNTIL THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND THURSDAY 
NIGHT...WENT WITH 50 POPS IN THE MOUNTAINS AND DECREASING POPS 
WESTWARD.  HIGHEST QPF WILL BE IN THE MOUNTAINS EAST OF THE EXPECTED 
TRACK.  DRIER WEATHER PUSHES IN FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...SHOULD BE 
ONLY DIURNAL ACTIVITY BOTH DAYS.  WENT WITH A DRY SUNDAY WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE ACROSS THE AREA.  NEXT TROPICAL SYSTEM MOVING UP FROM THE 
GULF ON MONDAY.  KEPT ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ON TUESDAY SINCE 
BETTER CHANCE SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER TUESDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1003 AM EDT TUE JUL 5 2005

.DISCUSSION...GENERALLY PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES ACROSS THE CWA 
THIS MORNING. A MODERATE TO OCCASIONALLY HEAVY AREA OF SHOWERS MOVED 
FROM KNOXVILLE NORTHEASTWARD TOWARD TRI CITIES THIS MORNING AND HAS 
SINCE LEFT THE FORECAST AREA. ALL FOCUS NOW TURNS BACK TO THE WEST 
WHERE 12Z SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWED AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT 
STRETCHING FROM DETROIT MI SOUTHWEST TO NEAR DYERSBURG TN. AHEAD OF 
THIS FRONT A BROKEN LINE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS HAS DEVELOPED 
ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND NORTHERN ALABAMA. THIS LINE IS MOVING TO 
THE EAST AROUND 20 MPH. 

WITH ONLY THE SOUTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA SEEING SIGNIFICANT 
BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS...FEEL BEST ORGANIZED CONVECTION WILL TAKE 
PLACE THERE AND HAVE RAISED POPS TO 70 PERCENT. HAVE DECIDED TO KEEP 
POPS AT 70 PERCENT ELSEWHERE AS APPROACHING SHOWERS ARE NOT 
WEAKENING TO MUCH. WILL NOT TAKE TO MUCH HEATING IN THIS MOIST 
AIRMASS TO TOUCH OFF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS. MORNING SOUNDING 
FROM OHX CAME IN WITH 1500 J/KG OF CAPE AND AN LI OF -5. MSAS 
ANALYSIS HAS AN AREA OF -3 TO -4 LIS ACROSS MY SOUTHERN VALLEY AT 
THIS TIME. ONLY ISOLATED PULSE TYPE SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS ARE 
EXPECTED TODAY...IF ANY AT ALL...AND MAINLY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
THIRD OF THE CWA. CURRENT HWO HIGHLIGHTS THIS POSSIBILITY WELL.

FOR THE UPDATE THIS MORNING WILL REMOVE MORNING WORDING FROM ZONES. 
WILL ALSO LOWER MAX TEMPS A CATEGORY AS CLOUD COVER AND APPROACHING 
SHOWERS WILL HAMPER THE WARM UP. WILL HAVE THE ZONES OUT SHORTLY.

HAVE A GREAT DAY

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 050728
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EDT TUE JUL 5 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES GENERALLY 
AGREE THAT WEAK UPPER TROUGH/SURFACE COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE 
FORECAST AREA DURING THE FIRST PERIOD. THIS FEATURE WILL GENERATE 
SCATTERED AND POSSIBLY EVEN ORGANIZED CONVECTION...ESPECIALLY DURING 
MAXIMUM SURFACE HEATING TIME FRAME. THUS HAVE INCREASED POPS TO 
LIKELY CATEGORY FOR MOST LOCATIONS. ANTICIPATE ANY ORGANIZED 
CONVECTION TO MOVE EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS BY THE SECOND 
PERIOD...BUT CANT RULE OUT LINGERING SCATTERED ACTIVITY AND 
CONTINUED CHANCE POPS. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED THE BLEND OF 
GUIDANCE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...TWO MAIN FEATURES WILL BE 
THE COLD FRONT JUST COMING INTO THE REGION TODAY...AND THEN THE 
TROPICAL SYSTEM (DEPRESSION #3) WHICH IS PROGGED TO ENTER THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AROUND THURSDAY.  REMNANTS OF THIS TROPICAL 
SYSTEM MAY INTERACT WITH THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND AFFECT OUR REGION
...BUT THE PROBLEM IS TIMING AND THE TRACK OF THE DEPRESSION AT THIS 
POINT.  

FOR THE COLD FRONT...MODELS HAD TRIED TO PUSH A COLD FRONT THROUGH 
THIS PAST WEEKEND...AND SUGGESTED DRYING WHICH NEVER QUITE HAPPENED.
THIS COULD INDEED HAPPEN AGAIN WITH THE FRONT COMING INTO THE REGION 
TODAY.  HOWEVER...I DID ADJUST POPS DOWN SLIGHTLY FOR NRN AREAS FOR 
WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY...TO BETTER MESH WITH NEIGHBORS GRIDS AND 
LATEST MOS POPS.  KEPT CHANCE POPS GOING FOR SRN MOST AREAS...SINCE 
FRONT MAY STALL AND ALSO THE TROPICAL SYSTEM WILL AFFECT SRN AREAS 
INITIALLY.  WILL LET LATER SHIFTS CONSIDER MAKING ANY MORE 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES FOR LATE FRIDAY INTO THE WEEKEND...ONCE THE 
TRACK AND TIMING OF THE DEPRESSION BECOMES MORE CERTAIN.

OTHERWISE...ADDED SOME PRELIMINARY GRIDS FOR THE NEW DAY SEVEN 
(TUESDAY) AND MADE VERY MINOR MAX/MIN TEMP ADJUSTMENTS.  

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
347 AM EDT MON JUL 4 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...THE WEAK UPPER TROUGH FROM 24 
HOURS AGO IS GONE...WITH SHORTWAVE RIDGE NOW MOVING INTO PLACE.  THE 
WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS NOW ALMOST NON-EXISTANT.  DEWPOINT TEMPS 
ARE SLIGHTLY LOWER ACROSS SWRN VA AND NE TN WHERE LOW TO MID 60S 
WERE NOTED...AND GENERALLY UPPER 60S TO AROUND 70 DEGREES ELSEWHERE.

THIS ALL WOULD APPEAR TO NOT LEAVE ANY WELL DEFINED FOCUS FOR 
CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT LATER TODAY...OTHER THAN HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS 
SUCH AS SUGGESTED BY NAM/ETA AND NGM MODELS.  GFS MODEL LOOKS TO 
BROADBRUSH THE CONVECTIVE PCPN TOO MUCH.  CURRENT RADAR PICS SHOW 
LINGERING CONVECTION MAINLY CONFINED TO WRN NC.  PREVIOUS FORECAST 
AND GRIDS PAINTED LIKELY POPS THIS AFTERNOON FOR MTN ZONES...AND  
GENERALLY 30 PERCENT ELSEWHERE...WHICH LOOKS VERY REASONABLE TO ME.
POPS DIMINISHING TONIGHT TO 20 TO 30 PERCENT RANGE LOOKS FINE AS 
WELL.  SUPPOSE THAT AN ISOLATED STORM OR TWO MIGHT REACH MARGINAL 
SEVERE LEVELS...BUT OVERALL LOOKS TO BE ONE OF THE LESS STORMY 
FOURTHS OF JULY.

MADE VERY MINOR MAX TEMP ADJUSTMENTS BASED ON YESTERDAYS HIGHS... 
AND ALSO ADJUSTED MINS MORE IN LINE WITH PERSISTENCE OVER PAST FEW 
NIGHTS.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...ANOTHER COLD FRONT MOVES 
SOUTHEAST INTO THE OHIO VALLEY TUESDAY WITH A LARGE AREA OF PRE 
FRONTAL CONVECTION AHEAD OF IT. MODELS DISAGREE ON THE AFFECT FOR 
THE EASTERN TN VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE GFS KEEPS THE 
BULK OF THE CONVECTION TO THE SOUTH IN MS/AL/GA DURING THE DAY 
TUESDAY AND THEN DEVELOPS AN MCS OVER THE AR/TN BORDER AREA TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND SHIFTS THE LEFTOVERS INTO MIDDLE AND EAST TENNESSEE BY 
LATE WEDNESDAY. THE GFS DOES NOT BRING THE COLD FRONT THROUGH UNTIL 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THE NAM BRINGS A LARGE AREA OF RAIN AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT ACROSS TN TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT AND HAS THE FRONT THROUGH 
WITH DRIER AIR OVER THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY WITH CONVECTION 
MOSTLY SOUTH. PREFER THE SLOWER GFS BUT WITHOUT THE HEAVIER QPF 
AMOUNTS WEDNESDAY. FROM THURSDAY ON THE GFS DRIES FORECAST AREA 
OUT WITH NOT MUCH CHANCE OF RAIN THROUGH SATURDAY. THE DGEX IS MORE 
REALISTIC WITH RAIN EACH DAY OF THE EXTENDED. TD NUMBER 3 MAY HAVE 
AN AFFECT ON THE FORECAST AREA AT THE END OF THE WEEK AS THE 
HURRICANE CENTER EXPECTS IT TO MOVE NE INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY 
FRIDAY. THIS SYSTEM WOULD INCREASE RAIN CHANCES AND AMOUNTS IF IT 
FOLLOWS THE CURRENT FORECAST TRACK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
740 PM EDT SUN JUL 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...EVENING THUNDERSTORMS HAVE MOVED OUT OF THE MRX AREA 
...THOUGH CONVECTION CONTINUES ACROSS MANY SURROUNDING CWAS.  THERE 
REMAINS A POTENTIAL FOR FEW ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS TO MOVE INTO THE 
AREA DURING THE OVERNIGHT HOURS.  OTHERWISE...THE REMNANTS OF A 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY REMAINS TO OUR SOUTH TONIGHT WITH A WEAK SHORT WAVE 
MOVING ALONG THE BOUNDARY HAVING EXITED THE AREA.  WITH CONTINUED 
DEW POINTS AROUND 70 AND RECENT SCATTERED RAINFALL PROVIDING LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE ALONG WITH SOME CLEARING AND LIGHT WINDS...ANTICIPATE 
AREAS OF FOG TO FORM BY MORNING...MAINLY ALONG NORMALLY FAVORED 
AREAS.  ALL HANDLED WELL IN THE CURRENT FORECAST...WILL UPDATE LATER 
THIS EVENING TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING.

DIURNAL ACTIVITY...WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY THROUGH 
SUNDAY...DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS.

400 AM EDT SUN JUL 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...SKIES ARE PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY TONIGHT WITH SOME 
PATCHY FOG AFTER MUCH OF THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA 
RECEIVED SOME RAINFALL FROM SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS. A WEAK COLD 
FRONT LIES JUST TO THE SOUTH OF THE TENNESSEE VALLEY BUT THE AIRMASS 
TO THE NORTH OVER TN IS NOT MUCH DIFFERENT. SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR LIES 
TO THE NORTH OF A LINE FROM LONESOME PINE VIRGINIA TO NASHVILLE TO 
JACKSON LINE. A WEAK UPPER LEVEL TROUGH LIES OVER THE MS VALLEY. 
BOTH THE NAM AND GFS BRING A VORTICITY LOBE TOWARD MIDDLE TN AND THE 
PLATEAU TODAY CREATING CONVECTION DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EARLY 
EVENING. THE RUC AND THE GFS BRING A VORTICITY MAXIMUM ACROSS THE 
MOUNTAINS FROM SW TO NE. THIS OCCURS AS THE TROUGH MOVES EAST. 
SOUNDINGS SHOW THE AIRMASS TODAY WILL BECOME MODERATELY UNSTABLE 
WITH ALL THE MOISTURE LEFT OVER FROM THE LAST FEW DAYS CONVECTION 
BUT WINDS ALOFT WILL BE WEAK. A FEW STRONG THUNDERSTORMS MAY DEVELOP 
BUT THREAT FOR ORGANIZED SEVERE STORMS IS LIMITED. HEAVY RAINFALL 
WILL BE MORE OF A THREAT WITH PRECIPITABLE WATER VALUES AROUND 1.5 
TO ALMOST TWO INCHES.

MONDAY RIDGING STRENGTHENS FROM THE SOUTH BUT AT THE SAME TIME 
SHORTWAVES MOVE FROM SW TO NE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. 
LOWERED RAIN CHANCES SLIGHTLY MONDAY AND RAISED HIGH TEMPERATURES. 
THEN TUESDAY ANOTHER COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AND TRIES 
TO MOVE SOUTH INTO TN. RIDGE AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT OVER THE 
SOUTHEAST WILL KEEP FRONT NEAR OR OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE 
REST OF THE WEEK. TYPICAL AFTERNOON AND EVENING SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE ENHANCED SOMEWHAT WITH THE FRONT. THE PATTERN 
SHOWS NO CHANGES THROUGH THE EXTENDED FORECAST.

330 AM EDT SAT JUL 2 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AREA RADARS RATHER VOID OF 
CONVECTIVE PCPN AT THIS TIME.  HOWEVER...SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
DEWPOINTS REMAIN MOSTLY IN THE MID TO UPPER 60S THIS MORNING...AND

DAYTIME HEATING SHOULD SEND TEMPS INTO THE 80S TO LOWER 90S...AND 
CREATE SOME INSTABILITY THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING.  02/00Z 
MOS POPS ARE GENERALLY IN THE CHANCE RANGE ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA...SO DECIDED TO INCREASE POPS IN THE MTN ZONES AND EXTREME SRN 
COUNTIES INTO CHANCE CATEGORY.  ADDED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ELSEWHERE. 

FOR TONIGHT...ASSUMING THAT COLD FRONT SHOULD EVENTUALLY PUSH SOUTH 
AND EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA...BUT FELT IT WAS WISE TO KEEP LOW 
POPS FOR MTNS AND SE TN INTO THE EVENING HOURS.  THIS ALSO MESHED 
BETTER WITH FFC AND GSP GRIDS.

OTHERWISE...JUST MINOR TEMP ADJUSTMENTS MADE BASED ON HIGHS 
YESTERDAY AND LATEST MOS MAX AND MIN TEMPS.  AREAS OF FOG MAY BE 
LOCALLY DENSE THIS MORNING...BUT SO FAR NOTHING WIDESPREAD.  WILL 
COVER THE FOG IN SHORT TERM FORECAST IF OBS SITES FALL MORE BY 
DAYBREAK.  SEE SOME POTENTIAL FOR AT LEAST PATCHY OR AREAS OF FOG 
AGAIN TONIGHT...BUT WILL WAIT AND SEE BEFORE ADDING AT THIS POINT. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...EVEN WITH COLD FRONT THROUGH 
THE FORECAST AREA THE AIRMASS CHANGE WILL BE MINIMAL AND WEAK 
IMPULSES MOVING FROM WEST TO EAST ACROSS THE TN VALLEY SHOULD STILL 
DEVELOP WIDELY SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR MOST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...THE 
NORTHERN TENNESSEE VALLEY AND THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. THE 
BERMUDA HIGH BUILDS NORTH MONDAY BUT WILL KEEP AFTERNOON AND EARLY 
EVENING SHOWERS IN THE FORECAST FOR PERSISTENCE. ANOTHER COLD FRONT 
APPROACHING THE OHIO VALLEY MONDAY NIGHT MOVES INTO THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY TUESDAY AND SLOWLY SAGS INTO THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY AND 
THURSDAY. THIS KEEPS A CHANCE OF CONVECTION OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE REST OF THE WEEK.

JET TO PASS ACROSS OHIO VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON DOES PROVIDE SOME 
UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE ACROSS AT LEAST SW VA AND NRN PARTS OF EAST 
TN.  OTHERWISE...THE AMOUNT OF SHEAR AND STORM RELATIVE HELICITY 
LOOKS QUITE WEAK ACROSS OUR REGION...SO EXPECT MAIN THREAT TO BE 
DAMAGING DOWNBURST WINDS.  WOULD NOT RULE OUT A FEW REPORTS OF 
HAIL...BUT THE FREEZING AND WET BULB ZERO HEIGHTS LOOK A BIT TOO 
HIGH.  DID NOT MENTION SEVERE STORMS IN ZFP OR GRIDS...

OF ANY CONVECTION THIS EVENING...LEADING INTO A DRY WEEKEND BEHIND 
THE PASSING COLD FRONT.  

OTHERWISE...VERY MINOR TEMP/DEWPT AND MAX/MIN TEMP ADJUSTMENTS FROM 
PREVIOUS GRIDS.  DID INCLUDE SOME PATCHY AREAS OF FOG FOR EARLY THIS 
MORNING...MAINLY IN AREAS WHERE MEASURABLE PCPN OCCURRED OVER THE 
PAST 24 HOURS.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL PUSH 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY MORNING AS HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
THE SOUTHERN GREAT LAKES AND OHIO VALLEY MOVES SOME DRIER AIR INTO 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. KEPT SKIES MOSTLY SUNNY TO PARTLY CLOUDY 
WITH NO RAIN. COLD FRONT BECOMES STATIONARY TO THE SOUTH SUNDAY AND  
AS RIDGING BUILDS OVER THE SOUTHEAST AGAIN MOISTURE MOVES AROUND THE 
RIDGE AND INTO THE TN VALLEY. THE BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD BE OVER THE MOUNTAINS FIRST ON SUNDAY WITH 
TYPICAL LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS IN THE 
MOUNTAINS AND THEN CONTINUES AREAWIDE THE 4TH OF JULY AND THROUGHOUT 
THE WEEK. TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN HOT IN THE UPPER 80S TO LOWER 
90S.

COOLER AIR ENTERING CWA FROM NORTHWEST WILL BE RUNNING INTO UNSTABLE 
AIR MASS FRIDAY EVENING...BUT WILL BE STARTING TO STABLIZE AFTER 
SUNSET.  ANOTHER PROBLEM WILL BE THE AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY LEFT IN 
AREA FROM AFTERNOON CONVECTION AND POSSIBLE WAVE OF PRECIP FROM 
EARLIER IN THE DAY.  WILL DIMINISH POPS OVERNIGHT...WITH BEST 
CHANCES IN THE NORTHEAST AND MOUNTAINS. 

SATURDAY THROUGH ABOUT NOON MONDAY...COOLER/STABLE AIR MASS SAGS 
INTO REGION...WILL ONLY HAVE SLGT POPS IN APP MOUNTAINS SUNDAY 
AFTN.  

BY MONDAY AFTERNOON...WILL START UP SUMMER SHOWER/TSTM REGIME 
AGAIN.  LOOKS LIKE UPPER LEVEL RIDGING EARLY IN THE WEEK WILL GIVE 
WAY TO TROUGH LATE IN THE WEEK.  WILL SLOWLY RAISE POPS DURING WEEK 
IN ANTICIPATION OF UPPER TROUGH.  

GENERALLY GOING ON COOL SIDE OF GUIDANCE...THINK OVER THE WEEKEND 
COOLER AIR MASS WILL FILL IN BETTER THAN MODELS SHOWING...THINK THEY 
ARE HAVING TROUBLE RESOLVING TERRAIN EFFECTS ON AIR MASS...THINK 
WHOLE WEST SIDE OF APPS WILL GET FULL COOL AIR MASS OVER 
WEEKEND...MODELS HINT THAT AIR MASS WONT MODIFY THAT MUCH...BUT 
THINK IT WILL.  ALSO...MODEL HIGH TEMPS LOOK A LITTLE TOO WARM FOR 
SCENARIO NEXT WEEK.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             72  91  68  87 /  40  50  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  70  90  67  86 /  30  50  30  10

NATURE.  OTHERWISE...IT WILL BE ANOTHER WARM DAY AND WILL KEEP 
TEMPERATURE NEAR GUIDANCE. 

LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...NOT MANY CHANGES TO FORECAST. 
WEAK TROF LIFTS OUT, FLATTENED RIDGE TRIES TO MAKE A COMEBACK. 
HENCE, WEAKENED FRONT MAKES ATTEMPT AT CROSSING AREA LATE 
FRIDAY/EARLY SATURDAY. ONLY EFFECT WILL BE TO KEEP TEMPS AROUND 
NORMAL AS OPPOSED TO REALLY, REALLY HOT, AND SLIGHTLY DRIER AIR, BUT 
STILL MUGGY. TYPICAL SUMMERTIME LOOK RETURNS STARTING INDEPENDENCE 
DAY WITH LOW POPS, GENERALLY SUNNY BUT HAZY, AND HOT. FOR THE LEAST 
WINDIEST REGION OF THE COUNTRY, THIS MEANS RATHER OPPRESSIVE.

THIS MORNING HAVE HINDERED PROGRESS ON THE FORECAST. STILL, IT WAS 
NOT A FORECAST DESTINED FOR MANY CHANGES. THE UPPER LOW WHICH HAS 
LAIN OVER THE TOP OF THE MASSIVE SOUTHERN-HALF-OF-NORTH-AMERICA 
RIDGE IS BEGINNING TO PULL OUT. AS IT DOES IT WILL BEGIN TO AFFECT 
THE NORTHEAST PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST MORE, RATHER THAN THE 
SOUTHEAST HALF IT HAS FOR THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS. CHANCES FOR PRECIP 
IVE TWEAKED UP IN THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST TO ACCOUNT, BUT LEFT 
THE REST LARGELY UNCHANGED AS SOLAR POWER WILL BECOME THE DRIVING 
FORCE BY FRIDAY OR SO. THIS WILL ENTAIL A RETURN TO TYPICALLY 20S 
SUMMERTIME POPS. HUMIDITY WILL STILL BE A FACTOR IN THE DISCOMFORT 
ARENA.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE

VERY HUMID AND TROPICAL AIRMASS ACROSS THE REGION. SO FAR... 
CONVECTION TODAY HAS NOT BEEN AS EXTENSIVE AS YESTERDAY WHICH IS 
LIKELY DUE TO THE STABILIZING EFFECT OF THE EARLIER CONVECTION THIS 
MORNING. THINK THAT ADDITIONAL CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP LATER THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH THE UNSTABLE AND VERY MOIST AIRMASS IN 
PLACE. IN FACT...THINK CONVECTION COULD DEVELOP AT ANY TIME FOR THE 
NEXT SEVERAL DAYS...ALTHOUGH THE BEST COVERAGE WILL CONTINUE TO BE 
DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. MODELS INDICATE THAT A COLD 
FRONT WILL SLOWLY APPROACH THE AREA BY THURSDAY NIGHT...ALTHOUGH 
THINK THAT THE MODELS MAY BE TOO AGGRESSIVE WITH ITS SOUTHWARD 
PROGRESSION SINCE THE UPPER DYNAMICS ARE NOT PROGGED TO BE TOO 
STRONG. WILL PLAN TO TREND THE FORECAST TOWARDS PERSISTENCE...SINCE 
THE LOCAL AIRMASS WILL REMAIN VIRTUALLY UNCHANGED UNTIL THE FRONTAL 
PASSAGE ON FRIDAY. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT 
ABOUT BRINGING COLD FRONT SLOWLY THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY TO 
JUST SOUTH OF TN SATURDAY BEFORE IT WASHES OUT. INSTABILITY 
INCREASES AND WITH THE FRONT IN THE VICINITY SOME STRONG STORMS ARE 
POSSIBLE FRIDAY. SPC HAS PART OF THE FORECAST AREA IN A SLIGHT RISK  
FOR DAY 3. DRIER AIR IS EXPECTED TO FILTER IN AS HIGH PRESSURE OVER 
THE OHIO VALLEY SINKS SOUTH. LOWS SHOULD DROP A FEW DEGREES INTO THE 
UPPER 50S NORTH AND LOWER TO MID 60S SOUTH FOR A COUPLE OF NIGHTS. 
AS MOISTURE LIFTS NORTH SUNDAY WILL INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE RAIN 
AGAIN. BERMUDA HIGH STRENGTHENS AT THE BEGINNING OF THE WEEK OFF THE 
EAST COAST WHICH BRINGS MORE HUMID AIR AND CONTINUED CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS TO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.

ANTI-CYCLONIC ROTATION AROUND SOUTHERN EDGE OF RIDGE APPARENT OVER

MOISTURE NORTHWARD. THIS HELP TO KEEP POPS UP THROUGH TONIGHT. HAVE 
INCREASED POPS TODAY IN TN/NC MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER TERRAIN OF 
EXTREME SW VA TO ACCOUNT. INSTABILITY IS MODERATE (0 TO -2) SO THERE 
MIGHT BE SOME BORDERLINE SEVERE THUNDRSTORMS AGAIN TODAY. AS LONG AS 
THE WEAKNESS IN THE RIDGE (AS DEFINED BY THE LOW) HANGS AROUND, 
THIS WILL BE THE STORY.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH THE FOURTH OF JULY)...CUT OFF LOW 
BEGINS TO FILL AND LIFT OUT IN RESPONSE TO UPPER MIDWEST TROFFING 
AROUND THURSDAY MORNING. RIDGE ASSERTS ITSELF AGAIN, BUT NOT AS 
DRAMATICALLY INITIALLY AS BEFORE. HOWEVER, BY INDEPENDENCE DAY, ITS 
BACK WITH A VENGEANCE. IF THE GFS COMES TO PASS, A 593 DM UPPER 
RIDGE BUILDS AGAIN, UNDERLAIN BY A STRONG SURFACE BERMUDA HIGH, FOR 
HOT, MUGGY, AND HAZY WEATHER.

CAUGHT IN THE MIDDLE BETWEEN RIDGING TO THE WEST AND BERMUDA RIDGE 
TO THE EAST OVER THE SOUTHEAST ATLANTIC. WEAK TROUGH WILL STILL BE 
OVER THE OHIO AND TN VALLEYS WITH TROPICAL AIR COMING UP FROM THE 
SOUTH. GFS MODEL SHIFTS THE PRECIPITATION A LITTLE FARTHER EAST 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AS RIDGING FROM THE WEST MOVES TOWARDS THE TN 
VALLEY. THE NAM STRENGTHENS THE RIDGE BUT KEEPS THE TROUGH CENTERED 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH THURSDAY. 
WITH MODELS TENDING TO GO TOO HIGH IN THE SUMMER PREFER THE LOWER 
GFS. FOLLOWED A DIURNAL TREND WITH HIGHER POPS AFTERNOON AND EARLY 
EVENING WITH SLIGHT CHANCE THE REST OF THE DAY. TEMPERATURES SHOULD 
FOLLOW THE SAME TREND WITH HIGHS MID TO UPPER 80S AND LOWS UPPER 60S 
TO LOWER 70S. 

A STORM SYSTEM ACROSS THE PACIFIC NORTHWEST TODAY IS EXPECTED TO 
MOVE EAST ALONG THE CANADIAN BORDER AND THEN DIVE SOUTHEAST AROUND 
RIDGING OVER THE SOUTHWEST. A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE TOWARDS THE 
FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY AND MAY MAKE IT SOUTH OF THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY BY SATURDAY. THIS COULD GIVE THE AREA A MORE 
SOAKING RAIN AND A CHANCE FOR STRONG STORMS WITH THE FRONT FRIDAY OR 
FRIDAY NIGHT. DROPPED LOWS A FEW DEGREES OVER THE WEEKEND AND POPS 
DOWN TO 20 PERCENT AS DRIER AIR WORKS IN FROM THE NORTH BEHIND THE 
FRONT.

TO REFLECT THESE EXPECTATIONS.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT MON JUN 27 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK SFC PRES GRADIENT ACROSS 
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING. PATCHES OF LEFTOVER CONVECTION SLIDING 
UPSLOPE IN WRN NC MTNS TO DOWNSLOPE FROM THERE INTO TN VALLEY, 
WEAKENING AS IT COMES THIS WAY. SOME HINTS OF SLIGHTLY HIGHER CAPE 
IN CENTRAL VALLEY, BUT ITS JUST A LITTLE WARMER DOWN HERE, IS ALL. 
THIS WILL ALLOW SOME OF THE LEFTOVERS TO ENTER THE VALLEY LOCATIONS 
AND SO HAVE INCREASED POPS OVER SOUTHERN PARTS OF NORTHEAST TN 
ACROSS THE CENTRAL VALLEY AND PARTS OF NORTHERN SOUTHEAST TN/SW NC 
TODAY. STILL MAINTAINED CHANCE CAT, THOUGH. REMNANTS OF 
SUBTROPICAL/TROPICAL/QUASITROPICAL LOW MOVING AROUND RIDGE HAVE 
CREATED A LITTLE OF A DIFFICULT ISOBAR PATTERN AND SO NO REAL 
DRIVING DYNAMICAL LOW LEVEL FORCE TO PUSH AIR PARCELS UPWARD. 
HEAVIER RAINS FALLING IN NC MOUNTAIN/SC UPLANDS WILL NOT LIKELY MAKE 
THIS FAR IN ORGANIZED FASHION. SOME MINOR LOCAL FLOODING, ESPECIALLY 
IN FLOOD PRONE SPOTS OR HEAVILY URBANIZED AREAS MIGHT OCCUR. FOR 
TEMPS, HAVE ADJUSTED HIS/LOWS TO JUST BELOW THE BLEND GUIDANCE TO 
ACCOUNT FOR SOME CLOUDS TODAY AND BELIEVE THE GUIDANCE FOR TONIGHT 
WAS TOO HIGH.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...ATLANTIC AND GULF OF MEXICO 
WILL BE READILY TAPPED FOR MOISTURE AS RIDGING BUILDS ONCE AGAIN 
OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC WITH HEIGHT GRADIENT BETWEEN THIS HIGH AND 
A TROUGH OF LOW PRESSURE IN POSITION ACROSS THE MISSISSIPPI AND OHIO 
VALLEYS EARLY IN THE PERIOD WHICH MIGRATES E ACROSS THE APPALACHIANS 
ON THURSDAY. USED CHC POPS WITH HIGHEST VARIETY IN THE MTNS AND ON 
THE PLATEAU TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY AS ATMOSPHERE PROGGED TO BE 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE WITH HIGH PWS AND LIFT VCNTY OF MID SOUTH 
TROUGH. GFS STILL BRINGS FRONTAL BOUNDARY SOUTH AND TRIES TO PRESS 
THIS FEATURE THROUGH THE FA FRI/SAT TIMEFRAME AND MAINTAINED CHC 
POPS INTO THE WEEKEND AS BOUNDARY STALLS IN THE VICINTY OF THE MRX 
FA.
