AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EDT SUN JUN 26 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...AFTER SCATTERED LIGHT 
SHOWERS MOVED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT AND EARLY THIS 
MORNING CLOUD COVER THINNED ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE AREA 
WHICH IS TYPICAL WITH A SOUTHEAST TO EASTERLY FLOW. DOWNSLOPING OFF 
THE MOUNTAINS HELPED CLEAR OUT THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. DOPPLER RADAR SHOWS ONE PATCH OF SHOWERS NEAR CHATTANOOGA AND 
SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS IN THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS OTHERWISE THE RADAR 
SCREEN IS CLEAR. WILL START OUT WITH CHANCE POPS FOR THE LATE 
AFTERNOON. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE STILL LIES OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH 
THE UPPER LEVEL NEAR MOB. THE GFS BRINGS TO MUCH QPF OVER THE 
MOUNTAINS AS IT ROTATES AROUND THE UPPER LOW WITH THE NAM MORE 
REALISTIC. WILL TAPER POPS BACK TO SLIGHT CHANCE BY EARLY EVENING 
TONIGHT WITH THE BEST CHANCE LATE AFTERNOON DURING PEAK HEATING 
TODAY. MONDAY THE CENTER OF THE UPPER LOW MOVES NORTH INTO WEST TN 
SO INSTABILITY WILL BE GREATER AND MORE LOW LEVEL SHEAR. SPC IN THE 
DAY 2 OUTLOOK MENTIONED POSSIBLE MULTICELL STORMS WITH HIGH WINDS 
AND HAIL. WILL NOT MENTION SEVERE BUT INCLUDE THUNDER FOR ALL DAY 
MONDAY. TEMPERATURES HAVE RISEN SLOWER WITH THE HIGHER MOISTURE 
CONTENT IN THE AIR AND MORE CLOUD COVER. EXPECT LOWS TONIGHT TO DROP 
TO THE UPPER 60S TO NEAR 70 AND HIGHS TO REACH THE MID 80S. HAZY 
SKIES WILL ALSO CONTINUE ESPECIALLY IN THE MORNING.             

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS ARE 
IN AGREEMENT IN KEEPING TROPICAL MOISTURE ACROSS THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH AT LEAST MID-WEEK.  A 
WEAKNESS IN THE RIDGE WILL REMAIN OVER THE REGION...BUT 
OVERALL...LITTLE IN THE WAY OF UPPER SUPPORT FOR CONVECTION. MAIN 
LIFT WILL BE TERRAIN AND LIFT OVER SURFACE BOUNDARIES...GENERALLY 
TYPICAL FOR THIS TIME OF THE YEAR.

I EXPECT GENERALLY DIURNAL AFTERNOON/EVENING CONVECTION. SOME OF 
THESE STORMS WILL PRODUCE HEAVY RAINS...FREQUENT LIGHTNING...AND 
ISOLATED SEVERE EACH DAY.  AN UPPER TROUGH MOVING EAST ACROSS 
SOUTHERN CANADA AND NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE COUNTRY WILL HELP TO 
PULL A COLD FRONT TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS LATE IN THE WEEK. LATEST GFS SHOWS THIS FRONT MOVING 
SOUTH OF THE FORECAST FOR FRIDAY THEN LIFTING BACK NORTH AS A WARM 
FRONT SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. CONFIDENCE OF SOUTHWARD MOVEMENT OF FRONT 
LOW...SO WILL MAINTAIN CHANCE POPS THROUGH THE PERIOD.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...UPPER LOW CENTERED SOUTH OF THE

THE NAM AND GFS MODELS LEAD TO BIG SPREAD IN GUIDANCE NUMBERS.  NAM 
TAKES THE BULK OF THE MOISTURE AND PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE 
REGION...WHILE THE GFS LIMITS THE MOISTURE OVER OUR 
REGION...THEREFORE LOWER POPS.  GENERALLY SPLIT THE DIFFERENCE 
BETWEEN THE TWO NUMBERS WITH SLIGHT LEANING TOWARDS THE HIGHER NAM 
VALUES.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...LOWER PRESSURE SFC AND ALOFT 
WILL CONTINUE TO ESTABLISH ITSELF ACROSS THE SOUTHEASTERN U.S. 
DRIFTING W INTO THE MS AND OH VLY BEFORE BEING PICKED UP BY THE 
WESTERLIES IN A SHEARING AND WEAKENING FASHION BY MIDWEEK. MOISTURE 
SOURCE INITIALLY WILL BE THE ATLANTIC AND THEN WILL SHIFT TO THE 
GULF OF MEXICO TUE/WED AND THERE WILL BE PLENTY OF VAPOR FOR THE 
DEVELOPMENT OF SHRA AND SOME TSRA MON THROUGH WED AS FA BECOMES 
POSITIONED ON THE RIGHT SIDE OF THE CIRCULATION IN BEST LIFT AND 
MOISTURE CONVERGENCE. USED HIGHER CHC POPS WITH EMPHASIS IN THE 
MAJOR TERRAIN AREAS THROUGH THIS PERIOD. MAINTAINED SLIGHTLY LOWER 
POPS THU THROUGH SAT AS REGION GETS BACK TO MORE TYPICAL SMALL/SLGT 
CHC FOR CONVECTION MAINLY IN THE TERRAIN AS HUMIDITY LEVELS DROP A 
BIT AND PRESSURES RISE.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...MOISTURE HAS INCREASED 
GRADUALLY OVER THE LAST 24 HOURS AS THE UPPER LEVEL LOW OFF THE 
SOUTHEAST COAST HAS MOVED SLOWLY NORTH. THE SURFACE LOW WAS 280 
MILES SOUTHEAST OF THE CAROLINAS ABOUT 100 MILES FARTHER NORTH THAN 
FRIDAY. SCATTERED SHOWERS HAVE MOVED NORTH INTO THE CENTRAL 
CAROLINAS AND CENTRAL GEORGIA BY MID AFTERNOON. CURRENT RADAR 
SIMILAR TO FRIDAY WITH ONLY A FEW WEAK SHOWERS SO FAR ON THE 
SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. TEMPERATURES ARE A DEGREE OR SO COOLER 
THAN YESTERDAY AT THIS TIME...MOSTLY IN THE MID 80S. DEWPOINTS HAVE 
RISEN A FEW DEGREES AS WELL. 

GFS IS MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH BRINGING MOISTURE NORTHWEST OVER THE 
MOUNTAINS SUNDAY WITH LIKELY POPS IN THE SOUTH. THE NAM/ETA IS A 
LITTLE MORE REASONABLE AND WILL FOLLOW CLOSER...FROM CHANCE SOUTH TO 
SLIGHT CHANCE NORTH. TEMPERATURES SUNDAY WILL BE A FEW DEGREES 
COOLER TOO DUE TO MORE CLOUD COVER...ESPECIALLY IN THE SOUTH 
ALTHOUGH THE THICKEST CLOUDS SHOULD STAY EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. 
HAZE AND FOG WILL ALSO AFFECT VISIBILITIES DUE TO LIGHT WINDS BUT 
NOT ENOUGH TO CAUSE SEVERE RESTRICTIONS.    

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...NOT MANY CHANGES TO 
STATUS QUO. FORECAST ISSUE THIS PERIOD IS CIRCULATION CENTER 
OFFSHORE CAROLINA WHICH IS HEADED SLOWLY THIS WAY. BELIEVE RIDGE 
WILL FLATTEN FROM THE BOTTOM AS THIS THING APPROACHES, BUT WILL 
REMAIN STRONG ENOUGH TO WARD OFF MOST OF ITS ENERGY TO THE WEST. 
THUS  HAVE INCREASED POPS IN EXTREME SOUTHEAST TN/EXTRM SW NC SUNDAY 
NIGHT INTO MONDAY, BUT REMAINED IN CHANCE CAT. KEPT POPS LARGELY 
UNCHANGED MID-LATE NEXT WEEK AND JUST ADJUSTED POPS IN BETWEEN THESE 
TWO PERIODS TO MAKE A MORE GRADUAL DECREASE TO STATUS QUO. WITH 
HIGHER RH, EXPECT TEMPS TO DROP TO MORE SEASONAL LEVELS, WHICH ARE 
STILL HOT, BUT NOT IN THE 90S, GENERALLY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EDT FRI JUN 24 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...A LITTLE MORE CLOUD COVER HAS 
FORMED TODAY OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU TODAY THAN THURSDAY. THIS
AREA IS MORE UNSTABLE AND DEWPOINTS WERE A LITTLE HIGHER OVER 
NORTHERN AL AND MIDDLE TN. DOPPLER RADAR IS INDICATING SHOWERS 
ACROSS NORTHERN AL AND A FEW OVER SOUTHERN MIDDLE TN. A FEW 
LIGHTNING STRIKES ARE ASSOCIATED WITH THE ACTIVITY OVER NORTHERN AL. 
THE ACTIVITY IS MOVING SLOWLY WEST. HIGH PRESSURE AT THE SURFACE AND 
ALOFT CONTINUES OVER THE SOUTHEAST AND MIDDLE ATLANTIC STATES. AN 
UPPER LOW OVER SOUTHEAST FLORIDA IS SPREADING CLOUDINESS NORTH AND 
NORTHWEST INTO GEORGIA AND SOUTH CAROLINA WITH THUNDERSTORMS ALONG 
THE COASTAL AREAS. 

DURING THE NEXT 24 HOURS EXPECT A FEW SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A 
THUNDERSTORM TO DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON BUT NOT ENOUGH TO INCLUDE IN THE FORECAST BEFORE THEY 
DISSIPATE BEFORE SUNSET. THE EASTERLY FLOW WILL BRING A LITTLE MORE 
MOISTURE OVER THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT AND SATURDAY BUT DOWNSLOPING 
OFF THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS SHOULD KEEP ANYTHING MORE THAN A FEW 
SHOWERS FROM FORMING. MODELS KEEP THE DEEPER MOISTURE SOUTH OF THE 
BORDER AND THEN MOVE IT WEST INTO AL. ISOLATED SHOWERS AND A 
THUNDERSTORM MAY DEVELOP ACROSS SW NC AND SE TN SATURDAY AFTERNOON 
BUT NOT CONFIDENT ENOUGH THERE WOULD BE ENOUGH COVERAGE FOR ISOLATED 
WORDING. LOWS TONIGHT SHOULD BE A DEGREE OR SO WARMER ACROSS 
NORTHERN SECTIONS WITH HIGHS SATURDAY EXPECTED TO BE ABOUT THE SAME 
AS TODAY UPPER 80S TO NEAR 90.        

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...SAME-O, SAME-O AS 
PREVIOUS FORECASTS WITH A NOTABLE EXCEPTION. RIDGE CONTINUES TO 
DOMINATE THE AREA WITH HOT TEMPS AND MAINLY DRY CONDITIONS. LOW OFF 
THE FLORIDA COAST WANTS TO MEANDER THIS GENERAL DIRECTION BUT MODELS 
DIFFER ON JUST WHERE AND THAT MAKES ALL THE DIFFERENCE. NATIONAL 
GUIDANCE SEEMS TO FAVOR THE GFS AND SURROUNDING OFFICES HAVE 
ACCOUNTED FOR THIS IN THEIR FORECASTS. HAVE NO PROBLEM RAISING POPS 
A HAIR ON THE WEEKEND FOR THIS POSSIBILITY. STILL DONT WANT TO GO 
TOO HIGH AND IMPLY THAT THIS MEASLY LOW WILL OBLITERATE THE STRONG 
RIDGE. THERE HAVE ONLY GONE LOW CHANCE IN MOUNTAINS AND A LITTLE 
INTO THE CENTRAL VALLEY, WITH SLIGHT CHANCE ELSEWHERE. AFTER LOW 
MAKES ITS (POSSIBLE) ENTRANCE, IT MOVES ON AND ALLOWS RIDGE TO 
RE-BUILD, BUT A SERIES OF SHORT WAVES EJECTING FROM SOUTHWEST LOW 
WILL TEND TO FLATTEN THE RIDGE, ALLOWING FOR RETURN OF SOME MOISTURE 
LATER IN THE PERIOD. IT ALMOST LOOKS LIKE THE DOG DAYS OF SUMMER 
ALREADY. MORE HOT AND HUMID WITH TYPICALLY SUMMER-LIKE LOW POPS.

&&

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT)...UPPER RIDGE OVER KSTL INDUCED 
NELY UPPER LEVEL FLOW OVER...ALONG THE SPINE OF THE MOUNTAINS...ON

NORTHWARD.  UPPER FLOW SHOULD BECOME MORE EASTERLY AS A RESULT 
TODAY.  SO CUMULUS BUILDUPS OVER THE MOUNTAINS TODAY SHOULD DRIFT TO 
THE WEST TODAY...RESULTING IN MORE CLOUD OVER FOR LOWER ELEVATIONS 
TODAY.  

HAVE INSERTED SLGT CHC -SHRA INTO HIGHEST TERRAIN OF THE SMOKIES FOR 
TODAY.  WEAK DOWNSLOPING EASTERLY/SOUTHEASTERLY FLOW FROM MOUNTAINS 
SHOULD MAKE IT DIFFICULT FOR -SHRA TO BE SUSTAINED...RIGHT NOW VERY 
LOW POPS IN VALLEY GRIDS.  ALL CUMULUS COVER SHOULD DISSIPATE AGAIN 
NEAR SUNSET.

DOWNSLOPING WIND SHOULD ALSO HELP TO RAISE HI TEMPS BY ABT 2 DEG F 
TODAY OVER VALUES YESTERDAY. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...AS HAS BEEN THE CASE FOR 
THE PAST SEVERAL SUMMERS ACROSS THE SRN APPALACHIANS WE CANT SEEM 
TO HOLD ONTO A GOOD OLD FASHIONED UPPER LEVEL RIDGE FOR VERY LONG 
WITHOUT A WEAKNESS OR EASTERLY WAVE DEVELOPING AND ENDING OUR RUN OF 
ABOVE NORMAL WARMTH AND SUPPRESSED CONVECTIVION. IT APPEARS THAT THE 
MODELS (NAM/GFS) WANT TO BRING AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CURRENTLY 
VCNTY OF THE BAHAMAS INTO THE SERN U.S. NAM WAS DISCARDED BECAUSE OF 
ITS FARTHER WEST TRACK OF THE LOW INTO THE DEEP SOUTH WHILE THE GFS 
MOVEMENT OF THE LOW INTO THE CAROLINAS LATER SAT NIGHT INTO SUN 
WAS PREFERRED. SYSTEM TRACKS NWD TO THE EAST OF THE FA SO MTNS ALONG 
THE NC BORDER WOULD APPEAR TO HAVE THE BEST CHANCE FOR CONVECTION 
WITH DOWNSLOPING ELY FLO INHIBITING PRECIP TO AN EXTENT IN THE GREAT 
VALLEY IN THIS SCENARIO. INTRODUCED SLGT CHC POPS ACROSS THE S AND 
MTNS SAT NIGHT AND THEN USED SLGT CHC SHRA/TSRA FOR SUN THRU THU AS 
LOW LVL MOISTURE INCREASES AROUND BACK SIDE OF SFC-85H HI PRES WHICH 
RE-ESTABLISHES ITSELF OVR THE WRN ATLANTIC. STAYED A LITTLE BELOW 
GUIDANCE MAX/MIN TEMPS EARLY IN THE PERIOD AND THEN HELD CLOSE TO 
MAX TEMPS LATE IN THE LONG TERM BUT ADJUSTED MINS DOWN SLIGHTLY 
BECAUSE THEY APPEARED TO BE UNREALISTICALLY MILD FOR THE MRX 
FA.

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE A LOWER ONE MORE NIGHT BEFORE MOISTURE 
INCREASES AND HIGHS FRIDAY ABOUT THE SAME AS TODAY IN THE UPPER 80S 
TO LOWER 90S. WITH DRIER AIR IN PLACE THINK THERE WILL BE A LITTLE 
LESS FOG TONIGHT AND FRIDAY MORNING SO HAVE KEPT IT OUT OF THE 
FORECAST.         

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MORE OF THE SAME. 
RIDGE BUILDS OVER EASTERN US FROM SURFACE OF THE EARTH TO THE MOON. 
GENERALLY DRY FORECAST EACH DAY, BUT WITH INTENSE SOLAR RADIATION 
MUST KEEP A LOW (20%) POP IN EACH PERIOD. LATE IN THE TIME FRAME, 
SAY, NEXT WEDNESDAY-THURSDAY, BERMUDA HIGH BUILDS ENOUGH TO PROVIDE 
SIGNIFICANT DEWPOINTS, AGAIN, AND A SERIES OF SHORT WAVES TEND TO 
FLATTEN THE RIDGE, SO HAVE UPPED POPS A LITTLE THEN. BASICALLY, A 
SUMMER ISOLATED CONVECTION PATTERN PREVAILS.

SLIGHT CHANCE FOR CONVECTION ON SUNDAY.

BY SUNDAY...AND HAVE A LIMITED AFFECT ON THE FORECAST AREA. A 
BERMUDA HIGH IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC BY EARLY
NEXT WEEK...WHICH SHOULD DOMINATE THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE WEEK.
THIS SCENARIO SHOULD RESULT IN A TYPICAL SUMMERTIME PATTERN OF 
ISOLATED DIURNAL CONVECTION EACH DAY. TEMPS THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF 
NEXT WEEK LOOK TO REMAIN ABOVE NORMAL WITH NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGE 
EXPECTED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT MON JUN 20 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...AFTERNOON/EVENING 
CONVECTION WILL DIMINISH WITH SUNSET AS THE AIR MASS BEGINS TO 
STABILIZE.  STRONG HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN ANCHORED TO OUR WEST 
WITH AN UPPER LOW CONTINUING TO ROTATE OVER THE CAROLINAS.  SKIES 
WILL CLEAR AS CONVECTION ENDS TONIGHT AND SURFACE WIND FIELDS WILL 
BECOME LIGHT.  AS A RESULT...PATCHY FOG IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP 
TOWARD MORNING...MAINLY WHERE RAIN RECENTLY FELL.  ON TUESDAY...THE 
UPPER LOW WILL WEAKEN AND BEGIN TO FILL.  THE AIR MASS WILL AGAIN 
BECOME AT LEAST MARGINALLY UNSTABLE...HOWEVER...WITH LIMITED 
MOISTURE AND LIFT...EXPECT AFTERNOON CONVECTION TO REMAIN ISOLATED 
WITH BEST CHANCE OVER EASTERN MOUNTAINS.  MODEL GUIDANCE REMAINS 
REASONABLE AND WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM THESE NUMBERS FOR 
TEMPERATURES.  

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...COOL FRONT DROPS S INTO THE 
FA ON WED AND USED A CHC POP FOR SW VA/NE TN AND THE CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU REGION NEAR THE KENTUCKY BORDER WITH SLGT CHC FOR THE 
REMAINING COUNTIES IN THE FA. MAINTAINED THIS IDEA THROUGH WED NITE 
AS BOUNDARY BUILDS S TWD THE GA BORDER. UPR RIDGING FINALLY BUILDS E 
TO INCLUDE TN VLY AND SRN APPALACHIANS IN A PERIOD OF ABV NORMAL 
WARMTH AND SUPPRESSED TSRA CHANCES. INTRODUCED SLGT CHC FOR 
CONVECTION ONCE AGAIN SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT MAINLY ACROSS SW VA/NE 
TN...NRN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND NRN MTN GROUP AS MODELS GIVE SOME 
INDICATION OF UPR TROFFING ACROSS NERN U.S. WHICH MAY PUSH A FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS PROVIDING A SMALL CHC FOR 
TSRA DEVELOPMENT IN THESE AREAS. USED A DRY FCST FOR MON AS UPR 
RIDGING STILL PRESENT IN THE VCNTY AND OFFENDING FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
SLIPS A LITTLE FARTHER N AWAY FROM THE FA. STYAED FAIRLY CLOSE TO 
TEMP GUIDANCE WED THRU FRI BUT DIDNT WANT TO GO QUITE AS WARM AS 
SUGGESTED MAXES SAT-MON SO TRIMMED THESE NUMBERS SLIGHTLY.

FORECAST AREA...PROVIDING A BETTER FOCUSING MECHANISM FOR A LITTLE 
MORE CONVECTION TODAY THAN IN PREVIOUS DAYS. WILL PLAN TO RAISE POPS 
IN ALL ZONES TODAY...AND ALSO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF ISOLATED 
SEVERE STORMS WITH THE MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIRMASS EXPECTED. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO FOLLOW PERSISTENCE SINCE CLOUDS AND CONVECTION 
SHOULD KEEP HIGHS FROM WARMING MUCH ABOVE YESTERDAYS VALUES. 

.LONG TERM...(TUE THROUGH SUN)...PESKY UPPER LOW PROJECTED TO 
FINALLY WEAKEN INTO AN OPEN TROUGH AND PULL AWAY FROM THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS BY MID-DAY TUESDAY. REGION WILL REMAIN IN NORTHWEST 
FLOW INTO THE UPCOMING WEEKEND AS RIDGING BUILDS IN FROM THE WEST 
AND TROUGHING PERSISTS ALONG THE ATLANTIC SEABOARD. WEAK COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY...BUT MODELS DEPICT FRONT 
WILL FURTHER WEAKEN AND BECOME QUITE DIFFUSE BY THE TIME IT ARRIVES 
HERE. NOT EXPECTING ANY MAJOR CHANGES ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE 
AT THIS TIME. ONCE AGAIN...SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO PREVIOUS 
GRID/FORECAST NOT WARRANTED BASED ON LATEST MODEL AND ENSEMBLE DATA.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             86  62  88  66 /  30  20  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  84  61  85  64 /  30  20  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       84  61  85  64 /  30  20  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              82  57  82  59 /  30  20  10  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...RETRANSMISSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
242 AM EDT MON JUN 20 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER NEW ENGLAND COVERING THE ENTIRE EASTERN 
HALF OF THE NATION...WITH A WEAK TROUGH AXIS LOCATED ALONG THE 
EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE APPALACHIANS. A WEAK CUT-OFF UPPER-LEVEL 
LOW OVER THE CAROLINAS...COMBINED WITH A SLIGHT INCREASE IN MOISTURE 
TODAY...SHOULD PRODUCE A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIRMASS OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA BY THIS AFTERNOON. ALSO...THE SURFACE TROUGH OVER THE 
EASTERN FOOTHILLS IS PROGGED TO SLOWLY MIGRATE WESTWARD INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA...PROVIDING A BETTER FOCUSING MECHANISM FOR A LITTLE 
MORE CONVECTION TODAY THAN IN PREVIOUS DAYS. WILL PLAN TO RAISE POPS 
IN ALL ZONES TODAY...AND ALSO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF ISOLATED 
SEVERE STORMS WITH THE MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIRMASS EXPECTED. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO FOLLOW PERSISTENCE SINCE CLOUDS AND CONVECTION 
SHOULD KEEP HIGHS FROM WARMING MUCH ABOVE YESTERDAYS VALUES.

AND TROUGHING PERSISTS ALONG THE ATLANTIC SEABOARD. WEAK COLD FRONT

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 200057
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
855 PM EDT SUN JUN 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY HAS INCREASED THIS EVENING OVER 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE MOUNTAINS AS 
MOISTURE ROTATING AROUND UPPER LOW JUST TO THE EAST AND THE DAYTIME 
HEATING SET OFF THE ACTIVITY. THE CONVECTION CONTINUES TO MOVE 
SOUTHWEST AND IS MOST CONCENTRATED AROUND THE TRI CITIES AREA. SOME 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL HAS OCCURRED WITH THE ACTIVITY IN SEVIER 
COUNTY AND IN TRI CITIES BUT THE THREAT OF FLOODING IS LOW DUE TO 
THE DRY SOIL AND THE MOVEMENT OF ABOUT 20 MPH. EXPECT ACTIVITY TO 
DIE DOWN FOR THE NIGHT IN THE NEXT HOUR OR SO. MINOR UPDATE TO ADD 
PATCHY FOG IN AREAS THAT RECEIVED RAINFALL FOR THE LATE NIGHT AND 
EARLY HOURS MONDAY.  

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC......NONE.
TN......NONE.
VA......NONE.

FXUS64 KMRX 192019
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
417 PM EDT SUN JUN 19 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...UPR LVL TROF/CLOSED LOW WILL 
HOLD ITS POSITION ACROSS THE CAROLINAS THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON. 
COLD POOL ALOFT ALONG WITH SOME S/WV ENERGY PROGGED TO ROTATE SW 
AROUND THE BACK SIDE OF UPR FEATURE WILL KEEP SLGT CHC POPS GOING 
ACROSS THE FA. BELIEVE DEVELOPMENT FOR THE MOST PART WILL BE LIMITED 
TO TERRAIN AREAS SUCH AS CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND MTNS OF SW VA AND 
MAJOR APPALACHIAN CHAIN ALONG NC BORDER BUT WENT AHEAD AND ADDED 
SLGT CHC TO THE VALLEY WITH POSSIBLE ADDED SUPPORT FROM VORT WHICH 
MODELS SEEMED TO AGREE WOULD BE PRESENT DURING THE DAY MONDAY. 
DIDNT STRAY FAR FROM TEMP GUIDANCE BLEND WHICH FEATURES MAX/MIN 
TEMPS VERY SIMILAR TO TODAYS NUMBERS...IF NOT A DEGREE WARMER 
CONCERNING MINS. 

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...CLOSED LOW/TROF ALONG THE EAST 
COAST LIFTS NORTH...PULLS OUT TUESDAY WITH UPPER LEVEL RIDGE 
BEGINNING TO BUILD IN FROM THE WEST BUT A COLD FRONT WILL MOVE SOUTH 
FROM THE GREAT LAKES TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY APPROACHING THE 
AREA BUT WEAKENING BEFORE IT REACHES TN. FORECAST AREA WILL BE ON 
THE EDGE OF CENTRAL US RIDGE THE REST OF THE WEEK AND WEEKEND. THIS 
WILL BE A MORE NORTHWEST FLOW PATTERN WITH WARMER TEMPERATURES. 
DAYTIME HEATING AND WEAK SYSTEMS MOVING AROUND RIDGE WILL BRING A 
CHANCE OF MAINLY LATE AFTERNOON AND EVENING THUNDERSTORMS FRIDAY 
THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 190640
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 AM EDT SUN JUN 19 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION EXTENDING SOUTH 
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE RIVER VALLEY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
KEEPING AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE CAROLINAS TODAY...WHICH WILL 
RESULT IN MARGINAL INSTABILITY AGAIN DEVELOPING ACROSS THE REGION. 
THUS...EXPECT ISOLATED TSTORMS TO DEVELOP AGAIN THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...MAINLY ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST PORTIONS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA WHERE INSTABILITY WILL BE GREATER. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
CONTINUE TO FOLLOW PERSISTENCE...BUT THINK HIGHS TODAY SHOULD BE A 
DEGREE OR TWO WARMER THAN YESTERDAY. 


.LONG TERM...(MON THROUGH SAT)...SHORT RANGE ENSEMBLES GENERALLY 
SUPPORT OPERATIONAL MODELS NOTION THAT UPPER LOW WILL REMAIN PARKED 
OVER THE SOUTHEASTERN ATLANTIC COASTAL REGION THROUGH EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. EFFECT FROM THIS FEATURE WILL BE FELT MAINLY EAST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS...BUT SPOKES OF VORTICITY ROTATING AROUND UPPER LOW 
WILL LIKELY INDUCE ISOLATED CONVECTION HERE...MAINLY IN THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN. UPPER LOW IS PROJECTED TO PULL AWAY FROM THE AREA BY LATE 
TUESDAY. SURFACE COLD FRONT APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA ON 
WEDNESDAY BUT WEAKENS AS IT DOES...AND IS NOT EXPECTED TO HAVE A 
SIGNIFICANT IMPACT HERE. TEMPS/RELATIVE HUMIDITY EXPECTED TO SLOWLY 
INCREASE AS HEIGHTS RISE IN WAKE OF DEPARTING UPPER LOW. GENERALLY 
MADE ONLY MINOR CHANGES TO EXISTING GRIDS/FORECAST.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             86  61  86  63 /  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  84  60  83  61 /  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       84  60  83  61 /  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              82  56  80  56 /  20  10  20  10

FXUS64 KMRX 190102
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
900 PM EDT SAT JUN 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...CONVECTION ON EAST SIDE OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
SENT AN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY INTO EXTREME EAST TN THIS EVENING AND CAUSE 
SOME ISOLATED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS OVER MAINLY THE EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS AND ALSO SW VA AND PART OF THE NE TN VALLEYS. A FEW CELLS 
WERE STILL EVIDENT ALONG THE TN/VA BORDER NEAR BRISTOL AND OVER 
BLOUNT AND SEVIER COUNTIES MOVING OUT OF THE MOUNTAINS. THE SHOWERS 
AND STORMS ARE DRIFTING SLOWLY SOUTH AND SOUTHWEST AND EXPECT THE 
CONVECTION TO DISSIPATE DURING THE NEXT HOUR OR SO. WITH UPPER LEVEL 
TROUGH OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WILL HOLD ONTO A 20 PERCENT 
CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION ACROSS THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS THE REST OF THE 
NIGHT. UPDATE OUT IN ABOUT ONE HOUR TO TAKE OUT EVENING WORDING. 
OTHERWISE NO OTHER CHANGES

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EDT SAT JUN 18 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...PATTERN JUST DOESNT 
WANT TO LET SUMMER TAKE HOLD OVER THE ERN U.S. AS TROFFING ALWAYS 
SEEMS NEVER BE MORE THAN A FEW MILES AWAY. UPR TROF GENERATING LARGE 
AREA OF CLOUDS ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS 
AFTERNOON AND WITH ASSOCIATED COLD POCKET ALOFT AND OROGRAPHIC 
LIFT...CONVECTION IS FIRING OVR THE MTNS AND LOOKS TO BE FORMING 
ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AS WELL. THIS PATTERN WILL CONTINUE 
THROUGH THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS AS UPR TROF SHIFTS SLOWLY E. MAINTAINED 
A SLGT CHC POP FOR OROGRAPHIC CONVECTION ON THE PLATEAU AND ACROSS 
MTNS OF SW VA AND ALONG THE NC BORDER AS INSTABILITY PRESENT WITH 
EVER STRENGTHENING MID JUNE INSOLATION AND COLD AIR ALOFT IN 
ASSOCIATION WITH UPR TROF. STAYED PRETTY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE BLEND 
CONCERNING TEMP FCST.  

.LONG TERM...DRY WARMING TREND CONTINUES THROUGH THE EXTENDED PERIOD 
UNDER WEAK RIDGING PATTERN.  SLIGHT POSSIBILITY OF ISOLATED SHOWERS 
IN THE FAVORED UPSLOPE AREA...HOWEVER...TOO SMALL A CHANCE TO 
INTRODUCE AT THIS TIME.  BACKED OFF POPS ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY 
HOWEVER INCLUDED POPS NEXT SATURDAY WITH INCREASING MOISTURE AND 
INCREASED HEATING BRINGING BACK AFTERNOON CONVECTION CHANCES.

FXUS64 KMRX 180645
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EDT SAT JUN 18 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION EXTENDING SOUTH 
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE RIVER VALLEY. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
DEEPENING AN UPPER TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN SEABOARD TODAY...WHICH 
WILL HELP TO INCREASE INSTABILITY ACROSS THE REGION. AS A RESULT... 
EXPECT ISOLATED TO SCATTERED TSTORMS TO DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...MAINLY ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEAST PORTIONS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA WHERE INSTABILITY WILL BE GREATER. AS FOR TEMPS...WILL 
GENERALLY FOLLOW PERSISTENCE...BUT THINK HIGHS TODAY SHOULD BE A 
DEGREE OR TWO WARMER THAN YESTERDAY. 

.LONG TERM...(SUN THROUGH FRI)...STILL NO GENERAL AGREEMENT AMONG 
MODELS/ENSEMBLES ON TRACK OF UPPER LOW THROUGH EARLY NEXT WEEK. 
MODELS AND ENSEMBLES GENERALLY AGREE THAT THE UPPER LOW WILL REMAIN 
EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS...BUT NAM CONTINUES TO RETROGRADE THIS 
FEATURE ALONG THE GULF COAST BY EARLY IN THE WORK WEEK. THIS IS NOT 
DEPICTED BY THE GFS...CANADIAN GEM OR THE SHORT-RANGE ENSEMBLE MEAN 
WHICH KEEP THE FEATURE ALONG THE EASTERN SEABOARD. DUE TO 
UNCERTAINTY...HAVE OPTED TO NOT MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO 
PREVIOUS FORECAST PACKAGE/GRIDS. RAISED MAX TEMPS SLIGHTLY ON SUNDAY 
AND MONDAY TO CORRELATE BETTER WITH GUIDANCE BLEND.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
850 PM EDT FRI JUN 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES ROTATING ON THE BACK OF A LONG-WAVE UPPER TROUGH
OVER THE NORTHEAST UNITED STATES WILL MOVE TOWARD THE NORTHERN SECTIONS
OF THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT.  MAINLY MID-LEVEL CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH
THESE WAVES WITH THE AIRMASS TOO DRY FOR RAIN.  WILL CONTINUE WITH 
PARTLY-MOSTLY CLOUDY FORECAST FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE.

LEFT OVER HIGH-SOME MID LEVEL CLOUDS MOVING ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY
THIS EVENING ASSOCIATED WITH LAST NIGHTS MCS. TREND FOR THIS UPPER CLOUD
COVER TO DISSIPATE...SO MOSTLY CLEAR FORECAST FOR SOUTHERN HALF STILL
LOOKS GOOD.

TEMPERATURE FORECAST ON TRACK AS WELL. HAVE A GOOD NIGHT...

FXUS64 KMRX 171915
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT FRI JUN 17 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...GENERALLY A FAIR WX 
PERIOD DESPITE THE FACT THAT MODELS INDICATE AN UPR TROF DROPS S 
ACROSS THE FA TONIGHT INTO SATURDAY AND EVEN DEVELOPS A CLOSED LOW 
OVR THE SRN APPALACHIANS SAT NIGHT. EXPECT MOST PRECIP IN THE FORM 
OF -SHRA/SHRA TO DEVELOP ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE MTNS IN THE 
CAROLINAS AND MAINTAINED SLGT CHC POPS FOR THE HIGHER TERRAIN OF SW 
VA AND NRN/CNTRL MTN GROUPS OF TN FOR SAT AFTERNOON. UPR LOW DROPS 
SE INTO SC ON SUN. MODELS BROADBRUSH QPF WELL W INTO THE FA ON SUN 
BUT DONT BELIEVE THERE SHOULD BE TOO MUCH SHRA/TSRA DEVELOPMENT 
EXCEPT IN TERRAIN ALONG NC BORDER WITH LOW LVL EASTERLY FLO. WILL 
MAINTAIN SLGT CHC POPS IN NRN MTN GROUP SUN AFTERNOON INTO SUN NIGHT 
FOR POSSIBLE DEVELOPMENT. STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMP BLEND FOR 
THE SHORT TERM WHICH CONTINUES BELOW NORMAL TEMPS IN NLY FLO REGIME.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...GLOBAL MODELS CONTINUE TO 
REMAIN IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE EARLY PORTION OF THE LONG TERM 
FORECAST PERIOD. SOME DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE 00Z AND 12Z GFS EXIST 
IN THE STRENGTH AND AMOUNT OF PRECIP ON MONDAY. THE 12Z GFS IS 
INDICATING THAT THE MCS NOW MOVING INTO THE LOWER SOUTHEAST WILL 
CONTINUE TO MOVE ALONG THE GULF COAST AND GENERATE A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM ALONG THE ATLANTIC COASTLINE IN GEORGIA. THIS COMBINED WITH 
THE CLOSED UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER THE CAROLINAS ON MONDAY INTENSIFIES 
THE PRECIPITATION FIELD IN THE GFS QUITE A BIT FROM THE 00Z RUN. 
FEEL THAT THIS IS OVERDONE IN THE 12Z GFS. NEVERTHELESS...WE WILL 
STILL HAVE DOWNSLOPING FLOW INTO OUR REGION ON MONDAY AND THUS WE 
WILL HAVE LESS PRECIP CHANGES THAN ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE MOUNTAIN. 
WILL GO AHEAD AND PLACE A TIGHT PRECIP GRADIENT IN THE GRIDS ON 
MONDAY WITH 40 POPS IN NE TN MOUNTAINS...30 POPS IN THE SMOKYS AND 
20 POPS IN THE ADJACENT VALLEY LOCATIONS BUT WILL KEEP THE TYS AND 
CHA AREAS DRY AS EXPERIENCE SHOWS THAT DOWNSLOPING FLOW INTO THE 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY JUST ABOUT KILLS OFF ALL PRECIP. WILL 
KEEP TEMPS A FEW DEGREES BELOW MOS NORTH AND IN THE MOUNTAINS DUE TO 
EXPECTED CLOUD COVER BUT WILL STAY JUST SLIGHTLY BELOW MOS IN 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS.

FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY...AS A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS OVER 
THE AREA FROM THE WEST...EXPECT MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES 
OVER THE REGION WITH A SLOW WARM UP OF TEMPERATURES BUT NOT AS QUICK 
AS THE MEX GUIDANCE INDICATES. A FRONTAL SYSTEM THAT WAS INDICATED 
YESTERDAY IN THE GFS...LOOKS TO NOW MISS OUR FORECAST AREA TO THE 
NORTH. THIS HAS BEEN NOTICED IN THE 00Z AND 12Z FORECAST CYCLES AND 
SO I REMOVED POPS ON WEDNESDAY. 

THURSDAY AND FRIDAY WILL BE TRANSITIONAL DAYS AS THE RIDGE AXIS 
SHIFTS EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA AND A SOUTHERLY FLOW RETURNS 
BRINGING MORE MOISTURE. 12Z GFS SHOWS A SURGE OF SOUTHERLY MOISTURE 
FROM THE GULF ON FRIDAY THAT NECESSITATES INCREASING POPS OVER THE 
SOUTHERN SECTIONS AND THEN INTO THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA 
BY AFTERNOON. OVERNIGHT FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY I HAVE DECIDED TO RAISE 
POPS TO 40 PERCENT SOUTH...30 CENTRAL...AND 20 SOUTH AS THE MOISTURE 
AND QPF IN THE MODELS LOOKS FAIRLY DEEP. LATER SHIFTS MAY NEED TO 
RAISE THESE POPS AS LATER RUNS CONFIRM WHAT WAS SEEN IN THE MODELS 
TODAY.

HAVE A GREAT WEEKEND

&&

HAVE MAINTAINED CONTINUITY AND CONTINUED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN FOR SATURDAY PM. GFS SUGGESTS SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN 
REGION WILL REMAIN IN NORTHWESTERLY FLOW THROUGH MOST OF THE 
UPCOMING WEEK. HOWEVER...TEMPS ARE EXPECTED TO MODERATE TO NEAR 
CLIMO BY THE END OF THE PERIOD.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 161902
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 PM EDT THU JUN 16 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CONTINUED WEAK 
NORTHERLY FLOW WILL BRING COOLER AIR TO THE REGION.  HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL DOMINATE THE WEATHER WITH A WEAK SHORT WAVE MOVING BACK INTO 
THE AREA FRIDAY AFTERNOON.  WITH THE SHORTWAVE...CLOUDINESS WILL 
INCREASE...PARTICULARLY OVER THE NORTHERN PART OF THE FORECAST 
AREA.  THIS SHORT WAVE WILL FURTHER INPACT THE AREA ON SATURDAY 
BRINGING A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SHOWERS IN THE NORTH AND FAVORED 
UPSLOPE AREAS OF THE APPALACHIANS.

DID NOT STRAY FAR FROM GUIDANCE VALUES AS NO CLEAR TREND.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...SAME FORECAST ISSUE AS 
YESTERDAY WITH WHETHER OR NOT TO BELIEVE THE CUTOFF UPPER LEVEL LOW. 
MODELS TODAY DID HAVE A LITTLE BETTER AGREEMENT AT 06Z AND 12Z WITH 
THE UKMET...GFS...NAM AND ECMWF BOTH INDICATING A DEEP TROF ACROSS 
THE MID ATLANTIC AND SOUTHEAST EXTENDING FROM CENTRAL GEORGIA 
NORTHEASTWARD INTO VIRGINIA. THE GFS AND THE NAM TRY TO CLOSE OFF AN 
UPPER LEVEL LOW OVER THE DELMARVA PENINSULA BY MONDAY MORNING. THE 
MODELS HAVE BACKED OFF OF RETROGRADING THE UPPER LOW ACROSS THE 
SOUTHEAST INTO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY. HOWEVER...THEY STILL 
KEEP THE LOW NEARLY STATIONARY OR WITH A SLIGHT SOUTHWARD DRIFT 
UNTIL MUCH LATER IN THE PERIOD WHEN THE RIDGE FINALLY STARTS TO 
SHIFT TO THE EAST AND KICK IT OUT BY THURSDAY. MODELS ARE IN FARELY 
GOOD AGREEMENT RUN TO RUN WITH THE LOCATIONS OF THE MOISTURE FIELDS. 
THE 00Z GFS WAS MUCH DRIER THAN THE 06 AND 12Z VERSION. AS SUCH THE 
MEX POPS WERE RATHER LOW. AFTER LOOKING AT THE 06 AND 12Z GFS 
RUN...FEEL IT IS PROBABLY BETTER TO FOLLOW RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY 
AND TWEAK POPS SLIGHTLY IN THE EXTENDED SECTIONS TO MATCH UP WITH 
THE 06 AND 12Z GFS. 

SUNDAY...MADE SOME CHANGES TO THE GRIDS FROM YESTERDAY SO THAT THE 
AREA WILL BE PRECIP FREE UNTIL SUNDAY NIGHT WHEN THE FIRST VORT MAX 
MOVES OVER THE NORTHEASTERN CWA. HAVE ONLY PLACED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
IN FOR THE NE TN MOUNTAIN GROUPS BECAUSE MOISTURE WILL BE EXTREMELY 
LIMITED ON OUR SIDE OF THE MOUNTAINS. MODEL X-SECTIONS EXTENDING 
FROM CHA TO RNK SHOW THAT THE BULK OF THE MOISTURE SUNDAY NIGHT WILL 
BE CONFINED BELOW 700 MB. ANY SHOWERS THAT DEVELOP WILL LIKELY BE 
SHORT LIVED...AND OF COURSE DO NOT EXPECT ANY THUNDER WITH THIS 
SYSTEM AS ATMOSPHERE WILL BE STABLE. TEMPERATURES FOR SUNDAY 
AFTERNOON WILL BE BELOW CLIMO ALL AREAS...BUT NOTICEABLLY COOLER 
ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA WHERE TEMPS WILL BE IN THE UPPER 60S TO MID 
70S. SUNDAY NIGHT TEMPERATURES WILL ALSO BE FARELY COOL AND HAVE 
GONE AT SLIGHTLY ABOVE GUIDANCE NORTH DUE TO CLOUD COVER AND BELOW 
GUIDANCE SOUTH DUE TO EXPECTED MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES.

MONDAY...TIGHT GRADIENT OF MOISTURE CONTINUES AS THE UPPER LEVEL LOW 
(POSSIBLY A CUT OFF LOW) MEANDERS ACROSS EASTERN NORTH CAROLINA. 
HAVE ONLY PLACED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS OVER THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE 
FORECAST AREA AS MOISTURE LEVELS ARE HIGHEST RIGHT ALONG THE 
MOUNTAIN ZONES. TEMPERATURES WILL START TO WARM JUST SLIGHTLY BUT 
CLOUD COVER NE MAY HAMPER THIS WARM UP...SO HAVE STAYED SLIGHTLY 
BELOW GUIDANCE THERE. 

TUESDAY...HAVE DECIDED TO CHANGE TUESDAY TO A DRY DAY BASED ON THE 
UPPER LOW MOVING AWAY AND WHAT LITTLE MOISTURE THERE WAS...EXITING 
THE REGION. SHOULD SEE A MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY DAY AS SKY 
COVER DEPARTS THE REGION AS THE UPPER LOW PULLS AWAY. WITH THE UPPER 
LOW MOVING OFF...HEIGHTS RISE AND TEMPERATURES BEGIN TO WARM BACK TO 
NEAR NORMAL TEMPERATURES. WENT JUST SLIGHTLY BELOW GUIDANCE HERE.

WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...EXTENDED MODELS RUNS INDICATE A SHORT WAVE 
TROF WITH A POSSIBLE COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE REGION. BEST 
MOISTURE AND LIFT IS AROUND 12Z ON WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...IN THE 
EXTENDED PERIODS THE GFS CAN BE OFF ON A FROPA BY 24 HOURS. 
ADDITIONALLY...THIS FRONT DOES NOT HAVE MUCH ENERGY WITH IT AND MAY 
STALL OUT ACROSS OR JUST SOUTH OF MY FORECAST AREA. WILL RUN WITH 
CHANCE OF -TSRA ALL DAY ACROSS THE CWA ON WEDNESDAY BUT WILL KEEP 
THURSDAY DRY AT THIS POINT DUE TO ALL THE UNCERTAINTY. TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE SLIGHTLY ABOVE NORMAL FOR THIS PERIOD.

&&



000 
FXUS64 KMRX 151830
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EDT WED JUN 15 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...
UPPER TROUGH DIGGING INTO THE NORTHEAST SECTION OF THE NATION AND
SURFACE RIDGE BUILDING INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY WILL BE THE MAIN
PLAYERS TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT.  AIRMASS WILL BE QUITE DRY WITH
PWS GENERALLY BETWEEN 0.75 AND 1 INCH.  ALSO...FORECAST SOUNDINGS
SHOW A FAIRLY DECENT MID-LEVEL SUBSIDENCE INVERSION WHICH WILL HELP
SUPPRESS CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT.

NAM DOES SHOW A MCS MOVING SOUTHEAST FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS INTO THE
LOWER MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY LATE FRIDAY AND FRIDAY WHICH MAY GIVE
ADDITIONAL CLOUDS TO SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE. HOWEVER...THE GFS DOES NOT
SHOW THIS FEATURE BUT DOES PULL MORE CLOUDS SOUTH FROM UPPER LOW INTO
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. WILL CALL FOR PARTLY 
CLOUDY SKY FOR FRIDAY AREA-WIDE.

DRIER DEWPOINTS WILL ALLOW FOR GREATER DIURNAL RANGE IN TEMPERATURES
THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS WITH WARM AFTERNOONS AND MILD MORNINGS.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)

...MODEL DISCUSSION...
THE 00Z GFS AND OTHER GLOBAL MODELS (ECMWF AND UKMET) WERE ALL IN 
DECENT AGREEMENT THROUGH THE FORECAST PERIOD...OR AS FAR OUT AS THE 
MODELS WOULD GO. THE 00Z GFS WAS SHOWING THE UPPER LEVEL TROF 
PROGGED TO MOVE THROUGH THE NORTHERN THIRD OF MY FORECAST AREA ON 
SATURDAY BECOMING CLOSED OFF AND CUT OFF FROM THE MAIN FLOW AND 
ACTUALLY RETROGRADING SOUTHWESTWARD INTO THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY BY MONDAY AFTERNOON. I WAS REALLY LEANING TOWARD DISCOUNTING 
THIS GFS SOLUTION...BUT THE OTHER GLOBAL MODELS ALL FOLLOWED SUIT. 
MOREOVER...HPC FAVORS THE GFS SOLUTION AND THEREFORE I AM GIVING THE 
GFS ADDED WEIGHT. THE 06Z GFS CONTINUED WITH ITS PREDECESSOR OF A 
CUTOFF LOW MOVING INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY. HOWEVER...THE 12Z GFS 
JUST IN HAS DECIDED TO KEEP THE CUT OFF LOW FROM RETROGRADING AND 
KEEPS IT NEARLY STATIONARY THROUGH MONDAY OVER THE UPPER MIDWEST. 
THIS ONLY WILL CHANGE THE FORECAST SLIGHTLY BUT THIS JUST SHOWS THE 
DEGREE OF UNCERTAINTY IN THE FORECAST. IF THE UPPER LEVEL LOW MOVES 
OVER OUR REGION...A MOSTLY CLOUDY AND COOLER PERIOD WILL BE 
EXPERIENCED WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR -TSRA AND -SHRA. IF IT STAYS TO 
THE NORTH...SLIGHTLY WARMER AND FAIRER WEATHER WILL BE IN STORE FOR 
OUR FORECAST AREA. 

GFS MODEL ENSEMBLE MEMBERS DO SHOW A SLIGHT INCREASE IN PRECIP 
CHANCES STARTING AT THE FIRST OF THE WEEK. NO LARGE RANGES ARE 
NOTICED IN THE ENSEMBLE PLOTS AND THIS HELPS TO ADD CONFIDENCE TO A 
SITUATION WHERE THE MODELS SEEM TO BE SLIGHTLY FLIP FLOPPING RUN TO 
RUN. NEVERTHELESS...HERES THE FORECAST.

SATURDAY...THE PERIOD STARTS OFF WITH THE UPPER LOW THAT IS OVER THE 
GREAT LAKES TODAY MOVING INTO THE NORTHEAST AND DRAGGING A MID LEVEL 
TROF ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. AN AREA OF HIGHER MOISTURE IS 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE AND PROGGED TO MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA ON SATURDAY. HOWEVER...WITH BARELY ANY MOISTURE RETURN FROM THE 
GULF...IT APPEARS AS LITTLE IF ANY PRECIPITATION CAN BE GENERATED. 
HAVE DECIDED TO PLACE IN ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN THE FAVORED 
UPSLOPE AREAS FROM THE SMOKIES NORTHWARD INTO NE TN MOUNTAINS AND SW 
VA. HAVE LEFT THE VALLEYS DRY FOR SATURDAY. OMEGA X-SECTIONS REVEAL 
VERY LIMITED LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE FEATURE AND 
THEREFORE...TOPOGRAPHY WILL BE THE ONLY AVAILABLE SOURCE OF LIFT. 
WILL SHUT OFF PRECIPITATION AT 00Z SUNDAY AS THE TROF AXIS SHIFTS 
EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

WITH UNCERTAINTY ABOUT THE PATH OF THE UPPER LEVEL LOW...HAVE 
INCREASED SKY COVER ON SUNDAY OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AS IT 
APPEARS THERE WILL BE SOME POOLING OF LOW AND MID LEVEL MOISTURE 
AGAINST THE EASTERN SIDE OF THE APPALACHIANS. I HAVE MADE SOME TIGHT 
GRADIENTS IN SKY COVER TO ACCOUNT FOR MORE CLOUDINESS NEAR THE RIDGE 
LINE. WITH THIS MOISTURE PRESENT WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED TO HAVE SOME 
THUNDERSTORMS DEVELOP IN THE AFTERNOON AND HAVE PLACED 30 POPS IN 
THE MOUNTAINS WITH 20 POPS CENTRAL AND SOUTH. 

MUCH OF THE SAME TYPE OF FORECAST CONTINUES MONDAY INTO TUESDAY AS 
ENOUGH UNCERTAINTY EXISTS IN THE PATH OF THE UPPER LEVEL LOW TO 
INCLUDE A CHANCE OF -TSRA EVERYWHERE. I FEEL THERE IS A BETTER 
CHANCE ACROSS SOUTHERN SECTIONS AND HAVE THEREFORE PLACED 30 POPS 
THERE FOR THE AFTERNOON HOURS WHILE THERE ARE 20S ELSEWHERE. 

TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY FEATURE THE RETURN OF A LITTLE MORE MOIST 
ATMOSPHERE AND WILL THEREFORE CONTINUE THE SAME PRECIPITATION 
BREAKUP AS ON MONDAY WITH 30 POPS SOUTH AND 20 POPS NORTH.

TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE PERIOD WILL BE SLIGHTLY BELOW CLIMATOLOGY 
UNTIL WEDNESDAY. SOME OF THE COLDEST TEMPERATURES EXPERIENCED IN A 
COUPLE OF WEEKS WILL BE FELT ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN WHERE MINS 
SATURDAY MORNING WILL DIP INTO THE LOW 50S WITH ONLY HIGHS RETURNING 
TO THE MID TO UPPER 70S. I HAVE FORECASTED A SLIGHT WARMING TREND 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED STARTING ON SUNDAY WITH MAX AND MIN TEMPS 
GENERALLY BOTH INCREASING A DEGREE OR TWO EACH DAY. THIS IS CLOSE IN 
LINE WITH THE MEX GUIDANCE AS GOOD AGREEMENT EXISTS BETWEEN ENSEMBLE 
MEMBERS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

944 AM EDT WED JUN 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...
COLD FRONT HAS MOVED EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS ALLOWING DRIER AIR TO
FILTER INTO THE FORECAST AREA. BNA SOUNDING SHOWS A MUCH DRIER AIRMASS
WITH PWS BELOW 1 INCH. NAM SOUNDINGS SHOW THIS DRIER AIR SPILLING INTO

J/KG...BUT ENOUGH SUBSIDENCE BEHIND FRONT AND DRY ADVECTION TO KEEP
CONDITIONS DRY TODAY.

FOR MOSTLY CLEAR SKY TODAY.  PLENTY OF SUNSHINE WILL ALLOW 
TEMPERATURES TO WARM NICELY THIS AFTERNOON...PER GOING FORECAST.

CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD AND WILL ONLY MAKE COSMETIC CHANGES TO

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 142300
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
700 PM EDT TUE JUN 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...STRONG RADIATIONAL HEATING EARLIER THIS AFTERNOON 
COMBINED WITH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE HAS ALLOW THE AIR MASS TO BECOME 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE THIS EVENING.  RADAR INDICATES A LINE OF 
THUNDERSTORMS...KICKED OFF FROM AN APPROACHING COLD FRONT...HAS 
MOVED INTO THE NORTHERN PORTION OF THE MRX CWA.  THE STRONGEST OF 
THESE STORMS HAS THE POTENTIAL OF SMALL HAIL AND STRONG GUSTY 
WINDS.  THE STORMS SHOULD WEAK WITH SUNSET.  THE FRONT SHOULD MOVE 
THROUGH AROUND 06Z TO 09Z TONIGHT.  BEHIND THE FRONT...A DRY...MORE 
STABLE AIR MASS WILL MOVE IN WITH SLIGHTLY COOLER AIR SLOWLY 
FILTERING IN FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  ALL LOOKS GOOD IN THE CURRENT 
FORECAST...WILL UPDATE LATE EVENING TO REMOVE EVENING/MIDNIGHT 
WORDING.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 141909
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
306 PM EDT TUE JUN 14 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT VISIBLE 
SATELLITE IMAGE SHOWS CONVECTIVE CUMULUS ACROSS THE CWA AND 
DEVELOPING THUNDERSTORMS ACROSS OHXS FORECAST AREA TO THE WEST. SPC 
HAS ISSUED SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH NUMBER 482 FOR THE COUNTIES 
ADJACENT TO THE WEST. INSIDE THIS BOX NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED FORMING INTO BROKEN LINE SEGMENTS. IN 
OUR FORECAST AREA...LITTLE IN THE WAY OF DEVELOPMENT THUS FAR...BUT 
DEWPOINTS REMAIN IN THE UPPER 60S AND LOW 70S WITH A SURGE OF 
MOISTURE INDICATED OVER NORTHERN ALABAMA. LIFTED INDICES ON MSAS ARE 
CURRENTLY -7C ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND LIS ARE DECREASING 
ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF MY CWA. LAPS INDICATES SBCAPES APPROACHING 
2500 J/KG ACROSS THE CENTRAL VALLEY OF EAST TENNESSEE. NEEDLESS TO 
SAY THE ATMOSPHERE IS REALLY DESTABILIZING TODAY.

FOR THE IMMEDIATE SHORT TERM...ALL FOCUS WILL BE ON THE DEVELOPING 
CONVECTION OVER MIDDLE TENNESSEE. WE HAVE ALREADY ISSUED A SPS 
STATEMENT CONCERNING THE POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE WEATHER. AS DISCUSSED 
IN THIS MORNINGS AFD...THE MAIN THREATS WILL BE STRONG DAMAGING 
DOWNBURST WINDS DUE TO ALL THE DRY AIR ALOFT. THIS THREAT WILL BE 
INCREASE IF ANY OF THESE DEVELOPING THUNDERSTORMS CAN MERGE INTO 
BROKEN LINE SEGMENTS OR EVEN BOWING SEGMENTS. HAIL DOES NOT APPEAR 
TO BE AS BIG OF A THREAT...HOWEVER SOME OF THE STRONGEST 
THUNDERSTORMS COULD PRODUCE HAIL UP TO THE SIZE OF HALF 
DOLLARS...BUT THIS WILL BE HIGHLY ISOLATED. 

MODEL QPF IS EXTREMELY DRY IN THE NAM. ONLY THE GFS WAS ABLE TO PICK 
UP ON THE CONVECTION IN MIDDLE TENNESSEE. DESPITE THIS FACT...THE 
GFS POPS OVERNIGHT ARE JUST TO LOW TO GO WITH IN THIS FORECAST. 
(I.E. 10 PERCENT AT TYS) WILL THEREFORE BE GOING WITH PREVIOUS 
FORECAST OF AROUND 40 PERCENT...BUT MAY RAISE THIS PRIOR TO ZFP 
ISSUANCE. CURRENT THINKING IS THAT PRECIPITATION WILL ARRIVE IN THE 
EARLY EVENING HOURS AND CONTINUE THROUGH UNTIL AROUND MIDNIGHT 
BEFORE DIMINISHING. SOME CONCERN THERE WILL BE SOME LINGERING POPS 
TOWARD MORNING IN THE NORTH AND MOUNTAIN ZONES AND HAVE COVERED THIS 
POSSIBILITY WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS AFTER 06Z. WILL INCLUDE THROUGH 
02Z THE MENTION OF DAMAGING WINDS IN THE ZONES. 

850 RH PLOT SHOWS THAT AFTER ABOUT 09Z MOST OF THE AREA WILL DRY OUT 
CONSIDERABLY AS THE FRONTAL SYSTEM MOVES THROUGH. AN UPPER LEVEL 
LOW...NOW OVER CENTRAL MINNESOTA WILL BEGIN TO MOVE ACROSS THE 
CENTRAL GREAT LAKES AND INTO THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY. THIS UPPER LEVEL 
LOW WILL SEND SEVERAL SPOKES OF ENERGY ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH THE 
SHORT TERM PERIOD. HOWEVER...MOISTURE WILL BE EXTREMELY 
LIMITED...PLUS THE IMPULSES WILL BE COMING DURING THE OVERNIGHT 
HOURS...SO THERE WILL BE NO AIDE FROM DIURNAL HEATING. HAVE ONLY 
INCLUDED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS WED AND THURS NIGHT FOR THE FAVORED 
UPSLOPE AREAS NORTH OF THE SMOKIES. 

FOR TEMPERATURES THROUGH THE PERIOD...A GRADUAL DECREASE EACH DAY IS 
INDICATED IN THE MAV GUIDANCE AND AS SUCH FELT IT BEST TO FOLLOW THE 
MAV GUIDANCE CLOSELY DUE TO PRIOR PERFORMANCE. 

WILL HOLD OFF ON ZFP UNTIL AROUND 330 TO 345 PM TODAY TO CAPTURE 
LAST MINUTE CHANGES. ALL OTHER PRODUCTS EXPECTED OUT AROUND THAT 
TIME TOO. 

THANKS TO GSP FOR THE COORDINATION ON THE SEVERE WEATHER SITUATION.

.LONG TERM...(FRI THROUGH TUE)...06Z GFS CONTINUES TO SHOW SPURIOUS 
UPPER LOW FORMING OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND SUBSEQUENTLY 
RETROGRADING TO THE MID-MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY REGION. THIS 
SCENARIO IS NOT SUPPORTED BY THE 06Z DGEX OR MOST OF THE GFS 
ENSEMBLES MEMBERS. THUS WILL TEND TO DISREGARD THE 06Z GFS AT THIS 
TIME AND FAVOR DGEX SOLUTION. THIS WOULD LEAD TO A GENERALLY DRY 
FORECAST THROUGH THE WEEKEND WITH ONLY ISOLATED DIURNAL CONVECTION 
INTO THE EARLY PART OF THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK. TEMPS SHOULD SLOWLY 
MODERATE FROM BELOW CLIMATOLOGY OVER THE WEEKEND TO NEAR CLIMATOLOGY 
BY LATE IN THE PERIOD AS HEIGHTS RISE INEXORABLY.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 141434
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1034 AM EDT TUE JUN 14 2005

.DISCUSSION...FOG WAS DENSE THIS MORNING AT TRI AND OQT. 
ALSO...VISBY SATELLITE SHOWED FOG IN THE USUAL LOCATIONS IN THE 
SEQUATCHIE VALLEY AND ALONG I-75 SOUTH OF LOUDON COUNTY. WITH THIS 
FOG NOW STARTING TO LIFT JUST ABOUT EVERYWHERE IN THE CWA...HEATING 
IS BEGINNING VERY QUICKLY. AT 10 AM...CHA WAS ALREADY 80/71 WITH TYS 
AT 78/72. 12Z SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWED A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
BEGINNING TO MOVE JUST TO THE EAST OF OUR AREA AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT 
EXTENDING FROM SE MINN TO CENTRAL ARK. THIS FRONT WILL MOVE EAST 
THROUGHOUT THE DAY HELPING TO PROVIDE SOME LIFT FOR DEVELOPMENT OF 
THUNDERSTORMS. INTERESTING TO NOTE THAT THE ISODROSOTHERM ANALYSIS 
FROM THIS MORNING REVEALS A MOIST TONGUE OF HIGHER DEWPOINTS ACROSS 
WEST TN AND WEST KY. THIS MOIST SURGE IS A COUPLE HUNDRED MILES 
AHEAD OF THE FRONT. WE SHOULD SEE SOMETHING SIMILAR TO THIS LATER 
THIS AFTERNOON AS THE MOIST SOUTHWEST FLOW BECOMES STRONGER AS THE 
PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENS OVER OUR CWA. 

BIG STORY FOR TODAY WILL BE THE POTENTIAL FOR SEVERE WEATHER. SPC 
HAS HIGHLIGHTED MY ENTIRE FORECAST AREA IN A SLIGHT RISK. ANALYSIS 
OF UPPER AIR CHARTS SHOWS UPPER RIDGING STARTING TO MOVE EAST OF THE 
FORECAST AREA AS WELL. CONCERN TODAY IS OVER THE POSSIBILITY OF 
SEVERE WEATHER. BIGGEST THREAT IS DAMAGING WINDS...MAINLY FROM 
DOWNBURSTS. THIS IS DUE TO THE DRY AIR ALOFT AND RELATIVELY DRY AIR 
AT THE SURFACE. THETA-E DIFFERENCE OF 32K IS PRESENT BETWEEN THE 
SURFACE AND 500 MB WHICH ALSO IS A STRONG INDICATOR OF POTENTIAL FOR 
DOWNBURST WINDS. WILL THEREFORE BE ADDING STRONG GUSTY WIND WORDING 
TO ZONES AND WILL HOLD OFF ON DAMAGING WORDING UNTIL LATER THIS 
AFTERNOON IF A WATCH IS ISSUED OR THE THREAT BECOMES MORE 
WIDESPREAD. 

AS FAR AS HAIL POTENTIAL...WET BULB ZEROS ARE LOWER THE FURTHER WEST 
YOU GO ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. CONSIDERING A 500MB TEMP OF -6C...A 
DECENT UPDRAFT WOULD BE NEEDED TO PRODUCE VERY LARGE HAIL. STILL 
THINKING THAT NICKEL TO QUARTER SIZE HAIL WILL BE POSSIBLE IN THE 
STRONGEST STORMS. VIL OF THE DAY CALCULATIONS ARE AROUND 55 KG/M2. 

STORMS SHOULD DEVELOP FIRST ACROSS THE PLATEAU LOCATIONS AND HAVE A 
MOVEMENT TO THE NORTHEAST AROUND 20 TO 30 MPH. DUE TO THIS FAST 
MOVEMENT...WIDESPREAD FLOODING WILL NOT BE A THREAT. I ONLY EXPECT 
TYPICAL URBANIZED SMALL SCALE FLOODING LIKE YOU WOULD EXPECT FROM A 
HEAVY THUNDERSTORM.

WILL UPDATE ZONES ADDITIONALLY TO REMOVE MORNING FOG WORDING AND 
TWEAK TEMPERATURES SLIGHTLY OVER THE MOUNTAIN ZONES AS IT DOESNT 
APPEAR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS HAVE MUCH SHOT AT THE UPPER 80S TODAY. 
STILL GOING TO BE VERY WARM TODAY ACROSS THE VALLEY LOCATIONS. TRI 
WILL HAVE A SHOT AT TYING THE RECORD HIGH OF 92 DEGREES.  

ZONES OUT SOON...HAVE A GREAT DAY

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC......NONE.
TN......NONE.
VA......NONE.

OUT THE LOWER LEVELS. DESPITE NW FLOW THIS DRYING SHOULD ALLOW AFTN

OROGRAPHIC SHWR POTENTIAL THU AFTN/EVE. E U.S. TROUGH DEEPENS AND 
RESULTS IN PLEASANT TEMPS AND LOW POPS THROUGH THE WEEKEND.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 131902
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT MON JUN 13 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...STRATO-CUMULUS DECK 
NOW BEGINNING TO BREAK UP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ALLOWING 
TEMPERATURES TO WARM INTO THE UPPER 80S SOUTH TO UPPER 70S NORTH. 
EXPECT A FEW MORE DEGREES OF WARMING...SO TEMPERATURES COULD 
APPROACH THE 90 DEGREE MARK IN CHATTANOOGA. THIS IS JUST A PREVIEW 
OF WHAT IS TO COME TOMORROW.

BUT FIRST...TONIGHT WILL BE ANOTHER HUMID NIGHT ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA. TEMPS ONLY COOL DOWN SLIGHTLY NORTH THANKS TO DRIER AIR 
FILTERING IN. WITH THE ATMOSPHERE SO WARM AND JUICY...DONT EXPECT 
WIDESPREAD FOG FORMATION AS USUALLY A WARM ATMOSPHERE HERE WILL NOT 
HAVE WIDESPREAD FOG NO MATTER HOW MUCH MOISTURE YOU PUT INTO IT. 
HAVE ADDED PATCHY FOG TO THE ZONES AS THE USUAL SPOTS...LIKE 
TRI...WILL PROBABLY GET SOME FOG AS IT RAINED THERE THIS MORNING. 
HAVE FOLLOWED CLOSELY TO THE MET GUIDANCE AS MAV APPEARS TO BE JUST 
A LITTLE TOO COOL. 

TUESDAY...AFTER THE FOG LIFTS...EXPECT PLENTY OF RADIATIONAL HEATING 
TO COMMENCE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. I HAVE DECIDED NOT TO GO AS 
HIGH AS THE MET NUMBERS...BUT NEVERTHELESS MOST OF MY VERIFICATION 
POINTS WILL BE IN THE 90S FOR HIGHS. THE REASON FOR THIS WARM UP IS 
STRONG SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW AHEAD OF A STORM SYSTEM PROGGED TO 
APPROACH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY. WITH THIS STRONG SOUTHWESTERLY 
FLOW...PLENTY OF MOISTURE WILL BE IN THE AREA AS WELL AS DEWPOINTS 
ARE EXPECTED TO RISE INTO THE LOW 70S IN THE SOUTHERN PORTION OF OUR 
FORECAST AREA. WITH SUCH A WARM AND HUMID AIRMASS...THE ATMOSPHERE 
WILL QUICKLY DESTABILIZE IN THE AFTERNOON. MODIFIED MODEL SOUNDINGS 
SHOW MUCAPE VALUES NEAR 3200 J/KG WITH LIS IN THE -6 TO -8 RANGE. 
WHILE BETTER JET DYNAMICS ARE ACROSS NORTHERN KENTUCKY...THE GFS HAS 
A 25 TO 30 KT JET AT 850MB ACROSS OUR FORECAST REGION IN THE 
AFTERNOON. NEEDLESS TO SAY...SPC HAS MY ENTIRE FORECAST AREA IN A 
SLIGHT RISK FOR SEVERE WEATHER TOMORROW. MAIN THREATS SHOULD BE 
DAMAGING DOWNBURST AND STRAIGHT LINE WINDS AND HAIL ABOUT QUARTER 
SIZE OR LESS. WILL BE UPDATING THE HWO TO MENTION THIS POSSIBILITY. 
THE NAM IS RATHER DRY WITH ITS QPF TOMORROW...BUT SO IS THE GFS...SO 
I HAVE GONE ABOVE THE MOS POPS AND PLACED 40 IN THE PLATEAU AND 
MOUNTAIN GROUPS AND 30S IN THE VALLEY LOCATIONS. 

TUESDAY NIGHT...EXPECT AT THE START OF THE EVENING PERIOD STRONG 
THUNDERSTORMS TO BE CONTINUING AND THEN GRADUALLY WEAKENING AFTER 
SUNSET AS INSTABILITY DIMINISHES. THE NAM IS BRINGING IN AN AREA OF 
CONVECTION CENTRAL AND NORTH OVERNIGHT AND HAVE KEPT POPS UP TO 
ACCOUNT FOR THIS POSSIBILITY AS AN UPPER LEVEL LOW CENTERED OVER THE 
UPPER GREAT LAKES WILL BE SENDING DOWN A SERIES OF VORT MAXES OVER 
THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS TO CREATE CHANCES FOR PRECIPITATION. 

WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...WITH THE FRONT PASSING WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON 
WILL HAVE 30 POPS WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE FRONT AS MOISTURE AT THIS 
POINT WILL BE LIMITED. THERE WILL BE A DECENT TEMPERATURE CONTRAST 
BEHIND THIS FRONT COME WEDNESDAY NIGHT THANKS TO HEIGHTS FALLING AT 
LEAST 30 TO 60 DM DUE TO THE UPPER LEVEL LOW DESCENDING INTO THE 
UPPER OHIO VALLEY. WILL SEE MINS THURSDAY MORNING DROP INTO THE 
LOWER 60S NORTHEAST AND MID 60S SOUTH. THURSDAY AFTERNOON SHOULD BE 
DRY...DESPITE MODELS GENERATING SOME QPF OVER THE AREA. MODELS 
TRYING TO CREATE SOME UPSLOPE...BUT DO NOT THINK THIS IS A FAVORABLE 
SOLUTION...ESPECIALLY WITH LIMITED MOISTURE.

THURSDAY NIGHT...PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES WILL PREVAIL AS A WEAK AREA OF 
HIGH PRESSURE MOVES OVER THE REGION PROVIDING FOR A COOL 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW. TEMPERATURES DROP INTO THE UPPER 50S UP NORTH 
AND MID 60S SOUTH TO GIVE THE REGION ANOTHER TASTE OF LATE SPRING.

.LONG TERM...(FRI THROUGH MON)...SIGNIFICANT DIFFERENCES BETWEEN 06Z 
GFS AND 06Z DGEX CAST CONSIDERABLE UNCERTAINTY THROUGH MUCH OF THE 
EXTENDED PERIOD. BOTH GFS AND DGEX PORTRAY A RATHER DEEP (FOR THIS 
TIME OF THE YEAR) UPPER CUT-OFF LOW OVER THE EASTERN CONUS. 
PLACEMENT OF THIS UPPER LOW IS CONSIDERABLY DIFFERENT HOWEVER WITH 
THE DIFFERENCES POTENTIALLY HAVING A PROFOUND EFFECT ON OUR SENSIBLE 
WEATHER. GFS SUGGESTS THE UPPER LOW WILL HOVER OVER THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY REGION THROUGH THE PERIOD WHILE THE DGEX SHOWS IT BEING 
ANCHORED OVER THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC STATES. POOR RUN-TO-RUN 
CONSISTENCY OF THE GFS LEADS TO SOME SKEPTICISM OF ITS SOLUTION. 
THUS INCLINED TO FAVOR 06Z DGEX SOLUTION. PREVIOUS GRIDS/FORECAST 
COINCIDES QUITE WELL WITH DGEX SOLUTION SO WILL MAKE ONLY COSMETIC 
CHANGES. CONTINUED TREND OF GENERALLY DRY WEATHER INTO DAY 7 
(MONDAY). FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY USED BLEND OF GFS AND ENSEMBLE 
GUIDANCE THROUGH MOST OF THE PERIOD.


&&

FXUS64 KMRX 131410
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 AM EDT MON JUN 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...EARLY MORNING VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL A 
STRATUS DECK MOVING ACROSS THE EASTERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND INTO 
THE CENTRAL VALLEY. THIS CLOUD DECK HAS HAD SOME LIGHT RAIN AND 
DRIZZLE WITH IT AS WELL AS LOW CEILINGS. VERY WARM TEMPERATURES THIS 
MORNING CHARACTERISTIC OF MORNINGS IN FLORIDA WITH MINS IN THE LOW 
70S AND DEWPOINTS ONLY A COUPLE OF DEGREES COOLER. THIS IS EVIDENT 
OF THE TROPICAL AIRMASS LEFT BEHIND IN THE WAKE OF ARLENE. 

12Z UPPER AIR ANALYSIS AT 700MB AND 500MB REVEALS A LARGE SWATH OF 
DRY AIR AT THOSE LEVELS MOVING INTO MY CWA FROM THE WEST. THIS IS IN 
RESPONSE TO A WEAK SHORTWAVE TROF MOVING THROUGH THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS WITH DRY AIR FILLING IN BEHIND. POINT SOUNDINGS OVER 
THE SMOKYS SHOW THAT WHILE THE SOUNDING IS MOIST UP TO 700MB RAPID 
DRYING COMMENCES ABOVE THIS LAYER. AT THE SURFACE...ETA12 HAS A 
THETA-E RIDGE OVER MY MOUNTAIN COUNTIES AT PEAK HEATING TIME. THIS 
SEEMS REASONABLE GIVEN THE VERY WARM AND MOIST AIRMASS AT THE 
SURFACE. HOWEVER...WITH THE DRY AIR ALOFT I AM NOT CONFIDENT IN MUCH 
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT THIS AFTERNOON. BEST LOCATION FOR 
THUNDERSTORM INITIATION WILL BE OVER THE APPALACHIANS. DEVELOPMENT 
IS POSSIBLE OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU MAINLY EARLY IN THE DAY 
BEFORE TO MUCH DRY AIR FILTERS IN. STORM MOVEMENT SHOULD BE OFF TO 
THE NORTHEAST AROUND 20KTS. 

WITH SUCH DRY AIR ALOFT...IF A FEW THUNDERSTORMS REALLY GET GOING IN 
THIS ENVIRONMENT...THERE IS A THREAT FOR DAMAGING DOWNBURST WINDS. 
THIS THREAT WILL BE ISOLATED TO ONLY THE STRONGEST OF THUNDERSTORMS. 
HAIL DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE A THREAT GIVEN THE HIGH FREEZING LEVEL 
NEAR 16000 FT. ALSO...GIVEN THE TROPICAL AIRMASS STILL IN PLACE AT 
THE SURFACE...SOME STORMS COULD HAVE HEAVY RAIN AT TIMES. 

FOR THE UPDATE THIS MORNING...WILL KEEP CURRENT POP AMOUNTS THE SAME 
AND WILL ONLY TWEAK THE HOURLY TEMP GRIDS TO GET BETTER IN LINE WITH 
CURRENT TRENDS. HAVENT MADE ANY CHANGES TO MAX TEMPS TODAY AS WE 
ARE ONLY 10 TO 15 DEGREES AWAY FROM PREDICTED MAX TEMPS. WILL REMOVE 
MORNING FOG WORDING AND USE BECOMING PARTLY CLOUDY PHRASING FOR 
SKY COVER.

UPDATE OUT SOON...HAVE A GREAT DAY

&&

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SOME PATCHY FOG OVER THE AREA

AIR MASS REMAINS OVER THE REGION AND A COLD FRONT APPROACHES FORM

APPALACHIAN REGION TUESDAY NIGHT INTO WEDNESDAY.  MODELS SHOW LITTLE 
IN THE WAY OF FORCING OR MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT 
ITSELF...AND WILL CONTINUE WITH THE 20 TO 30 POPS FOR THIS TIME 
FRAME.  BEHIND THE FRONT...A COOLER...DRY AND STABLE AIR MASS WILL 
FILTER INTO THE AREA WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN BY THE 
WEEKEND.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...REMNANTS OF ARLENE CONTINUE TO 
PULL QUITE RAPIDLY TO THE NORTH BUT CONVECTIVE BANDS IN THE 
SOUTHEASTERN QUADRANT OF THE CIRCULATION CONTINUE TO MOVE THROUGH

DIMINISH TONIGHT AS CENTER OF CIRCULATION MOVES FARTHER AWAY AND 
CONTINUES TO WEAKEN. ALSO EXPECT WINDS ASSOCIATED WITH CIRCULATION 
TO DIMINISH AND WIND ADVISORIES WILL BE ALLOWED TO EXPIRE AS 
SCHEDULED. SOME CLEARING IN THE SECOND PERIOD SHOULD ALLOW TEMPS TO 
RECOVER TO NEAR OR EVEN ABOVE CLIMATOLOGY. GENERALLY STUCK CLOSELY 
TO GFS POPS AND TEMPERATURE GUIDANCE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(MON NIGHT THROUGH SUN)...NAM AND GFS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT WITH UPPER LOW MOVING ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES INTO THE 
NORTHEAST. ALSO IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH TIMING OF COLD FRONT 
FORECAST TO SWING THROUGH OUR REGION LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY 
WEDNESDAY. MOISTURE AND FORCING UNIMPRESSIVE WITH THIS FEATURE FOR 
OUR AREA...SO AFTER SLIGHT CHANCE EVENING POPS MON NIGHT AND CHANCE 
TUE AFTERNOON...WILL JUST KEEP LOW CHANCE RUNNING THROUGH TUE NIGHT 
AND SLIGHT CHANCE WED WITH THE FRONT.  MODELS QUICKER MOVING UPPER 
LOW OUT THAN YESTERDAYS SOLUTION...SO AFTER A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS THU AFTERNOON AND EARLY THU NIGHT...WILL 
GO DRY REMAINDER OF FORECAST AS UPPER RIDGING BUILDS EAST TOWARDS 
THE AREA AND SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FROM THE NORTHWEST.  


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.DISCUSSION...CENTER OF CIRCULATION OF REMNANTS OF ARLENE CURRENTLY
MOVING THROUGH MIDDLE TENNESSEE PER RADAR LOOPS. CONVECTIVE BANDS
HAVE SET UP WELL TO THE EAST OF THE CIRCULATION...WITH SEVERAL IN
AND AROUND OUR FORECAST AREA. SOME ISOLATED FLOODING POTENTIAL EXISTS
IF THESE BANDS TRAIN OVER THE SAME AREAS FOR EXTENDED PERIODS. KMRX
VAD WIND PROFILE INDICATES WINDS 35-40 KTS SEVERAL THOUSAND FEET OFF
THE SURFACE. REPORTS HAVE BEEN RECEIVED OF TREES BEING BLOWN DOWN IN
THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS OF THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS. THUS WILL ISSUE WIND
ADVISORY FOR HIGHEST ELEVATIONS OF THE MOUNTAIN ZONES. WILL BEEF UP
WINDS IN THOSE ZONES ACCORDINGLY. REMAINDER OF FORECAST APPEARS
GENERALLY ON TRACK...AND NO OTHER CHANGES ARE PLANNED AT THIS TIME.

.LONG TERM...MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...REMNANTS OF ARLENE WILL HAVE 
EXITED THE AREA ON MONDAY.  HOWEVER...RESIDUAL MOISTURE MAINLY IN 
THE LOWER LEVELS AND WEAK DYNAMICS WILL CONTINUE SCATTERED SHOWERS 
INTO MONDAY MORNING.  THERMAL HEATING PROVIDING MARGINAL INSTABILITY 
WILL GENERATE SOME AFTERNOON/EVENING CONVECTION.  UPPER LEVEL FLOW 
WILL BECOME MORE WESTERLY ON TUESDAY ALLOWING FOR SOME DRYING.  
HOWEVER...THE ATMOSPHERE WILL DESTABILIZE IN THE AFTERNOON WITH AN 
UPPER WAVE MOVING THROUGH AHEAD OF THE NEXT SYSTEM.  THIS WILL 
PROVIDE ANOTHER ROUND OF AFTERNOON AND EVENING CONVECTION.  A WEAK 
COLD FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH ON WEDNESDAY FOR CONTINUE UNSETTLED 
WEATHER.  WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS MUCH OF THE REMAINDER OF THE 
EXTENDED AS AN UPPER LOW TRACKS THROUGH TO OUR NORTHEAST.

FXUS64 KMRX 111830
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
228 PM EDT SAT JUN 11 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...STILL SOME UNCERTAINTY ABOUT 
EASTERN EXTENT OF PRECIP SHIELD FROM ARLENE AS MODELS DISAGREE QUITE 
A BIT. ETA PROJECTS ONLY SPOTTY PRECIP THROUGH THE ENTIRE EVENT 
WHILE GFS IS MUCH MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH THE PRECIP...ESPECIALLY OVER 
THE EASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. THE CANADIAN GEM MODEL TENDS 
TO FAVOR THE GFS WHILE THE SHORT-RANGE ENSEMBLES SEEM TO OFFER A 
COMPROMISE OF THE OPERATIONAL MODELS. INCLINATION IS TO SLIGHTLY 
FAVOR THE GFS BASED ON CURRENT TRENDS. TENDED TO UNDERCUT GFS 
GUIDANCE POPS IN THE NORTHEASTERN ZONES HOWEVER. BASED ON STILL 
UNCERTAIN PATH OF ARLENE THROUGH TENNESSEE...WILL CONTINUE SPS. 
APPEARS RAIN HEAVY ENOUGH TO CAUSE WIDESPREAD FLOODING IS UNLIKELY 
AT THIS TIME HOWEVER. FOR TEMPS...DID NOT STRAY FAR FROM GFS 
GUIDANCE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(SUN NIGHT THROUGH SAT)...CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE LINGERS 
OVER THE AREA SUN NIGHT INTO MONDAY...BUT MODELS DO INDICATE SOME 
DEEP LAYER DRYING BY TUESDAY...ALTHOUGH LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
CONTINUES.  NAM HAS SHIFTED MUCH MORE IN LINE WITH THE GFS...SO THEY 
ARE NOW IN DECENT AGREEMENT.  APPEARS WE WILL HAVE SCATTERED SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS AROUND MONDAY AND TUESDAY...MAINLY DRIVEN BY 
DAYTIME HEATING.  00Z GFS WAS FOLLOWED FURTHER OUT...WHICH WAS THE 
PREFERRED SOLUTION BY HPC. A COLD FRONT IS FORECAST TO SWING THROUGH 
THE REGION LATE TUESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY WED...SO WILL CONTINUE CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.  CUT OFF UPPER LOW FORECAST TO BE 
POSITIONED TO OUR NORTHEAST THU THROUGH SAT.  CONSIDERABLE 
UNCERTAINTY AS TO WHERE THIS WILL SET UP RESIDENCE...HOW QUICKLY IT 
WILL PULL OUT...AND ALSO AS TO TIMING OF ANY VORT LOBES ROTATING 
AROUND IT.  GIVEN HIGH LEVEL OF UNCERTAINTY...FOR NOW JUST WENT WITH 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THU THROUGH SAT.

FROM POP/QPF GUIDANCE BUT FEEL THEY MAY BE UNDERDONE. BEST 
ISENTROPIC LIFT MOVES N OF AREA TODAY. HEATING WILL BE LIMITED BY 
CLOUD COVER. DESPITE LACK OF HEATING...TSTM PARAMETERS IN FCST 
SOUNDINGS ARE IN THE MDT RANGE SO KEPT MENTION FOR TSTM ACTIVITY. 
WENT WITH RELATIVELY LOW POPS NE AREAS WHERE SOME MID LEVEL DRYING 
AND DOWNSLOPING IS INDICATED. STAYED ON THE WARM SIDE OF TEMP 
GUIDANCE AS TROPICAL AIRMASS IS EVIDENT. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW IN 
MODEL SOLUTION FOR TIMING AND TRACK OF TS ARLENE.  UPPER HIGH 
CENTERED OFF THE SOUTHEAST U.S. COAST IS EXPECTED TO EXPAND WESTWARD 
WHICH SHOULD SERVE TO KEEP THE TRACK OF ARLENE TO OUR WEST AND MAY 
SLOW IT DOWN A BIT.  THEREFORE....WILL STAY IN LINE WITH HPC 
FORECAST OF MOVEMENT OF THE TS WHICH BRINGS THE SYSTEM INTO 
WESTERN-MIDDLE TN ON SUNDAY AS THIS LOOKS REASONABLE.  AS A 
RESULT...WILL CONTINUE THE LIKELY POPS OVER OUR CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN 
ZONES AND SLIGHTLY LOWER POPS IN OUR NORTHERN ZONES WITH PASSAGE OF 
THE REMNANTS OF ARLENE TO OUR WEST.  LITTLE CHANGE IN THE FORECAST 
FOR THE REST OF THE PERIOD.  MODELS CONTINUE TO HAVE POOR 
CONSISTENCY...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH ISOLATED TO SCATTERED POPS 
MAINLY FOR AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 110208
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1008 PM EDT FRI JUN 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS VERY WARM TROPICAL STYLE 
AIRMASS IN PLACE ACROSS THE REGION THIS EVENING. LAST VISIBLE 
SATELLITE IMAGES CONFIRMED THAT CIRRUS OUTFLOW FROM TROPICAL STORM 
ARLENE IS BEGINNING TO OVERSPREAD THE AREA AS ALMOST ALL METAR SITES 
ARE REPORTING A CEILING BETWEEN 12000FT AND 20000FT. PER TIME 
HEIGHTS ON ETA AND GFS EXPECT THIS CLOUD DECK TO REMAIN OVERNIGHT. 
UPPER AIR SOUNDING FROM OHX HAS PW OF 2.12 INCHES. TROPICAL AIRMASS 
IS SURELY IN PLACE NOW. AREA RADARS SHOWING CONVECTION BEGINNING TO 
DIMINISH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. HOWEVER...KGSP RADAR SHOWING A 
WEAKENING LINE OF SHOWER ACTIVITY MOVING TOWARD MY TN AND NC 
MOUNTAIN COUNTIES. 

TROPICAL STORM ARLENE IS NOW NEARLY A HURRICANE WITH SUSTAINED WINDS 
NEAR 70 MPH. PICTURE BECOMING A LITTLE MORE CLEAR ON HOW THIS SYSTEM 
WILL AFFECT OUR WEATHER OVER THE WEEKEND. UPPER AIR ANALYSIS AT 500 
MB SHOWS THE ATLANTIC RIDGE STARTING TO BUILD IN EVEN STRONGER. 
THIS...AS NHC HAS ADVERTISED...WILL TURN ARLENE ON A MORE 
NORTH-NORTHWESTWARD TRACK TOWARD WESTERN MIDDLE TENNESSEE. A SLIGHT 
DEVIATION TO THE EAST OF THIS FORECAST TRACK WILL BRING A GREATER 
CHANCE OF HEAVIER RAINFALL INTO MY CWA COME SATURDAY AFTERNOON. HAVE 
BROUGHT UP POPS BEYOND THE FIRST PERIOD SLIGHTLY TO COME IN BETTER 
AGREEMENT WITH SURROUNDING OFFICES. ONLY ALLOWED LIKELY POPS ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN THIRD OF THE CWA. FOLLOWED PREVIOUS FORECAST IN THE 
CENTRAL AND NORTHERN SECTIONS AS THEY WILL BE FURTHEST AWAY FROM THE 
EVENTUAL TRACK. WILL BE SENDING OUT AN SPS SHORTLY TO HIGHLIGHT 
RISKS FROM THIS SYSTEM. IT SHOULD BE NOTED MOST OF THE CONVECTION IS 
ON THE EAST SIDE OF THIS SYSTEM SO ONE SHOULD NOT FOCUS ON THE 
STORMS CENTER. 

FOR THE UPDATE TONIGHT...WILL KEEP POPS AT 50 PERCENT CENTRAL AND 
SOUTHERN MOUNTAIN GROUPS AND 30 TO 40 ELSEWHERE THROUGH 06Z...AND 
THEN WILL DROP DOWN TO 30 PERCENT SOUTH AND 20 PERCENT NORTH. TEMPS 
BASICALLY ON TRACK BUT HAVE MODIFIED HOURLY TEMP GRIDS TO INDICATE 
ONLY A MINOR DROP IN TEMPS SINCE MOST LOCATIONS CURRENTLY WITHIN 5 
DEGREES OF DEWPOINTS. WILL ADD IN SOME PATCHY FOG AS A VERY MUGGY 
AIRMASS IS IN PLACE NEAR THE SURFACE.

ZONES...GRIDDED PRODUCTS AND SPS OUT SOON. 

HAVE A GREAT WEEKEND

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC......NONE.
TN......NONE.
VA......NONE.

&&

239 PM EDT FRI JUN 10 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SAT)...MINOR CHANGES IN THE OFFING BY THE 
SECOND PERIOD AS EFFECTS FROM TROPICAL STORM ARLENE BEGIN TO BE FELT 
IN THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. ETA FORECAST SOUNDINGS DEPICT ELEVATED 
SUBSIDENCE INVERSION DEVELOPING AS NORTHERN PERIPHERY OF ARLENE 
APPROACHES. THIS SUGGESTS THAT DIURNAL CONVECTION WILL BE SUPPRESSED 
SOMEWHAT COMPARED WITH THE PAST SEVERAL DAYS. THUS HAVE LOWERED POPS 
SLIGHTLY IN THE SECOND PERIOD. 12Z GFS DEPICTS CONVECTIVE BAND FROM 
ARLENE ENTERING THE SOUTHERN TIER OF OUR FORECAST AREA BY LATE 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON...WHICH CASTS SOME UNCERTAINTY IN POPS TRENDS 
HOWEVER. DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO TEMPS AS THEY MATCH 
GUIDANCE QUITE WELL AS IS.

.LONG TERM...(SAT NIGHT THROUGH FRI)...FIRST ISSUE FOR THIS PERIOD 
IS WHAT EFFECT REMNANTS OF ARLENE WILL HAVE ON THE AREA.  OFFICIAL 
TPC FORECAST TRACK SIMILAR TO BUT FASTER THAN GFS...KEEPING CENTER 
WELL WEST OF OUR AREA.  HOWEVER...GFS DEPICTS SWATH OF TROPICAL 
MOISTURE MOVING NORTH ACROSS THE AREA SAT NIGHT INTO SUNDAY.  STILL 
CONSIDERABLE UNCERTAINTY FOR THIS TIME FRAME...SO FOR NOW WILL 
TREND WETTER...BUT STILL WILL NOT GO AS HIGH AS MAV POPS.  
CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE LINGERS INTO MONDAY...SO WILL CONTINUE CHANCE 
POPS.  RUN TO RUN CONTINUITY OF MODEL SOLUTIONS...AND MODEL 
AGREEMENT...CONTINUES TO BE LACKING FURTHER OUT.  LATER PERIODS WERE 
GENERALLY BASED ON 06Z GFS...WHICH WAS THE PREFERRED SOLUTION BY 
HPC.  THIS BRINGS A COLD FRONT INTO THE AREA WED NIGHT. WILL GO WITH 
CHANCE POPS THROUGH WED NIGHT...THEN SLIGHT CHANCE FOR THU AND FRI.  
WILL NOT ARGUE MUCH WITH GFS MOS TEMPS.

FOR TEMPERATURES.

THE TROPICAL STORM.  THIS WILL BRING THE REMNANTS OF THE STORM INTO 
MIDDLE TN AT AROUND 72 HOURS.  WITH MAIN FOCUS OF THE TS EXPECTED TO 
STAY TO OUR WEST...WILL CONTINUE WITH SCATTERED TYPE POPS...BUT WITH 
DETAILS SO UNCERTAIN CONFIDENCE IS LOW.  THEREFORE...WILL MAKE 
ONLY MINOR TWEAKS TO FORECAST FOR THIS PERIOD.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 100155
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
955 PM EDT THU JUN 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...SAME STORY AS YESTERDAY WITH AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS 
DUMPING DECENT AMOUNTS OF RAINFALL ACROSS THE REGION. 
THANKFULLY...NOT ALWAYS IN THE SAME PLACES AS YESTERDAY. SURFACE AND 
UPPER RIDGING IS STILL IN PLACE PROVIDING FOR A MOIST SOUTHERLY FLOW 
INTO THE REGION. IR SATELLITE IMAGES SHOW SOME OF THE CLOUDS 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE CIRCULATION OF TROPICAL STORM ARLENE MOVING INTO 
NORTHERN FLORIDA AND SOUTHERN GEORGIA. CURRENT NHC ADVISORY HAS THIS 
SYSTEM STILL SOUTH OF CUBA. NHC FORECAST BRINGS THE SYSTEM INTO 
MIDDLE TENNESSEE IN 72 HOURS. WILL CONTINUE TO MONITOR THIS SYSTEM 
AS THE ADDED TROPICAL MOISTURE WILL NO DOUBT IMPACT OUR WEATHER. 

IN THE IMMEDIATE SHORT TERM...WITH THE SETTING OF THE SUN THIS 
EVENING ALMOST ALL OF THE CONVECTION IN MY CWA HAS DISSIPATED. IR 
SATELLITE HAS CLOUD TOPS WARMING ACROSS THE CENTRAL VALLEY NORTHWARD 
INDICATING AN END TO CONVECTION. SATELLITE AND GSP RADAR SHOW 
WEAKENING OUTFLOW BOUNDARY EXTENDING FROM ANDERSON SC TO CHARLOTTE 
NC MOVING NORTHWEST TOWARD THE MOUNTAIN COUNTIES OF NORTH CAROLINA. 
TWO NIGHTS AGO A SIMILAR FEATURE MOVED INTO THE MOUNTAINS AND 
ENHANCED AN ALREADY ACTIVE AREA OF SHOWERS. A LITTLE CONCERNED WITH 
ALL THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE PRESENT THAT THIS BOUNDARY MAY HELP TO 
INITIATE SOME -SHRA OR EVEN -TSRA ACTIVITY OVER THE MOUNTAINS. THIS 
IS THE ONLY FEATURE THAT WILL ALLOW FOR ANY PRECIPITATION OVERNIGHT 
AND THUS THE CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION IS LOW. WILL THEREFORE KEEP 30 
PERCENT CHANCE POPS IN THE MOUNTAIN ZONES AND DECREASE TO 20 PERCENT 
AFTER 06Z. WILL GO AHEAD AT ZONE UPDATE ISSUANCE AND PLACE 30 POPS 
IN THE ZONES FOR THE MOUNTAINS AND LET THE DIGITAL PRODUCTS SHOW THE 
DECREASE TOWARD MORNING. WILL HAVE 20 POPS IN FOR NE TN...SW VA AND 
THE NORTHERN PLATEAU COUNTIES.

WILL ADD SOME PATCHY FOG TO THE ZONES AS TEMPERATURES ALREADY CLOSE 
TO DEWPOINTS. MODELS NOT TO BULLISH ON DENSE FOG LIKE LAST 
NIGHT...BUT LAST NIGHT CHA WENT TO ZERO VISIBILITY DUE TO FOG. TYS 
WAS FOG FREE WHILE TRI ONLY MADE IT TO 2SM. MOISTURE TRANSPORT 
VECTORS SHOW A SURGE OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE INTO THE CHA AREA 
OVERNIGHT AND THIS MAY HELP TO PROVIDE SOME FOG FORMATION AGAIN 
GIVEN MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND CALM WINDS. HOWEVER...I AM NOT GOING TO 
MENTION DENSE FOG AS FEEL COVERAGE WILL BE SPOTTY AT BEST. 

TEMPERATURES ALREADY CLOSE TO ADVERTISED MINS AND WILL ONLY TWEAK 
SLIGHTLY TO MATCH THE CURRENT TRENDS. HAVE REWORKED THE HOURLY TEMP 
GRIDS TO FIT CURRENT OBSERVATIONS AND ACCOUNT FOR A VERY SLOW 
TEMPERATURE DROP OVERNIGHT. 

ZONES AND GRIDDED PRODUCTS OUT SHORTLY AFTER 10PM THIS EVENING.

HAVE A GREAT NIGHT

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC......NONE.

VA......NONE.

FLOW CONTINUES THROUGH THE FIRST TWO PERIODS AS UPPER RIDGE REMAINS 
ANCHORED OFF THE SOUTHEAST COAST. MODEL TIME HEIGHTS SHOW MOIST 
REGIME EXTENDS FROM THE SURFACE THROUGH THE HIGHEST LEVELS OF THE 
TROPOSPHERE. THUS...HAVE NO COMPELLING REASON TO CHANGE THE MAINLY 
DIURNAL NATURE OF PRECIP AS CURRENTLY DEPICTED IN THE 
GRIDS/FORECAST. TEMPS ALSO APPEAR REASONABLE BASED ON PERSISTENCE 
AND LATEST MODEL GUIDANCE.


.LONG TERM...(FRI NIGHT THROUGH THU)...CONSIDERABLE UNCERTAINTY IN 
FORECAST...WHICH IS TIED TO THE EVENTUAL TRACK OF ARLENE.  NAM 
FASTER THAN GFS...BUT GFS CLOSER TO OFFICIAL TPC TRACK UNTIL IT 
BECOMES SLOWER ON SAT AND SUN.  THINK PIECES OF VORT ENERGY THAT GFS 
BRINGS NORTH AHEAD OF ARLENE LOOK SUSPICIOUS...SO PREFER NAM 
DEPICTION EARLY ON WITH CONTINUATION OF CONSIDERABLE MOISTURE AND 
LITTLE FORCING FOR FRI NIGHT INTO SATURDAY.  SHOULD SEE EVENING 
CONVECTION EARLY FRI NIGHT...THEN CONVECTION SHOULD REDEVELOP SAT 
AFTERNOON. OFFICIAL TRACK KEEPS REMNANTS OF ARLENE TO OUR WEST...SO 
MAY NOT BE A BIG PRECIP PRODUCER HERE...BUT DETAILS AND EXACT TRACK 
STILL VERY UNCERTAIN THAT FAR OUT.  FOR NOW...GIVEN 
UNCERTAINTY...WILL JUST HAVE CHANCE POPS SAT NIGHT AND SUNDAY.  
ASSUMING REMNANTS OF ARLENE ARE GONE BY EARLY MONDAY...PER TPC 
TRACK..WILL GO BACK TO AFTERNOON AND EVENING CONVECTION PATTERN FOR 
MONDAY INTO TUESDAY.  GFS...AND HPC GUIDANCE...CONTINUES TO SHOW 
COLD FRONT PUSHING THROUGH BY EARLY WED...WITH DRIER AIR PUSHING IN 
WED AND THU.  WILL JUST GO 20 POP FOR WED...THEN DRY WED NIGHT AND 
THU.

.SHORT TERM...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL REMAIN ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST UNITED
STATES WITH ABUNDANT MOISTURE OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND TENNESSEE
VALLEY.  PWS WILL BE NEAR 1.75 INCH WITH K INDICES IN THE LOWER AND MID 30S.

TEMPERATURE ONLY AROUND 80.  TERRAIN AND LEFT OVER OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES WILL
BE THE ONLY LIFT FOR TODAY.  INTERESTING FEATURE IS LEFT OVER BOUNDARY MOVING
EAST ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE FROM DYING MCS.  

PERSISTENT SCATTERED MAINLY AFTERNOON AND EVENING THUNDERSTORMS WILL ONCE 
AGAIN DEVELOP TODAY WITH GREATEST COVERAGE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.
MAIN CONCERN WILL BE LOCALIZED TORRENTIAL RAINS AND ISOLATED THREAT OF
SEVERE (DOWNBURST WINDS MAIN PROBLEM). 

.LONG TERM...UPPER AND SURFACE RIDGING PERSIST OVER THE SOUTHEAST THROUGH
THE WEEKEND...HOWEVER...DEVELOPING TROPICAL SYSTEM IS EXPECTED TO MOVE
NORTH TOWARD THE CENTRAL GULF THIS WEEKEND. TROPICAL MOISTURE FROM THIS 
SYSTEM SHOULD INCREASE THE COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS LATE SATURDAY
AND SUNDAY. ALSO...HEAVY RAIN AND LOCALIZED FLASH FLOODING WILL BE MORE
OF A CONCERN.  NEXT FEATURE WILL BE UPPER TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHERN
PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES WITH TRAILING WEAK COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY. DRIER
AIRMASS ANTICIPATED FOR THE FORECAST AREA FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.

.DISCUSSION...THE ATMOSPHERE HAS HAD JUST ABOUT ALL THE ACTION IT

DISSIPATED ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH ONLY A COUPLE OF LIGHT 
SHOWERS REMAINING IN THE VICINITY OF TRI AND TYS. THIS IS MUCH 
DIFFERENT THAN LAST NIGHT AS SHOWERS REMAINED WELL INTO THE EVENING 
HOURS. 00Z MESOANALYSIS SHOWED OUTFLOW BOUNDARY FROM DECAYING MCS 
OVER SOUTHERN ILLINOIS CONTINUING TO MOVE SOUTHEASTWARD. WITH MOST 
ASOS SITES SEEING PRECIPITATION TODAY...TEMPERATURES HAVE REALLY 
DROPPED OFF PER ANALYSIS. ENTIRE CWA IS HOLDING ON TO THE LOWER TO 
MID 70S AS OF 00Z. WILL LIKELY SEE A SLOW TEMPERATURE DROP 
OVERNIGHT. 

FOR THE UPDATE...WILL LOWER POPS DOWN TO SLIGHT CHANCE EVERYWHERE 
EXCEPT MOUNTAIN ZONES. KGSP RADAR SHOWS -TSRA MOVING JUST WEST OF 
DUE NORTH ACROSS NW NORTH CAROLINA. THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD MISS MY TN 
AND VA COUNTIES JUST TO THE EAST...BUT ANY INTERACTION WITH LEFTOVER 
BOUNDARIES FROM CONVECTION TODAY COULD KICK OFF A STRAY SHOWER OVER 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND THIS CHANCE IS GREATER THAN IN THE VALLEY 
LOCATIONS. CONSIDERING RAINFALL AT MOST LOCATIONS TODAY WILL ADD 
PATCHY FOG TO THE ZONES. NOT OVERLY CONCERNED THAT THIS FOG WILL GO 
DENSE TONIGHT AS ASOS SITES ONLY DROPPED INTO THE 2SM RANGE ON 
VISBYS...BUT THE USUAL LOCATIONS MAY BRIEFLY SEE DENSE FOG PRIOR TO 
SUNRISE. THIS WILL BE LIKELY BE SPOTTING AND WILL THEREFORE NOT 
MENTION DENSE FOG IN ZONES.

MINIMUM TEMPERATURES LOOK FINE AND MADE NO CHANGES. DID ADJUST 
HOURLY TEMPERATURES TO FAVOR A GRADUAL DECREASE OVERNIGHT AS 
TEMPERATURES ALREADY WITHIN 5 TO 8 DEGREES OF FORECASTED MINS.

ZONES AND GRIDDED PRODUCTS OUT SHORTLY.

HAVE A GREAT NIGHT

COAST AND SOUTHEAST STATES. THE GFS AND ETA SHOWS A WEAKNESS IN THE
RIDGE OVER THE LOWER MS VALLEY AND WEAK VORTICITY MAXIMUMS MOVING 
FROM SOUTH TO NORTH WITH THE FLOW. BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE LATE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING DURING THE 
TIME OF MAXIMUM HEATING. ALSO HEAVY RAIN WITH LOCALIZED FLOODING IS 
POSSIBLE BEFORE SUNSET WITH THE STRONGER THUNDERSTORMS DUE TO LIGHT 
WINDS FROM THE SURFACE UP TO HIGH LEVELS. SOME THUNDERSTORMS MAY 
PRODUCE AN INCH OR TWO IN AN HOURS TIME. THAT WILL BE THE MAIN 
THREAT THROUGH THURSDAY ALTHOUGH HIGH WIND GUSTS COULD OCCUR WITH A 
FEW COLLAPSING CELLS THROUGH EARLY EVENING.

MUCH OF THE EXTENDED PERIOD.  MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT FOR THE BIG 
PICTURE...BUT AS USUAL SOME DIFFERENCES IN THE DETAILS.  THINK NAM 
SOLUTION LOOKS GOOD FOR THE FIRST PART OF THE PERIOD...WITH QUITE A 
BIT OF MOISTURE LINGERING BUT NOT MUCH FORCING EVIDENT INTO THE 
WEEKEND.  SHOULD SEE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...WITH THE BULK OF 
THE ACTIVITY IN THE AFTERNOON WITH THE DIURNAL HEATING.  MODELS 
STILL TRYING TO SHOW A POSSIBLE TROPICAL SYSTEM MAKING LANDFALL ON 
THE GULF COAST SOMETIME POSSIBLY AS SOON AS THIS WEEKEND...BUT THE 
OFFICIAL TRACK STAYS PRETTY FAR TO THE WEST AFTER LANDFALL.  06Z 
GFS...AND HPC GUIDANCE WHICH WAS BASED ON IT...SHOW A COLD FRONT 
PUSHING THROUGH BY EARLY WED.  WILL KEEP CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS EACH DAY THROUGH TUE...THEN SLIGHT CHANCE WED.

TO 2000 J/KG A LITTLE HIGHER THAN YESTERDAY. A WEAK SHORT WAVE IS

HEAVY RAINFALL OCCURRED ACROSS SOME AREAS OF NORTHEAST TENNESSEE

MOUNTAINS. ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS MAY OCCUR WITH HIGH WINDS THE MAIN 
THREAT. CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD. ONLY CHANGE WILL BE TO MENTION

DOWNPOURS AND LIGHTNING.

A FAIRLY UNSTABLE AIRMASS WITH CAPES NEAR 2500 TO 3000 J/KG. ALSO...K-
INDICES IN THE 30S. STORM MOTION A LITTLE FASTER TODAY WITH A GENERALLY
SOUTH TO NORTH MOVEMENT AROUND 10 KNOTS OR SO. WEAK UPPER WAVE WILL REMAIN
NEAR THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. THIS WAVE COMBINED
WITH TERRAIN AND LEFT OVER OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES WILL PRODUCE SCATTERED CONVECTION
LATER TODAY. DUE TO PWS OF 1.75 INCH...HEAVY RAIN WITH THE STRONGER STORMS
IS A SURE BET. IF THUNDERSTORMS TRAIN ALONG AN OLD OUTFLOW...THEN ISOLATED
FLASH FLOODING IS A CONCERN.

ALSO...SIMILAR TO TUESDAY ACTIVITY...ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLE AS WELL
WITH MAIN CONCERN BEING DAMAGING DOWNBURSTS WINDS AND HAIL UP TO NICKEL SIZE.

.LONG TERM...OVERALL PATTERN REMAINS STAGNANT WITH UPPER RIDGE OVER THE 
SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES WITH TROPICAL MOISTURE CONTINUING TO FEED INTO
THE FORECAST AREA. GFS ALSO HINTS OF A TROPICAL SYSTEM MOVING INTO THE 
CENTRAL GULF COAST STATES EARLY THIS WEEKEND THEN MOVING NORTH. MAIN LIFT
THROUGH THE EXTENDED FORECAST WILL REMAIN MAINLY TERRAIN AND OLD OUTFLOW
BOUNDARIES. BY TUESDAY...GFS HINTS OF A WEAK FRONT MOVING INTO THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY.

WILL CONTINUE WITH MAINLY DIURNAL CONVECTION THROUGH THE EXTENDED FORECAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
956 PM EDT TUE JUN 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...BUSY EVENING FOR THE LAST COUPLE OF HOURS ANYWAY WITH 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MOVING MAINLY OUT OF THE NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND INTO THE NORTHEAST TENNESSEE VALLEY. SOME OF 
THE LAST VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGES INDICATED TWO OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES 
MOVING INTO MY CWA. THE MAIN OUTFLOW BOUNDARY OF CONCERN WAS OVER 
NORTHWESTERN NORTH CAROLINA AND MOVING TOWARD THE TN/NC BORDER. THIS 
OUTFLOW BOUNDARY WILL LIKELY SERVE AS A FOCUSING POINT FOR CONTINUED 
SHOWERS INTO THE LATE EVENING AND EARLY MORNING HOURS. WITH THE SUN 
ALREADY SET...INSTABILITY IS QUICKLY STARTING TO DIMINISH ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA AS REFLECTIVITY SIGNATURES ON KMRX RADAR ARE STEADILY 
DROPPING BELOW 50DBZ. HOWEVER...AS OCCURRED LAST NIGHT...AN AREA OF 
SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL LIKELY REMAIN OVER NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
EXTREME SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA FOR THE NEXT FEW HOURS AS IT IS AIDED BY 
THE APPROACHING OUTFLOW BOUNDARY FROM THE SOUTHEAST.

THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA WAS PRETTY MUCH DEVOID OF 
CONVECTION EXCEPT FOR SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA AND THE SOUTHERN 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. A DECAYING MCV WAS MOVING THROUGH THE REGION AS 
EVIDENT BY COUNTERCLOCKWISE CIRCULATION OF STORMS ON RADAR IMAGERY. 
AS INSTABILITY HAS DIMINISHED GREATLY...ALMOST ALL PRECIPITATION HAS 
CEASED. KHTX RADAR ONLY HAS A FEW WEAK RETURNS OVER POLK COUNTY IN 
TENNESSEE. 

FOR THE UPDATE THIS EVENING...WILL REARRANGE POPS IN THE SHORT TERM 
TO ACCOUNT FOR THE CURRENT RADAR TRENDS IN THE NORTHEAST CWA AND  
ELSEWHERE. WILL CONTINUE TO DECREASE HOURLY POPS OVERNIGHT AS 
REMAINING INSTABILITY AND LIFT DIMINISHES. WILL ADD IN SOME PATCHY 
FOG FOR NE TN AND SW VA WITH ALL THE ADDED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE FROM 
THE STORMS. HAVE MADE NO CHANGES TO THE TEMPERATURE GRIDS AS MINS 
ARE ON TRACK. 

ONE SPECIAL NOTE ABOUT THE RAINFALL THIS EVENING...SINCE 853 PM 
EDT...THE TRI CITIES REGIONAL AIRPORT HAS RECEIVED 1.70 INCHES OF 
RAIN. THIS WILL BREAK THE DAILY MAXIMUM RAINFALL RECORD.

MADE VERY FEW CHANGES TO TEMPERATURE GRIDS.

SOUTHERN ALLAPHIAN REGION IN SOUTHERLY FLOW ALOFT.  THIS FLOW WILL 
CONTINUE TO FEED MOISTURE INTO THE AREA.  WITH DIURNAL HEATING... 
THE AIR MASS WILL DESTABILIZE EACH AFTERNOON.  THIS WILL BE 
SUFFICIENT FOR THERMAL INDUCE CONVECTION EACH DAY OF THE EXTEND.  
ADDITIONALLY...THE ARE WEAK WAVES IN THE UPPER FLOW WHICH MAY 
ENHANCE CONVECTION.  HOWEVER...DETAILS SUCH AS TIMING AND POSITION 
OF THE WAVES IS DIFFICULT.  THEREFORE...WILL GENERALLY JUST CONTINUE 
WITH ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS THROUGH THE PERIOD.  WILL 
KEEP TEMPERATURES CLOSE TO MODEL GUIDANCE AS THESE NUMBERS LOOK 
REASONABLE.

324 AM EDT TUE JUN 7 2005

.SHORT TERM...A LOT OF CONVECTIVE DEBRIS CLOUDS REMAIN ACROSS THE FORECAST
AREA EARLY THIS MORNING WITH PATCHY FOG.  BREAKS IN THE CLOUD COVER 
ANTICIPATED LATER THIS MORNING...HOWEVER...WATER VAPOR SHOWS PLUME OF
TROPICAL MOISTURE MOVING ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS...
SO OVERALL A MOSTLY CLOUDY DAY.

ENOUGH BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS TO ALLOW FOR A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIRMASS WITH
CAPES APPROACHING 2000 J/KG. ALSO...SOUNDING DATA SHOWS A FAIRLY LOW CONVECTIVE
TEMPERATURE...SO CONVECTION SHOWED DEVELOP FAIRLY EARLY TODAY. MAIN LIFT WILL
BE LIFT OVER BOUNDARIES AND TERRAIN. K-INDICES IN THE MID 30S SUGGEST A
FAIRLY DECENT COVERAGE OF STORMS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. CONVECTION MAY
ALSO BE AIDED BY WEAK WAVES IN THE UPPER FLOW.

MAIN CONCERN FROM THESE THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL DUE
TO THE ABUNDANT MOISTURE AND SLOW MOVEMENT OF STORMS.  HAVE INCLUDED LOCALLY
HEAVY RAINS IN THE FORECAST. AIRMASS NOT AS UNSTABLE TODAY AS YESTERDAY...
SO SEVERE THREAT NOT AS POTENT. HOWEVER...ISOLATED SEVERE STILL POSSIBLE 
PRODUCING DAMAGING DOWNBURST WINDS.

.LONG TERM...GFS AND NAM SHOWS SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES REMAINING UNDER THE
INFLUENCE OF WEAK UPPER RIDGING WITH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN
APPALACHIANS IN THE PLUME OF TROPICAL MOISTURE ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE HIGH.
DIURNAL CONVECTION SEEMS A GOOD BIT EACH DAY WITH MAIN LIFT REMAINING THE
HIGHER TERRAIN AND LIFT OVER BOUNDARIES. MAY BE SOME WEAK UPPER WAVES AS
WELL...BUT TIMING AND INFLUENCE OF THESE INDIVIDUAL WAVES VERY DIFFICULT
TO PIN DOWN.  WILL MAINTAIN SCATTERED MAINLY AFTERNOON AND EVENING CONVECTION
EACH DAY.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...ATMOSPHERE HAS DESTABILIZED 
ACROSS THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON AND AS A RESULT...ISOLATED CONVECTION 
POPPING UP ACROSS THE MRX CWA...MAINLY OVER THE PLATEAU AND EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS. FLOW IS SLOWING MOISTENING THE AIR MASS...BUT IT IS STILL
