NEEDED LIFT FOR STORMS...THEREFORE...CONVECTION SHOULD REMAIN 
ISOLATED AND MAIN FOCUS OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS WHERE NEEDED LIFT CAN 
AID DEVELOPMENT. CONVECTION IS THERMALLY DRIVEN AND SHOULD END AS 
THE SUN SETS THIS EVENING. RIDGE AXIS WILL SHIFT EAST OF THE MRX 
AREA OVERNIGHT AT THE APPROACH OF A FRONTAL BOUNDARY. A BRIEF 
DECREASE IN CLOUDS EXPECTED BEFORE HIGH AND MID LEVEL CLOUDS INVADE 
AT THE APPROACH OF THE TAIL END OF THE FRONT. ON MONDAY...WITH ADDED 
DYNAMICS AND MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THE FRONT...AND AN UNSTABLE 
AIR MASS IN PLACE...SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE 
EXPECTED. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A STAGNANT WEATHER 
PATTERN WILL CONTINUE OVER THE FORECAST AREA THROUGHOUT THE WEEK... 
AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS OVER THE WESTERN ATLANTIC AND SOUTHEAST. 
WITH A MOIST AND UNSTABLE AIR MASS LINGERING OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA...SCATTERED CONVECTION SHOULD DEVELOP EACH DAY THIS WEEK... 
ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND DURING THE AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING HOURS. ZONAL UPPER-LEVEL FLOW WILL KEEP A WEAK COLD FRONT 
NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY THIS WEEK... 
WITH WARM AND MUGGY CONDITIONS CONTINUING WITHOUT MUCH CHANGE.

FRONT WILL SLOWLY BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY 
NEXT WEEK...AS THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW REMAINS ZONAL ACROSS THE EASTERN 
HALF OF THE NATION. A FEW TSTORM COMPLEXES MAY DEVELOP AHEAD OF THIS 
FRONT AND TRACK TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA...BUT ITS TOO EARLY TO 
HAVE ANY CONFIDENCE IN THIS POSSIBILITY. THUS...WILL PLAN TO KEEP 
POPS IN THE LOW CHANCE CATEGORY THROUGH NEXT WEEK. TEMPS SHOULD 
REMAIN NEAR SEASONAL NORMALS THROUGHOUT NEXT WEEK WITHOUT MUCH 
CHANGE EXPECTED FROM DAY-TO-DAY.

AND THUNDERSTORMS HAVE DEVELOPED. ANALYSIS OF 500 MB HEIGHTS SHOW 
TROF AXIS JUST WEST OF A NASHVILLE TO BIRMINGHAM LINE. AS THIS AXIS 
SLOWLY MOVES NORTHEAST OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS...UPWARD MOTION FOR 
PRECIPITATION WILL SLOWLY DIMINISH SOUTHWEST TO NORTHEAST. HAVE SEEN 
SOME GOOD SIZE THUNDERSTORMS ON AREA RADARS THIS EVENING. NO REPORTS 
OF SEVERE WEATHER...BUT SOME GOOD RAINERS AND A FEW WITH HIGH 
LIGHTNING COUNTS. CURRENT RADAR SCAN FROM KMRX SHOWS INTENSITY OF 
RETURNS DIMINISHING. HOWEVER...I EXPECT TO CONTINUE TO SEE SHOWER 
ACTIVITY CONTINUE INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS...ESPECIALLY ACROSS 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE AREA. 

FOR THE UPDATE THIS EVENING...NOT MANY CHANGES NEEDED. WILL GO AHEAD 
AND TRIM POPS BACK ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA. THIS IS WHERE THE MOST 
STABLE AIR IS AT THIS TIME. MSAS HAS LIS +4 AND UP. 
MOREOVER...EASTERLY AND SOUTHEASTERLY FLOW WILL HELP TO PROVIDE SOME 
DOWNSLOPING OVERNIGHT AND HELP PREVENT LITTLE IN THE WAY OF 
PRECIPITATION. WILL CONTINUE PREVIOUS TREND OF INCREASING POPS 
OVERNIGHT NORTHEAST...BUT WILL NOT COME UP QUITE AS FAST. ACROSS 
CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS WILL ADJUST POPS TO REFLECT CURRENT 
RADAR TRENDS. 

AS FOR TEMPERATURES...FORECASTED MINS APPEAR TO BE ON TRACK...BUT 
WILL TWEAK DOWN JUST A COUPLE OF DEGREES ACROSS SW VA WHERE 
TEMPERATURES ARE ALREADY INTO THE LOWER 60S. 

WILL MONITOR RADAR TRENDS FOR THE NEXT HALF HOUR AND THEN START 
SENDING OUT UPDATED PRODUCTS BY 10 PM.

HAVE A GREAT NIGHT

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC......NONE.
TN......NONE.
VA......NONE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

300 PM EDT THU JUN 2 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT WITH 
MAIN SYNOPTIC FEATURES AFFECTING THE AREA...NAMELY TIMING AND 
POSITION OF AN UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS THAT IS PROGGED TO SWING 
THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TONIGHT. SCATTERED SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS FORMING OVER GA/AL THIS AFTERNOON WILL CONTINUE TO 
TRACK TO THE NORTH INTO EAST TENNESSEE THROUGHOUT THE EVENING HOURS 
WITH THE AIR MASS SLOWLY STABILIZING TONIGHT. HOWEVER...THE 
ATMOSPHERE WILL REMAIN MARGINALLY UNSTABLE OVERNIGHT...AND THIS 
COMBINED WITH DEEPENING MOISTURE AND DYNAMICS FROM THE TROUGH AXIS 
WILL CONTINUE SCATTERED SHOWERS AND EVEN SOME ISOLATED 
THUNDERSTORMS. THIS PRECIP WILL SPILL OVER INTO FRIDAY AS WEAK 
INSTABILITY CONTINUES AND THE TROUGH EXITS THE REGION. MODEL 
GUIDANCE LOOKS REASONABLE FOR TEMPERATURES AND WILL STICK CLOSE TO 
THESE.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A WEAK QUASI-STATIONARY 
FRONT SHOULD BECOME SITUATED OVER CENTRAL EAST TN ON FRIDAY NIGHT... 
AS ITS ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW PRESSURE AREA DIMINISHES OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA. INSTABILITY BEGINS TO INCREASE OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
ON SATURDAY...WITH SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOPING IN THE VICINITY 
OF THIS FRONT. EXTENDED MODELS INDICATE THAT A BERMUDA HIGH PATTERN 
WILL DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHEAST BY SUNDAY...BRINGING A MORE TYPICAL 
SUMMERTIME PATTERN THROUGH NEXT WEEK. AS A RESULT...EXPECT SCATTERED 
CONVECTION THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK...MAINLY DURING THE 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING HOURS. 

A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL SLOWLY MOVE ACROSS THE MIDWEST ON MONDAY... 
BECOMING QUASI-STATIONARY OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY AS THE UPPER- 
LEVEL FLOW REMAINS ZONAL. GFS MODEL INSISTS THAT THIS FRONT WILL 
CONTINUE TO SLOWLY SINK SOUTH INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON TUESDAY... 
BUT WITH THE UPPER FLOW REMAINING ZONAL...THINK THAT THIS FRONT WILL 
LIKELY STALL-OUT SOMEWHERE AROUND THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE 
MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. TEMPS WILL WARM BACK TO MORE SEASONAL LEVELS BY 
SATURDAY WITHOUT MUCH OF A CHANGE THROUGH NEXT WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
347 AM EDT THU JUN 2 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES ARE IN 
GENERAL AGREEMENT THAT UPPER TROUGH WILL CONTINUE TO SLOWLY APPROACH 
THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THE FIRST TWO PERIODS. THIS WILL RESULT IN 
RATHER UNSETTLED WEATHER. AGREEMENT AMONG MODELS IS NOT REFLECTED IN 
THE MODEL GUIDANCE POPS HOWEVER AS THEY RANGE FROM CHANCE TO 
CATEGORICAL. DUE TO UNCERTAINTY...STAYED WITH CURRENT POP 
GRIDS/FORECAST FOR THE MOST PART. LOWERED POPS TO LIKELY IN ALL 
AREAS EARLY IN THE FIRST PERIOD AS CURRENT BAND OF PRECIP SHOULD 
LIFT OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA BY SUNRISE. ONLY SCATTERED PRECIP HAS 
DEVELOPED BEHIND THIS MAIN BAND. ALSO CONTINUED TO MENTION THUNDER 
FOR AFTERNOON/EVENING PERIODS AS UPPER TROUGH MOVING INTO THE AREA 
CAUSES ATMOSPHERE TO BECOME SOMEWHAT UNSTABLE. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY 
STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE BLEND.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH/LOW 
CONTINUES TO LIFT SLOWLY NE FRIDAY...WEAKENING AND FINALLY MOVING 
JUST NE OF THE REGION BY FRIDAY EVENING.  THE SURFACE LOW PRESSURE 
AREA ALSO WEAKENS CONSIDERABLY WITH AN ASSOCIATED FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
LYING ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN...DURING PEAK HEATING.  THUS...RAISED 
POPS A BIT NEAR THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY AND ALSO ADDED A MENTION OF 
THUNDERSTORMS DUE TO SLIGHTLY NEGATIVE SURFACE BASED LIFTED INDICES 
AND AN INCREASE IN POSITIVE CAPE VALUES INTO THE 800 TO 1500 J/KG 
RANGE.  MY POP VALUES ARE JUST BELOW THE HIGHER MOS VALUES...BUT 
WERE A BETTER FIT WITH SURROUNDING OFFICES GRIDS.  
  
CONVECTION SHOULD WEAKEN AND GRADUALLY DISSIPATE FRIDAY EVENING. THEN
THE UPPER RIDGE BUILDS TO A MORE SUMMERTIME PATTERN FOR THE WEEKEND 
AND INTO NEXT WEEK.  INSTABILITY LOOKS TO REALLY INCREASE ON SAT AND 
SUN...REACHING EASILY 2000 J/KG OR HIGHER DUE TO CONSIDERABLE 
RESIDUAL MOISTURE AND MUCH WARMER MAX TEMPS.  THERE IS POTENTIAL FOR 
MCS ACTIVITY TO AFFECT AT LEAST WRN AND NWRN PARTS OF THE FORECAST 
AREA LATE SATURDAY AND LATE SUNDAY...AS VERY FAVORABLE CONDITIONS 
EXIST FOR THUNDERSTORMS TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND MID 
MISS VALLEY...WITH MOVEMENT EASTWARD.  HOWEVER...THIS IS STILL 
SOMEWHAT UNCERTAIN AT THIS POINT...WITH BEST BET TO BE A MORE 
TYPICAL CONVECTIVE PATTERN FAVORING THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS SUCH AS 
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COUNTIES.  THUS...ONLY VERY MINOR POP AND 
WEATHER ADJUSTMENTS MADE FOR THE WEEKEND.  NO CHANGES MADE FROM 
MONDAY OUT...EXCEPT TO ADD SOME PRELIMINARY NEW DAY 7 (THURSDAY) 
GRIDS.

OTHERWISE...FAVORED THE COOLER MAV MOS MAX TEMPS ON FRIDAY...A BLEND 
FOR MINS FRIDAY NIGHT...AND A LITTLE CLOSER TO THE BLEND OF MOS FOR 
HIGHS ON SATURDAY.

.DISCUSSION...A VERY COLD AND DAMP NIGHT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA

ACROSS THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA TO MID 60S SOUTH.

SOUTHEAST. 1005MB SURFACE LOW CENTERED NEAR TUPELO MS WITH PRESSURES 
10MB HIGHER OVER MY NORTHERN COUNTIES. THIS IS LEADING TO A STEADY 
NORTHEAST WIND. ABINGDON VA HAS BEEN SEEING 13KTS SUSTAINED WITH 
GUSTS UP TO 20KTS. REPORTS ON THE NC SIDE OF THE MOUNTAIN FROM GSP 
WEATHER INDICATE WIND GUSTS NEAR 40 KTS. IT WONT BE UNCOMMON IN OUR 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS TO HAVE GUSTS APPROACH THIS MAGNITUDE. HAVE MADE 
TWEAKS TO WIND GRIDS USING NAM-12 TO ACCOUNT FOR THE GUSTINESS. WILL 
ALSO ADD GUSTY WORDING TO MOUNTAIN ZONES...ESPECIALLY OVER NE TN 
GROUPS. 

PRECIPITATION BEGINNING TO FILL IN AGAIN FROM SOUTHWEST TO 
NORTHEAST. LIGHT TO EVEN MODERATE RAIN FALLING AT TIMES REDUCING 
VISIBILITIES AT CHA TO NEAR 2SM. 

BOTH NAM AND GFS IN GOOD AGREEMENT ABOUT MOVEMENT OF PRECIPITATION. 
GFS AND NAM INDICATE STRONG OMEGA LIFT ON EAST SIDE OF APPALACHIANS 
OVERNIGHT...BUT DOWNSLOPING WILL HELP PREVENT HEAVY PRECIPITATION. 
NEVERTHELESS...WITH CURRENT RADAR TRENDS BEING WHAT THEY ARE...TOUGH 
TO GO AGAINST 100 POPS EVERYWHERE. WILL CONTINUE 100 POPS OVERNIGHT. 
AS FOR TEMPERATURES...WILL LOWER MINS A FEW DEGREES CENTRAL AND 
NORTH AS TEMPERATURES CONTINUING TO DROP. HIGHER ELEVATIONS WILL 
LIKELY MAKE IT INTO THE UPPER 40S BY DAYBREAK. HAVE ADJUSTED HOURLY 
TEMPS TO BETTER MATCH TRENDS. 

ZFP AND GRIDDED PRODUCTS OUT SOON.

DISCREPANCIES WITH THE AMOUNT OF RAINFALL EXPECTED THURSDAY NIGHT 
AND FRIDAY...AND WILL CONTINUE WITH CHANCE POPS THROUGH THE PERIOD

WEAK THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT...SO EXPECT MAINLY JUST LIGHT SCATTERED 
SHOWERS.

UP OVER THE SOUTHEAST BRINGING A MORE TYPICAL SUMMERTIME PATTERN. 
THUS...EXPECT ISOLATED TO SCATTERED CONVECTION THIS WEEKEND THROUGH 
THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK...MAINLY DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING 
HOURS. A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA ON 
TUESDAY...BUT SHOULD BECOME STATIONARY OVER THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY AS 
THE UPPER FLOW REMAINS ZONAL. AS FOR TEMPS...A WARMING TREND BACK TO 
MORE SEASONAL LEVELS WILL DEVELOP BY THIS WEEKEND...WITHOUT MUCH 
CHANGE EXPECTED THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EDT WED JUN 1 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AREA RADARS SHOW PRECIP SHIELD 
WHICH HAS PERSISTED OVER THE SOUTHEAST CONUS THE PAST FEW DAYS HAS 
FINALLY INVADED OUR SOUTHERN TIER AS UPPER TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS 
SLOWLY PROGRESSES EASTWARD. ANTICIPATE THAT THIS AREA OF PRECIP WILL 
CONTINUE TO SLOWLY SPREAD NORTHWARD THROUGH THE FIRST PERIOD. 
HOWEVER...DOWNSLOPE FLOW WILL TEND TO INHIBIT THIS PROGRESSION 
THROUGH THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEYS. NEVERTHELESS...STILL HAVE 
OPTED TO GO WITH CATEGORICAL POPS AS MID-LEVEL LIFT APPEARS STRONG 
ENOUGH TO OVERCOME THE DOWNSLOPE INHIBITION OF PRECIP. ALSO WENT 
CATEGORICAL POPS FOR THE SECOND PERIOD AS AXIS OF UPPER TROUGH 
APPROACHES THE AREA. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FAVORED A BLEND ALTHOUGH 
TEMPS WILL BE HEAVILY DEPENDENT ON RATE OF PROGRESSION OF PRECIP 
NORTHWARD THROUGH THE FIRST PERIOD.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH OVER 
LOWER MISS VALLEY REGION TODAY MOVES EVER SO SLOWLY ENE...AND 
CREATES A LENGTHY PERIOD OF MOSTLY SHOWERS FOR THE TN VALLEY AND SRN 
APPALACHIANS.  LOCATION OF THE TROUGH ON THURSDAY JUSTIFIED RAISING 
POPS TO LIKELY...AND ALSO NUDGED UP TO GOOD CHANCE POPS RIGHT 
THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY.  HOWEVER...THE FORCING DOES NOT 
LOOK STRONG AND INSTABILITY IS QUITE LIMITED...SO THE THREAT OF ANY 
THUNDERSTORMS IS VERY MINIMAL UNTIL THE WEEKEND.  FEEL THAT COVERAGE 
OF SHOWERS WILL DROP CONSIDERABLY BY SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...AS 
RIDGING ALOFT SHOULD PROVIDE WARMING AND AT LEAST A WEAK CAP.  THIS 
MAKES BOTH THE GFS AND DGEX LOOK A BIT SUSPECT TO ME IN SHOWING SUCH 
WIDESPREAD PCPN EVEN ON THE WEEKEND.  MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW MODERATE 
CAPE WITH SOME LINGERING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND MAX TEMPS TOPPING 
OUT NEAR CLIMO FOR A CHANGE...SO FELT BEST BET WAS TO STICK WITH OUR 
20-30 PERCENT POPS FOR NOW FOR SAT AND SUN.

OTHERWISE...JUST SOME MINOR TWEAKS TO MAX/MIN TEMPS...AND ALSO SOME 
PRELIMINARY GRIDS MADE FOR THE NEW DAY 7 (WEDNESDAY).

INCREASES.  WITH NO STRONG FORCING INDICATED...THIS SHOULD DELAY AND 
WEAKEN ANY PRECIP TRYING TO MOVE INTO NORTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEY 
AREAS.  WILL GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE CENTRAL TONIGHT...CHANCE 
SOUTH...THEN LIKELY SOUTH AND CHANCE CENTRAL AND NORTH TOMORROW.  
WILL NOT MENTION ANY THUNDER...AS APPEARS ATMOSPHERE WILL BE FAIRLY 
STABLE.  WILL GO CLOSE TO MAV NUMBERS FOR TEMPS.  

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...WARM FRONT/SURFACE 
LOW PUSHING UP FROM SOUTH WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.  WILL GO 
WITH LIKELY POPS BOTH PERIODS.  NOT MUCH INSTABILITY EXPECTED ON 
THURSDAY...THINK IT SHOULD BE MAINLY SHOWERS AND JUST ISOLATED 
THUNDER.  DEEP UPPER LOW PUSHES IN SLOWLY THURSDAY NIGHT WITH AMPLE 
MOISTURE...WILL KEEP 50 POPS FOR THURSDAY NIGHT.  SHORTWAVE LINGERS 
INTO FRIDAY...WILL ADD CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY.  MOISTURE DECREASING 
BY FRIDAY NIGHT...KEPT ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY.  ANOTHER FRONT PUSHING ON SUNDAY AND STALLS...KEPT CHANCE 
POPS FOR SUNDAY AND TUESDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT TUE MAY 31 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A GENERALLY DRY DAY IN STORE AS 
UPPER LEVEL CONVERGENCE SUPPRESS ANY PRECIP THROUGH THE FIRST 
PERIOD. A WEAK SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM APPROACHES FROM THE SOUTHWEST 
BY THE SECOND PERIOD. SOME TIMING DIFFERENCES BECOME APPARENT WITH 
THE ONSET OF PRECIP WITH THE SHORT-RANGE ENSEMBLES THE FASTEST AND 
THE 00Z NAM THE SLOWEST. GFS REPRESENTS A GOOD COMPROMISE AND IS 
SUPPORTED BY THE CANADIAN GEM...THUS IS THE PREFERRED SOLUTION AT 
THIS TIME. POPS SLOWLY INCREASE TO LIKELY CATEGORY IN THE SOUTHERN 
TIER BY LATE IN THE SECOND PERIOD. HOWEVER...ANTICIPATE FAR NORTHERN 
TIER TO REMAIN DRY THROUGH THE FIRST TWO PERIODS AS PRECIP ONLY 
SLOWLY OVERSPREAD THE AREA. FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE VALUES ARE 
GENERALLY CLOSE AND APPEAR REASONABLE. TENDED TO SLIGHTLY FAVOR GFS 
GUIDANCE WHERE DIFFERENCES EXIST BASED ON THAT BEING THE PREFERRED 
SOLUTION.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...THE WEAK UPPER TROUGH IN 
THE SRN STREAM WILL BE A SLOW MOVER AND AFFECT THE EARLY PERIODS OF 
THE LONG TERM...LIKELY WELL INTO FRIDAY.  THIS SYSTEM LOOKS TO KEEP 
OUR AREA UNDER ABUNDANT CLOUDINESS WITH VERY COOL AND PLEASANT HIGH 
TEMPS EACH DAY.  THE AIRMASS LOOKS TO BE SO STABLE THAT I SERIOUSLY 
DOUBT IF THUNDERSTORMS CAN POSSIBLY DEVELOP UNTIL THE WEEKEND...WHEN
WARMER TEMPS AND AT LEAST PARTIAL SUNSHINE ACTUALLY CREATE SOME 
INSTABILITY IN THE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING PERIODS.  

CHANGES MADE IN THE GRIDS WERE TO SLOW DOWN THE ARRIVAL OF LIKELY 
POPS FOR SWRN VA AND NE TN UNTIL WEDNESDAY NIGHT...DOWNPLAYED 
THUNDERSTORM PROSPECTS AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE WITHOUT ACTUALLY 
DROPPING...AND RAISED POPS OVERALL FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY 
NIGHT.  BRIEF UPPER LEVEL RIDGING BY SATURDAY AND SUNDAY...BUT STILL 
BOTH GFS AND DGEX BRING MORE SHOWERS AND STORMS...WHICH SEEMED A BIT 
SUSPECT TO ME (SO NO WEATHER OR POP ADJUSTMENTS MADE FOR THE WEEKEND 
PERIODS JUST YET).  FOR TEMPS...NOTICED THAT OUR MAX TEMPS WERE 
CONSIDERABLY WARMER THAN NEIGHBORS FOR THURSDAY MAXES...SO LOWERED 
HIGHS THURSDAY SIGNIFICANTLY CONSIDERING THE CLOUDINESS AND EXPECTED 
PCPN.  A FEW PRELIMINARY GRIDS ALSO MADE FOR THE NEW DAY 7 (TUESDAY).

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             80  63  71  63 /  30  70  70  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  80  61  72  61 /  10  40  60  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       81  60  70  59 /  10  30  50  60

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
800 PM EDT MON MAY 30 2005

.DISCUSSION...A RATHER COMPLEX WEATHER PATTERN IS IN PLACE OVER THE 
EASTERN U.S.  A FRONTAL BOUNDARY REMAINS STRETCHED ACROSS THE GULF 
STATES...A TROUGH AXIS OVER EAST TEXAS IS SLOWLY SHIFTING EAST...AND 
A WEAK SHORT WAVE IS MOVING ALONG A BOUNDARY TO OUR NORTH.  
ASSOCIATED PRECIP HAS FORMED ALONG THESE FEATURES.  HOWEVER...IT 
SHOULD BE A QUIET NIGHT OVER THE MRX CWA AS WE REMAINS GENERALLY IN 
BETWEEN THE BOUNDARIES.  MAIN LIFT AND MOISTURE ACCOMPANYING THE 
WAVE TO OUR NORTH WILL REMAIN TO OUR NORTH AND EAST WITH ONLY 
ASSOCIATED SCATTERED CLOUDS CONTINUING OVER NORTHERN ZONES.  THE 
FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO OUR SOUTH WILL SLOWLY LIFT NORTHWARD OVER TIME 
AS THE TROUGH AXIS SLIDES EAST...BUT MAIN PRECIP THREAT FROM THIS 
WILL HOLD OFF INTO LATE TUESDAY.  IN THE MEAN TIME...ASSOCIATED 
BANDS OF LOW CLOUDS WILL PUSH THROUGH OUR SOUTHERN AREAS BUT 
EXPECTED TO REMAIN DRY OVERNIGHT.  ALL LOOKS GOOD IN THE CURRENT 
FORECAST...WILL UPDATE LATE THIS EVENING TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EDT MON MAY 30 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...TOUGH FORECAST IN THE SHORT 
TERM AS WE HAVE A FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO OUR SOUTH OVER THE GULF 
STATES...AN UPPER TROUGH OVER EAST TEXAS AND A SHORT WAVE SINKING 
SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY.  LOW CLOUDS (AND EARLIER SOME 
LIGHT RAIN) HAVE PUSHED UP INTO THE SOUTHERN PARTS OF THE AREA...AND 
HOW FAR NORTH THESE CLOUDS WILL MAKE IT IS PROBLEMATIC.  LOOKS LIKE 
SHORT WAVE TO OUR NORTH SHOULD KEEP THE BULK OF ITS ENERGY TO OUR 
NORTH AND EAST...SO EXPECT LITTLE MORE THAN SOME CLOUDS IN THE NORTH 
FROM THIS FEATURE TONIGHT.  SHORT WAVE ENERGY EJECTING FROM TX 
TROUGH MAY BE A PLAYER TOMORROW...BUT THINK GFS DETAILS LOOK SUSPECT 
IN BRINGING SURGE OF MOISTURE AND LIFT NORTH SO QUICKLY...SO PLAN TO 
GO CLOSER TO THE SLOWER NAM.  UPSHOT IS WILL GO WITH QUITE A BIT OF 
CLOUDINESS SOUTH...AND HIGHER POPS...BUT NO HIGHER THAN CHANCE.  
WILL GO WITH LESS CLOUDS NORTH...AND DRY TONIGHT...THEN SLIGHT 
CHANCE TOMORROW AFTERNOON AS THERE MAY BE ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR A 
SHOWER/TSTM.   

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...WARM FRONT/SURFACE LOW 
PUSHING UP FROM SOUTH TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.  ETA A LITTLE 
SLOWER THAN GFS ON BRINGING DEEPER MOISTURE INTO CWA...WENT WITH A 
BLEND ON TIMING AND KEPT THE LIKELY POPS IN THE SOUTH AND CHANCE 
POPS IN THE NORTH FOR TUESDAY NIGHT.  BOTH MODELS SHOWING DEEP  
MOISTURE ACROSS REGION AS SURFACE LOW AND WARM FRONT TRACKS INTO 
REGION ON WEDNESDAY...SHOULD HAVE ENOUGH COVERAGE FOR LIKELY POPS  
ON WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  NOT MUCH INSTABILITY EXPECTED ON 
WEDNESDAY...THINK IT SHOULD BE MAINLY SHOWERS AND JUST ISOLATED 
THUNDER ON WEDNESDAY.  MOISTURE LINGERING INTO THURSDAY AS UPPER 
TROUGH PASSES...KEPT 50 POPS FOR THURSDAY.  SHORTWAVE ROTATES 
THROUGH ON FRIDAY...MOISTURE LIMITED SO KEPT ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.  ANOTHER FRONT PUSHING ON SUNDAY AND 
STALLS...ADDED CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 300737
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EDT MON MAY 30 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A TOUGH FORECAST TO PIN DOWN 
THIS MORNING AS ONLY LIGHT RAIN HAS PUSHED AS FAR NORTH AS EXTREME 
SE TN AND SW NC SO FAR.  MAIN WEATHER FEATURES LOOK TO BE THE UPPER 
TROUGH OVER TX AND FRONTAL BOUNDARY ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES.  
ANALYSIS OF UPPER AIR PLOTS REVEALS ISENTROPIC LIFT AS THE MOST 
LIKELY FORM OF LIFT THIS MORNING...BUT THIS LIFT DOES NOT HOLD FOR 
MUCH BEYOND THE MORNING HOURS CAUSING SOME UNCERTAINTY FOR LATER 
TODAY.  OF COURSE...NEW CONVECTIVE PCPN WILL DEVELOP TO OUR SOUTH 
LATER TODAY...AND I DID INCLUDE A MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS FOR OUR 
FORECAST AREA.  OTHERWISE...THINKING WAS LIGHT RAIN AS PCPN TYPE 
THIS MORNING AND KEPT THE VERY LOW POPS NORTH TO LIKELY FOR SE TN 
AND SW NC.  SOME INSTABILITY THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...ALTHO 
LOOKS TO BE ANOTHER COOL DAY (NOTING THAT HIGHS SUNDAY ENDED UP EVEN 
COOLER THAN THE COOLEST MAV MOS).  CHANGED PCPN TYPE TO SHOWERS AND 
ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING.

SHORT RANGE MODELS SEEM IN AGREEMENT ON THE MAIN NORTHWARD PUSH OF 
SHOWERS AND FEW THUNDERSTORMS NOT UNTIL TUESDAY AND/OR TUESDAY NIGHT.
POP GRIDS TONIGHT GENERALLY REFLECT A DECREASING TREND FROM NEAR AND 
AFTER 06Z TUESDAY UNTIL AN INCREASING TREND FOR LATER TUESDAY.  

FOR TEMPS...LESSON LEARNED FROM YESTERDAY LED ME TO GO WITH OR TO 
UNDERCUT THE COOLER MAV MOS HIGHS.  THE MOS BLEND FOR MINS TONIGHT 
LOOKED FINE.  POPS WERE DRAWN VERY CLOSE TO MOS BLEND...FROM LIKELY 
SOUTH TO 20 PERCENT OR LESS NORTH TODAY...THEN A BIT BELOW THE MOS 
BLEND FOR TONIGHT TO MESH WITH NEIGHBORS GRIDS AND ALLOW FOR SOME 
UNCERTAINTY.  


.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...BIG CHANGES...OR NOT? 
TOUGHEST DECISION IN A LONG TIME. MODELS FIRST FLIP FLOP, BUT AT 
LEAST TOGETHER. THEN THEY DIFFER BY 180 DEGREES. NOW WHAT? BEST 
DECISION IN MY MIND IS TO GO WITH CONTINUITY TO SOME DEGREE WITH 
SOME TWEAKS. TUESDAY NIGHT HAVE MAINTAINED POPS BUT TAKEN THUNDER 
OUT OF NORTHEASTERN PORTIONS OF AREA. WEDNESDAY SHOWS QUITE AMPLE 
RAINFALL OVER AREA, SO UPPED POPS TO BE IN LINE WITH SURROUNDING 
OFFICES, AS WE WERE WAY LOW. THIS SEEMS TO HAVE WORKED OUT GOOD. 
HOWEVER, ON WEDNESDAY INSTABILITY VERY LOW WITH LIS AROUND +6 OR 
HIGHER AND CAPES ARE JUST SILLY, SO TOOK THUNDER OUT ALTOGETHER ON 
WED. ALSO ADJUSTED MAX/MIN TEMPS TO ACCOUNT FOR MORE CLOUDS...LOWER 
DURING DAY, SLIGHTLY HIGHER AT NIGHT.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 300130
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EDT SUN MAY 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...01Z SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS MESO-HIGH MOVING OFF TO THE 
EAST OF MY FORECAST AREA. WITH LITTLE IN THE WAY OF A PRESSURE 
GRADIENT...VALLEY WINDS HAVE GONE CALM MOST LOCATIONS. ONLY TYS AND 
OQT HAVE A 3 KNOT WIND. CLOUD COVER REMAINS IN PLACE OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA AS EVIDENT BY IR IMAGERY. SEVERAL COMPLEXES OF SHOWERS 
AND THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH...BUT ONCE THEY 
MOVE NORTH OF BIRMINGHAM AL THEY START TO FALL APART IN THE MORE 
STABLE AIRMASS. KHTX RADAR SHOWS ONLY A FEW LIGHT SHOWERS ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN FORECAST AREA AT THIS TIME WITH A WEAKENING LINE OF -SHRA 
MOVING INTO NORTHWESTERN GEORGIA. 

.UPDATE...NAM AND GFS CONTINUE TO BE IN SOME DISAGREEMENT ABOUT 
FUTURE EVOLUTION OF THE FORECAST OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. GFS HAS A 
BETTER HANDLE OF WHAT IS GOING ON RIGHT NOW...SO WILL GIVE A LITTLE 
MORE WEIGHT TO THE GFS. BOTH THE GFS AND NAM INDICATE AN AREA OF 
WEAK MOIST ISENTROPIC LIFT ON THE 300K SURFACE BETWEEN 06 AND 12Z 
ACROSS MY SOUTHERN CWA. CONSIDERING THIS AND LIGHT SHOWERS ALREADY 
IN PLACE TO THE WEST...WILL GO AHEAD AND RAISE POPS TO CATEGORICAL 
BY 09Z ACROSS MY SOUTHERN COUNTIES. WILL KEEP THE POP LAYOUT THE 
SAME ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF THE FORECAST AREA. IT IS GOING TO BE 
VERY HARD TO SEE ANY PRECIPITATION ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SW VA 
OVERNIGHT WITH THE DRY AND STABLE AIRMASS...BUT A SLIGHT CHANCE  
EXISTS OF SEEING A STRAY SHOWER MOVE THAT WAY BY DAYBREAK...SO WILL 
LEAVE POPS IN. 

HAVE ALSO LOWERED MINS A COUPLE OF DEGREES AT CHA DUE TO 
TEMPERATURES ALREADY INTO THE LOW 60S THERE. CURRENT OBS FROM 
SURROUNDING AWS SITES IN THE CHATTANOOGA VICINITY ARE NEAR 60 AS OF 
9PM EDT...SO THINKING UPPER 50S SHOULD BE BEST AS LITTLE ADDITIONAL 
COOLING SHOULD TAKE PLACE. HAVE ALSO MODIFIED THE HOURLY TEMP GRIDS 
TO REFLECT EXPECTED TEMP FALLS OVERNIGHT. 

WILL MAKE CHANGES TO ZFP AND REMOVE ANY EVENING AND OVERNIGHT 
WORDING. GRIDDED PRODUCTS OUT SHORTLY.

HAVE A GREAT NIGHT

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC......NONE.
TN......NONE.
VA......NONE.

ON MON WITH THE BULK OF RAINFALL ALONG AND SOUTH OF KNOXVILLE. NE TN 
SHOULD BE THE WARM SPOT ACROSS THE AREA. THIS TREND CONTINUES INTO 
TUE WITH A GOOD CHC FOR CONVECTIVE COMPLEX WORKING INTO THE AREA ON 
TUE NGT AS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM SWINGS IN. MODEL TEMPS CLOSE THROUGH 
PERIOD AND WITH DECREASED DIURNAL RANGE DUE TO CLOUD COVER.

.LONG TERM....(WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...MODELS PUSHING SURFACE 
LOW AND WARM FRONT INTO THE REGION ON WEDNESDAY...WITH AMPLE 
MOISTURE AVAILABLE...KEPT CHANCE POPS GOING FOR WEDNESDAY.  SURFACE 
LOW TRACKS SLOWLY EAST OVER OUR AREA THROUGH MIDWEEK.  KEPT CHANCE 
POPS GOING FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.  A SHORTWAVE ROTATES THROUGH 
ON FRIDAY...MOISTURE LIMITED SO KEPT ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
FRIDAY. ANOTHER FRONT PUSHING INTO REGION FOR THE WEEKEND...SHOULD 
HAVE ADEQUATE MOISTURE FOR SOME SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
ON SATURDAY.  MOISTURE A LITTLE MORE LIMITED ON SUNDAY...SO ONLY 
WENT WITH 20 POPS FOR NOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HIGH PRESSURE WAS NOTED ACROSS 
THE REGION AT THE SURFACE.  A LACK OF SIGNIFICANT CLOUD COVER AND 
NEAR CALM WINDS HAD ALLOWED TEMPS TO DROP SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW GRID 
VALUES.  DEW POINT TEMPS ALSO QUITE A BIT LOWER DUE TO DRY AIR 
ACROSS THE REGION...SO FRESH DEW POINTS FROM NGM MOS WERE BROUGHT 
INTO THE GRIDS.  MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT THERE WONT BE MUCH 
INSTABILITY TODAY...NOR ANY DEPTH AT ALL OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE.  
THUS...LIKED THE PREVIOUS FORECAST/GRIDS WITH JUST SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS THIS AFTERNOON IN SE TN (CHA).  LATEST RADAR PICS SHOW 
LINGERING CONVECTION OVER THE LOWER MISS VALLEY REGION...AND I LIKE 
THE MESO-ETA AND RUC MODELS DEPICTION OF MOST CONVECTION TODAY 
STAYING JUST TO OUR SOUTH (AND ALSO TO OUR NORTH ACROSS THE OHIO 
VALLEY).


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...DITTO THE CONVECTION 
STAYING MAINLY TO THE SOUTH EARLY ON. AT LEAST MAJOR CONVECTION. WITH 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE SO LIMITED IT WILL TAKE SOME TIME TO GET IT 
GINNED UP ENOUGH TO DESTABILIZE THE AMS TO THE POINT OF CONVECTION 
UP HERE. HOWEVER, THAT WILL HAPPEN ENOUGH OVERNIGHT INTO MONDAY TO 
CREATE LIKELY POPS OVER MOST OF THE AREA, ESPECIALLY IN SE TN/SW NC. 
THE MODEL DISCREPENCIES MAKE US RUN THE RISK OF FLIP FLOPPING ON A 
MAJOR HOLIDAY AND SO HAVE STAYED WITH PREVIOUS POPS. STILL, NO MAJOR 
CONVECTION. ONLY FLY IS K INDICES IN THE 30S. WHILE NOT EXPECTING 
HEAVY RAINFALL AT THIS TIME, I COULD NOT RULE OUT ONE OR TWO CELLS 
WITH SUFFICIENT WARM RAIN PHYSICS TO DELUGE A VERY LOCAL AREA ON 
MONDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING.  REST OF WEEK UNCHANGED.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT)...LOW CONFIDENCE 
FORECAST AS MODELS STRUGGLE WITH STRENGTH AND POSITION OF SYNOPTIC
AND CONVECTIVE FEATURES. MODEL QPF IS A SHOTGUN BLAST OF AMOUNTS 
WITH TIMING DIFFERENCES THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. LEANED SLIGHTLY 
TOWARD NATIONAL GUIDANCE AND THE GFS WHICH IS TRENDING TOWARD A LESS 
WET MEMORIAL DAY WITH CONVECTIVE COMPLEXES MAINLY TO THE SOUTH.
MAIN PLAYERS IN EVENTUAL WEATHER OUTCOME ARE LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPING 
IN ELONGATED E-W TROUGH OVR W GRTLKS THROUGH MON AND SOUTHERN STREAM 
SHORT WAVE MOVING E OF THE MISSISSIPPI ON MON.   

TONIGHT...ISOLATED EVENING SHOWERS POSSIBLE BUT OVERALL DRYING TREND 
AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA. LEANED ON COOL SIDE OF 
GUIDANCE. SUNDAY...ELEVATED WARM FRONT MOVES N THROUGH AREA WITH LOW 
CHC POPS SOUTHERN AREAS. GFS APPEARS TOO WET AND CLOUDY SO FOR THIS 
PERIOD LEANED AWAY AND WENT WITH WARMER TEMPS. SUN NGT THROUGH MON 
NGT...CONVECTIVE COMPLEXES A GOOD BET SW OF AREA AND STORM TRACKS 
WILL DETERMINE EXTENT OF COVERAGE AND AMOUNTS ACROSS MRX CWA. AGAIN 
HAVE LEANED TOWARD A SOLUTION KEEPING THE BRUNT OF THE ACTIVITY 
SOUTH OF THE AREA.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS PUSHING SURFACE LOW 
INTO THE REGION TUESDAY AND SLOWLY TRACKING IT EAST INTO OUR AREA.  
WITH AMPLE MOISTURE AVAILABLE...KEPT CHANCE POPS GOING FOR TUESDAY 
THROUGH THURSDAY.  SURFACE LOW SHOULD BE EAST OF CWA BY FRIDAY ALONG 
WITH THE DEEP MOISTURE.  HOWEVER...UPPER TROUGH FOLLOWING ON FRIDAY 
WITH SOME RESIDUAL MOISTURE...KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EDT SAT MAY 28 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...500 MB TROUGH AXIS EXTENDS FROM 
THE OHIO VALLEY SOUTH INTO THE MID MISS VALLEY REGION THIS MORNING.  
SURFACE TO 850 MB ANALYSIS DOES NOT SHOW AS SIGNIFICANT OF A COLD 
FRONT AS YESTERDAY...ALTHO WELL NOTED NW TO SE DIFFERENCE IN DEW 
POINT TEMPERATURES ACROSS OUR FORECAST AREA (MID TO UPR 40S NW TO 
UPR 50S SE).  SEEMS THAT THE BEST UPPER LEVEL SUPPORT IS OVER THE 
OHIO VALLEY (AND MAY BRUSH SW VA AND NE TN)...WHILE THE BEST 
INSTABILITY IS GENERALLY FROM THE GULF COAST STATES INTO SE TN AND 
SW NC TODAY.  MOISTURE AND CLOUDS ON THE INCREASE AT THIS 
TIME...ALTHO LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IS A BIT LACKING.

STAYED QUITE CLOSE TO PREVIOUS POPS IN THE ZFP AND GRIDS...BUT DID 
ADJUST POPS UP SOME THIS MORNING TO BETTER MESH WITH RADAR TRENDS.
CHOSE SCATTERED SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS FOR SE TN...AND 
MAINLY A CHANCE OF SHOWERS ELSEWHERE EARLY TODAY.  DONT SEE HOW CHA 
COULD GET ANYWHERE NEAR 87 DEGREES FOR MAX TEMP...FAVORING THE MUCH 
COOLER MAV MOS FOR HIGHS TODAY GIVEN THE INCREASE IN CLOUDS AND 
HIGHER RAIN CHANCES.

FOR TONIGHT...DONT SEE MUCH THREAT OF CONVECTIVE PCPN BEYOND THE 
EVENING HOURS...WITH JUST A MINOR TWEAK OR TWO FROM PREVIOUS 
SKY/POP/WX GRIDS.   


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MAIN PROBLEM IS WHAT TO DO 
ABOUT LATE SUNDAY NIGHT...MEMORIAL DAY...INTO EARLY TUESDAY. SOME 
FLIP-FLOPPING OF MODELS ON THE HOLIDAY. COMPLICATED PATTERN, YET 
MAINLY ZONAL UPPER FLOW DURING PERIOD. FRONTAL ZONE APPROACHING AREA 
MONDAY WITH WEAK TO MODERATE INSTABILITY AND ADEQUATE MOISTURE. K 
INDICES ARE SO-SO LATE MONDAY. ALL ELEMENTS SEEM JUST ENOUGH OUT OF 
SYNC TO KEEP US SEVERE TSTM FREE. HAVE INCREASED POPS DRAMATICALLY 
IN THE MOUNTAINS DURING BBQ TIME ON MONDAY, AND KEPT THEM HIGHER 
INTO MONDAY NIGHT-EARLY TUESDAY. SAME IS TRUE FOR THE WHOLE AREA, 
THOUGH NOT AS DRAMATICALLY. HAVE ALSO INCREASED MIN TEMPS SLIGHTLY 
MONDAY THRU WEDNESDAY IN RESPONSE TO CLOUDS AND PRECIP. OTHERWISE NO 
CHANGES IN LONGER TERM.


000 
FXUS64 KMRX 271850
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT FRI MAY 27 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT) VISIBLE SATELLITE 
IMAGERY SHOWS CUMULUS DEVELOPING ACROSS THE CWA. MOST DEVELOPMENT 
SEEN OVER SW VA AT THIS TIME. RADAR IMAGERY FROM KJKL SHOWS A FEW 
SHOWERS DEVELOPING IN SOUTHEASTERN KENTUCKY. KMRX RADAR AT THIS TIME 
SHOWING ONLY A COUPLE OF WEAK RETURNS TO THE NORTH OF MY CWA. MSAS 
ANALYSIS HAS THETA-E RIDGE STILL IN PLACE OVER THE EASTERN THIRD OF 
THE FORECAST AREA AND MAY SEE A BRIEF SHOWER OR THUNDERSTORM DEVELOP 
LATER IN THE AFTERNOON. WILL LEAVE IN A MENTION OF A SHOWER OR 
THUNDERSTORM IN THE EVENING HOURS OF THE FORECAST.

MODELS IN BETTER AGREEMENT TODAY THAN YESTERDAY WITH BOTH NAM AND 
GFS SHOWING A SHORTWAVE MOVING INTO THE REGION EARLY SATURDAY 
MORNING AND THROUGH THE AFTERNOON HOURS. GFS MAINTAINS MCS-LIKE 
FEATURE FROM YESTERDAY JUST SLIGHTLY TO THE NORTH OF ITS PREDICTED 
POSITION 24 HOURS AGO. HOWEVER...THE GFS HAS BACKED OFF OF THE 
INTENSITY OF THIS SYSTEM. THE NAM IS NOW FALLING MORE IN LINE WITH 
THE GFS IN BRINGING A LINE OF CONVECTION INTO MY FORECAST AREA ON 
SATURDAY. THE NAM IS RUNNING ABOUT 6 HOURS SLOWER THAN THE GFS IN 
THE FIRST TWO PERIODS. HOWEVER...CONFIDENCE HAS INCREASED THIS 
FORECAST CYCLE AND WILL THEREFORE BE ABLE TO GO WITH SOME HIGHER 
POPS.

TONIGHT...WILL HAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE OF -TSRA IN THE FORECAST UNTIL 
00Z TONIGHT TO ALLOW FOR ANY AFTERNOON CONVECTION THAT MAY DEVELOP. 
COVERAGE IS EXPECTED TO BE ISOLATED AT BEST. AREAS IN SW VA AND 
MOUNTAINS OF NE TN APPEAR TO HAVE THE BEST CHANCE OF SEEING ONE OF 
THESE SHOWERS OR THUNDERSTORMS. GUIDANCE WAS AGAIN WARM AT TRI AND 
CHA BUT A LITTLE COOL AT TYS AND OQT LAST NIGHT. CONSIDERING 
MOISTURE MOVING IN DURING THE NIGHT FROM THE SOUTHWEST...WILL FOLLOW 
THE WARMER MAV NUMBERS A LITTLE CLOSER TONIGHT AND GENERALLY COME IN 
ONE DEGREE COOLER THAN THE MAV. CLOUDS SHOULD START TO BUILD IN 
AFTER 03Z THIS EVENING SW TO NE. WILL START SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
ACROSS WESTERN SECTIONS AT 00Z AND INCREASE TO CHANCE BY 06Z ALMOST 
ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. TIMING DISCREPANCIES BETWEEN THE GFS AND NAM 
PREVENT GOING HIGHER THAN 40 PERCENT ANYWHERE OVERNIGHT...AND FEEL 
GREATEST CHANCE FOR PRECIPITATION WILL BE AFTER 06Z.

SATURDAY...GFS INDICATES ONGOING CONVECTION IN THE FORECAST AREA BY 
DAYBREAK WHILE NAM IS JUST BRINGING IN PRECIPITATION TO OUR WESTERN 
COUNTIES. HAVE SPLIT THE DIFFERENCE ON THE TWO MODELS IN TIMING OF 
THIS SYSTEM WITH THE GREATEST CHANCES OF PRECIPITATION FALLING 
BETWEEN 12Z AND 18Z. CONFIDENCE HIGH ENOUGH AT THIS POINT TO GO WITH 
50 POPS CENTRAL AND SOUTH AND LIKELY POPS NORTH. IT SHOULD BE NOTED 
THAT MET GUIDANCE IS A GOOD 20 PERCENT HIGHER THAN MAV GUIDANCE. I 
FELT IT BEST TO STAY CLOSER TO THE MAV GUIDANCE AS IT HAS BEEN A 
LITTLE MORE CONSISTENT OVER THE PAST COUPLE OF DAYS WITH THIS 
FEATURE. TEMPERATURES WILL BE A LITTLE SUPPRESSED DUE TO ALL THE 
CLOUD COVER AND TSRA ACTIVITY. STAYED CLOSE TO THE WARMER MAV 
NUMBERS AGAIN IN THIS SITUATION. SPC HAS HIGHLIGHTED THE AREA JUST 
TO MY EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS IN A SLIGHT RISK FOR SEVERE WEATHER  
AND KEPT MY FORECAST AREA IN A GENERAL THUNDERSTORM SECTION. AGREE 
WITH THIS DECISION AS BEST INSTABILITY WILL BE EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS 
WHERE MORE HEATING CAN TAKE PLACE. STILL...THERE COULD BE AN 
ISOLATED STRONG THUNDERSTORM MOVE THROUGH TOMORROW AFTERNOON WITH 
THE MAIN THREATS BEING HAIL AND GUSTY WINDS. 

SATURDAY NIGHT...PRECIPITATION ENDS QUICKLY WEST TO EAST AS 
SHORTWAVE KICKS OUT WITH A WEAK RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE MOVING IN. 
BOTH NAM AND GFS AGREE PRECIP SHOULD END SHORTLY AFTER 00Z. WILL 
HAVE AREA PARTLY CLOUDY AND PRECIP FREE IN THE FORECAST BY 06Z. 
TEMPERATURES WILL BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN THE PREVIOUS NIGHT 
AND TOOK A BLEND OF THE MET AND MAV GUIDANCE AS THE MAV HAS BEEN TO 
WARM DURING RADIATIONAL COOLING NIGHTS.

SUNDAY...HIGH PRESSURE IN CONTROL FOR THE DAY...BUT EXPECT A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF -TSRA OVER THE PLATEAU...NE TN AND SW VA AS THE NAM AND 
GFS PROG AN AREA OF MOISTURE TO MOVE OVERHEAD. WITH PLENTY OF 
HEATING EXPECTED...CANT RULE OUT A STRAY SHOWER AND 
THUNDERSTORM...BUT EXPECT MOST OF THE AREA TO REMAIN DRY ON SUNDAY. 
TEMPERATURES WARM BACK TO NEAR NORMAL WITH HIGHS IN THE MID 80S 
SOUTH TO UPPER 70S NORTH. THIS IS A BLEND OF THE GUIDANCE.

SUNDAY NIGHT...WE WILL NOW BEGIN TO ENTER A VERY UNSETTLED PERIOD 
WITH THE GFS SENDING SEVERAL PIECES OF ENERGY TOWARD THE FORECAST 
AREA. GFS AND NAM BOTH HAVE A STORM SYSTEM ON OUR DOORSTEP BY 
DAYBREAK MONDAY AND HAVE RAISED POPS OVERNIGHT TO 40 SOUTH AND 30 
NORTH TO ACCOUNT FOR THE APPROACH OF THIS SYSTEM. WITH WARM 
SOUTHERLY FLOW...HAVE STUCK CLOSE TO THE WARMER MAV NUMBERS FOR 
TEMPERATURES SUNDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS BRINGING A SURFACE LOW 
INTO REGION ON MONDAY.  WENT WITH THE SLOWER DGEX AND HELD OFF BEST 
POPS UNTIL MONDAY AFTERNOON AND OVERNIGHT.  WITH AMPLE MOISTURE 
ADVECTING IN...WENT WITH HIGH CHANCE POPS.  HELD OFF ON LIKELY POPS 
SINCE MODELS STILL SHOWING SOME TIMING ISSUES.  DRIER WEATHER 
PUSHING IN TUESDAY...BUT WITH SOME RESIDUAL MOISTURE LINGERING...  
KEPT CHANCE POPS INTO TUESDAY.  PRECIP SHOULD BE ENDING TUESDAY 
NIGHT AND DRY WEATHER CONTINUING INTO WEDNESDAY.  MODELS INDICATING 
A SHORTWAVE APPROACHING WEDNESDAY NIGHT ALONG WITH THE RETURN OF 
MOISTURE...KEPT LOW CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY 
NIGHT AS TROUGH PASSES.  DRIER WEATHER RETURNS FRIDAY...BUT KEPT LOW 
POPS INTO FRIDAY WITH MODELS INDICATING ANOTHER SHORTWAVE MOVING 
THROUGH.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1001 AM EDT FRI MAY 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...FRONTAL BOUNDARY HARD TO FIND THIS MORNING. LEE 
TROFING PRESENT FROM CENTRAL VIRGINIA SOUTHWEST INTO CENTRAL 
GEORGIA. A WEAK DEWPOINT GRADIENT EXISTS ACROSS THE CENTRAL OHIO 
VALLEY ON 12Z SURFACE ANALYSIS. SATELLITE IMAGES SHOWS A LINE OF 
CLOUDS MOVING THROUGH MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND EASTERN KENTUCKY. THIS IS 
MOST LIKELY THE LOCATION OF THE FRONT AS MSAS HAS LARGEST GRADIENT 
OF THETA-E IN THIS LOCATION. 

AS PREVIOUS FORECASTER NOTED...NOT TO EXCITED ABOUT PRECIPITATION 
CHANCES TODAY...ESPECIALLY IN THE CENTRAL VALLEY. BOTH NAM AND GFS 
INDICATE A THETA-E RIDGE AT 850MB PERSISTING OVER THE MOUNTAIN 
COUNTIES IN TN AND NC THROUGH 21Z TODAY. THETA-E ADVECTION BECOMES 
STRONGLY NEGATIVE WEST TO EAST BETWEEN 15Z AND 21Z THUS HELPING TO 
LIMIT CONVECTION. 

POPS ARE ALREADY IN THE FORECAST AND WITH A GOOD WARMUP IN 
STORE...PREFER TO KEEP CURRENT POPS. BEST FORCING IN THE TN 
AND NC MOUNTAINS WHERE GREATEST INSTABILITY WILL EXIST THE LONGEST. 
MODEL SOUNDINGS HAVE VERY HIGH LCL HEIGHTS (800 MB AND ABOVE) DUE TO 
RELATIVELY DRY BOUNDARY LAYER. THIS WILL HELP PRECLUDE STORM 
DEVELOPMENT IN THE VALLEY LOCATIONS. ANY THUNDERSTORMS THAT DO 
DEVELOP ACROSS NE TN AND SW VA COULD POSSIBLY PUT DOWN SOME SMALL 
HAIL DUE TO COLD TEMPERATURES ALOFT...BUT THIS WOULD REQUIRE A GOOD 
SIZE THUNDERSTORM.  

FOR THE UPDATE...WILL REMOVE MORNING AND AFTERNOON WORDING AND TWEAK 
TEMPERATURES JUST A COUPLE OF DEGREES UPWARD WHERE A FEW SITES ARE 
COMING IN A LITTLE WARMER THAN CURRENT DIURNAL TRACE. GRIDDED AND 
ZFP PRODUCTS OUT SHORTLY.

HAVE A GREAT DAY

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT FRI MAY 27 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...HARD TO GET VERY EXCITED ABOUT 
RAIN CHANCES TODAY...WITH JUST ISOLATED COVERAGE LOOKING GOOD.  THE 
WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY DOES SHOW UP ON SURFACE AND 850 MB 
ANALYSIS...AND MAY VERY WELL LIE JUST ABOUT WHERE SOME VERY WEAK AND 
SPOTTY SHOWERS WERE NOTED FROM ERN KY SOUTH INTO MIDDLE TN.  OTHER 
THAN THIS BOUNDARY...TERRAIN SHOULD BE ANOTHER WEAK FOCUS DURING 
PEAK HEATING.  I GENERALLY LIKED AND ONLY SLIGHTLY MODIFED THE 
PREVIOUS 15-20% POPS IN THE GRIDS FOR TODAY...CHANGING TO SHOWERS 
FOR TYPE THIS MORNING WITH LITTLE INSTABILITY.  MOISTURE IS VERY 
LIMITED AND SOUNDINGS SHOWED A WEAK CAP AROUND 600 MB LEVEL...MORE 
REASONS NOT TO CARRY POPS MUCH ABOVE 20% POPS FOR TODAY.

FOR TONIGHT...THE RIDGING ALOFT HAS WEAKENED CONSISDERABLY AND OPENS 
THE DOOR FOR SOME POSSIBLE LATE NIGHT MCS ACTIVITY...TO BRUSH AT 
LEAST THE WRN AND NRN ZONES.  THIS SEEMS STILL A BIT UNCERTAIN FOR 
NOW...SO DONT SEE THE NEED FOR MORE THAN CHANCE POPS.  

OTHERWISE...ALLOWED FOR TEMPS TO WARM A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE THU MAXES
FOR HIGHS TODAY...THEN THE MOS BLEND WAS QUITE CLOSE AND ACCEPTABLE 
FOR MINS TONIGHT.  


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...NO CHANGES TO LONGER TERM 
FORECAST. REALLY THE ONLY CHANGE WAS TO THE POPS FOR MEMORIAL DAY. 
WITH ELONGATING, SLOWING FRONT IN VICINITY, BROAD AREA OF MID-LEVEL 
LIFT, AND ADEQUATE MOISTURE (ESPECIALLY TOWARD LATE AFTERNOON/EARLY 
EVENING), FELT THAT INCREASING POPS SLIGHTLY (WITHIN CHANCE CAT) 
WAS CALLED FOR.

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK AND DIFFUSE COLD FRONT 
STRETCHING FROM NEAR DETROIT SOUTHWEST TO NEAR MEMPHIS. SATELLITE 
IMAGES REVEAL ONLY A FEW HIGH CLOUDS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FRONT... 
AND AREA RADARS ARE DEVOID OF ANY PRECIP ALONG IT. THIS COLD FRONT 
IS PROGGED TO APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA AROUND SUNRISE...BUT WITH 
LIMITED MOISTURE AND THE MAIN UPPER DYNAMICS REMAINING NORTH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA...THINK THAT IT WILL REMAIN DRY EVERYWHERE OVERNIGHT.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 261850
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EDT THU MAY 26 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS AND SATELLITE IMAGE SHOWS MOSTLY CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY 
CONDITIONS PREVAILING ACROSS THE CWA TODAY. TEMPERATURES HAVE WARMED 
INTO THE MID 70S SOUTH TO LOW 70S NORTH. DEWPOINTS ARE BEGINNING TO 
APPROACH THE 50 DEGREE MARK. TO THE NORTHWEST...A WEAK FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY IS EVIDENT STRETCHING FROM CENTRAL MICHIGAN SOUTHWESTWARD 
TOWARD THE OZARKS OF MISSOURI. AIRMASS BEHIND THE FRONT IS NOT MUCH 
DIFFERENT THAT CURRENT AIRMASS WE HAVE IN PLACE...SO WHEN THIS WEAK 
FRONT PASSES LATER TOMORROW...DONT EXPECT MUCH OF A CHANGE IN THE 
OVERALL AIRMASS.

FOR THE FIRST 24 HOURS OF THE FORECAST MODELS REMAIN IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT WITH THE PASSAGE OF THE AFOREMENTIONED FRONT THROUGH THE 
CWA BETWEEN 12 AND 18Z ON FRIDAY. BOTH NAM AND GFS SHOW A MOISTURE 
SURGE AROUND THAT TIME. MOISTURE TRANSPORT VECTORS SHOW GREATEST 
INFLUX OF MOISTURE IN THE 925-850MB LAYER TO BE BETWEEN 09 AND 15Z 
TOMORROW. IT IS AT THIS POINT THAT WILL INTRODUCE POPS INTO THE 
FORECAST. AS FRONT IS VERY WEAK WITH LITTLE OR NO LIFT ASSOCIATED 
WITH IT...WILL ONLY PAINT POPS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. OTHER 
CONCERN WILL BE THE MINIMUM TEMPERATURE FORECAST. MODELS INDICATE 
DEWPOINTS MAY RISE SLIGHTLY OVERNIGHT IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT. CLOUD 
COVER WILL ALSO BE ON THE INCREASE. CLIMATOLOGY SHOWS MINS OCCUR 
AROUND 10Z HERE...JUST AT OR AFTER LOW LEVEL CLOUD COVER SHOULD 
ARRIVE. BOTH MET AND MAV GUIDANCE HAS HAD A WARM BIAS OVER THE LAST 
COUPLE OF DAYS AND WILL THUS CONTINUE TO GO A COUPLE OF DEGREES 
BELOW GUIDANCE ON MIN TEMPS TONIGHT. HAVE ADJUSTED HOURLY TEMP GRIDS 
TO INDICATE A STEEPER RISE IN TEMPERATURES AFTER 10Z THAN USUAL.

FRIDAY...WILL HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS MOST LOCATIONS EXCEPT THE 
TN/NC MOUNTAINS WHERE CHANCE POPS WILL BE PLACED. WITH DECENT 
HEATING EXPECTED AND COLD TEMPERATURES ALOFT (FREEZING LEVEL FALLS 
THROUGHOUT THE DAY TO A MIN VALUE OF 9500 FEET OVER OUR VA COUNTIES) 
I CANNOT RULE OUT AN ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM. AS AIRMASS DOES NOT 
CHANGE MUCH BEHIND THE FRONT...WILL FOLLOW MAV GUIDANCE CLOSELY HERE 
AS IT HAS PERFORMED BETTER ON MAX TEMPS.

FRIDAY NIGHT...FORECAST CONFIDENCE STARTS TO LESSEN HERE. WIDELY 
DIVERGENT SOLUTIONS BETWEEN THE GFS AND NAM. FOR THE LAST SEVERAL 
RUNS THE GFS HAS INDICATED A MCS MOVING ALONG THE SOUTHERN TENNESSEE 
BORDER TOWARD THE EAST OVERNIGHT FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY. YESTERDAYS 
RUN HAD THE MCS MOVING INTO THE CHA AREA BY 06Z...TODAYS RUN IS 
SLIGHTLY SLOWER. NEVERTHELESS...CONSISTENCY IN THE GFS DOES AT LEAST 
COUNT FOR SOMETHING. THE NAM HAS BEEN CONSISTENT IN INDICATING LOW 
CHANCE POPS WITH NO MCS OVERNIGHT. HAVE DECIDED...AFTER COORDINATING 
WITH OTHER OFFICES...TO PLACE A 30 POPS IN THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF 
THE CWA. THIS MAY NEED TO BE RAISED ON THE OVERNIGHT SHIFT AS 
CONFIDENCE INCREASES. GFS COULD BE HAVING SOME CONVECTIVE FEEDBACK 
ISSUES...BUT THAT WONT BE KNOWN UNTIL AFTER THE FORECAST VERIFIES. 
DYNAMICS NOT VERY IMPRESSIVE IN THE TENNESSEE VALLEY...SO GFS MAY BE 
OVERPLAYING ITS HAND. THAT BEING SAID...CANNOT DISCOUNT THE 
CONSISTENCY IN THE GFS. LIKE THE MAV TEMPS FOR MINS AND WILL FOLLOW 
THEM CLOSELY.

SATURDAY...NAM INDICATES WEAK IMPULSE MOVING THROUGH THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY ON SATURDAY WHILE THE GFS CONTINUES MOVEMENT OF THE 
AFOREMENTIONED MCS THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. EITHER WAY...EXPECT 
THERE TO BE GOOD CHANCES OF CONVECTION AREA WIDE AND HAVE GONE WITH 
30 PERCENT FOR THE FORECAST AREA AS CANNOT AT THIS POINT PREDICT 
WITH CONFIDENCE WHERE CONVECTION WILL OCCUR. WILL TAKE A BLEND OF 
THE MAV AND MET MOS HERE FOR TEMPS AS THE MAV IS PREDICTING COOLER 
TEMPS BECAUSE OF MCS ACTIVITY. 

SATURDAY NIGHT...BETTER AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE MODELS AS A DRY SURGE 
OF AIR PUSHES IN BEHIND WEAK IMPULSE DRYING OUT THE REGION AND 
PROVIDING FOR NO -TSRA OR -SHRA ACTIVITY. WILL CONTINUE NO POPS FOR 
SATURDAY NIGHT. WILL AGAIN TAKE A BLEND OF THE MET AND MAV MOS. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...MODELS INDICATING A WEAK 
SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH SUNDAY...MOISTURE LIMITED SO KEPT SUNDAY 
DRY.  A MORE ORGANIZED SYSTEM PUSHING IN ON MONDAY AS SURFACE LOW 
NEARS...SHOULD HAVE SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND LIFT FOR A LEAST 
SCATTERED PRECIP ON MONDAY.  GFS TRACKING SURFACE LOW ACROSS OUR 
AREA ON TUESDAY...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING ON TUESDAY.  BEST 
INSTABILITY REMAINS SOUTH ON BOTH DAYS...BUT WILL KEEP THUNDER IN 
FOR BOTH DAYS.  UPPER LOW FOLLOWS WEDNESDAY...STILL SOME RESIDUAL 
MOISTURE AND LIFT...SO KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING FOR WEDNESDAY.  
MOISTURE LINGERS INTO THURSDAY...BUT WILL KEEP THURSDAY DRY FOR NOW.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1025 AM EDT THU MAY 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...MORNING VISIBLE SAT IMAGES SHOWS ONLY SOME MID AND 
HIGH LEVEL CLOUDS STREAMING ACROSS THE NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE CWA. 
ALL VALLEY FOG HAD LIFTED OUT BY 1330Z GIVING THE AREA MOSTLY SUNNY 
SKIES. UPPER AIR ANALYSES REVEAL MID AND UPPER LAYER RIDGING MOVING 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA. AS THE RIDGE CONTINUES TO MOVE TO THE 
EAST...OUR HEIGHTS WILL RISE AND WILL ALLOW FOR TEMPERATURES TO WARM 
BACK INTO THE LOW TO MID 70S NORTH...UPPER 70S CENTRAL AND NEAR 80 
SOUTH. MOISTURE CONVERGENCE PLOTS SHOW WEAK DIVERGENCE IN THE LOWER 
LAYERS OF THE ATMOSPHERE...SO NOT WORRIED ABOUT PRECIPITATION 
DEVELOPING THIS AFTERNOON. EXPECT DEVELOPMENT OF CUMULUS TO COMMENCE 
SHORTLY OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN AND THEN IN THE VALLEYS. 
HOWEVER...EXPECT TO REMAIN PARTLY CLOUDY ALL AREAS.

NO UPDATE PLANNED TO THE CURRENT FORECAST AS TEMPERATURE TRENDS 
APPEAR GENERALLY TO BE ON TRACK WITH LOTS OF SUNSHINE IN TODAYS 
FORECAST.

HAVE A GREAT DAY

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
232 AM EDT THU MAY 26 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEAK RIDGING WILL CONTINUE TO 
BUILD IN TODAY.  AS A RESULT...LOW DEW POINTS WILL VERY SLOWING 
RISE...INCREASING HEIGHTS WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO MODERATE TO 
NEAR NORMAL LEVELS...AND THE AIR MASS WILL REMAIN RELATIVELY 
STABLE.  TONIGHT...THE UPPER RIDGE WILL DAMPEN AS A WEAK FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY APPROACHES THE REGION.  THE INITIAL PUSH OF THE BOUNDARY 
WILL REACH INTO THE MRX TOWARD MORNING.  IT HAS VERY LITTLE MOISTURE 
OR LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH IT AND EXPECT MAIN THREAT WILL BE AN 
INCREASE IN CLOUD COVER.  HOWEVER...WITH RESIDUAL LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
AND ADDED DYNAMICS FROM UPSLOPE FLOW...WILL KEEP SOME LOW POPS OVER 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF OUR NORTHEAST ZONES.

.LONG TERM...(FRI THROUGH WED)...MODEL TREND IS DRIER WITH WEAK 
FRONT EXITING AREA EARLY FRIDAY...AND WITH NO INFLUX OF GULF 
MOISTURE THINK 20 POPS FOR FRIDAY SHOULD SUFFICE. MODELS HAVING SOME 
DIFFICULTY WITH WEAK SHORT WAVE FEATURES THAT MAY AFFECT AREA FRIDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY.  TEND TO FAVOR THE NAM HERE...ALTHOUGH 
CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH.  WILL JUST CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE FRI NIGHT AND 
LOW CHANCE SAT.  WILL KEEP SUNDAY DRY...THEN GFS BRINGING 
SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM TO THE AREA FOR MONDAY INTO TUESDAY.  GIVEN POOR 
CONSISTENCY TRACK RECORD...NOT READY TO JUMP TOO HARD ON THIS...BUT 
WILL BUMP POPS UP SLIGHTLY FOR MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...AND LOWER 
MAX TEMPS A BIT. WILL GENERALLY LEAVE LATER PERIODS AS THEY ARE FOR 
NOW.

DMG





000 
FXUS64 KMRX 251832
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
231 PM EDT WED MAY 25 2005

.SHORT TERM...FINALLY THE UPPER LEVEL LOW PARKED OVER THE EASTERN 
SEABOARD FOR THE LAST TWO DAYS IS BEGINNING TO MOVE OFF TO THE 
NORTHEAST. HOWEVER...AS UPPER AIR ANALYSES REVEALED THIS 
MORNING...AREA WEATHER IS STILL UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF THE LOW. 
VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS CLOUDS CONTINUING TO MOVE TOWARD OUR 
REGION FROM THE NORTH. TODAY THERE ARE MORE BREAKS OBSERVED IN 
CLOUD FIELD...ESPECIALLY OVER OUR SOUTHERN COUNTIES. EXPECT CLOUDS 
TO DO MUCH THE SAME TONIGHT AS LAST NIGHT. SHORTLY AFTER SUNSET 
SHOULD START TO SEE MORE BREAKS NORTH AND EVEN CLOUDS DISSIPATE 
SOUTH. BY MORNING...CLOUDS SHOULD ONLY BE PRESENT NORTHERN SECTIONS 
AS THE LOW CONTINUES TO MOVE AWAY.

MODELS IN VERY GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE FIRST 48 HOURS OF THE 
SHORT TERM. RIDGING BACK TO OUR WEST AS OBSERVED ON 12Z UPPER AIR 
ANALYSES IS BUILDING IN BETWEEN H7 AND H3. RIDGING NOT WELL 
PRONOUNCED AT H85. NEVERTHELESS...AS THE RIDGE MOVES FURTHER TO THE 
EAST OVERNIGHT TONIGHT AND INTO TOMORROW...HEIGHTS WILL RISE CAUSING 
TEMPERATURES TO REBOUND SLIGHTLY. MOREOVER...CLOUD DEVELOPMENT 
TOMORROW WILL BE LIMITED TO FAIR WEATHER CUMULUS. NO PRECIPITATION 
IS EXPECTED.

INTO THURSDAY NIGHT...CLOUDS WILL SLOWLY BEGIN TO INCREASE FROM THE 
WEST AS THE NEXT DISTURBANCE APPROACHES. WILL INTRODUCE A SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF -TSRA EARLY FRIDAY MORNING AS A WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
APPROACHES. BIG DISCREPANCY IN THE MODELS IS HOW MUCH MOISTURE WILL 
BE PRESENT. NAM SHOWS LESS MOISTURE BUT HIGHER POPS. GFS SHOWS MORE 
MOISTURE BUT LOWER POPS. HAVE DECIDED TO TAKE A BLEND OF THE TWO 
MODELS AND TREAT THIS EVENT LIKE DIURNALLY DRIVEN CONVECTION. WILL 
KEEP POPS LOW CHANCE IN THE MORNING HOURS OF FRIDAY ALL ZONES AND 
THEN INCREASE TO 50 POPS IN THE NE TN MOUNTAINS AND SW VA. GO WITH 
40 POPS IN THE NORTHERN VALLEY...SMOKYS AND PLATEAU AND WILL INSERT 
30 POPS ELSEWHERE. THIS WAS DONE DUE TO OMEGA LIFT CROSS SECTIONS 
INDICATING THE BEST LIFT WOULD BE PRIMARILY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
AND GENERALLY IN THE NORTH OF I-40. 

MODEL SOUNDINGS FROM THE NAM INDICATE THAT THUNDERSTORMS THAT 
DEVELOP ON FRIDAY COULD BE POTENTIALLY STRONG TO SEVERE WITH MAIN 
THREATS BEING STRONG WINDS AND HAIL. WILL NOT INSERT ANY MENTION YET 
IN ZONES AS EXPECT ANY STORMS TO BE SCATTERED IN NATURE AND TOUGH TO 
PINPOINT AT THIS TIME. WILL GO AHEAD AND UPDATE HAZARDOUS WEATHER 
OUTLOOK TO INCLUDE MENTION OF ISOLATED SEVERE STORMS POSSIBLE DURING 
THE AFTERNOON HOURS ON FRIDAY. 

INTO FRIDAY NIGHT WILL SEE CONVECTION SLOWLY DIMINISH AS HEATING IS 
LOST BUT WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE OF PRECIP IN THE FORECAST AS GFS 
IS INDICATING ANOTHER WAVE MOVING INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
OVERNIGHT AND INTO SATURDAY.

FOR TEMPERATURES...EXPECT ONE MORE NIGHT OF UNSEASONABLY COOL 
CONDITIONS TONIGHT BEFORE A SLIGHT MODERATING TREND. SINCE MAV 
GUIDANCE HAS BEEN ON THE WARM SIDE LATELY...HAVE UNDERCUT MAV 
GUIDANCE A DEGREE OR SO FOR TONIGHT AND TOMORROW...BUT FOLLOWED IT 
CLOSELY FOR MIN AND MAX TEMPS FOR THE REST OF THE FORECAST PERIOD. 

.LONG TERM...(SAT THROUGH WED)...SCATTERED PRECIP LINGERS INTO 
SATURDAY BEFORE ENDING BY 00Z SUNDAY. UNCERTAINTY BECOMES QUITE HIGH 
BY 12Z MONDAY AS MODEL AND ENSEMBLE SOLUTIONS DIVERGE SIGNIFICANTLY. 
DID NOT MAKE ANY MAJOR CHANGES TO PREVIOUS GRIDS/FORECAST OTHER THAN 
TO LOWER SOME OF THE MIN TEMPS. ALSO INTRODUCED SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
FOR NEXT WEDNESDAY ALTHOUGH CONFIDENCE AGAIN IS NOT HIGH. FOR 
TEMPS...GFS MOS SEEMS REASONABLE EXCEPT FOR MAX TEMPS FOR NEXT 
WEDNESDAY WHERE HIGHER HEIGHTS ARE PROJECTED FOR THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION BY THE GFS ENSEMBLE MEAN THAN THE OPERATIONAL 
GFS. THUS WENT SLIGHTLY ABOVE GFS GUIDANCE VALUES FOR THAT DAY.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT RADAR HAS A FEW WEAK

MODELS SEEM WELL ON TARGET WITH MAIN WEATHER FEATURES AND TRENDS 
LOOK REASONABLE...SO SEE NO REASON TO STRAY FROM CURRENT GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS.


.LONG TERM...(THU THROUGH TUE)...WEAK RIDGING ALOFT AND SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE SHOULD KEEP THU DRY.  MODELS CONTINUE TO DEPICT FRONT 
AFFECTING AREA THU NIGHT/FRIDAY...BUT DIFFER A BIT ON THE 
DETAILS...INCLUDING TIMING.  THINK A COMPROMISE LOOKS REASONABLE FOR 
NOW.  MOISTURE LIMITED AND FORCING LOOKS UNIMPRESSIVE...SO WILL ONLY 
GO WITH 20 POPS FOR LATE THU NIGHT...30 POPS FOR FRIDAY WITH THIS 
FEATURE. UPPER LOW DROPS INTO GREAT LAKES AND NORTHEAST FRI AND 
SAT.  MAY BE SOME WEAK SHORT WAVE ENERGY ROTATING AROUND THIS 
FEATURE THAT WILL AFFECT THE AREA...BUT TOUGH TO TIME ANY WEAK 
WAVES THAT FAR OUT.  WILL KEEP 20 POPS FOR FRI NIGHT AND SAT FOR 
NOW...GIVEN UNCERTAINTY.  WILL KEEP SUNDAY DRY...AND DESPITE LATEST 
GFS FLIP FLOPPING BACK TO A DRY MONDAY...WILL KEEP MONDAY AND TUESDAY AS 
THEY ARE FOR NOW.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 241847
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EDT TUE MAY 24 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...RIGHT AROUND 17Z SHOWERS 
STARTED TO DEVELOP IN THE NORTHEASTERN CWA AND HAVE SINCE MOVED INTO 
NORTH CAROLINA. CURRENT RADAR TRENDS SHOW SOME SHOWERS STARTING TO 
DEVELOP NEAR THE KENTUCKY/VIRGINIA BORDER AND MOVING TO THE SOUTH. 
EXPECT THIS TO CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING HOURS WITH SOME LIGHT 
SHOWERS DEVELOPING AS THE VORT MAX MOVES OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

UPPER LEVEL LOW STILL ENTRENCHED ON THE EASTERN US KEEPING CLOUDY 
AND DOWNRIGHT COOL CONDITIONS FOR MAY IN THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. 
GOOD NEWS IS THAT THIS WONT LAST MUCH LONGER. 500 MB ANALYSIS SHOWS 
RIDGING OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS HEADING OUR WAY OVER THE NEXT COUPLE 
OF DAYS. SO EXPECT THIS PATTERN TO CHANGE BY THURSDAY.

NAM AND GFS BOTH IN AGREEMENT THROUGH THE SHORT TERM WITH ONE LAST 
VORT LOBE MOVING THROUGH TONIGHT GIVING A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWER 
ACTIVITY...PRIMARILY OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. HAVE SET UP POPS TO 
HAVE HIGHEST VALUES IN THE MOUNTAINS. KEPT POPS OUT OF THE CENTRAL 
AND SOUTHERN VALLEY AS MOISTURE AND SUPPORT JUST NOT THERE FOR 
DEVELOPMENT OF SHOWERS. SOME CONCERN EXISTS FOR SEEING PATCHY FOG IN 
THE NORTHEASTERN CWA IN LOCATIONS THAT RECEIVE SOME RAINFALL THIS 
EVENING. HOWEVER...IN SUCH A COOL AIRMASS IT IS NOT VERY LIKELY TO 
SEE FOG LIKE WAS EXPERIENCED THIS MORNING (TRI DOWN TO 1/4 SM). WILL 
NOT INCLUDE FOG IN ZONES AT THIS TIME.

FOR TOMORROW...UPPER LOW BEGINS TO MOVE AWAY AS RIDGING APPROACHES 
FROM THE WEST. HAVE REMOVED POPS AFTER 12Z WEDNESDAY FOR ALL ZONES 
AND WILL CARRY PARTLY CLOUDY EVERYWHERE TOMORROW. 

TEMPERATURES TONIGHT WILL BE ALMOST 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL IN 
PLACES. DONT SEE MUCH REASON TO DEVIATE TO FAR FROM MOS THIS 
EVENING AS WILL MAINLY BE A RADIATIONAL COOLING EVENT FOR CENTRAL 
AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS. FOR NORTHERN SECTIONS...WILL TAKE A BLEND OF 
THE MET AND MAV GUIDANCE. TEMPERATURES DO NOT WARM MUCH TOMORROW 
UNDER PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES...AS TEMPERATURES STRUGGLE TO CLIMB OUT OF 
THE MID 70S SOUTH AND MID 60S NORTHEAST. 

.MEDIUM TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...LATEST MODEL 
RUNS REVEAL A SLOWER PROGRESSION WITH THE NEXT COLD FRONT ON 
THURSDAY...WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE NOT EXPECTED ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA UNTIL FRIDAY MORNING. WITH LIMITED MOISTURE EXPECTED WITH THIS 
FRONT...WILL CONTINUE A MENTION OF ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY. MODELS INDICATE THAT ANOTHER BROAD UPPER 
LOW WILL DEVELOP OVER THE GREAT LAKES REGION...AND WILL CONTINUE A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE 
VALUES ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE MEDIUM RANGE PERIOD AND 
LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...UNCERTAINTY IS FAIRLY HIGH 
FURTHER OUT...BUT A WEAK SHORT WAVE MAY AFFECT THE AREA SAT...THUS 
20 POPS. WILL GENERALLY LEAVE LATER PERIODS AS THEY ARE FOR NOW. 
HEADING THROUGH THE WEEKEND AND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK...DGEX HAS LOW 
IN GREAT LAKES MUCH STRONGER THAN OTHER MODELS AND PUSHES FRONT AND 
CONVECTION FARTHER SOUTH FOR THE WEEKEND. IT DELAYS RETURN OF 
MOISTURE AND WARM FRONT TOO LONG. AM ALLOWING WARM FRONT PRECIP TO 
MOVE IN BY MONDAY AND INTO TUESDAY AS OTHER MODELS SUGGEST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1024 AM EDT TUE MAY 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...MORNING SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS FRONT THAT MOVED 
THROUGH OUR REGION YESTERDAY MORNING NOW NEARLY STATIONARY FROM 
CENTRAL MISSISSIPPI EASTWARD TO NEAR SAVANNAH, GA. VERY HIGH 
DEWPOINTS IN THE MID 70S SOUTH OF THE FRONT WHILE WE ARE REMAINING 
IN THE LOW TO MID 50S. SATELLITE IMAGE SHOWS A LAYER OF CLOUDS 
STARTING TO MOVE INTO THE CWA FROM THE NORTH. ALREADY SKIES ARE 
MOSTLY CLOUDY TO CLOUDY IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. A VERY LIGHT SHOWER 
IS ALSO OBSERVED ON KMRX RADAR MOVING THROUGH RUSSELL AND WASHINGTON 
COUNTIES IN VIRGINIA. FROM KNOXVILLE SOUTH (EXCLUDING THE SMOKYS) 
SKIES ARE MOSTLY CLEAR WITH TEMPERATURES ALREADY WARMING INTO THE 
LOW 70S. 

TAKING A LOOK AT THE NAM AND GFS SHOWS THE VORT PROGGED TO MOVE OVER 
THE REGION TODAY AT 18Z IS STILL ON TRACK FOR THAT TIME. 
PRECIPITATION LOOKS TO BE MOST LIKELY BETWEEN 18Z AND 21Z TODAY. FOR 
THAT REASON...WILL RAISE POPS SLIGHTLY...MAINLY OVER SW VA AND NE TN 
MOUNTAIN COUNTIES TO 40 PERCENT. NAM-40 SHOWS A VERY LOW FREEZING 
LEVEL OF 6500 FEET IN SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EXTREME NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE. WOULD NOT BE TOTALLY SURPRISED TO SEE A COUPLE OF ICE 
PELLETS IN THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS SHOULD SHOWERS DEVELOP.

ON THE UPDATE THIS MORNING WILL REMOVE ALL MORNING WORDING FROM THE 
ZONES. ALSO INCREASE POPS SLIGHTLY IN THE MOUNTAINS AND LOWER MIN 
TEMPS NORTHEAST ZONES A CATEGORY AS TEMPERATURES WILL RISE ONLY 
SLIGHTLY MORE (IF THAT) AS CLOUD COVER IS ALREADY FIRMLY ENTRENCHED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
248 AM EDT TUE MAY 24 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS IN REASONABLE AGREEMENT 
WITH ROTATING THE TAIL END OF A SHORT WAVE ACROSS OUR NORTHERN ZONES 
THIS AFTERNOON.  COMPARING SATELLITE IMAGERY...MODEL TIMING APPEARS 
REASONABLE AS WELL.  LITTLE IN THE WAY OF LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH WAVE 
AND MOISTURE IS LIMITED.  THIS WILL MINIMIZE SHOWER POTENTIAL...AND 
CONFINED PRECIP MAINLY TO NORTHERN AREAS.  A FEW RESIDUAL SHOWERS 
MAY REMAIN OVER OUR FAR NORTHEAST THIS EVENING AS THE WAVE EXITS THE 
AREA.  NORTHERLY FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO PULL IN A COOLER...MORE 
STABLE AIR MASS THROUGH TONIGHT.  GUIDANCE NUMBER LOOK GOOD AND WILL 
KEEP TEMPS CLOSE TO THESE.

.LONG TERM...(WED THROUGH MON)...MODELS CONTINUE TO DEPICT UPPER LOW 
PULLING AWAY WED AND THU...WITH ANOTHER UPPER LOW DROPPING INTO THE 
GREAT LAKES AND NORTHEAST FRI AND SAT.  IT WILL BE ON THE COOL SIDE 
WED...AND IT SHOULD BE DRY AS LATEST VORT LOBE ROTATING AROUND THE 
UPPER LOW MOVES OUT OF THE AREA.  DRY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THU...THEN 
NEXT WEAK FRONT APPROACHES AND MOVES THROUGH THU NIGHT AND FRI. IT 
APPEARS THAT THIS FRONT WILL NOT HAVE MUCH IN THE WAY OF MOISTURE OR 
FORCING WITH IT...SO JUST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS THU NIGHT AND 20 TO 30 
POPS ON FRI. UNCERTAINTY IS FAIRLY HIGH FURTHER OUT...BUT A WEAK 
SHORT WAVE  MAY AFFECT THE AREA SAT...THUS 20 POPS.   WILL GENERALLY 
LEAVE LATER PERIODS AS THEY ARE FOR NOW. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  79  52  73  53 /  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  72  49  70  51 /  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  71  50  70  50 /  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  65  47  67  47 /  30  10  10  10



000 
FXUS64 KMRX 231908 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATED
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EDT MON MAY 23 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...VERY GOOD AGREEMENT BETWEEN BOTH 
THE NAM AND GFS WITH POSITIONING OF UPPER LEVEL LOW. TIMING OF 
PRECIPITATION IS ALSO VERY CONSISTENT IN THE MODELS. BOTH INDICATE 
TWO VORT MAXES ROTATING THROUGH THE CWA OVER THE NEXT 24 HOURS. THE 
FIRST ONE TONIGHT BETWEEN 03Z AND 09Z WILL BE THE WEAKER OF THE TWO 
AND DELIVER ONLY A SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE OF SHOWERS OVER THE 
NORTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA. GFS HAS A LITTLE LESS MOISTURE 
THAN DOES THE NAM AND THUS POPS ARE SLIGHTLY LOWER. NEVERTHELESS... 
FEEL THAT SOME LOCATIONS IN THE NORTHERN THIRD...ESPECIALLY 
SOUTHWEST VA...WILL RECEIVE SOME SHOWERS WITH THE FIRST VORT.

BY 15Z TOMORROW SECOND (AND STRONGER) VORT APPROACHES FROM THE 
NORTH. BOTH MODELS SEEM TO WANT TO PLACE THE VORT MAX RIGHT OVER NE 
TN. FOR THIS ROUND OF PRECIP...HAVE RAISED POPS TO 40 IN SW VA AND 
NE TN MOUNTAINS...30 IN NE TN VALLEY...20 CENTRAL VALLEY AND NC 
MOUNTAINS AND WILL MENTION NO POPS IN SOUTHERN VALLEY WHERE MOISTURE 
AND LIFT WILL BE EXTREMELY LIMITED. CONSIDERED ADDING THUNDER TO THE 
ZONES TOMORROW GIVEN THE COOL AIR ALOFT WITH THE UPPER LEVEL LOW. 
HOWEVER...WITH LITTLE TO NO SURFACE INSTABILITY PRESENT...WILL KEEP 
JUST SHOWERS ONLY.

TEMPERATURES WILL BE BELOW NORMAL IN THE SHORT TERM. WILL GO THREE 
TO FOUR DEGREES BELOW GUIDANCE TONIGHT WITH HEIGHTS LOWERING AND A 
COOLER NW WIND BLOWING IN DESPITE THE POSSIBLE CLOUD COVER. 
MOREOVER...GUIDANCE HAD A WARMUP TODAY THAT DID NOT OCCUR... 
ESPECIALLY INTO SE TN. TEMPERATURES STRUGGLE TO REBOUND ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN CWA UNDER MOSTLY CLOUDY TO CLOUDY SKIES TOMORROW. LARGE 
TEMPERATURE CONTRAST BETWEEN SW VA AND SE TN TOMORROW DUE TO THE 
CLOUD COVER.

.MEDIUM TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...UPPER LOW OVER 
THE MID ATLANTIC STATES WILL MOVE EAST OUT OVER THE ATLANTIC ON 
TUESDAY NIGHT...WITH ANOTHER WEAK VORT LOBE ROTATING AROUND IT OVER 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING. GFS AND NAM 
MODELS INDICATE ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE WITH THIS VORT LOBE...SO WILL 
KEEP FORECAST DRY ON TUESDAY NIGHT FOR NOW. GFS MODEL ALSO REVEALS 
LIMITED MOISTURE WITH THE NEXT COLD FRONT ON THURSDAY...SO WILL ONLY 
MENTION SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR NOW. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE VALUES 
ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE PERIOD AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...TROUGH ACROSS THE EASTERN 
STATES CONTINUES WITH A RIDGE OVER THE WEST. A PAIR OF CLOSED LOWS 
WILL STILL STRETCH ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES STATES INTO THE NORTHEAST 
AND KEEP THE EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS IN A 
COOLER THAN NORMAL NORTHWEST FLOW PATTERN. ANOTHER COLD FRONT IS 
EXPECTED TO BRING A REINFORCING SHOT OF COOLER AIR AND DEEPEN THE 
TROUGH IN THE EAST EARLY FRIDAY. THE BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND A 
POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM WILL ALSO BE ACROSS SW VA AND EXTREME NE TN 
FRIDAY. AS THE TROUGH DIGS SOUTH FRIDAY AND SATURDAY HIGH TEMPS WILL 
BE A FEW DEGREES COOLER ACROSS NORTHERN AND CENTRAL SECTIONS AND FOR 
THIS TIME OF YEAR SOME 5 TO 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL. ALSO A STRONG 
SHORTWAVE ROTATING AROUND THE TROUGH SHOULD BRING ANOTHER SHOT OF 
SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS SATURDAY AFTERNOON OVER SW VA AND 
NE TN. LOWS SATURDAY WILL BE THE COOLEST OF THIS EXTENDED PERIOD IN 
THE UPPER 40S ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN.    

HIGH PRESSURE FROM SOUTH CENTRAL CANADA WILL DROP SOUTHEAST INTO THE 
TN VALLEY FOR THE WEEKEND. THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE OVER THE SOUTHWEST 
BREAKS DOWN THIS WEEKEND. A SYSTEM BEGINS DEVELOPING OVER THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS AND THE TROUGH OVER THE EAST FINALLY SHIFTS OUT INTO 
THE ATLANTIC. MOISTURE FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL MOVE INTO THE 
TN VALLEY MONDAY BUT NOT BE ENOUGH TO ADD PRECIPITATION FOR THE LAST 
DAY. TEMPERATURES WILL WARM BOTH AT NIGHT AND DURING THE DAY SUNDAY 
AND MONDAY.                 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             56  79  52  76 /  10  10   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  55  71  50  72 /  20  20   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       55  70  49  72 /  20  20   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              52  64  47  68 /  30  30   0   0 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC......NONE.
TN......NONE.
VA......NONE.
&&

FXUS64 KMRX 231425
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1025 AM EDT MON MAY 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...VISIBLE SATELLITE IMAGERY SHOWS LOW LEVEL CLOUDINESS 
LIFTING OUT THIS MORNING AS HEATING BEGINS. OVER THE MID SOUTH...A 
DECAYING MCS IS SENDING MID AND UPPER LEVEL CLOUD COVER OVER MY 
SOUTHWESTERN ZONES. THIS FEATURE WILL NECESSITATE LOWERING MAX 
TEMPERATURES A CATEGORY AROUND CHATTANOOGA. 

POSITION OF UPPER LEVEL LOW IS A LITTLE FURTHER NORTH THAN 
PREVIOUSLY FORECASTED. PER ETA12 MODEL WILL SEE A FINE DIVIDING LINE 
OF CLOUD COVER AND MOISTURE ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APALACHIANS. AT THIS 
POINT...FEEL VERY CONFIDENT THAT FOR MOST OF THE DAY SW VA AND NE TN 
WILL REMAIN PARTLY CLOUDY AND DRY AS MOST OF THE MOISTURE AND OMEGA 
LIFT REMAINS JUST TO OUR NORTH. THAT BEING SAID...HAVE LOWERED POPS 
TO SLIGHT CHANCE FOR SW VA...NE TN...AND THE SMOKIES. WITH COLD AIR 
ALOFT WILL CONTINUE MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS.

SOME CONCERN EXISTS WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF STRONG WINDS ACROSS THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. ETA12 HAS WINDS 20 TO 30 KTS THIS AFTERNOON. 
HOWEVER...CURRENT OBSERVATIONS SHOW WINDS COMING IN ABOUT 5 KTS 
BELOW MODEL FORECAST. WILL KEEP CURRENT WIND GRIDS IN PLACE...BUT 
WILL HOLD BACK ON A WIND ADVISORY. INSTEAD...I WILL ENHANCE THE 
WORDING IN THE ZFP TO INCLUDE SUSTAINED WINDS 15 TO 25 MPH WITH 
GUSTS 30 TO 40 MPH IN THE MOUNTAIN GROUPS.

ZFP AND GRIDDED PRODUCTS OUT SHORTLY.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 230812
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 AM EDT MON MAY 23 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RADAR SHOWS SHOWERS AND A FEW 
THUNDERSTORMS MOVING THROUGH NORTHERN AREAS AHEAD OF THE APPROACHING 
COLD FRONT.  MOST OF THIS ACTIVITY SHOULD EXIT THE AREA BY THE 
BEGINNING OF THE TODAY PERIOD. MODELS HAVE SOME DIFFERENCES IN 
HANDLING UPPER LOW IN NORTHEAST AND SHORT WAVE ENERGY ROTATING 
AROUND IT.  WILL GENERALLY GO CLOSER TO THE NAM SOLUTION...IN 
AGREEMENT WITH HPC.  SHOULD BE BREEZY TODAY BEHIND THE FRONT...AND 
RATHER WARM IN CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY AS COLDER AIR LAGS AND 
DOWNSLOPE OFF THE PLATEAU HELPS BOOST TEMPS.  MAY SEE A FEW SHOWERS 
OR THUNDERSTORMS IN NORTHERN AREAS THIS AFTERNOON...BUT THINK 
INSTABILITY WILL BE LIMITED. WILL ONLY CARRY 20 TO 30 POPS NORTH AND 
SMOKIES.  TONIGHT AS VORT LOBE MOVES ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS...SHOULD 
SEE MORE CLOUDS NORTH AND PERHAPS A FEW SHOWERS...WILL CARRY 20 TO 
30 POPS AGAIN NORTH.  MAV TEMPS GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO ONLY 
A FEW MINOR TWEAKS.            

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...REX BLOCK OVR ERN CANADA WILL 
DOMINATE THE WX PATTERN EARLY IN THE FCST PERIOD AS UPR LVL LOW HAS 
NO WHERE TO GO AND THUS WILL SPIN LOBES OF VORTICITY ACROSS THE 
CENTRAL AND SRN APPALACHIANS KEEPING SLGT TO LOW CHC POPS GOING 
ACROSS SW VA/NE TN AND TERRAIN AREAS ALONG NC BORDER. MUCH OF THE 
REMAINDER OF THE FA WILL BE DRY HOWEVER. PATTERN FINALLY RELENTS 
ALLOWING FOR AN APPROXIMATE 24 HR PERIOD EXTENDING INTO THU MORNING 
FREE FROM THE THREAT OF RAIN FOR THE ENTIRE AREA. YET ANOTHER UPR 
TROF AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM WILL MOVE SE ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES AND BUILD SLOWLY SE THRU MUCH OF THE ERN THIRD OF THE NATION 
INTO THE FIRST HALF OF THE WEEKEND INCREASING THE CHC FOR SHRA/TSRA 
THU AFTERNOON THRU FRI NITE. THE CHC FOR RAIN SHOULD END FOR MOST OF 
THE REGION SAT WITH THE EXCEPTION OF SW VA/NE TN WHERE ENERGY WILL 
CONTINUE TO ROTATE AROUND THE BACK SIDE OF DEPARTING UPR TROF. 
HEIGHTS SHOULD RISE SUFFICIENTLY FOR THE ENTIRE FA BY SUN TO KEEP 
PRECIP OUT OF THE FCST. STAYED PRETTY CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS WHICH 
FEATURE A FAIRLY DECENT NE-SW TEMPERATURE GRADIENT AS MORE SEASONAL 
WARMTH OCCURS ON THE PERIPHERY OF THE PERSISTENT NERN U.S. UPR TROF 
KEEPING TEMPS ACROSS SE TN A LITTLE CLOSER TO CLIMATOLOGY ESPECIALLY 
LATER IN THE PERIOD. BELOW NORMAL TEMPS WILL BE THE RULE WITH SOME 
MODERATION BY THE WEEKEND FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FA.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 221916
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 PM EDT SUN MAY 22 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...LATEST SATELLITE PICTURES 
AND RADAR DATA SHOWS A COLD FRONT ACROSS IL AND MO WITH A SHORTWAVE 
OVER THE OHIO VALLEY WHICH IS BRINGING SHOWERS TO OH AND WV MOVING 
INTO VA. NEW THUNDERSTORM COMPLEX IS DEVELOPING NEAR THE POINT WHERE 
AR OK AND KS COME TOGETHER WHERE THE COLD FRONT IS STALLED. IN THE 
UPPER LEVELS A STRONG RIDGE CONTINUES OVER THE SOUTHWEST WITH TWO 
UPPER LEVEL LOWS OVER THE EASTERN US ONE OVER MASSACHUSETTS AND THE 
DEEPER LOW ALONG THE MN AND ONTARIO BORDER WHICH IS ASSOCIATED WITH 
THE COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE MS VALLEY. THE MODELS MOVE THE MCS 
SOUTHEAST JUST SOUTH OF THE FRONT AND KEEP MOST OF THE ENERGY WITH 
THE FRONT ITSELF TO THE NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA AND MOVE THE BULK 
OF THE PRECIPITATION THROUGH THE OHIO VALLEY INTO THE MID ATLANTIC. 
I AM NOT VERY CONFIDENT OF ANY SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION FOR THE 
EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE BEST CHANCE 
FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL BE LATE THIS EVENING THROUGH 
ABOUT MID MORNING MONDAY. THE AIRMASS IS STILL STABLE THIS AFTERNOON 
BUT BECOMES UNSTABLE LATER TONIGHT WITH MID TO UPPER LEVEL WINDS 
INCREASING MONDAY. MOISTURE DECREASES RAPIDLY MONDAY ACROSS CENTRAL 
AND SOUTHERN SECTIONS AFTER 12Z BEHIND THE FRONT. PUT THE HIGHEST 
POPS SW VA MONDAY AS UPPER LOW OVER MN MOVES SE AND MERGES WITH 
PERSISTENT LOW ACROSS THE NE STATES. FLOW BECOMES MORE NORTHERLY 
AS UPPER LOW ENLARGES OVER THE EASTERN STATES MONDAY. TEMPERATURES 
SHOULD BE MILDER TONIGHT WITH EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER LATER AND COOLER
ACROSS THE NORTHEAST HALF MONDAY WITH LOWERING HEIGHTS AND A CHANCE
OF RAIN.      

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...CLOSED UPPER TROUGH ACROSS
THE MID-ATLANTIC AND EASTERN GREAT LAKE STATES WILL MOVE SLOWLY SOUTHEAST
ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS INTO VA/NC BY LATE TUESDAY AND 
WEDNESDAY.  SCATTERED SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A THUNDERSTORM ARE 
EXPECTED...MAINLY DURING THE AFTERNOON/EVENING TUESDAY AS COLD AIR ALOFT
HELPS DESTABILIZE THE AIR-MASS.

UPPER TROUGH WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA FOR WEDNESDAY WITH SURFACE RIDGING
BUILDING INTO THE REGION PRODUCING DRY CONDITIONS. NEXT UPPER TROUGH WILL
SWINGS SOUTHEAST FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS TOWARD THE OHIO VALLEY/GREAT
LAKES AREA FOR LATE THIS WEEK.  ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT WILL SWEEP THROUGH
THURSDAY NIGHT AND EARLY FRIDAY...SO HAVE CONTINUED CHANCE OF SHOWERS
AND THUNDERSTORMS LATE THURSDAY THROUGH MAINLY FRIDAY MORNING. COLD FRONT
BECOMES STATIONARY ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES FOR NEXT WEEKEND...BUT
UPPER TROUGH MAY SWING SOUTH ENOUGH TO DESTABILIZE AIRMASS FOR 
SCATTERED CONVECTION OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE 
SATURDAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

OAK RIDGE, TN                       61  79  54  69 /  30  20  20  10

WOBBLES FAR ENOUGH AWAY TO THE NORTH AND EAST TO ALLOW A DRY DAY WED 
BEFORE ANOTHER S/WV AND COLD FRONT PUSH THRU THE MIDWEST INTO THE

.DISCUSSION...NO UPDATES PLANNED TONIGHT.  FEW MID/HIGH CLOUDS

FOR THE REST OF TONIGHT.  TEMPERATURES LOOK GOOD...NO CHANGES NEEDED.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 PM EDT SAT MAY 21 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...LATEST VISIBLE SATELLITE IS 
STILL SHOWING QUITE A BIT OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ESPECIALLY ALONG THE 
KY/VA AND TN/KY BORDER. ALSO NEAR THE TN/GA BORDER. A WIDE RANGE OF 
AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES WERE OBSERVED DEPENDING ON HOW LONG THE LOW 
CLOUDS HUNG AROUND. CURRENT ANALYSIS HAS AN UPPER LEVEL LOW IN THE 
NORTHEAST. HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHERN GREAT LAKES AND OHIO 
VALLEY AND A SHORTWAVE OVER EASTERN IOWA AND WISCONSIN MOVING 
SOUTHEAST AROUND A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE 
SOUTHWESTERN STATES. BEHIND THE SHORTWAVE WAS A COLD FRONT THAT 
STRETCHED FROM THE NORTHERN PLAINS INTO THE CENTRAL ROCKIES. LOWER 
PRESSURE FORMING AN INVERTED TROUGH WAS OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
DURING THE NEXT 24 HOURS THE SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST TOWARD 
THE FORECAST AREA. AS THE SUN SETS SKIES SHOULD BECOME MOSTLY CLEAR 
WITH CLOUDS INCREASING BY AFTERNOON SUNDAY. HOWEVER THERE IS LIKELY 
TO BE SOME CIRRUS SPREADING IN BY MORNING FROM ANY THUNDERSTORM 
DEVELOPMENT OVERNIGHT FAR TO THE NORTHWEST. PREFER THE GFS SOLUTION 
WHICH BRINGS A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO EASTERN TN 
VALLEY MAINLY AFTER 23/00Z. ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF STORMS TO THE 
NORTHERN PLATEAU DURING THE LATE AFTERNOON. SPC PUTS A SLIGHT CHANCE 
OF SEVERE STORMS JUST TO THE BORDER FOR DAY TWO. ANY ACTIVITY DURING 
THE DAY SUNDAY SHOULD BE ISOLATED AND MORE ORGANIZED CONVECTION 
SHOULD HOLD OFF UNTIL EVENING.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...RIDGE NOW WEST OF US 
DROPS A SHORT WAVE OVER THE TOP (CURRENTLY DISINTEGRATING OVER IOWA) 
LATE SUNDAY AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING. THE REMNANTS OF THIS WILL 
COMBINE WITH FROPA IN THE WEE HOURS OF MONDAY TO PROVIDE SHOWERS AND 
TSTMS INTO MONDAY. HAVE INCREASED POPS SLIGHTLY ON MONDAY AND MONDAY 
NIGHT TO ACCOUNT. SLIGHT RISK MONDAY NIGHT FOR SEVERE, AND FEEL THAT 
ANY SEVERE TSTMS WILL BE BORDERLINE AND WILL PULSE MAKING FOR A LONG 
EVENING.

MIDWEEK KEPT STATUS QUO WITH STABILIZING ATMOSPHERE. BY THURSDAY 
ANOTHER FROPA WITH COOLER TEMPS AND TSTMS. INCREASED POPS (BUT 
MAINTAINED CATEGORIES) SLIGHTLY LATE NEXT WEEK ON STRENGTH OF 
SYSTEMS DEPICTED IN MODELS.

ACROSS CENTRAL/SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TO REQUIRE SLGT/SMALL CHC POPS

DRIED OUT ENTIRE FA TUE NITE THRU WED AS UPR LOW FINALLY MOVES AWAY 
TO THE E ALLOWING PRESSURE TO RISE FOR A BRIEF TIME. NEXT UPR TROF 
FRONTAL SYSTEM STILL ON SCHEDULE TO RAISE PROBABILITY OF -SHRA/TSRA 
THU AND FRI AND MAINTAINED FROM PREVIOUS FCST. TEMP FCST PROBLEMATIC 
TO SOME DEGREE WITH MOS HIGHER THAN PREVIOUS PACKAGE NUMBERS. STAYED 
A LITTLE BELOW SUGGESTED MAX TEMPS AND A LITTLE ABV MINS IN COOLER 
AND SOMEWHAT MOIST REGIME ADVERTISED BY MODELS FOR THE LONG TERM 
FCST.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 201929
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
329 PM EDT FRI MAY 20 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...UPPER TROUGH IS CURRENTLY 
LOCATED OVER EAST TENNESSEE WITH SHORTWAVE TRIGGERING AREA OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FROM THE NORTHERN PLATEAU AND THE CENTRAL 
VALLEY. SATELLITE SHOWS SOME MID LEVEL COOLING ALONG THE AXIS OF THE 
TROUGH ON THE WESTERN EDGE OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS AREA IS MOVING 
SLOWLY SOUTHEAST PRODUCING HEAVY RAINFALL...WITH THE STRONGEST STORM 
POSSIBLY PRODUCING LARGE HAIL AND HIGH WINDS OVER MORGAN COUNTY. 
OTHER SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS ARE OCCURRING ALONG A LINE OVER 
NORTHERN AL INTO CENTRAL GA. SURFACE CHART SHOWS LOW PRESSURE OVER 
EAST CENTRAL TN WITH A COLD FRONT ALONG THE TN/VA BORDER STRETCHING 
TO THE WEST TO NEAR JACKSON TN. SOME HEATING THIS AFTERNOON HAS 
CONTRIBUTED TO ENOUGH INSTABILITY FOR THE SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
TO DEVELOP. THE THREAT FOR SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL PERSIST 
INTO EARLY EVENING AS THE ACTIVITY MOVES SLOWLY SOUTH. HEAVY 
RAINFALL WILL BE A THREAT FOR FLOODING ESPECIALLY OVER THE PLATEAU 
AND CENTRAL VALLEY WHERE OVERNIGHT RAINS OF UP TO TWO INCHES 
SATURATED THE SOIL. BEHIND THE FRONT SKIES SHOULD SLOWLY CLEAR LATE 
TONIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY WITH PATCHY FOG FORMING IN AREAS THAT 
RECEIVED HEAVY RAINFALL. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN SATURDAY WITH 
CLEARING SKIES AND LOWER DEWPOINTS. SOME CU WILL STILL BE AROUND 
DURING THE AFTERNOON. FOLLOWED GFS GENERALLY FOR LOWS TONIGHT AND 
HIGHS SATURDAY.   

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...

SATURDAY NIGHT...CLEARING SKIES WILL PREVAIL SATURDAY NIGHT AS 
TEMPERATURES DROP TO COOLER VALUES THAN SEEN THE LAST FEW DAYS. 11 
DEGREE DIFFERENCE FORECASTED BETWEEN THE NORTHERN END OF OUR 
FORECAST AREA AND SOUTHERN END OF OUR FORECAST AREA PER MAV GUIDANCE 
WHICH WAS FOLLOWED CLOSELY.

SUNDAY...A TRANSITIONAL DAY AS A SURFACE HIGH MOVES EAST OF THE 
REGION CREATING A SOUTHERLY FLOW AHEAD OF THE QUICKLY MOVING FRONTAL 
SYSTEM OUT OF THE NORTHWEST. CLOUDS WILL BE ON THE INCREASE IN THE 
AFTERNOON HOURS AS THE FRONT APPROACHES. EXPECT A SLIGHT CHANCE OF 
SHOWERS OVER OUR NORTHWESTERN ZONES AFTER 18Z AS ENOUGH HEATING AND 
NEARBY MOISTURE COULD PRODUCE A FEW SHOWERS. HAVE PREFERRED THE GFS 
FORECAST FOR THIS FRONT AS IT HAS PERFORMED WELL WITH TODAYS STORM 
SYSTEM.

SUNDAY NIGHT...BULK OF PRECIPITATION WILL FALL IN THIS PERIOD. HAVE 
INCREASED POPS TO LIKELY ALL BUT SOUTHWESTERN CWA. THIS WAS DONE 
BECAUSE GFS GUIDANCE INDICATES LIKELY POPS WITH APPROACHING SYSTEM. 
A LITTLE CONCERNED TO GO SO HIGH WITH POPS SO FAST DUE TO GFS 
ENSEMBLES INDICATING A WIDE SPREAD OF SOLUTIONS. HOWEVER...GOOD RUN 
TO RUN CONSISTENCY OF THE GFS AND EXCELLENT AGREEMENT WITH THE NAM 
PROVIDE ENOUGH CONFIDENCE TO HOIST POPS SO HIGH.  

MONDAY AND TUESDAY...AS FRONT CLEARS THE AREA RAPIDLY IN THE MORNING 
HOURS...CLOUDS WILL CLEAR ONLY BRIEFLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN CWA AS AN 
UPPER LEVEL LOW SPIRALS IN LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND CLOUD COVER. 
PRECIPITATION CHANCES WILL REMAIN IN THE FORECAST THROUGH THESE 
PERIODS AS UPSLOPE COMPONENT IS PRESENT ALONG WITH NECESSARY 
MOISTURE. POPS ONLY IN THE CHANCE CATEGORY...BUT HIGHEST IN THE 
UPPER ELEVATIONS. HAVE ADDED THUNDERSTORMS TO THE FORECAST DUE TO 
COLD AIR ALOFT AND THE POSSIBILITY OF THUNDERSTORMS...HOWEVER MOST 
PRECIPITATION WILL BE -SHRA.

WEDNESDAY...MID LEVEL RIDGING BEGINS TO MOVE EASTWARD AND KICK THE 
UPPER LEVEL LOW OUT OF THE PICTURE...BUT ENOUGH MOISTURE REMAINS TO 
KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ACROSS OUR NORTHERN CWA. AS TEMPERATURES 
WARM TO NEAR 80 SOUTH AND MID 70S NORTH.

THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...YESTERDAYS 00 AND 12Z GFS INDICATED A LARGE 
PIECE OF ENERGY AND MCS MOVING INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY ON THESE 
DAYS. DIDNT GO WITH THE GFS ON THIS SYSTEM YESTERDAY. DECIDED TO 
FOLLOW THE GFS CLOSER TODAY WHEN IT AGAIN INDICATED A RATHER LARGE 
AREA OF PRECIPITATION AND LIFT ACROSS MY CWA IN NEARLY THE SAME 
LOCATION AS YESTERDAY. HAVE RAISED POPS TO 40 PERCENT ON THURSDAY 
AND FRIDAY AT THIS POINT IN LINE WITH MEX GUIDANCE AND TO MATCH WELL 
WITH SURROUNDING OFFICES. 

TEMPERATURES THROUGH EACH PERIOD WERE SET WITH A BLEND OF THE MAV 
GUIDANCE AND WERE UNDERCUT SLIGHTLY ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY TO ACCOUNT 
FOR THE UPPER LEVEL LOW.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             61  81  59  83 /  20  10  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  58  78  56  80 /  20  10  10  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       57  77  56  80 /  20  10  10  20 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              53  74  49  74 /  30  10  10  20

.DISCUSSION...LINE OF STRONG THUNDERSTORMS MOVING ACROSS SOUTHEAST

ACROSS THE NORTHERN TWO THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH ONLY LIGHT

SOUTHWEST FROM THE NORTHEAST STATES INTO THE MID MS VALLEY. ANOTHER 
SHORT WAVE MOVING SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY AND EASTERN 
TENNESSEE VALLEY LATE THIS MORNING AND AFTERNOON WILL INCREASE 
PRECIPITATION LATER TODAY. THE BEST CHANCE OF STRONG STORMS WILL BE 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN VALLEY. THIS WILL DEPEND ON 
THE AMOUNT OF SUN THIS AFTERNOON TO DESTABILIZE THE ATMOSPHERE. 
HIGHS COULD STILL REACH THE UPPER 70S TO NEAR 80 SOUTHERN SECTIONS. 
UPDATE OUT SHORTLY TO DROP SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WATCH AND DECREASE 
POPS SOME FROM THE CURRENT 100 PERCENT OVER MOST OF FORECAST AREA.
