
000 
FXUS64 KMRX 191902
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
302 PM EDT THU MAY 19 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...COLD FRONT OVER MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION OVERNIGHT TONIGHT BRINGING 
CATEGORICAL CHANCE FOR RAIN OVERNIGHT.  RAIN CHANCES CONTINUE WITH 
POST FRONTAL ACTIVITY ON FRIDAY BEFORE TAPERING OFF BY SUNSET 
FRIDAY.  TEMPERATURES WILL REMAIN ON THE WARM SIDE TONIGHT...BUT 
WILL MODERATE ON FRIDAY WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE.  SKIES WILL BE 
MOST CLOUDY TO CLOUDY THROUGHOUT THE PERIOD.

&&

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)

FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH MAIN 500 MB TROF AXIS TRAVERSING THE CWA AT THIS 
TIME...WILL BEGIN TO TAPER POPS DOWN IN THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. BOTH 
THE GFS AND NAM KEEP ENOUGH MOISTURE AND LIFT AROUND TO WARRANT 
KEEPING POPS IN PLACE. THE NAM IS SLIGHTLY SLOWER TODAY THAN 
YESTERDAY AT REMOVING PRECIP FROM THE FORECAST AREA. DUE TO BETTER 
CONTINUITY BETWEEN THE NAM AND GFS WILL START A RAPID CLEARING 
TOWARD DAYBREAK SATURDAY FROM NORTHWEST TO SOUTHEAST. 

SATURDAY...WITH TROF AXIS NOW OVER THE ATLANTIC COAST...WILL SEE 
SKIES RAPIDLY CLEAR AS BRIEF MID LEVEL RIDGING TAKES PLACE. WILL SEE 
A VERY NICE DAY ACROSS THE CWA BY MIDDAY AS ANY REMAINING LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE IS SCOURED OUT AND SKIES BEGIN TO CLEAR. HAVE UNDERCUT MAV 
GUIDANCE A DEGREE OR TWO AT MANY LOCATIONS TO ACCOUNT FOR THE 
SLIGHTLY COOLER AIR. MAIN DIFFERENCE IN AIRMASS WILL BE THE MUCH 
LOWER DEWPOINTS EXPECTED. MET GUIDANCE ON DEWPOINTS IS PREFERRED 
HERE WITH DEWPOINTS UPPER 40S NORTHEAST TO MID 50S SOUTHWEST. 

SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND MUCH LOWER 
DEWPOINTS...EXPECT GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS. SOME 
LOCATIONS ABOVE 5000 FEET COULD POSSIBLY BREAK INTO THE UPPER 30S. 
HAVE UNDERCUT MAV MOS AGAIN JUST SLIGHTLY TO ACCOUNT FOR GOOD 
RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS. ONLY NEGATING FACTOR TO RADIATIONAL 
COOLING WILL BE SURFACE HIGH MOVING JUST EAST OF THE AREA INDUCING A 
WEAK SOUTHERLY FLOW UP THE CENTRAL VALLEY. THIS MAY PREVENT 
TEMPERATURES FROM FALLING QUICKLY FROM KNOXVILLE SOUTHWARD TO 
CHATTANOOGA. 

SUNDAY WILL BE A TRANSITIONAL DAY AS A FAST MOVING COLD FRONT MOVES 
INTO THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY. EXPECT THIS FRONT TO MOVE INTO MY 
WESTERN CWA BY 00Z MONDAY AND HAVE RAISED POPS TO 20 PERCENT 
AREAWIDE AT THIS POINT. INCREASE POPS TO 30 IN TOWARD DAYBREAK 
MONDAY. WITH MOISTURE AND CLOUD COVER IN PLACE...TEMPERATURES WILL 
BE WARMER THAN PREVIOUS NIGHT AND HAVE NOT STRAYED FROM GUIDANCE. 

MONDAY THROUGH TUESDAY...UPPER LEVEL LOW BECOMES NEARLY STATIONARY 
AND CUT OFF FROM THE MAIN FLOW OVER THE MID ATLANTIC STATES. OVER 
THE NEXT COUPLE OF DAYS...PIECES OF ENERGY WILL ROTATE FROM THE 
NORTH AROUND THIS LOW AND INTO OUR CWA. THIS SCENARIO IS VERY 
SIMILAR TO MID WINTER WHEN CLIPPER TYPE SYSTEMS MOVE THROUGH VERY 
QUICKLY PROVIDING UPSLOPE PRECIPITATION. HAVE TREATED THIS EVENT THE 
SAME WAY IN THE EXTENDED. MEX GUIDANCE HAS MID CHANCE POPS AND HAVE 
FOLLOWED CLOSELY WITH HIGHER POPS IN THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN 
MOUNTAINS (30 PERCENT) WITH 20 PERCENT IN THE VALLEY SECTIONS. HAVE 
KEPT SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE DRY IN MOST OCCASIONS. ALSO EXPECT THERE TO 
BE A TIGHT TEMPERATURE GRADIENT DURING THIS TIME PERIOD. HAVE 
UNDERCUT MEX GUIDANCE A FEW DEGREES TO ACCOUNT FOR LOWER HEIGHTS 
ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS.  MONDAY NIGHT WILL BE THE COOLEST NIGHT 
WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE MID 40S NORTHEAST AND UPPER 30S IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. ABOVE 5000 FEET IN THE SMOKYS...MINS COULD 
APPROACH THE MIDDLE 30S. 

WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...MID LAYER RIDGING BEGINS TO PROGRESS 
EASTWARD KICKING THE LOW PRESSURE AREA OUT. WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS IN PLACE DURING THE DAY BUT TAKE OUT AT NIGHT. HEIGHTS BEGIN TO 
RISE AND SO DO TEMPERATURES. TEMPERATURES BY THURSDAY WILL BE 
SLIGHTLY BELOW SEASONAL NORMS. GFS EXTENDED INDICATES AN MCS MOVING 
INTO SOUTH MIDDLE TENNESSEE ON THURSDAY...BUT WILL NOT ACCEPT THIS 
SOLUTION AT THIS TIME AS IT IS SO FAR IN THE EXTENDED AND CONFIDENCE 
IS LOW.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             65  77  61  81 /  90  80  40  10

OAK RIDGE, TN                       65  77  59  78 / 100  80  30  10

.DISCUSSION...

ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. SCATTERED

SEEM TO BE IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE TRACK OF THIS LOW INTO THE 
MID ATLANTIC STATES BY FRIDAY. A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL LOW WILL MOVE 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BY FRIDAY MORNING...BRINGING A BETTER 
COVERAGE OF CONVECTION TONIGHT INTO FRIDAY. MODELS ARENT REVEALING 
AS MUCH INSTABILITY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH THIS SYSTEM AS 
THEY DID IN YESTERDAYS RUNS. HOWEVER...THINK THAT SOME SEVERE 
TSTORMS WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE LATER TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY...SINCE 
UPPER DYNAMICS WILL BE STRONG WITH LAPSE RATES STEEPENING AS THE 
COLD AIR ASSOCIATED WITH THE UPPER LOW MOVES OVER THE REGION. 

HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BEHIND THE COLD 
FRONT...BRINGING DRY AND TRANQUIL CONDITIONS FOR THE WEEKEND. 
ANOTHER COLD FRONT IS PROGGED TO MOVE INTO THE AREA BY LATE SUNDAY 
NIGHT INTO MONDAY...BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE OF CONVECTION.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 181904
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
303 PM EDT WED MAY 18 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...A MARGINALLY UNSTABLE AIR 
MASS AND DEW POINTS IN THE 50S IN PLACE OVER THE AREA HAS ALLOWED A 
CU FIELD TO FORM OVER OUR EASTERN MOUNTAINS.  AS A RESULT...A FEW 
ISOLATED SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING.  
OTHERWISE...THE UPPER RIDGE CURRENTLY POSITIONED OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION WILL DAMPEN TONIGHT AS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
APPROACHES THE AREA.  IN ADVANCE OF THE ATTACHED FRONTAL BOUNDARY... 
THE AIR MASS WILL FURTHER DESTABILIZE AS LIFT AND MOISTURE INCREASE 
OVER THE AREA.  WITH LI/S OF MINUS 2 TO 3 AND CAPES NEAR 1500J/KG 
PROGGED OVER THE AREA ON THURSDAY...SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS ARE 
EXPECTED TO FORM BY MID TO LATE AFTERNOON...WITH THE POTENTIAL FOR 
SOME STORMS TO BECOME STRONG AND CONTAIN GUSTY WINDS AND HAIL.  

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH AND ASSOCIATED
COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY NIGHT AND 
FRIDAY. FAIRLY DECENT UPPER DYNAMICS AND COLD AIR ALOFT INCREASING 
INSTABILITY WILL SET THE STAGE FOR WIDESPREAD CONVECTION FOR BOTH 
THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. COLD AIR ALOFT...ESPECIALLY FOR FRIDAY...WILL
INCREASE THE THREAT OF LARGE HAIL WITH THE AFTERNOON THUNDERSTORMS.  CAPES
FRIDAY INCREASE TO 2500 J/KG WITH LIFTED INDICES BETWEEN -5 TO -7.  
PLAN ON ISSUING A SPS CONCERNING THE POTENTIAL OF SEVERE 
THUNDERSTORMS.  SEEMS MAIN THREAT WILL BE LARGE HAIL AND DAMAGING 
WINDS...BUT ISOLATED TORNADOES ARE POSSIBLE WITH 0-3 KM SRH NEAR 250-300
M2/S2.

SURFACE RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE AREA FOR SATURDAY AND SUNDAY WITH NEXT WEAK
SHORT-WAVE AND COLD FRONT MOVING SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE REGION SUNDAY NIGHT
AND MONDAY.  RIDGING BUILDS BACK INTO THE AREA FOR LATE MONDAY THROUGH
WEDNESDAY.  LATEST GFS SHOWS ANOTHER COMPLEX OF STORMS WITH WARM AIR 
ADVECTION ALOFT FOR WEDNESDAY...BUT CONFIDENCE LOW SO WILL KEEP DRY 
FOR NOW.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 AM EDT WED MAY 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION WITH A WEAK TROUGH ALONG THE SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS. 
THIS SURFACE TROUGH...ALONG WITH INCREASING MOISTURE AND WEAK 
INSTABILITY OVER THE CAROLINAS...SHOULD HELP TO PRODUCE SOME 
ISOLATED CONVECTION OVER THE MOUNTAINS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 
BOUNDARY LAYER WIND PROFILE WILL REMAIN WEAK THROUGH TONIGHT...SO 
THINK THAT THIS CONVECTION SHOULD REMAIN LARGELY CONFINED TO THE 
MOUNTAINS. 

MODELS ARE SHOWING SOME DISAGREEMENTS THIS RUN (AND ALSO COMPARED TO 
THEIR PREVIOUS RUNS) WITH THE TRACK OF A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
CURRENTLY OVER THE NORTHERN PLAINS. LATEST MODEL RUNS INDICATE THAT 
THIS LOW WILL MOVE MORE EAST TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA...WITH THE 
NAM MODEL REVEALING THE MOST EASTERLY TRACK INTO THE MID ATLANTIC 
STATES BY FRIDAY. THE GFS MODEL ON THE OTHER HAND DROPS THIS LOW 
FARTHER SOUTH INTO THE DEEP SOUTH BY FRIDAY NIGHT. THE END RESULT 
APPEARS TO REMAIN THE SAME - SCATTERED CONVECTION DEVELOPING ACROSS 
THE AREA ON THURSDAY AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT...WITH THE GREATEST 
COVERAGE EXPECTED THURSDAY NIGHT AS THE UPPER LOW MOVES NEAR THE 
FORECAST AREA. WITH THE UPPER LOW NOW EXPECTED TO BE IN CLOSER 
PROXIMITY TO THE FORECAST AREA...THIS SHOULD RESULT IN STRONGER 
INSTABILITY ON THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT WITH AN INCREASED CHANCE 
FOR SEVERE TSTORMS. ON SATURDAY...WILL LEAVE A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
CONVECTION IN THE FORECAST TO ACCOUNT FOR THE POSSIBILITY THAT THIS 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MAY STALL OUT OVER THE DEEP SOUTH (AS SUGGESTED 
BY THE GFS MODEL).

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 171918
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EDT TUE MAY 17 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...IT IS VERY EASY TO PICK OUT 
THE POSITION OF THE APPALACHIAN MOUNTAINS TODAY AS CUMULUS CLOUDS 
HAVE FORMED AROUND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS TODAY THANKS TO LOW LEVEL 
SOUTHEASTERLY FLOW CAUSING UPSLOPE OVER THE APPALACHIANS. AS THIS 
FLOW DESCENDS IN THE EASTERN TENNESSEE VALLEY...SKIES ARE REMAINING 
MOSTLY SUNNY TO SUNNY. 

FORECAST IN THE SHORT TERM IS VERY TRANQUIL. ONLY CONCERN MAY BE FOR 
SOME LATE AFTERNOON CONVECTION TO DEVELOP OVER OUR MOUNTAIN 
COUNTIES. SOUNDING FROM GSO THIS MORNING REVEALS A RATHER STRONG CAP 
IN PLACE OVER THE EASTERN APPALACHIANS. HOWEVER...CONVECTIVE TEMPS 
ARE RATHER LOW (IN THE LOW 70S) AND ARE CLOSE TO BEING ACHIEVED. 
THETA-E RIDGE AT 850 MB IS PRESENT EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS...SO ANY 
CONVECTION FIRING ALONG OUR EASTERN BORDER WILL LIKELY NOT PERSIST 
FOR VERY LONG OR MAKE IT INTO THE VALLEY. THEREFORE...ONLY GOING 
WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS MOUNTAIN ZONES IN TENNESSEE AND NORTH 
CAROLINA THROUGH 01Z. 

EXPECT TEMPERATURES TONIGHT TO BE ABOUT 5 TO 7 DEGREES WARMER THAN 
LAST NIGHT MIN TEMPS. MAY EVEN STAY ABOVE 50 AT TRI CITIES. HAVE 
FOLLOWED A BLEND OF THE MET AND MAV GUIDANCE. AM SLIGHTLY CONCERNED 
ABOUT SOME MIST OR FOG AS RH TIME HEIGHT PLOTS INDICATE SUFFICIENT 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AT TRI CITIES. WILL NOT MENTION IN ZONES AS 
VISIBILITY RESTRICTIONS SHOULD REMAIN ABOVE 4 MILES. MAIN PLACEMENT 
OF THIS FOG SHOULD BE NEAR BODIES OF WATER IN THE REGION.

TOMORROW...EXPECT TO SEE A WARMER DAY AS TEMPERATURES WARM TO MID 
80S SOUTH TO NEAR 80 NORTH. THIS IS VERY CLOSE TO THE MAV GUIDANCE. 
ONCE AGAIN...MAY SEE SOME CONVECTION DEVELOP AFTER 2 PM TOMORROW IN 
THE MOUNTAINS. WITH GREATER INSTABILITY THAN TUESDAY AFTERNOON IN 
THE VALLEY ON WEDNESDAY...MAY SEE SOME SHOWERS MAKE THEIR WAY 
BRIEFLY INTO THE VALLEY LOCATIONS LATE IN THE AFTERNOON HOURS. 
HOWEVER...HAVE KEPT POPS AT THIS TIME OUT OF OUR VERIFICATION SITES. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...UPR LOW CURRENTLY 
SPINNING OVR WY WITH FAIRLY STOUT RIDGING TO ITS EAST. STRONG JET FM 
THE W PROGGED TO ACT AS KICKER...CRUSHING UPR LOW THROUGH TOP PART 
OF UPR RIDGE. UPPER TROUGH/LOW REACHES IOWA EARLY THU WITH SFC 
REFLECTION ACROSS OHIO RIVER VLY. SO WARMING TREND CONTINUES WITH 
INCREASED CLOUD COVER AND CHC SHWRS ON THU. MODEL SOLUTION DIVERGE 
ARND 18Z THU. GFS/ECMWF AND THE NOGAPS PREFER TO DROP UPR LOW 
SOUTHWARD ALONG E EDGE OF LARGE W CST RIDGE. NAM/GEM/UKMET PREFER A 
MORE SERLY TRACK MORE IN LINE WITH FLOW ARND NE U.S. LOW
WHICH TAKES THE SYSTEM TO A FAVORABLE PCPN SET UP FOR MRX CWA 
THU/FRI. HAVE GONE WITH A BLEND OF SOLUTION BUT FEEL POPS MAY NEED 
TO BE INCREASE THU/FRI WITH LATER PACKAGES. SEE PMDHMD FOR DETAILED 
MODEL DISCUSSION. WEAK FRONT MOVES INTO AREA AND RIDGE AXIS ALOFT 
SLIDES SE OF E TN ON SAT. SO PCPN CHC SHOULD DECLINE AND TEMPS COOL 
FOR THE WEEKEND. COOL HIGH PRESSURE CONTINUES TO BUILD DOWN ON E 
SIDE OF APPALACHIANS EARLY NEXT WEEK. WILL LIKELY SEE A STRONG 
TEMPERATURE GRADIENT ALONG TN/NC STATE LINE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 AM EDT TUE MAY 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...MORNING VISIBLE SAT PIX SHOWS SOME OF OUR RIVER 
VALLEYS IN THE NORTHEAST HAD SOME PATCHY FOG COVER BUT THAT HAS 
SINCE BURNED OFF AND ALL OF THE FORECAST AREA IS NOW UNDER MOSTLY 
SUNNY TO SUNNY SKIES. CURRENT TRENDS FROM AROUND THE AREA SHOW 
TEMPERATURES RISING QUICKLY INTO THE MID AND UPPER 50S. 06Z GFS 
INDICATED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF -TSRA IN OUR MOUNTAINOUS COUNTIES IN TN 
AND NC TODAY. AGREE WITH PREVIOUS FORECAST ON THIS POSSIBILITY AFTER 
18Z TODAY AS MOISTURE FLUX DIVERGENCE CHARTS SHOW GOOD MOISTURE 
CONVERGENCE AT LOW LEVELS BETWEEN 925 AND 850 MB. GIVEN EXPECTED 
GOOD HEATING TODAY...WOULD NOT BE SURPRISED TO SEE SOME CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT IN THE MOUNTAINS. MOVEMENT OF THESE -TSRA INTO THE 
VALLEY DOES NOT APPEAR LIKELY AS THETA-E VALUES DECREASE APPRECIABLY 
NORTHEAST OF THE TN/NC BORDER AND WILL THEREFORE NOT MENTION POPS IN 
THE VALLEYS.

ON THE UPDATE...WILL BE RAISING MAX TEMPS SLIGHTLY IN NC AND SW VA 
WHERE CURRENT TRENDS ARE BELOW PRESENT DIURNAL TEMP TRACE.

CURRENT ZONE FORECAST PRODUCT IS IN GOOD SHAPE WITH NO NEED FOR 
CHANGES AS IT ACCOUNTS FOR MID TO UPPER 70S IN NC AND MID 70S IN SW 
VA. ONLY CHANGES WILL BE TO GRIDDED AND WEB BASED PRODUCTS. 

HAVE A GREAT DAY

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT TUE MAY 17 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND LIGHT WINDS ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE THAT AN UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD ACROSS 
THE MS RIVER VALLEY THROUGH MID WEEK...KEEPING DRY AND TRANQUIL 
WEATHER ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH WEDNESDAY. A MOIST 
SOUTHEASTERLY FLOW ACROSS THE CAROLINAS WILL HELP TO PRODUCE SOME 
WEAK INSTABILITY ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS LATER TODAY AND AGAIN ON 
WEDNESDAY. THIS INSTABILITY SHOULD RESULT IN THE FORMATION OF SOME 
ISOLATED DIURNAL CONVECTION ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS...BUT WITH AN 
ABSENCE OF STRONG TRIGGERING MECHANISMS...THINK THAT THIS ISOLATED 
CONVECTION SHOULD REMAIN CONFINED TO THE MOUNTAINS. 

THIS UPPER RIDGE IS PROGGED TO BREAK DOWN BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT...AS A 
STRONG UPPER LOW DEVELOPS OVER THE UPPER MS RIVER VALLEY AND MOVES 
SOUTH ACROSS THE MS RIVER VALLEY. NAM AND GFS MODELS ARE IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT WITH THE TRACK OF THIS UPPER LOW INTO THE LOWER MS RIVER 
VALLEY BY THURSDAY NIGHT...BUT THE NAM SOLUTION REVEALS A WEAKER 
UPPER LOW COMPARED TO THE GFS SOLUTION. THINK THAT THE NAM SOLUTION 
WILL BE MORE REALISTIC SINCE THE GFS USUALLY SHOWS A BIAS TOWARD 
OVER-AMPLIFYING SYSTEMS IN THE MEDIUM FORECAST RANGES (DAYS 3 
THROUGH 5). THUS...WILL MENTION ONLY CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY. THIS UPPER LOW GETS CUT OFF FROM THE MAIN FLOW BY SATURDAY 
AND GRADUALLY DISSIPATES OVER THE GULF COASTAL REGION. BOTH THE NAM 
AND GFS MODELS INDICATE ONLY WEAK INSTABILITY DEVELOPING ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA FOR THURSDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...SO THINK THE THREAT OF 
SEVERE WEATHER WILL BE LOW THROUGH THE PERIOD.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...LITTLE CHANGE TO CURRENT

CONDITIONS CONTINUE THROUGH THE MEDIUM RANGE AS SURFACE RIDGE

MOUNTAIN ZONES. TEMPERATURES WILL SLOWLY CONTINUE TO WARM AS HEIGHTS 
RISE THROUGH THE MEDIUM RANGE. HAVE FOLLOWED A BLEND OF THE NAM AND 
GFS MOS TO CREATE TEMP FORECAST.

THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY....OPERATIONAL MODELS INDICATE A RATHER ODD 
SCENARIO FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY. AN UPPER LEVEL LOW IS PROGGED TO 
DIVE SOUTHWARD OUT OF THE HIGH PLAINS ON THURSDAY TOWARD THE GULF 
COAST. THIS APPEARS TO BE CAUSED BY A EAST TO WEST TILT OF A UPPER 
RIDGE OVER THE ROCKIES AND THE NEAR STATIONARY UPPER LEVEL TROF ON 
THE EAST COAST. JET FLOWS IN THE GFS ARE VERY WEAK SO I AM UNCERTAIN 
IF THIS WILL OCCUR. A COUPLE OF REASONS SUPPORT GOING WITH THIS 
UNUSUAL FEATURE. FIRST THE OPERATIONAL MODELS (GFS ECMWF UKMET AND 
DGEX) ALL INDICATE THAT AN UPPER LOW WILL DIVE SOUTHWARD OUT OF THE 
HIGH PLAINS. WHERE THEY DIFFER IS ON THE TRACK OF THIS 
AFOREMENTIONED LOW. AGREE WITH HPC THAT GFS HAS HAD BETTER RUN TO 
RUN CONSISTENCY OF THIS SITUATION. THAT BEING SAID...THERE STILL IS 
RUN TO RUN INCONSISTENCIES IN THE GFS. THE 00Z GFS HAD THE LOW 
MOVING WELL INTO THE WESTERN GULF. THE 06Z GFS HAD THE LOW MOVING 
INTO THE DEEP SOUTH AND GETTING ABSORBED BACK INTO THE MAIN FLOW 
OVER THE CAROLINAS. THE AFTERNOON PACKAGE WITH THE 12Z GFS AND NAM 
BOTH TEND TO AGREE MORE WITH A TRACK OF THIS UPPER LEVEL LOW MOVING 
FROM NORTH DAKOTA ON THURSDAY MORNING TO THE GULF COAST BY FRIDAY 
NIGHT. THIS IS INLINE WITH THE 00Z GFS. THEREFORE FOR THIS PERIOD OF 
THE FORECAST...HAVE LEANED CLOSER TO THE 00Z GFS AS ITS MOVEMENT IS 
MORE PREFERRED AND INDICATES A PROGRESSIVE MOVEMENT OF THE SYSTEM. 

FOR WEATHER...WILL INCREASE POPS THROUGHOUT THE DAY ON THURSDAY AS 
GFS AND NAM BOTH INDICATE HIGH AMOUNTS OF OMEGA LIFT OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA BY 18Z THURSDAY. THIS MEANS THAT BY THE TIME WE GET 
INTO FRIDAY WE WILL HAVE TO DRASTICALLY RAISE POPS TO 50 TO 60 
PERCENT CWA WIDE...ESPECIALLY IN THE MORNING. INTO FRIDAY AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING...UPPER LOW WILL BE MOVING TO MY SOUTHWEST. THIS WILL 
ALLOW POPS TO SLOWLY DECREASE INTO THE OVERNIGHT ON FRIDAY. I AM 
STILL BELOW MEX MOS AND HPC PROGS. THIS IS INTENTIONALLY DONE 
BECAUSE THERE IS STILL SOME HIGH UNCERTAINTY DESPITE THE 12Z GFS 
COMING IN SO CLOSE TO THE 00Z GFS. AS THE UPPER LEVEL LOW MOVES INTO 
THE DEEP SOUTH ON FRIDAY...WILL BEGIN TO LOWER POPS INTO SATURDAY 
MORNING WITH A POSSIBLE FRONTAL PASSAGE. BEHIND THIS FRONT ON 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON...SKIES WILL CLEAR FROM NORTH TO SOUTH AND 
TEMPERATURES WILL STRUGGLE TO WARM ABOVE THE MID 70S. HOWEVER...WILL 
KEEP ON A SLIGHT CHANCE POPS NORTH TO CHANCE SOUTH THROUGH SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON AS COOLER AIR ALOFT MAY SQUEEZE OUT A FEW SHOWERS IN 
AFTERNOON HEATING.

SUNDAY AT THIS POINT LOOKS TRANQUIL. CLOUDS WILL BE ON THE INCREASE 
SUNDAY NIGHT AS A RAPIDLY MOVING FRONT IS FORECAST TO MOVE THROUGH 
THE REGION. DUE TO THIS BEING IN THE FAR EXTENDED ON MONDAY HAVE 
ONLY MENTIONED SLIGHT CHANCE TSRA AS MOISTURE SUPPORT IS LIMITED.

SINCE THE MAIN EVENT IS PLANNED TO BE ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...WILL 
NOT ISSUE ANY STATEMENTS FOR POSSIBILITY OF SEVERE WEATHER BUT WILL 
MENTION THAT THREAT HERE. FORECAST SOUNDINGS ON THE ETA AND GFS BOTH 
INDICATE RATHER STEEP LAPSE RATES AROUND 8C/KM BETWEEN 850 AND 700 
MB. COUPLED WITH WET BULB ZERO HEIGHTS AROUND 9500 FT FOR TRI AND 
11000 FOR CHA...HAIL WILL POSSIBLY BE A THREAT FOR ANY STORM THAT 
CAN GROW SOUTH OF THE SURFACE BOUNDARY...WHEREVER IT SETS UP. AN 
INVERTED V-NOTCH ON THESE SOUNDINGS ALSO INDICATES AN ISOLATED 
STRONG WIND THREAT. LATER SHIFTS WILL NEED TO WATCH THIS DEVELOPING 
SITUATION AND ISSUE STATEMENTS ACCORDINGLY.



&&

OAK RIDGE, TN                       48  79  55  81 /   0   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              43  75  51  78 /   0  10   0  10

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
238 AM EDT MON MAY 16 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
YESTERDAYS COLD FRONT OVER THE CENTRAL CAROLINAS...WITH AN AREA OF 
HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDING ACROSS MOST OF THE CENTRAL U.S. THIS HIGH 
PRESSURE AREA WILL PRODUCE MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES WITH LIGHT WINDS TODAY 
AND TONIGHT ACROSS THE ENTIRE REGION. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT AND LOOK REASONABLE. HIGHS TODAY 
SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN YESTERDAY WITH FULL SUNSHINE 
EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...GENERALLY BENIGN WEATHER 
STILL ON TRACK THROUGH MID WEEK AS WEAK RIDGING SLOWLY BUILDS IN 
ALOFT. SOME MODEL DIFFERENCES DEPICTED WITH RESPECT TO PRECIP ON WED 
AND WED NIGHT WITH GFS AND SHORT RANGE ENSEMBLES PROJECTING 
VIRTUALLY NO PRECIP WHILE NAM PROJECTS SCATTERED PRECIP THROUGH MUCH 
OF THAT PERIOD. INCLINED TO FAVOR GFS/ENSEMBLES DEPICTION BASED ON 
RECENT HISTORY AND PROJECTION OF UPPER RIDGE BUILDING INTO REGION. 
THUS HAVE SCALED BACK POPS SLIGHTLY FOR THOSE PERIODS. 
CONVERSELY...EXTREME VARIATIONS IN ENSEMBLE MEMBER 
SOLUTIONS...ALONG WITH POOR RUN-TO-RUN CONSISTENCY OF GFS...PRECLUDE 
INCLINATION TO MAKE ANY CHANGES PAST THU. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY 
FAVORED BLEND OF GUIDANCE VALUES WHICH RESULTED IN ONLY MINOR TWEAKS 
TO EXISTING GRIDS THROUGH WED.

WINDS OF ABOUT 10 MPH SO DONT THINK CLOUDS WILL INCREASE BUT 
GRADUALLY DECREASE AS THE EVENING PROGRESSES. SOME HIGH LEVEL 
MOISTURE IS STREAMING INTO THE TN VALLEY FROM COMPLEX OF STORMS IN 
TEXAS BUT THIS WILL DECREASE LATER AS ACTIVITY DECREASES. 
TEMPERATURES HAVE FALLEN INTO THE 60S WITH DEW POINTS FALLING IN THE 
MID TO UPPER 40S SO CURRENT MIN TEMPS LOOK GOOD. FORECAST LOOKS 
GOOD. NO CHANGES NEEDED.

FXUS64 KMRX 151928
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EDT SUN MAY 15 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...LAST BIT OF SHOWERS 
HAVE FINALLY EASED JUST EAST OF THE TN AND NC STATE LINE THIS 
AFTERNOON.  HOWEVER..BROAD 500 MB TROUGH AXIS IS STILL TO OUR WEST 
AND A GOOD AMOUNT OF CUMULUS CLOUDS REFORMED IN THE CLEAR AREA 
BEHIND THE COLD FRONT.  GENERALLY STARTED SKIES OUT AS PARTLY CLOUDY 
IN THE GRIDS...THEN ALLOWED FOR SOME CLEARING OVERNIGHT.  I KEPT IN 
PATCHY FOG FOR CONTINUITY...BUT NOT SOLD ON WIDESPREAD DENSE FOG 
SINCE...1) THE RAINS YESTERDAY AND OVERNIGHT WERE NOT AS HEAVY OR 
SOLID IN COVERAGE AS EXPECTED...AND 2) THINK THAT WINDS MAY STAY UP 
JUST ENOUGH TO ALLOW SOME OF THE DRIER AIR COMING IN TO MIX INTO THE 
BOUNDARY LAYER.  DEW POINTS FALLING NICELY INTO THE 40S OVER MIDDLE 
TN AND CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...SO MOS MINS MAINLY IN THE 40S LOOKS GOOD.

FOR LATER PART OF THE SHORT TERM...NW FLOW ALOFT AS UPPER RIDGE 
GRADUALLY BUILDS EAST...AND SURFACE RIDGE MAINLY TO THE W AND N TO 
PROVIDE GENERALLY LIGHT NORTH WINDS.  A DRY FORECAST BUT NOT TOTALLY 
CLOUD-FREE...AS THE 850 MB FLOW BRINGS SUFFICIENT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
FOR AT LEAST SCATTERED CUMULUS (LOW) CLOUDS IN THE DAYTIME.  ALLOWED 
FOR MORE CLOUDS IN THE FAVORED TERRAIN AREAS ON MONDAY...THEN LESS 
ON TUESDAY ACROSS THE BOARD.  VERY PLEASANT 60S AND 70S FOR HIGHS 
MONDAY...FOLLOWED BY SLIGHT WARMING ON TUESDAY.  OTHERWISE...40S AND 
50S AT NIGHT ARE TOUGH TO BEAT.    


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WILL CONTINUE IDEA OF A 
DRY FCST FOR WED DAYTIME PERIOD AS DRY NW UPPER FLO EXISTS ON 
BACKSIDE OF DEPARTING UPR TROF. NEXT MAJOR WAVE WITH FRONTAL SYSTEM 
PRESSES THRU THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO VALLEY AND INTO THE REGION THU 
INTO FRI AND RAISED POPS FOR SHRA/TSRA SLIGHTLY TO HIGH CHC MAINLY 
NRN PART OF THE FA FOR THIS POSSIBILITY. WILL DRY OUT MOST OF THE 
REGION ON FRI BUT MODELS SHOW SOME TRAILING S/WV ENERGY DROPPING SE 
ACROSS SW VA/NE TN ON THE BACK SIDE OF UPR TROF TO KEEP CHC TO SLGT 
CHC POPS FOR -SHRA ALIVE IN THIS REGION. HAD TO USE A SLGT CHC POP 
FOR SAT AS ANOTHER COLD UPR LOW FINDS A HOME OVR THE ERN GREAT 
LAKES/NERN U.S. WITH VORTS ROTATING AROUND THIS FEATURE. FINALLY 
BACK TO A DRY REGIME FOR ENTIRE FA ON SUN ALTHOUGH MAJOR MODEL 
UNCERTAINTY EXISTS ESPECIALLY AT THIS LONG TIME RANGE SO CHANGES MAY 
OCCUR LATE IN THE WEEKEND AS GFS TRIES TO USE AN UPR LOW OVR THE LWR 
MS VLY COMPLETE WITH INVERTED SFC TROF ALONG WITH ISENTROPICALLY 
LIFTED GULF MEX MOISTURE OVR THE TN VLY/SRN APPALACHIANS. DISCOUNTED 
THIS IDEA FOR NOW.

.DISCUSSION...INITIAL BAND OF CONVECTIVE PCPN THIS MORNING IS WELL

REGION...SO EXPECT PLENTY OF SUNSHINE TO HELP WARM TEMPS INTO THE

TO 1500 J/KG...SOME POTENTIAL FOR STRONG WINDS...BUT VERY LITTLE 
STORM RELATIVE HELICITY.  FREEZING AND WET BULB ZERO LEVELS ARE VERY 
SIMILAR TO YESTERDAY (10 TO 11 THOUSAND FT)...WITH 500 MB TEMPS 
ABOUT 1 DEGREE CELSIUS COOLER THAN YESTERDAY (-13 DEG C).  500 MB 
TEMPS COOL SLIGHTLY THIS EVENING/OVERNIGHT...SO DIME TO QUARTER SIZE 
HAIL SEEMS POSSIBLE AGAIN WITH THE STRONGEST STORMS.   

FORECAST LOOKS IN GOOD SHAPE OVERALL THIS MORNING WITH SCATTERED 
WORDING AND 50 PERCENT CHANCES...INCREASING TO 80 PERCENT OR GREATER 
THIS EVENING.  PROBABLY WONT UPDATE THE ZFPMRX PRODUCT...BUT WILL 
CHECK OVER THE GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS TO SEE IF ANY FRESHENING IS 
NEEDED.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 140705
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 AM EDT SAT MAY 14 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
COLD FRONT ACROSS THE MID MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY WITH A PRE- 
FRONTAL LINE OF CONVECTION ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. LOCAL 
RADARS INDICATE THAT EARLIER CONVECTION HAS DISSIPATED ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE THAT THE LOCAL AIRMASS WILL BECOME 
MODERATELY UNSTABLE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING AHEAD OF THE COLD 
FRONT...BUT VERTICAL WIND PROFILES AND UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS ARE 
PROGGED TO BE MODEST. DUE TO THE MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIRMASS...A FEW 
TSTORMS SHOULD BECOME SEVERE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING WITH THE 
MAIN THREATS BEING DAMAGING WINDS...LARGE HAIL AND LOCALLY HEAVY 
RAINFALL. ALTHOUGH VERTICAL WIND PROFILES ARE PROGGED TO BE MODEST 
TODAY...WILL PLAN TO MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF AN ISOLATED WEAK 
TORNADO OR TWO IN THE HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK...SINCE A DECENT 
AMOUNT OF CAPE WILL BE LOCATED NEAR THE SURFACE (BELOW 1 KM) WITH 
RELATIVELY LOW LIFTED CONDENSATION LEVELS EXPECTED. IN THIS KIND OF 
AIRMASS...ITS POSSIBLE THAT A FEW WEAK TORNADOES COULD SPIN UP 
ALONG PRE-EXISTING OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT AND LOOK REASONABLE.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...SCATTERED SHOWERS LINGER 
BEHIND DEPARTING SURFACE COLD FRONT SUNDAY MORNING...MAINLY IN 
MOUNTAINS AND FAR EASTERN SECTIONS OF FORECAST AREA. SHORT RANGE 
ENSEMBLES ARE SLIGHTLY SLOWER WITH THIS PROCESS. UPPER TROUGH SLOWLY 
PULLS AWAY ALLOWING HEIGHTS TO RISE MARGINALLY. FLOW PROJECTED TO 
REMAIN NORTHWESTERLY ALOFT UNTIL AROUND 00Z THURSDAY WHEN MINOR 
RIDGING BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS WILL RESULT IN 
GENERALLY DRY WEATHER THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE WORK WEEK. NEXT 
TROUGH/FRONT APPROACHES ON THURSDAY PROVIDING THE NEXT CHANCE OF 
WIDESPREAD PRECIP. TEMPS WILL SLOWLY RECOVER FROM BELOW CLIMO TO 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE CLIMO BY MID AND LATE WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EDT FRI MAY 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...SCATTERED CONVECTION LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY 
EVENING HAS BEEN CONCENTRATED OVER SW VA AND IN THE CENTRAL AND 
NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS OF EAST TENNESSEE EXTENDING TO THE FOOTHILLS TO 
THE WEST OF THE MOUNTAINS. LARGE HAIL AND WIND DAMAGE HAS BEEN 
REPORTED WITH SOME STORMS AND THE SLOW MOVEMENT ACROSS SW VA HAS 
RESULTED IN FLOODING. THE CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY HAS DECREASED 
GENERALLY BUT MAY CONTINUE A FEW MORE HOURS IN THE NORTHEAST THIRD 
OF THE FORECAST AREA. HAVE INCREASED POPS FOR THIS AREA UNTIL AROUND 
MIDNIGHT. A SHORTWAVE OVER WEST TN AND KY SHOULD MOVE INTO MIDDLE TN 
BY MORNING WHICH COULD AID IN THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT ALONG THE 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. ALSO OUTFLOW BOUNDARIES FROM THIS EVENINGS 
CONVECTION MAY HELP TO START MORE CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT AFTER 
MIDNIGHT. WILL KEEP 20 POPS ACROSS THE ENTIRE REGION LATER TONIGHT. 
ALSO PATCHY FOG SHOULD FORM...SOME LOCALLY DENSE IN AREAS THAT HAD 
HEAVY RAIN TONIGHT. WILL ADD PATCHY FOG TO ZONES IN SW VA AND NE TN 
AND ALSO THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL MOUNTAINS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 PM EDT FRI MAY 13 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...TEMPERATURES HAVE 
CLIMBED VERY CLOSE TO YESTERDAYS VALUES...RESULTING IN DECENT 
INSTABILITY AGAIN TODAY.  MOST CONVECTION SO FAR HAS DEVELOPED IN 
THE CENTRAL/NRN MTNS...NE PLATEAU AND HIGHER TERRAIN OF SWRN VA.
MOVEMENT HAS BEEN N TO NE AT 10 TO 15 MPH WITH AN ISOLATED REPORT OF 
HAIL UP TO ONE HALF INCH DIAMETER.  THIS CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY MAY 
DECREASE WITH LOSS OF DAYTIME HEAT...BUT FOR CONTINUITY KEPT IN 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT.  NEXT SHIFT MAY CONSIDER ADDING 
PATCHY AREAS OF FOG...ESPECIALLY IN AREAS THAT ANY SIGNIFICANT 
RAINFALL ACCUMULATES TONIGHT.  MIN TEMPS CLOSE TO PERSISTENCE 
EXPECTED.

OTHERWISE...KEPT SIMILAR TIMING ON SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT WITH 
THE APPROACHING UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND COLD FRONT...NUDGING POPS UP 
TO 70 PERCENT FOR SAT EVENING.  ALSO...EXTENDED LOW POPS JUST INTO 
SUNDAY MORNING DUE TO SLOWER FROPA NOW ADVERTISED BY BOTH THE GFS 
AND NAM.  NOT SURE ABOUT THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS AS UPPER LEVEL 
SUPPORT AND JET DYNAMICS SEEM A BIT FAR TO OUR NW.  CERTAINLY MORE 
COVERAGE OF SHOWERS AND STORMS...WITH SOME STRONG STORMS POSSIBLE.
PARTIAL CLEARING SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...ALTHOUGH CLOUDINESS 
MAY LINGER JUST A BIT ACROSS THE NRN MOST AREAS. 


.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPR TROF TRAVERSES THE GREAT 
LAKES AND AMPLIFIES AS IT MOVES INTO THE NERN STATES. EARLY IN THE 
PERIOD DRY NWLY FLO PREVAILS WITH SFC RIDGE IN PLACE ACROSS THE ERN 
U.S. WILL NEED TO USE SLGT CHC POPS FOR SHRA/TSRA TUE NITE INTO WED 
FOR MOST OF THE FA WITH EMPHASIS ON SW VA/NE TN WHERE WEAK IMPULSES 
DROP SE ON THE BACK SIDE OF UPR TROF WITH WARM FRONT PROGRESSING NE 
THROUGH THE LWR MS VLY TOWARD THE TN VLY. USED LOW TO MEDIUM CHC 
POPS FOR WED NIGHT THROUGH THU NIGHT AS S/W TROF DIVES SE THRU THE 
GREAT LAKES INTO THE MIDDLE ATLANTIC STATES WITH SFC WAVE AND CD FNT 
BUILDING ACROSS THE FA DURING THIS PERIOD. FRONT SHIFTS SE TO THE 
GULF AND ATLANTIC COASTAL PLAIN LEAVING MUCH OF THE FA DRY ON 
FRIDAY.

.DISCUSSION...YESTERDAYS WEAK FRONTAL BOUNDARY IS DIFFICULT TO 
LOCATE TO ME...BASED ON EITHER A WIND OR DEW POINT ANALYSIS.  UPPER 
AIR PLOTS SHOW VERY WARM 850 MB TEMPS ACROSS OUR REGION WITH MAIN 
BAROCLINIC ZONE FROM ERN OHIO VALLEY TO THE MID ATLANTIC STATES. 
THUS...DONT EXPECT THE WEAK SURFACE BOUNDARY TO BE MUCH OF A FACTOR 
TODAY...LEAVING TERRAIN TO BE THE MAIN FOCUS FOR CONVECTIVE 
DEVELOPMENT.  PLOTS ALSO SHOW THAT THE UPPER RIDGE HAS SHIFTED JUST 
TO OUR SE...ALLOWING SLIGHTLY BETTER STEERING WINDS FOR STORMS TODAY
WITH A N TO NE MOTION AROUND 10 KNOTS EXPECTED.  

MODIFIED 12Z OHX AND RNK SOUNDINGS SHOW SLIGHT TO MODERATE 
INSTABILITY WITH MAX TEMPS TOPPING OUT AGAIN WELL INTO THE 80S.  
CAPES GENERALLY OF 1000 J/KG (RNK) TO PERHAPS AS HIGH AS 2500 J/KG 
FOR MODIFIED OHX SOUNDING.  FREEZING/WET BULB ZERO HEIGHTS 
RELATIVELY HIGH TODAY...AS IS THE EQUILIBRIUM LEVEL...SO SEVERE 
THREAT LOOKS MINIMAL.  I MAY ADJUST THE POPS SLIGHTLY IN THE MORNING 
UPDATE TO BE SURE TO HAVE CHANCE POPS IN ALL OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN 
AREAS...WITH SOME WEAK CONVECTION ALREADY TRYING TO START IN THE SRN 
MTNS.  PROBABLY WILL KEEP VALLEY/LOWER ELEVATIONS IN THE ISOLATED 
CATEGORY OF POPS.  

OTHERWISE...THINKING THAT PERSISTENCE ON MAX TEMPS TODAY IS A GOOD 
BET.  AFTER PLOTTING YESTERDAYS HIGHS...MAY NUDGE MAX TEMPS UP A 
FEW DEGREES IN MANY AREAS.  FULL UPDATE OF ZFP...GRIDS AND WEB 
PRODUCTS BY 11 AM EDT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EDT THU MAY 12 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...WEAK FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY JUST TO OUR NORTH HAS BEEN THE MAIN AREA OF LOW LEVEL 
CONVERGENCE THIS AFTERNOON.  PREVIOUS FORECAST AND GRIDS WERE SET UP 
WELL TO HANDLE THIS WEAK BOUNDARY SAGGING SOUTH OVERNIGHT.  DECIDED 
TO INCLUDE LOW POPS IN ALL AREAS TONIGHT...DUE IN PART TO THE AMOUNT 
OF INSTABILITY (AS TEMPS HAVE CLIMBED WELL INTO THE 80 TO 90 DEGREE 
RANGE) AND SOME ISOLATED STRONG STORMS THAT HAVE DEVELOPED OVER THE 
SEQUATCHIE VALLEY COUNTIES...WHERE NO RAIN CHANCES WERE EARLIER 
INCLUDED.  STORMS IN THIS AREA ARE UNDERNEATH THE UPPER LEVEL RIDGE 
WHERE STEERING WINDS ARE EXTREMELY LIGHT...SO EXPECT JUST A SLOW 
SOUTHWARD DRIFT OF THIS ACTIVITY OVER SE TN.  

OTHERWISE...THE WEAK BOUNDARY LIFTS NE TOMORROW...WHICH LEAVES NO 
CLEAR FOCUS FOR STORM DEVELOPMENT (OTHER THAN TERRAIN) UNTIL THE 
UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AND COLD FRONT APPROACH BY LATE SATURDAY.  ONLY 
SIGNIFICANT CHANGES WERE TO SLIGHTLY INCREASE RAIN CHANCES FROM THE 
WEST SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING.  TIMING STILL LOOKS GOOD FOR 
BRUNT OF SHOWERS/STORMS TO END EARLY SUNDAY MORNING.  FAVORED THE 
SLIGHTLY WARMER HIGH TEMPS...MORE TOWARD A PERSISTENCE FORECAST THAN 
CLIMO. 


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...CD FNT PROGGED TO SHIFT SE 
THRU FA EARLY SUN TAKING CHC SHRA/TSRA WITH IT. HOWEVER...BLENDED 
SLGT/SMALL CHC POPS WITH GFE NEIGHBORS WHICH PROVIDES BUFFER IN THE 
EVENT THAT FNT MOVES A LITTLE SLOWER. PERIOD OF COOLER/DRIER WX IN 
STORE BEHIND THIS SYSTEM AS UPR TROF PROGRESSES E ACROSS THE GREAT 
LAKES AND NERN U.S. WITH SFC RIDGE PRESSING E ACROSS THE MIDDLE 
ATLANTIC STATES ON TUE. DRY REGIME EXTENDS BASICALLY THROUGH TUE 
ALTHOUGH USED SLGT CHC POPS ACROSS THE MTNS AS NW FLO ENHANCES 
OROGRAPHIC LIFT. INTRODUCED SMALL/SLGT CHC POPS ACROSS SW VA/NE TN 
AND NRN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU FOR WED AND THEN ADDED AREA WIDE POP FOR 
THU AS ANOTHER UPR TROF BUILDS E THRU THE NERN U.S. WITH IMPULSES 
RIDING SE ACROSS CNTRL/SRN APPALACHIANS.

FXUS64 KMRX 101909
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EDT TUE MAY 10 2005

.SHORT TERM...UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM WILL MOVE EAST OF AREA OVER THE 
NEXT FEW HOURS...AND IT PRESENTS ONE OF THOSE TIMING PROBLEMS.  IT 
WILL NOT BE RAINING EXCEPT FOR IN THE FAR NE PART OF OUR CWA COME 6 
PM...BUT IT IS RAINING IN A LARGER AREA AT THIS TIME.  I DECIDED TO 
STICK WITH THE CONCEPT OF A FORECAST...NOT A NOWCAST...AND GO WITH 
THE WEATHER AS I EXPECT IT TO LOOK AT THE START OF THE TONIGHT 
PERIOD.  AS SYSTEM MOVES AWAY, SHOULD SEE SOME CLEARING SKIES 
TONIGHT...AND THAT WILL LEAD TO FOG FORMATION BY EARLY MORNING.  
COULD BE FAIRLY LOW VSBYS FROM 10 TO 13Z...BUT EXPECT THAT ANYTHING 
UNDER 1 MILE WILL BE VERY LOCALIZED.

CHANCE OF RAIN FOR TOMORROW NOW LOOKS VERY LOW AND DID NOT MENTION.  
GUIDANCE TEMPS WERE REASONABLE AND WERE FOLLOWED CLOSELY.  WINDS 
WILL BE VERY LIGHT NEXT 24 HOURS.  LOTS OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL 
BE LEFT IN PLACE...AND THEREFORE OVERNIGHT LOWS WILL NOT BE AS LOW 
AS THEY HAVE BEEN RECENTLY.


.LONG TERM...(WED NIGHT THROUGH TUE)...UPPER TROUGH/ASSOCIATED COLD 
FRONT STILL PROJECTED TO PASS THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS 
WEEKEND. HOWEVER...DISCREPANCIES IN TIMING BETWEEN MEDIUM RANGE 
MODELS AND ENSEMBLES CAST DOUBT ON EXACT PROGRESSION OF THIS FEATURE 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. ECMWF IS CONSIDERABLY SLOWER THAN GFS 
WITH THIS PROGRESSION. THE CANADIAN GEM AND NOGAPS TENDS TO SUPPORT 
THE SLOWER ECMWF. THUS HAVE TENDED TO FAVOR ECMWF TIMING. 
HOWEVER...HAVE EXPANDED PRECIP CHANCES THROUGH MUCH OF SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY DUE TO UNCERTAINTY. HAVE OPTED FOR DRY FORECAST FOR EARLY 
NEXT WEEK...BUT AGAIN CONFIDENCE IS NOT HIGH.




&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  60  87  61  90 /   0   0   0  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  58  83  60  87 /  10   0   0  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  58  84  60  87 /  10   0   0  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  56  81  56  85 /  10   0   0  20

FADES SE BY THIS AFTN. SMALL DEFORMATION AREA AND WEAK IMPULSE 
PROVIDING UPPER SUPPORT FOR SHOWER DEVELOPMENT. MODEL PWS APPEAR A 
BIT HIGH. RELATIVELY LOW RAIN AMOUNTS EXPECTED AS INITIAL AIRMASS ON

WARMING THIS AFTN AND COOLING ALOFT DECENT DESTABILIZATION FOR 
CONVECTION MAINLY NEAR MNTS. WENT NEAR POSSIBLY TOO COOL MODEL 
BLEND ON MAX TEMPS BASED ON 1000-850 MB THICKNESS AND UPSTREAM 
HISTORY. MID/UPR LVL RIDGING BUILDS IN THROUGH FRI. ABOVE NORMAL 
TEMPS WITH ISOLATED SLOW MOVING AFTN/EVE TSTMS PSBL. ATMOSPHERE 
MOISTENS UP ON SAT WITH SE ADVANCE OF WEAK COLD FRONT. INCREASED 
PCPN CHCS LATE SAT/EARLY SUN. THEN TEMPS SHOULD COOL TO NEAR NORMAL 
AS HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN SUN NGT AND MON.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
232 PM EDT SUN MAY 8 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...DRY AND WARM WEATHER CONTINUES 
THROUGH THE SHORT TERM AS AMPLIFIED UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES TO 
DOMINATE THE REGION. MODELS HAVE GENERALLY BACKED OFF ON POPS FOR 
LATE IN THE SECOND PERIOD AS UPPER RIDGE AXIS IS PROJECTED TO REMAIN 
ANCHORED OVER THE APPALACHIANS AND KEEP APPROACHING MIDWESTERN 
TROUGH AT BAY. THUS HAVE OPTED FOR DRY FORECAST IN THE SECOND 
PERIOD. CLOUDS EXPECTED TO INCREASE HOWEVER AS MODEL TIME HEIGHTS 
DEPICT MOISTURE INCREASING AT ALL LEVELS. FOR TEMPS...TENDED TO 
FAVOR BLEND OF GUIDANCE VALUES.

.LONG TERM...(MON NIGHT THROUGH SUN)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT IN 
BRINGING UPPER TROUGH ACROSS THE AREA FROM THE WEST MON NIGHT 
THROUGH TUE NIGHT.  MOISTURE AND FORCING LOOK UNIMPRESSIVE...BUT 
ENOUGH TO COMBINE WITH INCREASING INSTABILITY TO INCLUDE SLIGHT CHANCE 
TO CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THIS PERIOD...WITH THE 
HIGHEST POPS TUE WHEN WILL GO 40 TO 50.  NAM QUICKER IN PUSHING 
DEEPER MOISTURE EAST OUT OF THE AREA...AND FOR NOW WILL GO ALONG AND 
KEEP WED DRY.  GFS DEPICTS STRONG RIDGING FOR THU AND FRI...HOWEVER 
STILL SOME CONCERN THAT BACK DOOR COLD FRONT WILL PUSH INTO THE AREA 
BY THU.  WILL GO WITH HPC SOLUTION FOR NOW AND KEEP FRONT TO OUR 
NORTH...SO DRY THU.   NEXT SYSTEM FORECAST TO APPROACH BY THE 
WEEKEND...SO WITH INCREASING MOISTURE WILL GO SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FRI 
AND SAT...CHANCE SUN.   HOWEVER...STILL MORE THAN THE USUAL 
UNCERTAINTY FOR THE THU THROUGH SUN TIME FRAME.

HOWEVER...MODELS HINTING AT A SHORT WAVE CONTINUING OVER THE AREA ON

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION

227 PM EDT SAT MAY 7 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...SHORTWAVE WILL PASS TO THE

GFS HAS A BETTER HANDLE ON THINGS.  STAYED CLOSE TO GUIDANCE ON 
TEMPS AS THERE WAS NO REAL REASON TO DIFFER.  WENT CLOSER TO THE 
COOLER MAV TONIGHT IN THE NORTHEAST BASED ON PREFERENCE ALREADY 
DESCRIBED.


.LONG TERM...(SUN NIGHT THROUGH SAT)...UPPER RIDGE OVER THE AREA 
BEGINS TO BREAK DOWN BY MONDAY NIGHT AS UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES.  
LOOKS LIKE MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY WILL BE LIMITED ENOUGH TO GO DRY 
THROUGH MONDAY...THEN SLIGHT CHANCE POPS MONDAY NIGHT.  APPEARS BEST 
CHANCE FOR PRECIP WILL BE TUESDAY AFTERNOON INTO TUESDAY NIGHT.  
NEXT UPPER RIDGE EXPECTED TO BEGIN BUILDING IN ON WEDNESDAY...WITH 
WARM AND MAINLY DRY CONDITIONS FOR WED AND THU. MODEL AGREEMENT 
LACKING FOR THE THU THROUGH SAT TIME FRAME.  PER HPC MAY BE A 
BACKDOOR COLD FRONT THAT SAGS INTO THE AREA LATE THURSDAY OR THU 
NIGHT...THEN RETREATS BACK NORTH BY EARLY SAT...HOWEVER GFS NOT ON 
BOARD WITH THIS.  FOR NOW WILL GO WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FRI AND 
FRI NIGHT...DRY SAT.  HOWEVER...CONFIDENCE LOWER FOR THU THROUGH SAT 
PORTION OF THE FORECAST.

FXUS64 KMRX 061830
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
229 PM EDT FRI MAY 6 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM CENTERED OFF THE NORTH CAROLINA COAST...WITH 
ONLY A FEW CUMULUS CLOUDS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. THESE CLOUDS 
SHOULD DIMINISH AS THE SUN SETS TONIGHT...WITH MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES... 
LIGHT WINDS AND SOME PATCHY FOG DEVELOPING OVERNIGHT. HIGH PRESSURE 
WILL BE CENTERED OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY TOMORROW...WITH MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKIES AND DRY CONDITIONS CONTINUING. AS FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE 
NUMBERS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT AND LOOK REASONABLE.


.LONG TERM...(SAT NIGHT THROUGH FRI)...MODELS CONTINUE TO DEPICT 
UPPER RIDGE BUILDING OVER THE AREA SAT NIGHT AND SUNDAY.  ONE FLY IN 
THE OINTMENT IS SHORT WAVE ROTATING AROUND UPPER LOW TO OUR 
NORTHEAST...WHICH WILL MOVE BY SAT NIGHT.  IT LOOKS LIKE MOST OF THE 
FORCING WITH THIS FEATURE WILL STAY TO OUR NORTHEAST...SO WILL  
CONTINUE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS MAINLY SW VA FOR SAT NIGHT...AND JUST 
INCREASE CLOUDS FURTHER SOUTH. SUNDAY...CLOUDS SHOULD DIMINISH AGAIN 
AND TEMPS SHOULD CLIMB ABOVE SEASONAL NORMALS.  WILL KEEP THINGS DRY 
SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY MORNING AS UPPER RIDGE DOMINATES...THEN RIDGE 
BREAKS DOWN AND APPROACHING WAVE MAY BRING SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
AT TIMES MON AFTERNOON THROUGH TUE NIGHT.  ANOTHER UPPER RIDGE IS 
FORECAST TO BUILD IN BEHIND THIS WAVE...WILL GO DRY WED AND 
THU...SLIGHT CHANCE FRI AS MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY MAY INCREASE 
ENOUGH FOR SOME CONVECTION. ONLY MINOR TWEAKS TO GFS MOS TEMPS.

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS REVEALS A DIFFUSE BOUNDARY ACROSS NORTHEAST 
TN AND SOUTHWEST VA AS EVIDENCED BY THE DEWPOINT GRADIENT OF AROUND 
15 DEGREES BETWEEN KTRI AND KTYS. MODEL SOUNDINGS AND A MODIFIED 
MORNING BNA SOUNDING INDICATE THAT SOME WEAK INSTABILITY WILL 
DEVELOP LATER TODAY WITH AFTERNOON HEATING. THIS WEAK INSTABILITY... 
COMBINED WITH THE SURFACE BOUNDARY AND A WEAK SHORT WAVE IN THE 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT...MAY TRIGGER A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS ACROSS 
NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA THIS AFTERNOON. 

WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO MENTION THIS SLIGHT 
CHANCE OF RAIN...AND TO REMOVE THE MENTION OF MORNING FOG. FORECAST 
MAXES STILL LOOK GOOD AND WILL NOT PLAN TO CHANGE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
313 AM EDT FRI MAY 6 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A FEW SPRINKLES MAY BE 
LINGERING OVER THE MRX CWA EARLY THIS MORNING...MAINLY OVER OUR 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS.  ADDITIONALLY...WITH YESTERDAY/S RAIN AND LIGHT 
WINDS...AREAS OF FOG HAVE DEVELOPED BUT SHOULD LIFT BY MID MORNING.  
OTHERWISE...THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS HAS EXITING THE REGION OVERNIGHT 
WITH A HIGH PRESSURE RIDGE BEGINNING TO BUILD THIS MORNING.  AS A 
RESULT...INCREASING THICKNESSES WILL MOVING IN AND AIDED BY PLENTY 
OF SUN THIS AFTERNOON...HIGHS TODAY WILL WARM TO NEAR NORMAL 
LEVELS.  THE HIGH WILL DOMINATE AREA WEATHER THROUGH SATURDAY FOR 
CONTINUED DRY CONDITIONS.  MODEL GUIDANCE LOOKS REASONABLE AND WILL 
STAY NEAR THESE READING.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A WEAK IMPULSE WILL 
RIDE DOWN IN THE NORTHWESTERLY FLOW OF THE HIGH ON SATURDAY NIGHT 
...BRUSHING OUR FAR NORTHEAST CORNER.  THE IMPULSE WILL KICK OUT OF 
THE AREA BY SUNDAY WITH THE HIGH REMAINING THE MAIN WEATHER FEATURE 
FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY.  THE NEXT SYSTEM IS PROGGED INTO THE REGION 
MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY WITH CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS.  
A RETURN OF DRY CONDITIONS ON WEDNESDAY AS THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
EXITS THE REGION.  MODELS HINTING AT A WEAK DISTURBANCE PUSHING IN 
ON THURSDAY.  HOWEVER...CONFIDENCE IS LOW ON THE TIMING AND POSITION 
OF THE FEATURE SO FOR NOW WILL KEEP THINGS DRY UNTIL MODELS GET A 
BETTER HANDLED ON IT.

THAT THE ETA MODEL FOR PAST FEW RUNS SEEMED TO DO QUITE WELL IN 
DEPICTING WHERE THE AREA OF RAIN WOULD FALL...EVEN QUITE ACCURATE IN 
SHOWING THAT THE LEAST AMOUNT OF RAIN WOULD FALL ACROSS WRN NC TODAY.

ALREADY DID AN EARLIER UPDATE OF GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS AT 5PM...TO 
REFLECT COOLER HOURLY TEMPS AND SLIGHTLY HIGHER DEW POINTS.  WILL 
RE-VISIT GRIDS AND MAKE SOME MORE ADJUSTMENTS...PLUS ADD SOME AREAS 
OF FOG FOR REST OF TONIGHT...PERHAPS NOT DENSE YET DUE TO LINGERING

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...RAIN EVENT COMES TO AN END IN

ANY SIGNIFICANT CLEARING DOUBTFUL UNTIL THE SECOND PERIOD AT THE EARLIEST. 
HOWEVER...LACK OF ANY LIFT DEPICTED IN THE TIME HEIGHTS SUGGESTS 
PRECIP WILL END BY AROUND OR SHORTLY AFTER 03Z IN ALL AREAS. UPPER 
RIDGE BUILDS INTO THE REGION IN THE SECOND PERIOD WITH GOOD HEIGHT 
RISES PROJECTED. THE RISING HEIGHTS ALONG WITH ANTICIPATED CLEARING 
SHOULD ALLOW TEMPS TO WARM NICELY TOMORROW. GENERALLY FAVORED BLEND 
OF GUIDANCE VALUES FOR TEMPS.

.LONG TERM...(FRI NIGHT THROUGH THU)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT 
THAT UPPER RIDGE WILL BEGIN BUILDING OVER THE AREA FRI NIGHT AND 
WILL CONTINUE INTO SUNDAY. WILL GO WITH DRY CONDITIONS AND MOSTLY 
CLEAR TO PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS FRIDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY.  BY MONDAY 
NIGHT NEXT UPPER TROUGH WILL APPROACH...WILL CARRY LOW CHANCE TO 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR MON NIGHT THROUGH TUE NIGHT WITH THIS 
SYSTEM.  AN UPPER RIDGE EXPECTED TO BUILD INTO THE REGION AGAIN WED 
AND THU...WILL GO DRY BOTH DAYS.   WILL NOT STRAY TOO FAR FROM GFS 
MOS TEMPS.

LOW LEVELS AND NOT TOO MUCH IN THE WAY OF ADVECTION ABLE TO KICK IN 
BEFORE THE INFLUENCE OF THE UPPER LEVEL SYSTEM SLIPS OFF TO THE 
EAST.  SHOWERS WILL BE TAPERING OFF BEFORE SUNRISE FRIDAY.

SMOKIES HANGS IN AS COOLER/DRIER AIR INFILTRATES EAST OF MOUNTAINS.  
ETA LEAVES DEW POINTS HIGH ENOUGH TO BE UNSTABLE IN THE 
AFTERNOON...BUT THINK VALUES ARE TOO HIGH AND SUBSIDENCE BEHIND TROF 
AXIS WILL HELP SUPPRESS CONVECTION.  NOT INSERTING ANY POPS AT THIS 
TIME.

RIDGE MOVES IN FOR THE WEEKEND.  THINKING AHEAD...MIGHT HAVE SOME 
FOG SATURDAY MORNING...BUT NOT CONVINCED IT WOULD BE THICK ENOUGH TO 
MENTION IN PRODUCTS THIS FAR AHEAD OF TIME. 

NEXT TROF SWEEPS INTO AREA LATE MONDAY OR TUESDAY DEPENDING ON 
TIMING.  HAVE BOOSTED THE POPS FOR MONDAY NIGHT.  ALSO FOR TUESDAY 
MORNING HAVE BUMPED UP MIN TEMPS AS CLOUDS AND RELATIVELY BREEZY 
CONDITIONS COUNTERACT RADIATIONAL COOLING.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 PM EDT WED MAY 4 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SKIES REMAIN MOSTLY SUNNY 
THIS AFTERNOON AS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE EASTERN GREAT 
LAKES CONTINUES A DRY NORTHEAST FLOW ACROSS THE TN VALLEY AND 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WAS MOST EVIDENT IN THE 
NORTHEAST WITH CU FORMATION BUT SKIES HAVE QUICKLY SCATTERED OUT. 
HIGH CLOUDINESS WAS SPREADING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN AND WESTERN PART 
OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

GFS/NAM NOT IN VERY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH NEXT SYSTEM. A SOUTHERN  
SHORTWAVE TROUGH OVER EAST TX IS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST 
ACROSS THE GULF COAST TONIGHT AND THURSDAY WHILE A STATIONARY FRONT 
CONTINUES OVER THE GULF AND FLORIDA. THE SHORTWAVE IS EXPECTED TO 
FORM A WEAK LOW ALONG THE FRONT AND MOVE IT TO THE NORTHEAST OFF  
THE SOUTHEAST US COAST BY THURSDAY EVENING. THE NAM BRINGS THE 
MOISTURE MUCH FARTHER NORTH AND WEST THAN THE GFS. HAVE NOT CHANGED 
THE FORECAST MUCH AS THE GFS HAS BEEN MORE CONSISTENT. HAVE REMOVED 
POPS TONIGHT. WITH CURRENT LOW DEWPOINTS WENT BELOW ALL GUIDANCE ON 
LOWS A FEW DEGREES. HIGH CLOUDS SPREADING IN FROM THE SOUTHWEST 
AHEAD OF SOUTHERN SHORTWAVE SHOULD NOT LOWER UNTIL THE LATE NIGHT OR 
EARLY MORNING HOURS. PUT LIKELY POPS ACROSS SW NC AND THEN 40 
PERCENT CHANCE IN THE REST OF THE MOUNTAINS AND 30 PERCENT OR LESS 
IN THE VALLEYS AND PLATEAU. THICKENING CLOUDS THURSDAY SHOULD KEEP 
HIGHS COOL AGAIN TOMORROW MAINLY IN THE LOWER TO MID 60S...JUST 
BELOW MAV GUIDANCE.   

.LONG TERM...(THU NIGHT THROUGH WED)...GFS/NAM IN POOR AGREEMENT FOR 
THU NIGHT THROUGH SAT.  NAM APPEARS TO BE AN OUTLIER IN ITS HANDLING 
OF LOW NEAR THE SOUTHEAST COAST THU NIGHT THROUGH FRI NIGHT...WHILE 
THE GFS HAS MUCH BETTER SUPPORT FROM ENSEMBLES AND OTHER MODELS...SO 
WILL FOLLOW HPC LEAD AND GO CLOSE TO GFS SOLUTION.  BY SAT GFS IS 
NOT AS AMPLIFIED WITH THE UPPER RIDGE BUILDING IN...AND HAS 
WEAKENING SHORT WAVE ENERGY MOVING SOUTHEAST DOWN THE EAST SIDE OF 
THE RIDGE.  THINK THE GFS MAY BE OVERDONE WITH THIS FEATURE...AND 
EVEN IT HAS NO PRECIP IN OUR AREA SAT.  WILL JUST GO PARTLY CLOUDY 
SAT AFTERNOON RATHER THAN MOSTLY SUNNY FOR NOW...WILL HAVE TO WATCH 
LATER TRENDS.  LOOKS LIKE UPPER RIDGE BUILDS IN AND CONTROLS OUR 
WEATHER SUN AND MON...WITH NEXT SYSTEM BRINGING POSSIBILITY OF 
SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS MON NIGHT THROUGH TUE NIGHT.

WILL ALSO DRY THINGS OUT WITH FAIRLY DECENT DIURNAL SWINGS IN THE
TEMPERATURES ANTICIPATED. SURFACE RIDGE MOVES EAST OF THE REGION BY TUESDAY
AND WEDNESDAY ALLOWING BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE TO RETURN.  SOME DIURNAL

AS UPPER RIDGE WEAKENS.

MODELS SHOW BEST CHANCES OVER MOUNTAINS TO EAST...SO THINKING A

AGREEMENT WITH TRACK THE OF NEXT SYSTEM PROGGED INTO THE REGION ON 
THURSDAY INTO THURSDAY NIGHT.  FOR NOW...WILL CONTINUE WITH A 
COMPROMISE SOLUTION WHICH PLACES THE BEST CHANCE OF SHOWERS ALONG 
OUR EASTERN MOUNTAINS AND LOWER POPS TO THE WEST.  SYSTEM MOVES OUT 
ON FRIDAY AS A STRONG RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN FOR THE 
WEEKEND FOR DRY CONDITIONS AND WARMING TEMPERATURES.  MODEL AND RUN 
TO RUN CONSISTENCY CONTINUE TO BE A PROBLEM WITH THE HANDLING OF THE 
WEATHER SYSTEM PROGGED INTO THE THE AREA AROUND THE MONDAY/TUESDAY 
TIME FRAME.  CONFIDENCE IS LOW WITH THE HANDLING OF THIS SYSTEM SO

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 AM EDT TUE MAY 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...AREAS OF CI/CS AND SOME MID-LEVEL CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO 
MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY...BUT SURFACE 
RIDGING WILL KEEP CONDITIONS DRY.  MOSTLY CLEAR SKY AND LIGHT WINDS
TONIGHT WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO DROP INTO THE MID AND UPPER 30S OVER
NORTHERN THIRD OF THE AREA AND PLATEAU AND FAR EASTERN MOUNTAINS.  WILL
INCLUDE SCATTERED FROST IN THESE AREAS AND ISSUE A SPS FOR TONIGHT.

MODELS DIFFER GREATLY IN RESPECT TO PHASING OF NORTHERN AND SOUTHERN STREAM
SHORT-WAVE MOVING TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR THURSDAY. NAM
DEPICTS A STRONGER SHORT-WAVE TROUGH WITH GREATER RETURN MOISTURE AND
PRECIPITATION OVER THE FORECAST AREA. GFS HAS A WEAKER WAVE WITH SURFACE
CYCLOGENSIS OFF THE SOUTHEAST COAST...BUT KEEPING MOST OF THE RAIN EAST
OF THE FORECAST AREA.

WILL MAINTAIN CURRENT THINKING AND TREND TOWARD THE GFS MODEL...WHICH
IS ALSO FAVORED BY HPC.  WILL ONLY CALL FOR 20-30 PERCENT POPS FOR
THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT.

FOR THE EXTENDED...AS UPPER TROUGH MOVES EAST FRIDAY...UPPER AND SURFACE
RIDGING WILL BUILD OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
THIS WEEKEND ALLOWING FOR DRY AND WARMER CONDITIONS.  BY MONDAY...MOISTURE
BEGINS TO INCREASE AS UPPER RIDGE FLATTENS.  WILL MAINTAIN CHANCE POPS
FOR MONDAY.

OTHERWISE...WITH GOOD DIURNAL COOLING EXPECTED TONIGHT...DECREASING

BELIEVE AT LEAST PATCHY FOG WILL DEVELOP BY MORNING...ESPECIALLY 
AROUND WATER SOURCES AND LOW LYING AREAS. A QUIET WEATHER PATTERN 
CONTINUES INTO MONDAY WITH DRY CONDITIONS AND SEASONAL TEMPERATURES.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...DRY WEATHER WILL CONTINUE 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY...AS NAM AND GFS MODELS BOTH INDICATE THAT 
MOISTURE WILL BE LIMITED WITH A BROAD UPPER TROUGH ON TUESDAY. THIS 
UPPER TROUGH SHOULD BRING JUST AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS ON TUESDAY AS 
IT SWINGS ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WAS 
PROGGED TO DEVELOP OVER THE DEEP SOUTH ON THURSDAY...BRINGING THE 
POSSIBILITY OF A FEW SHOWERS ON THURSDAY. HOWEVER...LATEST GFS MODEL 
RUN INDICATES THAT A MESOSCALE CONVECTIVE SYSTEM MAY DEVELOP INSTEAD 
ALONG THE GULF COAST. THIS SCENARIO WOULD LIMIT ANY SURFACE LOW 
DEVELOPMENT OVER THE SOUTHEAST...WHICH WOULD RESULT IN LESS MOISTURE 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THUS...DRY CONDITIONS MAY CONTINUE 
FOR MOST OF THE WEEK. WILL LET LATER SHIFTS DECIDE WHETHER TO REMOVE 
POPS ON THURSDAY...SINCE MODEL CONTINUITY IN THE EXTENDED PERIODS 
HAS BEEN POOR LATELY.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...DRY WEATHER CONTINUES ON 
SUNDAY AND MONDAY WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING INTO THE REGION.  
ANOTHER FRONT PUSHES IN TUESDAY AND LINGERS INTO WEDNESDAY...KEPT 
CHANCE POPS ON TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS THURSDAY.

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
925 PM EDT THU APR 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...
THE SHOWERS THAT PASSED THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA HAVE MOVED OUT OF 
THE REGION THIS EVENING. HOWEVER THIS BREAK IS ONLY TEMPORARY AS THE 
STRONG FLOW ALOFT JUST TO THE NORTH IS EXPECTED TO CAUSE A WARM 
FRONT TO FORM AND MOVE NORTH INTO SW VA AND SOUTHERN KY BY MORNING. 
THE BEST CHANCE OF RAIN WILL BE ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS AS WARM AIR 
IS LIFTED NORTH. THE RUC INDICATES A SHORTWAVE MOVING FROM THE MS 
VALLEY EASTWARD INTO THE TN VALLEY WILL INCREASE PRECIPITATION AS 
WELL. ALSO PATCHY FOG IS BEGINNING TO FORM IN THE TN VALLEY. WILL 
ADD THAT IN THE WORDING FOR THE REMAINDER OF TONIGHT. HAVE ADJUSTED 
POPS DOWN SLIGHTLY IN SOME AREAS. ALSO EXTENDED GRIDS HAVE BEEN 
CHANGED SLIGHTLY DUE TO TRANSFER PROBLEMS WHEN OHX WAS BACKING US UP 
DURING TODAYS SOFTWARE UPGRADE.

FXUS64 KMRX 281908
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
ISSUED BY NASHVILLE TN
308 PM EDT THU APR 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...
SHOWERS COVERING MUCH OF EASTERN TN AT THE CURRENT TIME. FAST MOVING
DISTURBANCES ALOFT HELPING WITH THE SHOWER ACTIVITY THIS AFTERNOON.
HIGH PRESSURE OFF THE GA COAST IS MOVING OUT OVER THE ATLANTIC
AND ITS INFLUENCE WILL CONTINUE TO WEAKEN.

STRONG WEST TO EAST JET ALOFT TO CONTINUE THROUGH TONIGHT WITH
FRONTOGENESIS ON ORDER ACROSS SOUTHERN KY INTO FAR SW VA. THUS...
WITH JUST A SLIGHT DEGREE OF INSTABILITY...THE BETTER CHANCES OF
RAINFALL AFTER MIDNIGHT WILL BE ALONG AND NORTH OF THE BOUNDARY.
THIS WILL INCLUDE NORTHERN PORTIONS OF EASTERN TN AND PARTICULARLY
ACROSS FAR SW VA. OTHERWISE...FOR THE EVENING HOURS...WILL GO WITH A
CHANCE OF SHOWERS FAR SOUTH...THEN LIKELY CHANCES TO THE NORTH.
MAY EVEN GO CATEGORICAL DEPENDING ON THE MOST RECENT RADAR TRENDS.

ON FRIDAY...INSTABILITIES WILL BE ON THE UPSWING...PARTICULARLY
LATE IN THE AFTERNOON. HOWEVER...PRECIP CHANCES WILL BE LOWER GIVEN
THE INTENSIFICATION OF A MUCH STRONGER SFC LOW LOCATED NEAR THE
ARKLATEX AROUND 18Z. THIS STRONGER SFC LOW WILL ACT TO MITIGATE
MUCH OF THE ENERGY DOWNSTREAM AND ALONG THE PREVIOUSLY MENTIONED
BOUNDARY. THUS...WITH THE SOUTHERLY WIND ON THE INCREASE...
TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM QUITE WELL DURING THE AFTERNOON. THIS IN
TURN...WILL HELP OUT WITH THE DESTABILIZATION PROCESS.

BY FRIDAY NIGHT...SEVERE WEATHER WILL BE POSSIBLE. UPPER TROUGH AND
AN ASSOCIATED VORT MAX ACROSS THE CENTRAL U.S. WILL ENHANCE THE
DEVELOPMENT OF THE SFC LOW TO OUR WEST. THIS LOW WILL QUICKLY TRACK
NORTHEAST AND WILL BE LOCATED OVER EXTREME SOUTHERN IN AROUND 06Z
SAT. INSTABILITY PROFILES DO KEEP THE BETTER CAPES AND LOWEST LI
VALUES TO THE WEST THROUGH THE EVENT. HOWEVER...WITH A 50-55 KT 850
MB FLOW WITHIN A STRONG REGION OF FORCING...CANT RULE OUT SVR
POTENTIAL. STORMS WILL BE VERY FAST MOVERS WHICH COULD FURTHER ADD
TO THE WIND DMG POTENTIAL IN ADDITION TO ANY DOWNWARD MOMENTUM
TRANSFER.

SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE EARLY SATURDAY MORNING...
PARTICULARLY ACROSS EASTERN AREAS. THE FRONTAL BOUNDARY WILL THEN
PUT AN END TO THE PRECIPITATION BY SATURDAY EVENING AS IT MOVES
EAST.

IN THE EXTENDED FORECAST...SFC HIGH WILL GOVERN THE WEATHER THROUGH
MONDAY. MOISTURE WILL THEN SPREAD BACK TOWARD THE AREA BY THE
MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. LATEST GFS POINTS TO A WET AND SLIGHTLY COOLER
THAN NORMAL SCENARIO AS A SFC LOW TRACKS ALONG THE GULF COASTAL
STATES. SEVERAL MRF RUNS HAVE HINTED TOWARD THIS SCENARIO.

&&

OVER EASTERN TN TODAY SO THE BULK OF THE PRECIP WILL BE IN THE FORM
OF SHOWERS.

WIND WISE...PRESSURE GRADIENT TO TIGHTEN NOTICEABLY AFTER 18Z.
CURRENT PACKAGE REFLECTS THIS NICELY.

ZONES. OTHERWISE...TEMPS AND WINDS LOOK FINE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EDT THU APR 28 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH TONIGHT)...UPPER LEVEL TROUGH THAT 
SUPPORTED INSTABILITIES TO GIVE US NUMEROUS SHOWERS AND EVEN SOME 
SMALL HAIL WEDNESDAY HAS NOW SWUNG WELL TO THE EAST.  DEEP WARM 
ADVECTION ALOFT SHOULD BEGIN TO STABLIZE AIR MASS FOR MOST OF THE 
PRECIP THAT MOVES IN THIS AFTERNOON AND TONIGHT.  WILL LEAVE IN 
ISOLATED THUNDER FOR WESTERN PORTIONS OF AREA LATE TODAY AND FOR 
MUCH OF THE AREA TONIGHT...BUT THINK MAJORITY OF PRECIP THROUGH 
TONIGHT WILL BE THUNDER-FREE.

FOR TONIGHT...WARM FRONT LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE SETTING UP NEAR 
TN/KY.  WENT WITH TIGHT GRADIENT OF POPS AND QPF...THINKING THAT 
BETTER CHANCES OF BOTH WOULD BE NEAR AND NORTH OF THE FRONT.  
FOR NORTHEAST VALLEY HAVE ALLOWED HIGHER POPS SINCE COOL AIR NORTH 
OF FRONT MAY BE SLOW TO LIFT NORTHWARD.

HAVE TRIMMED HIGH TEMPS TEMPS 1-2 DEGREES IN GRIDS TODAY THINKING 
THAT CLOUD COVER THIS AFTERNOON WILL LIMIT INSOLATION.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...OVERALL THINK THAT GFS/NAM 
AND OTHER MED TO LONG RANGE MODELS ARE VERY SIMILAR FOR OUR AREA 
WITH THE STRONG SYSTEM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY.  THE
PREVIOUS FORECAST AND GRIDS LOOKED ON TRACK...AND TIMING STILL 
SUGGESTS A COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE SAT MORNING.  THE BEST THREAT OF 
THUNDERSTORMS APPEARS TO BE FROM AROUND 06Z SAT TO 15Z SAT...THEN 
THE DEEP MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY IS EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. 
EXPECT STRONG TO SEVERE STORMS TO PROBABLY MAKE IT TO EASTERN PARTS 
OF THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SE TN BY 06Z SAT...THEN LIKELY WEAKEN 
AS STORMS ENCOUNTER MUCH LESS INSTABILITY ACROSS REMAINDER OF OUR 
FORECAST AREA.  STRONG WINDS WOULD APPEAR TO BE THE MAIN THREAT WITH 
WET BULB ZERO AND FREEZING HEIGHTS HIGH...WHILE STORM MOVEMENT LOOKS 
MUCH TOO FAST FOR ANY LOCALLY HEAVY RAINS OR FLOODING.  

OTHERWISE...KEPT POP GRADIENT N TO S IN ASSOCIATION WITH WARM FRONT 
FRIDAY...THEN SWITCHED TO A W TO E POP GRADIENT AS COLD FRONT AND 
SHORTWAVE TROUGH APPROACH FROM THE W FRIDAY NIGHT.  SEE POTENTIAL 
FOR MOS HIGHS ON FRIDAY TO BE REACHED...AS SOUNDINGS SHOW PLENTY OF 
DRY AIR INTRUSION AND LOW LEVEL WARM AIR ADVECTION.  SAT MAX TEMPS 
WERE LOWERED BY A FEW TO SEVERAL DEGREES ACROSS THE BOARD WITH 
COOLING BEHIND THE FRONTAL PASSAGE...WHICH ALSO FITS WELL WITH NEW 
MOS VALUES AND ADJUSTMENTS MADE BY MOST SURROUNDING OFFICES.

FOR LATER PERIODS...NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES MADE AT THIS POINT... 
ALTHO QUICK LOOK AT GFS AND DGEX SUGGESTS POSSIBLY BETTER RAIN 
CHANCES ON TUESDAY AND/OR WEDNESDAY.  ADDED SOME PRELIMINARY GRIDS 
FOR THE NEW DAY 7 (THURSDAY)...STARTING OUT AS DRY AND NEAR CLIMO 
TEMPS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EDT WED APR 27 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE LOWER MS 
RIVER VALLEY BUILDING INTO THE FORECAST AREA. CURRENT RADARS REVEAL 
SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA...IN ASSOCIATION 
WITH AN UPPER TROUGH WHICH HAS BROUGHT MUCH COLDER AIR ALOFT ACROSS 
THE REGION. A FEW REPORTS OF SMALL HAIL WERE RECEIVED EARLIER THIS 
AFTERNOON...WITH HAIL COVERING THE GROUND IN SOME AREAS. THIS 
CONVECTION SHOULD DECREASE RAPIDLY AFTER SUNSET...WITH AREAS OF FOG 
DEVELOPING AFTER MIDNIGHT AS CLOUDS DECREASE AND WINDS DECOUPLE. 
AFTER TONIGHT...MODELS ARE IN REASONABLE AGREEMENT WITH DEVELOPING A 
WARM FRONT ACROSS KY AND SOUTHWEST VA BY THURSDAY...WHICH SHOULD 
BECOME THE FOCAL POINT FOR CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT FROM THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY. A STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS PROGGED TO 
DEVELOP ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS BY FRIDAY MORNING...WHICH WILL 
THEN QUICKLY MOVE NORTHEAST INTO THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY BY FRIDAY 
NIGHT. BREEZY SOUTHERLY WINDS WILL DEVELOP ON FRIDAY ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA AHEAD OF ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT. RIGHT NOW...IT 
APPEARS THAT A LARGE OUTBREAK OF SEVERE TSTORMS COULD DEVELOP ACROSS 
WEST TN BY FRIDAY EVENING...BUT THEN WEAKEN AS THIS FRONT MOVES EAST 
TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA (INTO MORE STABLE AIR). HOWEVER...STRONG TO 
SEVERE TSTORMS WILL STILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA LATE 
FRIDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...CANADIAN MODEL PREFERRED 
EARLY IN THE PERIOD WITH ECMWF THE BEST MODEL BEGINNING DAY 6 AND 
FOLLOWED CLOSELY. EARLY WEEKEND UPR TROF AND ASSOCIATED CD FNT MOVES 
E OF THE FA BY SAT EVENING WITH POPS DROPPING OFF FROM HIGH CHC 
SHRA/TSRA ENTIRE REGION TO SLGT CHC -SHRA ACROSS SW VA/NE TN SAT 
NIGHT. A BREAK IN THE ACTION FOLLOWS FOR A COUPLE OF DAYS AS UPR FLO 
TRANSITIONS TO MORE ZONAL PATTERN WITH LOW LVL RIDGING BUILDING 
ACROSS THE AREA. LATE IN THE FCST TUE/WED...WILL INTRODUCE SOME 
SLGT/CHC CHC POPS AS SRN STREAM WAVE RIDES ALONG BOUNDARY IN PLACE 
ALONG THE GULF COAST. KEPT SW VA/PART OF NE TN DRY EARLY IN THIS 
PERIOD AND THEN USED SLGT CHC HERE BY WED AS ISENTROPIC LIFT 
INCREASES AS WAVE BUILDS NE INTO THE SRN APPALACHIANS. STAYED PRETTY 
CLOSE TO GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGH FCST.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
355 AM EDT WED APR 27 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES PROJECT 
UPPER TROUGH AXIS TO SWING ACROSS SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS DURING THE 
FIRST PERIOD.  ENOUGH LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE AND INSTABILITY WILL 
ACCOMPANY THE UPPER TROUGH THAT SCATTERED SHOWERS ARE POSSIBLE... 
ESPECIALLY OVER THE NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA.  THUS 
HAVE KEPT LOW POPS FOR THOSE AREAS IN THE FIRST PERIOD. SECOND 
PERIOD LOOKS DRY AS FLOW BECOMES ANTI-CYCLONIC ALOFT AND SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN.  FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE VALUES ARE IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT AND APPEAR REASONABLE.  TENDED TO GO WITH BLEND OF THOSE 
GUIDANCE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THRU WEDNESDAY)...NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES MADE 
TO THURSDAY/THURSDAY NIGHT AS THE MAIN THREAT OF CONVECTIVE PCPN 
LOOKS TO BE ASSOCIATED WITH THE SURFACE LOW AND WARM FRONT IN THE 
MID MISS VALLEY REGION...WITH NEARLY ZONAL UPPER FLOW TO PUSH PCPN
EASTWARD.  PREVIOUS POP/WX GRIDS WERE STILL ORIENTED TO FAVOR HIGHER 
POPS ACROSS NRN MOST PARTS OF OUR FORECAST AREA.  NOT A LOT OF 
INSTABILITY OR STRONG LIFT UNTIL FRIDAY NIGHT...SO MODIFIED PCPN 
TYPE TO JUST SHOWERS UNTIL THE STRONGER SYSTEM ARRIVES LATE FRIDAY.

FOR THE 27/00Z MODEL RUN...FOUND NAM AND GFS IN BETTER AGREEMENT ON 
TIMING THE STRONGER SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND COLD FRONT INTO WRN PARTS 
OF THE FORECAST AREA LATE FRIDAY NIGHT.  BOTH THE NAM/DGEX AND GFS 
SUGGEST A FRONTAL PASSAGE (FROPA) BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON...ALTHO HPC 
MENTIONS THAT NCEP ENSEMBLE AND OTHER MED/LONG RANGE MODELS ARE NOT 
QUITE AS FAST AS THE OPERATIONAL GFS.  UPPER LEVEL PATTERN LOOKS 
PROGRESSIVE...AND HPC IS FAVORING THE GFS MODEL FOR NOW.  THUS... 
MADE SOME ADJUSTMENTS FROM FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...INCREASING 
POPS TO VERY HIGH CHANCE BY 06Z SAT UP TO 18Z SAT.  THEN...LOWERED 
POPS TO JUST SLIGHT CHANCE AFTER 06Z SUNDAY INTO SUNDAY AFTERNOON 
AND EVENING.   IF THIS FASTER TREND CONTINUES TO BE SUPPORTED...THEN 
LATER SHIFTS WILL NEED TO RAISE POPS TO LIKELY OR CATEGORICAL LATE 
FRIDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SATURDAY...AND CONSIDER COMPLETELY REMOVING 
POPS FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT.

OTHERWISE...VERY MINOR MAX/MIN TEMP ADJUSTMENTS MADE...AND SOME 
PRELIMINARY GRIDS WERE ALSO MADE FOR THE NEW DAY 7 (WEDNESDAY).

WITH THE EVENT...THUS NOT ANTICIPATING ANY CONVECTION TO GET TOO 
STRONG. NEVERTHELESS...HAVE CONTINUED TO MENTION THUNDER. UPPER 
TROUGH DEAMPLIFIES SOMEWHAT THROUGH THE SECOND PERIOD...BUT ENOUGH 
WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE IS PROJECTED TO KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING... 
ESPECIALLY OVER THE NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY FAVORED GFS GUIDANCE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THRU TUESDAY)...FOR EARLY PARTS OF THE LONG 
TERM...KEPT IN SOME LOW POPS FOR EARLY WEDS MORNING BUT NOT BEYOND 
THAT TIME.  DID NOT SEE ANY ADDITIONAL SHORTWAVE/VORT MAX OR THE 
POTENTIAL FOR WRAP AROUND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE FOR WEDS AFTERNOON...SO 
KEPT THE REST OF WEDS AND WEDS NIGHT DRY FOR NOW.  

FOR THU AND FRI...UPPER LEVEL FLOW BECOMES NEARLY ZONAL WITH ONE 
DEFINITE SURFACE FEATURE BEING A WARM FRONT THAT ENDS UP ACROSS KY 
TO W VA.  I SAW THE POTENTIAL FOR CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT ALONG THIS 
BOUNDARY WITH AN EASTWARD MOVEMENT (POSSIBLE MCS ACTIVITY)...SO POPS 
WERE RAISED FOR MY NRN AREAS (WHICH MESHES BETTER WITH JKL AND RLX 
GRIDS).  I ALSO INTRODUCED AT LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS EVERYWHERE 
THU AFTERNOON...BUT NOT REAL IMPRESSED WITH THE INSTABILITY FOR THU 
OR FRI...SO KEPT TYPE AS SHOWERS.  

WEEKEND AND BEYOND...MODELS BEGAN TO DIFFER TO THE POINT THAT MUCH 
UNCERTAINTY EXISTS...SO NO CHANGES AT THIS POINT.  GFS MODEL IS FAST 
IN BRINGING A SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND COLD FRONT INTO THE REGION BY 
LATE FRI NIGHT INTO SAT...WHICH SUGGESTS INCREASING POPS.  HOWEVER...
AS HPC MENTIONS...THE ENSEMBLES AND ECMWF ARE MUCH SLOWER THAN GFS.
WILL DEFER ANY WEEKEND CHANGES TO NEXT SHIFT.  SOME BASIC GRIDS WERE 
ADDED FOR THE NEW DAY 7 (TUESDAY).

OTHERWISE...MINOR TEMP ADJUSTMENTS TO BLEND BETTER WITH NEIGHBORS 
AND 26/00Z MOS VALUES THROUGH THU. 
 
&&

MENTION POSSIBILITY OF THUNDER TOMORROW AFTERNOON INTO EARLY TUE 
NIGHT.  WILL TAPER POPS OFF AND DROP THUNDER LATTER PART OF TUE 
NIGHT.   WILL GENERALLY STAY CLOSE TO MAV TEMPS THROUGH TUE 
NIGHT...WITH JUST A FEW TWEAKS HERE AND THERE. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...FRONT THROUGH THE EARLY 
WEDNESDAY.  STILL SOME RESIDUAL MOISTURE LINGERING WITH THE UPPER 
TROUGH...SO KEPT 20 POPS FOR THE MORNING HOURS AND DRY IN THE 
AFTERNOON.  SURFACE HIGH BUILDING IN KEEPING WEDNESDAY NIGHT DRY.  
GFS INDICATING A WARM FRONT MOVING IN LATE THURSDAY...WILL KEEP 
THURSDAY DRY FOR NOW AND HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS ON THURSDAY NIGHT.  
FRONT STALLS OVER THE AREA ON FRIDAY...AS SURFACE LOW NEARS...WILL 
KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT.  A SURFACE LOW/COLD 
FRONT ENTERS THE PICTURE ON SATURDAY...KEPT CHANCE POPS FOR SATURDAY 
AND SATURDAY NIGHT.  ANOTHER FRONTAL SYSTEM ENTERS REGION ON 
SUNDAY...KEPT CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT.  DRY WEATHER 
RETURNS ON MONDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 250825
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
420 AM EDT MON APR 25 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LINGERING LOW TO MID DECK CLOUDS 
PLUS WINDS HAVE REALLY HINDERED HOW MUCH TEMPS HAVE BEEN ABLE TO 
FALL OVERNIGHT.  LATEST IR SATELLITE PICS SHOW A TREND FOR SRN END 
OF CLOUDS TO ERODE...WHICH WILL HELP TEMPS FALL OVER THE NEXT FEW 
HOURS.  HOWEVER...WEST WINDS OF 10 TO 15 MPH SEEM QUITE COMMON 
ACROSS SWRN VA AND NE TN...WHICH CERTAINLY WORKS AGAINST TEMPS 
DROPPING TO OR BELOW FREEZING THIS MORNING.  THUS...WE FEEL BEST 
COURSE OF ACTION WILL BE TO CANCEL THE FREEZE WARNING FOR MANY AREAS 
THIS MORNING.  BASED ON AVAILABLE RAWS/FIRE WX SITES AND SCHOOL NET 
OBSERVATIONS...SEEMS WISE TO CONTINUE THE FREEZE WARNING FOR JUST 
THE MTN COUNTIES ALONG THE TN/NC LINE.  THE NPWMRX PRODUCT HAS BEEN 
UPDATED TO REFLECT THESE CHANGES.

FOR LATER TODAY...ALREADY SEEING SOME MID TO HIGH CLOUDS INCREASE 
FROM THE WEST...SO EXPECT A PARTLY CLOUDY DAY.  MAV MOS HIGHS LOOKED 
QUITE GOOD FOR TODAY...WITH WINDS ADJUSTED CLOSER TO THE NGM MOS. 

FOR TONIGHT...OVERALL WE FEEL THAT LATEST MOS POPS ARE A BIT TOO 
HIGH FOR TONIGHT...GIVEN WEAK LIFT AND HARDLY ANY INSTABILITY OVER 
OUR REGION.  THOSE HIGH MOS POPS ACTUALLY INCREASE RAPIDLY JUST 
BEFORE 12Z TUESDAY...SO WE FEEL SAFE IN UNDERCUTTING MOS POPS AND 
GOING SOMEWHAT CLOSER TO THE ETA MOS POPS.  TRIED TO MESH AS BEST 
POSSIBLE WITH NEIGHBORS POPS...AND STILL TAKE ADVANTAGE OF AN 
OPPORTUNITY TO BEST THE MOS POPS AND SHORT RANGE MODELS QPF.  ALSO
...FAVORED THE MOS BLEND FOR MINS TONIGHT GIVEN THE INCREASING 
CLOUDS AND RISING DEW POINT TEMPS.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...PREFER THE SLOWER NAM WITH 
THE START OF SOLID PRECIPITATION INTO THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY AS 
COLD FRONT MOVES INTO THE MS VALLEY. IT LOOKS LIKE THE WARM FRONT 
WILL STAY TO THE SOUTH OF TN HOWEVER ENOUGH DYNAMICS AHEAD OF THE 
FRONT SHOULD BRING SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS TO THE TN VALLEY AND 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. RAINFALL 
AMOUNTS SHOULD RANGE FROM A HALF TO ONE INCH WITH LOCAL AMOUNTS 
ABOVE ONE INCH SW NC AND SE TN. WINDS MAY GET STRONG ENOUGH TUESDAY 
FOR A WIND ADVISORY BEING REQUIRED IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS AS THE 
FRONT APPROACHES. THIS FRONT IS FAST MOVING AND SHOULD BE EAST OF 
THE APPALACHIANS BY ABOUT MIDNIGHT. LINGERING WRAP AROUND MOISTURE 
WILL MOVE NORTHEAST WEDNESDAY MORNING SO WEDNESDAY SHOULD BE NICE AS 
TROUGH FLATTENS AND AIRMASS DRIES OUT. SOME HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE 
SPREADS OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY THURSDAY AHEAD OF A STATIONARY 
FRONT EXTENDING FROM THE PLAINS WEST THROUGH THE ROCKIES BUT LOWER 
LEVELS OF THE ATMOSPHERE STAY DRY. LOW PRESSURE BEGINS TO INTENSIFY 
FRIDAY OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AS HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHEAST 
BRINGS MOISTURE NORTH INTO TN. A FEW SHOWERS MAY DEVELOP BUT THE 
DEVELOPING SYSTEM SHOULD AFFECT THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY AND 
SUNDAY. MORE WIDESPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS LOOK LIKELY WITH 
TEMPERATURES WARMING INTO THE 70S MORE LIKE NORMAL TEMPERATURES FOR 
THIS TIME OF YEAR.

.DISCUSSION...PRESSURE GRADIENT WEAKENING THIS EVENING AND WINDS

UNSEASONALBE COLD AIR MASS IN PLACE...EXPECT ONE MORE COLD NIGHT 
ACROSS THE REGION.  TEMPERATURES WILL FALL BELOW FREEZING ACROSS 
MUCH OF THE AREA WITH SOME NEAR RECORD READING POSSIBLE.  HOWEVER... 
TEMPERATURES ARE EXPECTED TO REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING ACROSS MUCH OF 
THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN TENNESSEE VALLEY.  A FREEZING WARNING IS IN 
EFFECT FOR THE REST OF THE CWA.  ADDITIONALLY...ISOLATED LIGHT RAIN 
AND SNOW SHOWERS OVER THE NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS WILL DIMINISH TO A FEW 
FLURRIES BEFORE ENDING OVERNIGHT.  NO ADDITIONAL SNOW ACCUMULATION 
IS EXPECTED.  ON MONDAY...HIGH PRESSURE WILL SLOWLY BUILD INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION...FOR DRY CONDITIONS AND CLEARING 
SKIES...ALLOWING TEMPERATURES TO BEGIN MODIFYING.  ALL HANDLED WELL 
IN THE CURRENT FORECAST...WILL UPDATE LATE THIS EVENING TO REMOVE 
EVENING WORDING.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 240930
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
530 AM EDT SUN APR 24 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY)...PRECIPITATION INCREASED OVER THE PAST HOUR 
OR SO...ESPECIALLY ACROSS NE TN AND SWRN VA (TRI BRIEFLY DOWN 3/4SM 
MILE VSBY WITH -SN).  DIFFICULT TIME OF THE DAY TO HAVE ANY GROUND 
TRUTH INFO FROM THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...SO FELT IT WAS BEST TO LET 
THE WINTER WX AND SNOW ADVISORIES RUN THEIR COURSE THRU NOON TODAY.  

PREVIOUS WX AND POP GRIDS ONLY REQUIRED MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO FIT 
LATEST RADAR DATA AND SURFACE TEMPERATURES...WITH 12 HOUR POPS 
ENDING UP VERY NEAR THE MOS BLEND FOR TODAY.  GIVEN THE COLD AIR 
ADVECTION...KEPT THE MAX TEMPS MORE IN LINE WITH OR JUST BELOW THE 
COOLER MAV MOS HIGHS.  ONLY PROBLEM TO THIS APPROACH IS THE 
POTENTIAL FOR A LOT OF SUNSHINE AT TIMES ACROSS WRN PARTS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA.

WIND SPEEDS NOT REAL IMPRESSIVE AT THIS TIME...BUT AGAIN NOT A LOT 
OF DATA AVAILABLE FROM THE HIGHER TERRAIN.  THE MRX WIND PROFILE 
(VWP) HAS CONSISTENTLY SHOWN ONLY 30 KNOT WINDS ALOFT TO MIX DOWN...
SO OPENED UP A LARGER RANGE OF WIND SPEEDS IN MOST GROUPS.  WIND 
ADVISORY CONTINUES THRU NOON TODAY FOR TN/NC MTN GROUPS.

.LONG TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...LAST LITTLE BIT OF ENERGY 
ROTATES AROUND UPPER LEVEL LOW MOVING INTO PA THIS EVENING WITH A 
FEW SNOW OR RAIN SHOWERS. PRESSURE GRADIENT BEGINS TO LOOSEN UP AND 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE FINALLY MOVES OUT OF NE TN DURING THE EVENING AND 
SW VA AFTER MIDNIGHT. HAVE ISSUED A FREEZE WATCH FOR TONIGHT FOR SW 
VA AND THE MOUNTAINS. DID NOT ISSUE A FREEZE WARNING YET FOR THESE 
AREAS BECAUSE CURRENT FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT THIS MORNING AND NOT 
QUITE CONFIDENT OF THE COVERAGE IN SW VA DUE TO LINGERING CLOUDS AND 
WIND. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE PLAIN STATES WILL WORK SE 
TOWARDS THE GULF SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY. DRY WESTERLY FLOW KEEPS 
THE FORECAST AREA NICE WITH GOOD WARMING TEMPERATURES...10 TO 15 
DEGREES ABOVE TODAYS 40S AND 50S TO THE LOWER TO MID 60S. SURFACE 
LOW AND SYSTEM OVER THE EASTERN LAKES LIFTS NORTH INTO CANADA MONDAY 
AS CYCLOGENESIS DEVELOPS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WITH NEXT 
DEVELOPING FRONTAL SYSTEM. A SHORTWAVE IS ALSO EXPECTED TO DROP 
SOUTH OUT OF CANADA AND COMBINE WITH THE SOUTHERN SYSTEM. A LARGE 
AREA OF PRECIPITATION WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE PLAINS MONDAY NIGHT 
AND SPREAD EAST INTO THE TN VALLEY TUESDAY MORNING. FOLLOWED THE 
SLIGHTLY SLOWER NAM WITH SHOWERS DEVELOPING BY MORNING SOUTH AND 
WEST AND DURING THE MORNING EAST AND NORTH. LOOKS LIKE HEAVIEST RAIN 
AND CONVECTION WILL STAY SOUTH OF TN OVER THE GULF STATES. MOST OF 
THE TN VALLEY COULD GET ONE HALF INCH OR MORE OF RAIN TUESDAY. 
INCREASED POPS TUESDAY OVER ALL BUT THE NORTHEAST TO LIKELY 
CATEGORY. THE COLD FRONT PASSES QUICKLY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
HIGH PRESSURE RETURNS WEDNESDAY WITH FLOW BECOMING ZONAL. ANOTHER 
WEAK FRONT MOVES THROUGH THURSDAY BUT NO RAIN IS EXPECTED. ANOTHER 
SOUTHERN SYSTEM DEVELOPS FRIDAY ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AND MAY 
GIVE THE AREA ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS FOR THE 
WEEKEND.                  

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 232330
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
730 PM EDT SAT APR 23 2005

.SHORT TERM...A STRONG UPPER LOW REMAINS THE MAIN WEATHER FEATURE 
OVER THE EASTERN U.S. TONIGHT.  THE NORTHWESTERLY FLOW AROUND THIS 
LOW WILL CONTINUE TO PULL IN AN UNSEASONABLE COLD AIR MASS. FREEZING 
LEVELS WILL LOWER AROUND 2000 FEET AND A FREEZE WARNING IS IN EFFECT 
TONIGHT FOR THE EAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS...THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND EXTREME SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA.  
SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE OVER THE MRX CWA TONIGHT AS 
WEAK IMPULSES ROTATE AROUND THE UPPER LOW.  THE RAIN MAY MIX WITH 
SNOW OVER VALLEY FLOOR LOCATIONS...ESPECIALLY ACROSS OUR NORTHERN 
ZONES.  OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS...RAIN WILL CHANGE OVER TO SNOW WITH 
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED...MAINLY ABOVE 2200 FEET.  SNOWFALL MAY 
BE ENHANCED BY UPSLOPE FLOW...PROVIDING ADVISORY LEVEL SNOWFALL OVER 
PORTIONS OF THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS OF TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA.  PRESSURE GRADIENTS WILL REMAIN TIGHT AND STRONG AND GUSTY 
WINDS WILL CONTINUE OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS AS WELL WITH A WIND 
ADVISORY IN PLACE OVER OUR EASTERN MOUNTAINS.  ALL ON TRACK IN THE 
CURRENT FORECAST...WILL BE UPDATING TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING.

&&
.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 232037
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 PM EDT SAT APR 23 2005

.SHORT TERM...LOW PRESSURE AREA WILL WOBBLE INTO SE CANADA THROUGH 
EARLY MONDAY. COLD NW FLOW WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE AREA. MOISTURE 
REMAINS PLENTIFUL OVERNIGHT AND BEGINS TO DECREASE BY MID DAY SUNDAY. 
THE FREEZING LEVEL WILL DROP TO NEAR THE SFC MOST LOCATIONS 
OVERNIGHT. RAIN WILL BECOME MIXED WITH OR CHANGE TO SNOW AND THE 
ACCUMULATING SNOW LEVEL LOOKS TO GET AS LOW AS 2200 FEET. SOME ICING 
IS ALSO POSSIBLE MAINLY ACROSS NORTHERN AREAS AS SOME SURFACES BEGIN 
TO FREEZE DESPITE BRISK WINDS AND CLOUD COVER THUS OPTED FOR WINTER 
WEATHER ADVSRY FOR SW VA. FREEZING TEMPS ARE ALSO POSSIBLE ACROSS 
PARTS OF NE TN BUT DURATION LOOKS BRIEF ENOUGH TO LEAVE THAT AREA 
OUT OF FREEZE WARNING. WINDS OF 20 TO 30 MPH MAY EXTEND THROUGH THE 
DAY ON SUNDAY AND WIND ADVSRY MAY HAVE TO BE EXTENDED INTO SUNDAY 
AFTN. OPTED NOT TO ISSUE FREEZE WATCH FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AS TO NOT 
CONFUSE THE ISSUE BUT ANOTHER MORE EXTENSIVE FREEZE WARNING WILL 
LIKELY BE REQUIRED SUNDAY NIGHT. WITH LESS CLOUD COVER NEAR FREEZING 
RECORD TEMPERATURES WILL BE APPROACHED OR EQUALED. A LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM APPROACHES FROM THE SW MONDAY NGT. BACKED OFF ON SLGT CHC 
POPS NE AREAS FOR MONDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MODELS ADVERTISE WARM FRONT 
PUSHING THROUGH THE AREA ON TUESDAY.  DECENT MOISTURE WITH IT...SO 
WENT WITH 40 POPS ACROSS THE CWA.  A COLD FRONT FOLLOWS ON TUESDAY 
NIGHT...KEPT CHANCE POPS GOING THROUGH THE OVERNIGHT HOURS.  GFS HAS 
FRONT THROUGH THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY MORNING...WILL KEEP 30/20 POPS 
FOR WEDNESDAY AS THE UPPER LOW PASSES...BUT MOST OF THE PRECIP 
SHOULD BE DURING THE MORNING.  HIGH PRESSURE BRINGS DRY WEATHER BACK 
TO THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  GFS INDICATING ANOTHER WEAK FRONT 
APPROACHING FROM THE NORTH ON THURSDAY WHICH STALLS ACROSS THE AREA 
THROUGH THE REST OF THE WEEK.  THINK BEST MOISTURE SHOULD STAY NORTH 
OF THE AREA THURSDAY...SO WILL KEEP THURSDAY AND THURSDAY NIGHT DRY 
FOR NOW.  WILL ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY AND CHANCE POPS FOR 
FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY WITH FRONT STALLED ACROSS THE AREA AND 
DEEPER MOISTURE RETURNING.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EDT SAT APR 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...AREA CURRENTLY EXPERIENCING SOME ANTICYCLONIC FLOW SO 
WINDS AND PCPN HAVE BEEN HELD AT BAY SOME. LOW CONTINUES TO DEEPEN 
NORTHEAST OF THE AREA. A SECONDARY TROUGH WILL SPIN DOWN FROM 
BACKSIDE OF LOW BRINGING COOLER TEMPS STRONGER WINDS AND BETTER 
UPSLOPE CONDITIONS FOR SHOWERS. PIREPS AND AREA SOUNDINGS INDICATE 
FREEZING LEVEL A BIT LOWER THAN MODEL DEPICTIONS SO WILL MENTION 
LIGHT SNOWS ABOVE 3500 FEET IN CENTRAL AND NE MOUNTAINS. SNOW 
ADVISORY MAY BE PUSHED UP TO 4 PM WITH NEXT PACKAGE ISSUANCE. WILL 
WORD TEMPS AS FALLING THIS AFTERNOON.
 
 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...A FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FOR TONIGHT FOR CHEROKEE AND CLAY 
COUNTIES. A WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH
EARLY SUNDAY MORNING.
TN...A FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FOR TONIGHT FOR THE NORTHERN 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...AND THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS OF TENNESSEE.
A SNOW ADVISORY IN EFFECT TONIGHT AND SUNDAY MORNING FOR THE EASTERN 
MOUNTAINS.
A WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY SUNDAY 
MORNING FOR THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS. 
VA...A FREEZE WATCH IN EFFECT FOR TONIGHT FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.
A SNOW ADVISORY FOR HIGHER ELEVATIONS TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING.
