000 
FXUS64 KMRX 230939
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
535 AM EDT SAT APR 23 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SEVERE WEATHER THREAT OVER BUT 
MUCH SIGNIFICANT WEATHER CONTINUES.  SKIES BRIEFLY CLEARED BEHIND 
THE LAST BIT OF CONVECTIVE PCPN...BUT QUICKLY CLOUDED BACK OVER AS 
POST FRONTAL LOW CLOUDINESS ADVECTED IN.  THE COLD FRONT HAS PUSHED 
EAST WELL INTO WRN NC...BUT THE UPPER LOW IS STILL SPINNING SLOWLY 
OVER THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS.  AREA RADARS STARTING TO SHOW 
SCATTERED VERY LIGHT SHOWERS CIRCULATING BACK ACROSS THE NRN 
TWO-THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA.  

MAIN CONCERNS FOR THE SHORT TERM ARE: 1) STRENGTH OF W-NW WINDS FROM 
LATER TODAY AND OVERNIGHT AS PRESSURE GRADIENT REMAINS TIGHT ACROSS 
THE REGION AND ADDITIONAL SHORTWAVE ENERGY ROTATES ACROSS THE REGION
...AND ALSO 2) THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS.  

DECIDED TO ISSUE WIND ADVISORY FOR ALL TN AND NC MTN COUNTIES FROM 
NOON TODAY THROUGH 8AM EDT SUNDAY...ALLOWING FOR GUSTS UP TO OR JUST 
ABOVE THE 850 MB JET MAX VALUES.  ELSEWHERE...RAN WITH 15 TO 25 MPH 
SPEEDS.  THE SNOW ACCUMULATION MAY BE DELAYED UNTIL TONIGHT...DUE TO 
WARM BOUNDARY LAYER TEMPS AND PARTIAL (1000-850 MB) THICKNESSES.
FOR NOW...WE LIMITED THE SNOW ADVISORY AREAS TO OUR THREE NRN MOST 
SW VA COUNTIES (1-3 INCHES TOTAL IN WISE...RUSSELL AND WASHINGTON)
...AND FOR THE SMOKY AND NE TN MTNS (2-4 INCHES TOTAL AND A HINT OF 
POSSIBLY MORE IN THE HIGHEST AREAS).  

GFS MOS ARRIVED TOO LATE TO HELP WITH THIS PACKAGE...BUT HOURLY 
TEMPS AND MAX TEMPS WERE CUSTOM MADE TODAY TO FIT THE SITUATION
(MORNING MAXES FOLLOWED BY STEADY OR FALLING TEMPS).  NOTICED THAT 
THE 23/00Z MOS MIN TEMPS FOR TONIGHT WERE SEVERAL DEGREES ABOVE 
PREVIOUS FORECAST/GRIDS.  DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND CLOUDS...I NUDGED 
MINS UP TONIGHT CLOSER TO THIS NEW GUIDANCE.  PREVIOUS POP GRIDS 
WERE IN EXCELLENT AGREEMENT WITH SENSIBLE WEATHER AND LATEST MOS.

AN EQUIPMENT NOTE: TRI CITIES NOAA WEATHER RADIO REMAINS OFF THE AIR
DUE TO EQUIPMENT PROBLEMS.  WE ARE SORRY FOR ANY INCONVENIENCE THIS 
HAS CAUSED...AND HOPE TO BE BACK ON THE AIR LATER THIS MORNING.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...WOUND UP LOW OVER THE EASTERN 
GREAT LAKES WILL GIVE THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS A VERY COLD START 
SUNDAY WITH SURFACE TEMPERATURES IN THE 30S AND DOWN TO MID 20S AT 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. SHORTWAVE ENERGY ROTATING AROUND THE UPPER LOW 
CENTERED OVER PA BY 12Z TOMORROW WILL BE CREATING SNOW SHOWERS 
ACROSS THE EASTERN TN MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SW VA WITH 
EVEN A FEW SNOW SHOWERS POSSIBLE IN THE VALLEYS MAINLY FROM I-40 
NORTH. THE PRECIPITATION SHOULD GRADUALLY TAPER OFF DURING THE 
MORNING BUT MAY CONTINUE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS THROUGH THE 
AFTERNOON. THE WIND ADVISORY MAY NEED TO BE EXTENDED IF THE SURFACE 
LOW MOVES AWAY SLOWER THAN EXPECTED. CLOUD COVER AND COLD AIR 
ADVECTION WILL CAUSE HIGHS TO STRUGGLE TO REACH THE 50S EXCEPT OVER 
SOUTHEAST TN. LOWS SUNDAY NIGHT SHOULD BE SIMILAR TO TONIGHTS LOWS 
BUT CLEARING WILL DEPEND ON HOW FAR NORTH THE UPPER LOW HAS MOVED.  
THE LATEST GFS WANTS TO KEEP WIND SPEEDS UP BUT THE NAM SHOWS A 
WEAKER GRADIENT AND MOVES THE MOISTURE OUT SOONER. LIKED ITS COOLER 
LOWS NEAR TO BELOW FREEZING. DRIER AIR SPREADS EAST MONDAY AND 
TEMPERATURES WILL WARM TO THE 60S BUT INCREASING MOISTURE SPREADS IN 
FROM THE WEST MONDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF THE NEXT WEATHER SYSTEM THAT 
MOVES INTO THE PLAINS FROM THE ROCKIES AND COMBINES WITH A SYSTEM 
DROPPING SOUTH OUT OF SOUTH CENTRAL CANADA. PATTERN SHIFTS AGAIN 
WEDNESDAY AS UPPER LEVEL LOW IN THE WESTERN GREAT LAKES SENDS A 
SERIES OF SHORTWAVES TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA IN A WET NORTHWEST 
FLOW. HIGH TEMPERATURES SHOULD STAY 5 TO 10 DEGREES BELOW NORMAL 
THROUGH THE WEEK.          
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  54  36  50  33 /  60  40  20  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       52  34  50  33 /  60  30  20  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              51  34  45  31 /  60  60  40  20

EARLY SUNDAY MORNING.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
730 PM EDT FRI APR 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...CONVECTION FORMING OVER MIDDLE TENNESSEE MOVING 
NORTHEASTWARD INTO THE MRX CWA THIS EVENING.  ATMOSPHERE BECOMING 
INCREASING UNSTABLE WITH AN INFLUX OF LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND STRONG 
LIFT MOVING IN IN ADVANCE OF A COLD FRONT.  THIS WILL ALLOW 
CONVECTION WILL CONTINUE INTO THE OVERNIGHT HOURS WITH POTENTIAL FOR 
SOME OF THESE STORMS TO BECOME STRONG...POSSIBLE EVEN SEVERE.  THE 
FRONTAL PASSAGE IS EXPECTED TO CROSS THE MRX CWA OVERNIGHT.  BEHIND 
THE FRONT SCATTERED SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE AND MUCH COLDER AIR WILL 
PUSH IN.  WINDS WILL INCREASE BEHIND THE FRONT...BECOMING BREEZY 
THROUGHOUT MUCH OF THE AREA WITH LOCALLY WINDY CONDITIONS EXPECTED 
OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 PM EDT FRI APR 22 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY NIGHT)...TODAYS CONVECTION HAS 
TEMPORARILY STABILIZED THE ATMOSPHERE ACROSS THE AREA. BREAKS IN THE 
CLOUDS SHOULD ALLOW FOR SOME ADDITIONAL HEATING EARLY THIS EVENING. 
A SHORT WAVE WITH GOOD ROTATION WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA THIS EVENING 
AS A STRONG JET SWINGS UNDERNEATH. THE EXIT REGION OF THE JET MOVES 
INTO THE AREA AROUND MIDNIGHT. CAPES SHOULD REBOUND TO AROUND 800 
J/KG WITH LIS AGAIN BECOMING NEGATIVE. CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT IS 
LIKELY IN ADVANCE OF APPROACHING COLD FRONT AND STORM MOTIONS FAVOR 
THIS ACTIVITY GETTING AS FAR EAST AS THE SMOKYS. SO ANOTHER ROUND OF 
STRONG TO POSSIBLY SEVERE STORMS EXPECTED THIS EVENING. COLD FRONT 
WILL MOVE EAST THROUGH THE AREA OVERNIGHT. WRAP AROUND PRECIPITATION 
WILL PERSIST SAT AND SAT NGT FAVORING THE NORTHERN CWA. THE FREEZING 
LEVEL DROPS TO AROUND 3600 FEET BY SAT AFTN SO SOME MIXED PCPN CAN 
BE EXPECTED ACROSS HIGHER ELEVATION. 850 MB TEMPS DROP DOWN TO 
AROUND -7C OVERNIGHT SAT AND THE FREEZING LEVEL DROPS TO NEAR THE 
SFC MOST LOCATIONS BY SUNDAY MORNING. ACCUMULATING SNOWS ARE LIKELY 
ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS WITH NEAR FREEZING TEMPS ACROSS THE 
VALLEYS. RECORDS SET IN 1986 CHA 34 TYS 28 TRI 28 MAY BE CHALLENGED 
AT CHA BUT SHOULD STAND ELSEWHERE. DRIZZLES FLURRIES AND SNOW 
SHOWERS CONTINUE MAINLY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS SAT NGT AND 
SUNDAY WITH BREEZY NW WINDS. TEMPS WILL REMAIN COLD SUNDAY NIGHT 
WITH RECORDS CHA 32 1974 TYS 33 1910 TRI 31 1969 APPROACHED. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE BRINGING DRY 
WEATHER ON MONDAY.  COLD FRONT APPROACHING AREA LATE MONDAY 
NIGHT...KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY NIGHT.  BEST CHANCES ON 
TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT AS FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE AREA.  UPPER 
TROUGH PASSES ON WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT...KEPT 30 POPS FOR 
WEDNESDAY.  MOISTURE PUSHES EAST ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT...KEPT ONLY 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS.  DRY WEATHER SHOULD RETURN FOR THURSDAY AND 
FRIDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 221338
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 AM EDT FRI APR 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...UPDATED POPS TO CATEGORICAL FOR TODAY AREAWIDE WITH 
UPPER DIFFLUENCE INCREASING AND AREA OF CONVECTION POISED TO SLIDE 
EAST INTO AREA. 

PREVIOUS DISCUSSION FOLLOWS: 


SHORT TERM....SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MINIMAL COVERAGE OF 
SHOWERS/STORMS AT THIS TIME...WITH SCATTERED COVERAGE STILL NOTED 
ACROSS MIDDLE TN WHERE SOME INSTABILITY LINGERS.  EXPECT THIS AREA 
TO CONTINUE TO PUSH EAST THIS MORNING AS SHORTWAVE TROUGH APPROACHES 
AND AIRMASS BECOMES UNSTABLE ACROSS OUR REGION.  PREVIOUS GRIDS 
REFLECTED THIS QUITE WELL...ALTHO I DID RAISE POPS UP INTO 
CATEGORICAL VALUES THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS GENERALLY WRN PARTS OF EAST 
TN.  

SHORT RANGE MODELS SIMILAR WITH TIMING BRUNT OF SHOWERS AND STORMS 
TO DECREASE...ALTHO GFS IS JUST A FEW HOURS QUICKER TO END THAN NAM 
(ETA).  PREVIOUS WX/POP GRIDS LOOKED LIKE A GOOD COMPROMISE AND WERE 
LEFT AS IS.  THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS LATER TODAY AND EARLY TONIGHT 
LOOKS TO BE MAINLY DAMAGING WINDS...AS FREEZING LEVEL DOES NOT FALL 
SHARPLY UNTIL SATURDAY.  WE WILL UPDATE THE SPSMRX PRODUCT AND ALSO 
HIGHLIGHT THE MODERATE RISK OF SEVERE STORMS IN THE HAZARDOUS 
WEATHER OUTLOOK.

OTHERWISE...WENT CLOSE TO MAV MOS FOR HIGH TEMPS TODAY...THEN TRENDED
MIN TEMPS DOWN A BIT ACROSS THE BOARD FOR TONIGHT IN LINE WITH 
LATEST MOS.

LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...STRONG COLD FRONT WITH 
DEEP TROUGH WITH VERY COLD AIR FOR THIS TIME OF YEAR WILL CAUSE A 
BIG DROP IN TEMPERATURES SATURDAY AS COMPARED TO THE STRING OF DAYS 
IN THE 70S. THE FRONT SHOULD BE EAST OF THE MOUNTAINS BY MORNING AND 
HIGHS FOR THE DAY WILL PROBABLY BE REACHED DURING THE MORNING WITH 
STEADY TO FALLING TEMPERATURES DURING THE DAY. COLDER AND DRIER AIR 
ALOFT WILL DROP FREEZING LEVELS TO 3 TO 4 THOUSAND FEET BY EVENING. 
PRECIPITATION WILL DECREASE AND LIKELY END IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY 
AND SOUTHERN PLATEAU BY AFTERNOON. STRONG WINDS AT THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS MAY REQUIRE A WIND ADVISORY FOR SATURDAY. A BIG CONCERN 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND EARLY SUNDAY WILL BE SNOWFALL. THE BEST CHANCE 
FOR ACCUMULATING SNOW WILL BE THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS OF THE SMOKIES 
AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WHERE TEMPERATURES WILL BE COLDEST AND ARE 
ALSO IN FAVORED UPSLOPE LOCATIONS. AT LOWER ELEVATIONS SNOW SHOWERS 
WILL BE LESS LIKELY AS AIRMASS DRIES OUT. GROUND TEMPERATURES SHOULD 
BE TOO WARM AT LOWER ELEVATIONS FOR ANY ACCUMULATIONS BUT HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS COULD SEE A COUPLE INCHES. LOWS SUNDAY MORNING WILL ALSO 
BE A SHOCK WITH READINGS IN THE 30S ONLY A FEW DEGREES ABOVE RECORDS 
FOR THE DATE. SOME LOCATIONS MAY EVEN DROP TO FREEZING OR BELOW 
ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN AND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE MOUNTAINS. 
COLD TEMPERATURES WILL PERSIST SUNDAY AS COLD UPPER LOW AND TROUGH 
LIFTS SLOWLY NORTHEAST. CLOUDS WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES IN THE 40S AND 
50S WITH STILL SHOWERS POSSIBLE NE HALF OF FORECAST AREA. TROUGH 
STAYS OVER THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE COUNTRY THROUGH MID WEEK WITH 
BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND ANOTHER SYSTEM MOVING IN MONDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY.       

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC......NONE.
TN......NONE.
VA......NONE.

&&

$$

SON

BE TOO WARM AT LOWER ELEVATIONS FOR ANY ACCUMULATIONS BUT HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS COULD SEE A COUPLE INCHES. LOWS SUNDAY MORNING WILL ALSO 
BE A SHOCK WITH READINGS IN THE 30S ONLY A FEW DEGREES ABOVE RECORDS 
FOR THE DATE. SOME LOCATIONS MAY EVEN DROP TO FREEZING OR BELOW 
ACROSS SW VA AND NE TN AND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF THE MOUNTAINS. 
COLD TEMPERATURES WILL PERSIST SUNDAY AS COLD UPPER LOW AND TROUGH 
LIFTS SLOWLY NORTHEAST. CLOUDS WILL KEEP TEMPERATURES IN THE 40S AND 
50S WITH STILL SHOWERS POSSIBLE NE HALF OF FORECAST AREA. TROUGH 
STAYS OVER THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE COUNTRY THROUGH MID WEEK WITH 
BELOW NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND ANOTHER SYSTEM MOVING IN MONDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH WEDNESDAY.       

&&

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAIN FEATURE OF 
INTEREST REMAINS UPPER TROUGH WHICH WILL SIGNIFICANTLY AMPLIFY INTO 
THE EASTERN CONUS THROUGH THE WEEKEND PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE 
CONSENSUS. SURFACE COLD FRONT IS PROJECTED TO PUSH THROUGH THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY SATURDAY MORNING AND WILL BE PRECEDED BY A 
PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH OF CONVECTION PER NAM. INSTABILITY MARGINAL BUT 
DYNAMICS DEPICTED TO BE QUITE STRONG...SO CAN NOT RULE OUT SOME OF 
THE CONVECTION TO BE ON THE STRONG SIDE AS TROUGH PASSES THROUGH 
FRIDAY EVENING. SIGNIFICANTLY COLDER AIR POURS INTO THE AREA BEHIND 
FRONT WITH 850 MB TEMPS PLUNGING TO WELL BELOW ZERO C. UPPER LEVELS 
DRY OUT CONSIDERABLY AFTER FROPA...BUT LOW-LEVEL WRAP-AROUND 
MOISTURE WITH STRONG UPSLOPE FLOW SUGGESTS RAIN/SNOW SHOWERS WILL 
LINGER THROUGH MUCH OF SUNDAY..ESPECIALLY IN THE FAVORED UPSLOPE 
TERRAIN. REMAINDER OF PERIOD WILL FEATURE SLOW WARMING TREND TO NEAR 
CLIMATOLOGY BY MID-WEEK WITH ONLY WEAK DISTURBANCES IN THE EARLY TO 
MID-WEEK TIME FRAME. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO 
MIDDLE-OF-THE-ROAD GFS GUIDANCE VALUES.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A SHORT WAVE OUT AHEAD OF AN 
APPROACHING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL SPREAD SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS 
ACROSS THE MRX CWA THIS AFTERNOON.  ASSOCIATED DYNAMICS NOT OVERLY 
IMPRESSIVE AND MOISTURE WILL INCREASE BUT REMAIN LIMITED.  HOWEVER 
WITH THE AIR MASS BECOMING INCREASINGLY UNSTABLE...BELIEVE LIFT AND 
MOISTURE SUFFICIENT FOR MOST LOCATIONS TO SEE SOME PRECIP.  WAVE 
MOVES OFF LATE THIS EVENING AND EXPECT A BREAK IN ORGANIZED PRECIP 
LATE TONIGHT BEFORE THE MAIN LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES IN ON 
FRIDAY.  WITH INCREASING CLOUDS AND SOME INCREASE IN DEW 
POINTS...TODAY/S HIGHS SHOULD BE A COUPLE DEGREES COOLER THAN 
YESTERDAY/S WHICH IS IN LINE WITH CURRENT GUIDANCE. 


.LONG TERM...(FRI THROUGH WED)...DIGGING TROUGH WILL CUT OFF...AND 
RESULTANT UPPER LOW WILL BE SLOW TO MOVE AWAY.  MODELS IN DECENT 
AGREEMENT IN HANDLING THIS...WITH JUST SOME DIFFERENCES ON THE 
DETAILS.  WILL TRY TO USE A COMPROMISE GFS/NAM SOLUTION WHERE 
DIFFERENCES EXIST THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT.  STRONG COLD FRONT WILL 
PUSH THROUGH THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT. WILL CARRY LIKELY POPS FOR 
FRI...THEN CATEGORICAL NORTH LIKELY ELSEWHERE FRI NIGHT.  MUCH 
COLDER AIR WILL PUSH IN SAT AND SAT NIGHT.  LOOKS LIKE THERE WILL BE 
ENOUGH MOISTURE AROUND...ALONG WITH STEEP LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES AND 
UPSLOPE FLOW TO KEEP SOME SHOWERS AROUND INTO AT LEAST SUNDAY.  AS 
COLDER AIR PUSHES IN WILL LIKELY SEE SNOW SHOWERS OVER THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN...AND SOME SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATIONS ARE NOT OUT OF THE 
QUESTION IN THESE AREAS.  ALSO SHOULD SEE SUB FREEZING TEMPS IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS...INCLUDING SOME AREAS WHERE THE SPRING FREEZE 
WARNING PROGRAM HAS BEGUN.  STILL UNCERTAIN IF FREEZING TEMPS WILL 
OCCUR IN VALLEY AREAS...SINCE CLOUDS AND WIND MAY INHIBIT TEMP 
FALL...BUT STILL WILL BE RATHER COLD.  WILL ISSUE AN SPS TO GIVE A 
HEADS UP FOR THIS WEEKENDS WEATHER.  WILL GENERALLY LEAVE THE LATER 
PERIODS OF THE FORECAST ALONE FOR NOW.

FORECAST TO BE SLOW TO LEAVE.  MUCH COLDER AIR FORECAST TO MOVE IN

STILL NOT COLD ENOUGH AND SNOW WILL HAVE TO BE HIT HARDER...BUT WILL

MONDAY AND TUESDAY AS IT IS.

AGAIN IN THE AFTERNOON...MAINLY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. AS FOR 
TEMPS...WILL PLAN TO FOLLOW PERSISTENCE WITH THE STAGNANT AIRMASS IN 
PLACE.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...PERSISTENT HIGH 
PRESSURE OVER THE SOUTHEAST STATES WILL BE SLOW TO DEPART WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY AS COLD FRONT DRIFTS SOUTH INTO THE OHIO VALLEY 
THURSDAY. HAVE LOWERED THE POPS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND SLOWED THE 
INCREASE IN RAIN CHANCES FROM NORTH TO SOUTH THURSDAY. INSTABILITY 
AND MOISTURE INCREASE AS THE FRONT APPROACHES AND WITH TEMPERATURES 
RISING TO THE 70S THUNDERSTORMS ARE POSSIBLE IN THE AFTERNOON. FROM 
THURSDAY NIGHT INTO FRIDAY MODELS DIFFER ON WHETHER AIRMASS WILL DRY 
OUT OVERNIGHT OR RECOVER AS NEXT FRONT OVER THE MS VALLEY 
APPROACHES. THE NAM IS FASTER AND BRINGS RAIN BACK IN THURSDAY NIGHT 
WITH THE GFS HAVING A LULL BEFORE INCREASING RAIN FRIDAY MORNING 
WITH MS VALLEY SYSTEM APPROACHING. KEPT POPS AT 20 TO 30 PERCENT 
THURSDAY NIGHT AND INCREASED BACK TO ABOUT 50 PERCENT FRIDAY. THIS 
SECOND SYSTEM BRINGS MUCH COLDER AIR INTO THE FORECAST AREA AS 
TROUGH DIGS OVER THE EAST SATURDAY AND SUNDAY. GFS HAS LOWERED 
TEMPERATURES CONSIDERABLY OVER THE WEEKEND AND PUTS LOWS IN THE 30S 
WITH A HINT OF SNOW SATURDAY NIGHT OVER SW VA AND NE TN. I HAVE NOT 
PUT ANY SNOW IN SATURDAY NIGHT AND KEPT LOWS IN THE MID 30S OR 
HIGHER. LOWERED HIGHS SEVERAL DEGREES SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.

CONFINED MAINLY TO MOUNTAIN REGIONS BY LATE TUESDAY AFTERNOON. 
HOWEVER...MOISTURE PROFILE DEPICTED BY MODEL TIME HEIGHTS IS 
UNIMPRESSIVE AND LIFT IS ESSENTIALLY NON-EXISTENT. WILL CONTINUE 
WITH DRY FORECAST THROUGH THE FIRST TWO PERIODS...ALTHOUGH ISOLATED 
CONVECTION PROBABLY CANNOT BE TOTALLY RULED OUT IN THE MOUNTAINS AS 
MODEL SOUNDINGS SHOW SOME INSTABILITY BY LATE IN THE SECOND PERIOD. 
FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO GFS GUIDANCE VALUES AS THEY 
SEEM REASONABLE BASED ON PERSISTENCE.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...DRY PATTERN CONTINUES 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY ALTHOUGH FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL. AN 
UPPER LEVEL LOW LIES OVER THE WESTERN STATES AND A TROUGH STARTS 
DIGGING SOUTH OVER THE GREAT LAKES. MOISTURE WILL INCREASE VERY 
GRADUALLY ESPECIALLY AT LOWER LEVELS. SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
HOLDS FIRM ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. A COLD FRONT MOVES 
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY AND THEN THROUGH 
THE OHIO VALLEY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. NAM AND ETA BRINGS RAIN WITH THE 
FRONT LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY AS IT MOVES INTO SW VA AND 
NE TN. THE NAM IS A FEW HOURS QUICKER WITH THE PRECIPITATION THAN 
THE ETA. INTRODUCED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS LATE EVENING SW VA 
AND NE TN AND CHANCE BY MORNING. THE BEST CHANCE OF RAIN WILL BE 
THURSDAY AS THE FRONT MOVES SOUTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. HIGH  
TEMPERATURES WILL BE MUCH LOWER BEGINNING THURSDAY. BOTH NAM AND ETA 
DEVELOP ANOTHER SURFACE LOW ALONG THE FRONT TO THE WEST AND BRING 
THE LOW EAST THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY AFTERNOON INTO 
SATURDAY MORNING BEFORE WEAK HIGH PRESSURE MOVES BACK IN SATURDAY 
NIGHT. RIDGING BUILDS NORTH OVER THE SOUTHWESTERN STATES AND THE 
TROUGH OVER THE EAST DIGS SOUTH ON THE WEEKEND. NORTHWEST FLOW 
BEGINS A SERIES OF QUICK SYSTEMS THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA FIRST 
SUNDAY AND THEN ANOTHER ONE ABOUT 24 HOURS LATER. AN UPPER LEVEL LOW 
DROPS SOUTHEAST OUT OF CANADA SUNDAY AND MOVES TO THE GREAT LAKES 
LATE MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE COOLER THAN NORMAL BECAUSE OF THIS 
AT THE END OF THE FORECAST PERIOD.      
&&

ALOFT. ABV NORMAL MAX TEMP GUIDANCE LOOKS GOOD EARLY IN THE LONG

NORMAL BY THE WEEKEND.

TONIGHT AROUND UPPER RIDGE CENTERED OVER THE SOUTH CENTRAL STATES 
AND JUST BRUSHES SW VA AND NE TN MONDAY MORNING. WITH DRY AIR ACROSS 
THE AREA WILL NOT ANY RAIN CHANCES IN MONDAY. TEMPERATURES WILL BE

INCREASES. CROSS SECTION DATA INDICATES HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE WILL 
MOVE OUT TONIGHT AND LOW LEVEL MOISTURE WILL INCREASE. SOME PATCHY 
MID OR LOW LEVEL CLOUDS COULD FORM. FOLLOWED THE COOL SIDE OF 
GUIDANCE FOR LOWS TONIGHT AND A BLEND FOR HIGHS MONDAY.

SHORT-WAVE MOVING EAST ACROSS THE FORECAST TUESDAY...BUT DUE TO LIMITED
MOISTURE WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY.  MAIN WEATHER MAKER EARLY IN THE EXTENDED
WILL CONTINUE TO BE SURFACE AND UPPER RIDGE ALOFT KEEPING FORECAST
DRY THROUGH WEDNESDSAY.  FOR THURSDAY...A BACK-DOOR COLD FRONT WILL
MOVE INTO SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...INCREASING THE
CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDESTORMS...MAINLY NORTHERN AREAS.

FRONT WILL BECOME NEARLY STATIONARY OVER THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR FRIDAY...
SO HAVE KEPT CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDESTORMS GOING. MAINLY DIURNAL
IN NATURE DUE TO THE LIMITED UPPER DYNAMICS. LATEST GFS SHOWS SURFACE
CYCLO-GENSIS ALONG FRONT FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY KEEPING CHANCES
OF STORMS GOING INTO SATURDAY.

UPPER TROUGH DEEPENS OVER THE FORECAST FOR SUNDAY. FOR NOW...SUNDAY
FORECAST DRY...BUT MAY NEED TO ADD CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS
LATER SINCE COLD AIR ALOFT MAY KEEP CONVECTION GOING.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE THE 
WEATHER TONIGHT AND FRIDAY WITH CLEAR SKIES AND COOL TEMPERATURES AT 
NIGHT WITH RAPID WARMING DURING THE DAY.  BOTH MODELS IN CLOSE 
AGREEMENT WITH VERY MINOR DIFFERENCES IN GUIDANCE NUMBERS.  WENT 
WITH A BLEND OF NAM AND GFS NUMBERS FOR GUIDANCE.  IT IS NOT YET IN 
THE GROWING SEASON FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND ANY FROST WE HAVE WILL 
BE VERY SPOTTY.  WILL ISSUE A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT FOR THAT 
AREA TO INDICATE THE LIMITED THREAT FOR TONIGHT AND FRIDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SURFACE AND UPPER 
RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE WILL DOMINATE MOST OF THE EXTENDED FORECAST 
UNTIL WEDNESDAY.  BESIDES AREAS OF CI/CS THROUGH MID-WEEK...SKY WILL 
BE MAINLY CLEAR.  BY WEDNESDAY...SURFACE HIGH WILL MOVE EAST WITH A 
COLD FRONT AND ASSOCIATED UPPER TROUGH MOVING ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
PLAINS.  AS FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...
CHANCES OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS WILL INCREASE.

BLEND FOR GUIDANCE.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPPER TROUGH WILL CONTINUE
TO EXIT ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES WITH A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDING INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.  INCREASING THICKNESS AND BOUNDARY
LAYER TEMPERATURES WILL ALLOW FOR A SLOW WARMING TREND THROUGH EARLY NEXT
WEEK. AN UPPER TROUGH WILL DIVE SOUTHEAST ACROSS THE NORTHERN PLAINS TOWARD
THE GREAT LAKES/OHIO VALLEY FOR LATE WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY OF NEXT WEEK.
THIS TROUGH AND INCREASING MOISTURE AS BOUNDARY WINDS BACK TO THE SOUTH
WILL PRODUCE A CHANCE OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS BY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...WEATHER DOMINATED BY

HAS RESULTED IN A FAIR AMOUNT OF RAIN ACROSS THE TN VLY AND 
APPALACHIAN MTNS. EXPECT SLOW EWD PROGRESSION OF THIS PATTERN WHICH 
MODELS DEPICT. THUS...HIGHER POPS SW VA/NE TN AND MTNS WITH SLIGHTLY 
LOWER PROBABILITY FARTHER SW EARLY THIS EVENING AS SOME SHRA/TSRA 
MAY YET DEVELOP ALONG CD FNT PRESSING E TWD THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
WITH A BIT OF LATE AFTERNOON HEATING. ALREADY SEEING CONVECTION 
FORMING IN AN ISOLATED FASHION ALONG THIS FRONT ACROSS S CNTRL KY 
AND NRN MID TN. THIS CONVECTION WILL PROBABLY WEAKEN A GREAT DEAL 
AND SPREAD OUT INTO SCATTERED -SHRA ABOUT AN HOUR OR SO AFTER SUNSET 
BEFORE DISSIPATING MID EVENING. THE NEXT ROUND OF PRECIP SHOULD 
DEVELOP LATE TONIGHT OR SHORTLY AFTER SUNRISE IN ASSOCIATION WITH 
UPR LOW WHICH WILL BRING RATHER COLD AIR ALOFT. THE COLD AIR ALOFT 
AND LOW LVL WARMING WHICH SHOULD REACH INTO THE UPPER 50S AND 60S ON 
WED SHOULD PRODUCE A NICE AREA OF SHRA AND TSRA ACROSS THE FA. THE 
CONVECTION WILL HAVE A DECENT CHANCE OF GENERATING HAIL DUE TO THE 
UNSEASONBLEY COLD AIR ALOFT. UPR LOW DROPS SLOWLY SE ACROSS THE TN 
VLY INTO NRN GA BY WED EVENING BUT TEMPS STILL COLD ENOUGH ALOFT TO 
KEEP THREAT FOR -SHRA ALIVE THROUGH THE EVENING AND POSSIBLY AS LATE 
AS THURSDAY MORNING ACROSS SE TN/SW NC SO INCLUDED A SLGT CHC POP 
FOR -SHRA HERE. AREA BEGINS TO DRY OUT DURING THE DAY THURSDAY AND 
THURSDAY NIGHT AWAITING UPR LVL RIDGE.        

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...RELATIVELY DRY SPRING PATTERN 
SETTING UP IN THE EXTENDED. MID/UPR LEVEL RIDGING BUILDS INTO AREA 
FM SW. SFC RIDGING BUILDS DOWN INTO THE AREA FM THE NORTH. LIGHT 
WINDS AND NEAR NORMAL TEMPS. DUE TO EXPECTED SUNSHINE AND DRY LOW 
LEVELS WENT A COUPLE DEGREES ABOVE GUIDANCE FOR MAXS DESPITE COOL 
LAYER THICKNESS VALUES.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EDT TUE APR 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK QUASI-STATIONARY FRONT OVER 
SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST TN...WITH A COLD FRONT ACROSS THE LOWER 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY ASSOCIATED WITH A STRONG LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM CENTERED NEAR KANSAS CITY. AREA RADARS ARE NOT INDICATING 
MUCH CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY AHEAD OF THE COLD 
FRONT...BUT MODELS INDICATE THAT A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE 
ROTATING AROUND THE UPPER LOW WILL GENERATE ADDITIONAL SHOWERS AND A 
FEW TSTORMS LATER THIS MORNING OVER THE TN RIVER VALLEY. THIS LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL SLOWLY MOVE SOUTHEAST TODAY INTO THE OHIO RIVER 
VALLEY BY THIS EVENING. THERE WILL LIKELY BE A BREAK WITH THE 
RAINFALL ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...ALLOWING FOR SOME 
DAYTIME HEATING TO DESTABILIZE THE LOCAL ATMOSPHERE. NAM MODEL 
CONTINUES TO REVEAL A MODERATELY UNSTABLE AIRMASS DEVELOPING BY LATE 
THIS AFTERNOON...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA CLOSER TO THE UPPER LOW. ANOTHER ROUND OF CONVECTION SHOULD 
DEVELOP LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...AS THE COLDER AIR ALOFT 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS UPPER LOW APPROACHES THE FORECAST AREA. THIS 
MUCH COLDER AIR ALOFT WILL ALSO BRING THE POSSIBILITY OF LARGE HAIL 
WITH SOME TSTORMS LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 

THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL SLOWLY MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON 
WEDNESDAY...BRINGING ADDITIONAL CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY ESPECIALLY IN 
THE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. MODELS ARE IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT 
WITH THE PROGRESSION OF THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM AND PLACE IT OFF 
THE CAROLINA COAST BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT. DRY WEATHER LOOKS TO RETURN 
BY THURSDAY AND CONTINUE THROUGH THE REST OF THE FORECAST PERIOD... 
AS A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS ACROSS THE EASTERN U.S.

MODELS THE ATMOSPHERE. IT LOOKS LIKE ITS DOING A FAIRLY DECENT JOB 
WITH TODAYS WEATHER (EXCEPTION BEING FCST OF QPF VCNTY STATIONARY 
FNT PARKED ACROSS SW VA/NE TN REGION) AND IT HAS A NICE SUPRESSED 
LOOK TO POP/QPF AS FAR AS TIMING OF PRECIP TONIGHT. MODELS REALLY 
WANTED TO DEVELOP -SHRA ACROSS SW VA/NE TN THIS AFTERNOON BUT IT 
LOOKS LIKE RIDGING HAS BEEN JUST A LITTLE TOO STRONG TO ALLOW IT TO 
HAPPEN. HOWEVER SOME LIMITED RETURNS ARE SHOWING UP ON AREA RADARS 
SE KY AND MODELS CONTINUE TO INDICATE INSTABILITY AND LIFT IN SW 
VA/NE TN SO WILL PLAY ALONG WITH SOME SLGT CHC POPS DURING THE 
EVENING ALONG WITH A SLGT CHC ON THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SE TN IN 
CASE A FEW SPRINKLES ARE ABLE TO FORM WITHIN THE POWER SUBSIDENCE OF 
NARROW RIDGE IN PLACE FM THE EASTERN GREAT LAKES THROUGH THE SRN 
APPALACHIANS. BETTER CHANCES FOR -SHRA LATER TONIGHT AS PLAINS 
STATES UPR LOW SLOWLY MIGRATES E TWD THE MS VLY. SFC LOW PRESSES E 
THRU THE MS INTO THE OH VLY BY 12Z WED DRAGGING CD FNT THRU THE FA 
ON TUE. USED LIKELY POPS FOR SHRA/TSRA TUE AND TUE NIGHT AS 
CONVECTION PROGGED WITH NEGATIVE LIS AND RESPECTABLE CAPE IN WARM 
SECTOR. SFC SYSTEM CONTINUES E INTO THE CAROLINAS ON WED HOWEVER UPR 
LOW A SLOW MOVER WITH SFC TROF DROPPING SE THRU THE FA WITH LIKELY 
POPS N AND CHC POPS S ON WED. DROPPED PROBABILITY TO MEDIUM TO LOW 
CHC WED NIGHT AS UPR LOW CONTINUES SE THROUGH THE SE ATLANTIC 
COASTAL STATES. DID NOT STRAY VERY FAR FROM GUIDANCE TEMP BLEND 
DURING SHORT TERM.   

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...RELATIVELY DRY SPRING PATTERN 
SETTING UP IN THE EXTENDED. LIGHT WINDS AND NEAR OR SLIGHTLY COOLER 
THAN NORMAL TEMPS. MID/UPR LEVEL RIDGING BUILDS INTO AREA FM SW. SFC 
RIDGING BUILDS DOWN INTO THE AREA FM THE NORTH.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 PM EDT SUN APR 10 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...CUMULUS CLOUDS FORMED OVER OUR 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU...SWRN VA AND EXTREME ERN MOUNTAINOUS COUNTIES

EVENING.  HIGH CLOUDS SHOULD GRADUALLY THICKEN OVERNIGHT...WHILE

FLOW MAINLY RETURNS TO MIDDLE AND W TN OVERNIGHT...SO I STAYED QUITE 
CLOSE TO THE MAV LOWS OR NEAR THE BLEND OF SIMILAR MOS MIN TEMPS.

FOR MONDAY...THE UPPER RIDGE CONTINUES TO WEAKEN AS THE PLAINS LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES SLOWLY EAST.  ALL SHORT RANGE MODELS WANTED TO 
PRODUCE SHOWERS (POSSIBLY THUNDERSTORMS) ALONG THE WEAK FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY TO OUR NORTH.  THIS BOUNDARY SHOWS UP AT 850 MB LEVEL AND 
AT THE SURFACE AS AT LEAST A DEWPOINT DISCONTINUITY TODAY...SO I 
INTRODUCED LOW POPS FOR MONDAY AFTERNOON AS THIS FEATURE SAGS 
SOUTHWARD INTO THE REGION.  POPS WERE LIMITED TO NRN MOST AREAS 
INITIALLY...THEN AREA WIDE AS THE COLD FRONT TO OUR WEST DRAWS 
CLOSER.  MODELS SHOW A SIGNIFICANT INCREASE IN 850 MB RH...SO MOS 
MAX TEMPS OF A FEW DEGREES COOLER THAN TODAY SEEMED REASONABLE. 

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY WILL SLOWLY APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT MONDAY NIGHT 
AND TUESDAY. A WEAK BOUNDARY OR BACK DOOR COLD FRONT SOUTH OF A 
LARGE AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE OVER NORTHEAST CANADA AND THE NORTHEAST 
STATES IS EXPECTED TO ALSO SAG SOUTH ACROSS THE NORTHERN PART OF THE 
FORECAST AREA MONDAY EVENING BRINGING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS TO 
NORTHERN SECTIONS. THIS BACK DOOR FRONT MAY HELP TO SLOW THE 
APPROACHING SYSTEM A LITTLE MORE. CLOUDS AND SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS SHOULD CONTINUE TUESDAY INTO WEDNESDAY AS FRONT 
APPROACHES AND UPPER LEVEL LOW MOVES FROM THE MID MS VALLEY TO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON. THURSDAY THE UPPER LOW 
MOVES TO THE EAST SIDE OF THE APPALACHIANS BUT MOISTURE ROTATING 
AROUND IT WILL KEEP THE FORECAST AREA WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS JUST 
LIKE THE LAST SYSTEM LAST FRIDAY. MAY EVEN HAVE THUNDERSTORMS WITH 
COLDER AIR ALOFT. FRIDAY UPPER LOW MOVES OFF THE COAST AND SO ENDED 
RAIN BUT KEPT SOME CLOUDS. WITH THE SLOW MOVEMENT OF THE SYSTEM 
LATER SHIFTS MAY HAVE TO ADD RAIN CHANCES BACK IN FRIDAY. WEAK HIGH 
PRESSURE TRIES TO BUILD IN FOR THE WEEKEND.

CONSIDERING DEWPOINT TEMPS...THINK COOLING WILL DRIVE THROUGH 
DEWPOINTS PRODUCING FOG...AS LEAST IN VALLEY LOCALES.

FOR SATURDAY...THINKING FOG/LOW CLOUDS IN MORNING THEN PRETTY GOOD 
CUMULUS FIELD IN THE AFTERNOON...THOUGH CAPPED BY INTENSIFYING 
SUBSIDENCE INVERSION.  WILL LEAN ON COOL SIDE OF GUIDANCE HIGH 
TEMPS...ESPECIALLY SOUTH...SINCE BUILDING CU FIELD WILL ABSORB UP 
LOTS OF HEATING.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...RIDGING BUILDING INTO 
AREA SATURDAY NIGHT KEEPING DRY WEATHER SUNDAY AND MONDAY.  GFS 
INDICATING A FRONT PUSHING INTO AREA MONDAY NIGHT...SHOULD HAVE 
SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND LIFT TO BRING SCATTERED SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE REGION...MAINLY LATE AND CONTINUING INTO 
TUESDAY.  UPPER LOW PUSHES IN ON WEDNESDAY...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS 
GOING ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.  DRIER AIRMASS RETURNS FRIDAY 
NIGHT...WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE EVENING HOURS.  DRY

SHOWERS FOR FRIDAY.  ALSO...AS SYSTEM EXITS AREA...HAVE LOWERED POPS 
FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON.

PERIOD...BUT MADE ONLY A FEW VERY MINOR CHANGES TO TEMP GRIDS.

LOW...WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS GOING ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY.

.DISCUSSION...
A LARGE BAND OF SHOWERS AND ISOLATED THUNDERSTORMS CONTINUE TO MOVE SLOWLY
NORTH NORTHEAST TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA.  THE LEADING EDGE HAS MOVED INTO THE
PLATEAU COUNTIES.  A STRONG UPPER JET WILL ROUND THE BASE OF THE TROUGH
OVERNIGHT TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS HELPING TO INCREASE THE 
DIFLUENCE ALOFT OVER THE AREA.  ALSO...INCREASING LOW LEVEL JET WILL (AROUND
35-40 KNOTS AT 850 MB) WILL PULL GULF MOISTURE INTO THE REGION.

A LARGE BAND OF RAIN AND EMBEDDED STORMS CAN BE EXPECTED WITH NEAR 100
PERCENT COVERAGE OVERNIGHT. WILL UP POPS FOR THE SOUTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF
THE FORECAST AREA.  RAIN MAY BE HEAVY AT TIMES OVER THE PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN
HALF OF THE AREA...ESPECIALLY THE UPSLOPE AREAS. WILL INCLUDE THE POTENTIAL
OF HEAVY RAINS IN THE FORECAST.  HOWEVER...FLASH FLOOD POTENTIAL LOOKS TO
BE ISOLATED...SO WILL NOT ISSUE A FFA AT THIS TIME.

DUE TO INCREASING LOW LEVEL JET...PLAN ON INCREASING THE WINDS OVER THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS TO 15 TO 30 MPH AND GUSTY.

HAVE A GOOD NIGHT...

UPPER LOW DEPART BY EARLY SATURDAY. AXIS OF UPPER RIDGE ANCHORS 
ITSELF OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH MUCH OF THE UPCOMING 
WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT WEEK. ANOTHER UPPER CLOSED LOW APPROACHES THE 
AREA BY LATE IN THE PERIOD BUT APPEARS UPPER RIDGE WILL KEEP ITS 
EFFECTS AT BAY THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT WEEK. THUS HAVE KEPT DAY 7 
(TUESDAY) DRY AT THIS TIME. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY FAVORED WARMER 
VALUES BETWEEN GFS AND ENSEMBLE MOS GUIDANCE AFTER FRIDAY BASED ON 
PROJECTION OF UPPER RIDGE AXIS PERSISTING OVER OUR REGION.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
231 PM EDT MON APR 4 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...MAINLY HIGH CLOUDS HEADED IN 
FOR THIS EVENING...WELL IN ADVANCE OF THE RAPIDLY SLOWING CENTRAL US 
SYSTEM.  WE SHOULD SEE THESE CLOUDS THICKEN AND LOWER TO A MID DECK 
OVER NIGHT BEFORE BREAKING UP SOMEWHAT TOMORROW AFTERNOON.  LIMITED 
LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE MEANS THERE IS NO CHANCE FOR RAIN TONIGHT OR 
TOMORROW.  WINDS TUESDAY WILL BE MUCH LIKE TODAY.  OTHERWISE...MILD 
TEMPS WILL CONTINUE.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS 
AND ENSEMBLES APPEAR TO BE COMING IN BETTER AGREEMENT WITH THE NEXT 
SIGNIFICANT EVENT IN THE LATE WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY TIME FRAME. 
SOME SUBTLE DIFFERENCES APPEAR BY 00Z SATURDAY AS THE CANADIAN GEM 
MODEL DEPICTS UPPER CLOSED LOW TO TRANSITION INTO AN OPEN 
WAVE...WHICH WILL EFFECT SPEED OF SYSTEM DEPARTURE. BOTH THE GFS AND 
THE ECMWF DEPICT THIS TRANSITION TO OCCUR SOMEWHAT LATER. TIMING THE 
END OF THE PRECIP EVENT REMAINS PROBLEMATIC AND HAVE NOT CHANGED 
EXISTING POPS GRIDS/FORECAST AT THIS TIME. HIGHLY AMPLIFIED RIDGE 
BUILDS IN BEHIND THE DEPARTING FEATURE OVER THE UPCOMING WEEKEND. 
THIS SUGGESTS TRANQUIL WEATHER AND MODERATING TEMPS INTO EARLY NEXT 
WEEK. HAD NO COMPELLING REASON TO SIGNIFICANTLY DEVIATE FROM GFS 
GUIDANCE TEMP VALUES SINCE THE OTHER MEDIUM RANGE MODELS AND 
ENSEMBLES GENERALLY SUPPORT THE GFS SOLUTION. FOLLOWED THOSE NUMBER 
FAIRLY CLOSELY FOR THE MOST PART.

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A DEEP AREA OF LOW PRESSURE NEAR 
PHILADELPHIA WITH ITS ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT OFF THE ATLANTIC COAST. 
RADARS STILL INDICATE SCATTERED SHOWERS ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF 
THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...IN ASSOCIATION WITH A DEEP UPPER- 
LEVEL LOW OVER CENTRAL VIRGINIA. REPORTS FROM EARLIER THIS EVENING 
INDICATED AROUND AN INCH OF SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN WISE COUNTY VA... 
WITH UP TO TEN INCHES NEAR CLINGMANS DOME IN THE SMOKIES. THUS... 
WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE THE SNOW ADVISORIES AND WARNINGS OVERNIGHT... 
SINCE ADDITIONAL LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE UNTIL THE 
PRECIP ENDS AFTER MIDNIGHT.

LATEST VAD WIND PROFILE INDICATES THAT STRONG WINDS AROUND 30 KNOTS 
ARE OCCURRING ABOVE 3000 FEET. SURFACE OBS STILL SHOW BREEZY WINDS 
ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA...BUT WINDS HAVE BACKED OFF 
CONSIDERABLY ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN ZONES. THUS...WILL PLAN 
TO CONTINUE THE HIGH WIND WARNING FOR THE MOUNTAINS OVERNIGHT...BUT 
WILL CANCEL THE LAKE WIND ADVISORY FOR THE SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL 
VALLEY AND CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. 

TEMPS LOOK TO BE ON TRACK AND WILL NOT PLAN TO CHANGE IN THE UPDATE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
212 PM EST SAT APR 2 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...OPERATIONAL MODELS AND SHORT 
RANGE ENSEMBLES GENERALLY AGREE THAT VIGOROUS UPPER LOW CURRENTLY 
CENTERED OVER SOUTHWESTERN WEST VIRGINIA WILL RAPIDLY PULL NORTHEAST 
AND AWAY FROM THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THROUGH THE FIRST PERIOD. 
ANTICIPATE THAT SIGNIFICANT PRECIP WILL HAVE ENDED ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA BY 09Z. UNTIL THEN...EXPECT RAIN SHOWERS (AND SNOW 
SHOWERS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS) TO CONTINUE ACROSS MUCH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA AS MOISTURE CONTINUES TO WRAP AROUND UPPER LOW. SNOW 
EVENT IN HIGHER TERRAIN WILL BE ENHANCED BY UPSLOPE FLOW COMPONENT. 
THUS WILL CONTINUE HEAVY SNOW WARNING FOR CENTRAL AND NORTHERN 
MOUNTAINS...AND ISSUE AN ADVISORY FOR SOUTHWESTERN VIRGINIA 
COUNTIES...MAINLY ABOVE 2500 FEET.

STRONG SURFACE PRESSURE GRADIENT BETWEEN DEPARTING SURFACE LOW 
PRESSURE AND HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING IN FROM THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
SUGGESTS STRONG WINDS WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE FIRST PERIOD. WILL 
ALSO CONTINUE WIND ADVISORIES/WARNINGS AS CURRENTLY CONFIGURED. 
POTENTIAL CLEARING SKY CONDITIONS LATE IN THE FIRST PERIOD MAY ALLOW 
TEMPS TO DROP TO NEAR PROJECTED DEWPOINT VALUES...AND TENDED TO 
FAVOR COOLER NGM MOS GUIDANCE VALUES IN THE FIRST PERIOD. GENERALLY 
WENT WITH A BLEND OF THE GUIDANCE VALUES IN THE SECOND PERIOD AS 
STRONG INSOLATION AND DOWNSLOPE FLOW SHOULD ALLOW TEMPS TO RECOVER 
SIGNIFICANTLY IN THE SECOND PERIOD.


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...WITH RIDGING BUILDING 
IN ALOFT...SHOULD BE DRY WITH A WARMING TREND FOR SUNDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT.  NEXT SYSTEM STILL LOOKS LIKE IT WILL 
APPROACH WEDNESDAY...GFS HAS BEEN CONSISTENT IN SHOWING A MIDWEEK 
SYSTEM...BUT TIMING HAS VARIED A BIT FROM RUN TO RUN.  GFS STILL 
SHOWING THE UPPER LOW CUTTING OFF AND RATHER SLOW MOVEMENT...WITH 
PRECIP LINGERING FOR A WHILE.  FOR NOW...WILL GENERALLY TRY TO 
FOLLOW HPC SOLUTION AND WILL CARRY PRECIP FOR WED THROUGH 
FRIDAY...THEN DRY FOR SATURDAY.  IF 00Z GFS IS RIGHT...COULD BE SOME 
HIGHER ELEVATION SNOW ONCE AGAIN AS THE UPPER LOW TRACKS ACROSS THE 
AREA...BUT 12Z RUN IS WARMER. WITH THE UNCERTAINTY THAT FAR OUT...WILL 
KEEP SNOW OUT OF THE FORECAST FOR NOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
428 AM EST SAT APR 2 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STRONG MID/UPR JET DIGGING SOUTH 
TOWARDS W TN THIS MORNING. THIS WILL SLOW THE NE PROGRESS OF THE 
WESTWARD SLANTED LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TO THE EAST INTO THE CNTRL 
APPALACHIANS. SFC PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO FALL ALLOWING FOR 
INCREASED W-NW WINDS ACROSS THE AREA TODAY CONTINUING INTO TONIGHT. 
A SFC COLD FRONT IS EXITING THE AREA TO THE NE THIS MORNING BUT 
PLENTY OF LOW TO MID LEVEL MOISTURE CONTINUES TO WRAP AROUND AND 
WILL ADVECT INTO THE AREA TODAY AND TONIGHT. PCPN AMOUNTS WILL BE 
LIGHT BUT COVERAGE WILL BE PRETTY GOOD. FREEZING LEVEL CONTINUE TO 
DROP AND WILL GET DOWN TO ARND 2500 FEET LATE THIS AFTERNOON. SNOW 
WILL BEGIN MIXING WITH RAIN ALOFT AND ACCUMULATIONS WILL BECOME 
POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS HIGHER ELEVATIONS DESPITE INITIAL 
WARM SFC TEMPS. WINDS WILL INCREASE TO 20 TO AS HIGH AS 30 AREAWIDE 
WITH HIGHER SPEEDS ACROSS THE MNTS THIS AFTN. TEMPERATURES WILL BE 
STEADY OR FALLING TODAY WITH A POSSIBLE TEMP BUST ACROSS CNTRL AND 
SOUTHERN VALLEYS DUE TO DOWNSLOPING OFF CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. MID/UPR 
JET SWINGS EAST OF AREA EARLY TONIGHT AND MOISTURE BEGINS TO FALL 
OFF. PCPN WILL TAPER OFF FROM SW THIS EVENING BUT CONTINUE NE AREAS 
OVERNIGHT. ACCUMULATING SNOW NEAR ADVSRY CRITERIA PSBL TONIGHT SW VA 
BUT WILL LET DAY SHIFT DECIDE ON EXTEND OF COVERAGE.   

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...CONTINUED UPSLOPE FLOW MAY 
KEEP A FEW LINGERING SNOW SHOWERS OVER OUR NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS EARLY 
SUNDAY.  OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE WILL BUILD IN THROUGH THE DAY ON 
SUNDAY FOR A DRYING AND WARMING TREND.  THE NEXT SYSTEM OF CONCERN 
REACHES INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION ON WEDNESDAY...THOUGH 
MODEL TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM HAS BEEN INCONSISTENT AND CONFIDENCE IS 
LOW.  FOR NOW...WILL CONTINUE CHANCE POPS WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY AND 
DRY ON FRIDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
226 PM EST FRI APR 1 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...A VERY COMPLEX WEATHER 
PATTERN THE NEXT 24 HOURS.  FIRST QUESTION IS SHOWER AND 
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING.  STILL FEEL 
THERE IS POTENTIAL FOR FAIRLY RAPID DEVELOPMENT THIS AFTERNOON SO 
HANGING ONTO HIGH POPS FOR THIS PERIOD.  THERE ALSO IS STILL THE 
POTENTIAL FOR SOME OF THESE STORMS TO BECOME SEVERE...PARTICULARLY 
IN THE SOUTHERN VALLEY SO WILL WORD ACCORDINGLY.

NEXT BIG QUESTION IS THE WRAP AROUND MOISTURE BEHIND THE COLD FRONT 
AND ASSOCIATED PRECIPITATION...PARTICULARLY IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS.  FEEL THAT ANY SNOW WILL BE IN ELEVATIONS ABOVE 3000 
FT.  THE GROUND WILL BE FAIRLY WARM STARTING THE EVENT AND INITIALLY 
THE SNOW WILL BE MIXED WITH RAIN SO DO NOT EXPECT MAJOR 
ACCUMULATIONS AT THIS TIME.  THROUGH THE DAY SATURDAY SEE AROUND AN 
INCH OF SNOW BY SUNSET SATURDAY.  THESE SNOW WILL CONTINUE INTO 
SATURDAY NIGHT AND WILL LET THE LONG TERM ADDRESS THESE CONCERNS.  
WITH THE UNCERTAINTIES AND AMOUNTS WILL NOT ISSUE WARNING OR 
ADVISORY AT THIS TIME BUT WILL ADDRESS WITH A SPECIAL WEATHER 
STATEMENT.


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS IN BETTER 
AGREEMENT THIS RUN THAN YESTERDAY. UPPER LOW PULLS AWAY SATURDAY 
NIGHT...BUT LINGERING MOISTURE...LOW LEVEL INSTABILITY...AND UPSLOPE FLOW 
SHOULD CONTINUE SHOWERS LINGERING INTO SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH SNOW 
SHOWERS OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  WILL USE HIGHEST POPS OVER THE 
NORMALLY FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS.   SHOULD SEE SOME ADDITIONAL 
ACCUMULATIONS OVER THE HIGHER TERRAIN.  ALSO...IT WILL BE WINDY OVER 
THE HIGHER TERRAIN SAT NIGHT INTO EARLY SUNDAY.  LATER SHIFTS MAY
NEED TO ISSUE WIND ADVISORIES.  MOISTURE EXITS SUNDAY...AND 
WITH RIDGING BUILDING IN...SHOULD BE DRY THROUGH TUESDAY.  NEXT 
SYSTEM APPROACHES WEDNESDAY...AND IF UPPER LOW CUTS OFF AS DEPICTED 
BY GFS...MAY BE SLOW TO LEAVE.  FOR NOW WILL CARRY PRECIP FOR 
WEDNESDAY THROUGH THU NIGHT...BUT WILL BE GO DRY FOR FRI.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  46  53  36  65 / 100  40  10   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  45  48  37  60 / 100  60  40   0

FXUS64 KMRX 010848
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
348 AM EST FRI APR 1 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RAPID CHANGES EXPECTED NEXT 24 
HRS AS DEVELOPING SFC LOW MOVES NE THROUGH MRX CWA. MID TO UPPER 
LEVEL JET MAX SWINGING UNDER SHORT WAVE TROUGH OVR TX WILL BEGIN 
HEADING NE THROUGH MID TN LATER TODAY BRINGING SHORT WAVE IN PHASE 
WITH NORTHERN TROUGH. SFC LOW WILL CONTINUE TO DEEPEN NEAR RIGHT 
EXIT REGION OF UPPER JET AND SLIDE INTO MRX CWA THIS AFTERNOON. WARM 
FRONT WILL MOVE NORTHWARD THROUGH MRX CWA IN ADVANCE OF APPROACHING 
LOW. AREA STARTING OUT RELATIVELY COOL WITH DECENT LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE. AREAS OF FOG EARLY BUT MIXING SHOULD PICK UP EARLY TODAY. 
AVAILABLE MOISTURE AND LIFT VERY FAVORABLE...INSTABILITY LOW FOR 
TODAY. PATTERN SETTING UP NICELY FOR WIDESPREAD SHOWERS. CONVECTIVE 
COMPLEX ALONG THE GULF CST THIS MORNING MAY GO A LONG WAY TO LIMIT 
LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ADVECTION. AREA HODOGRAPHS FAVORABLE FOR RIGHT 
MOVING SUPERCELL DEVELOPMENT. WIDESPREAD CONVECTION WILL LIKELY 
CONTAMINATE STORM INFLOW. THERE IS A SLIGHT RISK FOR LARGE HAIL 
ACROSS MRX CWA TODAY WITH A MODERATE RISK OF LARGE HAIL WITH 
ISOLATED TORNADOES POSSIBLE ACROSS SE TN/SW NC. THE JET CORE SHOULD 
MOVE INTO E TN THIS EVENING PROVIDING A DRY SLOT AND A DECREASE IN 
CONVECTION AS COLD FRONT MOVES EAST OF THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. 
COOLING ALOFT MAINTAINS A THREAT OF SMALL HAIL AND STRONG WINDS WITH 
SCATTERED CONVECTION. 

.LONG TERM...SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY...THE LOW PRESSURE TROUGH 
MOVES THROUGH THE AREA ON SATURDAY.  WITH ANOTHER BAND OF MOISTURE 
WRAPPING IN AND DECENT LIFT...WILL CONTINUE TO SEE WIDESPREAD 
SHOWERS OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION.  AS THE TROUGH EXITS 
THE REGION SATURDAY NIGHT AND A COLDER AND DRIER AIR MASS FILTERS 
IN...SHOWERS WILL END FROM WEST TO EAST AND THE RAIN WILL CHANGE TO 
LIGHT SNOW OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN AND 
WILL DOMINATE AREA WEATHER THROUGH TUESDAY.  MODELS HAVING PROBLEMS 
WITH TIMING OF NEXT SYSTEM.  MODELS MAY BE TRENDING TOWARD A SLOWER 
MOVEMENT OF THE SYSTEM...BUT WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS IN FOR BOTH 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY FOR NOW.  

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EST THU MAR 31 2005

.DISCUSSION...OUR BRIEF BREAK IN A WET PATTERN IS SURE TO BE 
SHORT-LIVED AS PRESSURE FALLS HAVE ALREADY BEEN NOTED ACROSS THE 
LOWER MISS VALLEY REGION IN ADVANCE OF THE DEEPENING UPPER TROUGH 
OVER THE PLAINS STATES.  SURFACE LOW PRESSURE LOOKS TO BE DEVELOPING 
AS EXPECTED ACROSS LA/MS VICINITY...AND WILL RATHER QUICKLY HEAD NE 
AND SPREAD SHOWERS AND A FEW THUNDERSTORMS OUR WAY FRIDAY.

GOOD NEWS IS THAT THE CURRENT CONVECTIVE PCPN IS MUCH FURTHER TO OUR 
SOUTH TONIGHT (THAN LAST NIGHTS)...AND THE STEERING WINDS ARE 
CONSIDERABLY WEAKER TONIGHT.  THUS...THE CURRENT SCENARIO FOR JUST 
CHANCE POPS IN OUR SOUTHERN AREAS LATE TONIGHT TO SLIGHT CHANCE NRN 
AREAS LOOKS GOOD (ALTHO POSSIBLY COULD REMOVE THE 20 PERCENT CHANCE 
FOR SWRN VA OVERNIGHT).

WILL CHECK MIN TEMP FORECAST AND CURRENT GRIDS FOR ANY NEEDED UPDATES
...BUT THE WORDING IN THE ZFP IS IN GREAT SHAPE WITH NO EVENING 
WORDING TO REMOVE.  LATER SHIFTS WILL NEED TO WATCH CLOSELY THE 
POTENTIAL FOR SOME HEAVY RAINS IN THE SRN MTNS FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...AS WELL AS POSSIBLE LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS IN THE 
HIGHEST TERRAIN ON SATURDAY.  HOWEVER...LATEST RUNS OF THE ETA(NAM)
AND GFS SEEM TO BE TRENDING MUCH LIGHTER ON POSSIBLE SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
231 PM EST THU MAR 31 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...BRIEF PERIOD OF DRY WEATHER 
IN STORE THROUGH EARLY FRIDAY MORNING AS SYSTEM WHICH PRODUCED THIS 
MORNINGS CONVECTION CONTINUES TO PULL AWAY. NEXT SYSTEM FOLLOWS 
CLOSE ON THE HEELS OF THE FIRST WITH PRECIP EXPECTED TO ENCROACH THE 
SOUTHERN TIER AROUND 06Z FRIDAY. THE PRECIP WILL OVERSPREAD THE REST 
OF THE FORECAST AREA BY AROUND 12Z. GFS IS A LITTLE SLOWER WITH THIS 
PROGRESSION. UPPER FLOW BECOMES MUCH MORE AMPLIFIED AS TROUGH 
CONTINUES TO DIG INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS DURING THE DAY ON FRIDAY. 
APPEARS THAT HEAVIEST PRECIP WILL REMAIN SOUTH OF OUR FORECAST 
AREA...ALTHOUGH SOME OF THE HEAVIER PRECIP MAY SNEAK INTO 
SOUTHEASTERN TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWESTERN NORTH CAROLINA. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY FOLLOWED GFS MOS VALUES FAIRLY CLOSELY.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...UPPER TROUGH PASSES 
OVER THE AREA FRIDAY NIGHT.  THIS SYSTEM...AND ESPECIALLY SURFACE 
LOW POSITION...STILL NOT HANDLED CONSISTENTLY BY MODELS...AND WITH 
POOR AGREEMENT AND CONSISTENCY CONFIDENCE IN THE DETAILS IS LOWER 
THAN AVERAGE.  WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW HPC LEAD AND USE A GFS/NAM BLEND.  
SHOULD BE SHOWERS AROUND FRIDAY NIGHT INTO SATURDAY...AND AS COLDER 
AIR COMES IN...MAY SEE SOME SNOW SHOWERS MIXING IN OVER THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN.  WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING IN NORMALLY FAVORED 
UPSLOPE AREAS EARLY SAT NIGHT...EXPECT CLOUDS TO GRADUALLY BEGIN 
CLEARING FROM SW TO NE OVERNIGHT.  TROUGH EXITS AND HIGH PRESSURE 
BUILDS IN...GIVING DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY THROUGH TUESDAY.  NEXT 
SYSTEM APPROACHES FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...WITH ANOTHER CHANCE 
OF SHOWERS.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...UPPER TROF OVERHEAD WITH SFC

SEVERE, BUT LATEST REPORTS HAVE STRONGEST STORMS AT AROUND 45 MPH 
WINDS WITH LIGHTNING AND RAIN...IN OTHER WORDS, THUNDERSTORMS.

TONIGHT, AND THEN A SMALL BREAK IN THE  ACTION OCCURS, WITH UPPER 
LOW WITH LIMITED SUCCESS TO CUT OFF FRIDAY AND SFC INVERTED TROF 
PROVIDING LOW LEVEL SUPPORT. HENCE SHOWERS NEARLY CATEGORICAL 
FRIDAY. HAVE LEFT HIGH/LOWS AS IS, AND TWEAKED SKY COVER A TAD IN 
THE FAR NORTHEAST TO ACCOUNT FOR TONIGHTS BREAK AND TO MOVE MORE IN 
LINE WITH THOSE OFFICES DROPPING OF CLOUD COVER NEARLY ALTOGETHER 
FOR SEVERAL HOURS.

ERN GT LAKES/SRN APPALACHIAN LINE BY 12Z SAT WITH COLD AIR SPILLING 
INTO THE FA ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE TROF. WILL HOLD ONTO THE 
LIKELY/HIGH CHC POPS FOR -SHRA WITH SOME -SHSN MIXING WITH THE RAIN 
AT THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS ALONG THE NC BORDER FRIDAY NIGHT/EARLY SAT 
MORNING. WRAP AROUND PRECIP LINGERS ACROSS SW VA/NE TN AND MTNS 
THROUGH MUCH OF THE DAY BEFORE ENDING BY SATURDAY EVENING. KEPT MUCH 
OF THE REMAINDER OF THE FCST DRY UNTIL LATE TUE NIGHT INTO WED AS 
UPR TROF AMPLIFIES OVR THE PLAINS/MS VLY DRIVING ANOTHER COLD FRONT 
INTO THE MID SOUTH. USED SLGT THROUGH LOW CHC POPS TUE NIGHT INTO 
WED TO ACCOUNT FOR THIS FRONTAL SYSTEM.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 310055
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
755 PM EST WED MAR 30 2005

.DISCUSSION...A BEAUTIFUL DAY ACROSS THE REGION IS WINDING DOWN WITH 
MOSTLY CLEAR SKIES AND VERY PLEASANT TEMPS IN THE MID 60S TO MID 70S 
NOTED.  SOME CONVECTIVE PRECIPITATION (PCPN) IS FINALLY STARTING TO 
FIRE ACROSS THE GULF COAST (WHERE BEST INSTABILITY IS NOTED)...AND 
ALSO ACROSS THE UPPER MIDWEST AND WESTERN GREAT LAKES REGION 
(ASSOCIATED WITH THE SURFACE AND UPPER LOW TRACK).  THIS LEAVES OUR 
REGION IN BETWEEN THESE TWO AREAS AND CURRENTLY HAVING A VERY STABLE 
AIRMASS IN PLACE WITH NO LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AS OF YET.

I HAVE SOME CONCERNS THAT THE SHORT RANGE MODELS MIGHT BE OVERDOING 
THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXTENT OF CONVECTIVE PCPN OVERNIGHT...AS QUITE 
OFTEN OUR AREA SEES SCATTERED OR LESS CONVECTION WITH UPPER LEVEL 
SUPPORT SO FAR NORTH OF US...AND BEST INSTABILITY TO OUR SOUTH OVER 
THE GULF COAST STATES.  I DID NOTICE TWO FEATURES THAT MIGHT HELP 
OUR CHANCES OF SHOWERS (POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS) BY THURSDAY MORNING 
...1) UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE IN ASSOCIATION WITH THE UPPER LEVEL JET 
ACROSS THE SE STATES...AND 2) A 40 KNOT OR SO LOW LEVEL JET THAT 
COULD TRANSPORT SUFFICIENT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE NORTHWARD IN ADVANCE 
OF THE SOMEWHAT WEAK COLD FRONT (ALTHO MODELS ONLY DEVELOP MARGINAL 
INSTABILITY THURSDAY).

WILL UPDATE THE ZFPMRX AROUND 9PM OR SO AND REMOVE ANY EVENING 
WORDING.  MAY ALSO SIMPLIFY THE WORDING A BIT...OPTING FOR 
INCREASING CLOUDS AND PERHAPS A SLIGHT DECREASE IN RAIN CHANCES THRU 
12Z THURSDAY (ESPECIALLY IF RADAR AND SATELLITE TRENDS SUPPORT 
THIS).  GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS WILL ALSO REFLECT ANY NEEDED CHANGES 
FOR TONIGHT.  HOWEVER...FOR NOW WONT MAKE ANY CHANGES TO THE SECOND 
PERIOD...PREFERRING THAT MIDNIGHT SHIFT LOOK OVER NEW 31/00Z MODEL 
RUN AND WATCH CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT OVERNIGHT.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC......NONE.
TN......NONE.
VA......NONE.

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
231 PM EST WED MAR 30 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND THURSDAY)...RIDGE ALOFT BEGINS TO BREAK 
DOWN AS THE NEXT S/W SWINGS IN OVERNIGHT TONIGHT.  SUFFICIENT 
MOISTURE HAS RETURNED FROM THE GULF TO ALLOW SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS TO MOVE INTO THE AREA BEGINNING FROM THE SOUTHWEST 
OVERNIGHT AND SPREADING ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF THE REGION BY 12Z.  
GFS AND NAM IN CLOSE AGREEMENT SO NO REAL CHOICE THERE.  WENT WITH A 
BLEND FOR GUIDANCE NUMBERS.  

SHOWERS BEGIN TO CLEAR FROM THE WEST TOMORROW MORNING AND POPS DROP 
BACK INTO THE CHANCE CATEGORY BY LATE AFTERNOON.


.LONG TERM...(THU NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS IN POOR 
AGREEMENT FOR SYSTEM THU NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY...ESPECIALLY WITH 
SURFACE LOW TRACK.  GFS IS FURTHER  NORTH WITH THE SURFACE 
LOW...ESPECIALLY LATER IN THE PERIOD. WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW HPC IDEA 
AND USE A BLEND...BUT HIGHER THAN NORMAL LEVEL OF UNCERTAINTY FOR 
THIS PART OF FORECAST.  REASONABLE AGREEMENT THAT SURGE OF MOISTURE 
AND DECENT LIFT AHEAD OF THIS SYSTEM WILL BRING PRECIP TO AT LEAST 
SOUTHERN AREAS LATE THU NIGHT...THEN LIFT ACROSS THE AREA FRIDAY.  
FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING INTERESTING...AS COLDER AIR SURGES 
IN...SHOULD SEE HIGHER ELEVATIONS CHANGE TO SNOW SHOWERS.  ETA 
BULLISH ON SNOW ACCUMULATIONS OVER THE MOUNTAINS...BUT USING A BLEND 
WOULD LIMIT AMOUNTS.  FOR NOW WILL JUST TREND COLDER AND ADD SNOW 
SHOWERS TO THESE AREAS FOR LATTER HALF OF FRI NIGHT INTO SATURDAY.  
FURTHER OUT...SHOULD BE DRY SUN THROUGH TUESDAY...THEN NEXT SYSTEM 
APPROACHES ON WEDNESDAY.

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...SKINNY UPPER RIDGE ALLOWING

TWEAKED THEM ON THE WESTERN BORDERS TO TRY AND ACHIEVE A MODICUM OF 
AGREEMENT WITH OTHER OFFICES. MAXES/MINS STATUS QUO. 

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...S/WV PROGRESSES E TWD 
THE MS VLY BY 12Z FRI KEEPING CHC POPS GOING WITH INCREASE IN 
PROBABILITY TWD DAYBREAK. USED LIKELY POPS DURING THE DAY FRI AS UPR 
TROF PRESSES INTO THE ERN U.S. WITH SFC LOW TRACKING NE ACROSS THE 
SRN APPALACHIANS. CONVECTION POSSIBLE WITH DYNAMIC SYSTEM AND WARM 
SECTOR BUILDS ACROSS THE SRN/ERN SECTIONS OF THE FA SO TSRA COMBINED 
WITH -SHRA AT TIMES. UPR TROF/CD FNT SWEEP E OF THE FA BY 12Z SAT 
BUT MAINTAINED CHC/SLGT CHC POP FOR -SHRA DUE TO UNCERTAINTY IN 
SPEED OF SYSTEM AND POSSIBILITY OF WRAP AROUND MOISTURE/UPSLOPE 
COMPONENT BEHIND DEPARTING SYSTEM. REMAINDER OF FCST DRY AS UPPER 
FLO DEAMPLIFIES WITH SFC RIDGING IN PLACE ACROSS SERN U.S. KEEPING 
MOISTURE RETURN LIMITED UNTIL TUE WHEN NEXT UPR TROF BUILDS TWD THE 
MS VLY WITH STRENGTHENING SLY FLO LATER TUE NIGHT. USED A SLGT CHC 
POP FOR -SHRA DURING THIS PERIOD WITH SFC SYSTEM MAKING PROGRESS E 
INTO THE LWR MS VLY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
307 PM EST TUE MAR 29 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...OTHER THAN SCHOOL NET 
OBSERVATIONS...MURPHY NC AWOS AND CHA ASOS...MOST AREAS HAVE YET TO 
REACH THE 70S THIS AFTERNOON.  GENERALLY RUNNING ABOUT 2-3 DEGREES 
BEHIND MOS TREND...AND CURRENT DEWPOINTS WERE ALSO RUNNING LOWER 
THAN EXPECTED.  LATE AFTERNOON TEMP/DEWPOINT GRIDS WERE ADJUSTED TO 
REFLECT THIS...AND ALSO I RE-POPULATED WITH FWC MOS DEWPOINTS (BEST 
OF THE BUNCH).   

FOR TONIGHT...EXPECT JUST SOME PASSING THIN HIGH CLOUDS AT TIMES 
WITH BULK OF CLOUDINESS TO REMAIN TO OUR WEST.  GIVEN THESE MOSTLY 
CLEAR SKIES...VERY LIGHT WINDS AND CURRENT DEWPOINTS...I FAVORED AT 
OR JUST BELOW THE COOLER MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT.  A FEW AREAS OF DENSE 
FOG WERE NOTED THIS MORNING (MAINLY NE AREAS)...BUT SOME DRYING HAS 
OCCURRED THIS AFTERNOON...SO OPTED TO JUST MENTION SOME PATCHY AREAS 
OF FOG LATE TONIGHT IN THE FAVORED AREAS NEAR LAKES/STREAMS.  LATER 
SHIFTS CAN MONITOR AND ADD DENSE FOG IF NEEDED.

FOR WEDNESDAY...JUST A GRADUAL INCREASE IN CLOUDS/MOISTURE FROM THE 
WEST...TO NO WORSE THAN PARTLY CLOUDY BY THE AFTERNOON.  SOUTHWEST 
LOW LEVEL FLOW STRENGTHENS IN ADVANCE OF THE NEXT SIGNIGICANT SYSTEM 
...WITH STRONGEST WINDS OVER WESTERN MOST PARTS OF THE AREA.  WAS 
NOT CONFIDENT ENOUGH TO GO WITH THE WARMER ETA MOS FOR MAX TEMPS 
WEDNESDAY...SO STAYED CLOSE TO PREVIOUS HIGHS WHICH WERE NEAR THE 
MOS BLEND CHOICES.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...A WEAKENING FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY WILL TRACK ACROSS THE AREA LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO 
THURSDAY FOR MAINLY SCATTERED LIGHT SHOWERS.  A SECONDARY WAVE WILL 
MOVE IN ON ITS HEELS THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY FOR MORE WIDESPREAD 
PRECIP.  COOLER...DRYER AIR WILL MOVE IN FOR SATURDAY.  MODELS IN 
POOR AGREEMENT WITH A COUPLE OF SHORT WAVE DURING THE REMAINDER OF 
THE EXTENDED.  CURRENTLY...TREND IS TO KEEP THE TRACKS TO OUR NORTH 
SO WILL KEEP THINGS DRY FOR NOW.

SURFACE LOW...WITH THE LOW EXPECTED TO BE LOCATED ACROSS CENTRAL 
EAST TN AROUND MIDNIGHT TONIGHT. THE DEEP UPPER LOW ASSOCIATED WITH

1000 AM EST SUN MAR 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN INVERTED TROUGH ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA WITH A SURFACE LOW OVER WEST CENTRAL ALABAMA. THE MAIN 
WARM FRONT ASSOCIATED WITH THIS LOW WAS STILL LOCATED SOUTH OF THE 
AREA OVER CENTRAL ALABAMA AND CENTRAL GEORGIA...AND SHOULD REMAIN 
SOUTH OF THE AREA THIS AFTERNOON. SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL A MORE 
EXTENSIVE DRY SLOT AHEAD OF THE SURFACE LOW THAN EARLIER EXPECTED... 
AND MORNING SOUNDINGS INDICATE A STRONG CAPPING INVERSION IN THE MID 
LEVELS. THESE FACTORS APPEAR TO HAVE SUPPRESSED THE EXPECTED 
CONVECTION FOR THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING WITH THE WARM FRONT... 
BUT THIS DRIER SCENARIO SHOULD HELP TO ALLOW FOR A GREATER TEMP 
WARM-UP AHEAD OF THE LOW AS ITS TRACKS NORTHEAST INTO THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS EVENING. A MODIFIED MORNING SOUNDING FROM NASHVILLE 
INDICATES THAT MODERATE INSTABILITY SHOULD DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON... 
WITH TEMPS EXPECTED TO RISE INTO THE 70S. THIS MODERATE INSTABILITY 
IN COMBINATION WITH THE HIGH HELICITY VALUES EXPECTED AHEAD OF THE 
SURFACE LOW SHOULD HELP TO SET THE STAGE FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF 
SCATTERED SUPERCELL TSTORMS ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY LATER THIS 
AFTERNOON. THE THREAT OF MORE WIDESPREAD CONVECTION WITH LOCALLY 
HEAVY RAINFALL SHOULD DEVELOP THIS EVENING AS THE LOW TRACKS INTO 
THE FORECAST AREA.

WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE FORECAST TO REMOVE MENTION OF MOST MORNING 
PRECIP...BUT WILL MENTION REDEVELOPMENT OF TSTORMS FOR THIS 
AFTERNOON. ALSO...WILL RAISE TEMPS A CATEGORY AND LOWER CLOUD COVER 
FOR TODAY WITH TEMPS ALREADY RISING QUICKLY AS CLOUD BREAKS HAVE
DEVELOPED IN THE DRY SLOT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 PM EST SAT MAR 26 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...A POWERFUL UPPER LOW...CURRENTLY 
OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS...WILL HELP STRENGTHEN A SURFACE LOW OVER 
THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY TONIGHT. IN RESPONSE TO THIS 
DEEPENING LOW...A STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN WILL PUSH A WARM 
FRONT NORTH TOWARDS SOUTHEAST TN BY SUNRISE. MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW 
SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THE LOCATION OF CONVECTIVE DEVELOPMENT LATE 
TONIGHT AND SUNDAY...BUT IT SEEMS APPARENT THAT WIDESPREAD 
CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP AHEAD OF BOTH THE WARM FRONT TONIGHT AND THE 
COLD FRONT ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. ELEVATED INSTABILITY 
COULD AID IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOME SEVERE TSTORMS OVERNIGHT ACROSS 
THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA...WITH ISOLATED TORNADOES 
POSSIBLE ALONG THE WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY TOWARDS SUNRISE ACROSS 
SOUTHEAST TN. AS THIS WARM FRONT MOVES NORTHEAST THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA SUNDAY MORNING...A DRY SLOT SHOULD CREATE A BREAK IN 
THE RAIN BEFORE THE COLD FRONT NEARS IN THE AFTERNOON. WITH SOME 
DECENT TEMP RECOVERY EXPECTED BEFORE THE COLD FRONT...THINK THAT 
WIDESPREAD SEVERE WEATHER WILL DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE COLD FRONT AS 
WIND DYNAMICS STRENGTHEN WITH THE APPROACH OF THE LOW. SEVERE 
PARAMETERS APPEAR TO BE COMING TOGETHER FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF 
NUMEROUS SUPERCELLS ACROSS THE TN VALLEY...WITH STRONG LONG-LIVED 
TORNADOES POSSIBLE NEAR THE TRACK OF THE SURFACE LOW. IN ADDITION TO 
THE SEVERE WEATHER... LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE POSSIBLE 
OVERNIGHT AND SUNDAY AS THE REGION BECOMES LOCATED UNDER THE 
FAVORABLE LEFT EXIT DIFLUENT REGION OF A STRONG UPPER JET. SOME 
TRAINING OF TSTOMS COUILD ALSO DEVELOP ALONG THE TRACK OF THE LOW 
WHERE LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL WILL BE POSSIBLE.

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...WIDESPREAD...LOCALLY 
STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL CONTINUE ACROSS THE MRX CWA SUNDAY EVENING 
AS THE COLD FRONT MOVES THROUGH THE REGION. SHOWERS AND 
THUNDERSTORMS WILL SLOWLY DECREASE IN INTENSITY OVERNIGHT. THE LOW 
PRESSURE CENTER WILL TRACK THROUGH THE AREA ON MONDAY CONTINUING 
SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS INTO MONDAY AFTERNOON. 
CONVECTION WILL SLOWLY END FROM WEST TO EAST MONDAY EVENING. WE WILL 
BE BETWEEN SYSTEM TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY AS HIGH PRESSURE PUSHES 
THROUGH. MODEL CONSISTENCY POOR IN BOTH TIMING AND POSITION OF THE 
NEXT SYSTEM. FOR NOW...WILL CONTINUE LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY 
AND FRIDAY FOR THIS SYSTEM.
&&

EVENING...WITH THE MAIN THREATS BEING THE POSSIBILITY OF DAMAGING 
WINDS AND LARGE HAIL.

POPS FOR THE SOUTH AND CENTRAL ZONES FOR TONIGHT AND LIKELY FOR THE 
NORTH. STILL SHOWING SOME INSTABILITY...SO STRONG THUNDERSTORMS 
STILL POSSIBLE OVERNIGHT.  DEEP SURFACE LOW/COLD FRONT TRACKS 
THROUGH AREA ON SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP CATEGORICAL POPS 
FOR SUNDAY AND LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL POPS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT.  GFS AND 
NAM ADVERTISING LIS NEAR -4 ON SUNDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING... 
ALONG WITH DEEP MOISTURE...WILL PROBABLY BE THE MOST LIKELY TIME FOR 
SEVERE STORMS.  UPPER LOW TRACKS ACROSS THE AREA ON MONDAY.  WILL 
KEEP LIKELY POPS INTO MONDAY...SHOULD NOT HAVE PROBLEMS WITH SEVERE 
WEATHER ON MONDAY AS MORE STABLE AIR MOVES IN.  MOISTURE DECREASES 
BY MONDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP ONLY LOW POPS IN FOR MONDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...HIGH PRESSURE BRINGS DRY 
WEATHER FOR TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.  GFS INDICATING ANOTHER FRONT 
ENTERING AREA ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY...WILL KEEP THE LOW POPS GOING.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 251953
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EST FRI MAR 25 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...ATMOSPHERE MARGINALLY UNSTABLE 
OVER THE MRX CWA THIS EVENING...HOWEVER...DON/T SEE GOOD TRIGGERING 
MECHANISM FOR CONVECTION. SO...HAVE LOWERED POPS A BIT FOR THE 
EVENING. RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY IN MODELS HAS BEEN POOR WITH DETAILS 
OF THE SERIES OF WAVES MOVING THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW. CURRENT RUN 
SHOWS A WEAK IMPULSE PROGGED INTO THE AREA TONIGHT...MAINLY JUST TO 
OUR NORTH. DIFFICULT SEEING THIS WAVE ON SATELLITE IMAGERY...MAY BE 
LOCATED OVER THE MID MS VALLEY PER IR. THE PROGGED TRACK SEEMS 
REASONABLE BASED ON MOVEMENT ON SAT IMAGERY...SO WILL KEEP SOME LOW 
POPS THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT. WE ONCE AGAIN DESTABILIZE SATURDAY 
AFTERNOON...BUT THE ATMOSPHERE IS MORE FAVORABLE FOR THUNDERSTORM 
DEVELOPMENT TO OUR SOUTH. THERE APPEAR TO BE A COUPLE OF WEAK WAVES 
IN THE UPPER FLOW TO INITIATE CONVECTION ON SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND 
EXPECT THIS TO SPREAD SCATTERED SHOWERS/THUNDERSTORMS INTO THE MRX 
CWA IN THE AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...A DEEP UPPER-LEVEL LOW 
OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL HELP DEVELOP A STRONG SURFACE LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY BY SATURDAY NIGHT. 
THIS SURFACE LOW WILL CREATE A STRONG WARM AIR ADVECTION PATTERN 
ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH...WHICH WILL PUSH A WARM FRONT NORTH TOWARD 
THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT. GFS AND NAM MODELS ARE NOW 
REVEALING SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THE TIMING OF THE SURFACE LOW AND 
THE RESULTING CONVECTION ALONG THE WARM FRONT ON SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
COLD FRONT ON SUNDAY. THE NAM MODEL IS NOW SLOWER WITH THE LOW AND 
DOES NOT GENERATE MUCH CONVECTION ALONG THE WARM FRONT SATURDAY 
NIGHT...BUT GENERATES A LARGE AREA OF CONVECTION ALONG THE COLD 
FRONT ON SUNDAY. THE GFS MODEL ON THE OTHER HAND TAKES THE OPPOSITE 
APPROACH AND DEVELOPS A LARGE AMOUNT OF CONVECTION ALONG THE WARM 
FRONT...BUT NOT MUCH ALONG THE COLD FRONT ON SUNDAY. WITH SUCH A 
DYNAMIC SYSTEM AND ITS ASSOCIATED STRONG WIND FIELDS...THINK THAT 
BOTH MODELS ARE RIGHT IN THAT CONVECTION WILL DEVELOP ALONG BOTH THE 
WARM AND COLD FRONTS. THEIR DIFFERENT CONVECTIVE PARAMETERIZATION 
SCHEMES IS LIKELY THE CULPRIT WITH THE OBSERVED DISCREPANCIES. BOTH 
MODELS INDICATE STRONG VEERING WIND PROFILES (RESULTING IN LARGE 
HELICITY VALUES) IN THE WARM SECTOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY. THIS 
WOULD SUGGEST THE POTENTIAL FOR ISOLATED TORNADOES ACROSS SOUTHEAST 
TN AND SOUTHWEST NC SATURDAY NIGHT...AND ALL OF THE FORECAST AREA ON 
SUNDAY. THE WILD CARD FOR THIS POSSIBLE SEVERE WEATHER EVENT STILL 
INVOLVES THE AMOUNT OF INSTABILITY EXPECTED SATURDAY NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY. HOWEVER...THE SHORT RANGE MODELS HAVE BEEN TRENDING TOWARD 
MORE INSTABILITY FOR THE FORECAST AREA WITH THIS SYSTEM...SO WILL 
PLAN TO REMOVE THE UNCERTAINTY WORDING IN THE SPECIAL WEATHER 
STATEMENT. 

A DEEP UPPER LOW WILL SLOWLY TRACK ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON 
MONDAY...PRODUCING ADDITIONAL CONVECTION THROUGH MONDAY EVENING. 
ANOTHER COLD FRONT WILL THEN APPROACH THE REGION ON THURSDAY... 
BRINGING ADDITIONAL CHANCES FOR CONVECTION. GFS MODEL INDICATES THAT 
A LOW PRESSURE AREA WILL DEVELOP ALONG THE FRONT BY FRIDAY OVER THE 
DEEP SOUTH...SO WILL KEEP A CHANCE OF RAIN THROUGH FRIDAY.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EST THU MAR 24 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...CLOUDS WILL CONTINUE TO DECREASE 
THROUGH THE EVENING. HOWEVER...A WEAK SHORT WAVE APPROACHING THE 
AREA LATE TONIGHT WILL AGAIN INCREASE CLOUD COVER BY MORNING. THIS 
WAVE WILL TRACK WELL TO OUR NORTH BUT LIMITED MOISTURE AND LIFT 
SHOULD PUSH IN...MAINLY OVER NORTHERN ZONES FOR SCATTERED SHOWERS 
FOR FRIDAY MORNING. THE ATMOSPHERE WILL BECOME MILDLY UNSTABLE 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON AS A SECONDARY WAVE SLIDES IN DIRECTLY BEHIND THE 
FIRST FOR CONTINUE SCATTERED SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORM ACTIVITY 
FRIDAY AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A COLD FRONT IS PROGGED 
TO BECOME QUASI-STATIONARY AROUND THE SOUTHERN TN BORDER FRIDAY 
NIGHT...AS THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMES ZONAL OVER THE REGION. A 
WEAK SHORT WAVE IS EXPECTED TO MOVE ALONG THIS BOUNDARY INTO THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY...BUT THE NAM AND GFS MODELS REVEAL DISAGREEMENTS WITH 
THE TIMING OF THIS FEATURE FOR SOMETIME FRIDAY NIGHT OR SATURDAY 
MORNING. THUS...WILL COMPROMISE AT THIS TIME AND MENTION A CHANCE OF 
TSTORMS THROUGH THE PERIOD SINCE A MARGINAL UNSTABLE AIRMASS WILL 
REMAIN IN PLACE OVER THE FORECAST AREA.
 
A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL LOW OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS ON SATURDAY WILL 
HELP DEVELOP A SURFACE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE LOWER MS RIVER 
VALLEY SATURDAY NIGHT. THIS SURFACE LOW WILL CAUSE THE QUASI- 
STATIONARY FRONT TO MOVE BACK NORTH ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AS A 
WARM FRONT SATURDAY NIGHT. STRONG UPPER DYNAMICS SHOULD HELP TO 
CREATE A LARGE AREA OF CONVECTION WITH THIS FRONT AS IT MOVES ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE THAT THERE WILL BE A LARGE AMOUNT 
OF HELICITY WITH THIS FRONT...BUT INSTABILITY APPEARS TO BE MARGINAL 
(AS HAS BEEN THE CASE WITH THE LAST FEW SYSTEMS). THUS...THE THREAT 
OF A SEVERE WX OUTBREAK FOR THE FORECAST AREA REMAINS UNCERTAIN. IF 
INSTABILITY CAN DEVELOP THIS FAR NORTH...THEN THERE IS CERTAINLY THE 
POTENTIAL FOR AN OUTBREAK. WILL PLAN TO REISSUE THE SPECIAL WEATHER 
STATEMENT CURRENTLY IN EFFECT...BUT WILL MENTION THE UNCERTAINTY IN 
THE DEVELOPMENT OF SEVERE WEATHER THIS WEEKEND. RIGHT NOW...IT 
APPEARS THAT THE MAIN SEVERE THREAT WOULD BE THE POTENTIAL FOR HEAVY 
RAINFALL SATURDAY NIGHT. A STRONG UPPER LOW (SIMILAR TO YESTERDAYS 
SYSTEM) WILL SLOWLY TRACK ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY 
PRODUCING ADDITIONAL LINGERING CONVECTION...WITH SHOWERS FINALLY 
EXITING THE REGION MONDAY NIGHT.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
412 AM EST THU MAR 24 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH 17 UTC FRIDAY)...
LARGE EXPANSE OF SC CLOUDS THIS MORNING...WILL LIKELY CONTINUE 
CLOUDY FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE MORNING EXCEPT POSSIBLY IN OUR NC 
COUNTIES WHERE DOWNSLOPING SHOULD BURN CLOUDS AWAY FASTER.  HAVE 
COOLED HIGH TEMPS ABOUT 1-2 DEGREES OVERALL TODAY...EXCEPT IN NC 
COUNTIES WHERE THE HIGHS HAVE BEEN RAISED 2-3 DEGREES.  IN HOURLY 
TEMP GRIDS...MADE DIRUNAL TEMP CURVE SLUGGISH THIS MORNING DUE TO 
CLOUD COVER...WITH RAPID WARM-UP THIS AFTERNOON AS CLOUDS ERODE.

FOR TONIGHT AND FRIDAY TILL NOON...AM GOING WITH LEADING SHORT WAVE 
AS THE MORE SIGNIFICANT ONE...INTRODUCING -SHRA LATE TONIGHT THAT 
TRACK QUICKLY ACROSS CWA.  HEIGHT OF ACTIVITY WITH THIS WAVE IS 
CENTERED AROUND 13Z.  AM LEAVING SOME POPS BEHIND THIS WAVE JUST IN 
CASE THE NEXT WAVE DIGS A LITTLE FARTHER SOUTH THAN FORECAST.  
TURNED OVER REST OF FRIDAY AND DEEP CONVECTION THREAT TO LONG TERM 
DESK.


.LONG TERM...(17 UTC FRIDAY THROUGH DAY 7)...
SOME INSTABILITY LINGERS FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...WITH 
WARM FRONT APPROACHING FROM THE SOUTH...AND ALSO A WEAK INVERTED 
SURFACE TROUGH AXIS NEARBY.  WITH AIRMASS DESTABILIZING IN THE 
AFTERNOON...MODELS SHOW SOME AREAS OF MOISTURE CONVERGENCE...AT 
LEAST IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS.  SINCE MAIN SHORTWAVE AND 
INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH AXIS ARE OVER NRN AREAS...ADJUSTED POPS UP 
TO REFLECT HIGHEST POPS NRN MOST AREAS (ALSO TO BLEND WITH HIGHER 
POPS OVER SE KY) AND LEAST CHANCES SRN AREAS.  WITH SURFACE 
BOUNDARIES NEARBY...AND POSSIBLE SHORTWAVE NOTED ON GFS FRIDAY 
NIGHT...KEPT AT LEAST SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING OVERNIGHT. 

TIMING THE STRONG SRN STREAM SHORTWAVE TROUGH/UPPER LOW OVER THE 
WEEKEND IS STILL TRICKY AT THIS POINT.  00Z GFS MODEL SEEMED TO BE A 
BIT FASTER THAN ETA/DGEX AS WELL AS ECMWF AND UKMET...SO I LOWERED 
THE POPS FOR EARLY SATURDAY...AND GAVE HIGHER CHANCES FOR SW AREAS 
DOWN TO LEAST CHANCES NE AREAS.  DID NOT WANT TO RAISE POPS 
DRAMATICALLY JUST YET FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY...BUT FELT THAT 
POPS COULD AT LEAST BE RAISED TO LIKELY FOR SE TN AND SW NC AREAS BY 
SATURDAY EVENING.  CONTINUED VERY HIGH CHANCE POPS FOR REST OF 
SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...AND WILL LET DAY SHIFT LOOK THIS OVER 
AGAIN AND MAKE MORE POP INCREASES IF TIMING BECOMES CLEARER.  IF 
SLOWER TRACK OF THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM PANS OUT...THEN HIGH POPS 
WILL BE NEEDED WELL INTO MONDAY MORNING.

OTHERWISE...PUT IN SOME PRELIMINARY NEW DAY 7 (THURSDAY) GRIDS FOR 
DAY SHIFT TO BUILD ON.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 PM EST WED MAR 23 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE OVER SOUTHERN WEST VA...WITH 
LOCAL RADARS REVEALING SOME SCATTERED CONVECTION MAINLY ACROSS 
NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. THIS CONVECTION SHOULD RAPIDLY 
DIMINISH AFTER SUNSET AND AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH EXITS THE REGION. 
A FEW LINGERING SHOWERS MAY REDEVELOP IN THE NORTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST VA MOUNTAINS OVERNIGHT IN ASSOCIATION WITH SOME UPSLOPE 
FLOW. WEAK HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS INTO THE REGION TOMORROW... 
BRINGING DRY AND TRANQUIL WEATHER CONDITIONS. A FEW SHOWERS MAY BE 
POSSIBLE FRIDAY MORNING OVER THE FORECAST AREA...AS CONVECTION 
DIMINISHES AHEAD A COLD FRONT OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY. THIS 
COLD FRONT WILL APPROACH THE FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...BRINGING A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS AND TSTORMS. WITH THE 
UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMING ZONAL ON FRIDAY...THIS FRONT SHOULD STALL 
OUT AROUND THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY NIGHT. WILL ONLY MENTION A SMALL 
CHANCE FOR CONVECTION FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND FRIDAY NIGHT...SINCE 
UPPER-LEVEL DYNAMICS WILL BE WEAK WITH MARGINAL INSTABILITY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...NRN STREAM S/WV RIPS E 
ACROSS THE GREAT LAKES EARLY ON SAT WHILE SRN STREAM BECOMES ACTIVE 
WITH AMPLIFICATION AND S/WV PRESSING NE FM SRN TX INTO THE LWR/MID 
MS VLY WITH INCREASING SW FLO ALOFT PROVIDING FOR SOME ISENTROPIC 
ASCENT AND EVEN A WM FNT MAKING ITS WAY N INTO THE FA DURING THE DAY 
SAT. GRADUALLY INCREASED POPS FM LOW TO HIGH CHC CATEGORY SAT INTO 
SAT NITE AND SUN AS MAIN UPR LOW (WITH POSSIBLE CLOSED CIRCULATION) 
DRIVES NE FM SRN TX INTO THE MID MS VLY BY MID DAY SUN AND MORE 
TOWARD EVENING IN THE TN VLY. SFC LOW MOVS E ACROSS TN VLY OF AL 
SUN/MON TIMEFRAME WHILE HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPR SYSTEM BUILDS ONLY 
SLOWLY E TO THE SRN/CNTRL APPALACHIANS BY 12Z MON. KEPT HIGH CHC 
POPS GOING WITH CONVECTION INCLUDED MUCH OF THE FA SAT/SUN AND THEN 
STARTED TO TAPER OFF POPS WITH SLOW EWD PROGRESSION OF STORM SYSTEM 
MON/MON NIGHT WITH A BIT OF WRAP AROUND PRECIP. UNSETTLED PATTERN 
COMES TO AN END WITH SFC THRU UPR LVL RIDGING WITH ASSOCIATED 
WARMING AS SW FLO GETS CRANKING ON THE BACK SIDE OF THIS FEATURE. 
MAX TEMPS HOLD CLOSE TO NORMAL THROUGH THE EXTENDED FCST WITH THE 
EXCEPTION OF SUN WHEN UPR TROF MAKES ITS MOVE TWD THE FA.  &&

.DISCUSSION...

AND NORTHEAST TN THIS AFTERNOON. WITH THIS LOW BRINGING MUCH COLDER 
AIR ALOFT...EXPECT REDEVELOPMENT OF CONVECTION THIS AFTERNOON AS 
INSTABILITY INCREASES...ESPECIALLY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND NORTHEAST 
TN. A CHANCE OF SEVERE TSTORMS STILL EXISTS ACROSS THE NORTHERN 
PORTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON...WITH THE POSSIBILITY 
OF MAINLY LARGE HAIL AS A RESULT OF THE COLDER TEMPS ALOFT.

HAVE ALREADY UPDATED THE ZONES TO REMOVE THE MENTION OF RAIN IN THE 
MORNING...AND TO MENTION THE EXPECTED REDEVELOPMENT OF CONVECTION 
THIS AFTERNOON.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
316 AM EST WED MAR 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...MAIN CONCERNS ARE FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT AS THE STRONG 
UPPER LOW...NOW SPINNING OVER MO/IL AREAS...CONTINUES TO MOVE EAST 
TODAY.  CONVECTION OVER MIDDLE TN HAS WEAKENED CONSIDERABLY... 
ALTHOUGH SHORTWAVE ROTATING AROUND THE UPPER LOW HAS HELPED DEVELOP 
AN AREA OF SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS...MOVING NORTHEAST FROM NRN GA 
ACROSS MOST OF E TN AND SW NC AT THIS TIME.  THIS CONVECTION 
WARRANTS HIGH POPS FOR AT LEAST THE EARLY MORNING HOURS...ALTHO THE 
THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS SEEMS VERY MINIMAL NOW.  

MOS POPS WERE MUCH HIGHER THAN OUR POP/WX GRIDS IN MOST AREAS FOR 
LATER TODAY...AND CONSENSUS FROM COORDINATION CHAT WAS TO GENERALLY 
RAISE POPS ACROSS THE AREA.  THINKING WAS THAT THE WARM LOW LEVELS 
PLUS COLD AIR ADVECTION ALOFT WITH UPPER LOW PASSAGE...WILL CREATE 
GOOD INSTABILITY FOR THIS AFTERNOON INTO THE EVENING HOURS.  SHORT 
RANGE MODELS IN AGREEMENT ON BEST LIFT AND COVERAGE ACROSS NE PLATEAU
...NE TN...AND SWRN VA FOR LATER TODAY AND EARLY TONIGHT.  HIGHEST 
POPS FOR THOSE AREAS...WITH SE TN/CHA PROBABLY THE LEAST COVERAGE 
AND LOWEST POPS.  IN FACT...A DRY SLOT NOTED ON WATER VAPOR PICS 
...POSSIBLY TEMPORARY FEATURE...WILL LIKELY BRING AN END TO THE 
CONVECTIVE PCPN OVER SE TN BEFORE DAYBREAK.  

MOS MAX TEMPS WERE WELL SHORT OF THE MARK YESTERDAY (AS MUCH AS 10 
TO 12 DEGREES LOW)...SO I TRENDED TOWARD THE WARMER ETA MOS HIGHS.
MIN TEMP FORECAST FOR TONIGHT WAS RAISED SLIGHTLY IN LINE WITH THE 
00Z MOS VALUES.  OTHERWISE...NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES MADE FOR TONIGHT 
THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT.  

HAD TO INCREASE POPS SLIGHTLY FOR FRIDAY AND FRIDAY NIGHT...MAINLY 
TO BETTER MESH WITH HIGHER POPS FROM JKL AND GSP.  STILL LOOKS LIKE 
THE BEST CHANCE OF MORE SHOWERS AND POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORMS WILL COME 
INTO PLAY BY SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY.  NO SOLID AGREEMENT YET ON 
LONG RANGE MODELS...BUT THE ECMWF/DGEX/GFS ALL DEVELOP A STRONG SRN 
STREAM SYSTEM AND WIDESPREAD PCPN AS EARLY AS SATURDAY NIGHT...BUT 
MORE LIKELY ON SUNDAY.  WILL LET DAYSHIFT LOOK THIS OVER IN MORE 
DETAIL TODAY AND MAKE ADJUSTMENTS AS NEEDED.

WEB PRODUCTS ISSUED AND ZFPMRX WILL FOLLOW SHORTLY.

.DISCUSSION...FIRST SHORT-WAVE HAS MOVED EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH

WEST AND SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA. SEVERE STORMS CONTINUE TO DEVELOP IN

SPC ISSUING A TORANDO WATCH FOR MOST OF ALABAMA. 

AIRMASS OVER MIDDLE TENNESSEE FAIRLY STABLE...SO DO NOT EXPECT ANY MAJOR
OUTBREAK OF SEVERE STORMS FOR THE FORECAST AREA. AN OUTSIDE CHANCE THAT 
A WEAKENING STORM MAY BE ABLE TO MAKE IT INTO THE PLATEAU AND SOUHEAST
TENNESSEE.  ISOLATED LARGE HAIL WILL BE MAIN POTENTIAL. HOWEVER...OVERALL
ONLY EXPECT SHOWERS WITH SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS LATER TONIGHT/WEDNESDAY
MORNING AS INCREASING QG FORCING RETURNS.

SUN/SUN NIGHT AS SYSTEM PUSHES SLOWLY E INTO THE CAROLINAS. UPR AND

CONSERVATIVE APPROACH TO TEMPS HOLDING CLOSE TO CLIMATOLOGY AT THIS 
EXTENDED TIME RANGE. NATIONAL/REGIONAL COORDINATION DISCARDED GFS IN 
FAVOR OF ECMWF FOR EXTENDED FORECAST.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
305 AM EST TUE MAR 22 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...STACKED UPPER LOW CURRENTLY OVER 
OKLAHOMA IS PROJECTED TO DRIFT EASTWARD THROUGH THE PERIOD AND BE 
CENTERED NEAR THE THE IL/IN BORDER BY 12Z WED. THIS FEATURE WILL BE 
RESPONSIBLE FOR GENERATING SCATTERED TO WIDESPREAD CONVECTION FOR 
THE FORECAST AREA AS IT ADVANCES. ANTICIPATE PRECIP TO COMMENCE IN 
THE SOUTHWESTERN PORTION OF THE FORECAST AREA BY MID-MORNING AND 
SLOWLY SPREADING ACROSS THE REMAINDER OF THE AREA BY MID-AFTERNOON 
WITH CATEGORICAL POPS EXPECTED OVER THE ENTIRE AREA BY 00Z 
WEDNESDAY. CAT POPS SPILL OVER INTO THE SECOND PERIOD...BUT POPS 
SHOULD TAPER TO CHANCE BY LATE IN THE PERIOD. INSTABILITY RATHER 
UNIMPRESSIVE FOR THE MOST PART...BUT HAVE INCLUDED THUNDER FOR THIS 
AFTERNOON AND OVERNIGHT AS UPPER FLOW BECOMES INCREASINGLY DIFLUENT. 
GENERALLY USED A BLEND OF GUIDANCE VALUES FOR TEMPS.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MINOR CHANGES MADE FOR 
WEDNESDAY WERE TO SLOW THE DECREASE OF POPS FOR WEDNESDAY MORNING.
SINCE THE UPPER LOW IS CLOSED OFF AND VERTICALLY STACKED (850 MB LOW 
BENEATH THE UPPER CENTER) THIS MORNING...DECIDED TO TREND MORE 
TOWARD THE NGM/ETA(NAM) SOLUTION OF A SLOWER EASTWARD PROGRESSION OF 
THE UPPER LOW.  EVEN THE FASTER GFS SOLUTION WOULD HAVE SOME PCPN 
LINGER WELL INTO WEDNESDAY MORNING...ESPECIALLY FOR SW VA AND NE TN 
AREAS.  LOCATION OF THE UPPER LOW AND SOME INSTABILITY FOR WEDNESDAY 
FAVORED KEEPING A MENTION OF THUNDERSTORMS AT LEAST FOR THE MORNING 
HOURS.

MAX TEMP FORECAST FOR WEDNESDAY WAS TRICKY...BUT CONSIDERING THAT 
CLOUDS AND PCPN WILL BE SLOWER TO EXIT THE REGION...FELT THAT A 
BLEND OF THE ETA AND MAV MOS WAS BEST CHOICE.  NGM MOS LOOKED TOO 
WARM FOR CHA AND TYS...UNLESS WE GET A DRY SLOT OVER THOSE AREAS AS 
THE UPPER LOW BEGINS TO LIFT NE OF THE REGION.  

OTHERWISE...NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES MADE FOR WEDS NIGHT OR THURSDAY.
TEMPS FOR THOSE PERIODS LOOK TO BE AT OR ABOVE CLIMO...GIVEN NO COLD 
AIR ADVECTION BEHIND OUR TUES/WEDS SYSTEM.  KEPT THE DRY FORECAST 
GOING UNTIL FRIDAY NIGHT.  THE TIMING OF ANY SYSTEMS FOR THE WEEKEND 
LOOKS UNCERTAIN...GIVEN DIFFERING MODEL SOLUTIONS.  SINCE THE LATEST 
GFS MODEL RUN DID NOT SUGGEST ANY MAJOR CHANGES FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS
...NONE WERE MADE AT THIS POINT FOR ANY PERIOD FROM FRIDAY AND 
BEYOND.

NIGHT.  FURTHER OUT...CONFIDENCE LOW WITH POOR AGREEMENT OF 
MODELS...WILL GENERALLY TRY TO FOLLOW HPC SOLUTION.  WILL GO DRY 
FRI...THEN NEXT SYSTEM BRINGS ANOTHER ROUND OF PRECIP FOR THE 
WEEKEND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
405 AM EST MON MAR 21 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...A WEAK SHORTWAVE/VORT MAX 
IS MOVING EAST ACROSS PARTS OF AL AND GA...PRODUCING A FEW WEAK 
RETURNS ON AREA RADARS.  THE WEAK RETURNS JUST TO OUR SOUTH APPEAR 
TO BE MAINLY MID TO HIGH CLOUDS...SO DID NOT MENTION ANY SPRINKLES 
OR CARRY LOW POPS FOR SE TN OR SW NC THIS MORNING. IN FACT...DECIDED 
TO REMOVE THE LOW POPS FOR ALL AREAS TODAY.

FOR TONIGHT THRU TUESDAY NIGHT...SHORT RANGE MODELS SEEM IN FAIR 
AGREEMENT ON SLOWING DOWN THE ONSET OF PCPN WITH THE DEVELOPING 
STRONG LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM...THAT MOVES INTO THE CENTRAL PLAINS AND 
LOWER MISS VALLEY REGION LATE TONIGHT AND TUESDAY.  FEEL THAT ANY 
MEASURABLE PCPN THRU 12Z TUESDAY WILL BE CONFINED TO JUST SE 
TN...BUT TO MESH WITH NEIGHBORS GRIDS...SOME SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW 
CHANCE POPS WERE CONTINUED FOR ABOUT THE SRN TWO THIRDS OF OUR 
FORECAST AREA (MAINLY LATE TONIGHT).  RAIN CHANCES WERE ALLOWED TO 
INCREASE OVER THE MORNING HOURS TUESDAY...WITH HIGHEST POPS 
JUSTIFIED FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING.  THERE ARE MINOR TIMING 
DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE GFS AND ETA/NAM...WITH THE GFS SLIGHTLY 
FASTER IN MOVING THE SURFACE LOW EAST...SO A COMPROMISE FAVORED 
KEEPING POPS RATHER HIGH FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND LINGERING CHANCE POPS 
FOR WEDNESDAY. 

CONCERNING THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS TUESDAY...APPEARS THAT THE BEST 
INSTABILITY WILL LIE TO OUR WEST AND ESPECIALLY SW NEARER TO THE 
WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY.  THUS...DAY 2 OUTLOOK HAS ONLY OUR WRN TWO 
THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA IN A SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE.  WILL 
ADDRESS THIS IN THE HWOMRX PRODUCT...BUT NOT INCLUDE ANY SEVERE 
WORDING IN THE ZFPMRX PRODUCT.  HOWEVER...PLENTY OF LIFT AND SOME 
INSTABILITY TO WARRANT THUNDERSTORMS FOR TUESDAY AFTERNOON...AND A 
LOT OF ELEVATED INSTABILITY TUESDAY NIGHT SO CARRIED THUNDERSTORMS 
FOR THAT PERIOD AS WELL.  

OTHERWISE...NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES MADE FOR WEDNESDAY.  THE SLOWER 
MOVEMENT OF THIS SYSTEM LED TO RAISING MIN TEMPS A GOOD BIT FOR 
TUESDAY NIGHT...IN LINE WITH LATEST MOS.  


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...NOT MUCH TO CHANGE 
IN THIS PART OF THE FORECAST. SLOWER TIMING OF TUESDAYS SYSTEM DOES 
NOT REALLY PUSH INTO LATE WEDNESDAY. HAVE UPPED POPS IN THE FAR TERM 
(NEXT WEEKEND) DUE TO MODELS DEPICTING ANOTHER SYSTEM WHERE ONCE 
THERE WAS NOT MUCH OF ONE, AND DUE TO SURROUNDING OFFICES HAVING 
SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS THAN WE. DID NOT MENTIONED THUNDER THIS FAR 
OUT. OTHERWISE, PRETTY STATUS QUO.

LATEST GFS MODEL RUN HAS TEMPS (ESPECIALLY 850 MB LEVEL) WARMER THAN 
PREVIOUS GRIDS FOR SATURDAY NIGHT...SO NEXT SHIFT MAY WANT TO RAISE 
MIN TEMPS SOME...MAINLY MTN ZONES WHERE PCPN WOULD APPEAR TO BE ALL 
LIQUID FOR THIS EVENT.

(NEXT WEEKEND) DUE TO MODELS DEPICTING ANOTHER SYSTEM WHERE ONCE 
THERE WAS NOT MUCH OF ONE, AND DUE TO SURROUNDING OFFICES HAVING 
SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS THAN WE. DID NOT MENTIONED THUNDER THIS FAR 
OUT. OTHERWISE, PRETTY STATUS QUO.
