FXUS64 KMRX 201939
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
228 PM EST SUN MAR 20 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...OF ETA AND GFS, ETA APPEARS A 
LITTLE QUICKER AND STRONGER ON SHORT DEVELOPING IN SOUTHERN PLAINS 
AND APPROACHING FORECAST AREA LATE MONDAY AFTERNOON/EARLY EVENING. 

VERY LEADING EDGE OF PRECIP ON ETA JUST ENTERS SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE
BY 00Z TUESDAY, WITH SFC-H5 RH TIGHT GRADIENT OVER AREA. HIGHEST RH
OBVIOUSLY OVER SE TN (FAR SW EDGE OF FORECAST AREA). EVEN THE GFS 
HAS A LITTLE RH IN THAT AREA, BUT NO PRECIP BY THEN. HAVE OPTED TO 
GO MORE WITH ETA AND KEEP WITH PREVIOUS PACKAGE GENERALLY THINKING
OF SLIGHT CHANCE TO VERY LOW CHANCE POPS IN SE TN FOR LATE MONDAY...
NO MENTION OF THUNDER DURING THAT TIME. HAVE INCREASED POPS EVERY 
SO SLIGHTLY IN THE EXTREME SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SOUTHERN 
TENNESSEE VALLEY LATE MONDAY TO BE MORE IN LINE WITH ADJACENT 
OFFICES. AS FOR TEMPS, HAVE KEPT MAINLY IN LINE WITH PREVIOUS PACKAGE
BUT DID RAISE MINS TONIGHT A HAIR WITH SOME CLOUDS ON THE WAY IN, 
AND FACT THAT TODAYS ACTUAL TEMPS WERE JUST A TAD HIGH. RAISED MAXES
MONDAY ALSO A LITTLE TO BE MORE IN LINE WITH THE BLEND MAXES.


.LONG TERM...THE BIG WEATHER MAKER FOR THIS FORECAST PERIOD IS TUESDAY
WHEN A STRONG NEGATIVELY TILTED TROF SWINGS THROUGH THE REGION BRING
RAINS BEGINNING EARLY TUESDAY MORNING.  THE BIG QUESTION IS HOW MUCH
CLEARING WILL OCCUR IN THE DRY SLOT TO ALLOW HEATING TUESDAY
AFTERNOON.  IF SUFFICIENT HEATING OCCURS THERE COULD BE SOME
SIGNIFICANT DESTABLIZATION AND A THREAT OF SEVERE WEATHER WITH
ISOLATED SUPER CELLS POSSIBLE.  ENOUGH UNCERTAINITY AT THIS TIME THAT
WE ARE NOT PUTTING SEVERE WORDING IN THE ZONES AT THIS TIME...HOWEVER
THERE IS A HAZARDOUS WEATHER OUTLOOK ISSUED THIS MORNING THAT COVERS
THE POSSIBLE THREAT.  

NEXT SHOT OF PRECIPITATION AFTER TUESDAY IS ON FRIDAY...HOWEVER AT
THIS TIME THIS DOES NOT APPEAR AS STRONG AS THE TUESDAY SYSTEM.
ANOTHER ROUND OF SHOWERS POSSIBLE ON SUNDAY...HOWEVER AGAIN THIS ONE
DOES NOT SEEM AS DYNAMIC AS TUESDAY.  GENERALLY USED THE BLEND
FORECAST NUMBERS FOR GUIDANCE.


&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 172029
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST THU MAR 17 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...LAST SHORTWAVE IN SWLY FLOW 
MOVING NORTHEAST TOWARD CWA.  STRONG SUBSIDENCE THAT HAS BEEN 
PRESSING ON THIS FEATURE ALL DAY FROM NORTHWEST IS TAKING ITS TOLL.  
COOLER CLOUD TOPS...< M17 DEG C...NOW ALL BUT FADED AWAY.  THERE 
HASNT BEEN ANY PRECIP WITH THIS FEATURE ALL DAY...AND EVEN THOUGH 
IT IS MOVING INTO AN ALMOST SATURATED AREA THINK THAT IT WONT BE 
ABLE TO GENERATE ANY MEANINGFUL PRECIP AS IT PASSES THROUGH THE AREA 
BETWEEN 22Z AND 01Z.  AFTER THIS WAVE PASSES...SUBSIDENCE TAKE OVER 
CLEARING SKIES THIS EVENING.  ALTHOUGH MOS GUIDANCE SAID NO FOG 
TONIGHT...WENT AHEAD AND MENTIONED LIGHT FOG IN TAF PRODUCTS DUE TO 
CLEARING SKIES...LIGHT WINDS...AND MOIST GROUND.

WARMED UP LOW TEMPS A DEG OR TWO IN NORTH...OTHERWISE FEW CHANGES IN 
TEMPS.  WILL FINALLY SEE SUN FOR FIRST TIME IN SEVERAL DAYS ON 
FRIDAY.

.LONG TERM...(FRI NIGHT THROUGH THU)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES CONTINUE 
IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH UPPER FLOW PATTERN. HOWEVER...TIMING 
INDIVIDUAL FEATURES IN RELATIVELY PROGRESSIVE PATTERN IS PROBLEMATIC 
AT BEST. SURFACE COLD FRONT PASSES THROUGH THE AREA ON SATURDAY PER 
MODEL CONSENSUS. GFS PROJECTS MINOR FEATURE TO PASS ALONG THE 
SOUTHERN TIER OF THE FORECAST AREA LATE SUNDAY AND EARLY MONDAY BUT 
NAM PROJECTS THIS FEATURE TO TRANSLATE ALONG THE GULF COAST. HAVE 
CONTINUED LOW POPS FOR THIS TIME FRAME FOR CONSISTENCY SAKE. A MORE 
SIGNIFICANT FEATURE APPROACHES LATE TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY. WENT WITH 
DRY FORECAST FOR DAY 7 (THURSDAY). FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY STAYED 
FAIRLY CLOSE TO GFS GUIDANCE VALUES WITH ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS 
BASED ON ENSEMBLES.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...A FAIRLY STRONG SHORT WAVE IS

IN EAST CENTRAL TENNESSEE AND MAINLY SNOW ACROSS THE NORTHERN ZONES 
AND EASTERN MOUNTAINS.  SNOW ACCUMULATION IS EXPECTED OVER HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS IN THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS WHERE A SNOW ADVISORY IS IN 
EFFECT.  WILL CONTINUE THIS ADVISORY EXCEPT FOR FAR SOUTHERN PORTION 
WHERE PRECIP IS BECOMING MORE ISOLATED TO SCATTERED.  SOME CONCERN 
FOR SNOW ACCUMULATION OVER SW VA AND THE NORTHERN PLATEAU...REPORTS 
GENERALLY HAVE MAINLY SNOW WITH LITTLE TO NO ACCUMULATION AS YET.  
FOR NOW WILL HOLD OFF ON ADVISORY AND MONITOR.  THE WAVE WILL 
EXIT THIS AFTERNOON AND PRECIP SHOULD END FROM SOUTHWEST TO 
NORTHEAST FOR MAINLY DRY CONDITIONS TONIGHT

.LONG TERM...(FRI THROUGH WED)...FRIDAY STILL LOOKS LIKE WE WILL BE 
BETWEEN SYSTEMS...SO WILL GO DRY.  WEAK COLD FRONT PUSHES IN ON 
SATURDAY.  MOISTURE AND LIFT DO NOT LOOK ALL THAT IMPRESSIVE WITH 
THIS SYSTEM...BUT STILL WORTH LIKELY POPS NORTH AND CHANCE SOUTH.  
THERMAL PROFILES INDICATE THIS SHOULD BE MAINLY RAIN...ALTHOUGH 
THERE MAY BE SOME SNOW AT THE ONSET OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  
DRIER AIR MOVES IN SAT NIGHT AND SUNDAY...SO AFTER SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS EARLY SAT NIGHT IN NORTHEAST...WILL GO DRY.  FURTHER 
OUT...MODEL CONSISTENCY HAS BEEN POOR...SO WITH HIGH LEVEL OF 
UNCERTAINTY WILL MAKE NO MAJOR CHANGES FOR NOW.

915 PM EST WED MAR 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
SOUTHEAST GEORGIA AND SOUTH CAROLINA COAST WITH AN INVERTED TROUGH 
OVER THE APPALACHIANS. A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE OVER THE 
OZARKS WILL MOVE TOWARD THE TN RIVER VALLEY OVERNIGHT...GENERATING 
ADDITIONAL LIGHT PRECIP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT. WITH 
TEMPS REMAINING ABOVE FREEZING ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA... 
THINK THAT MAINLY RAIN WILL OCCUR OVERNIGHT WITH POSSIBLY SOME SNOW 
TOWARDS SUNRISE. HOWEVER...WARM GROUND TEMPS WILL PREVENT ANY 
ACCUMULATIONS. ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET...SNOW 
WILL LIKELY DEVELOP EARLIER WITH SOME MINOR ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE.

CURRENT FORECAST SEEMS TO BE ON TRACK FOR THE MOST PART...BUT WILL 
UPDATE TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING. ALSO...PLAN TO EXPAND THE SNOW 
ADVISORY SOUTHWARD ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF EXTREME SOUTHEAST 
TN AND SOUTHWEST NC TO MATCH THE SURROUNDING OFFICES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
349 PM EST WED MAR 16 2005

.SHORT TERM...
SYSTEM FROM LAST NIGHT NOW TRYING TO EXIT NORTHEASTERN PART OF AREA 
AS NEXT SYSTEM HEADING TOWARD US.  TRICKY SITUATION OVERNIGHT 
TONIGHT AS FAST-MOVING SYSTEM CROSSES AREA WITH LIGHT PRECIP.  
MODELS SHOW AIR MASS COOLING FAIR AMOUNT TONIGHT TO ALLOW PRECIP TO 
TURN OVER TO SNOW OVER MUCH OF AREA...BUT MODELS HAVE BEEN RUNNING A 
LITTLE COOL OVERALL ON SYSTEMS.  ALSO WITH WARM BOUNDARY LAYER AND 
VERY WET SURFACE...THINK THAT MOST OF THE SNOW THAT FALLS WONT DO 
MUCH TO ROADS ETC.  

THINKING THAT HEAVIEST SNOWS WOULD FALL IN EASTERN AREAS EVEN 
WITHOUT THE MOUNTAINS...SO THINK THERE WILL BE A TIGHT GRADIENT OF 
SNOWS INTO THE SMOKIES AND SOUTH APPS.  WILL PLAN ON ADVISORY FOR 
EASTERN MOUNTAINS...FROM SMOKIES NORTHWARD. LOOKS LIKE MOST OF 
PRECIP WILL EXIT AREA BY AROUND 18Z ON THURSDAY.

COULD SEE SNOWS AS FAR SOUTH AS SIGNAL MOUNTAIN W OF KCHA...NEAR TYS 
AS WELL...BUT THINK THAT IMPACT IN THOSE AREAS WILL BE MINIMAL DUE 
TO REASONS MENTIONED ABOVE.

WARMED UP TEMPS OVERNIGHT ACROSS THE AREA...AND HAVE MADE VERY 
SLUGGISH RISE TO TEMPS ON THURSDAY.

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SEVERAL MORE WAVES 
HEADED OUR WAY IN MAINLY ZONAL FLOW THROUGH THE PERIOD...WITH TIMING 
ON ANY ONE WAVE DIFFICULT TO DO.  IT DOES APPEAR THAT FRIDAY WILL BE 
DRY...BUT AS OF SATURDAY AFTERNOON RIGHT THROUGH NEXT 
WEDNESDAY...THERE IS A CHANCE OF RAIN EACH PERIOD.  OF COURSE, IT 
WONT RAIN IN EACH OF THESE PERIODS...BUT RIGHT NOW IT IS IMPOSSIBLE 
TO RULE ANY ON ONE OF THEM OUT.  TEMPERATURES WILL BE MILD...NEAR OR 
ABOVE AVERAGE FROM SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY.  THERE IS VERY LITTLE 
CHANCE OF SNOW DURING THE PERIOD...WITH THE ONLY MENTIONABLE CHANCE 
IN SOUTHWEST VA AND THE NORTHERN MTNS OF EAST TENN FOR THURSDAY 
NIGHT...AND EVEN THEN THERE SHOULD BE VIRUTALLY NO ACCUMULATIONS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EST WED MAR 16 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION 
CONTINUES OVER THE MRX CWA THIS MORNING IN RESPONSE TO A LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKING ACROSS THE GULF COAST NORTHEAST INTO THE 
CAROLINAS.  CURRENT TRACK WILL TAKE THE MAIN FORCING AND MOISTURE TO 
OUR EAST.  HOWEVER...STILL EXPECT DECENT PRECIP OVER THE AREA.  
PRECIP TYPE REMAINS THE MAIN QUESTION.  CURRENT REPORTS INDICATE 
SNOW OVER VA ZONES AND MUCH OF THE NORTH AND CENTRAL MOUNTAINS.  
RAIN MAINLY THROUGH THE VALLEY AND PLATEAU AREAS WITH A MIX OF RAIN AND 
SLEET...AND SOME SNOW IN THE NORTH.  THIS PRECIP BREAKDOWN IS 
EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING HOURS...SNOW AND 
SLEET SHOULD DIMINISH OVER LOWER ELEVATIONS FROM SOUTH TO NORTH 
THROUGH THE MORNING.  THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS SHOULD CONTINUE TO SEE 
MAINLY SNOW WITH OCCASIONAL SLEET MIXED IN.  CURRENT ADVISORIES AND 
WARNINGS LOOK REASONABLE AND WILL CONTINUE THEM.  THE SYSTEM WILL 
EXIT THE REGION THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING WITH ANOTHER WEAKER SYSTEM 
NUDGING INTO OUR SOUTHERN AND EASTERN ZONES TONIGHT.  WITH 
THIS...EXPECT MAINLY RAIN SOUTH AND SNOW NORTH AND HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS.  SNOW AMOUNTS WILL BE LIGHT OVER HIGHER TERRAIN... 
GENERALLY LESS THEN 2 INCHES EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM...(THU THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS HAVE TRENDED DRIER FOR 
THURSDAY...ESPECIALLY NAM.  SHORT WAVE ENERGY TO MOVE ACROSS THE 
AREA...BUT APPEARS MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL BE LIMITED.  WILL GO WITH 
LIKELY POPS SOUTH...CHANCE NORTH AND CENTRAL. THERMAL PROFILES 
SUGGEST BOUNDARY LAYER WILL BE WARM ENOUGH FOR MUCH OF THIS TO BE 
RAIN...WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF SNOW IN THE VALLEYS MAINLY EARLY IN 
THE DAY.  HIGHER ELEVATIONS MAY STAY SNOW ALL DAY...BUT AMOUNTS 
SHOULD BE LIMITED.  THIS SYSTEM SHOULD EXIT BY THU NIGHT...SO DRY 
THU NIGHT AND FRIDAY. WEAK COLD FRONT TO APPROACH SATURDAY...BUT 
DOES NOT LOOK LIKE A BIG RAIN MAKER AT THE MOMENT.  APPEARS ANY 
PRECIP FOR LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY WILL BE MAINLY RAIN. GFS 
TRYING TO BRING RAIN BACK IN FOR SUNDAY...FOR NOW WILL JUST ADD A 
SLIGHT CHANCE TO SUNDAY NIGHT AND LET DAY SHIFT TAKE ANOTHER LOOK.  
WILL GENERALLY LEAVE LATER PERIODS AS THEY ARE FOR NOW.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
310 PM EST TUE MAR 15 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE MIDWEST...BRINGING A COLD NORTHEAST 
SURFACE FLOW INTO THE FORECAST AREA. SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL 
SPREAD A WARM AND MOIST AIRMASS ACROSS THE REGION TONIGHT FROM A 
DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE GULF OF MEXICO. IT APPEARS 
THAT THE BATTLE GROUND BETWEEN THE WARM AND COLD AIR MASSES WILL BE 
ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. NAM AND GFS MODELS INDICATE 
SOME DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THEIR VERTICAL THERMAL PROFILES FOR TONIGHT 
AND TOMORROW MORNING...WITH THE NAM MODEL REVEALING A MORE NORTHERLY 
SURGE OF ABOVE-FREEZING AIR AROUND 700 MB INTO THE REGION. THIS WILL 
COMPLICATE MATTERS BY CREATING THE POSSIBILITY OF A WINTRY MIXTURE 
OF PRECIP TYPES ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. WILL 
TREND THE FORECAST TOWARD THE NAM MODEL WHICH HAS BEEN MORE ACCURATE 
THAN THE GFS WITH WINTER WEATHER THIS SEASON. WITH THIS IN MIND... 
EXPECT MAINLY SNOW ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND THE NORTHEAST TN 
MOUNTAINS WHERE SNOWFALL ACCUMULATIONS WILL LIKELY EXCEED WARNING 
CRITERIA. HOWEVER...SOME SLEET AND FREEZING RAIN MAY BE POSSIBLE AS 
WELL WITH THE WARM 700 MB LAYER ALOFT. ACROSS THE CENTRAL AREAS... 
THINK MAINLY RAIN WILL DEVELOP IN THE VALLEYS WITH SLEET AND SNOW 
MIXED IN AT TIMES AFTER MIDNIGHT AND EARLY TOMORROW MORNING. THIS 
WARM LAYER ALOFT WILL LIKELY CAUSE PRECIP TO FALL IN MANY FORMS 
ACROSS THE SMOKIES WHERE WARNING CRITERIA ACCUMULATIONS MAY HAVE A 
HARD TIME DEVELOPING. THUS...WILL GO WITH A WINTER WX ADVISORY FOR 
THE SMOKIES...AND FOR THE NORTHERN PLATEAU WILL JUST MENTION THE 
POSSIBILITY OF AROUND AN INCH OF ACCUMULATIONS. MODELS INDICATE THAT 
THIS SYSTEM WILL QUICKLY EXIT THE REGION BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON.


.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES 
ARE IN GENERAL AGREEMENT WITH THE UPPER AIR FLOW THROUGH THE 
PERIOD...ALTHOUGH EXACT TIMING OF INDIVIDUAL EVENTS WILL BE 
PROBLEMATIC. ANOTHER SHORT WAVE TROUGH IS PROJECTED TO APPROACH THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WEDNESDAY NIGHT. ALTHOUGH QPFS ARE PROJECTED 
TO BE RELATIVELY LIGHT...THICKNESS VALUES SUGGEST POTENTIAL FOR SOME 
SNOW...ESPECIALLY OVER THE NORTHERN TIER AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS. 
HOWEVER...SHORT RANGE ENSEMBLES DEPICT A RATHER WIDE 
VARIABILITY...SO CONFIDENCE IN PRECIP TYPE IS LOW AT THIS TIME. THIS 
SYSTEM MOVES OUT BY LATE THURSDAY AND IS FOLLOWED BY WEAK SHORT WAVE 
RIDGING ON FRIDAY. A SURFACE COLD FRONT APPROACHES ON SATURDAY AND 
QUICKLY MOVES OUT BY LATE IN THE DAY PER MODEL CONSENSUS. REMAINDER 
OF WEEKEND LOOKS DRY BEFORE ANOTHER SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM 
APPROACHES ON MONDAY. A WARMING TREND IMPLIES AN ALL RAIN EVENT WITH 
THIS SYSTEM HOWEVER. FOR TEMPS...GENERALLY WENT WITH BLEND OF GFS 
AND ENSEMBLE GUIDANCE VALUES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
334 AM EST TUE MAR 15 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...WEAK HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
PROVIDE DRY AND SEASONAL CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON.  HOWEVER...THE 
WEATHER PATTERN WILL CHANGE TONIGHT.  A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM TRACKING 
ALONG THE GULF COAST WILL ROTATE OUR WIND FIELD TO THE NORTH AND 
NORTHEAST.  THIS CIRCULATION WILL PULL IN A COOLER AIR MASS.  
ADDITIONALLY...THE LOW WILL CIRCULATION A DEEP LAYER OF LOW TO MID 
LEVEL MOISTURE INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION.  ADDED DYNAMICS 
FROM AN UPPER LEVEL WAVE WILL AID LIFT...CREATING SUFFICIENT 
CONDITIONS FOR WIDESPREAD PRECIPITATION.  THE FAR SOUTHERN ZONES 
SHOULD REMAIN ALL RAIN...THE CENTRAL TENNESSEE VALLEY AND NORTHERN 
CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WILL SEE A MIX OF RAIN...SNOW AND SLEET...WITH 
SNOW AMOUNTS IN THESE LOCATIONS EXPECTED TO BE LESS THAN 2 INCHES.  
THE REMAINDER OF THE CWA HAS THE POTENTIAL FOR SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL 
WITH 3 TO 5 INCHES POSSIBLE AT LOWER ELEVATIONS AND 4 TO 7 INCHES 
OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  FOR THESE AREAS A WINTER STORM WATCH HAS BEEN 
ISSUED.  THE SYSTEM WILL EXIT THE AREA AND PRECIP SHOULD END FROM 
WEST TO EAST WEDNESDAY LATE MORNING INTO THE AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM...(WED NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MODELS DEPICT SIGNIFICANT
SHORT WAVE TO MOVE ACROSS THE AREA THURSDAY.  NAM COLDER WITH THIS 
SYSTEM THAN THE GFS...AND HAS THE PRECIP FURTHER NORTH.  WILL 
GENERALLY GO WITH A BLEND FOR NOW...WHICH STILL WOULD ALLOW FOR 
ANOTHER ROUND OF SNOW IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS...AND POSSIBLY SOME 
SNOW IN THE MIX FOR VALLEY AREAS.  WILL GO WITH LIKELY POPS ALL BUT 
SOUTH...WHERE WILL GO 80 POPS FOR THURSDAY.  NEXT PRECIP EVENT FOR 
THE WEEKEND LOOKS LIKE IT SHOULD BE MAINLY RAIN.  WILL GENERALLY 
LEAVE LATER PERIODS ALONE FOR NOW.

ACROSS THE WESTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE MOUNTAINS THIS AFTERNOON...BUT 
THINK THESE CLOUDS SHOULD CONTINUE TO SLOWLY DIMINISH TONIGHT. HIGH 
CLOUDS AHEAD OF ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM DEVELOPING OVER THE 
WESTERN GULF COAST WILL SPREAD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TOMORROW. 
WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR A SHOWER ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF 
THE FORECAST AREA TOMORROW AFTERNOON...AS A WEAK SHORT WAVE CROSSES 
THE REGION.


.LONG TERM...BIGGEST CHALLENGE IS TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.  
FAIRLY LARGE PRECIPITATION SYSTEM MOVING NORTHWARD ACROSS THE REGION 
DURING THIS PERIOD.  ETA HAS THIS MAINLY AS SNOW ACROSS SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA...AND MTNS OF NORTHEAST TENNESSEE WHILE GFS MIXES THIS WITH 
RAIN AND HOLDS LOWER AMOUNTS.  WILL ISSUE AN SPS TO COVER THIS EVENT 
FOR NOW AS UNCERTAINTY ENOUGH TO HOLD OFF ON EITHER WATCH/WARNING OR 
ADVISORY.  

BIG DIFFERENCE WITH THE POTENTIAL SYSTEM ON THURSDAY AS WELL WITH 
GFS SHOWING A FAIRLY LARGE RAIN EVENT WHILE ETA NEARLY DRY.  HELD 
THE MIDDLE GROUND WITH 40-50 POPS ON THIS EVENT.

CURRENT TREND CONTINUES WITH MODELS INDICATING OTHER POTENTIAL 
RAINERS EVERY FEW DAYS.

IN THE AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...FAST UPPER FLOW WILL CONTINUE

ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. NAM SHOWS AN INVERTED
TROUGH ACROSS THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS MONDAY NIGHT WITH INCREASING BOUNDARY
LAYER MOISTURE INTO WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA AND GEORGIA MOVING INTO THE
FAR EASTERN SOUTHEAST SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA TOWARD TUESDAY MORNING.

THE BOUNDARY LAYER MOISTURE WILL ADVECT NORTH INTO THE REST OF THE FORECAST
AREA TUESDAY. INCREASING INSENTROPIC LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH CYCLOGENSIS OVER
THE CENTRAL GULF COAST STATES WILL BEGIN TO DEVELOP RAIN OVER THE SOUTHERN
SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA TUEDAY AFTERNOON.  AS SURFACE LOW CONTINUES
TO DEVELO SOUTH...MOISTURE WILL CONTINUE TO BE PULLED NORTH INTO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WITH RAIN LIKELY AREA-WIDE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH 
MOST OF WEDNESDAY. TIMING OF WHEN PRECIPITATION MOVES EAST DIFFICULT WITH
MODELS HAVING VARYING SOLUTIONS. WILL EXPECT PRECIPITATION TO END THURSDAY
AND THURSDAY NIGHT NORTHEAST SECTIONS.  RAIN MAY CHANGE TO SNOW OVER THE HIGHER
ELEVATIONS BEFORE ENDING.

LATEST GFS SHOWS ANOTHER SYSTEM FOR LATE FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...BUT CONFIDENCE
AGAIN LOW DUE TO POOR MODEL CONTINUITY. WILL KEEP NEXT WEEKEND DRY FOR NOW.

TO NO POPS FOR CHA AREA.

FRONTALGENSIS AND ISENTROPIC LIFT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. HAVE UPPED POPS

MONDAY MORNING.

SNOW FOR PARTS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE.  MAY BE SOME
LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS...BUT WILL NOT HIGHLIGHT YET.  LATER SHIFTS MAY NEED TO 
ISSUE AN ADVISORY FOR THE EVENT.

ALLOWING WEAK RIDGING TO BUILD OVER THE FORECAST AREA.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS AND 
ENSEMBLES ARE NOT IN VERY GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE PERIOD AS 
PROGRESSIVE PATTERN CONTINUES. ECMWF DEPICTS A CLOSED UPPER 
CIRCULATION DEVELOPING OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS BY 00Z FRIDAY. THIS 
FEATURE IS PROJECTED BY ECMWF TO PROGRESS TO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS BY 00Z SATURDAY. THIS FEATURE IS NOT DEPICTED BY EITHER 
GFS OR CANADIAN GEM. THUS HAVE CHOSEN TO DISCOUNT ECMWF SOLUTION AT 
THIS TIME...BUT CONFIDENCE IS NOT HIGH. GFS DEPICTS GENERALLY DRY 
WEATHER WITH THE EXCEPTION OF LATE WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY. HAVE NOT 
MADE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO PREVIOUS FORECAST/GRIDS WITH RESPECT 
TO THIS EVENT. GENERALLY WENT WITH A BLEND OF GFS AND ENSEMBLE 
GUIDANCE FOR TEMPS.

SPECIAL DISCUSSION FOR MEDIA...
TRYING TO GET A REAL-TIME HANDLE ON SITUATION FOR THE CLIPPER LATE 
TONIGHT.  TRACKING THE MAIN SHORT WAVE...THE LEADING EDGE OF 
ENHANCED CLOUDS IS JUST NOW OVER KSTL AND MOVING AT ABOUT 120 
DEGREES AT 50 KT.

EXTRAPOLATION OF SATELLITE TIMING...
LEADING EDGE LIFT...KTYS AROUND 1AM...KTRI AROUND 3AM.
AXIS OF LIFT...KTYS AROUND 2-3AM...KTRI AROUND 5-6AM.
BACK EDGE OF LIFT...KTYS AROUND 5-6AM...KTRI AROUND 8AM.

MODELS VERY CLOSE ON THIS TIMING...MAYBE A LITTLE SLOW.

ALSO LATEST MODEL RUNS HINTING THAT STRONG WARM ADVECTION WILL BE 
OCCURRING WITH THE APPROACH OF THIS SHORTWAVE.  AT KTYS...PRECIP 
TYPE SHOULD BE MAINLY SNOW THIS EVENING...BUT LOOKING LIKE KTYS 
PRECIP LATE TONIGHT WITH THE CLIPPER MAY BE MOSTLY RAIN...AND THERE 
PROBABLY WONT BE MUCH PRECIP ANYWAY.  KTRI STILL LOOKS GOOD FOR 
PRECIP TYPE AS SNOW THROUGHOUT THE NIGHT AND BETTER CHANCES OF 
PRECIP AS WELL.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
254 PM EST FRI MAR 11 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)..A SHORT-WAVE MOVING EAST ACROSS
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ALONG WITH COLD AIR ALOFT HAS PRODUCED NUMEROUS 
SHOWERS OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON.  DUE TO THE LOW WBZ...REPORTS
OF SMALL HAIL...SLEET AND SNOW HAVE BEEN REPORTED WITH THE SHOWERS.  AS THE
TEMPEATURE PROFILE CONTINUES TO COOL OFF REST OF TODAY...PRECIPITATION WILL
FALL MORE IN THE FORM OF SNOW WITH ACCUMULATING SNOWS POSSIBLE ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND MOUNTAINS OF EAST TENNESSEE.

NEXT SHORT-WAVE IS STILL PROGGED FOR TONIGHT (AFTER MIDNIGHT). STRENGTHENING
BOUNDARY LAYER JET WITH 850 MB WINDS APPROACHING 50 KNOTS AGAIN OVERNIGHT.
THE LOW LEVEL SOUTHWESTERLY JET WILL INCREASE THE ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE
REGION...ESPECIALLY OVER THE NORTHERN THIRD OF THE REGION. A SWATCH OF MODERATE
SNOW WILL MOVE ACROSS SOUTWHEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...SO WILL
ISSUE A HEAVY SNOW WARNING THERE THROUGH NOON SATURDAY.

WILL ISSUE A SNOW ADVISORY FOR THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS GIVEN CURRENT SNOW SHOWER
ACTIVITY...BUT WILL END ADVISORY FOR THE MOUNTAINS BY 4 AM AS MOST OF THE 
ACTIVITY FROM SECOND WAVE WILL GO NORTH.

ELSEWHERE (TYS AND CHA)...A MIXTURE OF RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS ARE ANTICIPATED
WITH ONLY LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE FOR CENTRAL VALLEY AND SOUTHERN PLATEAU.

STRONG SOUTHWEST WINDS SATURDAY OVER MOST OF TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST NORTH
CAROLINA WILL ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM NICELY TOMORROW.

ANOTHER WAVE AND COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA SATURDAY NIGHT AND AGAIN
SUNDAY NIGHT...SO HAVE KEPT A CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION GOING FOR THOSE PERIODS. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...TROUGH OVER THE ROCKIES 
MOVES EAST AND RIDGING OVER THE SOUTHEAST STATES BREAKS DOWN. A 
SYSTEM DEVELOPING IN THE CENTRAL PLAINS STATES WILL MOVE THROUGH THE 
SOUTHEAST THURSDAY AND OFF THE EAST COAST FRIDAY. THE LONG RANGE GFS 
BRINGS A DEVELOPING SURFACE LOW WITH THIS SYSTEM ACROSS THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY INTO EASTERN KY THURSDAY. THIS MAY BRING STRONG 
WINDS TO THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES WILL BE CLOSER TO NORMAL 
WITH HIGHS IN THE 50S TO MID 60S. CLOUDS AND RAIN SHOULD KEEP LOWS 
MOSTLY IN THE 40S.

.DISCUSSION...A COLD FRONT MOVING SLOWLY EAST TOWARD THE FORECAST AREA THIS
MORNING WITH A GOOD DEAL OF CONVECTION OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST
TENNESSEE DUE TO COLD AIR ALOFT ADVECTING INTO THE REGION.  EVEN THOUGH 
SURFACE TEMPERATURES ARE ABOVE FREEZING AREA-WIDE...FREEZING LEVEL IS LOW
ENOUGH COMBINED WITH MIXING FROM CONVECTION TO PRODUCE PERIODS OF MODERATE
TO HEAVY SNOW OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. WISE COUNTY ALREADY REPORTING AN 
INCH OF SNOW. LOCALIZED ADVISORY CRITERIA SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ANTICIPATED
REST OF TODAY OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSE MOUNTAINS...
HOWEVER...DO NOT EXPECT WIDESPREAD ACCUMULATION TO WARRANT AN ADVISORY
FOR NOW.

PLAN 0N UPPING POPS MOST LOCATIONS FOR TODAY DUE TO INCREASING CONVECTIVE
DEVELOPMENT.  MSAS SHOWS LIFTED INDICES GENERALLY ABOVE ZERO...SO THUNDER 
CHANCE LOW. WOULD NOT RULE OUT THE POSSIBILITY OF AN ISOLATED THUNDERSTORM...
BUT WILL NOT INCLUDE IN FORECAST. SMALL HAIL/SLEET IS ALSO A POSSIBILITY
GIVEN THE LOW WBZ.

TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT THIS AFTERNOON...SO WILL ALSO CONTINUE LAKE WIND
ADVISORY.

WILL CONTINUE TO EVALUATE THE POSSIBILITY OF UPPING WATCH TO A WARNING
FOR THIS AFTERNOON.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EST FRI MAR 11 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DIFFICULT FORECAST THIS PACKAGE  
AS MODELS INDICATE POSSIBILITY OF ACCUMULATING SNOW FOR AT LEAST 
NORTHERN AREAS TONIGHT.  COLDER AIR TO PUSH IN TODAY...AND WILL SEE 
SOME RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTH.  SOME OF THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS MAY SEE SOME MINOR ACCUMULATION TODAY. GUSTY WINDS 
WILL CONTINUE WITH DECENT GRADIENT...WILL KEEP LAKE WIND ADVISORY 
AND EXTEND IT INTO TONIGHT.  REAL ACTION TONIGHT PRECIP WISE...AS 
UPPER TROUGH DIGS INTO THE AREA ALONG WITH SECOND SURGE OF COLD 
AIR.  LOOKS LIKE PRECIP WILL BE LIMITED IN THE SOUTH...WITH HIGHER 
AMOUNTS NORTH AND MOUNTAINS...WHERE UPSLOPE WILL ENHANCE.  THERMAL 
PROFILES INDICATE SNOW FOR HIGHER TERRAIN...AND CHANGING TO SNOW 
ELSEWHERE.  THINK IT WILL MOVE IN AND OUT FAIRLY FAST...SO NOT 
CONFIDENT OF 4 INCHES IN THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND NORTHERN 
VALLEY.  WILL DOWNGRADE TO ADVISORY THERE.  WILL CONTINUE WATCH FOR 
NORTHERN AND CENTRAL MOUNTAINS AND SW VA. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...RAPIDLY MOVING S/WV 
CONTINUES TO PRODUCE SOME ACCUMULATING SNOW IN WATCH AREA SAT 
MORNING WITH MEAN RH DECREASING FAIRLY QUICKLY THROUGH THE MORNING 
ALLOWING EXPIRATION OF WINTER STORM WATCH HERE. NEXT S/WV SHIFTS SE 
THROUGH THE UPPER MIDWEST SAT NIGHT INTO SUNDAY WITH SFC WAVE MOVING 
E INTO THE TN VLY. USED 40-50 PERCENT POPS NRN HALF OF THE FA 
TAPERING TO SLGT CHC SRN THIRD FOR -SHRA MOST OF THE FA 
HOWEVER...HAD TO INCLUDE -SHSN MAINLY HIGHER TERRAIN. MAINTAINED 
SLGT CHC POP THROUGH SUNDAY AS SFC WAVE SHIFTS SLOWLY S AND E INTO 
THE EVENING HOURS. ITS ALMOST HARD TO BELIVE THAT A COUPLE OF MODEL 
RUNS IN ROW WOULD HAVE AND EXTENDED DRY PERIOD OF TWO DAYS IN A 
ROW BUT WILL TRY TO KEEP THE DRY PERIOD GOING MON/TUE AND MAINTAIN 
SLGT CHC POPS FOR WED AS WARMER AIR TRIES TO MAKE A RETURN ALONG 
WITH SUFFICIENT MOISTURE/LIFT WITH SRN STREAM SYSTEM MOVING INTO THE 
MS VLY MIDWEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1010 PM EST THU MAR 10 2005

INTERESTING SCENARIO STILL TO PLAY OUT OVER NEXT 30-36 HOURS AS WEAK 
SYSTEMS MOVE ACROSS AREA.

FOR REST OF NIGHT HAVE BACKED OFF POPS BY 10-20% OVERALL...AND WITH 
WARM ADVECTION HAVE MADE ALMOST ALL THE PRECIP TYPE AS LIQUID.  
AFTER DAYBREAK SOME COOLER AIR FILTERS INTO REGION AND SHOULD ALLOW 
SOME SNOW AGAIN...ESPECIALLY OVER PLATEAU.  HAVE WARMED LOW TEMPS 
OVERNIGHT BY 1-3 DEGREES ACROSS THE AREA.  

OTHER BITS...TRACKED MAIN AXIS OF LIFT IN MODELS FRIDAY 
NIGHT...LOOKS LIKE WHEN IT MOVES THROUGH AREA IT WILL BE MOVING 
ABOUT 60 MPH...SO LOOKS LIKE INTENSE PRECIP EPISODE WILL BE LIMITED 
TO JUST A COUPLE OF HOURS...OTHERWISE UNSTABLE AIR MASS WILL BE ABLE 
TO KEEP SHOWER ACTIVITY OFF/ON.

MAY BE A PRETTY GOOD GRADIENT OF SNOW N TO S FRIDAY NIGHT AS EXTREME 
NORTH PART OF AREA WILL LIKELY BE ALL SNOW...BUT MAY BE TRENDING 
TOWARD MORE IN THE WAY OF RAIN FROM TYS TO THE SOUTH FOR EVENT.  
PRESENT WATCH AREA STILL LOOKS LIKE GREATEST THREAT.

STILL LOOKS PRETTY GUSTY THROUGH THIS SAME TIME PERIOD.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
336 PM EST THU MAR 10 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...CLOUDS ARE INCREASING AHEAD OF 
NEXT SHORTWAVE DIVING SOUTH THROUGH THE MS VALLEY THIS AFTERNOON. 
WINDS ARE ALSO INCREASING. DEEP SURFACE LOW WITH THIS NEXT SYSTEM 
OVER WISCONSIN IS HEADED SOUTHEAST TOWARD THE PA AND NY FRIDAY. AS 
SURFACE PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENS UP. WILL NEED TO ISSUE LAKE WIND 
ADVISORY FOR THE SECOND HALF OF TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY. TEMPERATURES 
THIS AFTERNOON RANGE FROM AROUND 40 NORTH TO THE LOWER 50S SOUTH. 
DEWPOINTS ARE IN THE MID TEENS TO MID 20S. EXPECTING THE WINDS TO 
KEEP TEMPERATURES UP TONIGHT WITH RAIN SHOWERS DEVELOPING LATE OVER 
THE NORTHERN TWO THIRDS. HIGHER ELEVATIONS COULD SEE A LITTLE SNOW 
MIXED IN AND THEN ACCUMULATING TO UP TO AROUND AN INCH BY MORNING AS 
TEMPERATURES DROP. BELIEVE STRONG SOUTHWEST FLOW WILL KEEP 
TEMPERATURES UP ENOUGH FRIDAY SO ACCUMULATIONS WILL ONLY BE AT THE 
HIGHEST ELEVATIONS ABOVE 4000 FEET. BEST CHANCE OF ACCUMULATING SNOW 
WILL BE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. FOLLOWED THE 
COOLER MET NUMBERS FOR LOWS TONIGHT AND COOLER MAV NUMBERS FOR 
HIGHS.          

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MAIN CONCERN IS STRONG SHORT-WAVE
DIGGING SOUTHEAST INTO THE LONG-WAVE TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN THIRD OF THE NATION.
NAM CONTINUES TO BE THE STRONGEST WITH THIS WAVE...BUT THE GFS HAS TRENDED
TOWARD THE NAM THE LAST COUPLE MODEL RUNS.  INITIALLY...AS COLD AIR ALOFT MOVES
OVER THE REGION FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING...AIRMASS WILL BECOME UNSTABLE 
ENOUGH TO SUPPORT QUITE A BIT OF SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY OVER THE NORTHERN HALF
OF THE FORECAST AREA.

MAIN DYNAMICS WITH SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS AFTER MIDNIGHT FRIDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH MID-MORNING SATURDAY. NAM SHOWS BEST LIFT OVER SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...AND NORTH PLATEAU. SNOW ACCUMULATIONS OF 3 TO 6 INCHES
ARE POSSIBLE WITH LOCALLY HEAVIER AMOUNTS POSSIBLE ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATION.
HAVE ISSUED A WSW FOR THESE AREAS FROM 6 PM FRIDAY THROUGH NOON SATURDAY.

FOR TYS...ADVISORY CRITERIA SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE WITH A QUICK
BURST OF SNOWFALL POSSIBLE...MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT THROUGH DAYBREAK SATURDAY.
FOR CHA...ONLY LIGHT ACCUMULATIONS...GENERALLY LESS THAN 1 INCH ANTICIPATED...
EXCEPT FOR THE SOUTHERN PLATEAU WHERE AN ADVISORY MAY BE REQUIRED.

MODELS SHOW UPPER FLOW BECOMING LESS AMPLIFIED THIS WEEKEND AND EARLY NEXT
WEEK WITH A SERIES OF FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVES EFFECTING THE AREA. TIMING 
DIFFICULT AND CONFIDENCE LOW. WILL MAINTAIN LOW CHANCE POPS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT
AND WEDNESDAY.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 100849
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
345 AM EST THU MAR 10 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A WEAK LOW PRESSURE AREA CENTERED 
OVER SOUTHERN GA...WITH LOCAL RADARS INDICATING SOME SNOW FLURRIES 
ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS. THESE FLURRIES SHOULD DIMINISH BY SUNRISE AS 
THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW PATTERN TEMPORARILY BECOMES MORE ZONAL TODAY. 
THE LONG WAVE TROUGH PATTERN OVER THE EASTERN U.S...WHICH HAS 
BROUGHT A PERSISTENT NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT OVER THE FORECAST AREA... 
WILL CONTINUE THROUGH SATURDAY. AS A RESULT...A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL 
QUICKLY MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...BRINGING ANOTHER ROUND 
OF LIGHT PRECIP. THIS FRONT WILL BE FOLLOWED QUICKLY BY ANOTHER COLD 
FRONT ON FRIDAY...BRINGING ANOTHER ROUND OF LIGHT PRECIP INTO FRIDAY 
NIGHT. A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE WILL ALSO DEEPEN ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA ON FRIDAY NIGHT...HELPING TO GENERATE MORE PRECIP 
AMOUNTS OVER THE REGION. AS A RESULT...SOME ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL 
APPEARS TO BE POSSIBLE FRIDAY NIGHT ACROSS A LARGE PART OF THE 
FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE DIFFERING SOLUTIONS IN REGARDS TO 
MOISTURE AVAILABILITY...BUT RIGHT NOW IT APPEARS THAT MAINLY LIGHT 
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE POSSIBLE. WILL PLAN TO CONTINUE A SPECIAL 
WEATHER STATEMENT ADDRESSING THE SITUATION.

IN THE EXTENDED FORECAST...YET ANOTHER COLD FRONT MOVE INTO THE 
REGION ON SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY...BRINGING ANOTHER ROUND OF 
LIGHT PRECIP. GFS MODEL INDICATES THAT THIS PERSISTENT LONG WAVE 
TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN U.S. WILL FINALLY BEGIN TO CHANGE BY EARLY 
NEXT WEEK RESULTING IN MODERATING TEMPS.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             50  39  54  33 /   0  30  30  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  48  37  50  31 /   0  40  50  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       49  37  50  30 /   0  40  60  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              45  34  45  28 /   0  50  60  80

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

WEAK SYSTEM NOW PASSING THROUGH SRN PART OF CWA.  FREEZING LEVEL 
MAKING INTERESTING SITUATION FOR HIGHER ELEVATION SNOW ON PLATEAU.  
SIGNAL MTN REPORTING LIGHT SNOW...WITH KCHA REPORTING LIGHT RAIN.  
AIR MASS WILL BE COOLING OFF...COULD CHANGE BRIEFLY TO -SN AT 
KCHA...BUT PRECIP MAY END BEFORE IT HAS A CHANCE TO CHANGE OVER.  
NOT EXPECTING MORE THAN ABOUT 1/2 INCH ON PLATEAU.  WITH THE 
DIRECTION THE PRECIP IS MOVING THINK THAT MOST OF SMOKIES WILL ONLY 
GET A GLANCING SHOT OF PRECIP.


&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC......NONE.
TN......NONE.
VA......NONE.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST WED MAR 9 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...A WEAK LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM TRACKING TO OUR SOUTH THIS EVENING WILL GENERATE SCATTERED 
RAIN AND SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS MAINLY OUR SOUTHERN CWA.  WEAK UPSLOPE 
FLOW DEVELOPING OVERNIGHT WILL AID ISOLATED TO SCATTERED LIGHT SNOW 
SHOWERS OVER NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS OVERNIGHT.  THE LOW IS EXPECTED TO 
MOVE THROUGH FAIRLY QUICKLY...EXITING THE REGION LATE TONIGHT...AND 
WITH THE TRACK KEEPING MAIN MOISTURE AND LIFT TO OUR SOUTH...PRECIP 
AMOUNTS SHOULD BE LIGHT.  WE WILL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS ON THURSDAY 
WITH COOL NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT.  A WEAK COLD FRONTAL BOUNDARY 
WILL SLIDE IN FROM OUR NORTHWEST ON THURSDAY NIGHT.  ATTACHED 
MOISTURE AND DYNAMICS IS LIMITED BUT SUFFICIENT FOR SCATTERED RAIN 
AND SNOW SHOWERS OVER THE MRX CWA.  MAIN SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL OVER 
OUR NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS...HOWEVER...LOW LEVEL FLOW NOT CONDUCIVE FOR 
GOOD UPSLOPE LIFT WHICH WILL LIMITED MOUNTAIN SNOWFALL AMOUNTS. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...HUDSON BAY UPPER LOW WILL
REMAIN IN THE START OF THE EXTENDED PERIODS WITH A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES
ROTATING DOWN INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN.  ONE
SUCH WAVE (SHEARED) WILL MOVE ACROSS FRIDAY MORNING...WITH A STRONGER
ONE SCHEDULED FOR LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING.  THE LATE
FRIDAY NIGHT WAVE WILL ALSO BRING WITH IT FAIRLY COLD AIR ALOFT WITH IT
WITH 500 MB TEMPERATURES DROPPING BRIEFLY INTO THE -30 TO -35 RANGE.
MESO-ETA SHOWS MODERATELY STRONG ISENTROPIC LIFT AHEAD OF THE SURFACE
WAVE ASSOCIATED WITH THE SHORT-WAVE WITH 0.25 INCH OF PRECIPITATION
DEPICTED.  THERMAL PROFILE SUGGESTS PRECIPITATION WILL FALL IN THE FORM
OF SNOW OVER MOST OF THE REGION. LATER SHIFTS MAY WANT TO ISSUE A WINTER
STORM FOR LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING WITH 2 TO 4 INCH SNOWFALLS
POSSIBLE.

PLAN ON ISSUING A SPS CONCERNING THE POTENTIAL SNOWFALL.

FOR THE LATER HALF OF THE WEEKEND...UPPER FLOW BECOMES LESS 
AMPLIFIED AND FLATTENS...SO A WARM-UP IS IN THE OFFING.  SOUTHERN STREAM
BECOMES MORE ACTIVE LATE IN THE EXTENDED WITH NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN FOR
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.

.DISCUSSION...A WEAK LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO THE SOUTHERN

INITIALLY WITH RAIN TURNING TO LIGHT SNOW LATE THIS EVENING AND 
OVERNIGHT.  THE LOW WILL EXIT THE AREA LATE TONIGHT WITH PRECIP 
EXPECTED TO END BY MORNING.  ALL HANDLED WELL IN THE CURRENT 
FORECAST...NO UPDATES EXPECTED.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EST WED MAR 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE TN 
RIVER VALLEY WITH A FEW SNOW FLURRIES LINGERING OVER SOUTHWEST VA 
AND NORTHEAST TN. THESE FLURRIES SHOULD DIMINISH BY SUNRISE AS THE 
UPPER-LEVEL FLOW PATTERN BECOMES ZONAL. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
CURRENTLY OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS WILL MOVE EAST ACROSS THE DEEP 
SOUTH TODAY...SPREADING CLOUDS AND MOISTURE INTO THE FORECAST AREA. 
WITH TEMPS EXPECTED TO RISE INTO THE 40S TODAY...THINK THAT MOSTLY 
LIGHT RAIN WILL DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING...ALTHOUGH THERE 
COULD BE A FEW SNOW SHOWERS TONIGHT IN THE MOUNTAINS AS WELL AS 
NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. ANOTHER CLIPPER SYSTEM FROM SOUTHERN 
CANADA WILL DIVE IN THE PERSISTENT NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT TOWARDS THE 
FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY. SURFACE TEMPS WILL ONCE AGAIN BE WARM 
ENOUGH FOR MAINLY RAIN THURSDAY NIGHT ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA...WITH SOME SNOW SHOWERS AGAIN POSSIBLE IN THE MOUNTAINS AS 
WELL AS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. A STRONG UPPER SHORT WAVE IS 
PROGGED TO SWING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY NIGHT...AS YET 
ANOTHER COLD FRONT DIVES TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS INDICATE 
DIFFERING SOLUTIONS IN REGARDS TO MOISTURE AVAILABILITY...BUT IT 
APPEARS RIGHT NOW THAT ACCUMULATING SNOWFALL WILL BE POSSIBLE FRIDAY 
NIGHT ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

IN THE EXTENDED FORECAST...MODELS INDICATE THAT THE PERSISTENT LONG 
WAVE TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN U.S. (WHICH HAS BROUGHT NUMEROUS COLD 
FRONTS INTO THE REGION IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT) WILL FINALLY 
BEGIN TO CHANGE TO MORE OF A ZONAL FLOW BY MONDAY. THE BAD NEWS IS 
THIS CHANGE WILL CAUSE A COLD FRONT ON SUNDAY TO STALL OUT NEAR THE 
FORECAST AREA THROUGH TUESDAY...BRINGING UNSETTLED WEATHER INTO 
EARLY NEXT WEEK. THE GOOD NEWS IS THAT WARMER WEATHER SHOULD RETURN 
WITH THIS PATTERN CHANGE WITH MOSTLY RAIN EXPECTED FOR EARLY NEXT 
WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EST TUE MAR 8 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE 
SPINE OF THE APPALACHIANS...WITH WINDS SHIFTED TO THE NORTHWEST 
ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. TEMPS BEHIND THIS FRONT ARE IN THE 
30S OVER MIDDLE TN AND SOUTHEAST KY...AND EXPECT RAIN TO CHANGE OVER 
TO SNOW BY SUNRISE. IN FACT...THE CROSSVILLE AND LONDON OBSERVATIONS 
ARE ALREADY REPORTING LIGHT SNOW WITH TEMPS IN THE LOWER 30S. THE 
BIG QUESTION WILL BE HOW MUCH MOISTURE LINGERS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA THIS MORNING AS THE SUB-FREEZING AIR ARRIVES? MODELS INDICATE 
DIFFERING SOLUTIONS...BUT EXPECT MOST AREAS TO SEE SOME SNOW SHOWERS 
THIS MORNING BEFORE MOISTURE COMPLETELY EXITS THE REGION. THINK THAT 
SNOW ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE CONFINED TO THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 
2000 FEET...SINCE GROUND AND NEAR SURFACE TEMPS SHOULD BE TOO WARM 
FOR ANY SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATIONS OUTSIDE OF THESE AREAS. WITH THIS 
IN MIND...HAVE ISSUED A SNOW ADVISORY FOR SOUTHWEST VA AND THE 
CENTRAL AND NORTHERN MOUNTAINS FOR TODAY. NORTHWEST WINDS WILL BE 
BREEZY TODAY...BUT RIGHT NOW IT APPEARS THAT WIND SPEEDS SHOULD 
REMAIN BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA.

ON WEDNESDAY...MODELS ARE REVEALING A MORE SOUTHERLY TRACK FOR THE 
NEXT LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM. WILL KEEP A LOW CHANCE FOR SOME SHOWERS IN 
THE FORECAST (ESPECIALLY ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC)...BUT 
THINK THAT ANY PRECIP WOULD BE ON THE LIGHT SIDE FOR WED AFTERNOON 
AND WED NIGHT. ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM WILL DIVE SOUTHEAST FROM CANADA 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY THURSDAY NIGHT...BUT PRECIP AMOUNTS LOOK 
TO BE ON THE LIGHT SIDE AGAIN. EXTENDED MODELS INDICATE THAT THIS 
PERSISTENT NORTHWEST UPPER-LEVEL FLOW PATTERN LOOKS TO CHANGE BY 
NEXT WEEK...WITH WARMER WEATHER EXPECTED.

.DISCUSSION...DEEP SURFACE LOW NOW OVER LAKE ONTARIO WITH COLD FRONT

AHEAD OF PRE FRONTAL TROUGH HAVE DROPPED TEMPERATURES TO THE MID 40S 
TO LOWER 50S. THE AIRMASS OVER THE FORECAST AREA HAS STABILIZED. THE 
BEST INSTABILITY IS OVER WEST TN AND NORTH MS WHERE THUNDERSTORMS 
ARE CONTINUING ALONG THE FRONT. THREAT FOR SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS HAS 
ENDED BUT MAY KEEP ISOLATED THUNDER IN SOUTHERN VALLEY WITH THE 
FRONT. COLDER AIR IS LAGGING THE FRONT A FEW HUNDRED MILES WITH 
BELOW FREEZING TEMPERATURES OVER NORTHERN IN AND IL OVER 300 MILES 
NW OF THE FORECAST AREA. SPS ALREADY ISSUED FOR SNOWFALL IN THE 
MOUNTAINS LATE TONIGHT AND TUESDAY AND BELIEVE THE BULK OF THE SNOW 
WILL OCCUR IN THE LAST HOUR OR SO BEFORE SUNRISE AND DURING THE DAY 
TUESDAY. MODELS SHOW FREEZING LEVELS DROP TO AROUND 2500 FEET BY 
12Z. NEXT SHIFT MAY NEED TO ISSUE AN ADVISORY FOR ACCUMULATIONS 
TUESDAY. ADJUSTED LOWS UP A LITTLE SW NC AND ACROSS NE AND KEPT POPS 
HIGHER LONGER OVERNIGHT TONIGHT.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 072110
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
410 PM EST MON MAR 7 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...CURRENTLY A COLD FRONT OUT 
OVER THE MISSISSIPPI VALLEY IS SLOWING MOVING EASTWARD, AND SOUTH 
WINDS ARE GUSTING IN THE FORECAST AREA, DEWPOINTS INCREASING, WHILE 
TEMPS, IN THE LACK OF REAL SUNSINE, ARE HOLDING FAIRLY STEADY. WE 
HAVE BEEN PLACED IN A SLIGHT RISK OF SEVERE THUNDERSTORMS AREA ALL 
DAY, BUT THE PROBLEM HAS BEEN A LACK OF ADEQUATE INSTABILITY. WITH 
LOWER DEWPOINTS AND TEMPS NOT RISING MUCH, PLUS A RELATIVELY WARM 
MIDDLE ATMOSPHERE, ITS BEEN TOUGH ALL AROUND. THERE IS A THETA E 
RIDGE AT THE SURFACE OVER MID-WEST TN, BUT WEVE HAD A SFC THETA E 
TROF OVER THE EAST, VA, NC WHICH HAS KEPT THINGS UNDER WRAPS. AN 
AREA OF SHOWERS IS CURRENTLY MOVING EASTWARD OVER US, BUT AMOUNTS 
ARE LIGHT AND THE NEAREST LIGHTING AS OF THE PUBLISHING OF THIS 
DOCUMENT IS OVER THE MS RIVER.

MODELS ARE IN MACABRE AGREEMENT TONIGHT WITH 100 POPS. HAVE GONE 
WITH THEM AS WHO CAN DISAGREE WITH THAT? THERE WILL BE A GAP IN THE 
PRECIP AS THE CURRENT PRE-FRONTAL CONVECTION MOVES OUT, BEFORE THE 
ACTUAL FRONT APPROACHES THE AREA LATE TONIGHT. BUT 100 POPS IS THE 
WAY TO GO, IN MY VIEW. THE OTHER PROBLEM IS, WILL IT GET COLD 
ENOUGH TO SNOW, AND WILL THE DYNAMICS OCCUR SIMULTANEOUSLY WITH THE 
COLD AIR? I BELIEVE THE ANSWER IS YES, HOWEVER, IT WILL ONLY BE 
COLD ENOUGH ABOVE ABOUT 2500 FEET AND FURTHER NORTH IN VA, WITH THE 
DYNAMICS LIMITED IN STRENGTH, AND MUCH OF IT IN THE FORM OF 
NORTHWEST LOW LEVEL FLOW. THIS NORTHWEST FLOW WILL CAUSE THE BIGGEST 
CONCERNS WELL INTO THE NC MOUNTAINS SO MUCH OF THE HEAVIEST SNOW 
WILL NOT OCCUR IN OUR FORECAST AREA. HENCE, HAS NOT ISSUED A WINTER 
STORM WATCH, AND HAVE OPTED INSTEAD TO UPDATE THE CURRENT SPECIAL 
WEATHER STATEMENT. HAVE REWORDED IT TO CALL FOR THE HEAVIEST OF THE 
1-4 INCH TOTALS ABOVE 3500 FEET, TOO. TEMPS I HAVE NOT TWEAKED TOO 
MUCH, AND HAVE LEFT WINDS ALONE EXCEPT TO ADD SOME GUSTINESS TONIGHT 
ASSOCIATED WITH THE LOWEST PRESSURE NEAR THE FRONT.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...ANGRY ATMOSPHERE CONTINUES 
TO PUMMEL FA WITH WAVE AFTER WAVE AFTER WAVE EMANATING FROM THE COLD 
WESTERN CANADIAN PROVINCES. FIRST S/WV IN THE LONG TERM BUILDS SE 
THROUGH THE PLAINS INTO THE OZARKS AND CONTINUES THROUGH THE TN VLY 
OF AL AND THE REST OF THE DEEP SOUTH. PRECIP TYPE APPEARS TO BE A 
MIX OF -RA/-SN WITH -SN MAINLY IN THE MOUNTAINS OF TN. USED SLGT CHC 
POPS N (WITH EXCEPTION OF MOST OF SW VA) AND CHC POPS SRN HALF FA 
FOR THIS EVENT. WILL HAVE TO WAIT FOR LATER MODELS RUNS TO GET A 
BETTER FOCUS ON THIS SYSTEM AS SOME DISAGREEMENT IN TERMS OF TIMING 
AND TRACK BETWEEN GFS/NAM. FADE POPS OFF TO SLGT CHC WED EVENING AND 
DROP ENTIRELY MOST OF THE FA BY DAYBREAK THU. HOWEVER NEXT IN SERIES 
OF WAVES WITH FRONTAL SYSTEM DROPS INTO THE MS VLY ON THU AND 
CONTINUES SE THROUGH THE APPALACHIANS BY 12Z FRI. SLGT TO CHC POPS 
USED AT THIS LONGER TIME RANGE WITH A MIX OF -RA/-SN MAINLY MTNS AND 
NRN THIRD FA TO MATCH DIURNAL TEMP TRENDS WHICH DROP TO AROUND 
FREEZING OR BELOW OVERNIGHT INTO FRI. SUFFICIENT ENERGY/NW FLO/LOW LVL 
MOISTURE FILLING INTO THE BACK SIDE OF GREAT LAKES UPR TROF TO 
EXTEND CHC -RA WITH SOME -SN MTNS THROUGH FRI. NW UPSLOPE FLO 
CONTINUES ON SAT AND MAINTAINED SLGT CHC POP FOR MIX -RA/-SN SW 
VA/NE TN AND MTNS HERE. FCST MURKY AT SUCH LONG TIME RANGES WITH 
SYSTEMS MOVING RAPIDLY SE OUT OF CANADA SO WITH MY SURROUNDING FOS 
MAINTAINED SLGT CHC POPS OUT THROUGH DAYTIME PERIOD MON AGAIN USING 
MAINLY -RA WITH -SN FOR OVRNIGHT NRN THIRD OF FA AND MTN ZONES. 
STAYED CLOSE TO NATIONAL GUIDANCE TEMPS THROUGH MOST OF LONG TERM 
FCST.
      
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1005 AM EST MON MAR 7 2005

.DISCUSSION...FRONT STILL LIES WAY OUT WEST IN THE OZARKS, BUT SMALL 
SQUALL LINE IS FORMING IN WESTERN KENTUCKY AND MOVING EAST. ANOTHER 
PATCH OF WEAK (SO FAR) CONVECTION IS MOVING EAST ACROSS EXTREME 
SOUTHERN MIDDLE TENNESSEE. AN AREA OF PATCHY WEAK SHOWERS IS MOVING 
EAST ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. ANY CLOUD-FREE AREAS ARE SLOWLY 
CLOSING OVER MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND DO NOT EXPECT MUCH SUNSHINE OVER 
THE FORECAST ARE TODAY. TEMPS WILL NOT WARM BECAUSE OF INSOLATION, 
BUT BECAUSE OF LOW LEVEL WAA. DEWPONTS STILL IN THE 20S AND 30S IN 
THE AREA, BUT IN THE 40S AND LOW 50S FROM MID TN OVER INTO AR. TEMPS 
ALSO MUCH WARMER OVER THERE. HENCE, SFC THETA E VALUES ARE QUITE LOW 
OVER HERE, AND HIGHER TO THE WEST WITH TIGHT GRADIENT BETWEEN. 
BELIEVE THIS TO BE THE CAUSE OF THE WEAK CONVECTION IN MIDDLE TN AND 
THE PLATEAU. THE SQUALL LINE IN WESTERN KY APPEARS TO BE DRIVEN BY 
THE SFC CONVERGENCE AHEAD OF THE FRONT, PLUS STRENGTHENED BY A SMALL 
THETA E RIDGE IN THE AREA.

WILL NOT ISSUE A ZONE FORECAST UPDATE THIS MORNING. BELIEVE THE 
WORDING IN THE ZONES ACCOUNTS FOR PRESENT CONDITIONS AND FOR CHANGES 
WHICH WILL OCCUR DURING THE DAY. A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT IS 
STILL VALID FOR TONIGHT AS TEMPS DROP AND PRECIP CHANGES TO SNOW 
SHOWERS IN THE LOW ELEVATIONS AND SOME ACCUMULATIONS IN THE HIGHER 
(2500+ FEET). QUESTION STILL REMAINS AS TO TIMING OF MOISTURE AND 
COLD AIR TONIGHT. IF ONE IS OFF, NOT MUCH WILL ACCUMULATE. WILL 
WATCH FOR AFTERNOON PACKAGE.

SCATTERED CONVECTION OCCURRING ACROSS THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY AHEAD 
OF A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH. THIS LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL RAPIDLY MOVE 
SOUTHEAST TODAY TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA...BRINGING A STRONG COLD 
FRONT ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING. 
MODELS STILL INDICATE ONLY MARGINAL INSTABILITY DEVELOPING AHEAD OF 
THE FRONT...BUT THE STRONG WINDS AND UPPER DYNAMICS EXPECTED SHOULD 
HELP TO GENERATE A LINE OF TSTORMS ACROSS THE TN VALLEY LATE THIS 
AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING. DAMAGING WINDS APPEAR TO BE THE 
GREATEST THREAT WITH THESE STORMS...BUT WITH THE HIGH HELICITY 
VALUES PROGGED...THINK AN ISOLATED TORNADO OR TWO WILL BE POSSIBLE. 
THE OTHER FORECAST CONCERN FOR THIS PERIOD INVOLVES THE POSSIBILITY 
OF ACCUMULATING SNOW IN THE MOUNTAINS...AS THE SUB-FREEZING AIR ALOFT
BEHIND THE FRONT TRIES TO CATCH-UP WITH THE EXITING MOISTURE AFTER 
MIDNIGHT TONIGHT. GFS AND NAM MODELS INDICATE SOME DISCREPANCIES 
WITH HOW MUCH MOISTURE WILL BE LINGERING AFTER MIDNIGHT AS THE 
SUB-FREEZING ENTERS THE REGION. RIGHT NOW...THINK THAT ONLY ONE TO 
FOUR INCHES WILL BE POSSIBLE AROUND SUNRISE IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
ABOVE 2500 FEET. BOUNDARY LAYER APPEARS TO BE TOO WARM FOR ANY
ACCUMULATING SNOW ELSEWHERE. WILL PLAN TO ISSUE A SPECIAL WEATHER 
STATEMENT AND NOT A WATCH TO ADDRESS TONIGHTS SITUATION...SINCE 
ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD REMAIN BELOW WARNING CRITERIA. AS FOR TEMPS... 
ALTHOUGH INCREASING CLOUDS ARE EXPECTED TODAY...WILL TREND TOWARDS 
THE WARMER NGM MOS NUMBERS FOR HIGHS TODAY WITH BREEZY SOUTHWEST 
WINDS. WINDS WILL REMAIN BREEZY BEHIND THE FRONT AS WELL THROUGH 
TUESDAY.


.LONG TERM (TUE NIGHT THROUGH SUN)...AFTER A BRIEF ALBEIT COLD 
RESPITE IN THE FOURTH PERIOD...NEXT IN A SERIES OF NORTHERN STREAM 
SHORT WAVES APPROACHES THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON WEDNESDAY. 
TIMING AND PLACEMENT OF THIS SYSTEM REMAINS PROBLEMATIC WITH GFS 
PROJECTING A MORE SOUTHERLY TRACK THAN NAM. THUS GUIDANCE POPS 
VASTLY DIFFERENT. DOES NOT APPEAR TO BE A MAJOR EVENT AT ANY RATE 
WITH QPFS PROJECTED TO BE GENERALLY LESS THAN 0.1 INCHES. HAVE NOT 
MADE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO PREVIOUS FORECAST PACKAGE OTHER THAN 
TO SPEED UP ONSET TIMING SOMEWHAT. NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES IN THE 
LATE THURSDAY/EARLY FRIDAY TIME FRAME. GFS AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS 
SUGGEST A SIGNIFICANT DEAMPLIFICATION OF EASTERN CONUS TROUGH BY 00Z 
SUNDAY. THIS SHOULD RESULT IN TEMPS MODERATING TO NEAR CLIMO BY LATE 
IN THE PERIOD.


&&

330 PM EST SUN MAR 6 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...MOST INTERESTING 
PERIOD WILL BE LATE MONDAY INTO TUESDAY MORNING...WITH A THREAT OF 
SEVERE STORMS FOLLOWED BY A GOOD CHANCE OF SIGNIFICANT SNOW (HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS MAINLY) BY TUESDAY MORNING.  MOST GRID CHANGES WERE TO 
MONDAY NIGHT...WHEN SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMS WERE INTRODUCED TO THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SWRN VA AND THE NE AND SMOKY MTNS OF E TN.  I 
ALSO PAINTED IN SOME LIGHTER SNOW ACCUMS FOR OUR NE PLATEAU COUNTIES.
AGREE WITH GSP THAT THE MTN AREAS MAY VERY WELL SEE MORE SNOW THAN 
IN CURRENT GRIDS...AND THIS POTENTIAL WAS HIGHLIGHTED IN MY UPDATED 
HWOMRX PRODUCT AROUND 1245 PM EST TODAY.  THE ETA AND GFS MODELS 
WERE IN QUITE GOOD AGREEMENT ON TIMING THE COLD AIR ARRIVAL BY 06Z 
TO 09Z TUESDAY...AS WELL AS BOTH SHOWING SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMS.
THE MOISTURE LOOKS DEEP ENOUGH ON TUESDAY WITH SUFFICIENT 
INSTABILITY AND LOW LEVEL FORCING (NW UPSLOPE WINDS) TO KEEP SNOW 
SHOWERS GOING INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS.  WILL LET MIDNIGHT SHIFT 
DECIDE IF SNOW AMOUNTS WILL BE IN THE ADVISORY RANGE OR POSSIBLY 
HIGHER FOR TUESDAY.  

OTHERWISE...I FOLLOWED THE MESO-ETA TIMING FOR INITIAL SHOWERS... 
THEN SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS BY MONDAY AFTERNOON...WHICH WAS ONLY 
MINOR CHANGES FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS.  THREAT OF SEVERE STORMS FOR LATE 
MONDAY SEEMS TO BE ONLY LIMITED BY LACK OF INSTABILITY...AS WIND 
FIELDS LOOK QUITE FAVORABLE.  MAV MOS HAS PERFORMED RATHER POORLY OF 
LATE...SO I WENT MORE FOR THE BLEND ON MAX TEMPS...WITH LITTLE 
DIFFERENCES ON MINS FROM MOS.  MAX TEMPS TUESDAY WILL BE IN THE AM...
WHICH I GENERALLY TRIED TO LET THE GRIDS REFLECT.  


.LONG TERM...(WED THROUGH SUN)...S/WV AND ASSOCIATED SFC SYSTEM 
PRESS E ACROSS THE SE U.S. WED NIGHT INTO THU WITH ANOTHER CLIPPER 
COMPLIMENTS OF CANADA RIPPING SE FOR ARRIVAL THU NIGHT INTO FRI WITH 
MORE COLD AIR AND NW OROGRAPHICALLY ENHANCED LIFTING PROCESSES ON 
PLATEAU AND APPALACHIAN TERRAIN. ATMOSPHERE DEMANDS THAT SNOW BE 
VERY MUCH PART OF THE FCST FOR MUCH OF THE REGION ESPECIALLY WED 
NIGHT INTO THU WITH CLIPPER SYSTEM AS RELENTLESS NW FLO CONTINUES. 
THREAT FOR SNOW MAINLY NRN TWO THIRDS OF FA WITH EMPHASIS IN HIGHER 
TERRAIN AGAIN THU NIGHT INTO FRI. OROGRAPHICS ALONG WITH TRAILING 
S/WV ENERGY IN NEVER ENDING NW FLO WILL EVEN REQUIRE USE OF SLGT CHC 
POPS THROUGH DAYTIME PERIOD SAT WITH A MIXED BAD OF -RA/-SN DUE TO 
CHILLY ATMOSPHERIC STRUCTURE. TRIED TO GO WITH A DRY PERIOD SAT 
NIGHT THROUGH SUN NIGHT AS MODELS DEPICT A PATTERN CHANGE. NEEDLESS 
TO SAY TEMPS A GOOD TEN DEGREES BELOW NORMAL THROUGH MOST OF 
EXTENDED PERIOD WITH AN ATTEMPT AT MODERATION BY SUN.

ADVERTISE NEXT IN A SERIES OF SYSTEMS APPROACHING THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS ON MONDAY. MARGINAL INSTABILITY STILL REFLECTED IN 
MODEL FORECAST SOUNDINGS...SO HAVE CONTINUED TO MENTION THUNDER FOR 
MONDAY AFTERNOON/EVENING. RELATIVELY STRONG DYNAMICS SHOULD AID 
THUNDERSTORM DEVELOPMENT. SURFACE COLD FRONT PASSES THROUGH THE AREA 
AROUND 06Z TUESDAY USHERING IN SIGNIFICANTLY COLDER AIR. ANY 
LINGERING PRECIP TUESDAY MORNING MAY CHANGE OVER TO SNOW ESPECIALLY 
IN THE MOUNTAINS AND NORTHEASTERN ZONES. MUCH DRIER AIR PUSHES INTO 
REGION BEHIND FRONT. HOWEVER...LINGERING LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE MAY 
PRECLUDE COMPLETE CLEARING ON TUESDAY. NEXT DISTURBANCE ARRIVES LATE 
WEDNESDAY. REMAINDER OF WORK WEEK CONTINUES UNSETTLED AS WEAK 
NORTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVES PARADE THROUGH THE AREA IN NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW ALOFT. INDIVIDUAL ENSEMBLE MEMBERS DEVIATE SIGNIFICANTLY FROM 
ONE ANOTHER...SO TIMING THESE EVENTS CONTINUES TO BE AN ISSUE. FOR 
TEMPS...GENERALLY WENT WITH A BLEND OF GUIDANCE VALUES.

MOISTURE AND OROGRAPHICS WITH SOME TRAILING VORTICITY WILL LEAD TO A 
CONTINUED CHC PRECIP MAINLY IN THE FORM OF -SHRA WITH SOME -SHSN IN 
THE MTNS OF SW VA/NE TN TAPERING OFF DURING THE AFTERNOON WITH A DRY 
PERIOD TUE NIGHT AS FA AWAITS A PARADE OF UPR TROFS WITH NEXT 
FEATURE AND ASSOCIATED SFC WAVE MOVING ACROSS THE MID SOUTH WED WITH 
MORE WRAP AROUND MOISTURE/LIFT FOR THU FOLLOWED BY YET MORE CLIPPER 
ACTION DROPPING INTO THE TN VLY FRI WITH ASSOCIATED CAA WRAP AROUND 
MOISTURE AND OROGRAPHICS TO KEEP SMALL CHC FOR PRECIP ALIVE DURING 
THE DAY SAT. THROUGH THIS PERIOD FOR PRECIP TYPE USED MIXED -RA/-SN 
MTNS AND MUCH OF THE NRN TWO THIRDS OF THE FA WITH -RA SE TN. TEMPS 
STAY SEVERAL DEGREES BELOW NORMAL IN THE EXTENDED NW FLO PATTERN.

MIN FOR CHA AND TRI TONIGHT.  MY POPS ENDED PRETTY MUCH CLOSE TO THE 
MOS BLEND FOR TONIGHT.

CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS FOR SATURDAY...WHEN AIRMASS IS SLIGHTLY 
UNSTABLE WITH COLD MID LEVEL TEMPS MOVING THROUGH.  DID END THE PCPN 
CHANCES A BIT SOONER FOR SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH NOT MUCH THREAT OF 
ANY SNOW SHOWERS.  SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT STILL LOOK DRY AND MILD.


.LONG TERM...(MON THROUGH FRI)...USING FINER TEMPORAL RESOLUTION IN 
EARLY PART OF LONG TERM FCST STEPPED UP PROBABILITIES FROM SLGT TO 
MEDIUM CHC -SHRA FROM MON THROUGH MON NITE WITH SOME -SHSN MAINLY 
AFTER MIDNIGHT AND IN HIGHEST TERRAIN SW VA AND MTNS OF E TN AS NEXT 
S/WV AND ASSOCIATED FRONTAL SYSTEM PRESS SE THROUGH THE FA. HELD 
ONTO SOME POPS ON TUE ALTHOUGH STEPPING BACK TO CHC/SLGT CHC FOR 
TRAILING VORT ENERGY ROUNDING BASE OF UPR TROF WHICH MAKES ITS WAY E 
FROM MS VLY TO THE WESTERN ATLANTIC BY 12Z WED. AS COLDER AIR SPILLS 
IN BEHIND DEPARTING SFC LOW -SHSN BECOMES THE PREDOMINANT PRECIP 
TYPE THROUGH THE OVRNIGHT PD TUE NIGHT. HAD TO MAINTAIN CHC POPS FOR 
-SHRA MUCH OF THE DAYTIME PERIOD WED WITH -SHRA/-SHSN WED NIGHT 
THROUGH FRI WITH YET MORE -SHRA/-SHSN (MAINLY OVRNIGHT INTO THE 
MORNING HOURS) AS NEVER ENDING SERIES OF CLIPPER SYSTEMS RIP SE OUT 
OF CANADA INTO THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. TRIED TO GO 
WITH DRY FCST FOR FRI NIGHT THROUGH SAT AS POLAR VORTEX GRADUALLY 
SHOWS SIGNS OF RELEASING STRANGLEHOLD ON EASTERN U.S. WITH 
POSSIBILITY OF SOME RIDGING AND SOME SMALL HOPE OF MODIFICATION IN 
TEMPS NEXT WEEKEND.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
936 AM EST FRI MAR 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...CLOUDS ARE INCREASING ACROSS KY THIS MORNING WITH 
PATCHY AREAS OF VERY LIGHT RAIN...AND THIS IS THE AREA WHERE WARM 
AIR ADVECTION AND WEAK ISENTROPIC LIFT IS OCCURRING.  THIS WEAK 
ISENTROPIC LIFT SHOULD SPREAD INTO OUR REGION THIS EVENING AND 
OVERNIGHT...AS THE FAST MOVING UPSTREAM SHORTWAVE APPROACHES.

HOWEVER...UNTIL TONIGHT THE RAIN PROSPECTS LOOK SLIM AS REFLECTED IN 
THE CURRENT FORECAST OF 50 PERCENT CHANCE NORTH TO 20 PERCENT CHANCE 
SOUTH.  ALSO...IF CLOUDS DO NOT INCREASE SIGNIFICANTLY THIS AFTERNOON
...THEN MAY NEED TO CONSIDER RAISING MAX TEMPS A BIT...ESPECIALLY 
OVER SRN AREAS.  OHX 12Z SOUNDING SUPPORTED HIGHS IN THE LOWER 60S 
TODAY...WHILE THE COOLER RNK 12Z SOUNDING INDICATED AROUND MID 40S 
FOR SWRN VA.  

WORDING IN THE ZFP WILL REQUIRE AN UPDATE...AND WILL ALSO CHECK 
GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS FOR POSSIBLE UPDATE AS WELL BY 11 AM.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 AM EST FRI MAR 4 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS THE 
FORECAST AREA IN BETWEEN A WEAK TROUGH OVER THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF 
THE APPALACHIANS AND A WEAK LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE MID MS 
RIVER VALLEY. THIS LOW OVER THE MID MS RIVER VALLEY WILL MOVE EAST 
TODAY ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY...CREATING A CHANCE FOR SHOWERS 
BY THIS AFTERNOON ACROSS MAINLY THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST 
AREA. A FAST-MOVING CLIPPER SYSTEM (CURRENTLY OVER SOUTHERN CANADA) 
WILL DIVE SOUTHEAST TODAY IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT...AND MOVE 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA AROUND MIDNIGHT TONIGHT. THIS SYSTEM SHOULD 
INCREASE THE COVERAGE OF SHOWERS TONIGHT...AS NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT 
HELPS TO CREATE SOME WEAK INSTABILITY OVER THE AREA AFTER MIDNIGHT. 
AS FOR TEMPS...A NICE WARM-UP EXPECTED TODAY WITH SOUTHWEST WINDS 
DEVELOPING AHEAD OF THE CLIPPER SYSTEM.

.LONG TERM (SAT THROUGH THU)...NORTHERN STREAM SHORT WAVE MOVES 
THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS ON SATURDAY AS AREA REMAINS IN 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. NAM PROJECTS SOME INSTABILITY AS THIS 
DISTURBANCE MOVES THROUGH. THUS ADDED A SLIGHT CHANCE OF THUNDER ON 
SATURDAY. OTHERWISE DID NOT MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO 
PRECEDING FORECAST/GRIDS. SURFACE FLOW TURNS NORTHWESTERLY BEHIND 
SURFACE FRONT BY SATURDAY NIGHT SETTING THE STAGE FOR POTENTIAL 
UPSLOPE FLOW SNOW SHOWERS FOR CENTRAL AND NORTHERN MOUNTAINS. NOT 
ANTICIPATING A MAJOR EVENT AT THIS TIME HOWEVER. DRIER AIR AND 
STRONG SUBSIDENCE MOVE IN ON SUNDAY AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS 
IN. NEXT IN A SERIES OF DISTURBANCES APPROACHES LATE MONDAY IN THE 
PERSISTENT NORTHWESTERLY FLOW REGIME. HAVE NOT MADE ANY CHANGES 
THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK AS TIMING INDIVIDUAL 
EVENTS REMAINS A CHALLENGE.

318 PM EST THU MAR 3 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT)...SURFACE HIGH

UPSTREAM IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT AND MORE CLOUDINESS TO OUR SOUTH 
ACROSS THE GULF COAST STATES.  THE EXPECTED CLIPPER TYPE SHORTWAVE 
FOR FRIDAY INTO EARLY SATURDAY MAY NOT BRING IN ANY SIGNIFICANT 
CLOUDS UNTIL AFTER 12Z FRIDAY...SO WILL RUN WITH MOSTLY CLEAR TO 
PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES OVERNIGHT.  GENERALLY FAVORED THE ETA MODEL ON 
HANDLING OF LIGHT PCPN WITH THIS SHORTWAVE FEATURE...WHICH KEEPS THE 
HIGHER CHANCES OF MEASURABLE PCPN OVER MY NRN AREAS.  THIS WAS ALSO 
SUPPORTED BY THE WRF MODEL RAN LOCALLY AT WFO HUNTSVILLE (PER CHAT 
COORDINATION).  THIS LIGHT PCPN COULD LINGER INTO SATURDAY NIGHT...
BUT LOOKS TO BE MAINLY A RAIN EVENT NOT SNOW.  CLEARLY THE LEAST 
CHANCE OF ANY PCPN LOOKS TO BE SE TN AREAS...WHERE POPS WERE KEPT IN 
THE SLIGHT CHANCE TO CHANCE CATEGORY.

OTHERWISE...GIVEN THE INCREASING CLOUDS FRIDAY...PCPN LATE FRIDAY 
AND COLD AIR ADVECTION SATURDAY...I STAYED CLOSER TO THE COOLER MOS 
HIGHS BOTH DAYS.  MIN TEMP GUIDANCE WAS QUITE CLOSE AND GENERALLY 
ACCEPTED.   


.LONG TERM...(SUN THROUGH THU)...PLENTY OF NW FLOW TO KEEP TEMPS 
BELOW NORMAL THROUGH THE PERIOD. TWO S/WVS ARE DEPICTED TO DROP 
INTO THE REGION IN CLIPPER FASHION WITH PRECIP RANGING FROM -RA TO 
-SHSN/SHSN IN HIGHER TERRAIN AND MAINLY ACROSS SW VA/CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU. THE FIRST AFFECTS FA MON WITH BROADBRUSH TECHNIQUE FOR NW 
UPSLOPE PRECIP DEVELOPMENT INTO TUE. TAPER POPS OFF TO SLGT CHC TUE 
NIGHT. NEXT WAVE BUILDS SE INTO FA WED AND USED CHC POPS FOR WED 
TAPERING TO SLGT CHC WED NIGHT AND THU AS TRAILING S/WV ENERGY 
CONTINUES TO MOV THRU THE BASE OF PERSISTANT ONTARIO/QUEBEC CLOSED 
LOW/LONGWAVE TROF WHICH EXTENDS THRU MIDWEST AND APPALACHIANS LATE 
IN THE FCST PD. NOT SURE WHEN THE FA SEES MODERATION IN TEMPS AS 
SEEMINGLY NEVER ENDING NW FLOW PERSISTS INTO THE MIDDLE OF MARCH.

FXUS64 KMRX 021933
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
228 PM EST WED MAR 2 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...WEAK SHORTWAVE PUSHING 
THROUGH THE AREA TONIGHT...MOISTURE TOO LACKING TO ADD ANY POPS.  
SKY MAY BECOME MOSTLY CLOUDY FOR A BRIEF PERIOD TONIGHT...BUT IT 
SHOULD REMAIN PARTLY CLOUDY FOR MOST OF TONIGHT.  DRY WEATHER 
CONTINUES INTO THURSDAY.  WILL PROBABLY SEE SOME CLEARING IN THE 
AFTERNOON.  COOL TEMPERATURES CONTINUE...STAYED PRETTY CLOSE TO MAV 
GUIDANCE FOR BOTH PERIODS. 

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY NIGHT THRU WEDNESDAY)...TWO SYSTEMS AFFECT 
THE REGION DURING THE LONG TERM...WITH THE FIRST A FAST MOVING 
CLIPPER TYPE SHORTWAVE IN THE NW FLOW ALOFT ON FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY.  SHORT RANGE MODELS (MAINLY GFS AND ETA) DIFFER SLIGHTLY 
ON THE TIMING AND COVERAGE AREA OF WHAT SHOULD BE VERY LIGHT QPF 
FROM THIS FEATURE.  FOR NOW...POPS WERE KEPT IN THE CHANCE RANGE 
WITH SLIGHTLY HIGHER POPS FOR URN AREAS...AND ALSO SINCE MIN TEMPS 
LOOK TO BE SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER FOR FRIDAY NIGHT...THERE LOOKS TO 
BE LESS THREAT OF ANY SIGNIFICANT SNOW WITH THIS SYSTEM. 

THE NEXT SYSTEM IS POTENTIALLY MUCH STRONGER AND WETTER WITH SOME 
PROSPECTS FOR SNOW...AT LEAST IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS.  WE WILL 
NEED TO MONITOR THIS EVENT AS MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY DRAW CLOSER.
THE ECMWF MODEL WAS FAVORED BY HPC...AND MAY DIFFER SLIGHTLY FROM 
THE GFS AND ETA MODELS ON TIMING THE ONSET OF PCPN AS THE UPPER LOW 
OVER THE SW STATES MOVES EAST ON MONDAY.  A GOOD SURGE OF MOISTURE 
AND WARM AIR ADVECTION IN ADVANCE...SO MOSTLY RAIN UNTIL COLD AIR 
LOOKS TO MOVE INTO THE REGION TUESDAY AFTERNOON OR EVENING.  STRONG 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AND COLD AIR ADVECTION INTO WEDNESDAY WOULD 
KEEP AT LEAST SCATTERED RAIN OR SNOW SHOWERS INTO WEDNESDAY NIGHT.
SINCE THIS IS A DAY 6 AND 7 EVENT...NOT CERTAIN ENOUGH TO GO ABOVE 
40 PERCENT CHANCE POPS JUST YET.  CONSENSUS FROM NEIGHBORING OFFICES 
WAS TO UNDERCUT MEXMOS BY SEVERAL DEGREES FOR HIGHS ON WEDNESDAY.  

OTHERWISE...ONE MINOR CHANGE WAS TO REMOVE THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
AND KEEP SUNDAY THRU MONDAY PERIODS DRY...AND AGAIN THIS ACTION WAS 
FAVORED BY ALL NEIGHBORING OFFICES.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
240 PM EST TUE MAR 1 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...SATELLITE AND AREA RADARS 
CONTINUE TO SHOW CONVECTIVE BANDS MOVING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS AND TENNESSEE VALLEY...BUT WEAKENING TREND HAS BEEN 
NOTED THIS AFTERNOON. AFTER COORDINATION WITH JKL AND AREA LAW 
ENFORCEMENT... PLAN ON ALLOWING ADVISORIES AND WARNINGS EXPIRE AT 4 
PM.  DO EXPECT LIGHT TO MODERATE SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES TO 
CONTINUE FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS THROUGH THE NIGHT...BUT WILL ONLY 
CALL FOR 1 INCH WITH LOCALLY 2 INCHES HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

WILL ALSO CONTINUE WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE/CHANCE SHOWERS SHOWERS AND
LIKELY FLURRIES FOR THE NIGHT FOR TRI AND TYS AREAS. 

TIGHT PRESSURE GRADIENT FROM STRONG LOW PRESSURE OVER THE NORTHEAST
UNITED STATES AND HIGH IN THE CENTRAL PLAINS WILL CONTINUE GUSTY
WINDS...ESPECIALLY HIGH TERRAIN.  WILL CONTINUE LAKE WIND ADVISORY
FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS THROUGH
4 AM.  WIND CHILLS WILL DROP DOWN TO CLOSE TO ADVISORY CRITERIA...
WHICH IS -5F. WILL PROBABLY EXCEED ADVISORY CRITERIA ACROSS THE
HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WILL HIGHLIGHT LOW WINDS CHILLS...BUT HOLD OFF
ISSUING AN ADVISORY FOR NOW SINCE WILL ONLY AFFECT THE HIGHEST
ELEVATIONS.

UPPER TROUGH WILL EXIT THE AREA BY WEDNESDAY MORNING WITH NORTHWEST
FLOW ALOFT CONTINUING.  MODELS DO SHOW SOME HIGH/MID LEVEL CLOUDS
MOVING ACROSS THE REGION IN NORTHWEST FLOW THROUGH THURSDAY. A WEAK
SHORT-WAVE IS DEPICTED TO MOVE SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY.

.LONG TERM...(THU NIGHT THROUGH TUE)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES REMAIN 
IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH THE OVERALL 
UPPER AIR FLOW PATTERN. THIS CONSISTS OF THE PERSISTENT RIDGE 
WEST/TROUGH EAST REGIME WHICH MEANS CONTINUATION OF NORTHWESTERLY 
FLOW FOR THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THE DEVIL IS IN THE DETAILS 
HOWEVER AS A SERIES OF WEAK SHORT WAVES TRANSLATES THROUGH THE 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW. TIMING THESE INDIVIDUAL DISTURBANCES IS LARGELY 
AN EXERCISE IN FUTILITY. GFS HAS SPED UP THE WEEKEND EVENT SLIGHTLY. 
THE CANADIAN GEM STILL PROJECTS TIMING TO BE LATE SATURDAY/EARLY 
SUNDAY. THE NOGAPS ENSEMBLES SHOW VIRTUALLY NOTHING THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND. RATHER THAN CHASING THE WEEKEND EVENT...WILL CONTINUE AS 
CURRENTLY CONFIGURED IN THE GRIDS/FORECAST. GFS PROJECTS ANOTHER 
DISTURBANCE LATE MONDAY/EARLY TUESDAY. WILL INTRODUCE SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS FOR TUESDAY...HOWEVER CONFIDENCE IS NOT HIGH AT THIS POINT. 
GENERALLY USED A BLEND OF OPERATIONAL GFS AND GFS ENSEMBLE GUIDANCE 
FOR TEMPS.

TENNESSEE.

CONTINUE. WILL MAINTAIN CURRENT WARNING/ADVISORIES GOING THROUGH 4 
PM.  WILL LOWER SNOW ACCUMULATIONS TO 1 INCH OR LESS FOR THE CHA 
AREA.

GIVEN THE COLD AIR ADVECTION INTO THE REGION.

SHOULD FLATTEN THIS MORNING ALLOWING FOR BETTER CONVERGENCE AND 
GREATER SNOWFALL COVERAGE. LAPSE RATES SUPPORT SOME INSTABILITY 
SHOWERS BUT MAIN PRODUCTION WILL BE IN BANDS. SURFACE FINALLY HAS 
COOLED TO ALLOW FOR STEADY ACCUMULATION. UPSTREAM CLOUD COVER AND 
RADAR DEPICTIONS BEGINNING TO EXPAND. AVAILABLE MOISTURE...PWS NEAR 
.22 MAIN LIMITING FACTOR. BECAUSE OF THIS HAVE DECIDED TO DOWNGRADE 
SW VA WARNING TO ADVISORY LENDING FOCUS TO TODAYS EXPECTED 
ACCUMULATIONS. CAA UNDERWAY AND PRESSURE GRADIENT INCREASING LATER 
TODAY AND TONIGHT. WEST NORTHWEST WINDS 20 TO 30 MPH ACROSS SW VA 
AND MOST TN MNTS LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT. BREEZY WINDS ACROSS LOWER 
ELEVATIONS INTO THIS EVENING. UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUE TONIGHT 
IN SW VA AND TN MNTS WITH WDLY SCT SN AND FLURRIES ELSEWHERE ACROSS 
NORTHEAST TN. PATTERN BECOMES INCREASINGLY STABLE WITH LARGE SCALE 
TROUGH OVER EASTERN CAN AND US WITH REINFORCING SHORT WAVES DRIVING 
INTO AREA.
 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             41  24  47  27 /  20  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  35  22  41  24 /  60  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       36  22  41  25 /  60  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              33  21  37  20 /  80  30  10  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
.NC......SNOW ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM.
.TN......HEAVY SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM FOR THE 
CENTRAL AND NORTHERN MOUNTAINS.
SNOW ADVISORY IN EFFECT ELSEWHERE UNTIL 400 PM. 
LAKE WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1000 AM UNTIL 400 AM WEDNESDAY FOR 
THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN MOUNTAINS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
630 AM EST TUE MAR 1 2005

...UPDATE...ISSUED SNOW ADVISORY FOR SOUTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND 
UPPED POPS FOR SE TN. SNOW BANDS DEVELOPING ACROSS S MID TN AND LOOK 
TO TRACK ACROSS SOUTHERN PLATEAU FOR A FEW HOURS. REPORTS OF SNOW 
ALREADY ACCUMULATING AND EXPECTING ANOTHER COUPLE INCHES ACROSS 
HIGHER ELEVATION.

.DISCUSSION...COLD CORE OF UPPER TROUGH SWINGS EAST ACROSS NORTH 
PART OF MRX CWA TODAY. 500 MB TEMPS DROP TO NEAR -34C. INCREASING 
JET AXIS SWINGS EAST SOUTH OF AREA. SMALL SCALE RIDGING EXTENDING NE 
INTO AREA EARLY TODAY HAS HINDERED SNOWFALL OVERNIGHT. THIS FEATURE 
SHOULD FLATTEN THIS MORNING ALLOWING FOR BETTER CONVERGENCE AND 
GREATER SNOWFALL COVERAGE. LAPSE RATES SUPPORT SOME INSTABILITY 
SHOWERS BUT MAIN PRODUCTION WILL BE IN BANDS. SURFACE FINALLY HAS 
COOLED TO ALLOW FOR STEADY ACCUMULATION. UPSTREAM CLOUD COVER AND 
RADAR DEPICTIONS BEGINNING TO EXPAND. AVAILABLE MOISTURE...PWS NEAR 
.22 MAIN LIMITING FACTOR. BECAUSE OF THIS HAVE DECIDED TO DOWNGRADE 
SW VA WARNING TO ADVISORY LENDING FOCUS TO TODAYS EXPECTED 
ACCUMULATIONS. HAVE ALSO DROPPED ADVISORY FOR SOME CENTRAL TN VALLEY 
LOCATIONS SINCE WIDESPREAD TWO INCHES NOT EXPECTED. 
CAA UNDERWAY AND PRESSURE GRADIENT INCREASING LATER TODAY AND 
TONIGHT. WEST NORTHWEST WINDS 20 TO 30 MPH ACROSS SW VA AND MOST TN 
MNTS LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT. BREEZY WINDS ACROSS LOWER ELEVATIONS 
INTO THIS EVENING. UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUE TONIGHT IN SW VA 
AND TN MNTS WITH WDLY SCT SN AND FLURRIES ELSEWHERE ACROSS NORTHEAST 
TN. PATTERN BECOMES INCREASINGLY STABLE WITH LARGE SCALE TROUGH 
OVER EASTERN CAN AND US WITH REINFORCING SHORT WAVES DRIVING INTO 
AREA.

FXUS64 KMRX 010217
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EST MON FEB 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE 
EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE APPALACHIANS...WITH BREEZY WEST WINDS 
ADVECTING COOLER AND DRIER AIR INTO THE FORECAST AREA BEHIND THIS 
FRONT. A STRONG UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH OVER THE MIDWEST THIS EVENING 
WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE EAST INTO THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS BY SUNRISE. 
LIGHT SNOW HAS ALREADY BEEN REPORTED AT CROSSVILLE AND WISE VA THIS 
EVENING...WITH KOHX RADAR REVEALING SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS 
MIDDLE TN ASSOCIATED WITH MUCH COLDER TEMPS ALOFT. IN FACT...THE 
NASHVILLE EVENING SOUNDING REVEALED A COLDER VERTICAL PROFILE THAN 
THE GFS AND NAM/ETA MODELS (ESPECIALLY AROUND 700 MB)...WHICH SHOULD 
RESULT IN STEEPER LAPSE RATES FOR THE FORECAST AREA LATER TONIGHT. 
AS A RESULT...COVERAGE OF SNOW SHOWERS WILL LIKELY INCREASE TOWARDS 
SUNRISE AS THIS COLDER AIR ALOFT MOVES ACROSS THE REGION. UPSLOPE 
FLOW IN THE MOUNTAINS SHOULD ALSO ENHANCE THE COVERAGE AND INTENSITY 
OF SNOW SHOWERS THERE OVERNIGHT.

CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS TO BE IN GOOD SHAPE OVERALL THIS EVENING... 
BUT WILL PLAN TO UPDATE TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...

.NC......SNOW ADVISORY FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT UNTIL 4 PM TUESDAY FOR 
NCZ060-061.

.TN......HEAVY SNOW WARNING TONIGHT UNTIL 4 PM TUESDAY FOR TNZ018- 
041-043-045-047-072-074.

SNOW ADVISORY FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT UNTIL 4 PM TUESDAY FOR TNZ012> 
017-035>040-042-044-046-067>071-073-087-102.

.VA......HEAVY SNOW WARNING TONIGHT UNTIL 4 PM TUESDAY FOR VAZ001- 
002-005-006-008.

&&

DMG

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 281947
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
247 PM EST MON FEB 28 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT)...UPPER TROUGH WILL DIG
SOUTH INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS OVERNIGHT AND TUESDAY. COLD 
FRONT...CURRENTLY ACROSS WESTERN/MID TENNESSEE WILL SWING SOUTHEAST
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING WITH TEMPERATURES QUICKLY DROPPING
INTO THE UPPER 20S AND MID 30S AFTER FROPA.  MAIN STRATIFORM PRECIPITATIN
AREA WILL MOVE EAST OF THE AREA THIS EVENING ALONG AND AHEAD OF 
FRONT. 

HOWEVER...AS COLD AIR ALOFT ASSOCIATED WITH DIGGING UPPER TROUGH MOVES
INTO THE REGION OVERNIGHT AND TUESDAY A GOOD DEAL OF SHOWERS WILL BREAK
OUT AS BOUNDARY BECOMES UNSTABLE. SATELLITE SHOWS A GOOD DEAL OF
CELLUAR/CONVECTIVE NATURE TO THE CLOUDS OVER MISSOURI AND ILLINOIS 
ASSOCIATED WITH COLD AIR ALOFT. NAM SOUNDINGS RELATIVELY UNSTABLE 
CONDITIONS FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON. ANTICIPATE
A GOOD DEAL OF SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY WITH THE POTENTIAL OF BANDING
SNOW SQUALLS PRODUCING BRIEF MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOWS.  WILL EXTEND
HEAVY SNOW WARNING UNTIL 4 PM AND ISSUE A SNOW ADVISORY FROM MIDNIGHT
TONIGHT THROUGH 4 PM FOR THE NORTHERN PLATEAU...NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE...AND CENTRAL VALLEY.

FOR TUESDAY NIGHT...SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY WILL WEAKEN AS AIRMASS BECOMES
WELL MIXED AND DIMINISH TO FLURRIES OVERNIGHT. 

.LONG TERM...(WED THROUGH MON)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES IN GENERAL 
AGREEMENT WITH LONGWAVE PATTERN TREND OF RIDGE WEST/TROUGH EAST 
PERSISTING THROUGH THE PERIOD. THIS WILL KEEP THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS IN NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT. DRY WEATHER ANTICIPATED 
THROUGH THE PERIOD WITH THE EXCEPTION OF LATE SATURDAY/EARLY SUNDAY 
WHEN A MINOR DISTURBANCE TRANSLATES THROUGH THE NORTHWESTERLY FLOW 
INTO THE AREA. NOT ANTICIPATING THIS TO BE A SIGNIFICANT EVENT AT 
THIS TIME AND CONTINUED WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS. ALSO...STILL SOME 
UNCERTAINTY WITH RESPECT TO TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM. TEMPS WILL SLOWLY 
MODERATE FROM WELL BELOW CLIMO TO NEAR CLIMO BY LATE IN THE PERIOD 
AS EASTERN LONGWAVE TROUGH DEAMPLIFIES SOMEWHAT. GENERALLY STAYED 
CLOSE TO GFS GUIDANCE VALUES FOR TEMPS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             31  41  24  47 /  30  20  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  30  35  22  41 /  70  60  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       29  36  22  41 /  70  60  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              27  33  21  37 / 100  80  30  10 

&&

.TN......HEAVY SNOW WARNING FOR TONIGHT UNTIL 4 PM TUESDAY FOR

FXUS64 KMRX 281451
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
951 AM EST MON FEB 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...BANDS OF SNOW CONTINUES TO MOVE ACROSS THE HEAVY SNOW
WARNING AREA WITH REPORTS OF 3 TO 6 INCHES ALREADY RECEIVED ACROSS
PARTS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS. THE 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE VALLEY REPORTS HAVE BEEN GENERALLY LESS THAN ONE
INCH OF SLUSHY SNOW. SATELLITE AND AREA RAOBS SHOW UPPER TROUGH STILL
DIGGING SOUTH ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS
WITH A COLD FRONT ANALYZED OVER WESTERN TENNESSEE. ALSO...SURFACE LOW
STRENGTHENING OFF THE CAROLINA COASTS.

BANDS OF PRECIPITATION WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST
AREA TODAY WITH LATEST TEMPERATURE PROFILE FROM THE NAM SUGGESTING
MAINLY SNOW FOR THE WARNING AREA.  A MIXTURE OF SNOW AND RAIN FOR
THE ADVISORY AREA. SINCE GROUND TEMPERATURES REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING
AND TEMPERATURES WILL BE AT OR ABOVE FREEZING IN THE ADVISORY AREA...
FEEL SIGNIFICANT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL BE LESS THAN ONE INCH FOR
THE TRI AREA. WILL CANCEL THE ADVISORY FOR NOW...HOWEVER...MAINTAIN
CURRENT HEAVY SNOW WARNING FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

COLD FRONT WILL SWEEP ACROSS THE REGION THIS EVENING WITH NAM SHOWING
STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION...ESPECIALLY ALOFT. FAIRLY STEEP BOUNDARY
LAYER LAPSE RATES SETUP FOR LATER TONIGHT AND TUESDAY GIVING THE
AREA WITH A DECENT CHANCE OF SEEING SNOW SHOWERS. MAY NEED TO EXTEND
HEAVY SNOW WARNING INTO TUESDAY AND ISSUE A SNOW ADVISORY FOR AT LEAST
THE PLATEAU...NORTHEAST TENNESSEE (TRI AREA)...AND POSSIBLY CENTRAL
VALLEY (TYS AREA) FOR LATE TONIGHT AND TUESDAY.

&&
.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
.NC......NONE.
.TN...HEAVY SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM TUESDAY
FOR THE CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS.
.VA...HEAVY SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM TUESDAY 

&&

$$

DH

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 281158 CCA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...CORRECTION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
700 AM EST MON FEB 28 2005

CORRECTION TO WATCH/WARNING SECTON

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...DYNAMIC COOLING UNDERESTIMATED 
BY GUIDANCE EARLY THIS MORNING. T/TDS ACROSS NE PART OF MRX CWA 
ABOUT 4 DEGREES BELOW CURRENT AND PREVIOUS MOS. EXPANDED WSWMRX TO 
INCLUDE SNOW ADVISORY FOR NE TENNESSEE THIS MORNING. HEAVY SNOW 
WARNING LOOKS ON TRACK FOR SW VA AND TN MNTS SMOKYS NORTHWARD. BEST 
LIFT PROVIDED THIS MORNING BY SHORT WAVE MOVING NE THROUGH THE AREA. 
THIS FEATURE IS PRESSED BETWEEN STRONG SOUTHERN STREAM FM CNTRL 
GLFMEX TO OFF MID ATLC CST AND APPROACHING TROUGH FM NW WITH A GOOD 
IMPULSE DIVING DOWN ITS BACKSIDE. MODELS POSITIONS OF SFC LOW OFF SC 
CST NOT TO BAD BUT ALL SEEM A TAD TOO HIGH WITH PRESSURE. THIS 
FEATURE WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE RAPIDLY NNE UP EAST CST TODAY AND 
TONIGHT. ATTENTION SHIFTS TO TROUGH WHICH SWINGS SE THROUGH AREA 
TONIGHT. THIS FEATURE DEEPER AND COLDER THAN PREVIOUS MODEL RUNS. A 
SFC LOWS SPINS WITHIN THIS TROUGH ACROSS N OH RVR VLY THROUGH 
TONIGHT. WITH THIS SHIFTING PATTERN SFC FLOW ACROSS MRX CWA 
UNDERGOES NEAR FULL CIRCLE SWING TODAY AND TONIGHT. STARTING WITH NE 
FLOW SHIFTING QUICKLY THROUGH THE S TO SW BY THIS AFTERNOON WITH 
GOOD CAA OVERNIGHT. MOST AREAS WILL SEE SNOW AND FLURRIES. FLOW NOT 
FAVORABLE FOR UPSLOPE SNOW PRODUCTION AND MODELS SHOW RAPID DROP IN 
AVAILABLE MOISTURE SO VALLEY AMOUNTS NOT IMPRESSIVE AT THIS TIME. 
CONCERNED MOISTURE TONIGHT UNDERDONE BUT HAVE MADE LITTLE CHANGE TO 
CURRENT QPF FORECAST BUT HAVE INCREASED LIKELIHOOD.

.LONG TERM...TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY...THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL 
BE EXITING THE AREA ON TUESDAY WITH PRECIP CONTINUING TO TAPER OFF 
THROUGHOUT THE DAY.  HOWEVER...THE WESTERLY FLOW...THOUGH NOT THE 
BEST FOR UPSLOPE LIFT...SHOULD BE SUFFICIENT FOR LINGERING SNOW 
SHOWERS OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF OUR NORTHEAST THROUGH TUESDAY 
NIGHT.  THESE SNOW SHOWERS SHOULD END ON WEDNESDAY AS A DRIER AIR 
MASS FILTERS IN.  WITH A BREAK BETWEEN SYSTEMS...TEMPERATURES WILL 
SLOWLY MODERATE AS WELL.  MODELS STILL HAVING PROBLEMS RESOLVING THE 
DETAILS OF A WAVE DROPPING DOWN THE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT.  
CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW ON THE TIMING AND STRENGTH OF THE WAVE...SO 
FOR NOW WILL CONTINUE WITH LOW POPS FOR SUNDAY.

&&
.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             46  32  42  25 /  70  30  20  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  45  31  38  22 /  90  50  30  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       45  30  38  22 /  90  50  30  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              39  28  34  20 / 100  60  50  20 

&&
.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
.NC......NONE.
.TN...HEAVY SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM TUESDAY
FOR THE CENTRAL AND NORTHEAST MOUNTAINS.
SNOW ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON FOR PORTIONS OF NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE.
.VA...HEAVY SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM TUESDAY
&&

$$

SON/MJB

MASS FILTERS IN.  WITH A BREAK BETWEEN SYSTEMS...TEMPERATURES WILL 
SLOWLY MODERATE AS WELL.  MODELS STILL HAVING PROBLEMS RESOLVING THE 
DETAILS OF A WAVE DROPPING DOWN THE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT.  
CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW ON THE TIMING AND STRENGTH OF THE WAVE...SO 
FOR NOW WILL CONTINUE WITH LOW POPS FOR SUNDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
915 PM EST SUN FEB 27 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE CENTERED OVER 
NORTHERN FLORIDA NEAR JACKSONVILLE...WITH A WEAK TROUGH GENERALLY 
ALONG THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. LIGHT RAIN HAS FINALLY MOVED ACROSS 
MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...AS THE DRY BOUNDARY LAYER 
SLOWLY CONTINUES TO MOISTEN. KMRX VAD WIND PROFILE INDICATES A WARM 
AIR ADVECTION PATTERN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...WITH SOUTHEAST FLOW 
UP TO AROUND 8000 FEET. THIS SOUTHEAST FLOW WILL PRODUCE DOWNSLOPE 
EFFECTS OVERNIGHT ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEYS...WHICH 
SHOULD KEEP RAINFALL AMOUNTS ON THE LIGHT SIDE. MOST PRECIP TONIGHT 
WILL BE CONFINED TO THE WESTERN NC MOUNTAINS WHERE UPSLOPE FLOW WILL 
OCCUR. LATEST EVENING SOUNDINGS FROM GSO AND RNK REVEAL A SLIGHTLY 
COLDER VERTICAL PROFILE THAN THE MODELS...WHICH SUPPORTS THE CURRENT 
FORECAST OF ALL SNOW FOR THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. PRECIP MAY START IN 
THE FORM OF A MIXTURE OF RAIN AND SNOW ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
THIS EVENING...BUT THIS RAIN SHOULD QUICKLY CHANGE-OVER TO SNOW 
BEFORE MIDNIGHT AS STRONGER LIFT (CURRENTLY OVER NORTHWEST GA) 
CROSSES THE SMOKIES CREATING STRONG DYNAMIC COOLING. ALSO...AN UPPER 
TROUGH OVER THE MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEY WILL GRADUALLY MOVE TOWARD 
THE REGION BY SUNRISE...BRINGING MUCH COLDER ALOFT ACROSS THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. FOR REST OF THE FORECAST AREA...THE BOUNDARY LAYER 
SHOULD REMAIN WARM ENOUGH FOR MOSTLY RAIN OVERNIGHT...SINCE 
DEWPOINTS CONTINUE TO RISE WELL ABOVE THE FREEZING MARK.

CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS TO BE IN GOOD SHAPE OVERALL...BUT WILL PLAN 
TO UPDATE THIS EVENING TO START THE HEAVY SNOW WARNING NOW AND TO 
REMOVE EVENING WORDING.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
.NC......NONE.

.TN......HEAVY SNOW WARNING UNTIL 6 AM TUESDAY MORNING FOR THE 
CENTRAL AND NORTHERN MOUNTAINS ABOVE 2500 FEET.

.VA......HEAVY SNOW WARNING UNTIL 6 AM TUESDAY MORNING FOR 
ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET.

FXUS64 KMRX 272001
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST SUN FEB 27 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...RATHER COMPLICATED SCENARIO 
SHAPING UP FOR THE SHORT TERM. MODELS HAVE COME INTO A LITTLE BETTER 
AGREEMENT ON THE TRACK OF THE SURFACE LOW...CURRENTLY CENTERED IN 
THE NORTHEASTERN GULF OF MEXICO...GENERALLY ALONG THE ATLANTIC 
COAST. THIS TRACK DIMINISHES OUR QPF SOMEWHAT BUT ALSO RESULTS IN 
SLIGHTLY COOLER TEMPS. THIS IS STILL A VERY BORDERLINE EVENT AND 
EVEN AN INCREMENTAL DEVIATION IN TEMPS WILL HAVE A PROFOUND EFFECTS 
ON SNOW ACCUMULATIONS. GENERALLY GOING WITH THE SLIGHTLY COOLER NAM 
WHICH SUGGESTS SIGNIFICANT SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ARE POSSIBLE...MAINLY 
IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. WILL ISSUE HEAVY SNOW WARNING FOR CENTRAL AND 
NORTHERN MOUNTAIN ZONES...ALONG WITH HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF 
SOUTHWESTERN VIRGINIA. SNOW ALSO POSSIBLE IN NORTHEASTERN AND EVEN 
CENTRAL VALLEYS...BUT BOUNDARY LAYER LOOKS TOO WARM FOR SNOW TO 
ACCUMULATE SIGNIFICANTLY.

UPPER NORTHERN STREAM TROUGH SWINGS TOWARD THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
ON MONDAY. WRAP AROUND MOISTURE WITH THIS FEATURE WILL CONTINUE 
SHOWERY PRECIP ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN. NAM SOUNDINGS 
INDICATE SOME INSTABILITY/CAPE AS THIS UPPER TROUGH SWINGS THROUGH. 
HOWEVER...RATHER WEAK FLOW AND NON-IDEAL UPSLOPE (WESTERLY) FLOW 
COMPONENT CASTS SOME UNCERTAINTY OF POTENTIAL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS 
IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN FOR THE SECOND PERIOD ALSO.

.LONG TERM...(MON NIGHT THROUGH SUN)...UPPER TROUGH DIGS IN MONDAY 
NIGHT...ALONG WITH STRONG COLD ADVECTION.  MOISTURE PROFILE AND LOW 
LEVEL LAPSE RATES LOOK LIKE WE SHOULD HAVE SIGNIFICANT SNOW SHOWER 
ACTIVITY AROUND MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY...ALTHOUGH LOW LEVEL 
FLOW MORE WESTERLY THAN IS IDEAL FOR UPSLOPE SNOW EVENT...WHICH 
SHOULD HELP LIMIT AMOUNTS.  STILL LOOKS LIKE FAIRLY HIGH POPS WILL 
BE NEEDED HOWEVER...AND SNOW AMOUNTS LOOK SIGNIFICANT ENOUGH TO 
CONTINUE HEAVY SNOW WARNING  FOR NORTHERN AND CENTRAL MOUNTAINS AND 
PARTS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT.   COLD ADVECTION 
AND UPSLOPE FLOW LINGER INTO EARLY WED...SO WILL GRADUALLY TAPER 
POPS TO JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE IN NORMALLY FAVORED UPSLOPE LOCATIONS 
BY EARLY WED...THEN DRY BY WED NIGHT.  FURTHER OUT...MODELS HAVING A 
HARD TIME RESOLVING ANY SHORT WAVE ENERGY COMING DOWN IN THE 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT.  CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH FOR LATE IN THE 
PERIOD...BUT FOR NOW WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR SAT NIGHT AND 
SUNDAY AS WE MAY BE DEALING WITH A WEAK SYSTEM IN THAT TIME FRAME.

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY THROUGH MONDAY)...SHORT WAVE WITH DECENT
