SOUTHERN STREAM AS A NORTHERN STREAM IMPULSE DIGS SOUTHWARD TOWARDS 
THE BACKSIDE OF THE SHORT WAVE LATER TODAY. SFC LOW DEVELOPS UNDER 
SOUTHERN STREAM ALONG THE NORTH GLF CST INTO N FL TODAY. ASCENDING 
FLOW IN ADVANCE OF THESE FEATURES DRAWS DEEPENING MOISTURE ACROSS 
MRX CWA TODAY AND CONTINUES INTO MONDAY WITH WIDESPREAD PCPN. SHORT 
WAVE MOVES NE INTO E TN TONIGHT WITH INCREASING SOUTHERN STREAM TO 
THE SE. DIGGING IMPULSE CARVES TROUGH DOWN FM W GRTLKS. SFC LOW 
MOVES NE FM N FL TONIGHT WITH VARYING MODEL POSITIONS. FAVOR CSTL 
CAROLINA GFS TRACK. A SECOND SFC LOW DEVELOPS OVER N IL. PCPN TYPE 
NEAR CRITICAL THICKNESS VALUES DEPENDING ON HOW MUCH LOW LEVEL 
COOLING OCCURS ON NW SIDE OF LOW TRACK. A WET SNOW IS LIKELY TONIGHT 
ACROSS NE PARTS OF MRX CWA FAVORING HIGHER ELEVATIONS. INITIAL SFC 
TEMPS NOT FAVORABLE FOR ACCUMULATIONS HOWEVER POTENTIAL SNOW RATES 
FAIRLY HIGH. LEANING TOWARD A WARMER SOLUTION AND WILL LET DAY SHIFT 
ADJUST FORECAST IF NEEDED SINCE A SLIGHTLY COOLER TREND WOULD RESULT 
IN SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL. IMPULSE IN NORTHERN STREAM SWINGS EAST IN 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AS EASTERN SFC LOW CONTINUES TO PULL NE. 
BREEZY SWRLY LOW LEVEL FLOW GETS UNDERWAY WITH ENOUGH WARMING TO 
CHANGE ALL PCPN BACK TO RAIN WITH A DECREASING PCPN TREND WHEN EXIT 
REGION OF IMPULSE MOVES THROUGH IN THE AFTN.   

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...A COLD FRONT WILL 
BE EXITING THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT...BUT MOISTURE AND WEAK LIFT FROM 
WAVES ROTATING AROUND THE UPPER TROUGH COMBINED WITH LIMITED UPSLOPE 
FROM WESTERLY FLOW WILL CONTINUE SCATTERED SHOWERS OVER THE AREA.  
TEMPS WILL FALL BEHIND THE FRONT AND SCATTERED RAIN SHOULD TURN TO 
SNOW IN THE TENNESSEE VALLEY DURING THE EVENING.  ON TUESDAY... 
ISOLATED SNOW SHOWERS...TURNING TO RAIN IN THE TENNESSEE VALLEY IN 
THE AFTERNOON...WILL LINGER OVER THE AREA AS THE SYSTEM CONTINUES TO 
PULL AWAY FROM THE REGION.  MODELS CONTINUE TO HAVE PROBLEMS WITH 
TIMING AND POSITION OF A WAVE MOVING IN TOWARD THE LATER PART OF THE 
EXTENDED...AND CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW.  BUT...FOR NOW WILL CONTINUE 
WITH LOW POPS FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
238 PM EST SAT FEB 26 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...MAIN ISSUE FOR THE SHORT TERM 
PERIOD IS TIMING OF THE ONSET OF PRECIP IN THE SECOND PERIOD. 
SIGNIFICANT SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM...CURRENTLY AFFECTING MUCH OF 
TEXAS...IS PROJECTED TO PROGRESS NORTHEASTWARD OVER THE NEXT 24 
HOURS. THE NAM...GFS AND SHORT RANGE ENSEMBLES (SREF) ALL GENERALLY 
AGREE THAT PRECIP WILL ENCROACH THE SOUTHERN TIER BY 18Z SUNDAY AND 
PROGRESSIVELY OVERSPREAD THE REST OF THE FORECAST AREA BY 00Z 
MONDAY. GFS IS ACTUALLY A LITTLE SLOWER WITH THIS PROCESS THAN THE 
NAM...AND AM INCLINED TO FAVOR IT AS THE PROJECTED DOWNSLOPE FLOW 
COMPONENT WILL TEND TO DELAY PRECIP ONSET FOR CENTRAL AND NORTHERN  
SECTIONS. CANT COMPLETELY RULE OUT THE NAM TIMING THOUGH SINCE THE 
SREF TENDS TO SUPPORT IT. 

MEANWHILE...BENIGN WEATHER WILL RULE WITH ONLY AN INCREASE 
IN HIGH CLOUDS AS SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM APPROACHES. GUIDANCE TEMPS 
ARE GENERALLY CLOSE AND APPEAR REASONABLE. NOT ANTICIPATING AS LARGE 
A DIURNAL TEMP SWING AS INCREASING CLOUD COVER SHOULD PRECLUDE THAT.

.LONG TERM...(SUN NIGHT THROUGH SAT)...MODELS CONTINUE TO DEPICT 
COMPLEX SITUATION FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.  NAM/GFS DO NOT AGREE 
WELL...SINCE THE GFS NOW DEPICTS SIGNIFICANT COASTAL DEVELOPMENT OFF 
THE EAST COAST.  NAM STILL TRYING TO KEEP LOW PRESSURE CENTER 
FURTHER WEST.  WILL FOLLOW HPC LEAD ON THIS...AND GENERALLY GO 
CLOSER TO THE GFS SOLUTION.  THIS BRINGS MORE OF A POSSIBILITY OF 
WINTRY PRECIP TO PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND INTO THE 
NORTHERN AND CENTRAL MOUNTAINS...AS THERMAL PROFILES ARE CLOSE FOR 
SNOW...ESPECIALLY OVER THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  ALSO...WHILE WIND 
DIRECTION IS NOT GREAT FOR A MAJOR UPSLOPE EVENT...A BIT TOO 
WESTERLY...SHOULD STILL SEE SOME SNOW SHOWERS IN THE STRONG COLD 
ADVECTION AS UPPER TROUGH DIGS IN MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY.  WHILE 
CONFIDENCE ON PRECIP TYPE TOO LOW AT THIS POINT FOR ANY 
WATCHES/ADVISORIES FOR SUN NIGHT AND MONDAY...WILL ISSUE SPS TALKING 
ABOUT POSSIBILITY OF SNOW...ESPECIALLY OVER SOME OF THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN...AND ALSO THE SNOW SHOWERS ON THE BACK SIDE MONDAY NIGHT 
INTO TUESDAY.  FURTHER OUT...MODELS STILL HAVING TROUBLE WITH THE 
DETAILS OF ANY SHORT WAVE COMING DOWN IN THE NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT.  
FOR NOW WILL CARRY LOW POPS FOR FRIDAY INTO SATURDAY...AS GFS 
DEPICTING SHORT WAVE ENERGY MOST LIKELY IN THAT TIME FRAME.

WILL CONTINUE WIDESPREAD PRECIP OVER THE AREA...HOWEVER...COLDER AIR 
WILL PUSH IN WITH THE FRONT...SLOWLY TURNING RAIN TO SNOW LATE 
MONDAY INTO MONDAY NIGHT.  THE FRONT WILL EXIT THE AREA MONDAY NIGHT

LINGERING INTO TUESDAY.  MODEL CONSISTENCY REMAINS POOR FOR THE 
REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED.  BUT...BELIEVE WE WILL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS 
WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...WITH THE NEXT SYSTEM MOVING IN ON FRIDAY.  
HOWEVER...CONFIDENCE IN THE TIMING OF THIS SYSTEM REMAINS QUITE 
LOW.

MENTION SOME WINTRY PRECIP IN THE FAR NORTH AND NORTHERN

PUSHING IN...AND MAY SEE MORE PRECIP CHANGING TO SNOW OVER THE 
HIGHER TERRAIN BY LATE IN THE DAY.  WITH UPPER TROUGH DIGGING IN AND 
COLD ADVECTION...POSSIBILITY OF SNOW SHOWERS ALL ZONES BY LATE

QUESTION.  WILL THEREFORE CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR NOW.

755 PM EST THU FEB 24 2005

.DISCUSSION...SHORTWAVE TROUGH IS STILL JUST A BIT UPSTREAM THIS 
EVENING...BUT SHOULD PASS EAST OF THE REGION AROUND MIDNIGHT.  
ALREADY SEEING SOME DRY AIR/SUBSIDENCE ACROSS THE MID MISS AND OHIO 
RIVER VALLEYS ON WATER VAPOR SATELLITE PICS. AT THE SURFACE...THE 
INVERTED TROUGH AXIS HAS SHIFTED JUST EAST INTO WRN NC WITH 
NORTHERLY WINDS INCREASING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AT THIS TIME. 
THESE NORTHERLY WINDS HAVE HELPED CLOUD CEILINGS TO RISE...WITH MORE 
IMPROVEMENT AS THE DRY AIR AND SUBSIDENCE SPREADS OUR WAY LATER 
TONIGHT.  

THE ONLY PRECIPITATION SO FAR THIS EVENING HAS BEEN SCATTERED AREAS 
OF LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE ACROSS EXTREME NE TN AND PARTS OF SWRN VA.
LITTLE TO NO RADAR ECHOES BACK IN THE COLDER AIR WHICH HAS ADVECTED 
INTO THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND EXTREME WRN COUNTIES OF SWRN VA.
MAY NEED TO CONTINUE SOME VERY LOW POPS FOR EXTREME NE TN AND SWRN 
VA...BUT WILL DECIDE ON THIS LATER.

WILL UPDATE THE ZONE FORECAST (ZFP) AND REMOVE ANY EVENING OR AFTER 
MIDNIGHT WORDING BY 930 PM EST...AND FRESHEN THE GRIDS AND WEB 
PRODUCTS AS WELL.

PASSAGE OF THIS WAVE AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE AREA.

NOT MAKE ANY WHOLESALE CHANGES TO EXISTING GRIDS FOR THE MOST PART.


.LONG TERM...(FRI NIGHT THROUGH THU)...A WEAK AND MOISTURE STARVED  
COLD FRONT WILL SLIP INTO THE AREA FROM THE NORTH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT 
INTO SATURDAY...BUT SHOULD DO LITTLE MORE THAN INCREASE THE CLOUDS A 
BIT.  NEXT SYSTEM RATHER COMPLEX...AND UNCERTAINTY WITH MODEL 
SOLUTIONS CONTINUES.  ALTHOUGH TRACK VARIES FROM MODEL TO 
MODEL...SHOULD SEE SURFACE LOW PRESSURE FORMING IN THE NORTHERN GULF 
AND TRACKING NORTHEAST...AS ANOTHER LOW TRACKS EAST SOMEWHERE NEAR 
THE GREAT LAKES.  COLD FRONT TO SWING THROUGH OUR AREA FROM THE 
WEST...BUT TIMING UNCERTAIN. FOR NOW WILL GENERALLY TRY TO FOLLOW 
HPC LEAD...SLOWING DOWN THE FRONT FROM THE GFS SOLUTION. WILL GO 
WITH A FRONTAL PASSAGE DURING MONDAY NIGHT.   SIGNIFICANT UPPER 
TROUGHING TO DIG INTO THE AREA...WITH RATHER COLD AIR PUSHING IN 
LATE MONDAY NIGHT INTO TUESDAY NIGHT. SHOULD SEE SOME UPSLOPE SNOW 
SHOWERS WITH THIS SURGE OF COLD AIR.  PRECIP TYPE FOR EARLIER PRECIP 
STILL PROBLEMATIC...WITH THERMAL PROFILES SUGGESTING POSSIBILITY OF 
WINTRY PRECIP...AT LEAST IN PARTS OF NORTH AND MOUNTAINS.  WILL 
ALLOW FOR RAIN OR SNOW IN PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE 
NORTHERN AND CENTRAL MOUNTAINS FOR LATE SUNDAY NIGHT INTO EARLY 
MONDAY.  UNCERTAINTY STILL QUITE HIGH FOR DAYS 6 AND 7...BUT FOR NOW 
PLAN TO GO DRY BOTH DAYS AS HPC PREFERRED SOLUTION DEPICTS HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING IN.

NORTHEAST TO LITTLE TO NO POPS FOR THE PLATEAU COUNTIES AND SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE.

LATEST NAM SHOWS FORECAST AREA REMAINING UNDER BROKEN-OVERCAST LOW STRATUS
CLOUDS TODAY. NORTHERN STREAM SHORT-WAVE TROUGH WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO
VALLEY TODAY PROVIDING EMPHASIS TO PULL INVERTED TROUGH OVER THE REGION
EAST OF THE AREA WITH COLD AIR ADVECTION WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE FOR LATE TODAY
AND THIS EVENING. WILL CONTINUE WITH A CHANCE OF SHOWERS SHOWERS/FLURRIES FOR
MAINLY THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA...NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...
AND SMOKY MOUNTAINS.  LITTLE TO NO SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ANTICIPATED.

FOR FRIDAY...NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AND SURFACE RIDGING WILL BE THE RULE WITH
AIRMASS DRYING OUT ALLOWING SKY TO GO MOSTLY CLEAR.  RETURN OF SUNSHINE WILL
ALLOW TEMPERATURES TO WARM TO NEAR SEASONAL LEVELS.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW AN
AREA OF LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPING ACROSS THE EASTERN GULF COAST STATES THEN
MOVING NORTHEAST INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY.
WILL CONTINUE WITH A CHANCE OF RAIN. ECMWF AND GFS HAVE SOME DISAGREEMENTS
TO UPPER TROUGH DIGGING INTO THE EASTERN UNITED STATES TUESDAY AND WEDNESDAY.
WILL FOLLOW ECMWF WHICH IS MORE CONSISTENT AND DEPICTS A SLIGHTLY SLOWER
EVOLUTION OF THE TROUGH. EITHER WAY COLDER TEMPERATURES BY MID-WEEK NEXT
WEEK WITH A CHANCE OF SNOW SHOWERS AND FLURRIES.

740 PM EST WED FEB 23 2005

.DISCUSSION...MID TO HIGH LEVEL CLOUDINESS RAPIDLY SPREADING NE 
ACROSS OUR FORECAST AREA THIS EVENING...WITH 00Z TEMPS QUITE MILD IN 
THE MID 40S TO UPPER 50S.  WATCHING DEWPOINT TEMPS ACROSS MAINLY 
SWRN VA...WHERE CURRENT READINGS WERE IN THE MID TO UPPER 20S.  THE 
AREA OF RAIN IS SPREADING EAST ABOUT 30 TO 35 MPH FROM MIDDLE TN AND 
WRN AL...AND LATEST RADAR PICS SEEM MORE IN LINE WITH THE ETA MODEL
THAN THE SLIGHTLY FASTER GFS MODEL.  GIVEN THE WARM AIR ADVECTION 
ALOFT...PLUS CURRENT TEMPS AND DEWPOINTS...IT DOES APPEAR THAT OUR 
AREA SHOULD ESCAPE ANY WINTRY MIX OVERNIGHT AND AT LEAST WELL INTO 
THURSDAY.  THE ONLY THREAT WOULD BE IF SURFACE TEMPS COULD FALL 
BELOW FREEZING ACROSS THE NE TIP OF TN INTO SWRN VA...AND THIS LOOKS 
UNLIKELY AT THIS POINT.  THEN OF COURSE...A PERIOD OF RAIN/SNOW MIX 
OR SNOW SHOWERS FOR HIGHER ELEVATIONS POSSIBLE BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON 
AND/OR EVENING AS THE COLD AIR ADVECTS INTO THE REGION...AND LIGHT 
PCPN CONTINUES IN ADVANCE OF THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH.  

OTHER CONCERN WAS THE POSSIBILITY OF THUNDERSTORMS...DUE TO ELEVATED 
INSTABILITY...MAKING IT AS FAR NE AS OUR SE TN ZONES.  HOWEVER...THE 
LIGHTNING ACTIVITY HAS BEEN STEADILY DIMINISHING TO OUR SOUTH...SO 
THUNDERSTORMS LOOK TO REMAIN WELL TO OUR SOUTH OVERNIGHT.  

WILL UPDATE THE ZFP PRODUCT BY 930 PM AND REMOVE EVENING WORDING...
AND ALSO FRESHEN GRIDS/WEB PRODUCTS AS NEEDED.

.SHORT TERM...
LARGE AREA OF PRECIP STILL TRUDGING TOWARD AREA.  NO MAJOR PROBLEMS 
EXPECTED FROM THIS SYSTEM AS AIR MASS EXPECTED TO BE RELATIVELY

NORTHEAST OF REGION.  ALSO EXPECTING PRECIP IN THAT AREA TO STAY 
LIGHT.  LATE IN THE DAY ON THURSDAY AS COLD AIR COMES IN...COULD 
CHANGE OVER TO SNOW...BUT MOISTURE IS ON ITS WAY OUT. WILL NOT ENTER 
ANY SNOW AMOUNTS IN THURSDAY GRID.  

NOT PUTTING ANY THUNDER IN FORECAST FOR TONIGHT...THINK IT WILL STAY 
SOUTH.  ELEVATED THUNDER OCCURRING NOW IN NRN MS...ONE THING TO KEEP 
EYE ON THIS EVENING IS WHETHER IT TRIES TO MAKE A MOVE FARTHER NORTH.

HAVE WARMED UP TEMPS ON THURSDAY AS WARMING AHEAD OF FRONT SHOULD 
SPREAD ACROSS ALL OF REGION INTO THE EARLY AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM...(THU NIGHT THROUGH WED)...COLD ADVECTION CONTINUES INTO 
EARLY THU NIGHT AND SOME LOW LEVEL MOISTURE SHOULD HANG AROUND FOR A 
WHILE...BUT LOW LEVEL FLOW FAIRLY QUICKLY TURNS MORE ANTICYCLONIC 
AND LOW LEVEL LAPSE RATES DO NOT APPEAR TO IMPRESSIVE...SO THINK ANY 
UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS WILL BE LIMITED.  FOR NOW WILL JUST CONTINUE 
CHANCE IN THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL MOUNTAINS INTO SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA...AND QUICKLY TAPER TO FLURRIES.  SHOULD BE DRY FRIDAY INTO 
SUNDAY AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE AND WEAK UPPER RIDGING TAKE 
CONTROL.  CONFIDENCE NOT HIGH ON NEXT SYSTEM MODELS IN SOME 
DISAGREEMENT. GENERALLY ACCEPTED THE HPC BLENDED SOLUTION...WHICH 
BRINGS A SURFACE LOW BY TO OUR SOUTH SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY...THEN 
A COLD FRONT SWEEPS THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT.  UPPER TROUGH DIGS IN AND 
MODELS INDICATE SIGNIFICANT COLD ADVECTION INTO TUESDAY...SO MAY SEE 
SOME UPSLOPE PRECIP. WILL GO DRY FOR NOW ON WED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
322 AM EST WED FEB 23 2005

.SHORT TERM...AREA OF LOW CLOUDS PERSIST ACROSS MIDDLE TENNESSEE AND
ACROSS NORTHERN SECTIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. LATEST NAM SHOWS DOWNSLOPE
NORTHWEST WINDS KEEPING CLOUDS MAINLY WEST AND NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA...
EXCEPT FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND FAR NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. LOW CLOUDS WILL
EVENTUALLY DISSIPATE BY NOON...HOWEVER...HIGH/MID LEVEL CLOUDS ALREADY 
SPREADING RAPIDLY INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND WILL OVERSPREAD THE AREA
THIS AFTERNOON/EVENING.

NAM AND GFS ARE FAIRLY CLOSE IN REGARDS TO NEXT SYSTEM FOR TONIGHT THROUGH
THURSDAY EVENING. A FAIRLY FAST MOVING SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM WITH DECENT
ISENTROPIC LIFT AND MODERATE JET DYNAMICS. ALSO...MODELS SHOW AN INVERTED
TROUGH OVER THE FORECAST AREA FOR TONIGHT AND THURSDAY.  PLAN ON UPPING POPS
TO CAT TONIGHT AND HIGH CHANCE SOUTH AND CAT NORTH FOR THURSDAY.

MAIN QUESTION WILL BE POSSIBILITY OF SNOW/SLEET FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS. LATEST MODELS SHOW TEMPERATURE PROFILE A
LITTLE WARMER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS. WILL MAINTAIN A MIX OR CHANGEOVER TO SNOW
FOR HIGH ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE...BUT
FEEL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS LIMITED.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...A RIDGE OF HIGH PRESSURE SURFACE AND
ALOFT FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...BUT BOTH A SOUTHERN STREAM AND NORTHERN STREAM
ENERGY COMES TOGETHER LATE IN THE FORECAST.  BOTH THE ECMWF AND GFS DEPICT
A FAIRLY DECENT UPPER TROUGH ESTABLISHING ITSELF BY EARLY/MID WEEK NEXT WEEK.
HAVE BUMP UP POPS TO CHANCE FOR SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY.  HAVE ALSO LOWERED
HIGHS FOR TUESDAY GIVEN SUCH A DEEP UPPER TROUGH.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
320 PM EST TUE FEB 22 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...CLOUDS BREAKING UP ACROSS 
THE CWA...WITH SOME CLEARING EXPECTED TO CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING.  
BUT...A SHORTWAVE IS EXPECTED TO MOVE IN LATER TONIGHT.  NOT ENOUGH 
MOISTURE TO GENERATE ANY PRECIP...BUT SHOULD INCREASE CLOUDS LATER 
TONIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTH.  
DESPITE SOME SHALLOW MOISTURE...WIND STAYS UP TONIGHT SO NOT 
EXPECTING A FOG PROBLEM LIKE LAST NIGHT.  MODELS SHOWING A SURFACE 
FRONT PUSHING IN FROM THE SOUTH LATE WEDNESDAY.  GFS CONSIDERABLY 
FASTER THAN ETA ON BRINGING PRECIP IN.  WITH THE DRY LOW LEVELS... 
WILL GO WITH THE SLOWER ETA AND KEEP WEDNESDAY DRY.  

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS IN VERY POOR 
AGREEMENT IN THE HANDLING OF THE SYSTEM PROGGED INTO THE REGION 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.  ADDITIONALLY...RUN TO RUN CONSISTENCY 
IS ALSO QUITE POOR...THEREFORE...CONFIDENCE IS VERY LOW...ESPECIALLY 
ON TIMING AND POSITION OF THE SYSTEM.  GUIDANCE NOW PLACES POPS AT 
LIKELY CATEGORY...BUT DUE TO LACK ON CONFIDENCE WILL ONLY RAISE POPS 
TO HIGH CHANCE.  850MB TEMPS WILL BE SUCH THAT EXPECT MAINLY VALLEY 
RAIN WITH A RAIN/SNOW MIX OVER HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  THE SYSTEM SHOULD 
EXIT THE AREA LATE THURSDAY WITH A DRIER AIR MASS MOVING IN.  A 
COUPLE OF WEAK WAVES TRACK THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW THROUGH THE 
REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED...BUT MAIN MOISTURE AND LIFT ARE PROGGED 
TO REMAIN OUT OF THE MRX CWA.  A FRONTAL BOUNDARY FROM AN UPPER LOW 
MOVES THROUGH THE AREA AROUND THE MONDAY TIME FRAME AND WILL 
CONTINUE SLIGHT CHANCE PRECIP FOR THIS FEATURE.  OTHERWISE...WILL 
KEEP THINGS DRY FOR MUCH OF THE EXTENDED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
322 AM EST TUE FEB 22 2005

.SHORT TERM...WET GROUND...LIGHT WINDS...AND BREAK IN THE LOW CLOUDS
HAVE ALLOWED AREAS OF DENSE FOG TO FORM. VISIBILITIES HAVE DROPPED TO LESS
THAN ONE-QUARTER MILE AT LNP...TYS...OQT...MRX..AND RHP. LATEST NAM SHOWS

ISSUED A DENSE FOG ADVISORY TO COUNT FOR THE AREAS OF DENSE FOG UNTIL MID-
MORING.

A GOOD DEAL OF FOG AND LOW CLOUDS WILL SLOWLY DISSIPATE THIS MORNING. NAM
SHOWS BOTH 925 MB AND SURFACE RELATIVE HUMIDITY LOWERING WITH SKY BECOMING
PARTLY CLOUDY THIS AFTERNOON.  SURFACE RIDGE WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD INTO
THE REGION TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.  NAM SHOWS ENOUGH DRIER DEWPOINTS ADVECTING
INTO THE AREA FOR LATER TODAY AND TONIGHT...SO ANOTHER ROUND OF WIDESPREAD
DENSE FOG IS NOT ANTICIPATED.  MODELS SHOW INCREASING HIGH/MID LEVEL
CLOUDS FOR TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY...SO PARTLY TO MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS
EXPECTED.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNEDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...MAIN FORECAST CONCERN IS 
POTENTIAL GULF COAST STATES SURFACE LOW DEVELOPMENT. NAM IS THE STRONGEST
IN DEVELOPING A LOW ACROSS AL/GA WITH A SURFACE INVERTED TROUGH INTO THE
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. GFS DOES DEVELOP A WEAKER AND FASTER SYSTEM ACROSS
THE GULF COAST STATES.  WILL TREND TOWARD THE NAM...BUT WILL NOT GO AS
HIGH AS NAM POPS FOR NOW AND WAIT AND SEE IF LATER RUNS CONTINUE TREND.
NEXT QUESTIONS IS POTENTIAL FROZEN PRECIPITATION FOR NORTHERN SECTIONS AND
MOUNTAINS. NAM SOUNDINGS SHOW A FAVORABLE TEMPERATURE PROFILE AND THICKNESS
FOR SNOW OR SNOW/RAIN MIX FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA/NORTHEAST TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS
AND POSSIBLE NORTHERN PLATEAU FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY EVENING.

WILL NOT HIT SNOWFALL POTENTIAL TOO HARD YET DUE TO SYSTEM UNCERTAINTY. ALSO...
PRECIPITATION WILL LIKELY OCCUR DURING THE DAYLIGHT HOURS WHICH WILL LIMIT
SNOW ACCUMULATION POTENTIAL.  ALSO...GROUND TEMPERATURES RELATIVELY WARM
WHICH WILL LIMIT SNOWFALL. WILL INCLUDE POTENTIAL WINTRY CONDITIONS IN THE
HWO.

SURFACE AND UPPER LEVEL RIDGING DOMINATES CONDITIONS FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.
NEW MEDIUM RANGE GFS SHOWS A POTENTIAL CYCLOGENSIS OFF SOUTHEAST COASTS FOR
SUNDAY NIGHT AND MODAY...BUT DUE TO LOW CONFIDENCE IN SYSTEM WILL KEEP THINGS
DRY FOR NOW.

HAVE A GREAT MORNING...

&&

SOUTH.  SOME ASSOCIATED PRECIP MAY CLIP OUR SOUTHEAST CORNER.  A 
COUPLE OF WEAK WAVES MOVE THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW TOWARDS THE

DRY FOR NOW.

MIDDLE TN CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY FOR POSSIBLE NEW WATCH TOWARD 15Z.

OTHERWISE...HIGH POPS IN CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS GOOD FOR TODAY WITH 
A CHANCE OF THUNDERSTORMS.  IF A WATCH IS ISSUED INTO E TN...THEN 
WILL WORD THUNDERSTORMS A LITTLE STRONGER.  ALSO...MAY NEED TO LOWER 
MAX TEMP FORECAST A FEW DEGREES IN THE COOLEST AND MOST STABLE PARTS

WILL TREND THE EXTENDED FORECAST TOWARD THE GFS WITH SMALL POPS 
CONFINED TO SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC FOR TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE DEEP SOUTH NEARS THE 
FORECAST AREA BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT INTO THURSDAY...SO WILL INCREASE 
RAIN CHANCES ACROSS MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA. ANOTHER COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH A SLIGHT CHANCE OF A FEW RAIN SHOWERS 
IN THE VALLEYS AND SNOW SHOWERS IN THE MOUNTAINS.

FXUS64 KMRX 191931
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EST SAT FEB 19 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM IS 
APPROACHING THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TONIGHT. IN ADVANCE OF 
THIS SYSTEM...CLOUDS HAVE MOVED IN ACROSS THE AREA. A FEW SPRINKLES 
OR LIGHT RAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE THIS EVENING...BUT MAIN MOISTURE AND 
LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH A WARM FRONT WILL REACH INTO THE AREA BETWEEN 
06Z AND 12Z...SPREADING MAINLY RAIN OVER THE MRX CWA. HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS...ESPECIALLY OVER NORTHEASTERN TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA WILL SEE A MIX OF RAIN...SNOW AND POSSIBLY BRIEFLY SLEET 
OVERNIGHT.  WITH WARM SOUTHWESTERN FLOW...UPSLOPE NOT A SIGNIFICANT 
FACTOR...SOME MINOR ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE MAINLY ABOVE 4000 TO 5000 
FEET OVER THE SMOKYS...ACCUMULATIONS OF LESS THAN TWO INCHES 
POSSIBLE OVER 2500 TO 3000 FEET OF ELEVATION IN THE NORTHEAST 
MOUNTAINS OF TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.  WIDESPREAD PRECIP 
WILL REMAIN OVER THE AREA THROUGHOUT THE DAY ON SUNDAY WITH WARM 
ADVECTION CONTINUING...THE WARMING TEMPERATURES WILL CHANGE PRECIP 
TO ALL RAIN BY MID AFTERNOON.  

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...WARM FRONT SHOULD BE 
LOCATED ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA BY SUNDAY EVENING. 
TEMPS WILL REMAIN STEADY OR SLOWLY RISE ON SUNDAY NIGHT OVER THE 
FORECAST AREA...AS SOUTHWERLY WINDS ADVECT WARM AND MOIST AIR BEHIND 
THIS WARM FRONT. MODELS CONTINUE TO REVEAL SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA ON SUNDAY NIGHT...WITH SURFACE-BASED 
INSTABILITY DEVELOPING BY MONDAY MORNING. THUS...WILL CONTINUE A 
MENTION OF THUNDER FOR SUNDAY NIGHT (MAINLY AFTER MIDNIGHT) AND 
MONDAY MORNING...AS A COLD FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE MISSISSIPPI AND 
LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEYS. THIS COLD FRONT SHOULD MOVE THROUGH THE 
FORECAST AREA AROUND THE MIDDLE OF THE DAY ON MONDAY...WITH DRIER 
AND COOLER AIR MOVING INTO THE AREA BY MONDAY AFTERNOON AND MONDAY 
NIGHT. 

BY TUESDAY...THIS COLD FRONT BEGINS TO STALL-OUT OVER THE DEEP 
SOUTH...BUT ITS EXACT LOCATION BECOMES PROBLEMATIC. EXTENDED MODELS 
CONTINUE TO REVEAL LARGE DISCREPANCIES WITH THE GFS MODEL CONTINUING 
TO INDICATE A MORE SOUTHERLY FRONTAL LOCATION THAN THE OTHER 
EXTENDED MODELS. THUS...THE GFS MODEL SOLUTION INDICATES THAT PRECIP 
WILL BE SUPPRESSED FURTHER SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA THAN THE 
ETA...ECMWF...CANADIAN AND UKMET MODELS AS WELL AS THE ENSEMBLE 
MEANS. ITS HARD TO IGNORE THE GFS MODEL SOLUTION...SINCE ITS HAS 
BEEN CONSISTENT FOR SEVERAL RUNS NOW. HOWEVER...THE OTHER MODEL 
SOLUTIONS CONTINUE TO INSIST THAT THE STATIONARY FRONT WILL BE 
FARTHER NORTH WITH AN ACTIVE SOUTHERN JET STREAM BRINGING MOISTURE 
INTO THE TN RIVER VALLEY. AT THIS POINT...IT SEEMS A COMPROMISE IS 
THE BEST SOLUTION AND WILL KEEP LOW POPS IN THE FORECAST ACROSS MOST 
OF THE AREA TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE 
DEEP SOUTH NEARS THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY...WITH RAIN CHANCES 
INCREASING SLIGHTLY AS IT SPREADS SOME MOISTURE NORTHWARD. DRY 
WEATHER SHOULD RETURN IN THE WAKE OF THIS SYSTEM FOR FRIDAY AND 
SATURDAY. 
&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 182001
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST FRI FEB 18 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...BENIGN WEATHER PATTERN IN PLACE 
OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION FOR THE SHORT TERM AS SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE PERSISTS OVER THE AREA AND AN UPPER LEVEL RIDGE BUILDS 
IN. WILL REMAIN BETWEEN SYSTEMS INTO SATURDAY SO WILL CONTINUE WITH 
DRY CONDITIONS AND A MILD WARMING TREND. CLOUDS WILL BEGIN TO 
INCREASE SATURDAY AFTERNOON...AND DEWPOINTS WILL CONTINUE TO RISE A 
LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES CLOSER TO THE AREA. 

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...A DEVELOPING LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS WILL STRENGTHEN SOUTHERLY 
FLOW ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SATURDAY NIGHT...WITH AREAS OF LIGHT 
RAIN DEVELOPING AS ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASES. RIGHT NOW IT APPEARS 
THAT MOST AREAS WILL REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING THROUGH SUNDAY MORNING... 
BUT SOME POCKETS OF NEAR-FREEZING TEMPS WILL LIKELY BE LINGERING 
ACROSS EXTREME NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA. MODEL SOUNDINGS REVEAL 
THAT A MIXTURE OF LIGHT SNOW AND SLEET WILL DEVELOP INITIALLY ACROSS 
PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA AND EXTREME NORTHEAST TN...AS MOISTURE 
SPREADS NORTHEAST ACROSS THESE AREAS SUNDAY MORNING. ANY WINTRY 
PRECIP SHOULD BE BRIEF WITH LITTLE OR NO ACCUMULATIONS EXPECTED... 
BEFORE TEMPS WARM SHORTLY AFTER SUNRISE SUNDAY MORNING WITH PRECIP 
CHANGING BACK TO ALL RAIN. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN CONTINUES TO REVEAL 
SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY OVER THE FORECAST AREA SUNDAY NIGHT...AND 
MARGINAL SURFACE-BASED INSTABILITY ON MONDAY...AS THE NEXT COLD 
FRONT APPROACHES FROM THE MISSISSIPPI AND LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEYS. 
THUS...WILL ADD A MENTION OF THUNDER FOR SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY 
ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. 

BY TUESDAY...COLD FRONT MOVES EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH SOME 
POST-FRONTAL SHOWERS POSSIBLE AS AN UPPER SHORT WAVE SWINGS OVER THE 
REGION. MODELS STILL INDICATE QUITE A BIT OF UNCERTAINTY WITH THE 
EXTENDED FORECAST ON WEDNESDAY THROUGH FRIDAY...AS THE COLD FRONT IS 
PROGGED TO BECOME STATIONARY ACROSS THE DEEP SOUTH. ENSEMBLE MEANS 
INDICATE THAT THE SOUTHERN JET STREAM WILL REMAIN ACTIVE...WITH SOME 
MOISTURE OVER-RIDING THE HIGH PRESSURE AREA EXPECTED TO BE IN PLACE 
ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY. THUS...WILL CONTINUE WITH A CHANCE OF 
RAIN IN THE FORECAST FOR WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...WITH THE BEST 
CHANCE EXPECTED ACROSS THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA WHICH 
WILL BE CLOSER TO THE STATIONARY FRONT. 
&&

NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
445 AM EST FRI FEB 18 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...A WEAK SHORTWAVE PASSING 
THROUGH THE AREA TODAY WILL BRING A PARTLY CLOUDY DAY TODAY...BUT NO 
PRECIP IS EXPECTED WITH IT.  DRY WEATHER CONTINUES TONIGHT AND 
SATURDAY.  A SURFACE TROUGH APPROACHES THE REGION ON SATURDAY 
NIGHT...WILL GO FOR CHANCE POPS SATURDAY NIGHT WITH BEST CHANCES IN 
THE SOUTH.  TEMPERATURES/THICKNESSES INDICATE POSSIBILITY OF 
SNOW/RAIN/FREEZING RAIN FOR SATURDAY NIGHT AND SUNDAY MORNING FOR 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE NORTHERN MOUNTAINS AND SMOKIES.  BOUNDARY 
LAYER TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE TOO WARM FOR ANYTHING BUT RAIN ACROSS 
THE VALLEY.  SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL RAIN ACROSS THE ENTIRE 
CWA BY SUNDAY AFTERNOON.  WITH AMPLE MOISTURE MOVING THROUGH...HAVE 
BUMPED UP POPS TO 70 PERCENT.   

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...ANOTHER FRONT MOVING INTO 
AREA ON MONDAY...WITH DECENT MOISTURE EXPECTED...WILL KEEP 50/60 
POPS FOR MONDAY.  MOISTURE LINGERS INTO MIDWEEK...WILL KEEP LOW 
CHANCES OF RAIN FOR TUESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY.


000 
FXUS64 KMRX 171948
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EST THU FEB 17 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...QUIET WEATHER PATTERN IN PLACE 
FOR THE NEXT 24 HOURS.  NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT REMAINS IN PLACE OVER 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION TONIGHT WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
DOMINATING AREA WEATHER.  A DRY AND COOL AIR MASS IS POSITIONED OVER 
THE AREA PROVIDING CONTINUED DRY AND SLIGHTLY COOL CONDITIONS.  WEAK 
COLD ADVECTION BEGINS TO MODERATE BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON WITH 850 MB 
TEMPS WARMING A COUPLE OF DEGREES. 

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...A WEAK COLD FRONT WILL 
MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA FRIDAY NIGHT...WITH MAINLY JUST AN 
INCREASE IN CLOUDS EXPECTED SINCE MOISTURE SHOULD BE LIMITED ALONG 
WITH WEAK UPPER DYNAMICS. THIS FRONT IS PROGGED TO STALL-OUT JUST 
SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY...AND THEN MOVE NORTH AS A 
WARM FRONT LATE SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY. A DEVELOPING LOW 
PRESSURE SYSTEM OVER THE CENTRAL PLAINS WILL HELP TO STRENGTHEN THE 
SOUTHERLY FLOW AND RESULTING ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER THE FORECAST AREA 
ON SUNDAY...PRODUCING AREAS OF RAIN. RIGHT NOW IT APPEARS THAT MOST 
AREAS WILL REMAIN ABOVE FREEZING AROUND SUNRISE SUNDAY MORNING...BUT 
SOME POCKETS OF FREEZING TEMPS COULD BE LINGERING ACROSS THE VALLEYS 
OF EXTREME NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA...SO WILL MENTION THE 
POSSIBILITY OF BRIEF FREEZING RAIN OR SLEET AS RAIN MOVES INTO THESE 
AREAS SUNDAY MORNING. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN INDICATES THAT SOME 
MARGINAL INSTABILITY WILL DEVELOP ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA ON 
MONDAY...AHEAD OF A COLD FRONT APPROACHING FROM THE MID MISSISSIPPI 
AND LOWER OHIO RIVER VALLEYS. THUS...WILL ADD A MENTION OF THUNDER 
FOR MONDAY FOR THE SOUTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. MODELS EVEN 
INDICATE SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY ON SUNDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL LEAVE 
THUNDER OUT OF SUNDAY NIGHTS FORECAST FOR NOW SINCE UPPER DYNAMICS 
LOOK TO BE WEAK. 

BY TUESDAY...EXTENDED RANGE MODELS BEGIN TO DIVERGE QUITE A BIT WITH 
THE GFS MODEL INDICATING HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA...WHILE THE ECMWF MODEL INDICATES THAT THE COLD FRONT WILL 
BECOME STATIONARY OVER THE FORECAST AREA AS ANOTHER LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM DEVELOPS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS. THE ECMWF SOLUTION IS 
THE PREFERRED SOLUTION FOR THIS TIME FRAME...SINCE IT IS SUPPORTED 
MORE BY THE ENSEMBLE MEANS. THUS...WILL KEEP A MENTION A RAIN IN THE 
FORECAST ON WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...BUT WILL ONLY MENTION A SLIGHT 
CHANCE DUE TO THE UNCERTAINTY. 
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             25  50  30  52 /   0   0   0   0 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  22  44  26  48 /   0   0   0   0 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       22  44  26  48 /   0   0   0   0 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              19  40  19  45 /   0   0   0   0 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
.NC......NONE.
.TN......NONE.
.VA......NONE.
&&

$$

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST WED FEB 16 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT ALONG THE EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE 
APPALACHIANS...WITH COLDER AND DRIER AIR CONTINUING TO FLOW INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA ON NORTHWEST WINDS. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH 
INDICATING ENOUGH MOISTURE TO PRODUCE A FEW SCATTERED FLURRIES 
ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST VA TONIGHT...AS AN UPPER TROUGH 
DEEPENS OVER THE REGION. OTHERWISE...HIGH PRESSURE EXPECTED TO 
CONTINUE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH FRIDAY. ANOTHER WEAK COLD 
FRONT WILL MOVE INTO THE AREA BY FRIDAY NIGHT...BUT WILL ONLY 
MENTION AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS AT THIS TIME SINCE MOISTURE APPEARS TO 
BE LIMITED. AS FOR TEMPS...GFS GUIDANCE VALUES APPEAR REASONABLE 
WITH NEAR NORMAL TEMPS EXPECTED THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...S/WV PROGRESSES E THRU THE 
NRN PLAINS INTO THE GREAT LAKES EARLY IN THE PERIOD DRIVING SFC LO 
PRES NE THRU THE MIDWEST SAT NIGHT INTO SUN AND THEN INTO THE 
EASTERN GREAT LAKES BY 12Z MON. REMOVED POPS FROM DAYTIME PERIOD OF 
FCST SAT AS MODEL SOLUTION SLOWED DOWN ISENTROPIC LIFT/MOISTURE 
AHEAD OF S/WV BUT USED LOW (30-40) CHC POPS FOR PERIOD SAT NIGHT 
THROUGH SUN DAYTIME THEN RAISED TO 50 PERCENT SUN NIGHT AHEAD OF 
ASSOCIATED CD FNT. MAINTAINED LOW CHC POPS MON INTO TUE DAYTIME 
PERIOD AS FNT DROPS GRADUALLY S OF FA AFTER PASSAGE OF ADDITIONAL 
WEAK S/WV ENERGY AND THEN REMOVED FOR TUE NIGHT INTO WED.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 160819
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EST WED FEB 16 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...COLD FRONT STILL POISED TO MOVE 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BETWEEN 12Z AND 15Z TODAY. MODEL TIME 
HEIGHTS DEPICT MOISTURE CONFINED MAINLY BELOW 700 MB. THIS PLUS THE 
EXPECTED RAPID PROGRESSION OF FRONT SUGGESTS ONLY LIGHT QPF WILL BE 
ASSOCIATED WITH THIS EVENT. MODELS AND ENSEMBLES GENERALLY AGREE 
THAT PRECIP WILL HAVE ENDED IN ALL BUT THE EASTERN-MOST PORTION OF 
THE FORECAST AREA BY 21Z. HEIGHTS SLOWLY FALL BEHIND THIS SYSTEM AS 
UPPER TROUGH AMPLIFIES OVER THE EASTERN CONUS. TIME HEIGHTS SHOW 
MOISTURE LINGERS IN THE MID LEVELS BEHIND FRONT...SO NOT 
ANTICIPATING SIGNIFICANT CLEARING THROUGH THE FIRST TWO PERIODS. 
BASED ON THIS EXPECTED CLOUD COVER...TENDED TO FAVOR COOLER GUIDANCE 
TEMPS IN THE FIRST PERIOD AND THE WARMER GUIDANCE TEMPS IN THE 
SECOND PERIOD.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...VERY LITTLE CHANGES MADE 
IN THE LONG TERM FOR NOW...ALTHO DAY SHIFT MAY NEED TO REALLY 
CONSIDER DROPPING PCPN CHANCES ON SATURDAY TO LESS THAN 15 PERCENT...
AS BOTH THE DGEX AND GFS NOW SHOW 500 MB HEIGHTS RISING PLUS SURFACE 
RIDGING DOMINANT OVER THE SE STATES DURING THE DAYTIME HOURS 
SATURDAY.  UNTIL THEN...THE UPPER FLOW STAYS W TO NW AND KEEPS SOME 
AMOUNT OF MID/HI LEVEL CLOUDINESS PLUS LINGERING LOW LEVEL MOISTURE 
AS WELL.  THUS...CANT GO ANY BETTER THAN PARTLY CLOUDY FOR THURSDAY 
THRU FRIDAY NIGHT.  HAD TIME TO ADD SOME PRELIMINARY GRIDS FOR THE 
NEW DAY SEVEN (WEDNESDAY)...AND DAYSHIFT CAN FINE TUNE THEM SOME.  

FOR TEMPS...DECENT AMOUNT OF COLD AIR ADVECTION LINGERS INTO EARLY 
FRIDAY...AND THE 00Z MOS MAX/MIN TEMPS SEEM TO REFLECT THIS QUITE 
WELL WITH TEMPS STAYING A FEW DEGREES BELOW CLIMO.  PREVIOUS TEMP 
GRIDS LOOKED RIGHT ON TRACK OVERALL.  

&&

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
830 PM EST TUE FEB 15 2005

.DISCUSSION...
LATEST SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS COLD FRONT FROM EXTREME NORTHERN OHIO TO
CENTRAL INDIANA...SOUTH-CENTRAL ILLINOIS TO SOUTHERN MISSOURI.  A WEAK
WAVE OF LOW PRESSURE IS OVER SOUTHEAST MISSOURI. A FEW LIGHTNING STRIKES
HAVE BEEN NOTED OVER SOUTHEAST MISSOURI THIS EVENING...BUT HAVE FADED
LATELY. LATEST MESO-ETA AND GFS CONTINUED TO SHOW FRONT MOVING 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA BY AROUND DAYBREAK WEDNESDAY WITH SCATTERED-
BROKEN SHOWERS DEVELOPING ALONG AND JUST BEHIND FROPA.  ALL IS COVERED
WELL BY CURRENT FORECAST.

MAIN CONCERN FOR THE OVERNIGHT PERIOD IS POTENTIAL OF LOCALIZED DENSE
FOG. GROUND REMAINS FAIRLY WET AND TEMPERATURE/DEWPOINT SPREAD IS 
NARROWING. HOWEVER...SATELITTE SHOWS A GOOD DEAL OF HIGH/MID LEVEL
CLOUDS DEVELOPING OVER MID AND EAST TENNESSEE WHICH WILL LIMIT TO A
CERTAIN DEGREE THE RADIATIONAL COOLING. LATEST MESO-ETA DOES SHOW HIGH
SURFACE RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR CHA AND TYS AREAS OVERNIGHT...SO WILL 
INCLUDE PATCHY DENSE FOG...BUT HIGH/MID LEVEL CLOUDS SHOULD LIMIT 
COVERAGE SOME.

HAVE A GOOD NIGHT.

&&

.NC......NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 151950
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
246 PM EST TUE FEB 15 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WED)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT FOR 
THIS PERIOD...WITH COLD FRONT TO PUSH INTO THE AREA LATE TONIGHT AND 
EXIT THE AREA RATHER QUICKLY ON WED.  GFS FASTER TO DRY THINGS OUT 
THAN THE ETA/NAM...WILL LEAN A BIT TOWARD THE ETA/NAM.  THIS SYSTEM 
IS A FAST MOVER...AND MOISTURE AND FORCING NOT OVERLY IMPRESSIVE.  
WILL GO WITH LIKELY POPS NORTH AND CENTRAL TONIGHT...CHANCE 
NORTH...THEN LIKELY ALL ZONES TOMORROW.  SHOULD BE AN ALL RAIN EVENT 
THROUGH TOMORROW...ALTHOUGH TEMPS WILL BE DROPPING IN THE AFTERNOON 
OVER THE TERRAIN.  WILL NOT STRAY FAR FROM MAV TEMPS. 

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY.  COLD FRONT EAST OF 
THE REGION BY WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH DRIER WEATHER PUSHING IN BEHIND 
IT.  WILL KEEP A SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE MOUNTAINS EARLY 
WEDNESDAY EVENING WITH SOME RESIDUAL MOISTURE AND UPSLOPE FLOW.  
SHOULD BE DRY EVERYWHERE BY MIDNIGHT.  MODELS INDICATING A WEAK 
SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH ON THURSDAY MORNING...BUT BEST MOISTURE 
REMAINS NORTH...SO WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST.  DRY WEATHER 
CONTINUES THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  ANOTHER FRONT APPROACHES FRIDAY 
NIGHT AND LINGERS ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH THE WEEKEND.  WILL KEEP 
ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND CHANCE POPS SATURDAY 
AND SUNDAY.  THICKNESSES AND SURFACE TEMPERATURES INDICATE PRECIP 
SHOULD BE RAIN/SNOW FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING ACROSS 
EVERYWHERE BUT THE SOUTHERN VALLEY...THEN CHANGE TO ALL RAIN BY 
SATURDAY AFTERNOON.  A LITTLE WARMER SATURDAY NIGHT/SUNDAY  
MORNING...BUT MAY AGAIN SEE RAIN/SNOW ACROSS NORTHEAST TENNESSEE 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND THE MOUNTAINS...THEN CHANGE TO RAIN IN THE 
AFTERNOON.  ANOTHER FRONTAL SYSTEM APPROACHES ON MONDAY...WILL 
CONTINUE CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY AND MONDAY NIGHT...BUT ONLY GO FOR 
20 POPS ON TUESDAY WITH A LITTLE LESS MOISTURE AVAILABLE.  SHOULD BE 
WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL LIQUID PRECIPITATION MONDAY AND TUESDAY.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...


000 
FXUS64 KMRX 150849
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
348 AM EST TUE FEB 15 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...TRANQUIL WEATHER WITH WELL ABOVE 
CLIMO TEMPS IN STORE FOR MOST OF THE FIRST TWO PERIODS AS AREA 
REMAINS UNDER ZONAL FLOW ALOFT. UPPER TROUGH/SURFACE COLD FRONT 
APPROACHES LATE IN THE SECOND PERIOD. PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH THIS 
SYSTEM IS SOMEWHAT UNCERTAIN WITH REGARD TO ONSET AS GFS AND NAM 
(ETA) DISAGREE ON TIMING. SHORT RANGE ENSEMBLES REPRESENT A 
REASONABLE BLEND OF THE TWO AND WAS GENERALLY USED FOR TIMING. 
GUIDANCE TEMPS ARE IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT AND A BLEND OF THE 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS SEEMS APPROPRIATE.

CONCERNING THE DENSE FOG ADVISORY...ABUNDANT BROKEN HIGH CLOUDS PLUS 
LINGERING LOW CLOUDS HAVE INHIBITED THE DENSE FOG DEVELOPMENT ACROSS 
NE TN AND SWRN VA.  THUS...OUR DENSE FOG ADVISORY WAS CANCELED EARLY 
FOR THOSE AREAS...BUT CONTINUES ELSEWHERE AS ISSUED EARLIER THRU 10 
AM EST.  A MENTION OF PATCHY DENSE FOG WAS KEPT IN THE ZFP AND GRIDS 
FOR NE TN AND SWRN VA...AS WELL AS COVERED IN THE LATEST SHORT TERM 
FORECAST.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH PRESIDENTS DAY)...MINOR CHANGES MADE 
FOR WEDNESDAY INTO THURSDAY...TO INCORPORATE LATEST MODEL HANDLING 
OF THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND COLD FRONT THESE PERIODS.  GFS MODEL WAS 
FASTEST WITH THE PCPN AND COLD FRONT...AND EVEN THE ETA MODEL 
SUPPORTED BRINGING IN SOME POPS TO THE NRN MOST AREAS AS EARLY AS 
LATE TUESDAY NIGHT WITH THIS SYSTEM.  DECIDED TO USE THE SLIGHTLY 
SLOWER TIMING OF ETA/NGM MODEL FOR WEDNESDAY...WITH THE MOST LIKELY 
PERIOD OF SIGNIFICANT PCPN BEING WEDS MORNING WHERE LIKELY POPS WERE 
USED FOR ALL BUT EXTREME SE TN AREAS.  KEPT CONTINUITY AND MESHED 
WITH NEIGHBORS TO THE WEST...IN HAVING SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR WEDS 
EVENING.  THIS LOOKS TO BE A BRIEF PERIOD OF LIGHT QPF AND NO THREAT 
OF THUNDERSTORMS.

OTHERWISE...THERE APPEARS TO BE A DECENT SHOT OF COLD AIR ADVECTION 
BEHIND THIS FRONT...SO TEMPS WERE WORDED AS STEADY OR SLOWLY FALLING 
BY WEDS AFTERNOON.  ALSO...THE COOLER AND DRIER AIR FILTERING IN 
WITH THE SURFACE RIDGE WEDS NIGHT AND THURSDAY...JUSTIFIED LOWERING 
DEWPOINT TEMPS SIGNIFICANTLY AS FAR OUT AS THURSDAY NIGHT AND EARLY 
FRIDAY (USING LATEST GFS AND MEX MOS AS INPUT).  HOWEVER...MAX AND 
MIN TEMPS FROM PREVIOUS GRIDS/FORECAST WERE STILL GENERALLY ON TRACK.

NO CHANGES CONSIDERED OR MADE BEYOND FRIDAY AT THIS TIME.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             70  51  58  32 /   0  40  50  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  66  49  56  30 /   0  50  60  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       66  49  55  29 /   0  50  70  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              65  43  51  26 /   0  30  70  20 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
.NC......DENSE FOG ADVISORY TIL 10AM EST FOR CHEROKEE/CLAY           
         COUNTIES.  
.TN......DENSE FOG ADVISORY TIL 10AM EST (9AM CST) FOR ALL BUT NE TN
         AND SMOKY MTNS.
.VA......NONE.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...WEAK COLD FRONT PUSHING

ABOVE MAV TEMPS. 

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY.  COLD FRONT PASSING

WEDNESDAY MORNING...BUT WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR LATE 
TUESDAY NIGHT.  GOOD MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THE COLD FRONT  
PASSING THROUGH AREA...WILL BUMP UP POPS TO HIGH CHANCE FOR 
WEDNESDAY.  SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR RAIN.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  MODELS INDICATING A WEAK SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH 
ON THURSDAY MORNING...BUT BEST MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH...SO WILL KEEP 
IT DRY FOR NOW.  DRY WEATHER CONTINUES THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  ANOTHER 
FRONT APPROACHES FRIDAY NIGHT AND STALLS ACROSS THE REGION THROUGH 
THE WEEKEND.  COMING IN A LITTLE SLOWER THAN PREVIOUS RUNS...WILL 
KEEP ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND CHANCE POPS 
SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.  THICKNESSES AND SURFACE TEMPERATURES INDICATE 
PRECIP SHOULD BE RAIN/SNOW FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY MORNING ACROSS 
EVERYWHERE BUT THE SOUTHERN VALLEY.  GETTING SOME DECENT WARM AIR 
ADVECTION ON SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...SHOULD BE ALL LIQUID 
PRECIPITATION SATURDAY NIGHT/SUNDAY MORNING.  UPPER TROUGH PASSING 
THROUGH ON MONDAY...BUT MOISTURE LIMITED SO WENT WITH ONLY 20 POPS.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 140927
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
425 AM EST MON FEB 14 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...RAIN CONTINUES THIS MORNING 
ACROSS THE BULK OF THE FORECAST AREA...WITH LEAST COVERAGE FROM NEAR 
MRX NE TO TRI DUE TO DOWNSLOPING.  THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS IS 
NEARING THE MISS RIVER WITH SIGNIFICANT AREA OF RAIN EXTENDING WEST 
TO A MSL (AL) TO BNA (TN) LINE.  DEWPOINT TEMPS ARE AS HIGH AS THE 
MID 50S ACROSS W TN JUST AHEAD OF THE WEAK COLD FRONT/SFC 
TROUGH...BUT ONLY IN THE UPPER 30S TO MID/UPR 40S ACROSS OUR 
FORECAST AREA. THUS...INSTABILITY IS QUITE LACKING TODAY SO JUST 
SHOWERS FOR US AS BEST INSTABILITY STAYS SOUTH ACROSS THE GULF COAST 
STATES.

MAIN CHANGES TO TODAYS WX/POP GRIDS WAS TO SPEED UP THE END OF THE 
SHOWERS A BIT SOONER...WITH THE UPPER TROUGH AXIS PASSING TO OUR 
EAST BETWEEN 18Z AND 00Z.  ENDED UP WITH SOME SLIGHT TO LOW CHANCE 
POPS EARLY THIS EVENING...TO MESH WITH NEIGHBORS GRIDS AND IN CASE 
THE SLOWER GFS MODEL IS MORE CORRECT.  INTRODUCED SOME AREAS OF FOG 
LATE TONIGHT DUE TO WET GROUND AND MOIST BOUNDARY LAYER.  HOWEVER...
DID NOT MENTION DENSE FOG YET...BECAUSE OF 1) UNFAVORABLE WESTERLY 
WINDS AND 2) UNCERTAINTY AS TO HOW MUCH SKIES ACTUALLY CLEAR.  THE 
SURFACE RIDGE AXIS DOES BUILD ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH HIGH LOW 
LEVEL RH...SO THE AMOUNT OF CLEARING AND HOW MUCH WINDS DECOUPLE 
WILL BE IMPORTANT FACTORS.  

OTHERWISE...STAYED QUITE CLOSE TO THE MAV/GFS MOS FOR HIGHS TODAY...
THEN A BIT CLOSER TO THE BLEND NUMBERS FOR MINS TONIGHT...SINCE NOT 
MUCH COLD AIR ADVECTION IF ANY IS EXPECTED BEHIND THE FRONT.   

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...COLD FRONT MONDAY WILL  
ACTUALLY HAVE A WARMING EFFECT WITH DRIER AIR AND NO COLD AIR 
ADVECTION BEHIND IT. RAISED TEMPERATURES A FEW MORE DEGREES TO GO 
ALONG WITH THE LATEST MAV GUIDANCE. FAST ZONAL FLOW WILL MOVE 
SURFACE HIGH QUICKLY ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY. INCREASING 
SOUTHWEST FLOW WILL WARM TEMPERATURES 10 TO POSSIBLY 15 DEGREES 
ABOVE TODAYS TEMPERATURES. NEXT SHORTWAVE DIVES SOUTH TOWARD THE 
REGION TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. ETA SHOWS SOME INSTABILITY WITH 
LIS UP TO -3 AND CAPES TO ABOUT 1000 J/KG. STRONG LOW LEVEL JET 
BRINGS SOUTHWEST WINDS OF 30 TO 35 KNOTS OVERHEAD WEDNESDAY. HAVE 
INCREASED RAIN CHANCES TO ABOUT 50 PERCENT WEDNESDAY. DID NOT 
INCLUDE THUNDER FOR WEDNESDAY YET. I FOLLOWED THE COOLER MAV 
GUIDANCE FOR HIGHS. IF ETA IS RIGHT AND TEMPERATURES WARM TO THE 60S 
ISOLATED STORMS ARE NOT OUT OF THE QUESTION. COLDER AIRMASS RETURNS 
THURSDAY AS UPPER TROUGH OVER EASTERN CANADA DIGS SOUTH. HIGH 
TEMPERATURES WILL LIKELY STAY IN THE 40S THURSDAY BUT SUNSHINE WILL 
BE ABUNDANT. NEXT SYSTEM MOVES OUT OF THE ROCKIES INTO THE PLAINS 
FRIDAY AND THEN THE TENNESSEE VALLEY FOR THE WEEKEND. TEMPERATURES 
WILL BE ON A WARMING TREND NEXT WEEKEND WITH RAIN DEVELOPING BY 
SATURDAY.      

&&

FRIDAY AFTERNOON...AND CHANCE POPS ON SATURDAY AND SUNDAY.  SHOULD 
BE COLD ENOUGH FOR RAIN/SNOW FRIDAY NIGHT/SATURDAY MORNING IN THE 
HIGHER ELEVATIONS BUT RAIN IN THE VALLEY.  ATMOSPHERE WARMING ALOFT 
ON SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT.  WILL KEEP IT ALL LIQUID 
PRECIPITATION SATURDAY NIGHT/SUNDAY MORNING...DESPITE SOME NEAR 
FREEZING SURFACE TEMPERATURES IN THE NORTH.

CONVECTIVE OUTLOOK (NOT IN GENERAL THUNDER).  500 MB TEMPS COOL A 
BIT MORE ON MONDAY...AND AS THE COLD FRONT DRAWS CLOSER...THE PCPN 
TYPE SHOULD BE MORE SHOWERY AT THAT TIME.  

ETA MODEL SUGGESTS A POSSIBLE BREAK IN THE RAIN LATER TODAY OR 
EVENING...BUT THE GFS DOES NOT.  CONSIDERED INDICATING THIS IN THE 
POP/WX GRIDS...BUT WITH ALL MOS POPS SO HIGH FOR TODAY AND TONIGHT I 
DID NOT WANT TO DRIFT TOO FAR BELOW MOS.  FOR THIS REASON AND TO 
BETTER MESH WITH NEIGHBORS GRIDS...THE POP GRIDS FOR NE TN AND SWRN 
VA WERE RAISED SLIGHTLY INTO THE LOWER END OF CATEGORICAL LATER 
TODAY.  

OTHERWISE...TEMPS TRICKY FOR TODAY GIVEN THE MUCH BELOW MOS VALUES 
FOR CURRENT 06-07Z TEMPS DUE TO THIN HIGH CLOUDS AND VERY LIGHT 
WINDS.  ADJUSTED THE 07Z TEMP GRIDS DOWN TO MATCH REALITY IN MOST 
LOCATIONS...THEN ALLOWED FOR WARMING INTO THE 45 TO 55 DEGREE THIS 
AFTERNOON.  MOS MINS FOR TONIGHT WERE QUITE CLOSE AND ACCEPTED.

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...COLD FRONT LIES OVER LOWER 
OHIO VALLEY AND WEST TN MONDAY MORNING WITH ETA MODEL INDICATING 
STRONGEST LIFT OVER AL AND GA AND NORTH OF FORECAST AREA.  MODELS 
HAVE SPEEDED THE MOVEMENT UP OF THE FRONT AND TROUGH.  THE FRONT 
MOVES QUICKLY EAST DURING THE DAY AND ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA 
DURING THE AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING.  GOOD SOUTHWEST FLOW AHEAD 
OF THE FRONT WILL KEEP IT BREEZY IN THE MOUNTAINS BUT NOT HIGH 
ENOUGH FOR AN ADVISORY.  HAVE ENDED PRECIPITATION A LITTLE EARLIER 
THAN LAST FORECAST PACKAGE BUT WILL FOLLOW THE GFS MODELS SLOWER 
ENDING THE PRECIPITATION AROUND 15/06Z.  UPPER TROUGH WEAKENS AS IT 
MOVES EAST AND WITH NO COLD AIR ADVECTION BEHIND THE FRONT AND ZONAL 
FLOW AND SUNSHINE HAD TO RAISE HIGHS SEVERAL DEGREES TUESDAY. 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY WEDNESDAY SHORTWAVE MOVES SOUTHEAST FROM THE 
GREAT LAKES AND DROPS A COLD FRONT THROUGH THE TENNESSEE VALLEY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL DROP DOWN TO BELOW NORMAL ONCE AGAIN AS RIDGING 
ALOFT RETURNS TO THE WESTERN HALF OF THE COUNTRY.  PATTERN BEGINS TO 
CHANGE ONCE AGAIN FOR THE WEEKEND AS SOUTHWEST FLOW BRINGS MOISTURE 
WITH A CHANCE OF RAIN AND WARMER TEMPERATURES ACROSS THE REGION.   
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FOLLOW QUICKLY IN THE HEELS OF THE WARM FRONT.  ASSOCIATED TEMPS 
WILL BE WELL ABOVE FREEZING...KEEPING PRECIP AS RAIN THROUGHOUT.

ALLOWING FOR SOME CONVECTIVE TYPE RAIN SHOWERS.  ALL LOOKS GOOD IN

LOCAL AMOUNTS HIGHER.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...RIDGE BUILDS IN ON 
TUESDAY...PROVING DRY WEATHER ON TUESDAY.  GFS ADVERTISING A WEAK 
COLD FRONT MOVING INTO THE REGION TUESDAY NIGHT...WILL KEEP 20 POPS 
GOING OVER THE ENTIRE AREA.  SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR RAIN...BUT 
MAY SEE A RAIN/SNOW MIX IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS LATE TUESDAY NIGHT 
AND WEDNESDAY MORNING.  SOME MOISTURE LINGERING INTO WEDNESDAY 
MORNING...SO KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS INTO THE MORNING HOURS.  DRY 
WEATHER RETURNS WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON.  LATEST RUN SHOWING MUCH DRIER 
AIRMASS ACROSS OUR AREA WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY WITH HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDING IN THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK...WILL REMOVE 
POPS UNTIL FRIDAY.  MOISTURE RETURNS LATE FRIDAY...BUT BEST MOISTURE 
REMAINS SOUTH.  WILL ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND 
SATURDAY.  SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW FRIDAY NIGHT IN THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS BUT RAIN IN THE VALLEY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EST SAT FEB 12 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE RIDGE ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING HAS RESULTED IN VERY LIGHT WINDS...EVEN 
IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS BASED ON LIMITED OBSERVATIONS TO CHECK.  
WIND GRIDS WERE FRESHENED WITH MAV MOS WINDS...ALTHOUGH HIGHEST 
ELEVATIONS ALONG THE TN-NC LINE WERE NUDGED UP INTO THE 10 TO 20 MPH 
RANGE FOR LATER THIS MORNING INTO THE EARLY AFTERNOON.  

THE UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD EASTWARD FROM THE PLAINS STATES TODAY 
WITH PLENTY OF SUNSHINE ON TAP...PLUS ALREADY SOME WEAK WARM AIR 
ADVECTION UNDERWAY AS THE 850 MB THERMAL TROUGH HAS PUSHED OFF TO 
OUR EAST.  OVERALL LITTLE DIFFERENCE FROM MOS CHOICES FOR MAX TEMPS 
FOR TODAY...AND I GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO THE MAV MOS.

FOR TONIGHT...CLOUDS INCREASE AFTER MIDNIGHT AS SHORTWAVE ENERGY 
MOVES ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS...BUT THE THREAT OF MEASURABLE PCPN 
SEEMS LIMITED TO MAINLY SE TN AREAS VERY LATE (09Z TO 11Z PERIOD).  
MODEL FORECAST SOUNDINGS SHOW A GRADUAL SATURATION AND LITTLE THREAT 
OF ANY SIGNIFICANT PCPN FOR NE TN AND ESPECIALLY SWRN VA AREAS UNTIL 
WELL AFTER 12Z SUNDAY.  PCPN TYPE WILL BE LIGHT RAIN WITH MIN TEMPS 
NOT EXPECTED BELOW MID 30S ANYWHERE...DUE TO WARM AIR ADVECTION AND 
INCREASING CLOUDS.  SLIGHTLY MILDER MAV MOS MINS LOOKED THE BEST.

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...RAIN MOVING IN MUCH FASTER 
SUNDAY THAN MODELS INDICATED 24 HOURS AGO AND HAVE ADJUSTED HIGH 
TEMPERATURES DOWN A FEW DEGREES BASED ON CLOUDS AND RAIN. ETA PLACES 
COLD FRONT TO THE MS RIVER WITH SYSTEM MONDAY EVENING WITH SURFACE 
LOW OVER OHIO. GFS ABOUT 6 HOURS SLOWER THAN THE ETA WITH FRONT 
THROUGH REGION BY EARLY EVENING MONDAY. PREFER THE SLOWER GFS SO 
DID NOT DROP POPS OFF UNTIL LATER MONDAY NIGHT. TOTAL RAINFALL 
AMOUNTS SUNDAY AND MONDAY COULD REACH ONE TO ONE AND A HALF INCHES 
WITH THE HEAVIEST RAIN IN SE TN AND SW NC. QUICK MOVING SYSTEM IS 
QUICK ON ITS HEELS TUESDAY AND TUESDAY NIGHT AS FLOW BECOMES ZONAL. 
THIS SYSTEM DOES NOT HAVE MUCH MOISTURE BUT WITH COLDER AIR MOVING 
IN BY EARLY WEDNESDAY COULD PRODUCE A LITTLE SNOW ESPECIALLY IN THE 
MOUNTAINS. WEDNESDAY TROUGH DEVELOPS OVER EASTERN STATES AND A 
SHORTWAVE ROTATES ACROSS THE NORTHERN HALF WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY 
THURSDAY. COLDER AIR IN PLACE WILL MAY BRING A LITTLE SNOW TO MAINLY 
THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.

ADJUSTMENTS MADE TO MAX/MIN TEMPS.  POPS KEPT GENERALLY BELOW 15 TO 
20 PERCENT FOR TODAY.

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...EAST COAST TROUGH SHIFTS 
FARTHER EAST SATURDAY WITH SOME WEAK RIDGING AND SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE. SKIES SHOULD BE MOSTLY SUNNY. HOWEVER SYSTEM IN THE 
SOUTHWEST WILL BE SPREADING HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE INTO THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY ALREADY BY LATE SATURDAY. BIG WARMUP SATURDAY WITH SOUTHWEST 
WINDS AND SUNNY SKIES. MUCH WARMER SATURDAY NIGHT WITH INCREASING 
CLOUDS. DEEPER MOISTURE MOVES IN BY SUNDAY MORNING ACROSS SOUTHEAST 
TN AND SPREADS NORTHEAST DURING THE DAY. LEAD SHORTWAVE MOVES ACROSS 
FORECAST AREA SUNDAY NIGHT WITH MOIST SOUTHWEST FLOW CONTINUING 
THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. COLD FRONT PASSES THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON 
WITH UPPER TROUGH MONDAY NIGHT. RAISED RAIN CHANCES TO LIKELY SUNDAY 
NIGHT AND MONDAY. UPPER FLOW TURNS MORE WEST TO NORTHWEST AFTER THIS 
SYSTEM AND TWO QUICK SYSTEMS MOVE THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT WITH A QUICK SHOT OF RAIN OR SNOW AND COOL 
TEMPERATURES.

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OVER THE

THE REGION OVERNIGHT...WITH SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUING TO DECREASE IN 
COVERAGE AND INTENSITY. WILL PLAN TO LET THE WARNINGS AND ADVISORIES 
EXPIRE ON SCHEDULE AT MIDNIGHT. REPORTS FROM AROUND THE AREA THIS 
EVENING INDICATE 3 TO 5 INCHES ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF 
JOHNSON AND CARTER COUNTIES IN NORTHEAST TN...2 TO 3 INCHES IN WISE 
COUNTY VA...AND UP TO 10 INCHES ON MT LECONTE IN THE SMOKIES.

CURRENT FORECAST LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK OVERALL...AND WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE LATER THIS EVENING MAINLY TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING AND 
EXPIRE THE WARNINGS AND ADVISORIES.

CHANCES IN THE MOUNTAINS.  MOISTURE MORE LIMITED ON TUESDAY NIGHT... 
WILL KEEP ONLY SLIGHT POPS FOR THE NORTH AND MOUNTAINS.  SHOULD BE

THURSDAY.  WILL ADD SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY AND THURSDAY 
NIGHT.  SHOULD BE COLD ENOUGH FOR SNOW IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS BUT 
RAIN IN THE VALLEY.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
308 AM EST THU FEB 10 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...STRONG COLD ADVECTION 
PUSHING IN TODAY.  850MB TEMPS WILL DROP TO AROUND MINUS 10 DEGREES 
C BY THIS AFTERNOON.  MAIN LIFT HAS EXITED THE AREA BUT EXPECT A FEW 
ISOLATED SHOWERS OVER THE MRX THIS MORNING.  GOOD UPSLOPE CONDITIONS 
DEVELOPING IN NORTHWESTERLY FLOW.  THIS COMBINED WITH LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE AND WEAK DYNAMICS WILL PRODUCE LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS OVER MUCH 
OF THE EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.  24 HOUR SNOW TOTAL IS EXPECTED AT 1 TO 4 INCHES 
AND A SNOW ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR THE AFFECTED AREAS.  
ADDITIONALLY...PRESSURE GRADIENTS WILL TIGHTEN AND ASSOCIATED WINDS 
WILL INCREASE.  HIGHER TERRAIN WINDS MAY APPROACH ADVISORY LEVEL 
THIS EVENING.  DURING THE OVERNIGHT...WINDS WILL SLOWLY DECREASE AND 
UPSLOPE DRIVEN SNOW WILL DIMINISH TO A FEW FLURRIES.

.LONG TERM...(FRI THROUGH WED)...SHORT WAVE DROPPING DOWN IN THE 
NORTHWEST FLOW FRIDAY AND EARLY FRIDAY NIGHT LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE 
RATHER MOISTURE STARVED.  WILL JUST INCREASE CLOUDS A BIT MAINLY 
NORTH AND CENTRAL WITH THIS SYSTEM...AND KEEP PRECIP OUT OF THE  
FORECAST FOR NOW.  DRY SATURDAY...THEN NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES BY 
LATE SAT NIGHT/EARLY SUNDAY.  GFS HAS TRENDED SLOWER WITH PRECIP 
ARRIVAL...SO WILL CONTINUE TO KEEP SAT NIGHT DRY...THEN BRING CHANCE 
POPS IN ALL ZONES SUN.  LOOKS LIKE IT WILL BE WARM ENOUGH FOR AN ALL 
RAIN EVENT FOR SUNDAY THROUGH MONDAY.  WILL GENERALLY LEAVE LATER 
PERIODS OF THE FORECAST AS THEY ARE FOR NOW.  MAV TEMPS LOOK 
REASONABLE...SO WILL STAY CLOSE.

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...LITTLE CHANGE TO

EXPECTED. RAIN WILL MIX WITH AND CHANGE TO SNOW AFTER MIDNIGHT 
ACROSS HIGHER ELEVATIONS AND BECOME NEARLY ALL SNOW BY DAYBREAK. 
MOST VALLEY SURFACES WILL BE TOO WARM FOR ACCUMULATIONS BUT 
MEASURABLE SNOW LIKELY ACROSS HIGHER ELEVATIONS. JET MAX SLIDES SE 
OF E TN TONIGHT WITH DRYING IN THE MID LAYERS. LOW PRESSURE TO THE 
NE CONTINUES TO DEEPEN RESULTING IN BRISK NW WINDS THU. MORNING SNOW 
SHOWERS AND FLURRIES DECREASING ACROSS SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL VALLEYS 
BY AFTN. ACCUMULATING...MAINLY UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUE INTO 
THE EVENING IN FAVORABLE TERRAIN. CAA AND CLOUD COVER LOOK 
SUFFICIENT TO UNDERCUT MOS TEMPS. ANOTHER FAIRLY STRONG SHORT WAVE 
DIGS DOWN INTO AREA ON FRIDAY BUT WITH LIMITED MOISTURE BUT BRIEFLY 
BRINGING ADDITIONAL CAA FRI NGT. 

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS AND 
ENSEMBLES ARE IN REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT WITH OVERALL UPPER AIR 
FLOW IN RELATIVELY PROGRESSIVE PATTERN. SOME DIFFERENCES STILL EXIST 
IN TIMING INDIVIDUAL EVENTS. GFS STILL THE FASTEST WITH THE SUNDAY 
EVENT. WILL CONTINUE TO HOLD OFF MENTIONING POPS UNTIL AFTER 12Z 
SUNDAY...BUT SOME UNCERTAINTY STILL LINGERS. APPEARS UPSLOPE FLOW 
COULD AGAIN OCCUR LATE MONDAY AND TUESDAY AFTER PASSAGE OF SURFACE 
FRONT. HOWEVER...TEMPS WILL REMAIN RELATIVELY MILD KEEPING MOST OF 
PRECIP AS RAIN. UNCERTAINTY LINGERS THROUGH THE MIDDLE OF NEXT 
WEEK...BUT HAVE KEPT WEDNESDAY DRY FOR NOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
325 AM EST WED FEB 9 2005

.SHORT TERM...RAIN SHOWERS WILL MOVE INTO THE MRX CWA TODAY AS AN 
UPPER LOW PRESSURE TROUGH MOVES ACROSS THE REGION.  850MB TEMPS WILL 
REMAIN AROUND 6 DECREES C FOR THIS AFTERNOON.  HOWEVER...AS THE 
TROUGH AXIS MOVES THROUGH AND FLOW ALOFT BECOMES NORTHWESTERLY... 
COLDER AIR WILL BEGIN TO PUSH INTO THE AREA TONIGHT.  RAIN SHOWERS 
WILL TURN TO SNOW OVERNIGHT ACROSS MUCH OF THE EAST TENNESSEE 
MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.  WITH 
CONTINUED LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IN PLACE...LIFT FROM THE ASSOCIATED LOW 
AND UPSLOPE FLOW...SNOW SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE THROUGH LATE 
THURSDAY.  TOTAL 24 HOUR SNOWFALL IS EXPECTED TO BE BETWEEN 1 AND 4 
INCHES...THEREFORE ...A SNOW ADVISORY HAS BEEN ISSUED FOR THE 
AFFECTED AREA.  

.LONG TERM...(THU THROUGH TUESDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW 
NORTHWEST FLOW AND COLD ADVECTION THU INTO THU NIGHT.  SHOULD SEE 
SOME SNOW SHOWERS ALL BUT SOUTH...WITH SOME ACCUMULATIONS POSSIBLE 
OVER THE NORMALLY FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS.  SNOW ADVISORY WILL 
CONTINUE INTO EARLY THU NIGHT.  NEXT WAVE DROPPING QUICKLY DOWN IN 
THE NORTHWEST FLOW FRI AFTERNOON INTO FRI NIGHT SHOULD HAVE VERY 
LIMITED MOISTURE...SO FOR NOW WILL JUST INCREASE CLOUDS AND ADD SOME 
FLURRIES FOR EARLY FRI NIGHT FOR SW VA AND NORTHERN AND CENTRAL 
MOUNTAINS.  SHOULD BE DRY SAT BEFORE NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES SAT 
NIGHT AND SUNDAY.  GFS STILL SHOWS PRECIP COULD ARRIVE AT LEAST IN 
WESTERN PORTION OF THE AREA LATE SAT NIGHT...BUT IT HAS TRENDED 
SLOWER.  FOR NOW PLAN TO KEEP CONTINUITY AND BRING PRECIP IN ON 
SUNDAY. WILL GENERALLY LEAVE LATER PERIODS ALONE FOR NOW.  WILL MAKE 
ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS TO MAV TEMPS.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EST TUE FEB 8 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS 
SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONT OVER WESTERN MIDDLE TN...WITH LOCAL 
RADARS REVEALING ONLY PATCHY LIGHT DRIZZLE OVER THE FORECAST AREA. 
WITH AN ABSENCE OF STRONG FORCING MECHANISMS EXPECTED TONIGHT... 
THINK THAT ONLY ISOLATED LIGHT SHOWERS WILL BE POSSIBLE. AREAS OF 
FOG WILL LIKELY DEVELOP OVERNIGHT WITH PLENTY OF BOUNDARY LAYER 
MOISTURE IN PLACE...BUT WILL NOT MENTION DENSE FOG SINCE CLOUD COVER 
SHOULD HELP TO KEEP VISIBILITIES FROM DROPPING TOO MUCH. THIS FRONT 
WILL FINALLY MOVE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA AROUND NOON TOMORROW... 
AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH DEEPENS ACROSS THE TN RIVER VALLEY. THIS 
UPPER TROUGH SHOULD TRIGGER ADDITIONAL POST-FRONTAL SHOWERS IN THE 
AFTERNOON...BUT RAINFALL AMOUNTS LOOK TO REMAIN ON THE LIGHT SIDE.

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MOISTURE WRAPPING 
AROUND AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH AND GOOD UPSLOPE FLOW SHOULD INDUCE 
SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY IN THE HIGHER TERRAIN...THROUGH 
THURSDAY NIGHT. TEMPS WILL BE WELL BELOW CLIMO ON THURSDAY. UPPER 
TROUGH AXIS SWINGS THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS EARLY FRIDAY 
WHICH SHOULD EFFECTIVELY CUT OFF UPSLOPE SNOW SHOWER EVENT. SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN DURING THE DAY ON FRIDAY AND TEMPS MODERATE 
BUT WILL REMAIN SOMEWHAT BELOW CLIMO. GENERALLY BENIGN WEATHER WILL 
PERSIST INTO MUCH OF THE WEEKEND.

FURTHER OUT...FAIRLY MAJOR MODEL DIFFERENCES APPARENT IN THE TIMING 
OF THE NEXT EVENT LATE IN THE UPCOMING WEEKEND. GFS IS SIGNIFICANTLY 
FASTER THAN DGEX IN BRINGING PRECIP INTO OUR FORECAST AREA. VARIOUS 
MODEL ENSEMBLES DO NOT HELP APPRECIABLY IN FORMING A CONSENSUS FOR 
THIS TIMING. THEREFORE...HAVE GENERALLY CONTINUED PREVIOUS TIMING 
AND KEPT ALL AREAS DRY UNTIL AFTER 12Z SUNDAY. DEPENDING ON FUTURE 
MODEL RUNS...THIS SCENARIO IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE HOWEVER. PRECIP 
LOOKS TO BE ALL LIQUID AT THIS TIME AS TEMPS RISE TO NEAR CLIMO BY 
ONSET OF PRECIP. TEMPS ARE PROJECTED TO RISE TO ABOVE CLIMO EARLY 
NEXT WEEK.

MOVING FRONT SHOULD FINALLY MOVE EAST OF THE AREA BY WED EVENING AS 
WEAK WAVE MOVES ALONG THE FRONT AND HEIGHTS FALL.  FORCING DOES NOT 
APPEAR IMPRESSIVE FOR WED...BUT LIKELY POPS LOOK WARRANTED FOR LIGHT 
PRECIP.  MUCH COLDER AIR MOVES IN FOR WED NIGHT THROUGH THU

SNOW SHOWERS.  COULD BE A DECENT SNOW SHOWER EVENT FOR SOME OF THE 
FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS.  FOR NOW WILL CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW 
CHANCE POPS FOR CENTRAL AND NORTHERN VALLEY AREAS THU...WITH 40 TO 
50 POPS IN THE MOUNTAINS.  DRY SOUTH THU AND THU NIGHT.  DRY FRI 
INTO SATURDAY. WILL LEAVE LATER PERIODS ALONE FOR NOW.  00Z GFS 
TRYING TO MOVE THE NEXT SYSTEM IN A BIT FASTER FOR SAT NIGHT...BUT 
GIVEN UNCERTAINTY WILL LEAVE ALONE FOR NOW.  BIGGEST CHANGE TO MAV 
TEMPS WILL BE THU...WHERE WILL GO LOWER...CLOSER TO THE COLDER MET 
NUMBERS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
248 PM EST MON FEB 7 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
AN ELONGATED AREA OF HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED ALONG THE EASTERN 
SEABOARD...WITH A COLD FRONT OVER THE MID MISSISSIPPI VALLEY AND 
SOUTHERN PLAINS. A LARGE AREA OF SHOWERS AHEAD OF THIS COLD FRONT 
CONTINUES TO SLOWLY MOVE EAST ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND CENTRAL KY THIS 
AFTERNOON. THESE SHOWERS SHOULD MOVE EAST INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
THIS EVENING...BEFORE GRADUALLY DIMINISHING IN AREAL COVERAGE AFTER 
MIDNIGHT AS THE UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMES MORE ZONAL. AS A RESULT OF 
THE ZONAL FLOW ALOFT...THE COLD FRONT WILL ALSO STALL-OUT OVER 
MIDDLE TN ON TUESDAY...WITH MILD CONDITIONS CONTINUING ACROSS THE 
REGION.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...GFS AND NAM (ETA) 
DISAGREE QUITE A BIT ON SIGNIFICANCE OF WEDNESDAYS EVENT IN A 
RELATIVELY PROGRESSIVE UPPER AIR FLOW PATTERN REGIME. BOTH SHOW 
HEIGHTS CONTINUING TO FALL AS TROUGH BEGINS TO DIG INTO THE GREAT 
LAKES REGION. THE NAM PROJECTS CONSIDERABLY HIGHER GUIDANCE POPS 
THAN GFS GUIDANCE. THE SHORT RANGE ENSEMBLES FAVOR THE NAM SOLUTION 
WHILE THE CANADIAN GEM GENERALLY SUPPORTS THE GFS. DUE TO 
UNCERTAINTY...HAVE MAINTAINED CHANCE POPS FOR ENTIRE FORECAST AREA. 
PRECIP TAPERS OFF WEDNESDAY NIGHT AS SURFACE COLD FRONT PUSHES EAST 
OF THE APPALACHIANS. SNOW SHOWERS WILL LIKELY LINGER IN THE HIGHER 
TERRAIN WITH GOOD UPSLOPE FLOW HOWEVER. SPRAWLING SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE THEN BUILDS IN THROUGH THE BALANCE OF THE WORK WEEK AND 
INTO MUCH OF THE WEEKEND. NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES LATE IN THE 
WEEKEND. TEMPS WILL FALL TO BELOW CLIMO AFTER PASSAGE OF COLD FRONT 
ON WEDNESDAY AND SLOWLY MODERATE TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE CLIMO BY EARLY 
NEXT WEEK AS SURFACE HIGH MOVES EAST OF THE FORECAST AREA.

TROUGH OVER THE PLAINS. SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF

DEVELOPING ACROSS THE PLATEAU. ALTHOUGH SOME BREAKS WILL CONTINUE TO 
BE POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON...THINK THAT MOSTLY CLOUDY WILL BE THE 
PREDOMINANT SKY CONDITION. THESE CLOUDS SHOULD HELP TO KEEP MAXES A 
LITTLE COOLER THIS AFTERNOON THAN CURRENTLY FORECASTED. WILL PLAN TO 
UPDATE THE FORECAST THIS MORNING TO TWEAK SKY CONDITION WORDING AND 
TO LOWER MAXES A LITTLE.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
243 PM EST THU FEB 3 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...PRECIPITATION IS ENDING 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA WITH A FEW FLURRIES OR DRIZZLE OCCURRING 
MAINLY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. VISIBLE SATELLITE PICTURES SHOWING 
A BREAKUP OF CLOUDS BEGINNING ACROSS THE SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE 
FORECAST AREA AND ON THE EAST SIDE OF THE APPALACHIANS. UPPER TROUGH 
IS MOVING THROUGH THE APPALACHIANS NOW AND THERE MAY BE A FEW SPITS 
OF RAIN OR SNOW EARLY. OTHERWISE HIGH PRESSURE WILL MOVE INTO THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY OVERNIGHT TONIGHT AND FRIDAY. GFS IS A LITTLE 
FASTER WITH MOVING LOW CLOUD DECK TONIGHT THAN ETA WITH BOTH MODELS 
SHOWING NO CLOUDS BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON. FOLLOWING MORE PESSIMISTIC 
ETA WITH DECREASE OF CLOUDS TONIGHT AND FRIDAY. FOLLOWED MAV 
GUIDANCE FRIDAY FOR HIGHS BUT SLIGHTLY ABOVE MAV NUMBERS TONIGHT 
BECAUSE OF LINGERING CLOUDS.   

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS
AGREE WITH BUILDING A FAIRLY SIGNIFICANT RIDGE OVER THE TENNESSEE
VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY. SOME CI/CS
ANTICIPATED TO MOVE INTO THE REGION BY SUNDAY AS THE RIDGE AXIS MOVES
EAST OF THE AREA...BUT OVERALL A CLEAR SKY FORECAST.

THE ECMWF SEEMS TO BE THE MODEL OF CHOICE AGAIN TODAY WITH BEST
TELECONNECTIONS AND CONSISTENCY.  WILL BASE NEXT WEEKS FORECAST MAINLY
OFF THE ECMWF MODEL WHICH DEVELOPS A FAIRLY DEEP TROUGH OVER THE MID-
SECTION OF THE NATION FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK. THICKNESS AND 850 TEMPERATURES
WARM SIGNIFICANTLY WITH ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES ANTICIPATED. ISENTROPIC
LIFT INCREASES MONDAY AND TUESDAY WITH FROPA ANTICIPATED FOR LATE 
WEDNESDAY AND WEDNESDAY NIGHT. THERMAL TROUGH NOT EXPECTED TO MOVE
EAST OF THE AREA UNTIL THURSDAY NIGHT...SO PLENTY OF COLD AIR STRATO-CU
FOR THURSDAY WITH SHOWERS POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY FOR THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS.

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

945 AM EST THU FEB 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT RADARS INDICATING LIGHT PRECIPITATION ACROSS NORTHEAST TN 
AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA WITH TEMPERATURES IN THE LOWER TO MID 30S. 
THE LOWER ELEVATIONS ARE REPORTING LIGHT RAIN BUT HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
MAY BE GETTING FREEZING RAIN OR SNOW. REPORTS FROM THE SMOKY 
MOUNTAINS ARE OF FREEZING RAIN AT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. FREEZING 
LEVELS SHOWN ON PROGGED SOUNDINGS WERE FROM 3000 TO 3500 FEET FOR NE 
TN AND SW VA AND EXPECTED TO DROP TO 3500 TO 4000 FEET IN THE 
SMOKIES BY THIS AFTERNOON AS UPPER TROUGH OVER THE OHIO VALLEY MOVES 
ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. WINDS WILL SHIFT TO THE NORTHWEST BY 18Z 
AND THIS SHOULD CHANGE THE PRECIPITATION TO SNOW AT THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. THE MOISTURE LOOKS TO MOVE OUT BY LATE THIS AFTERNOON.   
WILL CONTINUE THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY TO 4 PM. NO CHANGES TO 
CURRENT FORECAST.

AND ITS COLDER AIR ALOFT YET TO SWING ACROSS THE AREA...THINK SNOW 
AND SOME FREEZING RAIN SHOULD STILL DEVELOP IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
ABOVE 2500 FEET THIS MORNING.

WITH A GRADUAL WARMING TREND. ANOTHER FRONT IS PROGGED TO BRING THE 
NEXT CHANCE OF RAIN BY SUNDAY NIGHT INTO MONDAY...WITH UNSETTLED 
WEATHER POSSIBLE FOR MOST OF NEXT WEEK. THE GOOD NEWS IS MODEL 
SOUNDINGS AND THICKNESS VALUES INDICATE THAT PRECIP NEXT WEEK SHOULD

WEEKEND ALLOWING FOR RETURN TO DRY CONDITIONS AND MILD TEMPERATURES.

UPPER FLOW BECOMING MORE SOUTHWEST EARLY NEXT WEEK AS A UPPER TROUGH
BECOMES ESTABLISHED OVER THE SOUTHERN ROCKIES.  THIS SETS THE
STAGE FOR INCREASING ISENTROPIC LIFT THROUGH MID-WEEK WITH A SERIES
OF SHORT-WAVES EJECTING NORTHEAST MOVING ACROSS THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY.  PERIODS OF RAIN IS ANTICIPATED...BUT TIMING OF BEST COVERAGE
IS A TOUGH CALL.  HAVE CALLED FOR CHANCE POPS BEGINNING MONDAY NIGHT
AND TUESDAY.  A STRONGER SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO AND 
TENNESSEE VALLEYS FOR TUESAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 020836
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
335 AM EST WED FEB 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS CONTINUES TO SHOW A WEAK INVERTED TROUGH 
OVER THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...WITH A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
ALONG THE LOUISIANA GULF COAST. LIGHT RAIN SHOULD SLOWLY SPREAD 
NORTHEAST FROM THIS GULF LOW TODAY IN THE WARM SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. 
LOCAL RADARS INDICATE A LARGE AREA OF LIGHT RAIN ALREADY OVER 
NORTHERN AL THIS MORNING...WITH TEMPS REMAINING WELL ABOVE FREEZING 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN. MODELS APPEAR TO FINALLY BE COMING TOGETHER ON 
A SIMILAR SOLUTION FOR TODAY AND TOMORROW. THIS INCLUDES RAIN FOR 
MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA TODAY...WITH SNOW DEVELOPING AFTER 
MIDNIGHT TONIGHT ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWEST VA. MODELS 
INDICATE ONLY LIGHT PRECIP AMOUNTS TODAY WITH THE SURFACE LOW 
REMAINING OVER THE DEEP SOUTH. 

MOST PRECIP FOR THE FORECAST AREA IS EXPECTED AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT 
AND THURSDAY MORNING...AS AN UPPER-LEVEL TROUGH SWINGS ACROSS THE 
REGION. THIS UPPER TROUGH WILL BRING COOLER TEMPS ALOFT WHICH SHOULD 
CHANGE THE RAIN OVER TO SNOW ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA. MODELS INDICATE THAT THE BOUNDARY LAYER 
WILL REMAIN TOO WARM FOR SNOW ELSEWHERE. RIGHT NOW... EXPECT 
GENERALLY 1 TO 4 INCHES OF SNOW ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA BY THURSDAY AFTERNOON. IN ADDITION TO THE 
SNOW...SOME FREEZING RAIN WILL BE POSSIBLE ACROSS THE MOUNTAINS LATE 
TONIGHT AFTER MIDNIGHT BEFORE THE COMPLETE CHANGEOVER TO ALL SNOW. 
HOWEVER...THINK THAT ANY ICE ACCUMULATIONS SHOULD BE LIGHT AND OCCUR 
BRIEFLY TOWARDS SUNRISE. WITH ALL OF THIS IN MIND...WILL PLAN TO 
ISSUE A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT TO ADDRESS THE POSSIBILITY OF 
ADVISORY CRITERIA WINTER PRECIP IN THESE AREAS LATE TONIGHT INTO 
THURSDAY. 

SURE HOPE THE GROUNDHOGS DONT SEE THEIR SHADOWS TODAY...SINCE THIS 
FORECASTER IS TIRED OF WINTER.
&&

THU INTO THU NIGHT.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
420 PM EST TUE FEB 1 2005

.SHORT TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...SOUTHERN STREAM 
TROF MAKES ITS MOVE TOWARD THE TN VLY TONIGHT WITH PLENTIFUL 
MOISTURE AND ISENTROPIC LIFT REQUIRING RAISING POPS LATER TONIGHT 
INTO WED FOR -RA. CLOSED UPPER LOW BUILDS TWD THE FA WED NIGHT INTO 
THU WITH STRENGTHENING DYNAMIC LIFT. RESIDENT AIRMASS REMAINS CHILLY 
ESPECIALLY IN HIGHER TERRAIN ON WED AND BY WED NIGHT THICKNESS 
SUPPORTS A MIXED BAG OF PRECIP BECOMING MORE LIKELY SNOW ALONG THE 
CAROLINA BORDER BY DAYBREAK THU. WILL USE A MIXTURE OF PRECIP MUCH 
OF THE REMAINDER OF FA AS CRITICAL THICKNESS/LOW LVL TEMPS 
BORDERLINE FOR MIXTURE OF RAIN AND SNOW. HOWEVER...HIGHER TERRAIN 
ACROSS CAROLINA BORDER SHOULD SEE SOME LIGHT SNOW ACCUMULATION. 
LATER MODEL RUNS WILL BRING EVENT MORE IN FO. SOMETHING MORE LIKE THE 
CANADIAN IS PREFERRED.

THUS IT LOOKS LIKE ANY CHANCE OF SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION SHOULD 
BE PUSHED BACK INTO THURSDAY AFTERNOON. THICKNESSES SUGGEST A RAIN 
SNOW MIX ALMOST EVERYWHERE. DO NOT WANT TO PERFECT PROG THE GFS 
MODEL WITH ALL MODEL FORECASTS CHANGING DRASTICALLY FROM RUN TO RUN 
AND BETWEEN EACH OTHER. HOWEVER THE MORE NORTHERLY 500MB TROF MODELS 
ARE PAINTING A WEAK SURFACE LOW AND SIGNIFICANT PRECIPITATION COULD 
BE IN DOUBT IN THE NORTH AND ESPECIALLY THE NORTHWEST. 

REJECT THE GFS 500MB PATTERN AND THEREFORE THE GFS PRECIPITATION 
FRIDAY AND SEE PERHAPS A SLIGHT CHANCE IN THE EAST DURING THE 
MORNING HOURS AFTER SUNRISE.

WILL UPDATE STATEMENT ON THE EVENT WITH EMPHASIS ON CONTINUED 
UNCERTAINTY. NO WATCH AND IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT THIS EVENT MAY FALL 
IN THE NUISANCE ADVISORY CRITERIA.

NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES FOR TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY. 
&&

.LONG TERM (FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...
HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE REGION OVER THE WEEKEND RESULTING IN 
DRY WEATHER. WARMING TREND WITH HIGHS IN THE LOWER AND MID 50S. 
MOSTLY 30S AT NIGHT. 

MONDAY AND TUESDAY...
COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE AREA FROM WEST. TIMING DIFFERENCES AMONG 
THE MODELS AS TO WHEN FRONT WILL CROSS DURING THE MONDAY TUESDAY 
TIME FRAME...WILL CONTINUE CHANCE INTO TUESDAY. SEASONAL 
TEMPERATURES DURING THE PERIOD.
&&

..AVIATION...
EXTENSIVE STRATOCUMULUS LAYER OVER WESTERN CWA RESULTING IN CEILINGS 
4 TO 6 THOUSAND FEET. CENTRAL AND EASTERN SECTIONS...SCATTERED TO 
BROKEN STRATOCUMULUS LAYER 4 TO 6 THOUSAND FEET. VISIBILITIES 
UNRESTRICTED ACROSS THE CWA. CLOUDS GRADUALLY ERODING DURING THE 
EVENING...BECOMING SCATTERED LAYERS 5 TO 6 THOUSAND FEET BROKEN 
CEILING 10 TO 12 THOUSAND FEET. VFR CONDITIONS ENTIRE CWA AFT 02Z.  
PATCHY FOG LOWERING VISIBILITIES TO 3 TO 5 MILES 08Z-12Z.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 010839
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EST TUE FEB 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDING ACROSS MOST 
OF THE EASTERN U.S. WITH A WEAK TROUGH ACROSS THE WESTERN FOOTHILLS 
OF THE APPALACHIANS. RADARS INDICATE AREAS OF LIGHT DRIZZLE ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA THIS MORNING...WITH TEMPS REMAINING WELL ABOVE 
FREEZING IN THE UPPER 30S TO LOWER 40S. THIS DRIZZLE SHOULD END BY 
SUNRISE AS ITS ASSOCIATED WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE EXITS THE 
REGION. SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL EXTENSIVE CLOUDINESS ACROSS MOST OF 
THE EASTERN U.S. AND WILL NOT TRY TO BE OPTIMISTIC WITH CLOUD 
COVER...SINCE THERE DOESNT APPEAR TO BE ANY SIGNIFICANT DRYING OF 
THE ATMOSPHERE FOR THE NEXT SEVERAL DAYS. 

A DEVELOPING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM ALONG THE GULF COAST NEAR LOUISIANA 
WILL BEGIN TO INFLUENCE THE REGIONS WEATHER BY LATER TONIGHT. 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT WILL ADVECT MOISTURE FROM THIS GULF SYSTEM 
ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT...BUT EXPECT ONLY LIGHT 
RAIN WITH TEMPS REMAINING ABOVE FREEZING. GFS AND NAM/ETA MODELS 
CONTINUE TO BE IN DISAGREEMENT WITH THE TRACK OF THIS LOW PRESSURE 
SYSTEM BY WED NIGHT INTO THURSDAY. THE NAM/ETA MODEL REVEALS A MORE 
AMPLIFIED 500 MB TROUGH...WHICH RESULTS IN A MORE NORTHERLY TRACK OF 
THE SURFACE LOW THAN THE GFS MODEL. OTHER MODELS SUCH AS CANADIAN/ 
UKMET/ECMWF AND FSU SUPERENSEMBLES SUPPORT THE GFS SOLUTION OF A 
MORE SOUTHERLY TRACK OF THE SURFACE LOW...RESULTING IN LESS PRECIP 
FOR THE FORECAST AREA. THUS...EXPECT SOME PRECIP TO DEVELOP ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT...BUT AT THIS TIME IT 
APPEARS THAT IT WILL BE MOSTLY RAIN WITH LIGHT AMOUNTS GENERALLY 
LESS THAN A QUARTER OF AN INCH.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             50  38  45  38 /  10  30  60  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  48  36  45  36 /  10  10  40  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       48  35  46  36 /  10  10  40  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              42  30  44  34 /  10   0  30  50

FXUS64 KMRX 312103
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
400 PM EST MON JAN 31 2005

.SHORT TERM (MON NIGHT THROUGH WED NIGHT)...WEAK S/WV MOVS E ACROSS 
THE REGION TONIGHT. SYSTEM IS WEAK AND VORTICITY IS CHANNELED. 
HOWEVER DECIDED TO KEEP THE PREVIOUS FORECAST WORDING FOR 
POSSIBILITY OF SOME DRIZZLE OR FLURRIES. QUITE A BIT OF LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE IN STORE MUCH OF THE AREA AT LEAST THROUGH A GOOD PART OF 
THE MORNING TUE WITH SOME BREAKS TO REVEAL PARTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS 
BY AFTERNOON MAINLY CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEY ZONES. DRY FORECAST 
HAD TO BE ADJUSTED TO SOMETHING OTHER THAN DRY FOR WED AND WED NIGHT 
AS GFS MODEL HAS TRENDED MUCH CLOSER TO THE NAM ALTHOUGH DIFFERENCES 
REMAIN AS USUAL WITH NAM BEING MORE AMPLIFIED WITH SRN PLAINS TROF 
AS IT PRESSES E INTO THE TN VLY. WITH GREATER AMPLIFICATION NAM 
BRINGS MORE WARM AIR NORTH INTO APPALACHIANS THAN GFS. WITH MORE 
CLOUDS EXPECTED THAN SUN THE NEXT COUPLE DAYS AND E TO NE LOW LVL 
FLO TEMPS WILL NOT BE QUITE WARM ENOUGH TO STAY AWAY FROM A THREAT 
FOR MIXED PRECIP OR PLAIN OLD SNOW BY LATE WED NIGHT AS ISENTROPIC 
LIFT INCREASES AHEAD OF STORM SYSTEM. WILL HAVE TO WAIT FOR BETTER 
MODEL AGREEMENT TO GET INTO THE COMPLEXITY OF TRANSITIONING PRECIP 
TYPES IN LATER FORECAST ISSUANCES. STAYED CLOSE TO TEMP GUIDANCE 
BLEND FIRST THREE PERIODS AND WENT A LITTLE CLOSER TO GFS MAXES ON 
WED AS CLOUDS ADVANCE AHEAD OF SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM.  

.LONG TERM (THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...A RAIN AND SNOW MIX EXPECTED 
THURSDAY BECOMING MOSTLY RAIN IN THE VALLEYS BY AFTN. SCT SNOW 
SHOWERS EXPECTED TO CONTINUE FRI MORNING AS HIGH PRESSURE AND COLD 
AIRMASS BUILDS IN FM THE NW. MODELS ARE NOT CONSISTENT OR IN GOOD 
AGREEMENT BUT ACCUMULATIONS LOOKING BETTER FOR THE MNTS. SOME 
SUNSHINE AND RETURN FLOW EXPECTED LATE WEEK EARLY WEEKEND. ANOTHER 
BOUT WITH PCPN EXPECTED LATE SUNDAY AS ANOTHER COLD FRONT APPROACHES 
WITH PCPN CONTINUING ON MONDAY WITH FRONTAL PASSAGE.

&&

1000 AM EST MON JAN 31 2005

.DISCUSSION...CURRENT FCST LOOKS FAIRLY DECENT AT THIS POINT AS WEAK 
(THANKFULLY) S/WV TROF PUSHING E ACROSS MID SOUTH DOESNT APPEAR TO 
BE PRODUCING ENOUGH RISING MOTION TO PRODUCE LARGE ENOUGH DROPS OF 
-RA TO MAKE IT TO THE SURFACE THIS MORNING. EXPECT THIS GENERAL 
TREND TO CONTINUE WITH A SPRINKLE OR TWO AT BEST MAINLY SE TN/SW NC. 
CLOUDS SHOULD BE WITH US THROUGH THE DAY WITH THE PERSISTENT 
SATURATED LAYER AROUND 2-3 THOUSAND FEET WITH HIGHER LAYER MOVING IN 
AROUND 10 TO 15 THOUSAND FEET ASSOCIATED WITH UPPER LEVEL FEATURE. 
MAX TEMPS APPEAR TO HAVE BEEN CORRECTLY SLIGHTLY UNDERCUT OFF 
SUGGESTED GUIDANCE ON THE MIDNIGHT SHIFT DUE TO CLOUD COVER. NO 
UPDATES PLANNED ATTM.

FXUS64 KMRX 310748
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
248 AM EST MON JAN 31 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE EXTENDING ACROSS MOST OF THE EASTERN 
U.S. WITH AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS COVERING MOST OF THE TN AND OH 
RIVER VALLEYS. SOME WESTWARD-MOVING CLEARING OF THE LOW CLOUDS FROM 
THE MID ATLANTIC REGION MAY MOVE INTO PORTIONS OF SOUTHWEST VA AND 
EXTREME NORTHEAST TN THIS MORNING...BUT HIGH CLOUDS IN THE ZONAL 
FLOW ALOFT SHOULD HELP TO KEEP SKIES MOSTLY CLOUDY THROUGH TONIGHT 
EVERYWHERE. A WEAK SHORT WAVE IS PROGGED TO SWING ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA TONIGHT...POSSIBLY GENERATING A FEW AREAS OF DRIZZLE 
THIS EVENING AND SNOW FLURRIES AFTER MIDNIGHT. AS FAR AS TEMPS ARE 
CONCERNED...WILL UNDERCUT GUIDANCE BY A FEW DEGREES TODAY WITH THE 
EXTENSIVE CLOUD COVER EXPECTED TO CONTINUE THROUGH TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY THRU SUNDAY)...OPERATIONAL MODELS AND SHORT 
RANGE ENSEMBLES GENERALLY AGREE THAT SOUTHERN STREAM WILL REMAIN 
ACTIVE THROUGH THE PERIOD...BUT ACTIVITY WILL MAINLY BE CONFINED TO 
GULF COAST. SOME UNCERTAINTY EXISTS FOR LATE WED/EARLY THU AS 
ETA/NAM PUSHES SOME OF THE SOUTHERN STREAM PRECIP ACTIVITY INTO OUR 
FORECAST AREA AS POSITIVELY-TILTED SHORT WAVE TROUGH APPROACHES. 
HOWEVER...BOTH THE GFS AND CANADIAN GEM KEEP THE PRECIP TO OUR 
SOUTH. POOR AGREEMENT AMONG GFS ENSEMBLE MEMBERS PROVIDES LITTLE 
HELP. DUE TO UNCERTAINTY...WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY FOR NOW. WEAK 
UPPER RIDGING IS PROJECTED TO BUILD BACK INTO THE REGION BY FRIDAY 
AND PERSIST THROUGH THE WEEKEND. THUS...ANTICIPATE SOME TEMPERATURE 
MODERATION DURING THAT TIME FRAME.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.DISCUSSION...CLOUDY SKIES ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT AS HIGH

ADJUST TONIGHTS MINIMUMS UP A FEW DEGREES MOST GROUPS.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 302016
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST SUN JAN 30 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THRU MONDAY NIGHT)...WEATHER FINALLY TAKING A 
TURN FOR THE BETTER THIS AFTERNOON...ALTHOUGH OVERCAST CLOUD DECK 
HAS ONLY GRADUALLY LIFTED WITH JUST SOME DECENT BREAKS ACROSS 
WESTERN NC.  TRIED TO ALLOW FOR SOME OF THIS CLEARING TO WORK WEST 
INTO THE E TN MTN AND SW NC COUNTIES INTO THE EARLY EVENING HOURS...
THEN BACK TO MOSTLY CLOUDY ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA.  TEMPS 
HAVE WARMED JUST ABOUT RIGHT UP TO FORECASTED HIGHS...AND WONT 
LIKELY FALL TOO MUCH UNDER THE MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES TONIGHT.  THIS 
MEANS ANY BELOW FEEEZING TEMPS WILL BE LIMITED TO HIGHER ELEVATIONS
...AND ALSO RADAR/SURFACE OBSERVATIONS INDICATE THE DRIZZLE OR 
FLURRY ACTIVITY HAS ENDED.  HOWEVER...WILL INCLUDE PATCHY FOG AS 
TEMPS DROP TO NEAR DEWPOINTS TONIGHT...BUT NO DENSE FOG ATTM.

FOR MONDAY...EXPECT A GOOD CHANCE OF SOME PARTIAL SUNSHINE GENERALLY 
ACROSS THE AREA BY LATE MORNING/EARLY AFTERNOON AS RIDGE BUILDS.  
WILL NEED TO SWITCH BACK TO MOSTLY CLOUDY BY MONDAY NIGHT AS A 
SHORTWAVE PASSES ACROSS NRN TN...KY AND SW VA OVERNIGHT.  FOR NOW I 
HAVE LIMITED ANY PCPN TO JUST A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SNOW FOR SWRN VA...
AND FLURRIES OVER EXTREME NE TN.  WILL LET LATER SHIFTS SEE IF THIS 
FEATURE IS WORTH SPREADING LOW POPS ANY FURTHER SOUTH.  

FOR TEMPS...PRIOR TO OUR WINTER WEATHER EVENT...MAV MOS HAD BEEN TOO 
COOL ON BOTH MINS AND MAXES.  WITH THIS IN MIND...DECIDED TO GO 
CLOSER TO THE MOS BLEND MOST LOCATIONS...EXCEPT RHP WHERE THE MAX 
SHOULD BE HIGHER THAN CHA OR ANY OF THE MOS CHOICES.  FOR MINS MON 
NIGHT...INVERTED SURFACE TROUGH AND INCREASE IN CLOUDS SEEMED TO 
JUSTIFY GOING A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE THE MAV MOS.


.LONG TERM...(TUE THRU SUN)...A LITTLE TOO MUCH VARIABILITY IN 
MODELS DURING THIS PERIOD OF THE FCST FOR ANYTHING APPROACHING 
MODERATE LEVEL CONFIDENCE IN EXPECTED WX. THE GENERAL IDEA WAS TO 
STAY WITH DRY REGIME AS MAINLY WEAK SRN STREAM S/WVS RIP ALONG TO 
THE E THRU THE SRN THIRD OF THE U.S. WITH DEEPEST MOISTURE AND 
BETTER LIFT FARTHER SOUTH OF MRX FA. IF PRECIP WERE TO DEVELOP BEST 
CHC OF OCCURRENCE WOULD BE WED NIGHT THRU THU NIGHT AS HIGHER 
AMPLITUDE TROF BUILDS E THRU THE LWR MS VLY INTO THE GULF COAST 
STATES. DECIDED TO LEAVE DRY FOR NOW AND WAIT FOR MORE CONSISTENCY 
IN MODELS. AFTER THIS THREAT PASSES RIDGING STRENGTHENS ALLOWING FOR 
CONTINUED UNEVENTFUL WX WITH MAX/MIN TEMPS HOLDING NEAR 
CLIMATOLOGICAL NORMS. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

FXUS64 KMRX 301438
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
936 AM EST SUN JAN 30 2005

.DISCUSSION...LINGERING LIGHT PCPN ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA SHOULD 
BE JUST TRACE AMOUNTS OF DRIZZLE OR SNOW FLURRIES TODAY.  SOME 
LOCATIONS STILL INDICATING PATCHY DENSE FOG...BUT VISIBILITIES HAVE 
GENERALLY IMPROVED TO ONE MILE OR MORE.  THIS TRACE PCPN AND FOG IS 
WELL COVERED IN THE SHORT TERM FORECAST.  

THE 12Z OHX AND RNK SOUNDINGS SHOW THE LOW LEVEL MOISTURE IS QUITE 
DEEP...FROM AT LEAST 750 MBS TO THE SURFACE.  UPPER AIR PLOTS SHOW 
WEAK COLD AIR ADVECTION AT 850 MBS...WITH RUC MODEL SHOWING 
CONTINUED WEAK COLD AIR OR NEUTRAL ADVECTION THIS AFTERNNON.  THUS...
I DONT LOOK FOR TEMPS TO WARM BY MORE THAN 5 DEGREES OR SO FROM THE 
CURRENT VALUES.  WILL UPDATE AND REMOVE MORNING WORDING...PLUS MAKE 
ANY SLIGHT ADJUSTMENTS TO TEMPS AND/OR WINDS AS NEEDED.

FOR LATER PERIODS...THE SHORT WAVE TROUGH HAS PASSED TO OUR EAST 
WITH UPPER RIDGE TO BUILD IN FOR TODAY THRU MONDAY.  A FEW WEAK 
IMPULSES MAY APPROACH THE REGION MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY...BUT THE 
TROUGHING ACROSS THE SW STATES GENERALLY HOLDS IN PLACE.  THIS 
SHOULD KEEP OUR WEATHER MOSTLY DRY THROUGH TUESDAY AS REFLECTED IN 
CURRENT FORECAST.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
.NC...NONE.
.TN...NONE.
.VA...NONE.
