FXUS64 KMRX 300840
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EST SUN JAN 30 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
BROAD AREA OF LOW PRESSURE ACROSS THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS WITH 
TEMPS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA REMAINING SLIGHTLY ABOVE FREEZING. 
RADARS INDICATE THAT MOST OF THE EARLIER PRECIP HAS EXITED THE 
FORECAST AREA...AND WILL PLAN TO LET THE LAST OF THE WINTER STORM 
WARNINGS FOR NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA EXPIRE AS SCHEDULED. 
MODELS INDICATE THAT SOME PATCHY DRIZZLE WILL BE POSSIBLE THIS 
MORNING...BUT TEMPS SHOULD STAY ABOVE FREEZING AS DEWPOINTS REMAIN 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE FREEZING AT ALL OB SITES. MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE 
THAT THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS ABOVE 2500 FEET WILL BE BELOW FREEZING 
THIS MORNING...WHERE A FEW SNOW FLURRIES BE POSSIBLE WITH SOME 
REFREEZING OF LEFTOVER MOISTURE POSSIBLE ON THE ROADS. OTHERWISE... 
IT APPEARS IT WILL BE MOSTLY CLOUDY AND DRY THROUGH TONIGHT.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THRU SATURDAY)...GENERALLY UNEVENTFUL WEATHER 
ANTICIPATED THROUGH THE UPCOMING WORK WEEK AS SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
BECOME SANDWICHED BETWEEN ACTIVE NORTHERN STREAM ALONG THE CANADIAN 
BORDER AND SOUTHERN STREAM ALONG THE GULF COAST. LATEST GFS 
INDICATES SOME POTENTIAL FOR A LITTLE PRECIP TO SNEAK INTO THE 
SOUTHERN TIER OF THE FORECAST AREA ON THURSDAY...BUT THIS APPEARS TO 
BE INSIGNIFICANT AT THIS TIME. THUS WILL NOT CHANGE EXISTING DRY 
GRIDS/FORECAST FOR THAT PERIOD. TEMPS WILL GENERALLY AVERAGE NEAR TO 
SLIGHTLY ABOVE CLIMATOLOGY THROUGH THE PERIOD.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
905 PM EST SAT JAN 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...WINTER EVENT IS NEARING THE END BUT MAY HAVE ONE LAST 
GASP LATE TONIGHT...ESPECIALLY FROM ABOUT INTERSTATE 40 NORTH. WARM 
AIR ALOFT HAS CHANGED THE FREEZING RAIN TO RAIN IN ALMOST ALL 
LOCATIONS. UPPER LOW HOWEVER MOVING INTO THE OHIO VALLEY WILL DRAG 
SOME COLDER AIR INTO THE AREA LATER TONIGHT AS IT TRACKS JUST TO THE 
NORTH. OHX EVENING SOUNDING SHOWS ALL BUT ABOUT THE LOWEST THOUSAND 
FEED OF THE TEMPERATURE PROFILE BELOW FREEZING WITH. HAVE LET THE 
WINTER STORM WARNING EXPIRE FOR THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS EXPIRE AT 8PM 
WITH RAIN REPORTED THROUGH THE MOUNTAINS. OTHER AREAS OF NE TN AND 
SW VA WILL CONTINUE TO HAVE LIGHT RAIN THEN CHANGE TO LIGHT SNOW FOR 
A FEW HOURS LATE TONIGHT. AREA RADARS SHOWING VERY LIGHT RAIN OR 
POSSIBLY FREEZING RAIN NORTH COVERING THE EASTERN HALF OF TENNESSEE 
WILL CONTINUE CURRENT FORECAST WITH NO CHANGES. 
&&

         AND 4AM EST SUNDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 292112
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
412 PM EST SAT JAN 29 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THRU SUNDAY NIGHT)...WINTER EVENT IS WINDING 
DOWN A BIT...ESPECIALLY FOR WESTERN MOST AREAS WHERE THE WARM AIR 
ALOFT HAS CHANGED MIX TO MOSTLY LIGHT RAIN.  SMOKY MTN NATIONAL PARK 
CONTINUES TO REPORT WET SNOW WITH SOME ROADS TO BE CLEARED...THUS I 
KEPT THE WINTER STORM WARNING THRU 8PM EST AS ADVERTISED BEFORE.

THERE IS A THREAT OF MORE LIGHT SNOW OVERNIGHT AS THE UPPER LOW 
TRACKS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...IN FACT THE ETA MODEL SOUNDINGS 
ARE NOW A LITTLE COOLER THAN THE GFS SOUNDINGS AFTER 30/00Z  THUS
...KEPT THE WINTER STORM WARNING GOING A LITTLE LONGER OVER THE 
EASTERN MOST COUNTIES OF SWRN VA AND NE TN MTNS (THRU 4AM EST).
WITH THE CHANGE BACK TO LIGHT SNOW LATE TONIGHT...SOME LIGHT SNOW 
ACCUMS ARE POSSIBLE AND WERE MENTIONED IN A FEW AREAS (BELOW 
ADVISORY OR WARNING CRITERIA).  MINS DONT FALL MUCH BELOW UPPER 20S 
TO LOWER 30S OVERNIGHT.

THE PRECIPITATION LINGERS JUST INTO SUNDAY MORNING...BUT THE CLOUDS 
LOOK TO LINGER WELL INTO SUNDAY NIGHT.  COMPROMISED TOWARD THE 
COOLER HIGHS WITH MINS CLOSE AND ACCEPTED. 


.LONG TERM...MON THRU SAT)...APPEARS TO BE A DRY PERIOD AS HIGH PRES 
PUSHES COLD AIRMASS WELL INTO THE DEEP SOUTH FOR SEVERAL DAYS AND 
BEST MOISTURE AND SOURCES FOR LIFT ARE SUPPRESSED WELL SOUTH AND 
WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA. TEMPERATURES GRADUALLY RISE TO AROUND 
CLIMO EARLY IN THE WORK WEEK WITH SOME MODERATION TOWARD THE END OF 
THE WEEK.

FXUS64 KMRX 291506
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1005 AM EST SAT JAN 29 2005

.DISCUSSION...WINTER WEATHER EVENT SEEMS TO BE OCCURRING CLOSE TO 
EXPECTED...ALTHOUGH MORE AREAS OF FREEZING RAIN BEING REPORTED THAN 
SNOW OR SLEET.  SOME ICE ACCUMULATIONS OF 1/4 INCH OR MORE SEEM TO 
HAVE OCCURRED GENERALLY FROM SW TO NE PARTS OF THE FORECAST AREA.  
THE SMOKY MTN NATIONAL PARK HAS REPORTED 3 INCHES OF SNOW AT 
NEWFOUND GAP...WITH FREEZING RAIN ABOUT 1500 FEET ABOVE PARK 
HEADQUARTERS THEN A CHANGE TO SNOW IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS.  SNOW 
WAS ALSO REPORTED AT ROAN MTN IN CARTER COUNTY.

HAVE NOT LOOKED AT 12Z MODEL DATA WHICH IS TRICKLING IN...AS MOST 
TIME SPENT MAKING AND TAKING CALLS SO FAR.  HOWEVER...DID VIEW RUC 
AND WRF MODEL SOUNDINGS WHICH INDICATE THE WARM AIR ALOFT SHOULD 
CONTINUE TO PUSH INTO THE REGION...AND THE CHANGE OR MIX TO RAIN DID 
SEEM TO BE OCCURRING BASED ON CALLS.  HAMILTON COUNTY REPORTED ICE 
ON TREES AND POWERLINES...WITH SOME POWER OUTAGES.  GOOD NEWS IN THE 
SE TN AND SW NC AREAS IS THAT SURFACE TEMPS SEEM TO BE WARMING TO 
AND ABOVE 32 DEGREES.  THUS...THE WINTER STORM WARNING SET TO EXPIRE 
AT NOON THERE LOOKS ON TRACK.

WILL LIKELY NEED TO UPDATE THE ZFP SHORTLY...THEN FRESHEN THE WINTER 
STORM WARNING PRODUCT AND GRIDS BEFORE NOON.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
.NC...WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL NOON TODAY.

.TN...WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL NOON TODAY ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN.

WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL 8 PM THIS EVENING ACROSS CENTRAL EAST TN.

WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL MIDNIGHT SUNDAY ACROSS NORTHEAST TN.

.VA...WINTER STORM WARNING UNTIL MIDNIGHT SUNDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 290939
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EST SAT JAN 29 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A 
LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE EASTERN UNITED STATES...WITH 
LOW PRESSURE ACROSS THE GULF COAST NEAR NEW ORLEANS. A CLOSED 500 MB 
LOW OVER THE OZARKS THIS MORNING WILL CONTINUE TO HELP SPREAD  
MOISTURE NORTHEAST FROM THIS SURFACE LOW ACROSS THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION...OVER-RIDING A COLD AND DRY AIRMASS AT THE 
SURFACE. CURRENT SURFACE OBS REVEAL FREEZING RAIN ACROSS SOUTHEAST 
TN...THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND HERE AT KMRX. TEMPS HAVE BEEN SLOWER 
TO FALL IN THE CENTRAL TN VALLEY AND SOUTHWEST NC...WHERE THEY 
REMAIN SLIGHTLY ABOVE FREEZING WITH RAIN REPORTED. HOWEVER...EXPECT 
EVAPORATIVE COOLING DUE TO THE DRY AIRMASS IN PLACE TO CAUSE THESE 
TEMPS TO FALL BELOW FREEZING LATER THIS MORNING...WITH MAINLY 
FREEZING RAIN EXPECTED ACROSS THESE AREAS AS WELL. THE GFS AND NAM 
(FORMERLY KNOWN AS THE ETA) MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW THEIR SAME 
VERTICAL TEMP PROFILE DISCREPANCIES...BUT THE NAM MODEL APPEARS TO 
BE VERIFYING BETTER COMPARED TO THE SPECIAL 06Z BNA SOUNDING AND 
WITH THE CURRENT FREEZING RAIN/RAIN CONDITIONS. THUS...WILL 
GENERALLY FOLLOW THE NAMS DEPICTION OF A WARMER 850 MB SOUTHERLY 
FLOW PRODUCING MAINLY FREEZING RAIN ACROSS THE AREA. HOWEVER... 
NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA WILL LIKELY EXPERIENCE SOME SNOW 
ACCUMULATIONS AS WELL...SINCE COLDER AIR WILL BE MORE FIRMLY 
ENTRENCHED HERE AS COLD-AIR DAMMING INTENSIFIES ACROSS THE CAROLINAS 
AND VIRGINIA. WILL MENTION UP TO 4 TO 8 INCHES OF SNOW ACROSS 
EXTREME NORTHEAST TN AND WASHINGTON COUNTY VA (CLOSER TO THE COLDER 
AIR)...WITH 1 TO 3 INCHES POSSIBLE ELSEWHERE. 

.LONG TERM (SUNDAY THRU FRIDAY)...MAIN FORECAST ISSUE FOR LONGER TERM 
PERIOD IS THE TIMING OF THE ENDING OF CURRENT PRECIP EVENT ON SUNDAY 
IN AN OTHERWISE UNEVENTFUL FORECAST. MODELS AND ENSEMBLES ARE IN 
REASONABLY GOOD AGREEMENT THAT PRECIP WILL HAVE ENDED IN ESSENTIALLY 
ALL LOCATIONS BY 18Z SUNDAY AS UPPER TROUGH AXIS SHIFTS EAST OF THE 
APPALACHIANS. CURRENT GRIDS CONFIGURED APPROPRIATELY FOR THIS 
SCENARIO AND NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGES HAVE BEEN MADE. UPCOMING WORK 
WEEK IS PROJECTED TO BE GENERALLY DRY WITH TEMPS SLOWLY MODERATING 
TO SOMEWHAT ABOVE CLIMATOLOGY BY LATE IN THE WEEK.
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
943 PM EST FRI JAN 28 2005

.DISCUSSION...PRECIPITATION HAS STARTED IN SOUTHEAST TN DURING THE 
PAST COUPLE HOURS AND DEWPOINTS BOTTOMED OUT IN THE SINGLE DIGITS 
BEFORE LIGHT RAIN STARTED. TEMPERATURES ARE NOW IN THE MID 30S IN 
THIS AREA WITH DEWPOINTS AROUND 20. WARM LAYER AT 850 MB CONTINUES 
WITH VERY DRY LOWER LAYER. INCREASING WARM AIR ADVECTION IS EXPECTED 
TO MAINTAIN THE WARMING AS PRECIPITATION FALLS. TEMPERATURES SHOULD 
DROP BELOW FREEZING SOON PER SWOMCD DISCUSSION 126. HOURLY RAINFALL 
RATES MAY BE OVER 0.05 INCHES PER HOUR AS IT CONTINUES TO DEVELOP 
LATER TONIGHT. 

WILL UPDATE WINTER STORM WARNING TO 1/4 TO 1/2 INCHES OF TOTAL ICE 
ACCUMULATION ACROSS SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL SECTIONS OF FORECAST AREA 
EXCLUDING THE SMOKY MOUNTAINS OF EAST TN. WILL CHANGE TOTAL SNOWFALL 
AMOUNTS FOR THE PLATEAU AND CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN VALLEYS TO 1 TO 5 
INCHES DEPENDING ON LOCATION. WILL RAISE TOTAL SNOWFALL AMOUNTS IN 
THE EASTERN MOUNTAINS TO 5 TO 10 INCHES...WITH TOTALS THROUGH 
SATURDAY OF 4 TO 8 INCHES. NEW MESOETA INDICATING LESS WARMING 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA SATURDAY AND THAT ALL THE PRECIPITATION 
SHOULD BE IN THE FORM OF SNOW. WILL INCREASE TOTAL SNOW AMOUNTS
TO 5 TO 9 INCHES FOR THAT GROUP. HAVE ADJUSTED LOW TEMPERATURES 
TONIGHT DOWN A FEW DEGREES IN ALL AREAS DUE TO THE LOWER DEWPOINTS 
AND THE EVAPORATIVE COOLING EXPECTED WHEN THE PRECIPITATION BEGINS 
DURING THE NIGHT. HIGH TEMPERATURES SATURDAY MAY NOT REACH ABOVE 
FREEZING ALL DAY NORTH OF KNOXVILLE AND I-40 BUT WILL NOT CHANGE ON 
UPDATE AS NEXT SHIFT WILL HAVE MORE DATA.       
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
.NC......WINTER STORM WARNING MIDNIGHT TIL NOON SATURDAY.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
422 PM EST FRI JAN 28 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THRU SATURDAY NIGHT)...MAIN CONCERN IS THE 
APPROACHING LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM (UPPER LOW NOW OVER OK AND KS) AND 
SURFACE LOW DEVELOPING ACROSS THE LOWER MISSISSIPPI VALLEY.  
FORECAST FOR THIS PACKAGE WAS BASED ON A BLEND OF THE WARM ETA AND 
COLDER GFS MODEL...NOTING THAT MODEL FORECAST SOUNDINGS FROM THE WRF 
MODEL (PER HUNTSVILLE OFFICES HELP) WERE ALSO SLIGHTLY COLDER THAN 
THE ETA.  WE DONT FEEL THAT THE ETA IS ACCOUNTING FOR THE VERY DRY 
AND COOL AIR THAT MAY GET DRAWN INTO THE NE AND SE AREAS AT THE 
SURFACE...FROM THE EXTREMELY STRONG COLD AIR WEDGE TO OUR EAST.  ALSO
THE EVAPORATIVE COOLING WILL BE A FACTOR...PLUS STRONG ADIABATIC 
COOLING FROM THE SYNOPTIC SCALE LIFT IN ADVANCE OF THE TROUGH (AIDED 
BY ISENTROPIC LIFT AS WELL).  THUS...WE FAVORED THE GFS SOLUTION OF 
A MORE SUBSTANTIAL SNOW AND ICE POTENTIAL...LEADING TO ISSUANCE OF A 
WINTER STORM WARNING FOR THE ENTIRE FORECAST AREA...WITH THE THREAT 
LOOKING TO END OVER SE TN AND SW NC BY NOON SATURDAY.  ELSEWHERE THE 
THREAT OF WINTRY PCPN LINGERS INTO THE EVENING HOURS SATURDAY.  THIS 
IS ALL ALSO IN LINE WITH THE LATEST HPC AND WWE GRAPHICS FOR THIS 
EVENT.

SNOW AMOUNTS OVER EXTREME SWRN VA AND NE TN COULD EASILY EXCEED THE 
FORECASTED AMOUNTS...IF GFS MODEL IS MORE CORRECT.  KEPT MAX TEMPS 
DOWN TOWARD THE COLDER MOS FOR SATURDAY.  THIS IS CERTAINLY A RATHER 
COMPLEX AND INTERESTING WINTER WEATHER EVENT.  THANKS TO ALL FOR THE 
COORDINATION ON THIS FORECAST PACKAGE.    


.LONG TERM...(SUN THRU FRI)...UPR TROF EXITS SUN LEAVING AREA WITH 
LOW LVL MOISTURE ON NWLY FLO. JUST A SLGT CHC PRECIP SUN MORNING. 
NEXT SYSTEM WILL BE A WEAK DISTURBANCE RIDING E MON NIGHT INTO TUE 
WITH AGAIN JUST SLGT CHC POPS. RIDGING PRESSES E ACROSS THE REGION 
WED AND MUCH OF THU BUT WILL NEED TO ADD SLGT TO SMALL CHC POPS THU 
NITE INTO FRIDAY FOR -RA AS ANOTHER STRONGER SYSTEM MOVES E FROM THE 
MS VLY INTO THE TN VLY.

FXUS64 KMRX 280938
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EST FRI JAN 28 2005

.SHORT TERM (TODAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS 
SHOWS A LARGE DOME OF HIGH PRESSURE ACROSS THE EASTERN UNITED STATES 
WITH AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE DEVELOPING ACROSS DEEP SOUTH TEXAS. 
THIS AREA OF LOW PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO MOVE NORTHEAST ALONG THE 
GULF COAST TODAY AND TONIGHT...WITH A CUT-OFF 500 MB LOW SWINGING 
EAST ACROSS THE CENTRAL PLAINS. THIS UPPER LOW WILL HELP TO SPREAD 
MOISTURE NORTHEAST FROM THE SURFACE LOW INTO THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION TONIGHT...RIDING OVER THE SUB-FREEZING AIR AT THE 
SURFACE. THE GFS AND NAM (FORMERLY KNOWN AS THE ETA) MODELS ARE 
SHOWING SOME DISCREPANCIES WITH THEIR VERTICAL TEMP PROFILES...WHICH 
DOESNT HELP MATTERS WITH AN ALREADY DIFFICULT FORECAST. NAM MODEL 
REVEALS A WARMER 850 MB AIRMASS THAN THE GFS...WHICH WILL ULTIMATELY 
RESULT IN A BETTER POTENTIAL FOR FREEZING RAIN AND SLEET ACROSS THE 
AREA. ITS DIFFICULT AT THIS POINT TO KNOW WHICH MODEL WILL PERFORM 
CLOSER TO REALITY...BUT WILL DECIDE TO HANG MY HAT ON THE NAM 
MODEL SINCE IT HAS PERFORMED BETTER WITH WINTER WEATHER EVENTS IN 
THE PAST. BESIDES...THE GFS MODEL ALWAYS SEEMS TO HAVE A COLD BIAS 
(ESPECIALLY IN THE MID RANGES) SO WILL ASSUME THIS IS AGAIN THE 
CASE. EITHER WAY...THE BOTTOM LINE REVEALED BY BOTH MODELS IS THE 
POTENTIAL FOR A WINTRY PRECIP SCENARIO ACROSS THE ENTIRE FORECAST 
AREA. NAM MODEL SOUNDINGS INDICATE THAT MOSTLY FREEZING RAIN WILL 
OCCUR ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC...ALTHOUGH IT WILL LIKELY 
BEGIN AS RAIN MIXED WITH SLEET. FARTHER NORTHEAST ACROSS CENTRAL 
EAST TN...MOSTLY FREEZING RAIN IS EXPECTED AS TEMPS WILL LIKELY FALL 
TO AROUND THE FREEZING MARK AS THE PRECIP BEGINS. ACROSS NORTHEAST 
TN AND SOUTHWEST VA....EXPECT MAINLY SNOW AT THE PRECIP ONSET LATE 
TONIGHT...BUT PRECIP SHOULD CHANGE TO FREEZING RAIN AFTER SUNRISE AS 
THE 850 MB SOUTHERLY FLOW WARMS ABOVE FREEZING. SURFACE TEMPS SHOULD 
SLOWLY WARM ABOVE FREEZING BY SATURDAY AFTERNOON...WITH PRECIP 
CHANGING BACK TO MOSTLY RAIN FOR MOST OF THE AREA. THE EXCEPTION 
BEING WASHINGTON COUNTY VA AND JOHNSON COUNTY TN...WHERE TEMPS MAY 
STAY BELOW FREEZING FOR MOST OF THE DAY AS COLD-AIR DAMMING 
INTENSIFIES ACROSS THE CAROLINAS AND VIRGINIA.

.LONG TERM (SAT NIGHT THRU THU)...PRECIP LINGERS INTO FOURTH PERIOD 
AS SHORT WAVE TROUGH AXIS MOVES THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. ANTICIPATE BRIEF DRY PERIOD DURING 
THE DAY ON SUNDAY AS SHORT WAVE RIDGING BUILDS IN BEFORE THE NEXT 
SOUTHERN STREAM SYSTEM APPROACHES. SOME DISCREPANCIES EXIST BETWEEN 
ETA AND GFS REGARDING THIS SYSTEM WITH ETA BRINGING ROUND OF PRECIP 
INTO OUR FORECAST AREA BEFORE 12Z MONDAY WHILE GFS HOLDS OFF 
ANYTHING UNTIL AFTER 12Z...AND EVEN THEN ONLY VERY LIGHT QPF. ETA 
MUCH MORE AGGRESSIVE WITH THIS SYSTEM. CANADIAN GEM TENDS TO SUPPORT 
GFS. HOWEVER...DUE TO UNCERTAINTY...WILL NOT MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT 
CHANGES TO CURRENT GRIDS/FORECAST. TEMPS WILL TEND TO AVERAGE NEAR 
TO SLIGHTLY ABOVE CLIMATOLOGY THROUGH THE PERIOD PER GFS MODEL 
GUIDANCE.

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THRU SAT NIGHT)...MOST OF TIME SPENT ON FRIDAY 
NIGHT INTO SATURDAY NIGHT GRIDS...SO HOPEFULLY DID NOT OVERLOOK 
ANYTHING IN THE FIRST AND SECOND PERIOD.  POP AND WEATHER GRIDS WERE 
BASED MORE IN LINE WITH THE COLDER AND STRONGER GFS MODEL...SO SOME 
UNCERTAINTY IF THE WARMER/WEAKER ETA MODEL PROVES MORE CORRECT.  

GFS MODEL SOUNDINGS GENERALLY SUPPORTED A WINTRY MIX FOR SOUTHERN 
TWO THIRDS OF OUR FORECAST AREA...WITH MAINLY SNOW FOR NORTHERN 
THIRD AND MTN AREAS.  I DID SPEED UP THE ARRIVAL OF THIS WINTRY MIX 
AND ALLOWED FOR A POSSIBLE LIGHT ICE ACCUMULATION IN THE SOUTHERN 
AREAS WHERE PCPN STARTS THE EARLIEST.  MTN AREAS MAY SEE MORE 
SNOWFALL THAN INITIALLY PUT IN THE GRIDS...BUT WANTED TO WAIT FOR 
ANOTHER MODEL RUN OR TWO BEFORE GOING TOO HEAVY ON THE SNOW.  THE 
WWE SNOW/ICE GRAPHICS...PLUS HPC INPUT ON THE CHAT...WERE VERY 
HELPFUL.  WINTER STORM WATCH FOR 4AM SAT TO 4AM SUN HAS ALREADY BEEN 
ISSUED WITH MUCH MORE DETAILS THAN I CAN PUT IN THE AFD.

FOR TEMPS...HEDGED TOWARD THE BLEND TONIGHT WITH AN INCREASE IN HIGH 
CLOUDS EXPECTED...THEN FAVORED THE WARMER ETA MOS FOR HIGHS FRIDAY 
SINCE HIGHS TODAY ONCE AGAIN SOARED ABOVE ANY OF THE MOS VALUES.
I EXPECT THE CLOUDS AND WINTRY PCPN TO HOLD TEMPS DOWN ON SAT...SO
STAYED CLOSER TO PREVIOUS GRIDS WHICH WERE BELOW ALL OF THE MOS 
CHOICES.

OTHERWISE...WEB PRODUCTS AND WSW ALREADY ISSUED...WITH ZFP TO FOLLOW 
SHORTLY.  


.LONG TERM (SUN THRU THU)...OH VLY S/WV PRESSES E TO THE CENTRAL 
APPALACHIANS BY 12Z SUN WITH PRECIP TAPERING OFF DURING THE MORNING 
BUT WILL CONTINUE WITH A SLGT CHC INTO THE AFTERNOON HOURS. NEXT 
S/WV FOLLOWS ON ITS PREDECESSORS FOOTSTEPS THRU THE OH VLY WITH 
HIGH CHC POPS FOR -SHRA (SOME LIMITED POTENTIAL FOR -SN NRN TERRAIN 
AREAS OF SW VA/NE TN DURING THE MORNING). NEED TO CARRY LOW CHC POPS 
MON NIGHT INTO TUESDAY AS ENERGY SPILLS SOUTH THRU THE BACK SIDE OF 
OH VLY UPR TROF. AGAIN...MOSTLY A RAIN EVENT BUT WILL NEED TO 
INCLUDE SOME -SN IN SW VA/NE TN WITH FOCUS ON HIER TERRAIN DURING 
THE MORNING. REMAINDER OF FCST DRY AS SEEMINGLY ENDLESS STREAM OF 
MID SOUTH WAVES FINALLY SHUTS DOWN WITH DRIER NW FLO ALOFT.

IS IN LINE WITH CURRENT FORECAST.

CLOUDS TONIGHT THAN EARLIER THOUGHT...WHICH COULD AFFECT THE MINS FOR

.DISCUSSION...SHORT WAVE SWINGING EAST OF N PART OF MRX FCST AREA

TO S IL ON SAT. TROPICAL MOISTURE PLUME WILL INCREASE FM THE WEST 
AND BEGIN TO INVADE THE SKY BY FRI AFTN. SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE EAST 
ALONG N TN BORDER FRI NGT. ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER LOW LEVEL WEDGE 
BEGINS PCPN FRI NGT FM SW. THE FREEZING RAIN POTENTIAL INCREASING 
FOR SOUTHERN PARTS OF MRX CWA ON SATURDAY. PCPN SHOULD START AS SN 
MOST AREAS BEFORE CHANGING TO FREEZING RAIN AS 850 LAYER WARMS UP
TO ABOVE 0 C. STRENGTH OF WEDGE VS 850 LAYER WARM UP WILL DETERMINE 
EXTENT OF WINTRY WEATHER PROBLEMS. FOR NOW APPEARS WATCH WILL BE 
REQUIRED FOR ICE NEAR 1/4 INCH FOR AREAS NEAR THE GA BORDER. SNOW IN 
THE CNTRL & NE MNTS MAY ALSO BE A PROBLEM. PCPN SHOULD CHANGE TO A 
COLD RAIN SW-NE. FOR NOW LOOKS LIKE CHANGE OVER TO RAIN WILL BE 
AROUND 29/15Z CHA 29/18Z TYS AND 29/21Z TRI. PCPN CONTINUES E AREAS 
SAT NGT WITH RAIN MIXED WITH SCT SNOWS ESPECIALLY NE TN SW VA WITH 
FREEZING RAIN CONTINUING SW NC. ANOTHER SHORT WAVE APPROACHES FM W 
ON MON DRAGGING A SFC WAVE WHICH SHOULD INCREASE RAIN CHANCES UNTIL 
IT MOVES THROUGH EARLY TUE.

FXUS64 KMRX 261956

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
256 PM EST WED JAN 26 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THRU FRIDAY NIGHT)...THE COLD FRONT IS 
NEARING A LOZ TO CSV TO SE OF BNA LINE WITH MILD TEMPS STILL NOTED 
ACROSS OUR FORECAST AREA THIS AFTERNOON (MID 60S AT CHA).  MID AND 
HIGH CLOUDS IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT HAVE CLEARED SOME...BUT THE LOW 
CLOUDS WITH AND BEHIND THE COLD FRONT HAVE ALREADY DROPPED TO NEAR 
THE KY/TN STATE LINE AND INTO SWRN VA.  NO RADAR ECHOES NOTED SINCE 
AROUND MID MORNING TODAY...BUT WITH THE COLD AIR OVERNIGHT...FELT IT 
WAS WISE TO CONTINUE THE SLIGHT CHANCE OF SNOW OR FLURRIES FOR NRN 
MOST AREAS.  SRN MOST AREAS MAY STAY PARTLY CLOUDY FOR MUCH OF 
TONIGHT...MORE IN LINE WITH THE MAV MOS SKY COVER.  ELSEWHERE... 
EITHER A MOSTLY CLOUDY OR VARIABLY CLOUDY NIGHT.  MOS MINS WERE 
CLOSE AND GENERALLY ACCEPTED.

FOR THE BULK OF THE REST OF THE SHORT TERM PERIODS...DRY WEATHER IS 
EXPECTED WITH THE COLDEST NIGHT TO BE THURSDAY NIGHT AS THE SURFACE 
RIDGE HAS BUILT INTO THE REGION AND SKIES REMAIN MOSTLY CLEAR.  
THERE STILL LOOKS TO BE A LOW CHANCE OF SOME LIGHT MIXED RAIN OR 
FREEZING RAIN TOWARD DAYBREAK SATURDAY.  WARM AIR ADVECTION WILL 
CERTAINLY DEVELOP LATE FRIDAY NIGHT IN ADVANCE OF THE NEXT SYSTEM...
BUT THIS MAY MAINLY OCCUR OVER THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WITH SURFACE 
TEMPS NEAR OR JUST BELOW FREEZING IN SE TN AND SW NC.  PREVIOUS POP 
AND WEATHER GRIDS COVERED THIS SITUATION QUITE WELL...WITH LITTLE 
CHANGES OR MAJOR CONCERNS AT THIS POINT.  

OTHERWISE...MOS BLEND LOOKED GOOD FOR HIGHS.  I DID ADJUST MIN TEMPS 
A GOOD BIT ON FRIDAY NIGHT IN LINE WITH LATEST MOS (FAVORING THE 
WARMER ETA MOS FOR LNP DUE TO WARM AIR ADVECTION AND INCREASING 
CLOUDS).  


.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...SHORTWAVE PUSHING UP 
FROM SOUTH ON SATURDAY.  GFS INDICATING WARM AIR PUSHING IN ALOFT 
WITH BELOW FREEZING SURFACE TEMPERATURES...MAY SEE SOME FREEZING  
RAIN SATURDAY MORNING IN OUR SOUTHERN AND CENTRAL ZONES.  SURFACE  
TEMPERATURES SHOULD WARM SUFFICIENTLY FOR ALL RAIN BY AFTERNOON.   
PRECIP SHOULD STAY SOUTH OF NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA UNTIL THE AFTERNOON WHEN IT WILL BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL 
RAIN.  THE CHANCE OF RAIN WILL CONTINUE INTO THE EVENING HOURS... 
SHOULD BE WARM ENOUGH FOR ALL LIQUID PRECIPITATION.  SURFACE TROUGH 
ENTERS REGION ON SUNDAY WITH SUFFICIENT MOISTURE TO KEEP CHANCE POPS 
GOING FOR SUNDAY AND SUNDAY NIGHT.  THICKNESSES INDICATE ALL RAIN 
FOR SUNDAY NIGHT.  UPPER TROUGH ENTERING REGION MONDAY AND MONDAY 
NIGHT.  MOISTURE ADEQUATE ENOUGH TO CONTINUE CHANCE POPS FOR MONDAY 
AND MONDAY NIGHT.  AGAIN...LOOKS LIKE TEMPERATURES SHOULD BE WARM 
ENOUGH FOR ONLY RAIN MONDAY NIGHT.  UPPER TROUGH PUSHING THROUGH ON 
TUESDAY...MOISTURE IS LIMITED SO WILL ONLY CARRY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
FOR SOME RAIN SHOWERS.  DRY WEATHER RETURNS TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY. 

NOTE: THIS IS OUR FIRST FORECAST PACKAGE ISSUED USING IFPS 16.2.

&&

FXUS64 KMRX 261422
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
920 AM EST WED JAN 26 2005

.DISCUSSION...12Z UPPER AIR PLOTS SHOW THE UPPER LEVEL TROUGH AXIS 
LOCATED FROM SW VA TO SW CORNER OF NC THIS MORNING...WITH 850 MB 
LEVEL TEMPS RANGING FROM 4 TO 6 DEGREES CELSIUS.  AREA RADARS 
ALREADY SHOW THE BAND OF SHOWERS WEAKENING OVER NRN MOST PARTS OF 
THE FORECAST AREA.  THIS PRECIPITATION IS BECOMING SCATTERED IN 
COVERAGE AND LIGHT IN INTENSITY.  ALSO...SURFACE OBSERVATIONS (ASOS 
AND OTHER SITES) SHOW SURFACE TEMPS ARE GENERALLY NO COLDER THAN THE 
LOWER TO MIDDLE 30S ACROSS MOST OF SW VA AND EXTREME NE TN.  THE 
REMAINING AREAS HAD WARMED INTO THE 40S OVERNIGHT...SO THE THREAT OF 
ANY WINTRY MIXED PRECIPITATION HAS ENDED.

FOR THE FORECAST...CURRENT FORECAST AND GRIDS LOOK GOOD WITH CHANCE 
POPS NORTHERN AREAS FOR A BIT LONGER THEN DECREASING TO SLIGHT 
CHANCE IN THE AFTERNOON.  AFTERNOON HIGHS CLOSER TO THE COOLER 
GFS/MAV MOS NUMBERS LOOKS LIKE THE BEST CHOICE...WHICH IS IN LINE 
WITH CURRENT FORECAST.  AN UPDATE WILL BE REQUIRED...MAINLY TO 
REMOVE THE EARLY THEN AFTERNOON WORDING.  

FOR THE LATER PERIODS...THE 06Z GFS MODEL JUST IN...LOOKS DRY FOR 
FRIDAY NIGHT WITH 850 MB TEMPS WARMING WELL ABOVE ZERO OVER THE 
WEEKEND...AHEAD OF THE NEXT SIGNIFICANT CHANCE OF PRECIPITATION.

.DISCUSSION...MID/UPR TROUGH MOVING SE THROUGH AREA THIS MORNING

LOW LEVEL TROUGH UP EAST TENNESSEE VALLEY. PCPN OCCURRING ON LEADING 
EDGE OF SYSTEM WHERE SUBFREEZING TEMPS RAPIDLY WARM TO ABOVE 0 C. 
VERY BRIEF SLEET/FREEZING RAIN LIKELY ALONG LEADING EDGE. PCPN 
AMOUNTS QUITE A BIT MORE THAN EXPECTED BUT STILL ON THE LIGHT SIDE. 
SYSTEM WILL MOVE QUICKLY THROUGH CWA BY 18Z THEN DRAG COLD FRONT 
DOWN IN ITS WAKE INTO NORTHERN SECTIONS AROUND 21Z. IMPRESSIVE CAA 
THIS EVENING AND SUFFICIENT LOW LEVEL MOISTURE FOR SCT SNOW SHOWERS 
EXTREME N AND FLURRIES EXTENDING DOWN TO NEAR KNOXVILLE TONIGHT. 
SFC HIGH PRESSURE WITH DRY AND COLD AIRMASS BUILDS INTO E U.S. 
SETTING UP NICE DAMNING EAST OF SMOKIES. NEXT SHORT WAVE DUE TO 
APPROACH AREA AROUND SAT 12Z. FCST CONFIDENCE LOW. MODEL TIMING AND 
POSITIONS SCATTERED. SOUNDING TEMP PROFILES LINGER RIGHT AROUND 0 C 
IN THE 1000-800 MB LAYER. LEFT CURRENT FCST FOR WEEKEND UNCHANGED 
BUT EXPECT LATER ADJUSTMENT TO PCPN TYPES AND TIMING.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 260233
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EST TUE JAN 25 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS AN AREA OF LOW PRESSURE NEAR CHICAGO 
WITH ITS TRAILING COLD FRONT EXTENDING ACROSS THE MID MISSISSIPPI 
VALLEY. SATELLITE IMAGES REVEAL AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDINESS 
ASSOCIATED WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE OVER THE OZARKS...WITH 
SOME PATCHY LIGHT RAIN DEVELOPING ACROSS MIDDLE TN AHEAD OF IT. AS 
THIS SHORT WAVE MOVES EAST TOWARDS THE FORECAST AREA OVERNIGHT... 
EXPECT IT TO WEAKEN SOMEWHAT WITH A DRIER AIRMASS OVER THE FORECAST 
AREA HELPING TO LIMIT RAINFALL POTENTIAL. 

AS FOR TEMPS...DEWPOINTS HAVE BEEN SLOW TO RISE THIS EVENING AND 
TEMPS HAVE FALLEN A LITTLE FASTER THAN EXPECTED. MAIN FORECAST 
PROBLEM OVERNIGHT WILL BE DETERMINING WHETHER TEMPS RISE ABOVE 
FREEZING ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA BEFORE SUNRISE WHEN 
THE PATCHY LIGHT RAIN ARRIVES. CURRENT TEMPS ARE ALREADY IN THE 
LOWER TO MID 30S ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST VA...BUT EXPECT  
NEAR-SURFACE WINDS TO INCREASE AS THE COLD FRONT AND SHORT WAVE 
APPROACH AFTER MIDNIGHT. THESE WINDS SHOULD HELP TO MIX THE WARMER 
850 MB TEMPS DOWN TO THE SURFACE...CAUSING SURFACE TEMPS TO SLOWLY 
RISE AFTER MIDNIGHT BEFORE ANY LIGHT RAIN ARRIVES. 

OVERALL...EXPECT ONLY A FEW PATCHY AREAS OF LIGHT RAIN TOWARDS 
SUNRISE BUT WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE ZONES TO RAISE POPS A LITTLE 
ACROSS ALL ZONES. WILL ALSO TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE TO REFLECT CURRENT 
TRENDS AND TO MENTION RISING TEMPS AFTER MIDNIGHT.
&&

NC...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 251950
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
250 PM EST TUE JAN 25 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT)...WV IMAGERY SHOWS AN 
UPPER VORT CURRENTLY LOCATED OVER NORTH CENTRAL OKLAHOMA.  THIS 
FEATURE IS PROJECTED TO CONTINUE ITS EASTWARD TREK AND APPROACH THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY 12Z WED...WEAKENING SOMEWHAT AS IT GOES.  
ALTHOUGH OPERATIONAL MODEL GUIDANCE POPS HAVE INCREASED OVER THE 
PAST FEW RUNS...AM STILL NOT VERY IMPRESSED WITH THIS FEATURE.  
MODEL TIME HEIGHTS DEPICT UNIMPRESSIVE MOISTURE PROFILE WITH ONLY 
WEAK LIFT.  SHORT RANGE ENSEMBLES SHOW NO QPF OVER OUR FORECAST AREA 
AT ALL...AND ETA DEPICTS ONLY WIDELY SCATTERED LIGHT QPF.  BASED ON 
THESE FACTORS...AND THAT CURRENT RADAR RETURNS FROM THIS SYSTEM ARE 
GENERALLY LIGHT AND SPOTTY AND EXPECTED TO WEAKEN EVEN 
FURTHER...WILL CONTINUE WITH ONLY SLIGHT CHANCE POPS.  WILL ALSO 
CONTINUE TO MENTION FLURRIES IN HIGHER TERRAIN FOR WED NIGHT AS 
UPSLOPE FLOW DEVELOPS BRIEFLY.  GENERALLY TRANQUIL WEATHER WILL 
PREVAIL THROUGH THE BALANCE OF THE SHORT TERM AS RIDGING BUILDS INTO 
THE AREA BOTH AT THE SURFACE AND ALOFT.  OVERALL...HAVE NOT MADE 
MANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES TO EXISTING GRIDS/FORECAST.

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH TUESDAY)...THE SOUTHERN STREAM WILL 
BECOME MORE OF A PLAYER DURING THE MEDIUM RANGE FORECAST.  THE NEW 
GFS MODEL IS LESS AMPLIFIED WITH SHORT-WAVE MOVING INTO THE PLAINS 
STATES FRIDAY AND OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS AND TENNESSEE 
VALLEY FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT.  PLAN ON DIS-COUNTING NEW 
GFS RUN FOR NOW...GIVEN BETTER CONTINUITY BETWEEN THE OLD GFS AND 
ECMWF MODELS. WILL CONTINUE TO PULL MOISTURE AND PRECIPITATION BACK 
INTO THE REGION FOR SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT.  STRONG WEDGING 
EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS WILL TEND TO FUNNEL COLD AIR INTO THE 
SOUTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

THERMAL STRUCTURE AND EXPECTED EVAPORATIVE COOLING SUPPORTS A 
POTENTIAL OF FREEZING RAIN ON THE ONSET OF THE PRECIPITATION 
SATURDAY MORNING...ESPECIALLY FOR THE SOUTHERN COUNTIES. AFTER WARM 
AIR ADVECTION CONTINUES...PRECIPITATION WILL CHANGE TO ALL RAIN.

SYSTEM MOVES OUT FOR SUNDAY WITH A BRIEF PAUSE OF DRIER WEATHER FOR 
SUNDAY NIGHT...THEN ANOTHER STRONG SOUTHERN STREAM WAVE MOVES TOWARD
THE AREA FOR MONDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 242000
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST MON JAN 24 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT)...MODELS AND SHORT 
RANGE ENSEMBLES GENERALLY AGREE THAT UPPER AIR FLOW WILL CONTINUE TO 
SLOWLY DEAMPLIFY AS INTENSE UPPER LOW CONTINUES TO PULL AWAY INTO 
THE CANADIAN MARITIMES. HOWEVER...GENERAL LONG WAVE PATTERN TREND OF 
RIDGE WEST/TROUGH EAST WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. THIS 
RESULTS IN CONTINUATION OF NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT OVER THE SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIAN REGION. WEAK SHORT WAVES WILL TRANSLATE THROUGH THIS 
FLOW WITH THE NEXT WAVE PROJECTED TO MOVE THROUGH OUR FORECAST AREA 
IN THE TUESDAY NIGHT/WEDNESDAY MORNING TIME FRAME. MOISTURE AND LIFT 
NOT IMPRESSIVE WITH THIS FEATURE PER MODEL TIME HEIGHTS. ENSEMBLES 
SUGGEST ANY PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE WILL REMAIN NORTH OF 
OUR FORECAST AREA...WHILE OPERATIONAL MODEL GUIDANCE CONTINUES TO 
SHOW GENERALLY LOW POPS. WILL CONTINUE WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR 
THE THIRD AND FOURTH PERIODS FOR MOST OF FORECAST AREA...BUT THIS 
SYSTEM APPEARS RATHER INSIGNIFICANT. MODERATING TEMPS ARE PROJECTED 
THROUGH THE PERIOD BUT AM INCLINED TO FAVOR COOLER GFS MOS GUIDANCE 
IN NORTHWESTERLY FLOW REGIME.

.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...MEDIUM RANGE MODELS SHOW
UPPER FLOW DEAMPLIFING WITH STRONG SURFACE HIGH MOVING FROM THE
GREAT LAKES EAST INTO THE MID-ATLANTIC STATES BY FRIDAY MORNING. 
COLD AIR DAMMING DEVELOPS EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS AS SURFACE HIGH 
BUILDS INTO THE MID ATLANTIC STATES FOR FRIDAY AND SATURDAY...SO 
HAVE LOWER MAXES ACROSS THE SOUTHERN THIRD OF THE FORECAST AREA. 

SOUTHERN STREAM JET BECOMES ACTIVE WITH A SHORT-WAVE MOVING FROM
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TOWARD THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN 
APPALACHIANS FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT. HAVE UPPED POPS
AREA-WIDE BEGINNING LATE FRIDAY NIGHT SOUTH...THEN AREA-WIDE FOR
SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT. TEMPERATURE PROFILE SUGGESTS A POTENTIAL
OF LIGHT FREEZING RAIN AT THE BEGINNING...THEN CHANGING TO ALL RAIN.

SOUTHERN STREAM TROUGH MOVES EAST FOR SUNDAY ALLOWING A WEAK UPPER
RIDGE TO DEVELOP FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK WITH DRIER WEATHER AND MILD
CONDITIONS.

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
220 PM EST SUN JAN 23 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...GENERALLY BENIGN...OR AT LEAST 
DRY...WEATHER ANTICIPATED THROUGH THE SHORT TERM AS DEEP UPPER 
TROUGH PULLS AWAY ALLOWING UPPER FLOW TO DEAMPLIFY SOMEWHAT PER 
MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. FLOW ALSO BECOMES ANTICYCLONIC. THIS 
WILL PERMIT MODEST TEMPERATURE MODERATION IN THE SECOND PERIOD. 
HOWEVER AREA REMAINS IN NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT AND TEMPS WILL STILL 
TEND TO BE WELL BELOW CLIMATOLOGY. OVERNIGHT TEMPS WILL AGAIN BE 
VERY COLD UNDER GOOD RADIATIONAL COOLING CONDITIONS. HOWEVER...WINDS 
SHOULD BECOME A NON-FACTOR AS SURFACE RIDGE AXIS DRIFTS THROUGH THE 
TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. THIS SHOULD PRECLUDE 
WIND CHILLS FROM AGAIN BECOMING AN ISSUE.

.LONG TERM...(MON NIGHT THROUGH SUN)...DRY WEATHER SHOULD CONTINUE 
THROUGH TUESDAY...THEN MODELS CONTINUE TO DEPICT SHORT WAVE ENERGY 
SLIDING BY TO OUR SOUTH TUES NIGHT/WED AND THEN A NORTHERN STREAM 
SHORT WAVE MOVING BY TO OUR NORTH WED...WITH A WEAK COLD FRONT 
PUSHING THROUGH WED.  NONE OF THIS LOOKS LIKE IT SHOULD BE A MAJOR 
PRECIP PRODUCER FOR HERE...AS MOISTURE AND LIFT APPEAR LIMITED.  
HOWEVER...WILL CARRY A SLIGHT CHANCE POP FOR LATE TUE NIGHT INTO 
EARLY WED NIGHT.  GFS COLDER THAN ETA...BUT EVEN IT LOOKS LIKE ANY 
PRECIP SHOULD BE MAINLY LIQUID...SO WILL CARRY ONLY RAIN SHOWERS FOR 
NOW.  MODELS INCONSISTENT HANDLING OF WEAK SYSTEMS FURTHER OUT DOES 
NOT INSPIRE MUCH CONFIDENCE.  FOLLOWED HPC IDEA...GENERALLY 
SUPPORTED BY THE 00Z GFS...WHICH KEPT THURSDAY THROUGH SUNDAY 
DRY...THEN SLIGHT CHANCE POPS IN GRIDDED DATABASE FOR SUN NIGHT AS 
NEXT SYSTEM APPROACHES.  HOWEVER...12Z GFS BRINGS A SYSTEM THROUGH 
ON SATURDAY.  GIVEN HIGH LEVEL OF UNCERTAINTY...WILL STICK WITH 
EARLIER IDEA FOR NOW AND KEEP SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY DRY.


&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.DISCUSSION...WILL ALLOW WIND CHILL ADVISORIES TO EXPIRE AT 11 AM 
EST AS SCHEDULED AS TEMPS SLOWLY WARM AND WINDS SLOWLY DIMINISH. 
ALSO ANTICIPATE SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY TO CONTINUE TO DECREASE IN 
COVERAGE AND INTENSITY THIS AFTERNOON IN ALL LOCATIONS AS SURFACE 
HIGH PRESSURE TAKES CONTROL. WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE WIND CHILL 
HEADLINES AND FRESHEN WORDING BUT OTHERWISE MAKE NO MAJOR CHANGES AT 
THIS TIME.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATE
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
740 AM EST SUN JAN 23 2005

.SHORT TERM...TODAY...STRONG NORTHWEST LOW LEVEL FLOW WILL CONTINUE 
EARLY THEN RELAX SOME AS WINDS SHIFT TO THE NORTH. UPSTREAM MOISTURE 
SUFFICIENT TO CONTINUE SNOW ADVSRIES AND WARNINGS THIS MORNING. CAA 
WILL PERSIST THROUGHOUT THE DAY. DESPITE CLEARING SKIES WENT ABOUT 4 
DEGREES BELOW MODEL BLEND FOR TODAYS MAXES AS ALL MODELS INITIALIZED 
TOO WARM. 

.LONG TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)...WITH THE WINTER WEATHER 
SYSTEM HAVING EXITED THE AREA...DRY CONDITIONS ARE EXPECTED 
TONIGHT.  A COLD AIR MASS WILL CONTINUE TO FILTER IN AND OVERNIGHT 
LOW WILL BE QUITE COLD...GENERALLY IN THE TEENS AND SINGLE DIGITS.  
WINDS WILL CONTINUE TO DIMINISH DURING THE EVENING...THIS WILL LIMIT 
WIND CHILL READING.  FOR MONDAY AND TUESDAY...A COUPLE OF WEAK 
IMPULSES IN THE UPPER FLOW SHOULD REMAIN CONFINED TO OUR NORTH...SO 
DRY CONDITIONS SHOULD REMAIN IN PLACE.  A MINOR SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE 
IN ON WEDNESDAY/WEDNESDAY NIGHT FOR LOW CHANCE POPS.  WITH THIS... 
TEMPERATURES LOOK SUFFICIENTLY WARM FOR MAINLY LIGHT RAIN.  ANOTHER 
WEAK WAVE IS PROGGED INTO THE REGION AROUND THE SATURDAY TIME 
FRAME...BUT MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT SO WITH THE DEGREE OF 
UNCERTAINTY...WILL KEEP THINGS DRY FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE PERIOD.  

&&

.SHORT TERM...TODAY...WINDS ARE RELAXING ENOUGH TO ALLOW LAKE WIND/WIND

IN COVERAGE AND INTENSITY SO SNOW ADVISORY/WARNINGS WILL BE ALLOWED TO 
EXPIRE AT 800 AM EST. SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS WILL LINGER IN THE MOUNTAINS. 
SKIES WILL BECOME MOSTLY SUNNY BUT WENT ABOUT 4 DEGREES BELOW MODEL BLEND
FOR TODAYS MAXES AS ALL MODELS INITIALIZED TOO WARM.

FXUS64 KMRX 230145
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
845 PM EST SAT JAN 22 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE 
EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE APPALACHIANS...WITH STRONG NORTHWEST FLOW 
OCCURRING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. A CONVECTIVE BAND OF HEAVY SNOW 
(MIXED WITH SOME SLEET AND OCCASIONAL THUNDER) DEVELOPED EARLIER THIS 
EVENING IN RESPONSE TO SOME CONDITIONAL SYMMETRIC INSTABILITY ACROSS 
THE AREA. EQUIVALENT POTENTIAL VORTICITY PROGS FROM THE MESO-ETA 
MODEL REVEAL THAT THIS INSTABILITY HAS SHIFTED EAST OF THE FORECAST 
AREA...AND DO NOT EXPECT ANY MORE CONVECTIVE BANDS TO DEVELOP THIS 
EVENING. THIS EVENT APPEARS TO BE EVOLVING INTO MAINLY AN UPSLOPE 
FLOW EVENT...WITH HIGHER AMOUNTS EXPECTED ACROSS THE NORTHWEST- 
FACING SLOPES OF THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. EXPECT THE BULK OF THE 
SNOWFALL TO FALL BEFORE MIDNIGHT...WITH SNOW SHOWERS GRADUALLY 
DIMINISHING IN COVERAGE AND INTENSITY THEREAFTER. BREEZY NORTHWEST 
WINDS SHOULD CONTINUE OVERNIGHT WITH WIND CHILL READINGS DROPPING 
BELOW ZERO ACROSS THE CENTRAL AND NORTHERN MOUNTAINS...AND SOUTHWEST 
VA. 

CURRENT FORECAST STILL APPEARS TO HAVE THE SITUATION WELL COVERED... 
BUT WILL UPDATE TO REMOVE EVENING WORDING. ALSO...EXPECT BLACK ICE 
TO DEVELOP TONIGHT ACROSS THE ADVISORY AND WARNING AREAS...AS THE 
RESULT OF FREEZING OF EARLIER RAIN AND SNOWPACK. WILL PLAN TO 
MENTION THIS IN THE UPDATED ADVISORIES AND WARNINGS.
&&

TNZ043...TNZ045...TNZ047...TNZ072...TNZ074.

FXUS64 KMRX 221954
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
253 PM EST SAT JAN 22 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SUNDAY)...HIGHLY AMPLIFIED UPPER TROUGH 
MAIN FEATURE OF INTEREST THROUGH THE SHORT TERM. TROUGH AXIS PASSES 
THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS OVERNIGHT PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE 
CONSENSUS. WRAP-AROUND MOISTURE ASSOCIATED WITH THE TROUGH AXIS 
SHOULD KEEP UPSLOPE SNOW EVENT GOING AND THUS WILL CONTINUE SNOW 
ADVISORIES/WARNINGS AS CURRENTLY CONFIGURED. WILL ALSO CONTINUE WIND 
ADVISORIES AND INCLUDE WIND CHILL ADVISORY FOR CENTRAL AND NORTHERN 
MOUNTAINS AND SOUTHWESTERN VIRGINIA AS WIND CHILL VALUES WILL 
APPROACH -20 F IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. UPPER TROUGH CONTINUES TO 
PULL AWAY THROUGH THE SECOND PERIOD WITH MODELS INDICATING THAT 
PRECIP WILL GENERALLY END BY 12Z MONDAY WITH THE POSSIBLE EXCEPTION 
OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN WHERE UPSLOPE FLOW WILL ENHANCE SNOW SHOWER 
ACTIVITY. ANTICIPATE ALL PRECIP TO END BY AROUND 22Z TOMORROW. 
STRONG WINDS SHOULD SLOWLY DIMINISH DURING THE SECOND PERIOD AS 
SURFACE PRESSURE GRADIENTS RELAX WITH SURFACE RIDGE NOSING INTO THE 
AREA. SKY COVER WILL BE PROBLEMATIC AS LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE LINGERS 
THROUGH AT LEAST THE FIRST HALF OF THE SECOND PERIOD. PREVIOUS 
TEMPERATURE GRIDS LOOK REASONABLE AND GENERALLY STAYED WITH THOSE.

.LONG TERM...(SUN NIGHT THROUGH SAT)...LOOKS LIKE DRY WEATHER WILL 
CONTINUE THROUGH TUESDAY AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE SHIFTS TO OUR 
SOUTH...AND ANY WEAK ENERGY STAYS NORTH AND SOUTH OF OUR AREA. LOW 
CONFIDENCE IN TIMING ANY WEAK FEATURES FOR THE MIDDLE TO LATE PART 
OF THE WEEK...MODELS IN POOR AGREEMENT.  WILL GENERALLY FOLLOW HPC 
IDEA AND STRAY AWAY FROM THE GFS.  WILL CONTINUE TO CARRY SLIGHT 
CHANCE POPS FOR A WEAK WAVE AND FRONT IN THE WED/WED NIGHT TIME 
FRAME. APPEARS THERE MAY BE ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM FOR SATURDAY...BUT 
WITH HIGH LEVEL OF UNCERTAINTY WILL JUST GO DRY FOR THE THU THROUGH 
SAT PERIOD.  

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 220911
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
411 AM EST SAT JAN 22 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT) LOW PRESSURE DEEPENS TODAY OVER KY 
AND MOVES EAST THROUGH APPALACHIANS THIS AFTERNOON. TRAILING COLD 
FRONT WILL MOVE THROUGH MOST OF THE AREA BY THIS AFTERNOON. SW WINDS 
INCREASE IN ADVANCE OF THE FRONT AND AID IN DRAWING IN SOME LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE FROM THE SOUTHEAST. WARM SECTOR ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL 
FALL INTO INITIALLY DRY LOWER LEVER RESULTING IN SOME EVAPORATIVE 
COOLING MAINLY N AREAS. THEN STRONG SW FLOW OVERCOMES RESIDENT 
AIRMASSAND SETS OFF A BRIEF WWA. COLD FRONT SNAPS THROUGH THIS 
AFTERNOON WITH SOME WRAP AROUND AND UPSLOPE SNOWS CONTINUING 
OVERNIGHT MAINLY ACROSS CENTRAL AND NORTHERN AREAS. AVAILABLE RH 
MARGINAL BUT STEEP LAPSE RATES AND GOOD MOISTURE BELOW -10C RAISED 
CONFIDENCE IN SNOW POTENTIAL. POST FRONTAL WINDS STAY UP AND WIND 
CHILLS WILL BE FALL ACCORDINGLY. ADVISORIES WILL LIKELY BE REQUIRED 
EARLY SUNDAY FOR CHILLS. 

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...MODELS CONTINUE TO INDICATE  
THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM WILL EXIT THE AREA SUNDAY MORNING.  
ASSOCIATED SCATTERED SNOW SHOWERS ARE EXPECTED OVER THE EASTERN 
TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND OUR VIRGINIA COUNTIES THROUGH MUCH OF THE 
MORNING.  A FEW FLURRIES WILL BE POSSIBLE THROUGH EARLY MORNING OVER 
THE NORTHERN TENNESSEE VALLEY.  ADDITIONAL SNOWFALL AMOUNTS SHOULD 
BE LIGHT ON SUNDAY.  WINDS WILL BE DECREASING THROUGHOUT THE DAY AS 
WELL...AS THE PRESSURE GRADIENT SLACKENS AND COLD AIR WILL CONTINUE 
TO PUSH IN.  FOR THE REST OF THE EXTENDED...WE WILL REMAIN IN 
NORTHWEST FLOW ALOFT INTO THURSDAY WITH A SERIES OF WEAK WAVES IN 
THE UPPER FLOW.  FOR NOW...MODELS TRENDING TOWARD KEEPING ASSOCIATED 
PRECIP TO OUR NORTH WITH THESE...EXCEPT FOR ONE MOVING THROUGH 
AROUND THE WEDNESDAY TIME FRAME.  THIS MAY BRUSH INTO THE AREA SO 
WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE POP IN PLACE FOR THIS.  DRY CONDITIONS 
CONTINUE ON FRIDAY AS FLOW BECOMES ZONAL AT THE APPROACH OF THE NEXT 
SYSTEM.  


&&
.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
238 PM EST FRI JAN 21 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...BRIEF LULL IN ACTION 
CONTINUES TONIGHT BEFORE SIGNIFICANT SHORT WAVE TROUGH APPROACHES 
THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY 12Z SATURDAY. APPEARS ONSET OF PRECIP 
WILL GENERALLY HOLD OFF UNTIL AFTER 12Z ALTHOUGH SOME LIGHT PRECIP 
MAY COMMENCE IN THE NORTHERN-MOST ZONES SOMEWHAT BEFORE THAT TIME 
PER MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. ALSO APPEARS THAT LOW-LEVELS WILL 
WARM ENOUGH TO PRECLUDE ANY SIGNIFICANT WINTER PRECIP AND EVENT WILL 
START AS MAINLY A RAIN EVENT. MINOR ICE POSSIBLE IN ELEVATED VALLEYS 
IN MOUNTAINOUS TERRAIN IN SOUTHWESTERN VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST 
TENNESSEE...BUT NO MAJOR PROBLEM WITH ICING IS EXPECTED AT THIS 
TIME. SHORT WAVE AND ASSOCIATED SURFACE FRONT MARCHES THROUGH 
FORECAST AREA AROUND 18Z. SIGNIFICANTLY COLDER AIR WILL FOLLOW 
FRONTAL PASSAGE WITH RESIDUAL PRECIP CHANGING OVER TO 
SNOW...ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTHERN SECTIONS. EXPECT ANY SNOW TO BE 
SHOWERY IN NATURE AT THIS TIME WITH NO MAJOR ACCUMULATIONS 
ANTICIPATED BEFORE 00Z SUNDAY. GENERALLY FAVORED GFS MOS GUIDANCE 
FOR TEMPS THROUGH THE FIRST TWO PERIODS.

.LONG TERM...(SAT NIGHT THROUGH FRI)...MODELS IN SOMEWHAT BETTER 
AGREEMENT IN HANDLING EXITING SYSTEM SAT NIGHT AND SUNDAY.  TREND 
CONTINUES TO BE FOR PRECIP TO EXIT MORE QUICKLY.  ANOTHER TREND THAT 
CONTINUES IS COLDER AIR PUSHING IN FASTER...SO BULK OF ANY PRECIP 
SAT NIGHT SHOULD BE SNOW SHOWERS.  WILL GO WITH LIKELY POPS IN THE 
NORMALLY FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS OF THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL MOUNTAINS 
AND SW VA...CHANCE ELSEWHERE ALL BUT FAR SOUTH WHERE WILL GO WITH 
SLIGHT CHANCE.  WILL KEEP CHANCE POPS IN FOR SUNDAY MORNING FOR 
NORTHERN AND CENTRAL MOUNTAINS AND SW VA...DRY SOUTH AND FLURRIES IN 
BETWEEN.  MAY NEED WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FOR SAT NIGHT IN NORMALLY 
FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS...AND WINDS MAY MEET ADVISORY OR LAKE WIND 
ADVISORY CRITERIA AS WELL.  SINCE STILL THIRD PERIOD AT THIS 
POINT...WILL DEFER TO THE MIDNIGHT SHIFT AND JUST CONTINUE SPS.  
FURTHER OUT DECENT CONFIDENCE IN THE BASIC PATTERN...BUT DETAILS OF 
ANY WEAK SYSTEMS THAT MAY AFFECT THE AREA UNCERTAIN.  MAY HAVE A 
WEAK SHORT WAVE AND COLD FRONT IN THE MIDDLE OF THE WEEK...SO WILL 
CARRY A SLIGHT CHANCE OF SHOWERS FOR WED.  DRY OTHERWISE FOR NOW.

SHOULD SUFFICE WITHOUT AN ADVISORY.

VA INTO NE TIP OF TN...BUT I PREFER TO WATCH SATELLITE AND RADAR 
TRENDS FOR ANOTHER HOUR OR SO...SINCE WE ALREADY HAVE A MENTION OF 
UP TO 2 INCHES OF SNOW POSSIBLE IN THOSE AREAS.  IR SATELLITE PICS 
SHOW THE ENHANCED AREAS ALREADY SCOOTING OFF TO OUR EAST...WHICH 
DOES NOT BOOST MY CONFIDENCE IN GETTING ADVISORY AMOUNTS OF SNOW 
OVER THE REST OF THE EVENING.  WE WILL STAY IN CLEAR AIR MODE WITH 
THE KMRX RADAR TO BETTER DETECT ANY AREAS OF SNOW.

STAY TUNED FOR ANOTHER AFD UPDATE...WITH UPDATES TO GRIDS...WEB 
PRODUCTS AND ZFP AS NEEDED.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
235 PM EST THU JAN 20 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...NORTHWEST UPPER AIR FLOW REGIME 
CONTINUES AS RIDGE WEST/TROUGH EAST LONG WAVE PATTERN PERSISTS. NEXT 
IN A SERIES OF WEAK SHORT WAVE TROUGHS IN THIS NORTHWESTERLY FLOW 
CONTINUES TO APPROACH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS. ITS EFFECTS WILL BE 
CONFINED MAINLY TO THE NORTHEASTERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA PER 
MODEL AND ENSEMBLE CONSENSUS. PRECIP STILL EXPECTED TO BE GENERALLY 
LIGHT...ALTHOUGH ONE TO TWO INCHES OF SNOW ARE POSSIBLE IN 
SOUTHWESTERN VIRGINIA. COLUMN TEMPS AND THICKNESS VALUES SUGGEST 
MOSTLY A SNOW EVENT IN THAT AREA. WILL CONTINUE SPS TO HIGHLIGHT 
THIS EVENT. THERE WILL BE A TRANSITION TO PRIMARILY A RAIN EVENT TO 
THE SOUTHWEST PER MODEL TEMPERATURE PROFILES. THIS FEATURE IS A 
RAPID MOVER AND WILL BE MOSTLY OUT OF THE AREA BY 12Z FRIDAY. SECOND 
PERIOD ANTICIPATED TO BE DRY...ALTHOUGH LINGERING LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE 
MAY IMPEDE WIDESPREAD CLEARING. FOR TEMPS...GUIDANCE VALUES ARE 
GENERALLY CLOSE AND APPEAR REASONABLE. WENT WITH A BLEND OF THE 
GUIDANCE NUMBERS FOR THE MOST PART.

.LONG TERM...(FRI NIGHT THROUGH THU)...MODELS CONTINUE TO SHOW POOR 
AGREEMENT IN HANDLING WEEKEND SYSTEM.  ETA FURTHER NORTH WITH THE 
SURFACE LOW AND WARMER...WHILE GFS FURTHER SOUTH AND COLDER.  WILL 
FOLLOW HPC IDEA AND GO WITH A BLEND FOR NOW.  ONE TREND WORTH NOTING 
IS THAT THE MODELS HAVE BEEN CONTINUING TO EXIT THE SYSTEM A BIT 
FASTER. SYSTEM ALSO APPEARS MORE LACKING IN MOISTURE. WILL KEEP 20 
POPS FOR LATE FRI NIGHT IN NORTH...THEN CATEGORICAL ALL ZONES SAT. 
WILL ALLOW FOR THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME MIXED PRECIP AT THE ONSET 
NORTH...THEN ALL LIQUID FOR THE BULK OF SATURDAY.   COLDER AIR 
PUSHES IN RAPIDLY SAT NIGHT...TURNING ANY REMAINING PRECIP TO SNOW 
SHOWERS.  WILL GO WITH LIKELY POPS NORTH AND MOUNTAINS...TO LOW 
CHANCE SOUTH FOR EARLY SAT NIGHT...THEN DRY SOUTH AND CHANCE POPS 
NORTH AND SMOKIES FOR EARLY SUNDAY.  DRY SUNDAY NIGHT EXCEPT SLIGHT 
CHANCE SW VA AND NORTHERN AND CENTRAL TN MOUNTAINS.  STILL LOOKS 
LIKE SOME OF THE HIGHER TERRAIN COULD SEE SIGNIFICANT 
ACCUMULATIONS...SO WILL CONTINUE SPS.  AFTER THIS SYSTEM EXITS...NOT 
MUCH OF SIGNIFICANCE IN THE MODELS FOR MON THROUGH THU.  COULD BE A 
WEAK SYSTEM MID WEEK...BUT WILL LEAVE DRY FOR NOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
349 AM EST THU JAN 20 2005

.DISCUSSION...
A FAST MOVING SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE SOUTHEAST FROM THE OHIO VALLEY 
INTO THE CENTRAL AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS TODAY AND TONIGHT.  
FAIRLY DECENT ISENTROPIC LIFT ASSOCIATED WITH THE SYSTEM WHICH WILL
MOVE MAINLY ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE. 
MOISTURE IS LIMITED...BUT ENOUGH LIFT WARRANTS RAISING POPS TO CAT
NORTH TO 20-30 PERCENT TYS AND CHA AREAS. THERMAL PROFILE SUGGESTS
A MIX BAG OF RAIN AND SNOW WITH MAINLY SNOW OVER THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. WILL INCLUDE 1 INCH OR LESS FOR THE NORTHEAST COUNTIES 
WITH UP TO 2 INCHES ACROSS THE HIGHER TERRAIN.

MAIN SYSTEM WILL MOVE INTO THE REGION THIS WEEKEND. BOTH THE GFS
AND ETA ARE IN PRETTY GOOD AGREEMENT IN MOVING COLD FRONT ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA SATURDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING. GOOD LIFT ASSOCIATED 
WITH FROPA AND UPPER TROUGH LATER HALF OF SATURDAY...SO HAVE UPPERD 
POPS TO NEAR 100 PERCENT. INSTABILITY IS LIMITED...BUT FORECAST 
SOUNDINGS DO SHOW SOME ELEVATED INSTABILITY. WOULD NOT BE SUPRISED 
TO SEE ISOLATED THUNDER...BUT WILL LET LATER SHIFTS TO INCLUDE IF
NEEDED.

STRONG COLD AIR ADVECTION BEHIND FRONT WILL QUICKLY DROP 
TEMPERATURES SATURDAY NIGHT WITH TEMPERATURE PROFILES CHANGING RAIN 
TO SNOW SHOWERS AREA-WIDE AFTER MIDNIGHT. FAIRLY DECENT CYCLONIC 
FLOW WITH STRONG UPSLOPE COMPONENT INTO THE MOUNTAINS LATE SATURDAY 
NIGHT THROUGH AT LEAST SUNDAY EVENING.  ALSO...ANOTHER VORT DROPPING 
INTO THE BASE OF THE UPPER TROUGH BY 12Z SUNDAY WILL SET THE STAGE 
FOR THE POTENTIAL OF SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALLS FOR FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE 
MOUNTAINS WITH LIGHTER SNOW ACCUMULATIONS FOR PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST 
VIRGINIA. 

SYSTEM MOVES OUT SUNDAY NIGHT AND MONDAY MORNING WITH DRIER WEATHER 
FOR EARLY NEXT WEEK.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
340 AM EST FRI JAN 20 2005

.SHORT TERM...TODAY...LIGHT RAIN/LIGHT SNOW WILL CONTINUE TO DECREASE
EARLY TODAY AS IMPULSE MOVES EAST OF NORTHERN PART OF MRX CWA.
ANTICYCLONIC FLOW MOVES IN WITH CAA PUSHING INTO NORTHERN AND
EASTERN AREAS. EXPECT WARM FRONTAL BOUNDARY TO HANG ACROSS SW
PARTS SO KEPT TEMPS UP THOSE AREAS. LAYER DRIES OUT BUT LOW 
CLOUDS WILL LINGER MOST OF TODAY WITH DECENT CAP AROUND 850 MB.

.LONG TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...POOR CONSISTENCY IN MODELS 
CONTINUE FOR THE SYSTEM MOVING IN ON SATURDAY.  ONE OF THE TRENDS 
HAS BEEN TO MOVE THE FRONT THROUGH AT A FASTER PACE.  AS SUCH...HAVE 
TWEAKED TIMING OF MAIN BAND OF PRECIP UP A COUPLE OF HOURS AND 
CLEARED THE SYSTEM OUT OF THE AREA A BIT SOONER.  OTHERWISE... 
CONTINUING WIDESPREAD RAIN OVER THE AREA ON SATURDAY...CHANGING 
THINGS OVER TO SNOW OVERNIGHT.  MAIN QUESTION WITH THE SYSTEM IS 
TIMING OF RAIN CHANGING TO SNOW AND THE POTENTIAL FOR SNOW 
ACCUMULATION...MAINLY OVER HIGHER TERRAIN.  A FEW LIGHT SNOW SHOWERS 
WILL LINGER INTO SUNDAY MORNING AS DRIER AIR PUSHES.  WE STAY UNDER 
NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT FOR MUCH THE REMAINDER OF THE EXTENDED 
PERIOD.  A FEW WEAK DISTURBANCES MOVE THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW...BUT 
MODELS ARE CURRENTLY KEEPING MAIN MOISTURE AND LIFT TO OUR NORTH 
WITH EACH.  SO FOR NOW...WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST FOR THAT 
PERIOD.

AFFECTS MIN TEMP FORECAST AS WINDS HAVE GREATLY DIMINISHED ACROSS

WILL EXIT AREA THU NIGHT...AND WITH ONLY LIMITED MOISTURE AND 
LIFT...THINK SLIGHT CHANCE TO LOW CHANCE POPS MOST REASONABLE FOR

NOW...THEN MORE SIGNIFICANT SYSTEM APPROACHES THE AREA LATER FRIDAY 
NIGHT AND SATURDAY.  MODELS DEEP ENOUGH WITH THIS FEATURE TO PULL 
SIGNIFICANT WARM AIR INTO THE AREA AHEAD OF THE SURFACE LOW...WHICH 
IS EXPECTED TO TRACK BY JUST TO OUR NORTH.  THIS SHOULD LIMIT ANY 
WINTRY PRECIP AHEAD OF THE SYSTEM...BUT SINCE PRECIP MAY ARRIVE LATE 
FRI NIGHT WILL HAVE TO ALLOW FOR A MIX AT THE ONSET NORTH.  GOOD 
SURGE OF MOISTURE AND DECENT LIFT INDICATED FOR SATURDAY...SO WILL 
GO HIGH LIKELY POPS.  MUCH COLDER AIR WILL PUSH IN SATURDAY 
NIGHT...TURNING ANY REMAINING PRECIP TO SNOW.  GFS DEPICTS FAIRLY 
SHARP UPPER TROUGH SWINGING ACROSS THE AREA SUNDAY...WHICH MAY HELP 
TO ENHANCE SNOW SHOWER ACTIVITY. COULD SEE SOME SIGNIFICANT SNOW 
ACCUMULATION IN THE NORMALLY FAVORED UPSLOPE AREAS...WILL CONTINUE 
SPS.  SNOW SHOWERS SHOULD TAPER OFF SUNDAY NIGHT AND END BY MONDAY. 
MAY BE ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM BY WED...BUT WITH UNCERTAINTY HIGH...WILL 
GO DRY FOR THE MON THROUGH WED PERIOD FOR NOW.

CHANCE OF RAIN IN THOSE AREAS.  IT APPEARS NOW THAT WE WILL REMAIN 
COLD ENOUGH FOR ALL SNOW IN THESE LOCATIONS...ALTHOUGH THE AMOUNTS 
WILL BE VERY SMALL.  OTHERWISE...ONLY SUBTLE CHANGES TO CLOUDS AND 
HOURLY TEMPS/DEWPOINTS.

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 190852
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
353 AM EST WED JAN 19 2005

.DISCUSSION...A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO AND
TENNESSEE VALLEYS TODAY AND THURSDAY. MOISTURE IS LIMITED WITH BOTH SYSTEMS
WITH DEWPOINTS CURRENTLY IN THE SINGLE DIGITS AND TEENS. BEST LIFT AND
MOISTURE REMAINS NORTH OF THE AREA...BUT WILL CONTINUE WITH LOW 
CHANCE POPS FOR SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND NORTHEAST TENNESSEE.  A MIX BAG
OF RAIN/SNOW ANTICIPATED TODAY CHANGING TO SNOW SHOWERS FOR 
OVERNIGHT.  BEST CHANCE OF SNOW WILL ALONG WITH WEST/NORTHWEST FACING
SLOPES. DUE TO THE LIMITED MOISTURE...FEEL SNOW ACCUMULATIONS WILL 
BE MINIMAL.

THURSDAYS SYSTEM SEEMS EVEN WEAKER AND PLAN ON KEEPING POPS TO SLIGHT
CHANCE FOR MAINLY THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. ELSEWHERE...MOSTLY CLOUDY CONDITIONS WILL BE THE 
RULE WITH A MODERATION OF TEMPERATURES.

MAIN FORECAST CONCERN IS THIS WEEKENDS SYSTEM. MODELS ARE TRENDING WITH
A MORE NORTHERLY TRACK OF THE SURFACE LOW WITH FAIRLY STRONG SOUTHWEST
WINDS ANTICIPATED FOR SATURDAY.  IN RESULT WILL BE MAINLY A RAIN 
EVENT FOR SATURDAY.  AS SURFACE MOVES EAST OF THE REGION SATURDAY 
NIGHT...RAIN WILL CHANGE TO SNOW SHOWERS...ESPECIALLY FOR THE HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS. AGAIN...A SIGNFICANT SNOWFALL IS POSSIBLE LATE SATURDAY 
NIGHT AND SUNDAY FOR THE FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND HIGHER 
ELEVATIONS OF SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.  LATEST MESO-ETA SHOWS BETWEEN 6 
AND 10 INCHES OF SNOW FOR THE FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS WITH 
UP TO A FOOT FOR THE HIGHEST TERRAIN.  SNOW ACCUMULATIONS OF 1 TO 3 
INCHES ARE POSSIBLE FOR THE NORTH PLATEAU AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA.  
WILL ISSUE A SPS CONCERNING THIS POTENTIAL.

GENERALLY ONLY A DUSTING OR LESS FOR THE VALLEY LOCATIONS OF EAST 
TENNESSEE.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 182000
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST TUE JAN 18 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...THE COLD AIR IN PLACE ACROSS 
THE NRN MOST AREAS IS OBVIOUSLY HOLDING THIS AFTERNOON...AS TEMPS 
WERE STRUGGLING TO BREAK ABOVE 20 DEGREES ACROSS SWRN VA.  REST OF 
OUR AREA HAS WARMED INTO THE MID 20S TO MID 30S.  

THE UPSTREAM SHORTWAVE DROPPING QUICKLY SE FROM THE UPPER MIDWEST 
STATES...WILL BRING INCREASING CLOUDS LATE TONIGHT AND WED...BUT THE 
MAIN AREAS OF LIGHT PCPN (SNOW) SHOULD BE MOSTLY TO OUR NORTH.  I 
DID INCLUDE SOME 15 TO 25 PERCENT POPS FOR MAINLY SW VA AND NE TN
ON WED...WITH SOME SPRINKLES OR FLURRIES ALSO MENTIONED BRIEFLY FOR 
THE CENTRAL TN VALLEY COUNTIES.  HOWEVER...THIS IS A FAST AND 
PASSING FEATURE SO QPF...BOTH LIQUID AND SNOW AMOUNTS...WERE KEPT 
EXTREMELY LOW.  MAIN CHANGE TO WEATHER GRIDS WAS TO INDICATE THE 
TYPE OF PCPN AS SNOW SHOWERS OR FLURRIES INSTEAD OF MIXED RAIN/SNOW
GIVEN THE COLD 850 MB TEMPS AND MODEL FORECAST SOUNDINGS. 

FOR TEMPS...SKIES WILL REMAIN CLEAR POSSIBLY RIGHT UP TO MIDNIGHT... 
THEN THE CLOUDS INCREASE ALONG WITH LOW LEVEL WARM AIR ADVECTION.  
MY MIN TEMP GRIDS WERE DRAWN TO REFLECT THIS WITH LOWS OCCURRING 
AROUND 06Z OR 07Z...THEN TEMPS SHOWN TO REMAIN STEADY OR RISE A BIT.
LOWS NEAR THE MOS BLEND LOOKED REASONABLE.  FOR MAX TEMPS ON WED...
FELT THAT THE COOLER MAV HIGHS WERE THE BEST CHOICE...ALTHO THE SRN 
VALLEY COULD EXPERIENCE AT LEAST PARTIAL SUNSHINE IN THE AFTERNOON.

.LONG TERM (WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...COUPLE OF WEAK WAVES 
WILL MOVE THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW TO OUR NORTH WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
THROUGH FRIDAY.   MAIN MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL BE TO OUR NORTH WITH 
SOME WEAK UPSLOPE FLOW DEVELOPING.  THIS WILL KEEP SLIGHT CHANCE 
POPS CONFINED TO NORTHERN AND EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAIN ZONES.   
MODELS BRING A RATHER STRONG COLD FRONT INTO THE REGION FOR 
SATURDAY.  SIGNIFICANT WARMING IS PROGGED OVER THE AREA IN ADVANCE 
OF THE FRONT.  IF THIS OCCURS AS DEPICTED...EXPECT MAINLY RAIN AHEAD 
OF THE FRONT...WITH A RAIN/SNOW MIX OVER HIGHER TERRAIN AND FAR 
NORTHERN ZONES.  BEHIND THE FRONT...SATURDAY NIGHT INTO SUNDAY... 
COLDER AIR WILL MOVE IN...SWITCHING ALL LINGERING PRECIP TO LIGHT 
SNOW.  A COUPLE OF WEAK WAVES MOVE THROUGH TO OUR NORTH ONCE AGAIN 
MONDAY AND TUESDAY.  CONFIDENCE REMAINS LOW ON TIMING AND STRENGTH 
...THOUGH WAVES DO LOOK FAIRLY WEAK.  THEREFORE...FOR NOW...WILL 
KEEP FORECAST DRY FOR THIS PERIOD.
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             22  45  34  51 /  10  10  10  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  19  40  31  46 /  10  10  10  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       19  40  32  45 /  10  10  10  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              14  34  27  42 /  10  20  10  20

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1005 AM EST TUE JAN 18 2005

.DISCUSSION...LOTS OF SUNSHINE ACROSS THE REGION THIS MORNING WITH 
CLOUDS WELL OFF TO OUR NW AND S.  IN SPITE OF THE SUNSHINE...CURRENT 
TEMPS ARE ONLY IN THE SINGLE DIGITS OVER THE NORTH AND MAINLY TEENS 
ELSEWHERE.  12Z UPPER AIR PLOTS STILL SHOWED COLD 850 MB TEMPS 
RANGING FROM AROUND -5 DEG C SE TN TO -16 DEG C OVER SWRN VA.  12Z 
OHX AND RNK SOUNDINGS SUPPORT HIGHS MOSTLY IN THE LOWER 20S TO LOWER 
30S TODAY.  THE BEST LOW LEVEL WARM AIR ADVECTION WILL OCCUR THIS 
EVENING AND OVERNIGHT...SO THE LINGERING COLD AIR MAY OFFSET SOME OF 
THE SUNSHINE TODAY.  I WILL MONITOR TEMPS FOR THE REST OF THE 
MORNING HOURS...AND ONLY UPDATE IF TEMPS SEEM TO BE RUNNING BEHIND 
FORECASTED HIGHS.

OTHERWISE...A COUPLE OF WEAK SYSTEMS TO AFFECT US BEFORE THE 
STRONGER SYSTEM ON SAT AND SUN...WITH MORE DETAILS ON THIS IN THE 
AFTERNOON AFD/FORECAST.

SIGNIFICANT SNOWFALL ACROSS THE FAR EASTERN TENNESSEE MOUNTAINS AND

RETURNS FOR THURSDAY AND FRIDAY.  ANOTHER DISTURBANCE IS PROGGED TO

EXPECTED BE ABOVE FREEZING FOR MOST OF THE AREA...EXCEPT ACROSS 
SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST TN AND THE MOUNTAINS WHERE LIGHT SNOW WILL 
BE POSSIBLE.  ANOTHER SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH ON SUNDAY...BEST

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND TUESDAY)...DRY AND COLD AIR IN PLACE WITH

0...TRI -3).

TREND.  MOS MAX TEMPS WERE QUITE CLOSE AND HARD TO DISAGREE WITH FOR 
THE CENTRAL AND NRN AREAS...WHILE A COMPROMISE BETWEEN THE CHOICES 
FOR THE SRN AREAS LOOKED BEST.  

.LONG TERM (TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
AND NORTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT WILL CONTINUE PULLING IN A COLD AND DRY 
AIR MASS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALAHCINA REGION THROUGH WEEDNSDAY.  A 
WEAK SHORT WAVE WILL DROP THROUGH THE UPPER FLOW WEDNESDAY 
AFTERNOON/EVENING.  THE WAVE WILL BRUSH THROUGH OUR NORTHERN ZONES 
FOR A SLIGHT CHANCE OF LIGHT SNOWFALL.  WE WILL BE BEWTWEEN SYSTEM 
THURSDAY AND FRIDAY FOR DRY AND SLIGHTLY WARMER CONDITIONS.  A COLD 
FRONT WILL DROP DOWN ON SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT FOR THE BEST 
SHOT OF PRECIP DURING THE EXTENDED...SCATTERED RAIN MAINLY IN THE 
SOUTHERN ZONES...A MIX OF RAIN AND SNOW IN THE NORTH.  ANOTHER WEAK 
DISTURBANCE SLIDES THROUGH TO OUR NORTH ON SUNDAY.  MAIN MOISTURE 
AND LIFT APPREAR TO STAY TO OUR NORTH SO WILL KEEP FORECAST DRY FOR 
NOW.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 162002
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST SUN JAN 16 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND MONDAY)...A SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE ACROSS THE 
OUR NORTHERN ZONES THIS EVENING AS A TROUGH AXIS ROTATES THROUGH.  
THIS WILL BRING THE MEAN FLOW FROM THE NORTHWEST. SHALLOW...LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE ATTACHED TO THE WAVE AND THE STRONG NORTHWEST 
(UPSLOPE) FLOW WILL GENERATE LIGHT SNOWFALL OVER EASTERN MOUNTAINS.  
SCATTERED SNOW ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED...MAINLY ABOVE 2500 FEET 
FROM THE SMOKY MOUNTAIN NP NORTHWARD.  SNOW AMOUNTS WILL BE 
GENERALLY LESS THAN 2 INCHES. HOWEVER...THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS COULD 
SEE LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS. ALSO ASSOCIATED WITH THE TROUGH AXIS 
WILL BE LOCALLY BREEZY WINDS OF 10 TO 20 MPH WITH HIGHER GUSTS. THIS 
COMBINED WITH OVERNIGHT LOWS IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS OF 10 TO 15 
DEGREES FAHRENHEIT WILL GENERATE WIND CHILLS OF NEAR ZERO DEGREES. 
ANOTHER PUSH OF DRY AND COLD AIR WILL MOVE IN BEHIND THE AXIS ON 
MONDAY. DEW POINTS WILL FALL INTO THE SINGLE DIGITS AND AFTERNOON 
TEMPERATURES WILL STRUGGLE TO REACH THE FREEZING MARK.

.LONG TERM (MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A COLD ARCTIC AIRMASS 
WILL SETTLE OVER THE REGION THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT BRINGING DRY 
CONDITIONS. A FAST-MOVING COLD FRONT WILL RACE TOWARD THE FORECAST 
AREA ON WEDNESDAY...WITH THE LATEST GFS MODEL RUN CONTINUING TO 
INDICATE LIMITED AVAILABLE MOISTURE. THUS...WILL PLAN TO MENTION 
MAINLY JUST AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS...BUT WILL ADD A SLIGHT CHANCE FOR 
SNOW SHOWERS ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA AND THE MOUNTAINS OF NORTHEAST TN 
WHERE A FEW ISOLATED SNOW SHOWERS COULD BE GENERATED BY THE UPSLOPE 
FLOW. ANOTHER FAST-MOVING CLIPPER SYSTEM WILL MOVE ACROSS THE AREA 
ON SATURDAY...BRINGING THE POSSIBILITY OF SOME WINTRY PRECIP. 
HOWEVER...MOISTURE APPEARS TO AGAIN BE LIMITED WITH THIS SYSTEM... 
AND DONT EXPECT MUCH PRECIP TO BE GENERATED. GFS MODEL INDICATES 
THAT TEMPS WILL BE ABOVE FREEZING FOR MOST OF THE AREA...EXCEPT 
ACROSS SOUTHWEST VA...NORTHEAST TN AND THE MOUNTAINS WHERE LIGHT 
SNOW WILL BE POSSIBLE. LATEST GFS MODEL RUN ALSO INDICATES ANOTHER 
FAST-MOVING CLIPPER SYSTEM FOR SUNDAY...BUT THIS SCENARIO IS NOT 
SUPPORTED BY THE ENSEMBLE MEANS AND WILL PLAN TO KEEP THE FORECAST 
FOR SUNDAY DRY FOR NOW.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 161435
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
935 AM EST SUN JAN 16 2005

.DISCUSSION...MODELS IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH BRINGING A SHORT WAVE 
INTO THE REGION LATE THIS AFTERNOON.  MOISTURE IS LIMITED AND 
GENERALLY CONFINED TO THE LOWER LEVELS OF OUR NORTHERN ZONES.  FLOW 
WILL BE TURNING TO THE NORTHWEST WHICH WILL PRODUCE GOOD UPSLOPE 
CONDITIONS FOR EASTERN MOUNTAINS.  WITH A COLD AIR MASS IN 
PLACE...ASSOCIATED PRECIP WILL BE SNOW.  WITH LIMITED MOISTURE AND 
LIFT...THE SNOW WILL BE SCATTERED AND SNOW AMOUNTS LIGHT...UP TO AN 
INCH IS POSSIBLE OVER NORTHERN ZONES.  HOWEVER...HIGHER AMOUNTS ARE 
EXPECTED OVER HIGHER TERRAIN WHERE 1 TO 2 INCHES ARE POSSIBLE.  ALL 
ON TRACK IN THE CURRENT FORECAST...WILL UPDATE TO ADJUST FOR 
AFTERNOON WORDING.

ACROSS OUR AREA...BUT WILL BUMP UP POPS A BIT FOR THIS AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING.  BEST CHANCES IN THE NORTH WHERE THE BEST MOISTURE 
RESIDES.  ONLY EXPECTING AN INCH OR LESS BY THE TIME IT EXITS THE 
CWA...WITH ISOLATED HIGHER AMOUNTS IN THE HIGHEST ELEVATIONS.  THE 
DISTURBANCE SHOULD BE OUT OF THE AREA BY MORNING. 

.LONG TERM (MONDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...COLDER AND DRY WEATHER 
RETURNS ON MONDAY. WINDS STAY UP A BIT AS WELL RESULTING IN SOME 
VERY COLD WIND CHILL READINGS ON MONDAY AND TUESDAY.  A WARMING 
TREND IS EXPECTED THE LAST HALF OF THE WEEK.  AN UPPER/SURFACE 
TROUGH MOVES IN TOWARD THE END OF THE WEEK BRINGING ANOTHER CHANCE 
FOR RAIN/SNOW ON FRIDAY AND SATURDAY.

CONTINUE ACROSS THE APPALACHIAN REGION THROUGH WEDNESDAY...BRINGING

WEDNESDAY NIGHT...SO WILL PLAN TO MENTION ONLY AN INCREASE IN CLOUDS 
WITH DRY CONDITIONS CONTINUING THROUGH FRIDAY. A LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM 
IS PROGGED TO DEVELOP ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS FRIDAY NIGHT...AND 
SHOULD MOVE INTO THE FORECAST AREA ON SATURDAY. GFS MODEL INDICATES 
THAT IT WILL BE COLD ENOUGH FOR MIXED WINTER PRECIP...BUT ENSEMBLE 
MEANS SUGGEST THAT TEMPS WILL BE WARMER ON SATURDAY. WILL PLAN TO 
MENTION THE POSSIBILITY OF MIXED PRECIP FOR SATURDAY...BUT RIGHT NOW 
THINK IT WILL MAINLY BE RAIN EXCEPT ACROSS NORTHEAST TN...SOUTHWEST 
VA AND THE MOUNTAINS.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
245 PM EST FRI JAN 14 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT AND SATURDAY)...A COOL...DRY AIR MASS HAS MOVED 
IN BEHIND YESTERDAY/S COLD FRONT WITH SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE 
CONTINUING TO BUILD INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION. ASSOCIATED 
SUBSIDENCE WILL PROVIDE CLEARING SKIES...WHICH COMBINED WITH 
LOWERING DEW POINTS AND DECREASING WINDS...WILL ALLOW OVERNIGHT 
TEMPS TO FALL INTO THE 20S IN MOST LOCATIONS. EVEN THOUGH WE HAVE A 
MOIST GROUND FROM YESTERDAY/S RAINFALL...THE LOW DEW POINTS WILL 
PREVENT SIGNIFICANT FOG FORMATION. HOWEVER...LIMITED PATCHY FOG IS 
POSSIBLE...MAINLY ALONG AREA LAKES. HIGH PRESSURE WILL CONTINUE TO 
CONTROL AREA WEATHER INTO SATURDAY FOR A DRY...SUNNY AND SLIGHTLY 
WARMER DAY.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE WILL 
CONTINUE ACROSS THE APPALACHIAN REGION THROUGH WEDNESDAY...BRINGING 
SEASONAL TEMPS AND DRY CONDITIONS. A COLD FRONT SHOULD QUICKLY MOVE 
THROUGH THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WITH THE LATEST GFS MODEL RUN 
INDICATING ENOUGH MOISTURE WITH THIS FRONT FOR SOME PRECIP WEDNESDAY 
NIGHT AND THURSDAY. HOWEVER...ENSEMBLE MEANS SUGGEST THAT THE UPPER- 
LEVEL TROUGH DEPICTED BY THE LATEST GFS RUN FOR THURSDAY MAY BE TOO 
AMPLIFIED. ALSO...SINCE THE GFS MODEL HAS A FAIRLY CONSISTENT WET 
AND COOL BIAS IN THE EXTENDED...WILL CONTINUE WITH A DRY FORECAST AT 
THIS TIME THROUGH FRIDAY.

FXUS64 KMRX 132004
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST THU JAN 13 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND FRIDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS 
A COLD FRONT EXTENDING ACROSS THE LOWER OHIO AND LOWER MS RIVER 
VALLEYS WITH A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH AND ITS ASSOCIATED LINE OF SHOWERS 
ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU. THIS LINE OF SHOWERS WILL LIKELY 
PRODUCE SOME GUSTY WINDS AS A STRONG LOW-LEVEL JET CONTINUES AROUND 
850 MB. HOWEVER...IT APPEARS THAT MOST OF THE 850 MB WINDS ARE NOT 
REACHING THE SURFACE...AS SURFACE OBS AND KMRX VAD WIND PROFILE 
REVEAL THAT WINDS ARE REMAINING BELOW ADVISORY CRITERIA. THUS...WILL 
CANCEL THE WIND ADVISORIES FOR THIS EVENING. RAINFALL AMOUNTS WITH 
THESE SHOWERS HAVE BEEN FAIRLY MODEST....SO THINK THE THREAT OF 
LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL APPEARS TO BE MINIMAL. RAIN SHOULD MOVE OUT 
OF MOST OF THE AREA BY LATER TONIGHT...WITH HIGH PRESSURE BUILDING 
INTO THE AREA ON FRIDAY. 

.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY)...COOL SURFACE HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS INTO THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIAN REGION THROUGH THE 
WEEKEND AND WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL OF AREA WEATHER FOR MUCH OF NEXT 
WEEK.  ALOFT...AN UPPER TROUGH WILL BE POSITIONED OVER THE EASTERN 
U.S. PUTTING US UNDER ZONAL TO NORTHWESTERLY FLOW.  THIS WILL ALLOW 
COOLER...MORE SEASONAL TEMPERATURES TO FILTER INTO THE AREA.  A WEAK 
WAVE WILL DROP THROUGH MONDAY NIGHT BUT EXPECT GENERALLY AN INCREASE 
IN CLOUD COVER ASSOCIATED WITH THIS FEATURE.  ANOTHER WAVE MOVES IN 
FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  THIS ONE LOOKS STRONGER BUT STILL INSUFFICIENT 
FOR PRECIP.  HOWEVER...AS MODELS GET A BETTER HANDLE ON THIS FEATURE 
....MAY NEED TO INTRODUCE SOME LOW POPS ON WEDNESDAY NIGHT OR INTO 
THURSDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 131447
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
945 AM EST THU JAN 13 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT EXTENDING ACROSS THE 
LOWER OHIO AND LOWER MS RIVER VALLEYS WITH A PRE-FRONTAL TROUGH AND 
A LINE OF CONVECTION ACROSS MIDDLE TN AND NORTH AL. THIS LINE OF 
CONVECTION WILL LIKELY PRODUCE STRONG GUSTY WINDS BY THIS 
AFTERNOON...AS VAD WIND PROFILES REVEAL A 50 KT LOW-LEVEL JET AROUND 
850 MB. WITH THIS IN MIND...WILL PLAN TO EXTEND THE LAKE WIND 
ADVISORY FOR ALL ZONES THIS AFTERNOON...SINCE THERE SHOULD BE A 
COUPLE OF HOURS OF ADVISORY CRITERIA WINDS AS THIS RAIN MOVES 
THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA. AS FOR THE THREAT OF HEAVY RAINFALL... 
THIS LINE OF CONVECTION SHOULD MOVE THROUGH FAIRLY QUICKLY WITH ONLY 
A COUPLE OF HOURS OF LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL. THUS...DONT THINK A 
FLOOD WATCH WILL BE NEEDED THIS AFTERNOON. WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE 
FORECAST THIS MORNING TO MAKE A FEW MINOR WORDING TWEAKS...AND TO 
ADD THE WIND ADVISORY TO THE OTHER ZONES.
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL MIDNIGHT FOR ZONES NCZ060>061.

TN...WIND ADVISORY UNTIL MIDNIGHT FOR ZONES TNZ018...TNZ041... 
TNZ043...TNZ045...TNZ047...TNZ072...TNZ074...TNZ087...TNZ102.

LAKE WIND ADVISORY UNTIL MIDNIGHT FOR ALL OTHER ZONES.

VA...LAKE WIND ADVISORY UNTIL MIDNIGHT FOR ALL ZONES.

DMG





000 
FXUS64 KMRX 130943
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
440 AM EST THU JAN 13 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SYSTEM STEAMING TOWARD AREA 
NOW...AND SHOULD BE PRETTY MUCH OUT OF AREA BY 12Z FRIDAY.  
EXPECTING ALL AREAS TO GET MDT TO HVY RAINS TONIGHT.  IF SYSTEM 
WASNT PROGRESSING SO STEADILY...WE MIGHT HAVE ISSUED A FF WATCH.  
THINK MOST AREAS WILL GET A GOOD 4-6 HOURS OF RAIN WITH EMBEDDED 
THUNDER.  PRECIP TOTALS SHOULD GENERALLY RANGE FROM 1.0-1.5 
INCHES...WITH MAYBE A FEW ISOLATED 2 INCH AMOUNTS.

HAVE ISSUED WIND ADVISORIES GENERALLY FOR HIGHER TERRAIN WEST AND 
EAST THAT STARTS UP LATER THIS MORNING...WITH GRADIENT WINDS TODAY 
AND CONVECTIVELY ENHANCED GRADIENT WINDS LATE THIS AFTERNOON AND 
TONIGHT.

FOR SEVERE POTENTIAL...THINKING IT MAY BE HARD TO GET MUCH ORGANIZED 
THIS FAR NORTH.  EVEN WITH STRONG DYNAMICS...LOOKS LIKE CAPE 
VALUES...SURFACE DURING THE DAY...AND ELEVATED TONIGHT...WILL REMAIN 
BELOW 300 J/KG.  850-500MB LAPSE RATES ONLY ABOUT 5.5DEG/KM AS 
WELL.  LOOKING LIKE MORE OF A HEAVY RAIN EVENT OVERALL.

TEMPS SHOULD BE WARM AGAIN TODAY...BUT FAIRLY EARLY HIGH TEMPS DUE 
TO INCREASING CLOUD COVER AND PRECIP MOVING INTO WESTERN AREAS.


.LONG TERM...(FRIDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...MOST ATTENTION SPENT ON 
EDITING GRIDS ONLY AS FAR OUT AS FRIDAY.  HOWEVER...MINOR CHANGES 
WERE MADE TO MESH WITH NEIGHBORS ON LATER PERIODS...ESPECIALLY FOR 
MONDAY WHEN NW FLOW ALOFT MAY BRING A BIT MORE CLOUDINESS TO THE 
AREA THAN PREVIOUSLY THOUGHT.  OTHERWISE...THIS WILL BE A DRY PERIOD 
EXCEPT FOR LINGERING SHOWERS UP TO AROUND 14Z FRIDAY.

MODELS AND MOS SEEM TO HAVE FLIP-FLOPPED ON HOW MUCH COLD AIR 
ADVECTS INTO THE REGION FOR THIS WEEKEND.  GFS WANTS TO ADVECT MUCH 
COLDER AIR INTO THE REGION FOR SAT AND SUN THAN ETA...WHICH RESULTS 
IN A LARGE DISCREPANCY ON MIN TEMPS FRI NIGHT AND MAX TEMPS SATURDAY.
GIVEN THE MODEL INCONSISTENCIES FROM RUN TO RUN...MY CONFIDENCE ON 
WHICH WAY TO ADJUST TEMPS WAS LOW.  FOR NOW I KEPT TEMPS FOR THOSE 
PERIODS CLOSE TO THE MOS BLEND.  HOWEVER...I WILL COMMENT THAT THE 
UPPER FLOW ADJUSTING BACK TO A NEARLY ZONAL FLOW OVER THE WEEKEND...
WOULD NOT FAVOR THE STRONGER COLD AIR ADVECTION FROM THE GFS.  

ALL PRODUCTS...INCLUDING WEB PRODUCTS AND GRAPHICS...HAVE BEEN 
ISSUED AT THIS TIME.  THANKS TO ALL FOR THE COORDINATION THIS 
MORNING.

&&

OAK RIDGE, TN                       66  37  41  24 /  90 100  10   0

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 122003
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
300 PM EST WED JAN 12 2005

.SHORT TERM (TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...CURRENT SURFACE 
ANALYSIS REVEALS A DEEP SOUTHERLY FLOW ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA... 
WITH SOME DOWNSLOPING OFF THE MOUNTAINS CREATING BREAKS IN THE 
CLOUDS ACROSS THE NORTHEAST HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. THIS HAS 
ALLOWED TEMPS TO RISE TO ABOVE RECORD LEVELS ACROSS NORTHEAST TN AND 
SOUTHWEST VA. HIGH CLOUDS SHOULD CONTINUE TO ADVECT INTO THE REGION 
FROM THE SOUTHWEST TONIGHT...PRODUCING MOSTLY CLOUDY SKIES ACROSS 
MOST OF THE REGION. MODELS ARE IN GOOD AGREEMENT WITH BRINGING THE 
NEXT COLD FRONT AND ITS ASSOCIATED RAINFALL INTO THE FORECAST AREA 
BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON AND EVENING. A STRONG LOW-LEVEL 850 MB JET 
APPROACHING 50 TO 60 KTS IS EXPECTED TO DEVELOP AHEAD OF THE FRONT 
BY TOMORROW AFTERNOON...BRINGING BREEZY CONDITIONS ACROSS MOST OF 
THE AREA...ESPECIALLY ACROSS THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS. WITH SOME 
MARGINAL INSTABILITY EXPECTED TO DEVELOP TOMORROW AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING...THINK THAT SCATTERED TSTORMS WILL BE POSSIBLE WITH SOME OF 
THESE TSTORMS BRINGING THE STRONGER WINDS ALOFT DOWN TO THE SURFACE. 
IN ADDITION TO THE LOW-LEVEL JET...THE REGION BECOMES LOCATED UNDER 
THE RIGHT ENTRANCE REGION OF A 250 MB JET STREAK...WHICH SHOULD HELP 
TO ENHANCE THE LIFT AND POTENTIAL FOR LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL ACROSS 
THE FORECAST AREA. RAINFALL AMOUNTS OF ONE TO TWO INCHES APPEAR TO 
BE POSSIBLE...ESPECIALLY ACROSS SOUTHEAST TN AND SOUTHWEST NC...BUT 
FLASH FLOOD GUIDANCE VALUES REMAIN FAIRLY HIGH. ALSO...THIS RAIN 
SHOULD MOVE FAIRLY QUICKLY THROUGH THE AREA...SO WILL HOLD OFF WITH 
A FLOOD WATCH AND INSTEAD MENTION LOCALLY HEAVY RAINFALL IN THE 
ZONES AND IN A SPECIAL WEATHER STATEMENT. HIGH PRESSURE THEN BUILDS 
INTO THE FORECAST AREA BY FRIDAY BEHIND THE PASSAGE OF THE COLD 
FRONT.

.LONG TERM (SATURDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY)...UPR TROF/ASSOCIATED CD FNT 
WELL E/SE OF THE FA SAT WITH SFC HI PRES BUILDING SLOWLY E AND SE 
INTO THE MIDWEST MON EXTENDING E INTO THE UPR OH AND MID MS VLY 
REGION BY TUE. SHOULD BE A DRY PERIOD FOR THE TN VLY AND SRN 
APPALACHIANS AS BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT PROGGED WELL N AND S OF THE 
REGION. BY LATE WED AN UPR TROF BUILDS S THRU THE GREAT LAKES INTO 
THE NE U.S. DRAGGING A COLD FRONT TWD THE CENTRAL APPALACHIANS. 
CONSENSUS FCST LEFT THE FINAL DAY OF THE EXTENDED DRY WITH LATE 
ARRIVAL OF FRONT. STAYED CLOSE TO GFS MOS TEMP GUIDANCE FOR EXTENDED 
WHICH FEATURES TEMPS A FEW DEGREES ABV NORMAL SAT WITH A GRADUAL 
COOLING TREND AS CAA CONTINUES ON LOW LVL N-NELY FLO UNTIL TUE/WED 
WHEN AIRMASS MODIFIES AHEAD OF MID TO LATE WEEK FRONTAL SYSTEM. 
&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EST WED JAN 12 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONT ACROSS THE 
MID WEST WITH DEEP SOUTHWEST FLOW ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. PATCHY 
DENSE FOG EARLIER THIS MORNING APPEARS TO EVAPORATING WITH MOSTLY 
CLOUDY SKIES CONTINUING ACROSS MOST OF THE SOUTHEAST. CLOUD COVER 
WILL BE THE TRICKIEST PART OF THE FORECAST THIS AFTERNOON...BUT 
THINK THAT WITH THE DEEP SOUTHWEST FLOW...THE ATMOSPHERE SHOULD MIX 
ENOUGH FOR PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES TO DEVELOP THIS AFTERNOON. 

CURRENT FORECAST TEMPS LOOK TO BE IN GOOD SHAPE WITH THE TRI-CITIES 
AREA LIKELY SETTING A NEW RECORD HIGH. WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THE 
FORECAST THIS MORNING MOSTLY TO REMOVE MORNING FOG WORDING.



000 
FXUS64 KMRX 120858
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
355 AM EST WED JAN 12 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...MODELS AND ENSEMBLES GENERALLY 
AGREE THAT MAINLY BENIGN WEATHER WILL PERSIST THROUGH THE FIRST TWO 
PERIODS. UPPER LEVEL FLOW AMPLIFIES AS UPPER TROUGH APPROACHES FROM 
WEST. FLOW REMAINS ANTICYCLONIC OVER THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
THROUGH THE FIRST TWO PERIODS. BASED ON UPPER FLOW REGIME AND 
GENERALLY DRY MID-LEVELS...HAVE LOWERED POPS SOMEWHAT IN THE SECOND 
PERIOD. GOOD SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW SHOULD ALSO CAUSE TEMPS TO APPROACH 
RECORD HIGHS TODAY...ESPECIALLY AT TRI. DID NOT MAKE ANY SIGNIFICANT 
CHANGES TO EXISTING TEMP GRIDS/FORECAST AS THEY AGREE WELL WITH GFS 
GUIDANCE TEMPS.


.LONG TERM...(THURSDAY THRU TUESDAY)...MAIN SYSTEM FOR THIS PERIOD 
IS THE STRONG SHORTWAVE TROUGH AND COLD FRONT EXPECTED ON THURSDAY.
OPERATIONAL MODELS AND ENSEMBLES STILL SEEM IN GOOD AGREEMENT ON THE 
BRUNT OF THE CONVECTIVE PCPN TO OCCUR THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING
...WITH LITTLE IF ANY PCPN LEFTOVER AFTER 12Z FRIDAY.  SOME MINOR 
CHANGES WERE REQUIRED IN THE TIMING OF THE INITIAL ARRIVAL OF 
SHOWERS AHEAD OF THE FRONT THURSDAY MORNING...WITH GENERALLY ALL 
OFFICES AROUND DECREASING POPS FOR THURSDAY MORNING AND SHIFTING THE 
HIGHEST POPS TO AROUND 22Z TO 06Z PERIOD (LATE THU AFTERNOON AND 
EVENING).  ISOLATED TO SCATTERED THUNDERSTORMS WERE INTRODUCED DUE 
TO SOME INSTABILITY (MORE ELEVATED THAN SIMPLY USING SURFACE BASED 
LIFTED INDICES OR CAPES)...PLUS SOME STRONG POSITIVE OMEGA (LIFT)
AIDED BY PROLONGED PERIOD OF UPPER LEVEL DIVERGENCE OVER OUR REGION 
AS WE FALL UNDER THE RIGHT REAR QUADRANT OF A VERY STRONG UPPER 
LEVEL JET (GREATER THAN 150 KNOTS).  WOULD BE SURPRISED IF WE DO NOT 
NEED A WIND ADVISORY (AT LEAST) FOR HIGHER TERRAIN AREAS THURSDAY 
AFTERNOON AND EVENING...AS BOTH THE ETA AND GFS ADVERTISE THE LOW 
LEVEL JET REACHING 50 KNOTS OR BETTER.  

IF ANY BREAKS IN THE CLOUDS OCCUR...OR IF THE SHOWERS ARE A LITTLE 
LATER TO ARRIVE...THEN WE COULD EASILY REACH OR JUST EXCEED THE 
WARMER ETA MOS HIGH TEMPS THU.  OTHERWISE...OTHER CHANGES MADE WERE 
MAINLY TO SLIGHTLY RAISE TEMPS (MAX AND MIN) FROM FRIDAY THRU SAT 
NIGHT.  THIS WAS DUE TO LESS COLD AIR ADVECTION THAN EARLIER EXPECTED
...WITH BRUNT OF COLD AIR STAYING TO OUR NORTH OVER THE OHIO VALLEY 
AND GREAT LAKES REGION.  THE UPPER LEVEL FLOW LOOKS TO RETURN TO A 
ZONAL PATTERN AFTER PASSAGE OF THIS STRONG SHORTWAVE AND FRONT.  I 
DID NOT RAISE TEMPS OVER THE WEEKEND UP TO THE NEW MOS VALUES JUST 
YET...PREFERRING TO LET DAY SHIFT ADD SOME DEGREES IF THIS STILL 
LOOKS TO BE THE CASE.  ALSO...DID NOT WANT TO EXCEED TEMPERATURE 
TOLERANCES WITH NEIGHBORING OFFICES GRIDS.   

&&

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
239 PM EST TUE JAN 11 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WED)...EXITING SHORTWAVE MAY KEEP SOME 
SHOWERS IN THE AREA EARLY TONIGHT...ESPECIALLY NORTH.  WILL GO WITH 
CHANCE POPS NORTH AND SLIGHT CHANCE SOUTH FOR BEFORE MIDNIGHT 
SHOWERS.  THINK THUNDER CHANCES WILL HAVE DIMINISHED BY THEN...SO NO 
PLANS TO MENTION THUNDER FOR TONIGHT.  BIGGEST QUESTION FOR TOMORROW 
IS HOW MUCH CLOUD COVER...AND THUS HOW HIGH WILL THE TEMPS GET.  MET 
NUMBERS ARE RECORD VALUES FOR BOTH CHA AND TRI...AND EVEN THE MORE 
CONSERVATIVE MAV HAS A RECORD FOR TRI.  THINK THERE WILL BE QUITE A 
BIT OF CLOUDINESS AROUND...BUT PERHAPS A BIT LESS DURING THE 
AFTERNOON.  FOR NOW PLAN TO GO CLOSE TO MAV NUMBERS FOR LOWS TONIGHT 
AND SLIGHTLY ABOVE FOR HIGHS TOMORROW...BUT WOULD NOT BE TOO 
SURPRISED IF WE SEE TEMPS A FEW DEGREES HIGHER TOMORROW AFTERNOON.  

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...MOISTURE INCREASES 
AHEAD OF A STRONG COLD FRONT WEDNESDAY NIGHT...BUT THINK PRECIP WILL 
HOLD OFF UNTIL THURSDAY.  WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE POPS FOR LATE 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  SHOULD BE BREEZY IN THE HIGHER ELEVATIONS 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY WITH MODELS INDICATING 50-60KT AT 850MB 
AHEAD OF FRONT.  THE COLD FRONT IS ALSO MOVING A BIT QUICKER THAN 
PREVIOUS RUNS...WILL GO FOR LIKELY POPS BEGINNING THURSDAY MORNING 
AND CONTINUING THROUGH THE AFTERNOON.  SHOULD BE A LITTLE DRIER ON 
THURSDAY NIGHT...WITH BEST CHANCES IN THE EARLY EVENING...THEN 
DECREASING POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT AS DRIER AIR WORKS ITS WAY IN BEHIND 
THE FRONT.  MOST OF THE AREA SHOULD BE DRY BY FRIDAY...BUT KEPT 
SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE MOUNTAINS ON FRIDAY MORNING.  DRY WEATHER 
SHOULD CONTINUE INTO TUESDAY.  COOLER WEATHER EXPECTED TO PUSH IN 
BEHIND THE FRONT...BRINGING A RETURN TO MORE SEASONAL TEMPERATURES.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 110817
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 AM EST TUE JAN 11 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SHORTWAVE TROUGH STILL PROJECTED 
TO MOVE THROUGH THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS BY MID DAY TODAY. MOISTURE 
PROFILE NOT VERY IMPRESSIVE AND LIFT IS ONLY MODERATE WITH THIS 
FEATURE PER MODEL TIME HEIGHTS. THUS...DO NOT ANTICIPATE SIGNIFICANT 
RAIN EVENT ALTHOUGH COVERAGE COULD APPROACH LIKELY CATEGORY 
ESPECIALLY IN THE NORTHERN TIER. THIS SYSTEM MOVES OUT BY 06Z 
WEDNESDAY. HOWEVER...LOW-LEVEL MOISTURE LINGERS SUGGESTING SKY 
CONDITIONS WILL REMAIN GENERALLY CLOUDY THROUGH THE SECOND PERIOD. 
TEMPS REMAIN WELL ABOVE CLIMO AS UPPER RIDGE RE-AMPLIFIES OVER THE 
SOUTHEAST. GENERALLY STAYED CLOSE TO BLEND OF GUIDANCE VALUES.


.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY THROUGH MONDAY)...WARM FRONT LIFTS WELL 
NORTH OF THE REGION WEDNESDAY...AND WE EXPECT A BREAK IN THE RAIN 
UNTIL STRONGER SHORTWAVE AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT APPROACH LATE 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  THUS...LOW POPS WERE REMOVED FOR WEDNESDAY 
MORNING.  MOST OPERATIONAL MODELS (EXCEPT ECMWF) AND ENSEMBLES 
SUPPORT A FAST TROUGH AND COLD FRONTAL PASSAGE THURSDAY NIGHT.  THIS 
LEAVES VERY LITTLE CHANCE OF SHOWERS AFTER 12Z FRIDAY...SO POPS WERE 
REMOVED FOR ALL BUT THE EXTREME ERN AREAS FRIDAY MORNING (WITH JUST 
20 PERCENT THOSE AREAS).  NO ADDITION OF THUNDERSTORMS FOR THURSDAY 
AT THIS POINT...BUT WILL RE-EVALUATE THIS AGAIN AS THURSDAY DRAWS 
CLOSER.  THE MOISTURE AND LIFT EXIT THE REGION WELL AHEAD OF THE 
ARRIVAL OF COLD AIR AND BELOW ZERO DEGREE C 850 MB TEMPERATURES ON 
FRIDAY...SO NO THREAT OF ANY WINTRY PCPN WITH THIS SYSTEM.  

FOR TEMPERATURES...MORE PLEASANT AND UNSEASONABLY MILD TEMPS IN THE 
PICTURE UNTIL THE FROPA ON FRIDAY MORNING.  MOS MAX TEMPS GENERALLY 
IN THE 60S WEDNESDAY LOOKED GOOD...FOLLOWED BY VERY MILD LOWS MOSTLY 
IN THE 50S WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  THURSDAY MAX TEMPS MORE CHALLENGING...
GIVEN THE ETA MOS MID 60S TO LOWER 70S VERSUSES THE MUCH COOLER 
MAV/GFS MOS HIGHS.  CONSIDERING THAT BOTH THE ETA AND GFS SUPPORT 
THE FAST TRACK...AND BRING IN MUCH CLOUDINESS AND NUMEROUS SHOWERS 
EARLY THURSDAY...I STAYED MUCH CLOSER TO THE COOLER MAV/GFS HIGHS 
FOR THURSDAY.  

OTHERWISE...NO CHANGES CONSIDERED OR MADE BEYOND FRIDAY FOR NOW.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
230 PM EST MON JAN 10 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND TOMORROW)...LOW CLOUDS HAVE BROKEN UP 
ACROSS THE AREA...BUT HIGH CLOUDS STREAMING IN IN THE ZONAL FLOW.  
MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT THAT SOME SHORT WAVE ENERGY WILL SWING 
ACROSS THE AREA TOMORROW.  INCREASING MOISTURE TONIGHT SHOULD LEAD 
TO A MOSTLY CLOUDY TO CLOUDY SKY BY DAYBREAK...BUT LOOKS LIKE BETTER 
LIFT WILL HOLD OFF UNTIL TOMORROW.  WILL GO WITH CHANCE POPS ALL 
ZONES FOR TOMORROW...WITH HIGHEST POPS IN THE AFTERNOON.  MAV TEMPS 
GENERALLY LOOK REASONABLE...SO ONLY MINOR ADJUSTMENTS.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SHORTWAVE LIFTS 
THROUGH THE REGION TUESDAY NIGHT...BEST CHANCES SHOULD BE IN THE 
EVENING HOURS BEFORE THE DEEP MOISTURE ADVECTS NORTH OF THE CWA.  
MOISTURE LINGERS ACROSS THE AREA ON WEDNESDAY...NOT MUCH OF A 
TRIGGER...SO KEPT ONLY 20 POPS.  STRONG COLD FRONT ENTERING REGION 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WENT WITH 30 POPS FOR LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AHEAD 
OF FRONT...BUT BEST CHANCES STILL EXPECTED ON THURSDAY AFTERNOON 
WITH FROPA.  WILL NOT MENTION THUNDER WITH THE POSITIVE LIS 
EXPECTED.  50KT LOW LEVEL JET SHOULD PROVIDE BREEZY CONDITIONS IN 
THE MOUNTAINS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY.  KEPT LIKELY POPS GOING 
INTO THURSDAY EVENING FOR THE MOUNTAINS AND OUR NORTHERN ZONES...AND 
CHANCE POPS ELSEWHERE...THEN DECREASING POPS AFTER MIDNIGHT AS DRIER 
AIR WORKS ITS WAY IN BEHIND THE FRONT.  FRONT THROUGH THE AREA EARLY 
FRIDAY...KEPT CHANCE POPS FOR THE MOUNTAINS AND SLIGHT CHANCE POPS 
ELSEWHERE FOR THE MORNING HOURS.  SHOULD BE DRY BY FRIDAY AFTERNOON 
AS COOLER AND DRY WEATHER MOVES IN.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS ACROSS THE 
REGION WHICH SHOULD KEEP THE DRY WEATHER IN PLACE FOR SATURDAY 
THROUGH MONDAY.  ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES STILL EXPECTED WEDNESDAY 
AND THURSDAY...BUT THEY SHOULD FALL TO MORE SEASONAL LEVELS OVER THE 
WEEKEND AS COOLER AIR PUSHES IN.
