AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
433 AM EST MON JAN 10 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ZONAL UPPER LEVEL FLOW 
DOMINATING AND KEEPING FORECAST DRY...BUT CERTAINLY NOT FREE OF 
CLOUDINESS THIS MORNING.  LOW LEVEL CLOUDINESS REDEVELOPED (OR 
ADVECTED EASTWARD) OVER MIDDLE TN AROUND 02-03Z...AND HAS BEEN 
CREEPING SLOWLY EASTWARD ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU INTO PARTS OF 
THE TN VALLEY AND SE KY OVERNIGHT.  THE INCREASING CLOUDS AND SW 
WINDS IN A FEW SPOTS HAS RESULTED IN QUITE A VARIABLE AND COMPLEX 
TEMPERATURE PATTERN THIS MORNING.  THIS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE SHOULD BE 
SHALLOW AND PERHAPS JUST A PASSING FEATURE FOR THE TN VALLEY 
EASTWARD TODAY...BUT I EXPECT CLOUDINESS TO BE MORE PERSISTENT FROM 
THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU WESTWARD TODAY.  SKY GRIDS WERE ADJUSTED UP 
THIS MORNING...THEN A SLIGHT DECREASE ALL BUT WESTERN AREAS THIS 
AFTERNOON. 

.SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...ZONAL UPPER LEVEL FLOW DOMINATING 
AND KEEPING FORECAST DRY...BUT CERTAINLY NOT FREE OF CLOUDINESS THIS 
MORNING.  LOW LEVEL CLOUDINESS REDEVELOPED (OR ADVECTED EASTWARD) 
OVER MIDDLE TN AROUND 02-03Z...AND HAS BEEN CREEPING SLOWLY EASTWARD 
ACROSS THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU INTO PARTS OF THE TN VALLEY AND SE KY 
OVERNIGHT.  THE INCREASING CLOUDS AND SW WINDS IN A FEW SPOTS HAS 
RESULTED IN QUITE A VARIABLE AND COMPLEX TEMPERATURE PATTERN THIS 
MORNING.  THIS LOW LEVEL MOISTURE SHOULD BE SHALLOW AND PERHAPS JUST 
A PASSING FEATURE FOR THE TN VALLEY EASTWARD TODAY...BUT I EXPECT 
CLOUDINESS TO BE MORE PERSISTENT FROM THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU 
WESTWARD TODAY.  SKY GRIDS WERE ADJUSTED UP THIS MORNING...THEN A 
SLIGHT DECREASE ALL BUT WESTERN AREAS THIS AFTERNOON.  

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SUNDAY)...WEAK FRONT THAT IS 
APPROACHING THE OHIO RIVER THIS MORNING DROPS TO JUST NORTH OF THE 
FORECAST AREA TUESDAY AND THEN LIFTS NORTH AS A WARM FRONT. BOTH ETA 
AND GFS SWING A SHORTWAVE FROM THE MS VALLEY ABOUT 12Z TOMORROW 
ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY DURING THE DAY AND EARLY EVENING. THE 
ETA ONLY PRODUCES SLIGHT QPF WITH THE BEST LIFT ALONG THE TN/KY 
BORDER NEAR FRONTAL BOUNDARY. KEPT THE POPS ABOUT THE SAME BETWEEN 
ETA AND GFS WITH THE BEST CHANCE NORTH CLOSER TO BOUNDARY. CLOSED 
UPPER LOW MOVING INTO SOUTHWEST DEEPENS THE TROUGH OUT WEST AND A 
SURFACE LOW OVER THE ROCKIES INTENSIFIES AS IT MOVES INTO THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS WEDNESDAY. INCREASING SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW WILL BRING 
LOW TEMPERATURES UP SEVERAL DEGREES TUESDAY NIGHT AND EVEN WITH 
CLOUD COVER WARM TEMPERATURES A FEW MORE DEGREES FROM THE MID 60S 
TUESDAY. SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONT WILL MOVE ACROSS TN THURSDAY. A LINE 
OF SHOWERS AND POSSIBLY A FEW THUNDERSTORMS WILL LIKELY FORM AHEAD 
OF THE FRONT DUE TO THE STRONG LOW LEVEL MOISTURE ADVECTION...STRONG 
LIFT AND INCREASED SHEAR TO THE WEST OF THE FORECAST AREA IN WEST OR 
MIDDLE TN BUT NOT SURE IF THERE IS ENOUGH INSTABILITY FARTHER EAST 
AS THE CONVECTION MOVES INTO EAST TN. HAVE NOT ADDED THUNDER TO 
THURSDAYS WEATHER BUT LATER SHIFTS MAY NEED TOO AS THE TIMING AND 
INTENSITY OF THE SYSTEM BECOMES CLEARER. INCREASED POPS SLIGHTLY 
THURSDAY. BIG COOL DOWN STILL LOOKS LIKELY BEHIND THE FRONT FRIDAY 
BUT MOISTURE SHOULD BE OUT OF THE FORECAST AREA BEFORE A CHANGEOVER 
TO FROZEN PRECIPITATION COULD OCCUR. ARCTIC HIGH WITH ORIGINS IN 
NORTHWEST CANADA SETTLES OVER AREA FOR A DRY AND COLD WEEKEND. MOST 
OF THE AREA WILL SEE HIGHS IN THE 30S AND LOWS IN THE TEENS AND 
20S...BACK TO WINTER.           

&&

CHALLENGED.

30 POPS FOR LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AHEAD OF FRONT.  BEST CHANCES STILL 
ON THURSDAY AFTERNOON WITH FROPA.  KEPT CHANCE POPS INTO THURSDAY 
NIGHT WITH BEST CHANCES EARLY...AND DRY WEATHER WORKING ITS WAY IN 
BEHIND THE FRONT LATE THURSDAY NIGHT.  FRONT THROUGH THE AREA EARLY 
FRIDAY...KEPT SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR THE MOUNTAINS AND OUR NORTHERN 
ZONES ON FRIDAY MORNING AND DRY ELSEWHERE.  HIGH PRESSURE BUILDS IN 
BRINGING COOLER AND DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY.  ABOVE 
NORMAL TEMPERATURES STILL EXPECTED WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY...BUT 
TEMPERATURES SHOULD FALL TO MORE SEASONAL LEVELS INTO THE WEEKEND AS 
COOLER AIR PUSHES IN BEHIND THE FRONT.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 090947
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
445 AM EST SUN JAN 9 2005

.DISCUSSION...SKIES ARE MOSTLY CLEAR ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THIS 
MORNING WITH SOME LOW CLOUD COVER OVER MAINLY THE WESTERN 
COUNTIES...THE CUMBERLAND PLATEAU COUNTIES. SOME PATCHY FOG AND LOW 
CLOUDS ARE OVER PARTS OF THE CENTRAL VALLEY...SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND 
SOUTHWEST NORTH CAROLINA. THE LOW CLOUDS ON THE WESTERN BORDER 
EXTEND WEST TO CENTRAL ARKANSAS AND SOUTHWEST ACROSS NORTHERN AL AND 
INTO CENTRAL MS. THESE LOW CLOUDS HAVE REMAINED IN THE SAME SPOT ALL 
NIGHT AND ON SOUNDINGS SHOW UP BELOW ABOUT 900MB. SKIES SHOULD 
BECOME MOSTLY SUNNY ACROSS THE PLATEAU BY LATE MORNING AS THE LOW 
LEVEL MOISTURE MIXES OUT. DROPPED HIGH TEMPERATURES A FEW DEGREES 
FROM PREVIOUS PACKAGE BASED ON COOLER START THIS MORNING WITH A 
LITTLE MORE COLD AIR ADVECTION BEHIND SATURDAYS FRONT.

HIGH PRESSURE NOW LIES OVER THE SOUTHEAST AND SOUTH CENTRAL STATES 
WITH ZONAL FLOW ALOFT THROUGH MONDAY. A NEW SURFACE LOW IS EXPECTED 
TO DEVELOP OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS TUESDAY AND BRING MOISTURE NORTH 
AS A WARM FRONT INCREASING ISENTROPIC LIFT AND THE CHANCE OF LIGHT 
RAIN MAINLY TUESDAY AND TUESDAY EVENING AS A SHORTWAVE MOVES EAST. 
THE LOW PRESSURE AREA MOVES NORTHEAST INTO THE OHIO VALLEY AND TAKES 
THE HEAVIER PRECIPITATION NORTH OF THE FORECAST AREA WEDNESDAY. THEN 
COLD FRONT FORMS WEDNESDAY OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS AS WESTERN UPPER 
TROUGH DIGS SOUTH. THIS SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONT SHOULD MOVE ACROSS THE
SOUTHERN PLAINS AND INTO THE LOWER MS VALLEY WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND 
THROUGH TN THURSDAY AFTERNOON AND EVENING WITH THE POSSIBILITY OF 
CONVECTIVE ACTIVITY. A SIGNIFICANT COOL DOWN IS EXPECTED WITH THIS 
FRONT DROPPING TEMPERATURES FROM THE 60S THURSDAY TO 40S FRIDAY AND 
EVEN COLDER SATURDAY. 

TEMPERATURES MONDAY MORNING SHOULD BE A FEW DEGREES WARMER THAN 
TODAY AS SOUTHWEST FLOW BEGINS AS HIGH PRESSURE BEGINS TO SHIFT 
EAST. CROSS SECTION DATA INDICATES LOW LEVEL MOISTURE AND LIGHT 
WINDS CONDUCIVE TO MORE EARLY MORNING FOG. TEMPERATURES MONDAY 
SHOULD WARM A FEW DEGREES ABOVE TODAYS WITH SOUTHWEST WINDS WITH 
LOWS MONDAY NIGHT SEVERAL DEGREES WARMER AS CLOUDS INCREASE. 
TEMPERATURES TUESDAY LOOK TO BE A DEGREE OR TOO WARMER THAN MONDAY 
AS SOUTHERLY FLOW INCREASES AND WARM FRONT PASSAGE. FOLLOWED A 
MAV/ETA BLEND FOR POPS WITH BEST CHANCE AFTERNOON AND EVENING. NO 
CHANGES TOO LATER PERIODS OF THE FORECAST.

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
254 PM EST SAT JAN  8 2005

.SHORT TERM...COLD FRONT SLOWED DOWN SOME E OF THE AREA THIS 
AFTERNOON. VERY EFFECTIVE DOWNSLOPE FLOW OFF CUMBERLAND PLATEAU HAS 
RESULTED IN GOOD CLEARING AND WARMING ACROSS VALLEY LOCATIONS. 
TEMPERATURES ARE HOLDING STEADY OR RISING SOME BUT DPS ARE STARTING 
TO DROP. LARGE CLOUD FIELD ON W SIDE OF PLATEAU MAKES OVERNIGHT 
SKIES WORRISOME. HOWEVER SOME MIXING WILL CONTINUE THIS EVENING AS 
LAYER CONTINUES TO DRY OUT. FCST SOUNDING DO NOT SHOW A STRONG CAP 
SO WILL STAY WITH PARTLY CLOUDY WORDING. WINDS DECOUPLE LATER AND 
EXPECT GOOD TEMP FALL. SHALLOW COOLED INVERSION SETS UP AND DESPITE 
GOOD T/TD SPREADS IN MOS DATA RECENT RAINS WILL LIKELY RESULT IN 
PATCHY FOG DEVELOPMENT. SUNDAY WITH PLENTY OF SUNSHINE WILL AGAIN 
SEE TEMPS WELL ABOVE NORMAL. A RELATIVELY FLAT WAVE MOVES ACROSS N 
PART OF CWA SUN NGT SUPPRESSING THE SFC RIDGE SOUTHWARD. MOISTURE IS 
LIMITED BUT A BIT OF CAA ADVECTION OCCURS WITH THE WAVE PASSAGE 
EARLY MON MORN. GOOD WARM UP FOR MONDAY WITH TEMPS NEARLY 20 DEGREES 
ABOVE NORMAL. LAYER FLOW INCREASINGLY SW MON NGT CONTINUING WARM 
TREND.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY THROUGH SATURDAY)...A WARM FRONT PUSHES 
THROUGH THE AREA ON TUESDAY...DECENT MOISTURE AVAILABLE...SO WENT 
WITH CHANCE POPS FOR TUESDAY.  SOME MOISTURE LINGERS INTO THE MIDDLE 
OF THE WEEK...BUT NOT MUCH OF A TRIGGER...SO KEPT ONLY 20 POPS FOR 
TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY.  STRONG COLD FRONT ENTERING REGION 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT...WENT WITH 30 POPS FOR LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  BEST 
CHANCES STILL ON THURSDAY WITH FROPA...WILL ALSO KEEP CHANCE POPS 
INTO THURSDAY NIGHT.  COOLER AND DRY WEATHER RETURNS ON FRIDAY... 
WILL KEEP LOW CHANCE POPS FOR THE MORNING HOURS ON FRIDAY.  HIGH 
PRESSURE BUILDS IN BRINGING COOLER AND DRY WEATHER FOR FRIDAY NIGHT 
AND SATURDAY.  ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES STILL EXPECTED TUESDAY 
THROUGH THURSDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 080854
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
353 AM EST SAT JAN 8 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...SURFACE LOW HAS TRACKED FROM 
CENTRAL MS NE INTO AND THRU MIDDLE TN OVERNIGHT...TO CURRENT 
LOCATION OVER NE KY.  THE ASSOCIATED WARM FRONT WAS ABLE TO PUSH 
JUST INTO SE TN...WITH COLD FRONT HAVING JUST MOVED EAST OF A BNA TO 
HSV LINE.  THERE WAS A VERY BRIEF TSRA AT CHA AIRPORT...BUT OVERALL 
THE COVERAGE AND INTENSITY OF SHOWERS HAS BEEN ON THE DECLINE DURING 
THE WEE HOURS OF THE MORNING.  HAD TO DRAW POP/WX GRIDS TO MATCH 
LATEST RADARS...AS WELL AS MESH WITH NEIGHBORS GRIDS.  THUS...MAY 
VERY WELL HAVE TO UPDATE THE GRIDS AND ZFP AROUND DAYBREAK IF THE 
SHOWERS CONTINUE TO MOVE RAPIDLY EAST AND DIMINISH.

MODELS INDICATED THE STRONGEST LOW LEVEL JET UP TO AROUND 09Z THEN 
DIMINISHING AS THE LOW PRESSURE SYSTEM MOVES QUICKLY NE AWAY FROM 
OUR REGION.  USING OUR MESONET OF FIRE WX AND SCHOOL SITES...WE 
FOUND ONLY A FEW HIGHER SPOTS GUSTING UP TO 24 MPH...AND MOST 
LOCATIONS BARELY IN THE 10 TO 20 MPH RANGE SUSTAINED.  THUS...WE 
FELT IT WAS PRUDENT TO CANCEL THE LAKE WIND ADVISORY FOR OUR E TN 
MTNS AND CHEROKEE/CLAY COUNTIES JUST BEFORE THE ZONE ISSUANCE.

THE SHORTWAVE TROUGH IS A BIT SHARPER/DEEPER THAN EARLIER THOUGHT 
AND SOME COLD AIR ADVECTION IS POSSIBLE THIS AFTERNOON.  HOWEVER...
THERE IS ALSO THE POTENTIAL FOR SOME CLEARING FROM THE WEST THIS 
AFTERNOON (AS WELL AS WEAK DOWNSLOPE LOW LEVEL WINDS).  SO...OPTED 
FOR A DEGREE OR TWO ABOVE THE COOLER GFS/MAV MOS MAX TEMPS TODAY.

FOR TONIGHT...NEW MOS AND 08/00Z MODELS INDICATED CLEARING SKIES AND 
A LITTLE COOLER MIN TEMPS THAN PREVIOUS FORECAST.  GRIDS WERE 
ADJUSTED IN THIS DIRECTION...BUT NOT AS COLD AS THE GFS/MAV MOS JUST 
YET.  

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH FRIDAY)...ZONAL FLOW WITH SURFACE HIGH 
OVER THE SOUTH CENTRAL AND SOUTHEAST STATES AND RIDGING ALOFT WILL 
PREVAIL SUNDAY AND MOST OF MONDAY. THIS WILL KEEP THE TENNESSEE 
VALLEY AND THE SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS MILD WITH HIGHS IN THE 60S AND 
LOWS IN THE MID 30S TO MID 40S. MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY FLOW 
BECOMES MORE SOUTHWEST AS CLOSED UPPER LOW MOVES INTO CA AND SURFACE 
LOW DEVELOPS ACROSS THE SOUTHERN PLAINS INCREASING MOISTURE OVER THE 
MS VALLEY AND INTO THE TN VALLEY. A WARM FRONT LIFTS ACROSS THE AREA 
TUESDAY WITH ENOUGH MOISTURE FOR A CHANCE OF LIGHT RAIN POSSIBLY 
LINGERING INTO WEDNESDAY BUT. NEXT SIGNIFICANT COLD FRONT DUE TO 
ARRIVE THURSDAY NIGHT WHICH SHOULD DROP TEMPERATURES FINALLY DOWN TO 
MORE NORMAL TEMPERATURES ON FRIDAY.         
&&

.SHORT TERM...(THIS WEEKEND)...WARM TEMPERATURES TO CONTINUE THROUGH

LOW LEVEL RIDGE FAIRLY SHALLOW WITH GOOD ISENTROPIC LIFT OCCURRING
FROM AROUND 2500 FEET AND UPWARD. INITIAL BOUNDARY OF LIFT HAS 
STALLED OVER NORTH HALF OF CWA RESULTING IN FAIRLY PERSISTENT LIGHT 
RAIN. SHORT WAVE MOVES NE THROUGH THE OH RVR VLY TONIGHT WITH AXIS 
MOVING THROUGH MRX CWA AROUND 08/15Z. STRONG S-SW FLOW PUMPS 
ABUNDANT MOISTURE ACROSS AREA WITH VERY GOOD UPR SUPPORT. WIDESPREAD 
PRECIPITATION EXPECTED OVERNIGHT. NORTHERN PLATEAU MAY RECEIVE 
AROUND 1.25 INCHES OVERNIGHT WITH MOST AREAS GETTING AT LEAST A HALF 
INCH. PRECIP SHOULD TAPER OFF BY MID MORNING SAT. UPR FLOW BECOMES

THE AREA ON MONDAY...BUT THINK RIDGE SHOULD HOLD ENOUGH TO KEEP

FOR MONDAY NIGHT AND TUESDAY.  SOME MOISTURE LINGERS INTO THE MIDDLE 
OF THE WEEK...BUT NOT MUCH OF A TRIGGER...ONLY KEPT 20 POPS FOR

THURSDAY NIGHT.  FRONT SHOULD BE EAST OF OUR AREA BY FRIDAY 
AFTERNOON...WILL CARRY LOW CHANCE POPS FOR ONLY THE MORNING HOURS ON 
FRIDAY.  TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO BE ABOVE NORMAL MOST OF THE 
WEEK...BUT DRY AND MORE SEASONAL TEMPERATURES RETURN AFTER FROPA ON 
FRIDAY.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 070850
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
350 AM EST FRI JAN  7 2005

.SHORT TERM....SHORT TERM (TODAY AND TONIGHT)...LOTS OF MID AND HIGH 
CLOUDS ALREADY STREAMING NE...WELL IN ADVANCE OF THE SHORTWAVE 
EXPECTED TO MOVE EAST FROM THE CENTRAL ROCKIES LATER TODAY.  THESE 
CLOUDS HAVE INHIBITED RADIATION FOG FROM DEVELOPING THIS 
MORNING...SO I OPTED FOR NO MENTION OF FOG IN TODAYS WEATHER 
GRIDS.  SOME QUESTION IN MY MIND AS TO HOW FAST RAIN ACTUALLY 
DEVELOPS LATER TODAY...WITH NGM SLOWEST TO PRODUCE LIGHT RAIN.  FOR 
CONSISTENCY AND TO MESH WITH NEIGHBORS GRIDS...I CHOSE TO STAY THE 
ETA/GFS COURSE IN BRINGING LIKELY OR HIGHER POPS EVERYWHERE BY LATE 
AFTERNOON TODAY.  THE ISENTROPIC LIFT AND SATURATION OF THE AIRMASS 
DOES SEEM TO JUSTIFY THE HIGHER MOS POPS FOR THE FIRST PERIOD.  GFS 
MOS HIGHS LOOKED BETTER THAN THE WARMER ETA VALUES.

FOR TONIGHT...LOOKS LIKE A WIDESPREAD LIGHT TO MODERATE RAIN EVENT...
WITH HIGHEST POPS ROUGHLY FROM 00Z TO 06Z...SO POPS WERE NUDGED UP 
TO 100 PERCENT ACROSS THE BOARD AT THAT TIME.  ALSO...LOWERED QPF 
GRID FROM 06Z TO 12Z AS LIFT AND MOISTURE WILL BE DIMINISHING BY 
THAT TIME.  A BLEND OF ETA/GFS MOS FOR MIN TEMP FORECAST LOOKED 
BETTER THAN GOING RIGHT WITH THE COOLER GFS LOWS.  

.LONG TERM...(SATURDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...COLD FRONT WILL HAVE 
PASSED THROUGH THE FORECAST AREA BY SATURDAY AT 12Z WITH RAIN 
QUICKLY COMING TO AN END. BOTH ETA/GFS END THE RAIN AROUND 12Z SO 
POPS ARE A LITTLE HIGHER THAN ETA GUIDANCE DUE TO THE RAIN ENDING IN 
THE MORNING. ETA WANTS TO HOLD ONTO LOW LEVEL MOISTURE SATURDAY WITH 
THE GFS CLEARING SKIES OUT DURING THE AFTERNOON. WITH WINDS STAYING 
WEST TO SOUTHWEST BEHIND FRONT NO COLD AIR ADVECTION AND ACTUALLY 
WARMER TEMPERATURES. ODDLY ETA HAS TEMPERATURES SEVERAL DEGREES 
WARMER EVEN WITH CLOUDS SATURDAY. PREFER THE COOLER MAV NUMBERS 
SATURDAY AND USED A BLEND SATURDAY NIGHT. OVERALL UPPER AIR PATTERN 
REMAINS UNCHANGED WITH TROUGH IN THE WEST AND RIDGING SOUTHEAST 
WHICH KEEPS THE FORECAST AREA IN A MILD SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT. ETA 
TRIES TO SHOW ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE MOVING THROUGH SUNDAY TO GIVE A 
SLIGHT CHANCE OF RAIN AND CONSIDERABLE CLOUDS BUT STAYED WITH THE 
DRY AND SUNNIER GFS. ANOTHER WEAK SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER THE LOWER MS 
VALLEY MONDAY...THEN MOVES NORTHEAST INTO THE OHIO VALLEY TUESDAY 
AND STRENGTHENS. A STRONGER SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER THE SOUTHERN PLAINS 
WEDNESDAY AND BRINGS A MORE SIGNIFICANT CHANCE OF RAIN TO THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THURSDAY.   
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A COLD FRONT GENERALLY ALONG THE 
EASTERN FOOTHILLS OF THE APPALACHIANS WITH HIGH PRESSURE OVER THE 
LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY BUILDING ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA. SATELLITE 
IMAGES REVEAL AN EXTENSIVE AREA OF CLOUDS ACROSS THE SOUTHEAST WITH 
SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW CONTINUING TO ADVECT ADDITIONAL CLOUDS FROM THE 
SOUTHERN PLAINS. THUS...DONT THINK SKIES WILL BECOME PARTLY CLOUDY 
OVERNIGHT...AND WILL PLAN TO UPDATE THIS EVENING TO MENTION MOSTLY 
CLOUDY SKIES OVERNIGHT. ALSO...WILL MENTION PATCHY FOG SINCE WINDS 
SHOULD DECOUPLE OVERNIGHT IN THE VALLEYS...BUT DONT THINK FOG WILL 
BECOME TOO DENSE OR WIDESPREAD WITH THE EXPECTED CLOUD COVER. TEMPS 
APPEAR TO BE GENERALLY ON TRACK AND WILL NOT PLAN TO CHANGE MUCH.

UPR JET. MIN TEMP FORECAST TRICKY TONIGHT. SURFACE RIDGE OF HIGH 
PRESSURE CONTAINING A VERY COLD AIRMASS IS CURRENTLY W OF MS RVR AND 
PROGGED TO SLIDE TO OVR E KY BY FRI MORNING. CURRENTLY NOT EXPECTING 
SHALLOW COLD POOL TO ADVECT THIS FAR EAST AS PRESSURE PATTERN 
TRANSITIONS OVERNIGHT. TEMP PROBLEMS CONTINUE ON FRI WITH VERY 
LITTLE MIXING IN THE LOWER LAYERS AND INCREASED CLOUD COVER AS SHORT 
WAVE MOVES INTO MID MS RVR VLY WITH GOOD MOIST WAA ACROSS TN RVR 
VLY. LEANED TOWARD THE WARMER ETA EXCEPT IN THE NE SINCE ALL MODELS 
SHOW GOOD RETURN FLOW BY FRI AFTN. INCREASED PCPN CHC BY FRI AFTN 
WITH GOOD ISENTROPIC LIFT ESPECIALLY ACROSS SW AREAS. SHORT WAVE 
MOVES NE THROUGH OH RVR VLY FRI NGT AS DEVELOPING SFC TROUGH MOVES 
NE ACROSS E TN. VERY GOOD UPR SUPPORT FRI NGT AS PWS JUMP BACK UP 
ABOVE 1.00. WIDESPREAD PCPN EXPECTED. TIMING OF CAA AND PCPN END A 
PROBLEM FOR SAT ANTICIPATING PCPN LINGERING IN THE MORNING AND CAA 
NOT UNDERWAY UNTIL SAT AFTN. SO LIKE TODAY WARM MORNING AND COOL 
AFTN. SAT NGT LAYER DRIES OUT AS RIDGING BUILDS BACK IN.    


.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY THROUGH THURSDAY)...HIGH PRESSURE IN PLACE 
SUNDAY...PROVIDING DRY WEATHER FOR SUNDAY AND MONDAY.  A WEAK 
SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH THE AREA ON TUESDAY...THINK RIDGE WILL   
HOLD AND KEEP BEST MOISTURE TO THE NORTH OF OUR CWA...SO WILL    
KEEP TUESDAY DRY FOR NOW.  A LITTLE BETTER MOISTURE RETURNS FOR 
WEDNESDAY...WILL KEEP THE SLIGHT CHANCE POPS GOING.  A IS FRONT 
EXPECTED ON THURSDAY...BRINGING ADEQUATE MOISTURE AND LIFT...WILL 
ADD CHANCE POPS FOR THURSDAY.  TEMPERATURES STILL EXPECTED TO BE 
ABOVE NORMAL THROUGH THE PERIOD.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 060757
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
257 AM EST THU JAN 6 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...PRECIP ASSOCIATED WITH A FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY IS APPROACHING THE CWA THIS MORNING.  THESE SHOWERS WILL 
SPREAD WEST TO EAST ACROSS THE AREA THROUGHOUT THE MORNING... 
LINGERING OVER WESTERN ZONES INTO THE AFTERNOON.  ADDITIONALLY... 
WINDS WILL INCREASE WITH THE FRONTAL PASSAGE.  LOCALLY GUSTY 
CONDITIONS WILL DEVELOP WITH THE STRONGEST WINDS EXPECTED OVER 
HIGHER TERRAIN.  A FEW ISOLATED SHOWERS MAY REMAIN OVER FAR 
NORTHWESTERN MOUNTAIN INTO THE EVENING HOURS...BUT THE MAIN SYSTEM 
WILL HAVE EXITED THE AREA AND WE WILL BE BETWEEN SYSTEMS FOR THE 
NIGHT.  BEHIND THE FRONT...COOLER TEMPS WILL BEGIN TO FILTER IN.  
TONIGHT/S LOWS ARE EXPECTED TO BE NEAR 10 TO 15 DEGREES COOLER THAN 
THIS MORNINGS READINGS.  
 
.LONG TERM...(FRI THROUGH WED)...MODELS GENERALLY AGREE THAT WE WILL 
HAVE A FAIRLY WET PERIOD FOR FRIDAY AFTERNOON AND FRIDAY NIGHT. A 
SHORT WAVE WILL MOVE FROM THE CENTRAL PLAINS THROUGH THE OHIO 
VALLEY...AND LOW LEVEL SOUTHWEST FLOW WILL BRING CONSIDERABLE 
MOISTURE.  UPPER DYNAMICS SHOULD BE AIDED BY A ROUND OF ISENTROPIC 
LIFT.  WILL GO LIKELY TO CATEGORICAL FOR POPS FRI AND CATEGORICAL 
ALL ZONES FRI NIGHT.  DRIER AIR IS EXPECTED TO BEGIN MOVING IN 
SATURDAY...SO WILL END POPS BY AFTERNOON.  DRY WEATHER SAT NIGHT 
INTO MONDAY AS SURFACE HIGH PRESSURE MOVES OVER AND THEN OFF TO OUR 
EAST...AND SHALLOW RIDGE BUILDS OVER THE AREA.  WILL GENERALLY LEAVE 
LATER PERIODS OF THE FORECAST AS THEY ARE FOR NOW.

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A BROAD AREA OF LOW PRESSURE ACROSS

ACROSS WEST TN. TEMPS ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA REMAIN UNSEASONABLY

AREA RADARS REVEAL THAT RAIN REMAINS CONFINED MOSTLY TO THE OHIO AND 
MISSISSIPPI RIVER VALLEYS...AND THAT THINK THE FORECAST AREA WILL 
REMAIN DRY UNTIL LATER TONIGHT TOWARDS SUNRISE. WILL PLAN TO UPDATE 
THE FORECAST THIS EVENING TO MENTION RAIN AFTER MIDNIGHT AND TO 
TWEAK TEMPS A LITTLE.

FXUS64 KMRX 051954
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
251 PM EST WED JAN  5 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY NIGHT)...ANOTHER WARM NIGHT IN 
STORE WITH MIN TEMPS AROUND 20 DEGREES ABOVE NORMAL. UPR LOW 
MOVES RAPIDLY NE TONIGHT FROM NEAR TOPEKA TO CHICAGO. SW-NE ALIGNED 
JET MAX STRENGTHENS ON SE SIDE OF LOW. THIS FEATURE PUMPS PLENTY OF 
MOISTURE ACROSS THE AREA AND PROVIDES SUFFICIENT LIFT FOR PCPN 
MAINLY ACROSS WESTERN AREA TONIGHT. THE JET AXIS MOVES INTO N PART 
OF CWA ON THU. A DRY SLOT PUSHES IN BEHIND THE JET SO EXPECT 
DECREASING PCPN DURING THE AFTN. SFC LOW DEEPENS TONIGHT AS IT MOVES 
FM NW TN TO ACROSS THE OH RVR VLY ON THU. THIS RESULTS IN AN 
INCREASED SW PRESSURE GRADIENT AT THE SFC. PREFER THE SLOWER ETA 
WHICH DEPICTS WARMER TEMPS IN THE MORNING AND DELAYS COOLING AND 
FRONTAL PASSAGE UNTIL THU AFTN. LOW LEVEL RIDGING AND DRYING UP TO 
600 MB BUILDS IN THU NGT. NEXT SHORT WAVE APPROACHES FM W ON FRI 
WITH STRENGTHENING MID/UPR JET IN ADVANCE OF THIS FEATURE. JET DRAWS 
ABUNDANT MOISTURE UP FM GLFMEX WITH PWS RISING TO ABOVE 1.2. PCPN 
PRODUCTION AIDED BY ISENTROPIC LIFT OVER SHALLOW LOW LEVEL RIDGE 
INITIALLY. FRI MAX TEMPS A PROBLEM WITH RELATIVELY COOL SHALLOW 
AIRMASS OVER AREA WITH WEAK FLOW AND BLANKETING BY ADVANCING CLOUD 
SHIELD. MOS NUMBERS DIFFER BY AS MUCH AS 10 DEGREES ESPECIALLY 
ACROSS THE SOUTHERN MRX CWA. LEANED TOWARD WARMER ETA VALUES. BRUNT 
OF PCPN EXPECTED FRI NGT AS TAIL OF UPR JET MOVES OFF TO THE NE AND 
BROAD DEVELOPING SFC MOVES INTO S APPALACHIANS.
 
.LONG TERM...(SAT THROUGH WED)...NO SIGNAL IN THE MODEL TRENDS OR 
ENSEMBLES THAT THE PERSISTENT LONGWAVE PATTERN OF TROUGH WEST/RIDGE 
EAST WILL DISSIPATE FOR THE FORESEEABLE FUTURE. ISENTROPIC EVENT 
ASSOCIATED WITH WEAK SHORT WAVE AND SURFACE LOW PRESSURE MOVES OUT 
DURING THE DAY ON SATURDAY. REMAINDER OF EXTENDED APPEARS DRY WITH 
THE EXCEPTION OF LATE IN THE PERIOD AS SOUTHEASTERN RIDGE AMPLIFIES 
AND DEFLECTS PRECIP TO ITS WESTERN AND NORTHERN PERIPHERY. DELAYED 
ONSET OF LATE EVENT BY APPROXIMATELY 12 HOURS FROM PREVIOUS FORECAST 
TO EARLY WEDNESDAY. ONLY WENT WITH SLIGHT CHANCE POPS FOR WEDNESDAY 
AS SURFACE COLD FRONT APPROACHES. BASE ON PERSISTENT RIDGING AND 
UNSEASONABLY HIGH HEIGHTS...ANTICIPATE TEMPS TO REMAIN WELL ABOVE 
CLIMO THROUGH THE PERIOD.

464 
FXUS64 KMRX 051205 AAA
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION...UPDATE
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
705 AM EST WED JAN  5 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AREAS OF DENSE FOG CONTINUE 
ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE MRX CWA EARLY THIS MORNING.  WILL CONTINUE 
THE DENSE FOG ADVISORY INTO MID MORNING FOR NORTHERN ZONES.  AN 
UPPER RIDGE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL OF AREA WEATHER TODAY FOR DRY AND 
CONTINUED SEASONALLY WARM CONDITIONS.  MODELS HAVE SOME 
DISCREPANCIES WITH THE TIMING OF A COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE REGION 
POSSIBLY AS SOON AS WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  PER SATELLITE...LIKE A SLOWER 
SOLUTION...BUT WILL ADJUST TIMING JUST A BIT FOR CHANCE POPS LATE 
TONIGHT.  LOCALLY BREEZY CONDITIONS WILL MOVE IN IN ADVANCE OF THE 
FRONT.  STRONGEST WINDS EXPECTED OVER NORTHERN PLATEAU AREA WITH 
GENERALLY 15 TO 25 MPH WIND SPEEDS POSSIBLE.  

.LONG TERM...(THU THROUGH TUE)...MODELS CONTINUE TO AGREE ON A WEAK 
FRONTAL PASSAGE THROUGH OUR AREA ON THU...ALTHOUGH GFS STILL A BIT 
FASTER THAN THE ETA.  THINK ETA TIMING LOOKS MOST REASONABLE...BUT 
EITHER WAY THE PRECIP SHOULD EXIT OUR AREA BY THU NIGHT.  DRY PERIOD 
WILL BE BRIEF HOWEVER...AS MOISTURE SURGES NORTH AGAIN ON FRIDAY.  
APPEARS THERE WILL BE DECENT ISENTROPIC LIFT OVERSPREADING THE AREA 
FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT...SO WILL GO HIGH CHANCE NORTH TO LIKELY 
SOUTH FRIDAY...THEN LIKELY POPS ALL ZONES FRIDAY NIGHT.  LATEST GFS 
IS TRYING TO DEVELOP A MORE SIGNIFICANT SURFACE WAVE ALONG THE FRONT 
THAT THEN PUSHES NORTHEAST OF OUR AREA BY LATE SATURDAY...ALLOWING 
DRIER AIR TO MOVE IN MORE QUICKLY.  WILL NOT JUMP ON THIS IDEA 
YET...BUT WILL TREND POPS DOWN A BIT FOR SUNDAY AND REMOVE PRECIP 
FOR SUNDAY NIGHT.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  69  53  55  34 /  10  40  50  10

OAK RIDGE, TN  65  50  55  33 /  10  40  50  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  64  50  54  30 /  10  40  60  10

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...AREAS OF DENSE FOG CONTINUE 
ACROSS PORTIONS OF THE MRX CWA EARLY THIS MORNING.  WILL CONTINUE 
THE DENSE FOG ADVISORY INTO MID MORNING FOR NORTHERN ZONES.  AN 
UPPER RIDGE WILL REMAIN IN CONTROL OF AREA WEATHER TODAY FOR DRY AND 
CONTINUED SEASONALLY WARM CONDITIONS.  MODELS HAVE SOME 
DISCREPANCIES WITH THE TIMING OF A COLD FRONT APPROACHING THE REGION 
POSSIBLY AS SOON AS WEDNESDAY NIGHT.  PER SATELLITE...LIKE A SLOWER 
SOLUTION...BUT WILL ADJUST TIMING JUST A BIT FOR CHANCE POPS LATE 
TONIGHT.  LOCALLY BREEZY CONDITIONS WILL MOVE IN IN ADVANCE OF THE 
FRONT.  STRONGEST WINDS EXPECTED OVER NORTHERN PLATEAU AREA WITH 
GENERALLY 15 TO 25 MPH WIND SPEEDS POSSIBLE.  

.LONG TERM...(THU THROUGH TUE)...MODELS CONTINUE TO AGREE ON A WEAK 
FRONTAL PASSAGE THROUGH OUR AREA ON THU...ALTHOUGH GFS STILL A BIT 
FASTER THAN THE ETA.  THINK ETA TIMING LOOKS MOST REASONABLE...BUT 
EITHER WAY THE PRECIP SHOULD EXIT OUR AREA BY THU NIGHT.  DRY PERIOD 
WILL BE BRIEF HOWEVER...AS MOISTURE SURGES NORTH AGAIN ON FRIDAY.  
APPEARS THERE WILL BE DECENT ISENTROPIC LIFT OVERSPREADING THE AREA 
FRIDAY INTO FRIDAY NIGHT...SO WILL GO HIGH CHANCE NORTH TO LIKELY 
SOUTH FRIDAY...THEN LIKELY POPS ALL ZONES FRIDAY NIGHT.  LATEST GFS 
IS TRYING TO DEVELOP A MORE SIGNIFICANT SURFACE WAVE ALONG THE FRONT 
THAT THEN PUSHES NORTHEAST OF OUR AREA BY LATE SATURDAY...ALLOWING 
DRIER AIR TO MOVE IN MORE QUICKLY.  WILL NOT JUMP ON THIS IDEA 
YET...BUT WILL TREND POPS DOWN A BIT FOR SUNDAY AND REMOVE PRECIP 
FOR SUNDAY NIGHT.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  69  53  55  34 /  10  40  50  10 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  64  51  56  35 /  10  40  50  10 
OAK RIDGE, TN  65  50  55  33 /  10  40  50  10 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  64  50  54  30 /  10  40  60  10 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...DENSE FOG ADVISORY FOR THIS MORNING FOR ZONES TNZ012>018...
TNZ035...TNZ039...TNZ042>047.

VA...DENSE FOG ADVISORY FOR THIS MORNING FOR ZONES VAZ001>002...
VAZ005>006...VAZ008.
&&

$$

MJB/LDW

AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
822 PM EST TUE JAN 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...PATCHY LIGHT RAIN HAS MOVED NE OUT OF ALL BUT SWRN VA 
AND THE NE TIP OF TN THIS EVENING.  PARTIAL CLEARING BEHIND THE RAIN 
HAS ALLOWED AREAS OF FOG TO DEVELOP...WITH VSBY ALREADY BELOW ONE 
MILE AT OQT (OAK RIDGE) AND A FEW SPOTS IN SWRN VA.  I PLAN TO 
UPDATE EARLY AND REMOVE RAIN CHANCES FOR ALL BUT SWRN VA AND NE TN.  
I WILL ALSO ADD PATCHY FOG TO THE GRIDS AND ZFP.

UPDATED ZFP...GRIDS AND WEB PRODUCTS BY 9PM EST.  

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.


000 
FXUS64 KMRX 042033
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
330 PM EST TUE JAN  4 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT AND WEDNESDAY)...CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS 
SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONT ACROSS THE OHIO RIVER VALLEY WITH 
HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OFF THE GA AND SC COAST. AREA RADARS REVEAL 
ONLY A FEW PATCHY AREAS OF LIGHT RAIN OR DRIZZLE ACROSS THE FORECAST 
AREA...WITH THE BEST COVERAGE ACROSS NORTHERN MIDDLE TN AND 
SOUTHEAST KY. SCATTERED AREAS OF LIGHT RAIN SHOULD CONTINUE THIS 
EVENING ACROSS THE NORTHERN TWO-THIRDS OF THE FORECAST AREA AS A 
WEAK UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE MOVES THROUGH. UPPER-LEVEL FLOW BECOMES 
MORE AMPLIFIED TOMORROW AS A TROUGH DEEPENS ACROSS THE LOWER MS 
RIVER VALLEY. AS A RESULT...AN UPPER RIDGE WILL BUILD ACROSS THE 
FORECAST AREA BRINGING DRY AND CONTINUED UNSEASONABLY MILD 
CONDITIONS. 
&&

.LONG TERM...(WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...THE UNSEASONABLY 
MILD WEATHER WILL TAKE A SLIGHT BREAK AS A COLD FRONT MOVES FROM THE 
MS VALLEY ACROSS THE TN VALLEY LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. 
PREFER THE ETA SOLUTION IN TIMING WHICH PUTS MOST OF THE 
PRECIPITATION ALONG THE FRONT THURSDAY MORNING AND EARLY AFTERNOON 
BUT FOLLOWED THE GFS HIGHER POPS AND COOLER MINIMUMS WEDNESDAY NIGHT 
AND THURSDAY. SKIES CLEAR OUT THURSDAY EVENING AS FRONT PASSES 
THROUGH. THURSDAY NIGHTS LOWS WILL BE MUCH COOLER WITH DRIER AIR 
WORKING IN. HIGH PRESSURE WILL RETURN BRIEFLY FRIDAY BUT THURSDAYS 
FRONT BEGINS TO MOVE BACK NORTH WITH OVERRUNNING CAUSING A FEW 
SHOWERS FRIDAY AND EARLY FRIDAY NIGHT. A NEW SYSTEM DEVELOPS OVER 
THE SOUTHERN PLAINS FRIDAY NIGHT AND MOVES INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
LATE FRIDAY NIGHT AND AFFECTS THE AREA THROUGH THE WEEKEND. THIS 
NEXT FRONT IS EXPECTED TO MOVE THROUGH SUNDAY. HIGH PRESSURE WITH 
CONTINUED MILD TEMPERATURES BEHIND THIS FRONT FOR THE BEGINNING OF 
NEXT WEEK.    
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             50  70  52  56 /  10  10  50  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  52  68  49  56 /  10  10  50  70 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       53  66  49  55 /  20  10  60  60 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              49  64  46  57 /  30  10  40  70 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

$$

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EST TUE JAN 4 2005

.DISCUSSION...
CURRENT SURFACE ANALYSIS SHOWS A QUASI-STATIONARY FRONT ACROSS THE 
OHIO RIVER VALLEY WITH HIGH PRESSURE CENTERED OFF THE SOUTHEAST GA 
COAST. AREA RADARS REVEAL ONLY A FEW PATCHY AREAS OF LIGHT RAIN OR 
DRIZZLE ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA...WITH MOST RAIN CONFINED TO THE 
LOWER MS RIVER VALLEY IN ASSOCIATION WITH AN UPPER-LEVEL SHORT WAVE. 
EXPECT ONLY A FEW AREAS OF LIGHT RAIN THIS AFTERNOON...MAINLY ACROSS 
THE NORTHERN HALF OF THE FORECAST AREA. CURRENT POPS SEEM TO BE TOO 
HIGH AND WILL PLAN TO LOWER FOR THIS AFTERNOONS FORECAST. 
OTHERWISE...REST OF THE FORECAST LOOKS TO BE ON TRACK WITH ONLY A 
FEW MINOR TWEAKS NEEDED FOR THE UPDATE.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 040735
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
232 AM EST TUE JAN  4 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TODAY AND TONIGHT)...WEST TO SOUTHWESTERLY FLOW ALOFT 
REMAINS OVER THE REGION TODAY AS A WEAK SHORT WAVE MOVES  THROUGH 
THE UPPER FLOW.  THE MAIN TRACK OF THE WAVE WILL LIFT IT TO OUR WEST 
AND NORTH.  HOWEVER...BELIEVE SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND LIFT WILL 
REACH INTO THE AREA FOR SCATTERED POPS SOUTH AND LIKELY NORTH.  
AMOUNTS SHOULD BE LIGHT.  SHOWERS WILL LINGER OVER THE NORTHERN 
ZONES THROUGHOUT THE EVENING AS THE WAVE LIFTS TO OUR NORTH.  
OTHERWISE...CONTINUED SEASONALLY WARM TEMPS EXPECTED.  

.LONG TERM...(WED THROUGH MON)...MODELS IN DECENT AGREEMENT EARLY ON 
IN THE PERIOD...ALTHOUGH THE GFS IS A BIT FASTER IN PUSHING THE COLD
FRONT THROUGH THE AREA THU. THINK A COMPROMISE SPEED LOOKS 
REASONABLE FOR NOW.  WED SHOULD BE MAINLY DRY AND ON THE WARM SIDE 
AS THE WARM FRONT WILL BE TO OUR NORTH.  WILL BRING IN LIKELY POPS 
WEST LATE WED NIGHT AND ALL ZONES THU AS FRONT PUSHES THROUGH.  
SHOULD HAVE ANOTHER DRY PERIOD THU NIGHT BEHIND THE FRONT.  FRONTAL 
BOUNDARY MAY BE CLOSE ENOUGH TO OUR SOUTHERN ZONES TO ALLOW FOR SOME 
SHOWERS FRI AND FRI NIGHT...SO SLIGHT CHANCE THERE...DRY FURTHER 
NORTH.  NEXT SURGE OF MOISTURE EXPECTED TO ARRIVE SATURDAY. 

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN  67  50  68  52 /  40  10  10  60 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  66  50  67  49 /  50  20  10  50 
OAK RIDGE, TN  64  51  66  49 /  60  20  10  50 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN  63  47  63  46 /  60  40  10  40 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&


000 
FXUS64 KMRX 032018
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST MON JAN 3 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SOUTHWEST FLOW AND 
ABUNDANT MOISTURE CONTINUES TO BE THE CONTROLLING FACTOR FOR THE 
NEXT 24 HOURS AND BEYOND.  A WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE JUST NORTH OF 
THE AREA TONIGHT...BRINGING JUST ENOUGH ENERGY INTO THE AREA TO 
JUSTIFY CHANCE POPS OVERNIGHT.  YET ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE 
ACROSS TOMORROW...INCREASING POPS ONCE AGAIN.  ALL THESE IMPULSES 
ARE VERY WEAK AND RAINS WHERE THEY OCCUR WILL BE LIGHT.  
TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO BE UNSEASONABLY MILD.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...A SHORTWAVE WILL BE 
EXITING THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY EVENING WITH PERSISTENT UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGING OVER THE SOUTHEAST STRENGTHENING TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY. SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL INCREASE AS WEDNESDAY AS THE 
PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENS UP AS LOW PRESSURE ASSOCIATED WITH A COLD 
FRONT MOVING INTO THE OHIO VALLEY CONTRASTS WITH SURFACE HIGH OFF 
THE FLORIDA COAST. THE RAIN WITH THIS FRONT WILL STAY OVER THE LOWER 
MS AND OH VALLEYS WEDNESDAY BEFORE MOVING INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. THE UPPER 
FLOW PATTERN WILL REMAIN UNCHANGED WITH THE FRONT MOVING JUST SOUTH 
OF THE FORECAST AREA BEFORE MOISTURE IS BROUGHT BACK NORTH WITH 
OVERRUNNING SETTING UP THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. ANOTHER FRONT 
DEVELOPS IN THE PLAINS SATURDAY AND MOVES THROUGH SUNDAY BUT MAY GET 
HUNG UP JUST SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY JUST LIKE 
THURSDAYS SYSTEM SO WILL USE PERSISTENCE AND KEEP RAIN CHANCES IN 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED. LIKED THE LOWER POPS TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY AND HIGHER MAXIMUMS OF THE ETA WEDNESDAY SO WAS CLOSE TO 
THESE NUMBERS.  
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             50  65  50  69 /  30  30  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  51  64  49  68 /  50  60  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       52  61  49  68 /  60  60  30  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              49  61  45  67 /  40  70  50  20 
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

561 
FXUS64 KMRX 032018
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
315 PM EST MON JAN 3 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY)...SOUTHWEST FLOW AND 
ABUNDANT MOISTURE CONTINUES TO BE THE CONTROLLING FACTOR FOR THE 
NEXT 24 HOURS AND BEYOND.  A WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE JUST NORTH OF 
THE AREA TONIGHT...BRINGING JUST ENOUGH ENERGY INTO THE AREA TO 
JUSTIFY CHANCE POPS OVERNIGHT.  YET ANOTHER WEAK SHORTWAVE WILL MOVE 
ACROSS TOMORROW...INCREASING POPS ONCE AGAIN.  ALL THESE IMPULSES 
ARE VERY WEAK AND RAINS WHERE THEY OCCUR WILL BE LIGHT.  
TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO BE UNSEASONABLY MILD.

.LONG TERM...(TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...A SHORTWAVE WILL BE 
EXITING THE FORECAST AREA TUESDAY EVENING WITH PERSISTENT UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGING OVER THE SOUTHEAST STRENGTHENING TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY. SOUTHWEST WINDS WILL INCREASE AS WEDNESDAY AS THE 
PRESSURE GRADIENT TIGHTENS UP AS LOW PRESSURE ASSOCIATED WITH A COLD 
FRONT MOVING INTO THE OHIO VALLEY CONTRASTS WITH SURFACE HIGH OFF 
THE FLORIDA COAST. THE RAIN WITH THIS FRONT WILL STAY OVER THE LOWER 
MS AND OH VALLEYS WEDNESDAY BEFORE MOVING INTO THE TENNESSEE VALLEY 
AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY. THE UPPER 
FLOW PATTERN WILL REMAIN UNCHANGED WITH THE FRONT MOVING JUST SOUTH 
OF THE FORECAST AREA BEFORE MOISTURE IS BROUGHT BACK NORTH WITH 
OVERRUNNING SETTING UP THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY. ANOTHER FRONT 
DEVELOPS IN THE PLAINS SATURDAY AND MOVES THROUGH SUNDAY BUT MAY GET 
HUNG UP JUST SOUTH OF THE FORECAST AREA ON MONDAY JUST LIKE 
THURSDAYS SYSTEM SO WILL USE PERSISTENCE AND KEEP RAIN CHANCES IN 
THROUGH THE EXTENDED. LIKED THE LOWER POPS TUESDAY NIGHT AND 
WEDNESDAY AND HIGHER MAXIMUMS OF THE ETA WEDNESDAY SO WAS CLOSE TO 
THESE NUMBERS.  
&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             50  65  50  69 /  30  30  20  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  51  64  49  68 /  50  60  20  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       52  61  49  68 /  60  60  30  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              49  61  45  67 /  40  70  50  20

191 
FXUS64 KMRX 030942
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
430 AM EST MON JAN 3 2005

.DISCUSSION...FCST A LITTLE MURKY WITH PERSISTENT MOIST SW UPR LVL 
FLO WITH OCCASIONAL RIPPLES OF ENERGY...SOME A LITTLE STRONGER AND 
SOME A LITTLE WEAKER. MODELS INDICATE A WEAK WAVE TO MOVE ACROSS THE 
FA TODAY AND USED A HIGHER TO LOWER POP GRADIENT FROM N TO S AGAIN 
TODAY PER DEEPER MOISTURE AND BEST LIFT WITH THIS FEATURE. ANOTHER 
S/WV RIDES INTO THE TN VLY LATER TONIGHT AND USED HIGHEST POP 
(LIKELY CATEGORY) ON THE NRN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AFTER MIDNIGHT WITH 
CHC POPS ELSEWHERE. KEPT LIKELY POPS GOING AGAIN ON TUE AS THIS WAVE 
BUILDS E. SOME DIFFERENCES NOTED BETWEEN ETA/GFS IN ASSOCIATION WITH 
THIS S/WV BUT DECIDED TO GO WITH GFS WHICH CARRIES THIS FEATURE A 
LITTLE FARTHER S AND THUS IMPACTING MRX FA TO A GREATER EXTENT. UPR 
RIDGE AMPLIFIES OVR THE ERN U.S. ON WED AS WRN STATES UPR LOW MOVES 
NE INTO THE GREAT LAKES. WARM SECTOR IN PLACE ACROSS THE FA ON WED 
WITH MILD TEMPS AND LITTLE TO KEY ON IN TERMS OF LIFTING MECHANISMS 
SO STAYED WITH SLGT/LOW CHC POPS. UPR TROF AND ASSOCIATED COLD FRONT 
PRESS E WITH FRONT SLIDING ACROSS THE TN VLY/SRN APPALACHIANS LATER 
WED NIGHT INTO THU MORNING SO STAYED WITH LIKELY POPS FOR THE 
FRONTAL PUSH. WITH UPR LVL FLO REMAINING SW FRONT NEVER GETS VERY 
FAR S OF THE FA AND MORE MOISTURE/ENERGY RIDING NE TOWARD THE REGION 
HUNG ONTO A SLIGHT CHC POP SE TN/SW NC THU NIGHT AND CARRIED SLGT OR 
LOW CHC FOR -SHRA THRU THE DAYTIME PERIOD FRI. MAINTAINED MEDIUM CHC 
POPS INTO THE WEEKEND AS ACTIVE SW FLO CONTINUES.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             67  52  64  50 /  30  30  30  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  64  52  62  49 /  40  50  60  20 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       63  52  62  49 /  40  60  60  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              63  48  61  44 /  50  40  70  40



000 
FXUS64 KMRX 022007
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
306 PM EST SUN JAN 2 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH MONDAY)...SHORTWAVE IS NOW EXITING 
NORTHEAST TENNESSEE AND SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA AND HAS WEAKENED. ONLY A 
FEW HUNDREDTHS WERE OBSERVED AT MOST LOCATIONS EXCEPT ABOUT A 
QUARTER OF AN INCH AT BIG SOUTH FORK ON THE NORTHERN CUMBERLAND 
PLATEAU. SKIES HAVE BEEN MOSTLY CLOUDY WITH SOME BREAKS THIS 
AFTERNOON OVER SOUTHEAST TENNESSEE AND THE PLATEAU AREAS. WIDE RANGE 
OF MID AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES DEPENDING ON CLOUD COVER FROM THE MID 
50S TO MID 60S. TODAYS WEATHER PATTERN HAS BASICALLY REMAINED 
UNCHANGED THE LAST FEW DAYS EXCEPT FOR A LITTLE MORE LOW LEVEL 
MOISTURE AND THE PATTERN DOES NOT CHANGE MUCH THROUGH MONDAY WITH A 
BREAK IN THE PRECIPITATION FOR MOST OF TONIGHT. ANOTHER WEAK 
SHORTWAVE MOVES THROUGH LATE TONIGHT WITH A STRONGER SHORTWAVE 
MONDAY AFTERNOON AS A COLD FRONT SAGS A LITTLE FARTHER SOUTH TO NEAR 
THE OHIO RIVER. HAVE FOLLOWED CLOSER TO THE GFS DUE TO ITS BETTER 
HANDLING OF TODAYS RAIN. WILL HAVE SLIGHT CHANCE RAIN TONIGHT MAINLY 
LATE EXCEPT BEST CHANCE EARLY NORTHEAST SECTIONS. WENT JUST BELOW 
GUIDANCE TEMPERATURE BLEND BASED ON PARTLY CLOUDY SKIES FOR AWHILE 
THIS EVENING AND TRENDS THE LAST FEW NIGHTS. ADDED SOME PATCHY FOG 
IN TONIGHT TOO.      

.LONG TERM...(MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)
AN INTERESTING MEDIUM RANGE DISCUSSION FROM NCEP THIS MORNING.  THE 
UPPER LEVEL FLOW PATTERN WILL REMAIN GENERALLY WEST TO SOUTHWEST 
THROUGH AT LEAST THE NEXT 11 DAYS.  THE OVERALL PATTERN ACROSS NORTH
AMERICA WILL CORRELATE WELL WITH THE JAN 1950 PATTERN.  AFTER REVIEWING
JAN 1950 CLIMATOLOGY ACROSS EAST TENNESSEE...REVEALS THAT JAN 1950 WAS
THE WARMEST JANUARY ON RECORD AT TRI...TYS...AND CHA.  ALSO, JAN 
1950 WAS THE 2ND WETTEST AT TRI...8TH WETTEST AT TYS AND 15TH WETTEST
AT CHA.  ALL STATIONS HAD BETWEEN 8 AND 9 INCHES FOR JAN 1950.  THE 
PATTERN COULD EASILY SWITCH BACK TO A COLDER PATTERN LATE THIS 
MONTH...BUT FOR NOW SEEMS THE FORECAST AREA WILL REMAIN MILD AND 
WETTER.

NOW FOR THE EXTENDED...MONDAY NIGHT-WEDNESDAY...COLD FRONT WILL TRY TO
PULL SOUTH TOWARD THE NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA BEFORE 
STALLING.  A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES IN WEST-SOUTHWEST FLOW ALOFT WILL 
BRING PERIODS OF SHOWERS OVER THE REGION WITH THE BEST CHANCE NEAR 
THE FRONT.  WILL CONTINUE WITH HIGHEST POPS FOR THE NORTHERN HALF OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. OTHERWISE...RIDGING OVER FLORIDA WILL CONTINUE TO 
KEEP THE AREA UNSEASONABLY MILD.

FOR WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND THURSDAY...A STRONGEST SHORT-WAVE WILL MOVE 
NORTHEAST ACROSS THE UPPER OHIO VALLEY PROVIDING ENOUGH EMPHASIS TO 
PULL A WEAK COLD FRONT ACROSS THE FORECAST AREA THURSDAY MORNING. 
WILL UP POPS TO LIKELY AREA-WIDE FOR THURSDAY MORNING.  GIVEN THE 
FAST WESTERLY FLOW ALOFT...SURFACE HIGH WILL QUICKLY BUILD INTO THE 
AREA THEN MOVE EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS THURSDAY NIGHT.

FOR FRIDAY THROUGH SATURDAY...ISENTROPIC LIFT INCREASES AS THE FLOWS 
RETURNS TO THE SOUTH...SO WILL MAINTAIN CONTINUITY WITH INCREASING 
CLOUDS AND SHOWER CHANCES.  ANOTHER FRONT WILL PULL INTO THE AREA 
FOR SUNDAY...KEEPING THE WET PATTERN GOING.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             48  65  51  65 /  20  30  30  40 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  47  63  50  64 /  20  30  40  60 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       48  62  50  64 /  20  40  60  70 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              42  63  46  62 /  30  40  40  60 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

$$

TD/DH

859 
FXUS64 KMRX 020930
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EST SUN JAN 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...THE BASIC CONCEPT OF THE SEVEN DAY FCST HAS NOT 
CHANGED CONSIDERABLY ALTHOUGH POP NEEDED TO BE RAISED ACROSS THE 
BOARD FOR TODAY AS MODEL ADVERTISED WEAK S/WV JUST A LITTLE BIT 
STRONGER THIS MORNING CREATING SOME LIGHT TO MODERATE SHOWERS ACROSS 
MIDDLE TN. USED HIGHEST POPS N WHERE MODELS INDICATE BEST LIFT. 
SAT/RADAR TRENDS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM DURING THE PAST FEW 
HOURS SEEM TO FIT THIS SCENARIO PRETTY WELL AS SYSTEM IS LIFTING NE 
THROUGH TIME LEAVING PRECIP MORE WIDELY SCATTERED ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN TIER COUNTIES. TAPERED OFF PROBABILITIES FAIRLY 
SIGNIFICANTLY TONIGHT BEHIND DEPARTED S/WV WHILE WE AWAIT THE 
ARRIVAL OF NEXT IMPULSE RIPPING QUICKLY E THROUGH THE OH VLY. KEPT 
POPS HIGHEST ACROSS NRN SECTIONS WITH GRADATION TO LOWER VARIETY 
FARTHER S AND E AWAY FROM DEEPEST MOISTURE/LIFT. GENERALLY FOLLOWED 
THIS TREND THROUGH THE DAYTIME HOURS WED. BY WED NIGHT UPR TROF 
BUILDS E THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES/MIDWEST DRAGGING A COLD FRONT 
TOWARD THE FA. GFS A LITTLE SLOWER WITH FRONT PRESSING THE BOUNDARY 
E OF THE MTNS BETWEEN 12-16Z THU SO HELD ONTO SLGT CHC POP FOR PM 
HOURS SW VA/NE TN. COOLER/DRIER WX EXPECTED FOR FRIDAY HOWEVER WRN 
STATES UPR TROFFING LEADS TO SW FLO ALOFT AND MOISTURE RETURN FRI 
NIGHT INTO SAT SO MAINTAINED MC SKIES/LOW CHC -SHRA DURING THIS 
PERIOD.      

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             65  49  65  51 /  20  10  30  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  64  48  63  50 /  40  10  30  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       64  48  63  50 /  40  10  40  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              62  43  62  46 /  50  20  40  40 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 020930
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EST SUN JAN 2 2005

.DISCUSSION...THE BASIC CONCEPT OF THE SEVEN DAY FCST HAS NOT 
CHANGED CONSIDERABLY ALTHOUGH POP NEEDED TO BE RAISED ACROSS THE 
BOARD FOR TODAY AS MODEL ADVERTISED WEAK S/WV JUST A LITTLE BIT 
STRONGER THIS MORNING CREATING SOME LIGHT TO MODERATE SHOWERS ACROSS 
MIDDLE TN. USED HIGHEST POPS N WHERE MODELS INDICATE BEST LIFT. 
SAT/RADAR TRENDS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS SYSTEM DURING THE PAST FEW 
HOURS SEEM TO FIT THIS SCENARIO PRETTY WELL AS SYSTEM IS LIFTING NE 
THROUGH TIME LEAVING PRECIP MORE WIDELY SCATTERED ACROSS THE 
SOUTHERN TIER COUNTIES. TAPERED OFF PROBABILITIES FAIRLY 
SIGNIFICANTLY TONIGHT BEHIND DEPARTED S/WV WHILE WE AWAIT THE 
ARRIVAL OF NEXT IMPULSE RIPPING QUICKLY E THROUGH THE OH VLY. KEPT 
POPS HIGHEST ACROSS NRN SECTIONS WITH GRADATION TO LOWER VARIETY 
FARTHER S AND E AWAY FROM DEEPEST MOISTURE/LIFT. GENERALLY FOLLOWED 
THIS TREND THROUGH THE DAYTIME HOURS WED. BY WED NIGHT UPR TROF 
BUILDS E THROUGH THE GREAT LAKES/MIDWEST DRAGGING A COLD FRONT 
TOWARD THE FA. GFS A LITTLE SLOWER WITH FRONT PRESSING THE BOUNDARY 
E OF THE MTNS BETWEEN 12-16Z THU SO HELD ONTO SLGT CHC POP FOR PM 
HOURS SW VA/NE TN. COOLER/DRIER WX EXPECTED FOR FRIDAY HOWEVER WRN 
STATES UPR TROFFING LEADS TO SW FLO ALOFT AND MOISTURE RETURN FRI 
NIGHT INTO SAT SO MAINTAINED MC SKIES/LOW CHC -SHRA DURING THIS 
PERIOD.      

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             65  49  65  51 /  20  10  30  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  64  48  63  50 /  40  10  30  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       64  48  63  50 /  40  10  40  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              62  43  62  46 /  50  20  40  40 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

$$

000 
FXUS64 KMRX 020230
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
930 PM EST SAT JAN 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...SHORTWAVE KICKING OFF SOME SHOWERS IN NORTHERN AL AND 
MIDDLE TN.  MODELS ALL AGREE ON KEEPING SHORTWAVE/PRECIP OUR OF OUR 
AREA UNTIL CLOSE TO DAYBREAK.  WILL UPDATE ZONES TO REMOVE CHANCES 
OF SHOWERS IN ALL AREAS FOR TONIGHT.  WILL ALSO GO WITH A MOSTLY 
CLOUDY SKY ACROSS THE AREA WITH PLENTY OF CLOUDS MOVING IN AHEAD OF 
THE DISTURBANCE.  HAD SOME PATCHY LIGHT FOG LAST NIGHT.  WITH THE 
HIGHER DEWPOINTS...WILL ADD PATCHY FOG FOR TONIGHT DESPITE THE 
INCREASE IN CLOUDS.  TEMPERATURES LOOK GOOD. 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

000
FXUS64 KMRX 012006
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
246 PM EST SAT JAN 1 2005

.SHORT TERM...(TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY)...A BEAUTIFUL DAY IN THE 
SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS THIS AFTERNOON. SKIES HAVE BEEN MOSTLY SUNNY 
FOR MOST OF THE FORECAST AREA WITH TEMPERATURES REACHING NEAR 70 IN 
A FEW SPOTS WITH MOSTLY MID TO UPPER 60S ACROSS THE AREA. UPPER 
LEVEL RIDGING CONTINUES OVER THE FORECAST AREA WITH A PERSISTENT 
TROUGH OVER THE WESTERN STATES. A STATIONARY FRONT OVER THE NORTHERN 
OHIO VALLEY SEPERATES MUCH COLDER AIR TO THE NORTH AND MILD AIR TO 
THE SOUTH. THIS FRONT WILL MOVE LITTLE THROUGH SUNDAY. A SHORTWAVE 
WILL MOVE ACROSS THE MID MS VALLEY TONIGHT AND ACROSS THE OH AND TN 
VALLEYS LATE TONIGHT AND SUNDAY. THE BEST LIFT WILL CONTINUE TO BE 
ON THE NORTHERN EDGE OF THE FORECAST AREA TONIGHT AND SUNDAY. 
TEMPERATURES WILL CONTINUE TO BE MILD WITH LOWS IN THE 40S AND HIGHS 
IN THE 60S. WENT SLIGHTLY BELOW GUIDANCE TONIGHT FOR LOWS BECAUSE OF 
THE EXISTING RELATIVELY CLEAR SKIES ALTHOUGH DEWPOINTS HAVE RISEN TO 
THE MID 40S TO NEAR 50. FOR HIGHS SUNDAY FOLLOWED CLOSER TO MET 
NUMBERS WITH MOST LOCATIONS NOT GETTING RAIN AND WITH A MOSTLY 
CLOUDY SKY. IF BREAKS DEVELOP AND SUN COMES THROUGH TEMPERATURES MAY 
REACH NEAR 70 AGAIN.     

.LONG TERM...(SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY)
FOR SUNDAY NIGHT-TUESDAY...WEST TO SOUTHWEST FLOW CONTINUES ALOFT 
KEEPING STATIONARY FRONT TO OUR NORTH.  A SERIES OF SHORT-WAVES WILL 
MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY PRODUCING A CHANCE OF SHOWERS...MAINLY 
OVER THE NORTHERN SECTIONS OF THE FORECAST AREA.  MAIN STORY WILL BE 
CONTINUED PRESENCE OF UPPER HIGH OVER THE SOUTHEAST UNITED STATES 
WITH UNSEASONABLY WARM AFTERNOON TEMPERATURES FOR JANUARY.

FOR WEDNESDAY THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING...A STRONG SHORT-WAVE AND 
ASSOCIATED SURFACE LOW WILL MOVE ACROSS THE OHIO VALLEY WITH A COLD 
FRONT MOVING ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS 
WEDNESDAY NIGHT AND EARLY THURSDAY MORNING.  HAVE UPPED CHANCES OF 
SHOWERS FOR THIS TIMEFRAME GIVEN EXPECTED FROPA.  HAVE DECIDED TO 
KEEP CHANCE OF THUNDER OUT FOR NOW SINCE LIFTED INDICES REMAIN 
GENERALLY STABLE.

FOR THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...SURFACE HIGH BUILDS INTO THE 
FORECAST AREA THEN MOVES EAST OF THE APPALACHIANS. GFS SHOWS A QUICK 
RETURN OF SOUTHERLY WINDS ON THE BACK SIDE OF THE HIGH WITH 
INCREASING ISENTROPIC LIFT BY LATE FRIDAY.

FOR FRIDAY NIGHT AND SATURDAY...INCREASING ISENTROPIC LIFT WILL 
SPREAD CLOUDS BACK INTO THE REGION WITH A CHANCE OF RAIN SPREADING 
NORTH ACROSS THE TENNESSEE VALLEY AND SOUTHERN APPALACHIANS.

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             46  66  48  66 /  10  20  10  20 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  45  65  47  63 /  10  20  10  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       46  63  47  63 /  10  20  10  40 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              43  63  42  61 /  10  20  20  40 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.

&&

$$

TD/DH

000
FXUS64 KMRX 011501
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
1000 AM EST SAT JAN 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...SKIES HAVE CLEARED THIS MORNING WITH THICKEST CLOUDS 
ACROSS THE NORTHERN BORDER AND ACROSS SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. CROSS 
SECTION DATA INDICATES MOSTLY HIGH LEVEL MOISTURE WITH SOME 
SCATTERED LOW AND MIDDLE CLOUDS POSSIBLE THROUGH 02/00Z FOR MOST OF 
THE FORECAST AREA. CHANCES FOR MEASURABLE RAIN LOOK SLIM BUT WILL 
LEAVE CURRENT RAIN CHANCES IN FOR NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND 
SOUTHWEST VIRGINIA. TEMPERATURES LOOK GOOD. UPDATE OUT SHORTLY TO 
CHANGE SKY CONDITION FROM MOSTLY CLOUDY TO PARTLY CLOUDY.      
&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
VA...NONE.
&&

$$

TD

784 
FXUS64 KMRX 010921
AFDMRX

AREA FORECAST DISCUSSION
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE MORRISTOWN TN
415 AM EST SAT JAN 1 2005

.DISCUSSION...MILD WX TO CONTINUE FOR SEVERAL MORE DAYS AS FORECAST 
AREA ENJOYS THE WARMTH AND RELATIVE PROTECTION FROM UPPER LEVEL 
RIDGING OVR THE SE U.S. THERE WILL BE A CHANCE FOR -SHRA ACROSS THE 
NORTHERN CUMBERLAND PLATEAU AND SW VA TODAY AS MODELS DEPICT WEAK 
UPR LVL IMPULSE ALONG WITH ISENTROPIC LIFT MAINLY ACROSS KY. ANOTHER 
S/WV BUILDS NE TOWARD THE FA TONIGHT BRINGING A SLGT CHC -SHRA WRN 
SECTIONS TOWARD MORNING WITH MEDIUM CHC POPS ACROSS THE ENTIRE 
REGION ON SUNDAY. MODELS DEPICT A COUPLE MORE S/WVS ON MON AND TUE 
WITH BEST MOISTURE AND LIFT MAINLY NORTHERN HALF OF THE FA. LOW TO 
MEDIUM CHC POPS WERE CONTINUED FROM PREVIOUS FCST TO COVER THIS 
POSSIBILITY. BETTER CHC FOR RAIN OCCURS WED NIGHT AS UPR TROF BUILDS 
NE INTO THE GREAT LAKES/MIDWEST DRIVING A COLD FRONT E OF THE 
APPALACHIANS BY 12Z THU. HELD ONTO SLGT CHC POPS SW VA/NE TN AND 
MTNS THU MORNING WITH REMAINDER OF EXTENDED DRY. 
HOWEVER...PERSISTENT SW FLO BRINGS SUFFICIENT MOISTURE AND S/WV 
TROFFING TO THE SE U.S. AGAIN FRI NIGHT INTO SAT WHICH MAY REQUIRE 
THE USE OF SMALL CHC POPS AS NEW DAY SEVEN ADDED TO FCST.   

&&

.PRELIMINARY POINT TEMPS/POPS...
CHATTANOOGA AIRPORT, TN             67  47  62  48 /  10  20  40  30 
KNOXVILLE MCGHEE TYSON AIRPORT, TN  65  47  61  47 /  10  20  40  30 
OAK RIDGE, TN                       65  47  61  47 /  10  30  40  30 
TRI CITIES AIRPORT, TN              62  43  60  43 /  20  20  40  30 

&&

.MRX WATCHES/WARNINGS/ADVISORIES...
NC...NONE.
TN...NONE.
